text: My husband and I had requested to view 2 houses they had for rent. After many attempts to reach out,  we were scheduled to see the first house with a group of other people (which I thought was strange). We arrive at the house and are interested, but surely enough the other family was interested as well. We asked Carol what we should do since we both were interested, and she advised us to place an application and she will decide who is the best fit for the house. After the showing, we head to their main office just to find out that the other family had “beat us to it” and applied for the house even though Carol had told us that she would review each application. Brenda, her front desk manager, won’t even speak to you or acknowledge you when you first walk in when she’s on the phone (which is 99% of the time). It was a rookie move that they let multiple families view a house at the same time, instead of 15-20 minute increments like most agencies because it put us in a very awkward and disappointing situation. It was a waste of my time to know that she wouldn’t look over each application, but instead whoever made it to the office first “wins”. Even though they had other properties that we were interested in, I had no desire to do business with them or support them in any way. They way they handled this whole situation was immature, rushed, and with poor customer service. Carol was a very nice lady to talk to, but she needs to change her business model and priorities if she wants new tenants to trust her.

name: Jay Lindsey
text:
3 years ago-Called Brenda at Regency today to inquire about using Regency as the company to manage my house and Brenda was very nice, super friendly, and was willing to answer all the questions that she could, which were many. The ones she couldn't answer, she directed me how to go about getting them answered, but she answered 99.9% of them.

Anyways, thanks Brenda for all your help.

8/1/18-I have had my house with Carol and her company for over 3 years and they have been great to work with. I also had Carol as my real estate agent who was always in touch with me giving me updates and had my house sold within 3 months of being put on the market. Heather and Brenda both have also been a pleasure to talk to and assist me in anything I ever needed. Great Job and thank you all so very much. 5 STARS hands down!!!

name: Casey Wortham
text:
I have been trying to rent out my very nicely kept house through Regency since early February.  So far, I have had no results, and I am hard pressed to even get any kind of communication from the agent there, Carol.  There have been other houses near mine renting in as little as 2 weeks, but no such luck with my house.  I have made all the repairs they suggested, and we agreed on the rental amount.  However, I get the feeling they really aren't trying to get my house rented out.  I asked them to take a few more pictures of the inside of my home; this would show some of the good features of the interior.  It has been a couple of weeks, and this request still hasn't been done.  Furthermore, I have asked for follow up information via email twice in the past two weeks, and have had no response.
I recently was advised by another realtor to post a listing on Craig’s List.  She made this recommendation since she said no many people use the MLS for rental, at least yet.  I asked Carol at Regency about this, to which she said she would not do it.
I would not recommend them; I am in the process of seeking other help for renting out my house.  I guess I may be out the $350 they charged me for this.  This is all very curious since the rental market in Mobile is moving very fast right now.  It seems as if they almost do not want to rent it out.

name: Rachel “Rewi” White
text: Without verify any document offered by Client (Business owner relocate to Mobile have bank statement of decent savings/positive tax reports/Good credit/ legal status have been living in Alabama for 12+ years) send to them, directly got a respond "pay 1 year rent up front". I wonder if they practice Equal Credit Opportunity Act in state of Alabama? Client's moving time frame is 2 weeks, the agency wasted a week with the ugly disrespect. I can't stand with their Reputation!

name: Megan Kay Allgood
text: We have rented from Regency for the past year and will for at least the next year.  We love our home and dealing with the staff has been easy. All but one complaint was handled fast and satisfactory. I believe the one that took a little time for them to get to may have been the fault of the workers and was not something that affected our every day lives, so it's hardly a complaint. I would recommend them to a friend.

name: Lloyd Heard
text:
We rented as we had sold one house and were waiting to buy another.
The house we chose was well maintained, and the rent was fair. There were issues with cooling at the start which were handled promptly, and issues with deck boards that were handled as well.
When we notified them of our plans to terminate lease after our term, they sent a follow up letter to ensure we knew what to expect.  Upon leaving and doing a final walkthrough, they notified me of a few spots that we missed cleaning and allowed me to take care of them, after I had moved, saving cleaning fees.
I expect and was told to expect my deposits back less any contracted amounts, which means they did what they promised.
Cant ask for more.

name: Matt Finamore
text: As a business/property owner, I would not let Regency manage your property. They have done some good business with me in the past but the last 2 properties were poorly managed and costed me a lot of time and money.

name: lerin savo
text: This company needs to be shut down. I am filing suit against them first thing in the morning. They NEVER come to the house to make repairs, in fact their repair man makes you wait 3-5 hours to show up if he even shows up at all. I told them in the winter that the gas company was going to tag the heating unit because it severely needed service, yet it was never taken care of. Here it is in June, I am pregnant, and I have been living in a house for two days that is 85+ degrees because they refuse to give the repair man permission to make the appropriate repairs. I have wasted COUNTLESS hours and lots hundreds that I could have made at work because of the lack of professionalism this company exerts. They want to call and fuss at us because there are leaves in the front yard during the fall yet they can not make a repair so that the house is LIVABLE?? GO ELSE WHERE whether your are renting or looking for property management. Lets not even discuss the yard that FLOODS every time it rains that they did not tell us about. They didn't even know that the house required gas to heat! They do not even have a workable emergency number to contact if something does go wrong, such as the AC breaking in the heat of the summer. They should be ashamed of the work that they do! I can not wait to get an attorney involved!

name: Brian Hughes
text: Very bad experience renting from this agency.  I rented from them for over 2 years.  I requested permission to accomplish repairs or have them accomplish repairs.  After vacating after lease was complete my security deposit was kept for the exact issues I was having. They provided an itemized list of why they retained my security deposit that was rediculous such as $350 cleaning fee for a house that was very clean when we left, $250 for yard cut that was cut week prior to move out, $1209.69 to replace light bulbs and a door repair I requested to be repaired while there. I will ensure my employer, one of the largest in Mobile, is aware and adds them to the not recommended for employee list for utilization.

name: Summer Cotton
text: Do not use this company.  They do not respond in a reasonable time and they do not get maintenance problems done.  You have to constantly stay on top of them or things won’t get done and then you get penalized for their procrastination and lack of doing their job/responsibility.

name: Jason Tuttle
text:
I did not have a very good experience using this company to rent my property. They care only to collect money. Either from you or from your renters and they will send out half-wits to complete work but charge you a premium fee.

The last tenants related to me their disappointment with the quality of repair provided stating that they needed to have the same issue repaired multiple times do to the lack of experienced repairmen.

They also explained the the property was filthy when they moved in.

I moved from the area and after three years and two tenants I decided not to rent the property again. After inspecting the property I found several things that were damaged but never reported to me or repaired. Stained carpets, torn screens, decking repair needed, siding loose, erosion, molding damage, and overgrowth of shrubs. If someone didn't call them they were oblivious. They certainly didn't care about the property and were not proactive in the least sense of the word.

Good luck if you still choose to call these people.

name: THE WOMACK'S WAY!
text: Terrible customer service, never greeted when we walked in! Racial profiling to the fullest! So glad we dodged this bullet!

name: Willis Israel
text: I can only speak to my experience with Regency, but they were great.  Lived in Brookwood house they managed for 4 years.  Whenever there was an issue with the house, Brenda was quick to get it addressed.  They were easy to work with and I certainly appreciated working with them.

name: Raed Yusuf
text: ( NEVER AGAIN ) I do not recommend this rental company because I rented from them for a year and when the owner of the house decided to put the house on the market and I was only given 30 days to look for another house , They kept my deposit for 60 days and they deducted    $499.00 for what they call damages to paint . I get it any house can have some touch up here and there however $499 to touch up a wall is excessive, no sheetrock work no full paint on the walls just a couple strokes of a paintbrush here and there.  Renters beware, they will do everything in their power to keep your deposit. Now, I wouldn't send my worst enemy to them.

name: Angela Messick Jennings
text: I have been trying to get in touch with someone at this business for 3 weeks now to view multiple houses that are listed for rent through Regency. After reading the other reviews I see I am not alone. I was very disappointed to see that the bad reviews outweigh the good. I will no longer attempt to contact anyone because it's obvious they aren't interested in my business or money. I'm not sure how any homeowner could list their property through them after seeing all this. If you search the MLS you will find 15+ homes listed through Regency with Carol as the contact, however she does not return emails or phone calls. If I have this much trouble to simply VIEW a property for rent, I can't imagine the problems I would encounter if repairs or any maintenance were needed on a property I was renting through them. My advice to all homeowners that enlist their services would be to drop them. There are far too many reputable real estate agencies who would be happy to help you. My advice to potential renters of Regency contracted homes would be to just keep looking. Regency isn't concerned in renting any of their client's houses, that's obvious.

name: Tony Graham
text: Disgusting people! My family and I rented from this agency and took immaculate care of the home. They took our whole security deposit and blamed us for things that were already broken in the home before we even took possession. We had a broken appliances they were unwilling to repair. Just awful! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS COMPANY! Even if you love the home, I highly suggest looking elsewhere.

name: Jordan Scarbrough
text:
This place is terrible. Save your money and time, go somewhere else.... Actually, run in the complete opposite direction of this company. Like really really fast.

I'm almost sure the positive reviews on here are fake or they got some kind of incentive to write a review and wrote a good review without really dealing with the company. I know first hand that this company was a nightmare to deal with.
All of the negative reviews are 100% spot on.

name: Annia Perez
text: We have been renting for 3 year with Regency and they have been wonderful the staff is always helpful, never had a problem!

name: taylor c
text: I honestly don’t even know how this place is still in business! A friend of mine had some properties they were renting for them, they would let the place sit empty for MONTHS (while still getting paid for suposably having an ad out for the units) while there own units rented out fast. They also would charge dirt cheap prices on his rental units (when they actually did find renters) and would jack up there personal properties units prices. They propally cost him about $15,000 in lost rent last year alone, needless to say, he does not work with them any longer! On top of that, they are trying to avoid paying a cleaning bill in full! I cleaned a house for them that was DISGUSTING. It took 3 full days  of deep cleaning to actually get it normal again. The previous renters left trash in all sinks and tubs,  had some slim on the bathroom walls, the floors were all sticky, vents had not been touched the entire time they rented (you could tell they smoked in the house), the kitchen has food on all the surfaces and even the window blinds. This group is awful and I hope karma catches up to them!!

name: Matthew Smith
text: Gave us $1000 in bogus fees for "repairs" they had to make when we left. Current tenant says repairs never took place. It would have been more expensive for us to come back to Mobile to defend ourselves than it would have been just to pay  Terrible, shady business. Customer service is absolutely useless on the phone. If I did not go into the office and physically supervise the ladies in the office, nothing would get done/signed/reimbursed. RUN RUN RUN, FAR FAR AWAY.

name: Kristen M
text: Rude management. Horrible service. Out for money. Put your trust into a different company.

name: San Richards
text: Very rude. Called for weeks before getting a return call to see a house. Finally saw the house, which they showed to several people on the same day, and missed it because someone else put in an application before me.  Then they suggested another home in the same neighborhood, same size, and identical to the previous home except it was $175 more! No thank you!  When I  see their name on a listing I keep looking. June 2016.

name: Steve McClellan
text: Most helpful staff ever!  They really go to bat for their tenets with the owners.

name: Logan Andrews
text:
Terrible experience. They tried to withhold the security deposit and charge an additional $1,000. Regency implied that I was signing a 12 month lease, but at the last minute notified me that I needed to move out at the end of the 10th month because "all of their leases end in June".

Bottom line: save yourself the time, money, and headache and go with a more reputable agency.

name: a davis
text: I wanted to view a property in Spring grove OCTOBER 2017, the lady was very elated over the phone. I went by the office the next morning  told her my name she looked puzzled and hesitant. I let her make a copy of my driver license, gave $20 refundable key deposit, and received the key. Well i went to view the property with a colleague and the key wouldnt unlock the front door or back door. I called the woman at the office explained that wr couldn't gain entry to the property. She said i dont know why its the same key no one else had a problem.  I get back to the office, she had my $20 ready in her hand. I said look at the video of my colleague trying to unlock the doors . She said i believe you. I thought how odd. She couldn't look me in the eye, but im looking her in the eye. She was very cold, and she said when my brother and I find the key I will call you back. Well its November 13 2017. Needless to say I never got the telephone call from her. The dark complexion of my feminine skin in her office that morning didnt match how I sounded to her over the phone the day before. Very sad that the color of a person skin is still very much an issue instead of having a successful rental business .

name: David Friedel
text: I don't understand how they can call themselves a real estate company. I was trying to move to mobile and wanting to see some houses. Once I travel down there they will not answer the phone or respond to messages. How can you rent/buy a house from them when they will not communicate with you. It is 2 weeks since my fist call and voicemail(of several voice mails) and have still not heard back from them. The closest I got from contacting them was when they answered and hung up in my face.

name: Tracy Huynh
text: The first time I called them was in Feb. "Brenda" picked up (she sound soooo miserable with her life) rudely ask how can she help me so I told her that i was interested to look at a couple of houses. She said okay she going to tell her broker "Carol". Weeks flew by still no calls. So, I finally called back in March asking why there was no calls. She said the tenants were still in the house. I'm like okay why can't you just called and told me that from the get go?! SO whatever I call for another house she told me to call back on April 1st so I did. Called back, Brenda said the same thing she going to tell the broker. a week flew by still no callback. So, I called back asking why? Brenda said that Carol son died the week before. Okay sorry for your loss but Brenda could've called back and told me so! UGH! SO finally in the middle of April I get a surprisingly phone call from Carol! Finally right.. she said she going to show me the houses the following Tuesday morning. We went to go look at two. SO Carol told us that we just 95 for the application for everybody. (me, husband, sister, her b grandma) we said okay. so we return the application in and Brenda was like we need 95 for each application!!! WTF! I called her told her what Carol had told me. She okay Ill talk to her and call you back. Oh she call me back quick this time. (of course theres money involve now) She said sorry she was under the impression that it was just me and my sister.. WTF! I just said whatever so we we paid 95 each (three application 285!) SO we got a call back on Monday from "heather" this time saying that we are not eligible. So I was like well  got a co signer but she insisted no. SO basically they just wanted that application money. there was no helping or anything. I called other places but it was too long of a wait and they were sooooo helpful and nice unlike these people!!

name: Teresa Chapman
text: Absolutely Can not get a response from this agency.

name: DejaaVuTV
text: Don’t waste your time!!!!!

name: jacob motes
text: DO NOT RENT FROM THIS PLACE!!  They are only concerned with taking your money!! They do not care about their renters.

name: Cam Jones
text: I will actively avoid properties managed by Regency Rental Associates.

name: stacey jones
text: We have been in our house right at 2 years. Anytime we have had an issue, which has been very rare, it has always been taken care of quickly. Anytime I have spoken with someone over the phone or in person they have always been very friendly and professional. I have no complaints at all about the company and would highly recommend them.

name: Walker B
text:
Don't walk away Run!!!!

When the owner his self doesn't reply to a Review but makes his own review to give his dismal review rating a much needed 5 star rating  is pretty much all you need to know.  My complaints are the same as the other real reviews. They didn't fix anything. Charged for things that were there when we got there. But of course to take them to court would cost more then the damages so they will win this one. Do yourself a favor do not get involved. Read the real reviews  not the fake ones by owners or employees  or clients they  incentivized to give a review  after a few months of renting. Listening to the truth of the reviews  of actual former tenants.  At the time of this review this  company  has less then 3 stars. When a company has one bad review  chalk it up to a bad day or a disgruntled  human being. But read all the reviews  and find the truth. Do your self a favor Don't walk away from this company run.

name: CI_1877
text: I recently signed a contract with Weaver Holdings and although it is early in our relationship. I am very pleased with their work so far. Everyone in the office has been great;  friendly, prompt and professional. I highly recommend them for handling your property.

name: Leah Warren
text: They lied to is and kept over 500 dollars in addition to pet deposit. They told us not to worry about cleaning after we tried to hire two of their recommended cleaning people that stood us up. They wait till we leave and then send a cleaning person in and we did leave it relatively clean. This woman could have sat the whole time and charged 250 dollars. Then they tell us we were not responsible for the flower gardens that was excessive and charged us 250 for that. Just wrong!!

name: AlexNicole Carr
text: I write this review as a family man. I am a new tenant as of April. While I have had (sometimes) different points-of-view with the office, they all have spoken nicely to me. When there was a big issue, Rod got involved, and he has been very professional. They provided very detailed pictures of the home upon move-in (and so any move-out issues should not be a problem). The only note about the move-in pictures is that they are small pictures without being able to see all the small details. Many of the houses (like mine) are old houses, and so that comes with old house issues just like with any property management company that deals with older homes. So if you are reasonable about your expectations and what a property management company is or is not obligated to do, then they will work with you fine. What this property management company will do is talk through things with you and come to a mutual understanding. But you need to understand the challenges of any property management company and do your part as a tenant (they have engaged every conversation and so there is no need to be argumentative; just stick to the facts and you will be fine with this company). A note about communication: if you google the property management company, then you will get different phone numbers on their google business page from their own paperwork. Make sure you are calling the office number if you want immediate attention. Also, use their website portal for faster service (their website portal is actually pretty good). I have seen improvement with customer service, especially when things got more complicated. A full 5 star experience would be difficult with ANY company who rents older homes. I have not been the easiest person to work with, and so they could have just written me off. But they did not. They got the job done. These random notes of a review stem from a complicated case that was partly due to my own personal situation of renting. In this regard, some of their work went "above and beyond" what you would think they had to do. So bottom line, I think they are a company worth trying out if you are looking at one of their homes online. You are required to view the home before signing the lease anyway, and so some of the reviews of others about their homes may not be as relevant to you (future tenant) since you can go see for yourself before you pay any money. I would only note since they are older homes to look in every corner, turn on every appliance, and give it a really good look. If you do your due diligence with the home before signing, then you may have a better experience than these google stars make you think. They have a regular office in Huntsville, so just stop by when you are in the area if you have any doubt.

name: Christina Vasquez
text:
Please, please, please do yourself a favor and DO NOT RENT from this company. Their license should be revoked simply for not following the Code of Ethics as well as negligent misrepresentation and omission.

As Everyone below has stated this company lacks some serious ethics and should be required to take the Ethics course in its entirety again because they clearly learned nothing. We have lived in the property for a little over 2 months and items that were supposed to given to us in working order are still not repaired. Rod Weaver along with his other associates should not be allowed to work with people especially considering they lack serious customer service and to be quite frank any integrity what so ever.

Renters beware, the home we rented was completely misrepresented as photos posted were not an accurate description. I reached out to Rod many times and even welcomed him to come see the home prior to moving so he could see with his own eyes the issues that were present. Saying the home was not clean is an understatement to say the very least. He stated " I will not expose myself to COVID-19 by entering the home." Kind of ironic as then expected us to expose ourselves, children, and movers as the home had clearly not been properly clean and sanitized before us moving in. The blinds were broken and covered with a thick layers of dust, walls were marked and all scuffed. Flooring was dirty and carpet stained. The previous tenants had left garbage in the garage as well as other items. Black Mold in the Shower, Dishwasher wasn't working, Dryer was broken, Refrigerator taped together and making loud noises, these are just a few of the issues that we have encountered. We had to completely re-grout the shower because the mold would not come off even after using 2 bottles of bleach. Our move in day was December 29 and we couldn't even sleep there for a week in a half due to the amount of cleaning and sanitizing that had to be done.

At the very least they could have taken accountability and apologized but at no point has anyone from Weaver Holdings apologized or uttered any words of kindness or remorse.

name: Zachary Welsh
text:
never got to talk to anyone half the time I called, works orders barely ever got taken care of, for some reason had no access to outside storage.

overall not a great first time renting experience if you have any other option I would go for it.

name: Shawuna Simmons
text: Terrible at returning calls or responding to emails.

name: L. Jordan
text: Very unhappy with our experience. You can never get ahold of anyone on the phone. Very unfair deposit return. They charged us for carpet when we had documentation that the carpet was not clean when we moved in. I left my return address 3 times and they still used the excuse of not having a return address to send our deposit to. No phone call to even ask for a return address. They were just going to not return our deposit. It was outside of our contract time by time we got ahold of someone to get our deposit back. I would never recommend this company.

name: Malena Warren
text: Weaver holdings refused to return a fair deposit to me after I returned the unit I was renting to them in the condition they gave it to me in. I provided them proof in my move in summary that some of  the things they stated were unclean were that way upon our move in. Now some other areas weren’t clean and we were ok with paying for that. I said to them that I shouldn’t be responsible for the full payment of cleaning when I was given a unit that was partially clean to begin with. Additionally, the carpet in one bedroom was terrible when we arrived as documented by the move in summary. They also charged me for cleaning the carpet. ERIN LOHSE cowardly refused to take my calls. And after more than a week of me calling and emailing her and ROD WEAVER she responds to my email but didn’t address the concerns of the email. Rod never responded. She stated they didn’t receive my move in summary but I scanned a copy of the move in summary provided by them as proof the home was in the condition previously stated. Be WARNED DON’T RENT FROM ANY PROPERTY THEY MANAGE. I will be sure to tell everyone I know not to rent from them. Property owners may want to choose different management!

name: FoXy R3ap3r
text: They are a great place to rent from. Never had an issue and we have been with them for over 5 years. Depending on your landlord will depend on your experience fyi

name: tom hislop
text: Rod, L:inda, and Erin have done a great job helping with my rental.

name: Kosmo DoW
text:
I'm not sure what to make of this company. I was interested in a home they had listed, but this home wasn't available for viewing until the end of the month. Linda (leasing agent) told me she would not lease a home prior to at least a FaceTime tour of the home being completed, so I had called ahead prior to submitting my application to ensure that my app was transferable to another property, if another one became available in the meantime that I liked. I was told yes, it was. Well, one popped up so I inquired about this other house. After setting up a FaceTime tour of this home, Linda e-mails me to say that I'm actually not approved for this home because it's a different price from the one I applied for (even though it's still well within the 3-3.5x rent range for my income). Oooook... I asked about a different house, and I'm initially told it's available. Great! A day later, I ask to set up the tour, and Linda says it rented yesterday.... yesterday, as in the day we discussed it and you said it was available? She also informs me that the home I originally applied for has another applicant, and that it isn't going to be available much longer if I couldn't commit to it. (Remember when Linda told me she wouldn't lease a home without completing a facetime tour? Ya, I don't know what happened to that either.) Here's the kicker, when I asked about how to get approved for a more expensive home, Linda said she wouldn't be able to do so without starting over and running my credit again, resulting in another inquiry on my credit. Two problems with this:

1) Their application never ran a hard inquiry on my credit in the first place, at least not one that showed up my credit reports
2) When I asked how long my application was valid for, she said the credit report was valid for 60 days, so that long. If the credit report is valid for 60 days, why do you need to run it again for a different price range?? The report is still valid.

Long story short, I feel like I'm being mislead and given the run around, at best. Flat out lied to, at worst. I either bothered the wrong person, or they decided I wasn't an applicant they were enthusiastic about working with. My credit isn't perfect, so I could understand, but if you tell me I'm approved I expect to be treated as any other prospective tenant would. Not told after the fact that I was approved, but only for homes within a specific $50 price range that basically left me with zero options. I will be filing a complaint with the BBB.

All that said, I do like to find silver linings where I can, and I suppose that if this is they treat the people they work with and rent to, I should call it a blessing I didn't rent a home from them. Also, I gave it 2 stars because Kim (the realtor) was nice. I liked her.

name: Rod Weaver
text: In regards to James Eardley comments - Weaverholdings Property Management actually rented to James and his family instead of selling him a home.  James and his family never viewed the condo at "The Villages at Madison Town Center" Condo's.  James and his wife rented the condo site unseen.  However the owner of this condo has completely repainted the interior, Replaced all the Carpet and Replace ALL the appliances.  My opinion is that James and his family felt living in the condo community was beneath them but at this point they had signed the lease and delivered deposit on the unit weeks before they arrived.  The owner (NOT WEAVERHOLDINGS)  let them out of the lease instead of holding them to the 12 months which he could have.  My suggestion to any tenant....look at the property you are going to rent instead of being lazy and taking advantage of everyones good intentions....James could have been stuck paying the full 12 months instead of just losing his deposit.

name: Dsve Haynes
text: Great guy!

name: ADR ADR
text: Food was hot and tasted good. The price for two orders (to go) was about $21. I texted them my order and they replied within 5 minutes. The wait (to pickup my order) was an additional 5 minutes and the service was friendly.

name: Courtney Williams
text: Awesome staff.

name: Justin Lasiter
text: RIP miss Carol! She was trying to help me buy a house with less than perfect credit but she passed and no one has contacted me or extended me the courtesy like her! And to add to my last review I want to mention how rude miss Carol's family that took over is! We were approved for a house that they said they couldn't wait till March for us to move in! So I was going to pay rent at 2 houses but they took money from someone else and held the house for them until march!! Miss Carol would roll over in her grave to see her customers being treated in such a poor manner! We tried to forgive them for the rude way we were handled hoping it was an honest mistake but my wife text them about another house and they speak to her like she is an idiot!! You dont do good business handling people like that in the south!!! We treat people with the same courtesy we want to receive! A lesson I'm sure you will learn soon enough!

name: Suzanne Esfeller
text: Don’t EVER use this real estate company! Dawn Elder is the absolute WORST! She is VERY unprofessional and pursued my fiancé, calling him and having very “unethical” and “unprofessional” phone calls that were not related to our rental property AT ALL and then allowed him to start having “sleep overs” until she had him move in her house that she got in her divorce. She’s a liar and a terrible and untrustworthy person. I bought this lady flowers and a card when I rented this house from her because I thought she was a woman who had been through the same things I had been through and she seemed hurt by her ex husband as I was by mine, only to find out she was trying to do the SAME THING to ME the whole entire time with my fiancé! I rented this house through her in April and the key box lock on the back door is still on the door! The rooftops on both storage buildings were covered in pine straw and limbs that she had said would be cleaned along with the yard and they never were. Things weren’t fixed or painted as she claimed they’d be before we moved in and she said later they’d be done upon us moving in. Well that never happened either. Save yourself and your family the drama and the dissatisfaction and go to another realtor or definitely ask for anyone but DAWN ELDER!!!! Mrs Carol would have handled this lady appropriately if she was still alive and fired her home wrecking self!!

name: Vincent Sifuentes
text: Very unprofessional company! I would never rent from them or do business with them again. They were ok when Carol was handling things. However, Dawn in the office was very unhelpful  in following up with those whom we were renting from and getting back with us. It was like pulling teeth to get decent customer service. She did not respond to our emails in a timely manner and was less than professional.  She flat right out ignored our email questions and never cared to get back with us,  I thought that was her job? They joined forces with David Kahn Company and things seem to be getting much worse from a service perspective. We rented from them for 15 months and boy was it a miserable 15 months! Never again!

One time, the lawn guy was real late in mowing and after telling her this, she come out and mowed it herself the next day. We will likely use her to help us buy a house.

name: Kelsey
text: As an owner I look for a property manager that looks out for my best interest. Gordan management company does just that. For example I have had tenants that have skipped out without paying. Gordan management company tracked them down and made sure they payed what they owed. They are easy for me to get a hold of when I need to, they don't make excuses like some companies. Although no one can guarantee perfect tenants, they were hard at trying to get me good tenants They have been managing 6 of my properties for over 10 years. I highly recommend them.

name: Jane Smith

I agree with all comments left but the 5 star rating (that must be a family member). She will make your life a living hell while you are under contact. No people skills, hard to get in touch with unless she wants something, doesn't tell whole truth.

name: Tim Mahathey
text: I have found Lynn Hahn to be exceptional. If I need assistance she always responds asap. I highly recommend her and Gordon Realty

name: Tyresha Edwards
text: Dooooo Notttt do business with this company. Lynn G. Hahn is a 1,000 year old hag who will lie and make up things wrong with your home in order to use your money to make updates when you move out no matter how clean your house is. TRUST ME. Please listen. She will not fix anything in home and will not answer the phone. We had to live an entire year with a broken unit and pray it wasn’t a hot summer. When we were unexpectedly given a 30 day notice to leave because the owner wanted to sale the house, we respectfully left the house completelyyyy clean. The house was spotless and I have pictures to prove it. She lied and made up things wrong with the house so she could fixed it up for the owner who wanted to sale the house and make updates. She then refused to look at pictures taken by us because she knew that the house was left spotless. We left the yard in top wonderful shape as we paid someone to do the yard beautifully before we left. Nothing was left either. When I confronted her with it, she laughed and told me to take her to court and hung up the phone in my face. Before you move in, she will not do a walk through with you before you move in or move out. She is lazy and will only give you a check list paper and tell you to send it in by mail. We had another issue with our ac unit and I wanted to come to the office to talk to her. When I called, She had a family member act like her assistant to answer the phone and tell me that she was not available because she had shoulder surgery. The very next day, my husband and I seen her driving around town. When I looked over at her, she had no sling on or anything in which she was turning and driving just fine. SHE IS A LIER. Please save yourself the headache and do not do business with Gordon reality. You will be making a big mistake. I hate that I have to even give her 1 star!

name: Alan Dominic
text: Ms. Hahn was very helpful and forthcoming on everything needed to qualify for a rental house.

name: Stephen Rice
text:
I've owned rental property in the past and I would never use Lynn Hahn with Gordon realty. I'm looking to rent now and I canned last Monday to schedule appointment, I was told she rarely gets close to that rental propoety so we scheduled an appointment Thursday near lunch time. I showed up ten min late and she was gone already. That's understandable.

I called though and she told me she just got an application from the public viewing right before our appointment. I was waiting all week, why did you not tell me about the public viewing LYNN??????? I was basically bringing my money and everything on the spot.

HORRIBLE COMPANY

name: Josh Lang
text:
Absolutely terrible experience renting a property through Gordon Realty with Lynn Hahn. We had problems from day one and we were misled at move out and lost some of our security deposit. If you do not read further, take one thing to heart - DO NOT TAKE MS. HAHN AT HER WORD! Make sure you get a written move out inspection or it's very likely she will do whatever the new tenants ask and take it out of your deposit.

My favorite Lynn Hahn quote was, “I never do anything in writing, Josh.” This was after a heated argument on the phone when I called back asking her to give me something in writing that my full deposit would be returned. She had said I would get my deposit back but refused to put it in writing. Later, she deducted money from my deposit for additional cleaning and repairs that were not based on a move-out inspection. They were based on the request of new tenants. Outrageously unethical in my opinion but apparently legal, which I found out the hard way.

The lease that was used with us is evidently heavily stacked against the tenant, which I found out the hard way through small claims court. The line about the owner/agent being required to compare move-out inspection to move-in inspection is apparently trumped by other clauses because it did not matter that she never did that style of inspection.

I requested a pre-inspection after a group showing and Ms. Hahn asked me for some cleaning and other items, which I completed. When I asked about the final walk through, expecting to get a written inspection, she didn't want to do it and asked me to just drop the keys off. It was a mistake on my part to oblige. I was worried she might go back on her word and I took a ton of photos but it didn't matter.

When the new tenants moved in they complained about some things that were not cleaned to their standards and they also complained about the condition of a few of the walls, which was patched and painted by me in multiple places but had heavy wear and tear when we moved in that I unfortunately did not document. At any rate, additional cleaning and repairs were made at the request of the new tenant and they were deducted from our deposit. This was all testified to in small claims court.

During the trial, the new tenant was brought in and testimony of their complaints, and subsequent repairs and cleaning, were actually part of the defense. And it worked. She even admitted to not doing a paper move out inspection and from the way she said it, I don’t know that she ever does a real inspection. I didn't get any explanation from the court other than a judgement saying that we had lost, but my attorney believed the lease was worded too strongly in the Owner/Agent’s favor.

Ms. Hahn also made a false statement on the stand. She testified that she had told me the house was filthy and that I had to have it professionally cleaned during the pre-inspection, which I mentioned earlier here. This is absolutely not true. She told me to have the carpet professionally cleaned, clean the window sills, clean the laundry room floor, and paint a patch I had missed. That’s it.

A month later, when arguing about how she had deducted from my deposit and well after new tenants had moved in, she told me that the lease had a line for professional cleaning, something I had missed. But that was the first and only time prior to the trial that Ms. Hahn said anything about having the whole home professionally cleaned. Prior to the trial, when I had pressed for details on what needed cleaned she had mentioned something like, “needing to get a list from the [new] tenant.” At the trial, though, she just said the house was filthy.

There is so much more but there’s a character limit to these reviews. Our A/C was out all summer and it was such a hassle to get it fixed. When we moved in, the home wasn’t cleaned even though we had made arrangements 3 - 4 weeks prior and were promised cleaning. Lynn forgot we were coming and seem affronted when I was upset. Terrible!

name: CHRISTOPHER TOMPKINS
text: I just spoke with the front desk lady! Asked to speak with a manager and she acted like I was a criminal for asking this!??! I'm absolutely dumbfounded about this!! I've put in my application and wanted to speak to someone in charge about it! She absolutely refused to let me speak to anyone!!

name: karen sanders
text: Visited  Matt at Tweed Music..Stop by he is very knowledgable about instruments and gives music  lessons.  Great place.!

name: Angela Elmore
text: Great place to stay, have stayed last 5 years, staff very friendly!

name: Johnny Scott
text: Its always good! Great service

name: Adam Hosto
text: Great for vacation

name: Kenyon Gradert
text:
Edit: seems like Hayley boosts its google reviews by rating itself. (See pic.) Appears that one of their own property managers left a five-star review.  And four of their five-star reviews come from people with the last name Hayley, same as the owner. (Maybe it's a coincidence!) It's almost funny.

Read through these reviews and you'll notice a trend that explains Hayley's poor ratings everywhere: they start with poor quality and end with scamming you out of your deposit. My pregnant wife and I spent 3+ hours on our hands and knees scrubbing our rental house top to bottom before we moved out. It was far cleaner than when we moved in. We discovered $100+ was kept from our deposit because we "didn't have it professionally cleaned" -- which is not even a requirement of the lease. I provided photographic evidence that we cleaned up messes that Hayley had never addressed when we moved in, proving that we left the place cleaner than Hayley did. (See photos below for before and after.) Their lawyer said our photos were selective and that we were "belittling" their efforts -- says the person who penalized a pregnant woman for cleaning 3+ hours. Nor did Hayley specify what we failed to clean, much less photographic evidence to prove it. All this to say that Hayley appears to automatically deduct $100+ from deposits for cleaning yet doesn't use that fee to clean the place to their own supposed standards.

This was just the last of many frustrations. Ants and roaches were present when we moved in. Here too we picked up for Hayley's slack and hired exterminators. Hayley's lease requires tenants to maintain the yard but when we moved in, we discovered the yard filled with bamboo and 1+ foot of pine straw (no wonder there were bugs). We asked Hayley to fix it; they sent a maintenance crew that cut the bamboo and left everything else. I spent all week raking it up.

Finally, the property was quite literally rotting on the outside. (Again, no wonder there were bugs.) The owner clearly was attempting to put as little maintenance into the property as possible. I think Hayley is coasting on the Auburn housing market, but it won't take much for a competitor to pick up their slack.

name: Marc Newbern
text: Let’s start in the beginning.  A week after I moved in I had to go pick up the garage door openers because they didn’t give them to me when I moved in, the also didn’t have two keys and had to go get one made.  The office told me that they thought my wife and I had funny relationship.  One, my wife is black and I am white so I am not sure what was even meant by that and two,  it’s none of their concern what kind of relationship we have.  Secondly they cheat you out of your deposit, doesn’t matter if that was the way it was when you moved in.  I have pictures to prove and the move in sheet.  They took $600 for touch up paint. I would be curious to know if they actually painted because they sure didn’t paint any walls when we moved in.  Keep moving, don’t rent from them, it isn’t worth the hassle.

name: Heidi Smith
text: Nice places to stay, but you have to put up with unprofessional office staff.  I am furious and would not reccomend them to anyone.  Takes forever to fix anything, they have their deposits all mixed up and allow folks to move in even if they havent signed lease for that time period.  they make me sick

name: Ann-Braxton Mann Smith
text: Follow the rules and dont destroy the home you live in and you may get different results when ya move out. I had absolutely no issues while living with them. Always nice when i called the office and never had any problems! Highly Recommend them if you know how to follow rules! :)

name: Elias Moritan
text: Do not respond to calls and applications in timely fashion. Hard to work with. Would not recommend.

name: Meredith Kemp
text:
We purchased a condo two years ago for our sons to live in while at college. The current tenets had four months left on their lease so we had Haley stay on as property manager since we were not living in the area. About two months later we received an email notifying us that an upstairs toilet had leaked but it had been handled and everything was dry. Since they had eyes on the situation we trusted them when the email said they had handled it and everything was dried. We had insurance, if they had informed us how bad the leak and water damage was we would have contacted them to come in. Instead two years later we have reports from an environmental mold specialist ongoing us that the upstairs and room beneath where water leaked is covered in black mold. Testing shows that it clearly originated from the bathroom leak not dealt with two years ago and the specialist also told us this does not happen when fans and dehumidifiers are brought in to properly dry everything out.
We owned a home in Virginia that had been handled by a property manager for 7 years before we could sell and they were always clear about communicating and honest with handling any issues. Haley was paid to do a job and clearly did not. My guess is because they knew we would not be extending our contract at the end of those four months when our sons moved in. We now have $20,000 worth of mold damage and our son with asthma health to worry about because of their poor management of our property.

name: Brent Butts
text: Rented from Hayley management for over 4 years. Not all of it was bad, but I wouldn’t recommend them. When we first tried to rent from them they told us to come sign because they were holding a spot for us. Only for us to come in and they told us it was given to someone else. They wouldn’t do anything about it until I had my dad come up there and speak to the manager and show them the text. Just over all unprofessional. Then upon move out they racked all these charges on us. Some were warranted and completely understandable. Others were not. A professional company would call you and explain the situation. They basically told us through email that our case was closed and to pay. They would not provide any proof of the work done or proof that fault was on us for certain damages. Not the worst place in auburn but you can find better for sure.

name: Edward Branchhill
text:
I've tried contacting Haley Management on multiple occasions to try and set up tours of available units. I always got the same response that they were "shorthanded" that day and to leave my information so that they could call me back to set up a showing. I've never been contacted back even after leaving my information on four separate occasions. The first time that I contacted them was over 3 months ago. Your experience may differ, but if the way they handle tours is any indication about how responsive they are to their current tenants then I would avoid them if at all possible.

Also, it appears that at least some of the 5 star reviews are left by representatives of Haley Management. For example, the most recent review by "Ann-Braxton Mann Smith" appears to be from a person that works for Haley Management (just do a quick search of her name). On its face, it appears to be a conflict of interest.

name: Matt King
text: I’ve been renting from Hayley for 3 years now and have had no problems. The staff is friendly, helpful, and they are super flexible on rent payments which is great if you are a student. The two leasing agents, Kelli and Ann Braxton and are always happy to help and answer any questions I have. They actually care about their owners and tenants. If you are a student and need a place to rent in the Auburn/Opelika area, I highly recommend renting from Hayley Management. Fantastic establishment.

name: Evlyne G
text: Friendly informative. Easy to work with cross country. Was given other options when the first choice wasn't available

name: Arthur Bosswell
text: Super trash!  They have employees and family boost their ratings.

name: Maxi Roberts
text:
I lived with Hayley for 5 years and literally didn’t have a SINGLE problem. I see a lot of reviews concerning security deposits. They give you a check list to
Go by when you move out. I followed the check list just like my lease said to and I got my entire security deposit back. I know this is a college town so maybe all of these mad people are just college kids who don’t understand how the move out process worked...? Not sure but I’m just here to say that they were all great and very professional to me.

I’d be curious to see the conditions of the homes that these “bad” reviews were left in. I can only imagine what some people lived like!

name: Adrian Buice
text:
Absolutely terrible to work with.  Would not recommend to anyone looking for a rental property.  We moved into a house that was poorly painted; single coated, holes in the walls were terribly patched up and not painted.
Upon receiving our deposit statement, they charged us $450 for them to repaint.

Edit: After sending in photos of what the paint job looked like BEFORE we moved in, they asked us to provide MORE documentation because apparently their team has NO documentation whatsoever on the unit.  A complete asinine request.  They also stated the grass wasn't cut and charged us $200 to cut the grass.  We provided photos of the yard the day we moved out which shows the lawn was in good shape.  A month went by before new tenants moved in.  I'm pretty sure they did have to cut the grass again between that time but we shouldn't be responsible for those cuts.  Disgusting company.

name: Mallory Mitchell
text: I love Hayley Management! They have been super accommodating to me and my family since renting with them in 2018. Ann-Braxton has been soooo helpful in getting my needs met and I’m so thankful to rent with them!!!

name: Jessie Mann
text: Where do I begin... we subleased an apartment and after being promised the place would be cleaned and carpets professionally cleaned we moved in. Well months went on and I stayed on the phone with their managers about the damages that were there. Moveout time comes after discussing it many many times with them they send me a bill for 7k dollars wanting me to pay for damages the previous tenant caused. They are so very unprofessional.... I SEVERELY wouldnt recommend renting from them!

name: Georgie the sweetest
text: First time ever writing a review in my life..Lived here for a year. WORST place to live. All good reviews are fake..Worst part is when you move out. They will check everything on their move out check list dirty and will charge you $450 for painting, $200 for carpet cleaning, $150 for “unprofessional cleaning” when the apartment was not painted and cleaned at all when I first moved in.. Absolutely worst worst place to live

name: David Aguiñaga
text: Unprofessional place, called them every day to check for any updates on my application and at the end they ended up leasing the property without notice they told me to look for other options on their web site and they will call me back... which they didn't. I didn't even rent here and I do not even recomend it because of their service.

name: DaJon McIntosh
text: They have a lot of nice housing options, but bad communication between their different offices. I submitted my application before my roommate and he got a response of rejection before me. And this was after we had already made an appointment to see the house, and on the way to see it. They should really suggest doing the application first before setting up an showing. It cost us $70 for application fees and $15 in gas and a waste of a day.

name: callie morris
text: Hayley Management has been so quick to respond to any questions that my roommates and I had during this pandemic about our future living arrangements. They have also been very polite and worked so hard to make sure that we got the answers we needed.

name: Kenneth Beard
text: Worst rental company to ever do business with. They will rent your property out from under you giving you little to no time to find somewhere else after you have discussed trying to renew your current lease. They never call you back when they say they will. The tenants right to a peaceful enjoyment will constantly be broken with them trying to find the next renter. They care less about the properties structure or maintaining it so they can make you pay for it. Everything is half way complete with anything they do. I would give them ZERO stars if possible. Also, if you do try to do business with them read the fine print cause they will try and pull a fast one on everyone of their tenants. It's not a personal basis with them only a number and dollar sign. Beware for you have been warned.

name: Brittney Johnson
text: They full of it. They want you to have a high credit score when alot of dont have that! We have good.

name: Jeffrey Webb
text:
Smooth move in and worked with us if someone was a couple days behind on rent. I would give them 5 stars but....
They gave us a check list of stuff to do to get back out deposit. The place was sparkling when we left but we were still charged for everything on the checklist. I would have been better off not cleaning at all. Hope they enjoy the bonus month of rent money.

name: Kim Spencer
text: Discriminatory with mixed couples

name: Ted Cook
text:
I don't normally write reviews, but I feel like I need to warn people about this company.

I lived at a Hayley property for two years and actually enjoyed the property itself. The size and location weren't bad for the price, and the one time pet fee made having a dog in college actually plausible. Unfortunately, that was pretty much all Hayley got right.

The yard was always a mess, with massive patches of dead grass and poor irrigation that caused the yard and our sidewalk to flood whenever it rained. There was also an issue where the owner of our property had requested that Hayley not sign anyone to a lease after our first lease ended so that he could sell the property, but Hayley signed us to a second lease anyway. This lead to confusion between us and the owner over whether we would be able to even live there the next year at a point in the year were most properties in town were already taken.

However, the worst offense was their predatory security deposit handling. During our second lease, our new owners would visit often and always thanked us for taking such good care of the property. On moving out, we followed Hayley's checkout list in full and left the place better than we found it. Despite all this, instead of getting our security deposit back, we received a bill stating we owed $1600 in damages BEYOND what our security deposit covered.

We were surprised to hear this based on how we kept the property, so we requested proof of the damages we were being charged for from Hayley. We were told that we would have to schedule an appointment for that, but any subsequent attempts to schedule an appointment were ignored.

Funnily enough, a friend in the same neighborhood who also rented from Hayley received a very similar bill upon moving out and has had the same experience in being ignored.

It seems as though Hayley's strategy is to scare young tenants out of their security deposits by asking for a ridiculous amount of money and then silently slinking off with an extra month's rent. To make things worse, this money isn't being used to clean or renovate the properties either, if the state of our property when we moved in is any indication.

So in summary, just avoid this company. Don't be fooled by the reviews here (if you look closely, almost all of the good reviews are years old with no comments and the recent reviews are much more scathing). You may not have problems right away, but they're bound to arise at some point.

name: James Hayley
text: I highly recommend these people. I rented from them for 2 years. They gave me a check list of their expectations once I left. It was super helpful and I got a my deposit back. They responded to my work orders in reasonable time. The rental was very spacious and comfortable.

name: Side Track
text: Been living any their space for over a year and it’s been very easy. People are nice and respond quickly. They fix things as fast as possible. No complaints. Gonna keep renting from Hayley.

name: Smith Smithson
text: This company has to be one of the worst managed rental agencies around. They do not care about tenants at all. It can take weeks at a time to get a reply and answer for any questions you may have. If your question regards anything dealing with money, you will unfortunately never receive an answer. However if you're looking for a job though, I would highly recommend trying to become a manager for Haley Management. This is because every time you ask to speak to a manager the receptionists say that they are on "vacation". Sometimes they can be on "vacation" for weeks at a time. So if you're looking for a job that pays you to do nothing at all and gives you more paid vacation time than any business around, being a manager at Haley Management could be the right job for you. I would suggest only working for them though because living in a property owned by them is not half as rewarding.

name: Nicky Bravo
text: Unprofessional and drug their feet and lied to me. Would not recommend at all! If you have any other choice try to find arrangements with a different company

name: Janna M
text: This company is one of the greatest! We have rented from them and now rent our condo through them. They are always helpful and get things done fast when needed! I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a rental company!! All of the office staff is wonderful and very helpful!

name: Thanh Huynh
text: Their service is Good and I love working with Brandon, but some of the staff is so rule and I feel like I was discriminated. I cannot remember her name but she is white. She was so rude and racist. I can feel that by The way she talk to me because I am an Asian and don’t speak English well. She used to gave me some tours to the house but when I was not pleased with the house and then she had a bad attitude to us. Whenever I call to talk to Brandon, she never let me talk to him, and try to ask me why I call, and then answer impolitely. I feel bad. She is Really mean to me. Please respect your customer, I pay the rent on time, I didn’t take any one money. Please learn how to answer the phone if you are as customer service agent. Because of you, I give your company zero star.

name: Stephanie Greene
text: I called and asked to see a property, they were very polite and very prompt in sending me the access code. However, I was very disappointed to have found out that the house in question Had another interested party. In fact, I didn’t find out that somebody else put an application in on it until I called back about it, which wasn’t even 24 hours later. I am slightly disappointed of course. It was beautiful home and would have been perfect for my husband and I. However, I’m more frustrated that they wasted my time and as a former real estate professional I would have expected them to at least let me know that somebody else was interested in the home, had put an application in on the home, so that I would not have wasted my time. I think I’ll look for a more customer focused office for my future needs.

name: Trish Cooper
text: Very knowledgeable

name: Kathy McBride
text: The management is very rude. They don't respect their tenants at all. We don't mind to pay maintenance fee if it was our fault to clog the tub drain by fallen hair ( I tried my best to collect these hair while taking shower and threw them to trash can), but you don't have to send a complaining email and attached a picture on what you unclogged and warn us not to do that anymore! Sorry but I won't call for maintenance anymore!

name: May Chen
text:
I like the work of Hayley Management Company very much. They are very professional, responsive, efficient and considerate. They not only consider the demands of the property owners and handle management affairs efficiently and effectively, in the process of collecting lease and providing management service for the property, they are also very considerate for the tenants with the greatest goodwill. It is not easy to handle the balance of effectively solving problems and considering all relevant parties with a humanitarian spirit, but they can do it very well and balance them very well.

All the staff working there I have contacted, no matter over the phone or actually going to the office,  are very polite, professional and responsive to your inquiries and requests. So far, this is the best management agency I  have seen. I definitely highly recommend this property management company to my friends.

name: Brice Hilyer
text: I rented from Hayley Management last spring and their service was exceptional. The rooms were impeccable. Customer service is the best around! I would recommend Hayley Management for everyone!

name: Donna Burnett
text: Brianna is a great representative for your company.  She assisted me in finding a great place to live on short notice when I moved to Auburn!  I have every reason to recommend Haley Management Company to help others with their housing needs when moving to Auburn or the surrounding area!  Thank you, again!

name: Hannah Anderson
text: Rented from this company for 6 months. They were always prompt when I called for maintenance. They even repaired the fence for the backyard before move in, so my dog would be safe. They added a pay rent online feature that makes renting from them much easier.

name: Chris Jefferson
text: I always thought organized gambling was illegal in the state of Alabama, that is until I signed a lease with Hayley Management. You see, Tom Hayley and his band of thieves run Haley Management like that of a casino. When you sign a lease with them you are gambling with what service you will be provided. If an appliance ranging from a refrigerator to an air conditioning unit quits working, you have a chance at them fixing it in either 1 try or 10 tries. Sometimes these issues can raise your power bill up tremendously high. If you call their offices to try and figure out an issue with money of any value, your chances of receiving any kind of help are around 10%, the house has 90% in this particular game they offer. But rest assure every December and January their employees try to reel you back into the Hayley Management casino just like a pit boss does in Vegas or Biloxi. So unless you’re a degenerate gambler I’d steer far away from Hayley Management.

name: Maddy Carroll
text: Very helpful staff, I have enjoyed working with this company, especially through this stressful situation of COVID-19!

name: Andrew Orman
text: Not very good on customer service. Absolutely robbed us of our security deposit, deducting for ridiculous reasons. Our unit wasn’t nice to begin with, and we had to get it cleaned after we moved in, even tho they claimed it was done before hand. Overall terrible. Would choose Northcutt any day of the week.

name: Mona Johnson
text: R&R rentals is by far the best company I've ever rented from. My duplex was clean and in great condition when I moved (and when I moved out). My roommates and I never had any maintenance problems, but Kurt (the owner) was always just a phone call away if we had any problems/questions at all. I would definitely recommend renting from this company, it was a good experience.

name: Stephen Hughes
text: Highly recommend!  Impeccable work ethic.  Rented many properties over the years and have never been so satisfied with the staff.  Very personable and easy to work with.

name: Brett Nelson
text: The owners here are very friendly and very helpful.  The way the run things here flows smoothly and without a hassle. Highly recommended!

name: Ben Burkart
text: R and R (Hayley Management) took over management of the house we were renting right before our lease ran out. The company that was managing our unit did not provide Hayley management the total initial deposit amount that we put down. They also did not provide them with our initial unit inspection sheet. Because of this when we got our deposit refund it was much lower than it should have been. After explaining the situation to Kurt, and providing him copies of all our initial paperwork,  he was very willing to refund us the deposit amount that we deserved. Excellent customer service and they put their customers, both renters and owners, first.

name: DopeAMean (DJ Dope)
text: Unable to make contact, used someone else.

name: Farm House
text: Hayley management company is a great group of people to work with. They care about their customers and work to make their customers satisfied in everything they do. They really care about their work and the customers they serve.

name: ribbon ribbon
text: Do not be fooled by the close-to-perfect reviews of this rental company. The majority of the reviews come from random accounts who ONLY review Hayley Management AND Tiger Iron Gym... hmmm, the owner of both of these companies is Kurt Hayley, who only wants to boost the reviews of his places. I personally leased with them BECAUSE of these reviews, and while the quality of the duplex was sub-par, they don't have upkeep of their rental properties. People have dogs and don't even pick up after them... Not the worst rental company in Auburn for sure but I think it's really shady that the good majority of these reviews are from the owner hidden behind a computer. *disclaimer: This isn't my main e-mail account as I do not want to be harassed by places where I provide my HONEST review.

name: Andrea DeWitt
text: I was very disappointed a number of times working with Haley Management. I had accepted a job in Auburn and was looking to move relatively quickly. It was very difficult to get a reply to the emails I would send about available properties and viewing appointments. I still to this day have yet to receive an email from Charity about a property that I was later called for. I was told it was no longer available by phone call on my part but then called by Brandon the next week after I had accepted a property with a different agency. I understand that emails can pile up and get lost but after three months of working with them I would not recommend them if you are in any type of time strain.

name: Tfoles4Life
text: We have had a fantastic experience with R & R rentals. We had bad experiences with several other companies in looking for a house initially, but Kurt with R & R was very personable and easy to work with. We found a great place to live owned by R & R, and we've had great service ever since! When we first moved in there were several issues with the house, but within a couple short weeks R&R got them fixed. When we had a problem with some of the maintenance workers, Kurt went above and beyond to figure everything out for us. It is rare to be truly taken care of and looked out for as renting college students, but R&R has done a fantastic job!

name: Katelyn Johnson
text: Not much managing going on here. More interested in collecting a paycheck than ensuring and managing quality properties.

name: Glenn Lamb
text: Hayley Management is great! They really work hard on finding the right spot for you. Plus the lady up front is smoking hot!!! Makes you look forward to coming in every month to pay your rent!

name: Angela Tran
text: Stay away!! They give you a dirty unit to start with and when you live in the unit for two years you clean and fix everything that they didn’t. And once you move out they want to charge you for every little thing just to keep your security deposit! Money hungry. They don’t care for anyone. They have a bunch of college kids working for them and no one even seems to care. Just stay away from this place!

name: Sierra McNeel
text:
First of all, if I could leave Hayley Management 0 stars, I would. I lived under Hayley Management for 2 years. I enjoyed the property for the most part, but the office is very unorganized. Maintenance was also disrespectful to our belongings when they would come maintain the grass on the property. Grass was not cut as often as it should have been, multiple times it was knee high. They’d consistently leave the gate open and throw our yard furniture near the house. The bushes in front of the house were probably trimmed twice the entire time that I lived there. If you cannot maintain all of your properties, maybe you should charge less for rent and not offer this service.

Multiple times they called me saying I had not paid my rent when I had and even had a receipt to prove so. I was a very loyal resident who always paid my rent on time. The lease ended on the 20th of July and they would not offer us a pro-rate for the month. Although we had to pay the entire month’s rent, we were required to keep water and power on 7 business days after moving out, and if we turned it off, then we were charged a $95 reconnecting fee. Aside from all of that, Their move out checklist is insane. They are trying to have the tenants clean the entire property so that they do not have to pay a cleaning service to do it. Tomorrow is 60 days since we moved out and our lease stated that after move out if applicable we would receive our security deposit and could request a list of damages.

Back to being unorganized, no one in the office is able to provide me that list or amount that I am receiving back. I asked to speak to a manager and I spoke to Kurt who told me that this was a ridiculous question to ask. What's ridiculous is speaking to you clients like this. Is it really a ridiculous question to inquire about my money? Anyone who is leasing here or planning to lease here, be wary, because they make everything seem really nice in the beginning but really screw you over in the end.

name: Crispy Cloak
text:
I have rented from 3 other companies in the Auburn area. This is hands down the best realty company I have been with.

We had a flood here on Christmas Eve. When the realty manager Kurt comes out here himself on Christmas Eve with boots and shovels to dig trenches and rip out carpet and help us take care of the problem, you know you're in good hands.

I don't think I need to say anymore, but I will.

They are super easy to rent from, maintenance will come same day if you report a problem. Rent is a fair price and the office is always friendly. Coming from Alice Henderson realty before, this is paradise.

name: Ellis Kennedy
text: I got my full security deposit back. Great people and management. Definitely will rent from them again.

name: Valerie Tisdale
text: it's been 72 days since I've moved out and haven't gotten any information on my deposit refund. I didn't get any sort of checklist upon moving out. It seems like it's managed by undergrad students. Look at Northcutt reality instead.

name: Harry Fisher
text: Loved renting from Hayley management. Great people and always were quick to come fix something if it broke. Highly recommend renting from them.

name: Austin Phillips
text: My back door knob jammed after hours and I called and they were here within minutes. Changed the knob like a NASCAR Pit crew. Much appreciated.

name: Katy McCollister
text: I needed a place fast and Hayley Management helped me get a place to rent that day. They showed me the unit, ran there background check, and we signed a lease. It made finding a place to stay a breeze.

name: Melissa Monroe
text: Most of the good reviews are from friends of the Hayley family, family members themselves, and employees. They're the ones that treat the tenants poorly. Maintenance never fixed my leak, mold was present in unit and after requesting it to be taken care of and speaking with the ladies in the office along with Kurt they just said sorry. When I first moved in the floors were filthy, walls were missing paint,  window pane and blinds were already torn, light bulbs were not working, air filters were dirty, toilets constantly ran etc. Did I mention the unit and other units are invested with spiders. Even after telling them I had a baby present in the home nothing changed. I was never late on rent and kept my unit clean. When I moved out they were frustrated because i told them I was not resigning my lease due to their lack of care for their tenants.

name: LaDonna Moore
text: Hayley Managment is awful, my son’s lease has not even officially started and I can tell you I would NEVER recommend this company regardless if you are leasing or a property owner. My son signed a lease to move into an apartment where two other young men were renewing their lease for the upcoming year.  Not a sub-lease a NEW LEASE. The guy that moved out left the bedroom and bathroom disgustingly dirty, blinds broken, holes in bathroom wall.  Spoke with HM face to face with pictures in hand and they refused to do anything about it. Told me it was my problem and office manager said  “ if I were you I would not have signed a lease for an apartment I did not view first” . My son did view the apartment back in February when he signed it is now July.  I am sure HM will keep this boys deposit but they are refusing to use any of those funds to fix the damage and mess he left behind.

name: Anthony Greenlee
text: Really loved my apartment in Opelika. It was really spacious and in a great part of town. I am gonna miss that place.

name: Joshua Hollingsworth
text: HMC is fully focused on  providing the customer with top- notch customer service. This alone puts them way ahead of the competition. HMC also, keeps their tenants happy by quickly correcting maintenance issues and offering reasonable rates. Easy 5 stars.

name: Kevin Namey
text: Kurt Hayley is the man. Loved renting from his company. I will definitely continue to rent from them.

name: Harrison Godwin
text: Hayley Management Co. has by far the best service in the Auburn/Opelika area. Kurt runs an outstanding management team who's focus is clearly on the tenant experience. They are more than willing to work with you and place an emphasis on availability and ease of communication. After 5 years of renting through several other large management companies in Auburn,  I can say with full conviction that HMC succeeds where so many other companies fail: with a customer service focus, reasonable rates/requests, timely maintenance, and up-to-date/well-kept units.

name: Shannon Wiggins
text: We've worked with Hayley Management Company for the past year. Kurt Hayley and his team manage several of our Auburn properties, and we've been impressed by their responsiveness, local area expertise, and competitive rates. Not only is HMC reliable, they operate with honesty and integrity - qualities not often attributed to property management companies. We will continue working with HMC for years to come!

name: ann ryan
text: I will definitely use hayley management for future rentals. Kurt runs a great business and his employees are so helpful!
