name: Loraine Jones
text: Unprofessional and Misleading. They’ll  take you through too much just move. Three different people told me three different things. Charity gave me a list of available properties. When I found what I wanted Brandon wanted me to sign a lease mind you I haven’t even looked at the property. Sooooooo I called to do a viewing appointment. Kurt said someone lived there and I couldn’t  view it until May. Kurt said he would call me the next day but DIDN’T Then I get an email from Brandon saying I didn’t make enough money for the property I wanted. I’m think sooooo why did you want me to sign the lease. Lol they suck find someone else. And the behind the scene OWNERS suck too. You pay up your rent then they’ll decide they don’t wanna renew lease. Lol oh well.

name: Lindsey Richardson
text: The Hayley Management Company was very friendly, helpful and efficient in helping my family find our desired home. I would recommend them to anyone!

name: Tyler Heath
text: I made the switch from northcutt to Hayley management. I love it. Great company.

name: Joseph Vinson
text: Hello all, I'm a recent customer of Haley Management Company (HMC) after the homeowner I currently rent from began to use their services. I first want to state HMC was very point blank and aggressive and I find them to be unreasonably rude, making use threats and unnecessary means of manipulation to obtain rent EVEN THOUGH I WAS READY AND WILLING TO MAKE A PAMENT. After a recent Identity theft and a severe life threatening illness that left me homebound for several months I was very hesitant to send large amount of money to a company that I had never heard of. All this happened over text message too at that, though they Implied that I(who have had a great rental history prior to my current very difficult landlord) "Had just been ignoring them and they had been trying to make contact". All their problems were my fault. They show absolutely no desire and put forward effort to make my rent payment easy to make, just threats. even after the check I wrote them was RETURNED TO ME DUE TO SUSPICIOUS ACTIVITY. Excuse my language but i didn't even know where the goddam office was. This is an inexpensive company that at the moment appears to care nothing at all about about the well being of their tenants. This is just a personal note, but I can give the impression of that of a low income person in trouble (when in reality that was not the case) and I get the impression that this company has been using the fear and threat of security as a means manipulate their "less desirable" clientele regularly for some time now. they seem very practiced. My advice, don't do business with people who use fear as a business model. I will be living my very well enjoyed home to work with a company that values my business and perhaps more importantly, value me as a human worthy of respect. Spend your time, happiness, and money with better people. You (or your tenants) will thank you.

name: Regan “egan” Chandler
text: Completely unorganized and terrible communitcation within the company, each person you call tells you something different. They really screwed us over this year.

text: Just moved out from a unit. I loved that place. I couldn't ask for a better place for my college experience.

text: stellar property management company! Gotta borrow more hands but 4 thumbs up!

name: Mengyuan Qiu
text:
Hayley Management Company is by far the best management and real estate company in the Auburn/Opelika area.

Realty Service: Kurt Hayley is one of  the most knowledgeable and experienced realtors  in the area.  He is honest and to the point and will tell you exactly what the condition of the property is and how much you should pay for it.  His comps are current and accurate. You can't go wrong to pick Kurt and his team if you are a potential home owner.  Unlike other realtors in the area, Kurt is also a real estate investor.  For all the potential real estate investors out there, Kurt is the agent you want.  He is a great lead and he finds properties that are not on the MLS.  He has a team of contractors that can quickly and accurately estimate repair costs so you can generate your cost estimates.  Most importantly, if he cannot find a property that fits your criterion, he will tell you so instead of trying to sell you one that wouldn't be in your interest.

Management Company: Hayley Management Company will always answer your phone call and address the concerns you have on your properties.  The team always collect rent on time and send the check on time.  Kurt will always look for the best price for repairs to save you the owner money while keeping the customer satisfied.  I have heard nothing but good things from my renters.

name: 조경미
text:
(Translated by Google) Management is a mess. Unfriendly and...

(Original)
관리가 엉망진창 입니다.불친절하고..

name: Cait Chri
text: Love the Clubhouse. There are even showers in the men and women's locker rooms near the gym. Gym is better than the planet fitness!! Pool is fun! This place is perfect for students to live with friends.

resp.text: We love our new gym, too! Thank you so much!

name: tammy stanfield
text:
Read this before signing a lease. My daughter lived at this apartment complex for two years. When we got the house assignment before my daughter moved in they had completely changed the type house that my daughter had agreed to rent. Then they said directed me to the place in the least small print where it says they can switch you to any unit they please. There was nothing we could do about it. While we were in the unit the hot water heater was replaced going to a gas hot water heater and because the gas was in my name they charged the hot water heater to my account. It was charged to my gas account and debited out of my checking account, $1800 without my permission. I had to wait three months to be reimbursed and I also had to wait on a coupon from the gas company to be reimbursed. We could not wait to get out of there.

——I did receive a phone call a few days after posting my review from the corporate office about my negative review. I want to clarify that Spire didn’t charge my account without the On-site management people at Creekside letting the gas company into the home. I nor my daughter was there to let them in and the only people that authorized the charge and transaction was Creekside and Creekside refused to call Spire and correct the problem by billing them or the owner of the condo. Also, the small print indicating they could and did switch the unit that we wanted is a fact and an issue that future tenants need to understand. It makes you realize that they could and did show a nice unit in the style, location, and price and switch you to whatever they want.  They placed our daughter in a unit that was at the entrance to the community, high traffic, high noise, and her Eno was stolen off the tiny porch the first week.

resp.text: Hi Mrs. Stanfield! Thank you for taking our call this afternoon to discuss Spire charging your account for the water heater. We are glad they were able to sort everything out, but apologize for the lengthiness of the process.

name: Emma Truitt
text: I love living in creekside!! with all the beautiful amenities, trees, and sidewalks perfect for walking, it’s been the best place to live as a college student!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Emma! We have enjoyed having you as a resident.

name: Sarah Beth Bland
text: Creekside is a great place to live because of how it is built into the trees! Being able to hear a creek when on my porch is incredible. Not like some other places in town that are simply concrete slabs. Creekside has green!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Sarah Beth!

name: Loren Potts
text: creekside is the best place to live!!! the houses are great, and i love the clubhouse and the pool. the BEST pool in auburn. the gym is also great and has everything you need. highly recommend living there!!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Loren! We agree that Creekside has the best pool too!

name: Woodruff Columbus
text: We love managing Creekside of Auburn units!

resp.text: We appreciate our Woodruff family!

name: Emily Spraggins
text: Creekside is sooooo different than your average luxury apartment living. You really do get the ultimate college living experience by living here at Creekside. The houses are so cool and the amenities are off the charts. By far the best neighborhood to live in as a college kid!

resp.text: We love that you enjoy our community! Let us know if we can ever do anything for you!

name: Kellie Vosteen
text: SO happy I chose to live here for almost all of my college experience! The place and the amenities are beautiful! I love how much it can feel like home❤

resp.text: Thanks for the love, Kellie! We appreciate you!

name: Maddie McDaniel
text: I love creekside and it is very at home feeling!

resp.text: Maddie, thanks for the review! We are so glad that you feel at home.

name: James Richardson
text: Don’t waste your time. Office is EXTREMELY unprofessional. More worried about squeezing all your money from you instead of accommodating residents. Do yourself a favor and tour almost any other complex in Auburn.

resp.text: Thank you for stopping by the office today and going over Creekside's Rules and Regulations. Should you need anything else, please do not hesitate to ask!

name: Paige Maxwell
text: Very poor quality for what you pay. My carpet tack strip was showing in multiple places when I moved in and was never fixed. There were also cracks in our front door that you could see outside through. The wifi went out almost every day. I turned my keys in when I moved out but they claim they don't have record of that and charged me $100. :) Tons of miscommunication and conflicting answers from different people in the office when trying to get information on things like re-signing, gas/utilities, etc. Pick somewhere else to live

resp.text: Hi Paige! It looks like we were able to work out your key issue. Please let us know if we can help with anything else.

name: Amber Crumpton
text: Great staff and amenities! Highly recommend. Best place to live.

resp.text: Thank you Amber, we are so happy that you enjoy it here at Creekside!

name: Talley Mortara
text: Creekside has been an awesome place to live the past two years. I live in the lodge style houses and love it but i also love the access to a pool and workout space. It has a good sense of community.

resp.text: Thank you so much Talley we are so glad to have you!

name: Sheldon Holmes
text: Creekside is an outstanding neighborhood for college studies to live in. I have experienced nothing but safety and companionship while living in creekside. As an almost graduating senior in May of 2021, I will miss living in creekside. All the employees that work at creekside are efficient, kind, and helpful. I recommend creekside to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you Sheldon! We're so happy you've had a great experience here! We will miss you when you graduate and wish you the best of luck! As always, War Eagle!!

name: Lauren Binnig
text: This is my second year living at Creekside and I love it. The distance is far enough from campus, that you feel like you are away from school and come home to a nice area. The staff is great! I recommend checking it out!!

resp.text: Thank you so much! We are in love with our awesome amenities too!

name: kelvin james
text: Very neat excellent spacious condos

resp.text: Thank you Kelvin! We appreciate the kind words!

name: Bridget Casey
text: Great neighborhood. Great Staff. Nice amenities. Such a great place to live while attending Auburn University!

resp.text: Thank you so much Mrs. Casey! We love having you apart of our community! Thanks so much for the wonderful review!

name: Creekside Auburn
text: Creekside is THE place to be when being in Auburn! Great staff, amenities, and the houses are AMAZING!!

name: Clay Mintz
text: Great place for Auburn & Southern Union students to live!

resp.text: Thank you, Clay! We strive to be the best for everyone!

name: Bolton Brothers
text: I have lived in Creekside for all of my years at Auburn which would be 4. It has been an amazing experience. Beautiful landscaping, friendly neighbors, and a lot of good memories. The management has also taken great care of us. Lost my car keys and they delivered them to my house. Overall great quality.

resp.text: Thanks guys! We love your moving company! We are so happy you had such a great college experience here at Creekside!

name: Becca Hopkins
text: BEST most incredible staff out there. I have had the most amazing time living here. It blows my mind that people write about how the staff is unprofessional and rude. I promise those reviews are people who broke the rules in the neighborhood and were held accountable for their actions. I want to say just how beautiful the houses all are. There is a huge grass area for your pups to play! But most importantly, no matter what issues arose, regarding the neighborhood, my house, other residents, you name it, Kristen went so far ABOVE and beyond to be the most genuinely caring person. She is the sweetest manager you will ever meet. She didn't have to do 99% of what she did for me while I lived there and I can never say thank you enough for the staff of Creekside. Truly a luxury living environment. I spent a couple years living here and never regret it for a minute!! If you are looking for a place to live Fall or Spring you have to look at Creekside or you'll miss out BIG time! Also shout out to Charlie in the front office for helping Kristen pack my WHOLE house and move it to my new unit for me while I was abroad. How many managers and their employees in the office will do that for? that is just a testament to how much the staff cares about everyone (pups included).

resp.text: Becca! This is such a sweet post! We really appreciate all the love you have for Creekside and the staff! We loved having you as our resident for the past several years!

name: Kristin Burton
text: I have lived in Creekside for 3 years in as a student. This property has the absolute worst management I have ever seen. Clearly they don't train their staff to know anything. Any time my roommate and I had maintenance issues in our apartment, we had to call several times before someone would come out and fix the problem. Our AC in our unit breaks all the time. During graduation weekend it wasn't working and we were going to have several people in our unit celebrating with us. On Saturday, we called and were told maintenance doesn't work on Saturday's and then were told we could call someone not affiliated with Creekside. When we asked for a recommendation the girl said, I don't know I'm from Florida. Clearly, they don't care at all. The gate is never working and part of the money we pay to live here includes it being a "secure" neighborhood. They don't take care of the property. Don't live here even though it seems nice, I wish I had lived in Aspen Heights.

Workers at the office never seem to know anything and give you the run around, no one is on the same page. The gate has been down maybe 5 times since August, if the gate is down it only lasts maybe an hour because someone will run it over. name: Steve Klein
text:
I lived here for three years and figured I'd let people know my thoughts. Some of it is good, some of it is bad, some of it could go either way depending on what you want out of a place to live, and some of it is just unavoidable as it is targeted to college students.

Some aspects of the property are really nice. The clubhouse is pretty nice (though the weight room is a joke; I don't know why any Auburn student would use it instead of the top notch campus facility). The common areas are generally well-maintained. I say generally because while the landscaping is kept up, the gates are not. I've been trying to get my name added to the call box for three years and it still hasn't happened, yet I know residents that moved out years ago still in the list.  The gates are frequently broken and they keep nobody out. If someone wants to get in, they will get in. They will simply wait for someone to open the gate and go in after them. If you are going to be a "gated community" then be a gated community. In my opinion, Creekside should just get rid of the gates because they really don't accomplish anything except annoy the residents.

Creekside does not tow. This could be good or bad depending on your point of view. I never had an issue with parking. On busy football weekends, perhaps I'd be 10-12 spots away from my front door but that was about the extent of it. However, other parts of the complex may not have quite as abundant parking so that could be an issue. I'm really not sure. It was nice to not have to deal with visitor passes, etc. but it would be very frustrating if there wasn't enough parking near your home.

Creekside does not enforce many of its own rules. The one that really annoys me is the pool. It is supposed to be limited to residents and residents are allowed two guests I believe. What it ends up being is tons of people who might know one person in Creekside... or in some cases just show up without knowing anyone. I pay good money to live in a place like this and don't feel like my money should be going to clean up after non-residents who break chairs, leave beer cans and bottles strewn about, etc. Some would say I'm a party pooper... but I like to think of it as being irritated by trespassing. People (many times non-residents) bring beer bottles and dogs to the pool routinely... both are supposed to be fineable offenses... but I've never seen one handed out.

Maintenance is a mixed bag, but mainly poor. To get a broken door repaired, it took about a dozen phone calls over a two month period. Simply absurd. I also reported a broken toilet two different times. Once, it was repaired promptly. The other time... I was told they'd be out there "in the next couple of days" and nobody ever came. After about a week, I fixed the toilet myself. Also, I should point out that *OWNERS* are occasionally treated as second-class citizens by the on-site management. Essentially, the homeowner's dues should get me the same rights as the renter's... but when I file a maintenance issue that is supposed to be covered by the HOA dues, they handle all renters first... I guess to make sure they get people to resign because they know the homeowner is unlikely to sell because of a small issue like this. Or, in the vast majority of cases, it isn't the actual homeowner who lives in the house; It is often the parent of one of the residents who probably never even hears about the issue.

The last issue I have is with the TV/Internet Service. It has been nothing short of awful the entire time I've lived here. In 2015, I don't think people can really appreciate just how bad I have had it and what a negative it is. The internet is slow, often less than 1 megabit/second so forget about streaming Netflix during peak hours; You'll be lucky if you can just get a YouTube video to play in 240p, nevermind HD.

All in all, it is a decent place to live. You could definitely do a lot worse. I think I'd rather pay for a location closer to campus rather than the resort style amenities, but that is personal preference.

resp.text: Thank you for the valuable information

name: Angie Chatham Denton
text: Real nice, gated community.!

resp.text: Thank you Angie!

name: Kelly Tsaltas
text:
Creekside of Auburn claims to have the best pool and amenities in Auburn and to be “student living redefined.” Their definition of student living, however, did not live up to its advertisement.

Firstly, what they boast as the best pool in Auburn is ever crawling with non-residents and is usually dirty. Oftentimes people who come to the pool don’t even know anyone in the complex (I have no idea how they get in). Adding to their being unwelcome is the fact that they, along with actual residents, throw empty beer cans and cigarettes into the pool, making it disgusting and completely unable to be used.

Creekside also advertises itself as a gated community. Unlike other gated complexes, however, Creekside uses a barcode scan system, which is usually broken. Thus the gates are open 24 hours a day, including weekends. If the gates are closed and the scanner is broken, there is no code to open the gates, which led to three broken gates because of cars driving through them in the year that I lived there. Why they chose a system with no backup way to get in is beyond me.

Creekside is a magnet for irresponsible students who love to party loudly. I did not understand how there could be such a high concentration of people with such habits, but then I discovered that much of Creekside’s advertising involves half of drink specials for residents and other alcoholic incitements. There were obnoxiously loud parties that could be heard two rows of houses over and up the street nearly every weekend and even on weekdays. These parties were rampant with underage drinking and lasted until four a.m. or later. The courtesy officer never picks up his phone, so the police usually come. This is an inconvenience and an annoyance for the officers, especially since Creekside hired someone who is supposedly responsible for taking care of such noise disturbances.

The Internet is abysmal, and it is nearly impossible to get someone to come out and fix it. Our Internet didn’t work for three months, and the management refused to give us a refund on the portion of our rent that went toward cable and Internet.  They also refused to let us get our own router.

Management threatens to fine its residents constantly, but never follows up; therefore, what looks like a beautiful complex from outside the gates is full of porches that are littered with beer cans, cigarettes, trash, and beer pong tables. Any complaints about the state of the porches will go unnoticed.

All in all, Creekside is a place for rich kids whose parents don’t care if they drink excessively underage and blow off classes in the morning due to a midweek party. Were I a parent, no matter how much money I had, I would avoid investing in a unit in Creekside like the plague.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback on our college student community.

text: Expensive. Internet service provider is horrible. Other than that the Units are in decent condition though i believe we are all overpaying by about 50-75 dollars per month and the front gate is NEVER fixed. A gated community isn't a gated community without a gate. If you require at least internet a few times a week i would stay away from Creekside. I, unfortunately, am locked into a lease already..

Needless to say, you would better served looking for properties with other companies that actually VALUE people who have money, solid guarantors, and no prior rental issues.  Avoid!!!!!!!!

resp.text:
We always appreciate reviews-even those left by individuals who have threatened to harm our business via social media. We never want to find ourselves on the defense, but sometimes find that it can’t be avoided. We agree that anyone who does not meet our rental requirements clearly stated on our application should avoid applying. We placed the requirements here to save anyone not able to meet them the time, expense and credit pull involved with an application. While we strive to use feedback to improve our practices, we have not yet developed a system that can stop someone from ignoring the stated criteria and knowingly applying anyway. We have included the verbiage from our application below.

Before you begin:
Please be prepared to pay the application fee as outlined in the property listing. In addition to this rental application, you will also be required to provide a copy of a valid form of identification and proof of income.

To complete this rental application, you must be prepared to provide 3 years of residential history as well as contact information for your rental references. You will also be asked to provide information on your monthly income, and please note, most properties require that applicant(s) combined gross income is at least three (3) times the monthly rent amount. Approval is not guaranteed.

We require a minimum credit score of 600 and three times the monthly rent in monthly income for application consideration. Credit reports with active collections, judgments, tax liens, open bankruptcies and high debt to income ratios will result in an automatic decline.

Each resident over the age of 18 must submit a separate rental application.

Applicant accepts property in "AS-IS" condition.

Application fees are non-refundable.

In the case of multiple applications for a single property, complete applications will be processed in the order in which they are received. Only applications where all applicants have viewed the property in person and have attached all required documentation will be considered as complete.

Application fee: $40.00

name: LaToya Moore Freemont
text: I inquired about viewing a property. I was told that the office had been hit with Covid and there were no agents available to show the property so I should follow up on Monday morning when someone could “safely” do so. I followed up with Stacey, as instructed and received no response. Coincidentally, the property is no longer available. Makes me wonder whether theIt Covid was of the “Patriot” strain.

resp.text: In response to your accusation, we want to make it clear that the COVID-19 pandemic has had an effect on our office and on the lives of our tenants as well. Our showing agent was sick with COVID-19 last week. We would never knowingly expose the public. The property you inquired about is an occupied property and we are required to provide the tenant with a notice prior to showings. We received no response to our initial inquiries. On Monday following the New Year's holiday, we were inundated with requests and again, contacted the current tenant regarding possible showings. When we were finally able to reach them, we were told that they did not feel comfortable having anyone come through their home while occupied due to their concerns over COVID-19 exposure. This property is still available on our website and has remained so. However, we are not able to show it until the current tenant vacates. We hate that you feel that our response to circumstances created by the pandemic had anything to do with you personally. We can only do the best we can to protect our employees, our tenants and the public to the best of our abilities.

name: Scott Curlings
text: Been working with them for over 6 years.

name: John White RCDD
text: I’ve lived in a dozen or more places , easy.  I’ve had pretty okay landlord and management companies. Until now , I’ve never come across a more professional and high quality property management and real estate company. Consider yourself very lucky to have these great folks working with you. This is professionalism at its finest. I gave five stars because there’s no option for ten.

name: Eric Richardson
text:
I have some very legitimate concerns about Walton & Tower Real Estate, the worst landlord experience I have ever had.  I have never once written a review like this, I have worked in Customer Service for almost 10 years, and I always give benefit of doubt.  In this case, Walton and Tower absolutely deserves this review:

I recently moved from Kansas to Alabama for work, and due to the Pandemic, could not travel to view homes prior to my relocation.  My family helped tour properties, and I saw pictures and videos to help make my decision.  The home I found in Odenville, AL looked amazing from the initial pictures. Walton and Tower Real Estate made many promises that the house would be in “like-new” condition by the time I arrived. So I loaded up a 26” U-Haul, signed a lease and headed to Alabama. My nightmare started the day I walked through the doors for the very first time.

Prior to leaving a rental property, it is a standard that the property be professionally cleaned/repaired/painted prior to another tenet moving in.  Every time I move out of a property, I pay to have a professional group clean it, out of my pocket. I was given assurances by Walton that this would all be handled prior to my arrival, especially given my situation.  To my shock, it was a mess.  During a Global Pandemic, this company did not have the house professionally cleaned or sanitized in any meaningful way.  Here are just a few examples of things I had to deal with on my first night (before I could even start to unpack):
-	The ceiling fans had a half an inch of dust on every arm (hard to miss even for an amateur cleaning company).
-	HUMAN HAIR in the bathtubs and floors.
-	Food particles and stain in the microwave, and on the cooking surfaces.
-	The counters in the kitchen were sticky with grease, food, and god knows what else.
-	 All the Stainless-Steel appliance surfaces had stains.
-	TONS of dust above the fridge, cabinets, edges, fans, and several surfaces throughout.
- The kitchen/bathroom floors had not been mopped, one pass with my Swiffer mop and the pad was solid black.
-	Spiderwebs still hanging in the breezeways inside the house.
-	The worst part was the carpets, walking on it in socks you could feel your feet sticking to sections of it.  Gallons of black SLUDGE filled my own personal carpet cleaner after running it in only one room of the house.  The carpets had NOT been cleaned.

The house was disgusting, and the reaction of W&T was even more disgusting. In this Global Pandemic, cleanliness matters… I spent hours scrubbing surfaces, carpet cleaning, mopping, and using specialized cleaning products on every corner of the house.  One wipe with just a damp paper towel would pick up handfuls of dust and grim.

When I called the management group for help, their response was nothing short of inappropriate, I did NOT get a callback, but instead an EMAIL saying they found the cleaning of the home to be “satisfactory”. Imagine you go to the hospital to have surgery, and afterwards you wake up and the doctor tells you, “Well, I didn't do everything I was supposed to, but I think I did a satisfactory job”,  no one would be happy with that result.  I have given this company multiple chances to help in any way to fix this issue, and at every turn they have either ignored my requests, or shrugged me off as a "difficult" tenet ONE WEEK IN. Going as far to send one of the managers, Trace, to my home who insulted me, was very abrasive and said "it's not my problem", refusing to take any responsibility.  I signed the lease, and they could care less what happened next...

This is not how any Property Management company should react to situations like this, their behavior was inappropriate, and downright childish when trying to resolve minor issues.  I will not be using this company again and will be leaving as soon as my lease is expired, and I would URGE people to seriously research this group before considering to invest into one of their properties, or to hire them to manage your own property.

Some photos attached.

resp.text:
You can often find reviews with the added disclaimer “this review was collected as a part of a promotion.” In this case, we feel this review was the product of an extortion attempt by the tenant. Both this review and reply are being written after only two weeks of occupancy of the house. As mentioned, the tenant had multiple family members view the house prior to leasing. Both emails and phone calls have resulted in threats by the tenant to harm our business after a demand for cash was made. We do not “pay off” tenants to keep them from leaving negative reviews. We are sincerely sorry for the overlooked dust above the refrigerator and on ceiling fan blades, but we do not believe that these items show a lack of concern for tenant safety during the pandemic as is asserted in this review.
While we believe things like streaky stainless steel are subjective, timely payment of rent is not. It is part of a binding lease agreement-signed by both property manager and tenant. The first two rent payments due from the tenant were late resulting in $215 in late fees. As the tenant seemed to be unclear about the terms of the lease he signed, we initially refunded the fees as a one-time courtesy only to receive emails threatening to contact the property owner or “handle himself” if he was not given money for what he deemed an unsatisfactory cleaning. He made good on those threats with the above review. We do not pay off tenants. We made efforts prior to his arrival to make for an easy transition by arranging for the key to be at the house rather than being picked up from our office as is standard procedure, fielded calls from family members about matters that had been responded to days before and again, waived late fees that were a result of a failure to comply to a binding lease agreement. As mentioned by the tenant, we also had someone from our office go to the house to discuss his complaints in person.
We cannot find reason where none exists. While we hate for any tenant to have a negative experience, we also know when we are fighting a losing battle.

name: Brittany Wiginton
text: I rented a house with Rudolph Realty and I have to say they are the absolute WORST company I’ve ever had to deal with. So unprofessional, unreliable, and untrustworthy. They do not have the owners best interest at heart; and definitely not the renter’s. The only way to contact them is through email, in which they don’t answer often. Had to send several follow up emails to get anything done. (Bc they don’t have a phone number to call anyone). Took two months to get my security deposit back and then they hit me with stupid charges so they didn’t have to refund the whole thing. Sooo glad to not be managed by them anymore! Just wanted to let anyone looking for a rental company know so you don’t get stuck in a contract with them and regret it.

resp.text:
Brittany,

By law, we have up to 60 days to close out the security deposit. You vacated the property during one of our busiest months of the year so it took longer than usual to get to put together the invoices and close out your file.
Overall, the move out went well except for the overpowering pet odor. The carpet cleaners you used did an insufficient job in cleaning the carpets and we had no choice but to have the carpets cleaned again.  You do not get to determine how much a company can charge for cleaning carpets.
We have responded promptly to each and every one of your email inquiries.  You seemed to have a bigger problem with not being able to call our staff and verbally berate them as you did when you 1st took possession of the home. Hostile/emotional phone calls from you to my staff were the main reasons we switched to email communication only.
We wish you the best.

name: Timothy Hall
text:
Not great: They could be hard to contact at times, but if there was an issue, maintenance was always out promptly. Some of the staff weren't very friendly, some were.
They will give you your security deposit as late as they can (& for me falsely claimed a car was parked in the yard).
They also didn't communicate with the home owner about the pet deposit they collected on the owner's behalf.
They're inflexible when it comes to business dealings. They will do what's in your contract, nothing more and nothing less.
They're far, far from a slum lord, but also far, far from the best rental agency I've worked with.

resp.text: Tim, we appreciate the kind words. I hate to here you had somewhat of a bad experience.  You are correct about being inflexible.  We follow the  Alabama Landlord Tenant Act.  All tenants are held to the same standard when renting a home and when they vacate.  We try to process the security deposit refunds as quickly as possible and sometimes the we use most of the 60 days given by the Alabama Landlord Tenant Act. I'll research your comment about the pet fee.  If a pet was listed on your application, you would have paid a non-refundable $200 pet fee at the time you took possession.  Any funds collected would be credited to the home owner's account.

name: Sean Isaacs
text:
I've rented for over 10 years and have never had a place require an application or a "fee" just to look at a property. This should have been a sign of how they were to work with, but we tried it anyway.

We filled out their application, paid their fee, and looked at the home. It needed a lot of work done. The floors were really scratched up, the walls had holes in them, the patchwork and paint work looked like it was done by a child. Not to mention this property hadn't been cleaned in a long time.

Their application packet came with an offer page. I made a reasonable offer, asking for a small discount to forgo them fixing the floors, paintwork, and cleaning. They said they were "insulted" by my offer and wanted nothing to do with us a applicants.

They told us if we followed their process, it would work out. Well, it didn't. And now we are stuck with finding a new place to live and only have a few days to do so.

resp.text:
Seen (or Sean),
Let's review the timeline of events.
You initially come into our office and had issues with the fact that you must pre-qualify in order to check out keys to view the property.  We do this to ensure that neither you or our staff have to waste their time if a potential renter has an unsatisfactory credit score.
You boldly stated that you are a car salesman and "you know how to negotiate".
After speaking with you about your concerns where you may or may not qualify, you were instructed to turn in the application so we could process it and determine if we could rent to you and your family.
You offered $1,300/month on a $1,650/month rental and you demanded that my client waive the February and March rental payments.
I took your offer to the owner who informed me that he was insulted by your offer and would not consider you as a renter.
Keep in mind, you came to us.  You may be a car salesman but my client is not buying a car.
You were not charged the full application fees.  We did everything we could to work with you.  I'm sorry you are scrambling for a home and we wish you the best of luck moving forward.

text:
What a great team of professionals! We rented from Rudulph for 3 years and were immensely pleased with them from start to finish. That is saying a lot because there were issues with the property owner not meeting the standard of maintenance that Rudulph requires on several occasions. Each time, Rudulph did everything in its power to encourage the owner to comply.  Eventually, Rudulph decided to end its relationship with the owner, which made sense to us as  well.

Upon move out, the owner sued us for $3,500.00 in trumped up damages. Instead of leaving us high and dry, Rudulph took care of us and we only had to pay our security deposit, which was fair. We could not have asked for more support from any company.

If you are thinking of renting from Rudulph, I can assure you they operate with integrity and truly look out for their tenants. We are now looking to rent again and of course, we would not consider using anyone else but Rudy and his team of caring, knowledgeable professionals.

name: Coleysia
text:
Terrible company that lacks integrity. I am currently moving out of an apartment and I pay $1200 for my rent. I was inquiring about a townhouse they have listed for $1200 (I’m thinking same price, more space, makes sense). I thought this would be a simple transaction but boy was I wrong. I submitted an application and the security deposit (equal to one months rent). I passed the credit check, employment/ salary verification, and rental verification. You would think that would be enough to enter a contract.

My application was denied because the owner didn’t feel comfortable renting to me because I’m on (unpaid) maternity leave. I return back to work in August ( which was confirmed by my job). To prove I was secure financially, I offered to pay July and August rent to ease concerns. The owner still didn’t feel comfortable. I called back and offered to pay up until October (4 months). The owner still didn’t feel comfortable renting to me. At that point I knew I could offer to pay up the entire lease and it wouldn’t matter, because it wasn’t about maternity leave.

I was told negative things about this company prior to my inquiry but I decided to try them out anyway. I see this is just the way these people are. I’m not going to make accusations but I’m a well educated, professional, African American woman. Draw your own conclusions.

resp.text:
C C,
You were turned down because you did not meet our posted minimum requirements.
1) Combined monthly income of 3 x the monthly rent in garnishable wages.
2) Minimum credit score of 600 for all adults to be considered.  Having a 600 credit score does not guarantee that you will be accepted but your application will be considered based on the other criteria.
You were initially turned down because you did not meet the combined income of 3 x the monthly rent in garnishable income.  The other adult on the application reported no income on their application.  You and I spoke on the phone and you asked me if you could pay several months up front to cover the time until you went back to work.  I called the owner last night and reviewed the application with him and gave him your offer.  He said he did not feel comfortable accepting the application based on the information that was given.

On the occasions where repairs were needed, they were done quickly and professionally with minimal intrusion.  I would definitely recommend renting from Rudulph!

Thank you for your thoughts.  We enjoyed working with you.  Good luck on this next chapter of your life and please do not hesitate to reach out if you find yourself in need of our services again sometime in the future.

name: S B
text:
I don’t want to go into complicated details, but what I will say is that miscommunication has now cost me a great deal of money. ($10k+) I will also recommend to anyone using this company: that any communication be done ALL in writing.

What’s even sadder is that after renting/selling my home with them for years, my side of the story was considered a LIE & there was no attempt to keep me as a customer. To say I am disappointed is a huge understatement. I also just think that people should treat others better.

resp.text:
Ma'am,
The details are not complicated.    We had a roofing company ready to take care of what needed to be done after the adjuster went to your home.  Your father said he had a buddy who was a roofer who could handle the issue.  Your father's roofer is to blame for not removing the wet/molded insulation in the attic.  Your father's roofers did not put the gutters back on after the repair.  You asked us to handle.  Our contractor said the roofer did a sub-par job. You asked us to send everything to your father.  We did as you asked and he blamed us for what his roofers failed to do. You asked us to handle the interior repairs.  Our contractor handled the repairs from the ceiling down (patch and paint).  As we were not provided a copy of the adjuster's report, we had no way to know what was going on in the attic. We are certain you were paid for mold removal/remediation yet you never received a bill/estimate for mold removal/remediation from our contractors. This is an unfortunate series of events that I would like to help you with however you feel the only remedy is for me to take responsibility for something that was mismanaged by you.  You have a claim against the roofing company.  Have you contacted them about this?  It seems that it is easier for you to lash out at us instead of taking the necessary steps to hold the person(s) responsible who dropped the ball. I enjoyed working with you and I hate to end the relationship under these circumstances.
Rudy Rudulph
Property Manager

I didn't get the house but they came back and helped with my search, and are very invested in making sure I find a good placef

Thank you for continuing to work with us.  I'm glad you were able to find something that fit your needs.  Please keep us in mind in the future.

name: Dalton Newell
text: I rented a home from Rudulph Real Estate, and the experience was fantastic. This company was easy to work with, responsive to all maintenance requests, and super fair in their handling of the security deposit that I put down when I signed the lease. 10/10. Would do business with them again.

resp.text:
Dalton,

text: I leased a property from them and was less than satisfied with how they did business. A few days after moving in I phoned to tell them the heat wasn't working they had it checked out and I was treated like I was just a dumb women and that the heat was fine. later when the temp dropped I had to call again since the house was at 50 degrees in January after another service call they said whoops the whole unit is bad. Upon moving out they charged me for trash under the house that was there when I moved it. Also changed me over 400 in pet cleaning fees that were not disclosed at time of lease. I also had to wait for over 2 month for the little bit of security deposit I did get back. Just not upfront and honest about stuff. 😡

name: Melissa Shawler
text: The Rudulph Real Estate team was a complete pleasure to work with from beginning to end. I recommended them to a few fellow servicemembers, who are also very happy they decided to rent from Rudulph. Of all the property managers I have dealt with, including the managers of my own property in Louisville, KY, Rudulph is lightyears ahead of their competition. They are timely when addressing issues, accommodating on methods of payment, take great care of their properties and make all of the processes for renting or moving out extremely easy. I would not use any other property manager in the Birmingham metro area.

SFC Shawler,

It was a pleasure to work with you over the last few years.  Good luck on this next step with the military.  Please keep us in mind in the future if you ever find yourself back in Birmingham.

name: JERROD SLAY
text:
My wife and I rented with Rudulphrents for around 2.5 years in a house in Crestline Park. Rudy was an excellent property manager and his team was always prompt to respond to get things fixed when needed. In the time we were there, we had several issues including AC, plumbing, trees - all items resolved quickly.

We recently bought a house (mid-lease) which would not always be the best way to go for either party. From the time that I made Rudy aware of the circumstances, he was very good about making sure we were on track to sub-lease the house quickly so that we would not have to pay both rent and mortgage.

Overall, very good experience dealing with this company.

resp.text:
Jerrod,

Thank you much.  We enjoyed working with you guys.  We hate to see you go.

name: Amber Lese
text: No callback. Called for property management, instructed by machine to email. Sent email with my info, and still have yet ro receive any callback from them..

resp.text:
Amber,
I hate that we missed the opportunity to work with you. Please forward the email you sent originally to reception@rudulphrents.com.  This is the same email address where you should have sent your original inquiry.  I just spoke with my receptionist and she confirmed that we have not received any information requests from you.  Please note the spelling of Rudulph.  Many people have made the mistake of spelling Rudulph as Rudolph and the email does not get kicked back.  I believe that is because there are at least 2 Rudolph Real Estate offices in different parts of the country.  We welcome the opportunity to bring on new clients.  Even if a  property is outside of our service area, I always try to link you up with someone who should be able to help you.  I look forward to seeing your email.
Amber, we are still looking for your initial email.  Please forward to reception@rudulphrents.com so we can determine what happened.
7/15/19:
Amber: we still have not received the forwarded message from you.  Due to your lack of response, we will assume you either sent your initial request to the wrong email or you have never had contact with Rudulph Real Estate.

name: Neal Bradley
text: We've been renting from Rudulph for a few months now, and they have been spectacular.  The professional and courteous staff have been great.  We've had a couple maintenance issues that got resolved quickly through them.

resp.text:
Neal,
Thank you for your review.  We appreciate the feedback.

name: Cyndy Gurley
text:
I was extremely happy with this company up until just recently (hence the 3 star). I have been renting with them for around 14 months now. If you qualify and meet their standards they are wonderful to work with. If you are paying your rent in full and on time, they will go above and beyond to meet your needs. However, if there is an unexpected life turn, even notifying them will not help. I was laid off at work and could no longer afford the rent. Even their qualifications say that you must make 3x the rent in a months time. I now make less than 2x the rent. I notified them of my life changes thinking that was right thing to do, but as I had forgotten, just remember they have a contract in place and that is what they will go by like any other business. They are still a great company despite my disagreements and misunderstandings on some of their business practices, but if are going into renting with them knowing there is even a possibility of financial changes in your life, I would not recommend them.

Adding in response to owners reply. They did offer me release option, but ultimately that is continuing to pay the rent in full as usual until it is released, sold, or until end of your lease (which ever comes first). This is extremely risky option for someone who cannot afford the rent in the first place. Can’t afford their rent, but they want you to pay two rents while waiting for them to find another person to lease. Great idea guys. Even when I offered to pay 3 months rent, plus them keeping deposit to end lease ( 6400 total).  They claim they can get it leased in a month or two (3200 total) so why not take the 6400 total and let me go? Hmmm, wonder if it’s because they cannot/ or don’t try to immediately lease it out??? Just a thought. You have to move out before they will begin to show, again paying two rents. Not a great option when I cannot afford their rent, so no that’s not helpful as he claims. Not sure how that helps me at all as they are “helping me out of a bad situation”. And I have signed and returned the release option papers, so I am unaware of what that is about. I even got confirmation emails they were received, which I am happy to provide to anyone showing the dates of his post vs the dates of the emails. Also, I highly doubt I am the only person that has gotten frustrated from being in a financially binding situation, so not sure how that deems me the most difficult with this type situation. Again, great company, until you are in a financial situation where you cannot make rent.

Update on this (today 7/30/19), as if the owner below saying I did not sign and return the forms in June wasn’t enough, just got a call saying they did not have the forms (supposedly) and could not process anything. I told them I had email confirmation that all forms were received and would be glad to forward that over. Was told that worker was on maternity leave and they could not access email to get the forms. Not sure how that’s my problem??? But sure, I’ll redo everything again since you cannot properly arrange cover while employees are out on leave. 😄

resp.text:
Cindy,
Thank you for clarifying the fact that we hold renters to the agreement that they signed.  You did not include the part where we gave you the choice of a re-leasing agreement that you, as of today, have not signed because you would rather us let you out of your lease.  We understand that people run into financial hardships and we do this sort of deal at least 10 times a year.  We have never had someone react as you have reacted.  Keep in mind, we are trying to work with you to help you get out of a bad situation.

name: Troy Birdyshaw

text: I rented a place in alabaster AL. Mid-lease this company took over the lease. After moving out August 2013 they sent me what was left of my deposit per their evaluation. He last stated in january he was out of town and would review once he was back. Ive yet to hear anything. Rudy

name: lindsey hutchens
text: A misunderstanding meant we had to pay for a door repair because it looked like someone had tried to break in the apartment we'd been living in for about a year and a half.  We weren't sure - the door frame just splintered one day when opening, leaving the lock virtually useless. (The door was not in particularly good shape when we moved in.) We didn't file a police report as there was no evidence that a break in had actually occurred. When Rudulph repaired it and didn't charge us, we thought there was no issue, since nowhere in our lease did it indicate a police report would be necessary. We were a little shocked when we moved out several months later and over $400 was deducted from our deposit specifically for the repair of the door - without prior notification by the property manager of the cost of the repair, which only included a new deadbolt and a patch fix to the door and frame. Upon speaking with Mr. Rudulph, this was how they recouped their investment in the door repair. Maybe this is standard procedure for most leasing agencies, but it seems like bad practice to require your tenants to involve law enforcement before you will pay for repairs to damage they did not cause and that, if not addressed, could endanger their safety.

resp.text:
Lindsey,

I appreciate your thoughts.  It is standard policy that any time a tenant reports a break-in, we require them to send us a copy of the police report as soon as possible to justify the cost of sending a contractor to fix the door.  I explained this to you guys at the time of the incident and trusted that we would receive the police report after a few days.
Rudy

We would love an opportunity to know more about your experience with Whitworth Real Estate and how we can earn a 5-Star review from you. Please give us a call at 205-556-2242. We look forward to hearing from you. Thank you!

name: William (Will) Ketcheside
text: Totally unprofessional people run office. Arbor Place, which is a Whitworth property, is the worst apartment complex possible. Roaches everywhere, bed bugs, and the people are the worst part. I stayed here because it was cheap but it does not end cheap. Had a leak above my shower and maintenance came and cut a hole above my shower to fix it. They left the hole and when i moved out Arbor place charged me for repairing the hole!!! I never received any notice until 8 months after i moved out and my bill had been sent to collections. Since it was already at collections they said there was nothing they could do. Whenever Maintenance would enter my apartment they would leave foot prints and trash from their work. They are garbage apartments and people that do not serve the customer they look for anyway to take advantage of the residents. Do not stay here! Do not rent from this sorry company!

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback. At Whitworth Real Estate, we strive to give excellent customer service and meet each of our tenant’s needs and concerns so that their rental experience is a positive one. As per our lease agreement, the tenant is liable for all verified property damage. In order to verify property damage caused by the tenant, we first review the tenant's initial move-in inspection and any subsequent maintenance records and reconcile those against the final move-out inspection. We process the security deposits and charges within the first 60 days after move-out. All communication regarding security deposits and charges are sent via email and first class post to the forwarding address provided by the tenant. As per your request, we re-reviewed all charges against your security deposit and did not find any discrepancies. All outstanding tenant balances are sent to collections after 60 days of delinquency. If you wish to discuss this any further, please call us at 205-556-2242.

name: Jessica Keith
text: Whitworth Real Estate has always been helpful to me. They were always fast to help with maintenance requests and always professional. They even tried to help me find a new apartment when my plans fell through. I would gladly sign with Whitworth again!

resp.text: Thanks Jessica! We're glad to help! Let us know if we can be of service anytime. We appreciate your feedback and are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us!

name: Marsha Maddox
text: This company lacks integrity. They will take your security deposit and charge you additional fees for no reason at all. My apartment was spotless when I left it but they still tried to take my money until I threatened to sue. This company should not be in business. Do not move into their properties. Find somewhere else, trust me you will regret the decision if you do.

resp.text:
(**This review was just recently brought to our attention while updating our online information. **)

While we do not have any Marsha Maddox in our database, the only tenant who has threatened to sue us is Ciera Jefferson, and the information surrounding Ms. Jefferson’s interaction with us matches this review description from Marsha Maddox. We were hopeful that Ms. Jefferson would appreciate our efforts advocating for her even though she was legally responsible to pay this owner. We value integrity, and we honor our established guidelines, signed agreements, and thorough Move-Out process.  It’s unfortunate when a former tenant doesn’t take responsibility for minor items and subsequently tries to damage a business with an alias account on an unregulated review platform. The only way to combat such reckless libel is to give readers access to the facts.

As for the move-out charges, we provided Ms. Jefferson an itemized deposit record per our agreed upon lease agreement. Despite our right to charge $279.88 to Ms. Jefferson for minor damages and cleaning, we advocated to the owner on Ms. Jefferson’s behalf to allow us to refund her $250 deposit. This property owner ONLY made an exception with this specific tenant’s deposit because of her long term tenancy.

Copy and paste this link to view the documents (https://goo.gl/7rV1Tf), which include the 4th page of the lease with the applicable areas highlighted, the move-out form with photos, the original deposit letter, and the final adjusted tenant ledger.  A review of this information shows we were justified under the lease to make these charges. It is a farce for Ms. Jefferson to think the threat of a frivolous lawsuit – and not our intervention – was the reason she obtained any refund at all.

Our goal as a property management company is to have both satisfied owners and tenants, which sometimes puts us in a difficult position. We do not operate any facet of our business arbitrarily (for "no reason at all"); our reasons and policies are factual and transparent and are found in our lease agreement. We are saddened to hear that even after we advocated for Ms. Jefferson she still chose to leave such poor feedback. However, she stayed with us for over 3 years and renewed early each year – which is some testament to our good service, a point unmentioned in her review.

Customer satisfaction is very important to us, and we are disappointed we could not resolve this situation more amicably.

name: Seth Busby

resp.text: Thank you, Seth! We appreciate the review! You were a great tenant to work with as well!

name: Olithia Wingard
text: So, to clear this up. Professionalism was a problem from the beginning. If you can take the time to read the Google review, find out my issue and then respond in a very unprofessional manner, you "home owner" could have contacted me via phone call, text or email because you have all three. Now, onto poor quality. The cabinets in the kitchen don't close nor does the drawers. The paint still  sticks and when you open the cabinets and drawers  the paint chips away. The request that "the owner" is referring to, is the second roof leak problem that we had. When the maintenance man finally came out the first time, after two weeks, he himself, had no reason for it being two weeks. The second request was sent in on a Fri maintenance didn't come out til Mon (guess the were waiting for it to cave in like the others we've seen in the review). Someone came out on Tue, still unsure where it's coming from, since all they did the first time was put what looks like, tar on the roof from the first leak, which is not in the same place as the second leak. We pay, on-time, $1150 in rent, we should never have a roof leak problem in the first place. And by the way the roof is still leaking.

resp.text: Hi Olithia, thanks for the detailed reply! We will have someone look into this and get with you for any clarifications. Thanks!

text: I’ve lived in my house for 5years and I’ve been having issues… Lately I’ve been looking at others homes until they sent Elton Johnson a Maintenance Guy who took his time with me and fix all my issues.. He’s very professional And i adore him Thanks Atlas.. He really went above and beyond

name: Taylor Kosman
text: As you can see already, Mr. Rick is a diamond in the rough.  Just left my house and that was the most accommodating, friendly, and effective gentleman at his job that I've gotten the pleasure to meet.  He came out for one thing and asked if everything else was good - and his expertise picked out a small problem that was slotted to be called for an electrician! Mr. Rick went and worked on it quickly and thoroughly.  Please send him out here ANY TIME I submit maintenance requests and I will always be satisfied.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review Taylor!

name: Jennifer Wicks
text: We had a 2 year lease with Alabama Rental Property. During those 2 years, our kitchen sink never drained. We requested help with this multiple times. We had to do dishes in a tub and dump the tub outside when we were done. It was disgusting, sad and embarrassing. They never fixed it. We also had bad electrical problems.  Each time we used our dryer the power would go out. And sometimes even when we weren't using it, the power would just randomly go out and we have the switch the braker back on (outside). They never fixed that either. Outlets didn't work. Unusable 2 prong outlets everywhere. In the first few months, the shower and tub would get backed up. Someone actually came to "fix" that. What they actually did was cause everything from our toilets to go into a huge hole in our backyard. So we had literal raw sewage just sitting in our yard and they did not care. It took them over a month and me threatening to end the lease for them to actually come fix it. They said "oh sorry we have a receipt that you already had that fixed." You can call and call and they will not get back to you. DO NOT RENT WITH THESE PEOPLE. IT IS A SCAM. YOU WILL HATE YOUR LIFE LIVING IN THEIR HOUSES

text: Rick and Elton was very respectful and pleasant they went out there way to fix everything that needed to be done !! Very professional

name: Lindsey Coan
text: This 5 starts is for Rick and for Rick only!!! I’ve had a lot of issues with the rental company themselves but Rick the maintenance guy is great!! He came and did what he said he was going to do and he actually takes time to fix the problem!! He needs a raise!

name: Angie M
text: If I could give this company 0 stars I would. I’ve had so many issues with this rental house and the company never seems to be truly concerned. They will put a bandaid on the issue but that’s it. I’ve dealt with mold which is attracting slugs into my home. I’ve had to throw away clothes and shoes due to the mold as well. The company tried to place the blame on me not realizing I’ve already talked with neighbors and the previous tenants who both said that the mold has been an ongoing issue. The previous tenants said the mold is the reason they left. The house is not properly sealed so all types of bugs get into the house. My latest issue is my AC unit. I’ve been without AC going on 3 days now. According to my lease this meet the criteria for an emergency. The only response I get from their customer service line (which I’m convinced is not in the U.S.) is someone has been dispatched. PLEASE save your money and rent somewhere else! You’ll be sorry! Not personal…strictly business.

resp.text:
Good Afternoon,
We are sorry to hear of you concerns. If you would like to further discuss and address your concerns please email: mlewis@spartaninvest.com.
Thank you!

name: Tierra D
text: If there are any good reviews on here they are from the employees, this is by far the absolute worst company to rent from ever worse experience I’ve ever had in my life they don’t answer the phone at all the experience from the time I started to end was terrible and I was NEVER late on rent NEVER! All I’m going to say is run really really fast away from these unprofessional. And don’t comment apologizing because y’all NEVER showed any sympathy when I was renting.

name: Shadaria Gipson
text: if I could give 0 stars I would this is by far the WORST rental company I have ever rented through my house has been broken into I have had several things taken from the property the neighborhood is definitely trash not only that but they don't fix anything I have been having bad plumbing issues for the past 3 months they don't answer the phone and when they do its the same lies I will definitely be terminating my lease early unless you want to waste your hard earned money save it and rent elsewhere the water from the kitchen sink runs outside whenever I run the water the washing machine water comes out of the same pipe as the water from the sink the toilet water goes up the tub if not everything that's goes down the toilet goes outside in the backyard save yourself the trouble and rent elsewhere!! And by the way the comment that they left under here saying the issue was resolved that’s a LIE it was never resolved and is the reason why I broke my lease and they changed the name from Alabama Rental Property to Atlas Rental Property and we all know what that means like I said save yourself the trouble and RENT ELSEWHERE!!! Maybe I should just upload pictures of the backyard again so we can ask the people reading the reviews if the issue was ever resolved stop getting over on people we work to hard for our money just for y’all not to fix simple things like this 😂

resp.text: Hi Shadaria, sorry to hear you are unhappy with the home. It does look like we were able to get this issue resolved quickly but if you do feel you need additional asstiance please feel free to reach out to us. Have a great 4th of July!

I absolutely hate this company this maintenance team such that take 3-4 weeks to come fix anything and still don’t get the job done. Rick is very unprofessional he took personal calls while working and insulted me making a joke that he would take my personal information and apply for food stamps. I did not find that funny at all but very ignorant I don’t even qualify for food stamps. The company never answered the phone you only hear from them when it’s time to renew your lease. This is a picture of the leaking ceiling with mold whenever they come out they spray something over it and pretends it’s gone only for it to rain again and the black mold reappears

name: Charles Brown
text:
Details will vary per person, but take a scan of the ratio of positive and negative reviews and notate it's usually all or nothing. That's the best way I can describe your possible experience if you decide to move forward.

Good luck on your decision.

name: Ashton Williams
text: Nobody is ever in the office when you try to call. My husband and I have called 13 times in one day and still no answer. The house that we are renting is terrible quality and we have to put in a maintenance order for something to get fixed Atleast once a month. The last work order we put in was when our toilets were filling back up through the house and we’re not functional. The “emergency” maintenance line we called said someone would be out shortly. We went over 24 hours without working toilets and had to call the office several times the next day before someone finally answered the phone to send someone over to the house. About 2 weeks later we get a bill for $350 for repairs when no repairs were made. All the man did was snake out the line to remove a full weave from our lines. Ever since we received the bill and I told the office what the maintenance man actually did since he told them he pumped the septic tank- it’s been “under investigation”. We call every day to try and get an answer about the “investigation” and still no answer. We will not be using this rental company ever again and make sure none of our friends and family will either. Terrible customer service.

name: Alandria Browder
text: Elton was very nice and forthcoming. I appreciate him for coming and looking at the problem and taking pictures to ensure the problem is resolved.

name: Mari Kendall
text: By far the worst experience ever. Might I add that I have only been here since March of this year and it is only the end of July. Do not be fooled by the 5, 4, 3, or even 2 star ratings, the only reason I selected 1 is because there’s no option to give them a 0 in ratings. The professionalism as you can see by reading the reviews is very poor and the quality of the homes match. The home I am in have had two major leaks one of which still has not been resolved, I guess judging by the looks of the reviews they’re waiting for the roof to cave in. It’s ridiculous how long something so serious is not being fixed immediately. An emergency work order means nothing to these people  but I bet if I didn’t pay my rent on time (as I do) they’d readily place an eviction notice on my door the first day its late. I have a 8 month old baby who is now crawling and can’t because the floor has water puddles and paint from the ceiling falling off onto the floor also. Very sad case and I cannot wait until my lease is up. I’m sure by then I’ll be leaving another 0 star review.

text: This company is a scam!!!!! name: Sue Harviel
text: a/k/a Spartan Investments.  I rented a 3/2 house in April.  1 bathroom is unusable due to the fact that their plumber plumbed it incorrectly. I had raw sewage running in my backyard from May til the middle of July.  When I first moved in NONE of the bathrooms worked properly.  Flush the toilet & it all came back up into the sink and tub.  After many emails begging & then threatening, they sent out a plumber who took the cap off the cleanout.  When I complained to him about it his response was "Lady, sometimes you have to choose if you want it to back up into your house or into your yard."  NO AC vents in one bedroom or the only working bathroom.  The only "working" bathroom is plumbed incorrectly & my toilet tank fills with hot water.  On July 9, I put in a service request because my AC stopped working on half of the house.  No one has been here yet & it is July 22.  NO ONE answers your calls.  Sherry Floyd in maintenance will respond to emails & she seems to try as hard as she can but apparently, her hands are tied. I had broken windows when I moved in, paint all over the floors & windows, cracked bathtub, no shelves in the pantry or linen closet - making them useless.  Half of the electrical outlets don't work, cheap plastic faux wood flooring is popping up in every room.  Windows painted.  They even installed the kitchen cabinets doors backwards & I couldn't use two of them. New stove in the kitchen...not installed because the plug didn't fit the cord so they just left it sitting there.  I had to go out & buy a new cord so I could use the stove.  Ground level windows had no locks on them, I had to buy & install those.  Sliding doors don't lock, I have to use a pole. Most unresponsive company EVER.  It's obvious that the only thing they care about it getting your rent every month.  They couldn't care less if the house is habitable or not.  You might ask "if it was that bad, why did you rent it?"  To which I would respond:  I honestly thought it would all be taken care of before I moved in because the leasing agent assured me that it would & they had two weeks in which to do it before I took possession.  STAY AWAY!

name: Tiesha Marbury
text: THIS IS A WARNING! I only leave reviews on google to warn people and give them a heads up of what could happen so the same thing that happen to me dnt happen to other. We rented a house from Alabama Rental mid January of this year and moved out mid April. The first day we start moving boxes in the floors immediately start to come up, one of the toilets wouldn't work, one of the tubs didn't drain properly and the sink in the bathroom was clogged up. My husband texted the maintenance man with a list of issues, he came out but only the floors was fix. The maintenance man said the house should have been gutted. The pipes had black roots in it that did not get fixed and we didnt get a new toilet we was only able to use one of the bathrooms but thats not the reason why im writing this review. Im writing this review because I do not like to be played with. We was only at the home for 3 month we had to leave to come to Virginia since my husband renewed his contract with the army and is active duty. When we received our deposit back they had the nerve to take out 450 dollars just for paint, thats a whole house worth of paint they only should have took out enough  for one gallon of paint for the 3 months we was there the walls was fine. I have called the pass few days talked to two different people they said they was going to tell the property manager to get in contact with me still haven't heard anything back cause I need to know when we left the home what repairs was they doing with my money cause I was told by someone in that neighborhood they was working on the outside and inside of the home. I believe they using some of my deposit money to fix the issue that was supposed to have been fixed before we moved in and saying its paint just because it was some small scuffs on the wall from the furniture. Since you can reply to other Google reviews call me ASAP cause I need my money.

resp.text: Hi Mrs. Marbury, I was able to speak with your husband today about this. I think the confusion was over the labor price involved with painting. I gave him my contact and I would be happy to go over everything with you too. Thanks!

name: Cynthia Boyd
text: Elton was one of staff that came out to fix my light fixture for Alabama Rental property an he did a great job He was professional an polite an The work he did was great

name: BENZ317
text:
0/5 Stars

This company is the absolute worst. When a work order is reported they NEVER respond. They write the order off as if they have completed it. Our toilet has been running for months. My wife and I have put in work order after work order. While our upstairs bathroom has continued running the pipes under it have also been leaking. The pipes leaked to the point in which the ceiling fell in under the toilet. We again reported it. The company stated that they would send some one out for the order. This was Thursday June 24th. I called them back on Friday, June 25th. Again they stated that they would once again send another worker out. Friday passes by still no response. On this date June 28th this matter still has not been resolved not even a telephone call. This company does not care about their tenants they only care the rent at the end of the month. I would not recommend them to my worst enemy if they were homeless and thanks to the runny toilet in which I reported months ago, my water bill is now $750 for the activity of the previous month, but guess who is not going to care? Thats right Alabama Rental Property. Customer Service is not valued by this company. They only care about the dollar at the end of the month. If you consider this place to do business with, please do not waste your time and do business elsewhere.

Edit: what a joke. On 6/28/21 they have closed the order out again as if work has been complete. Completely sweeping this under the rug. I will be contacting the city.

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear this, can you please let us know your property address so we can look into this and correct?
