name: Jackie Brown
text: We just moved into this property and we haven’t even been here a month upon the delivery of the appliances the stove does not fit also the outlet for the stove is a dryer outlet. You would think that if you have a construction crew and all of these people that come back to fix up the house if they would know how to fix up the house! I’ve left several phone messages and emails to somebody named Victoria. I haven’t spoken to an actual person about the issue other than somebody named TC.He just so happened to pop up. He didn’t even know the house had been rented out.  He was nice but my problem still isn’t solved and I still don’t know when it will be taken care of. So now I live in a new house and I can’t cook! I bake for a living I have a side business and I would love to be able to bake anything!!!  I can’t even make a special dessert for my daughter to show her how happy I am that we live in this new house. This is ridiculous! I like the house. It’s nice just want to be able to enjoy it fully.

resp.text: Hi Ms Brown, Your work order has been re-dispatched.  We are sorry for the delay.  Someone will be contacting you shortly!

name: Dani Nicole
text: The only reason I used this company is because the house is big enough for what I need, but this house is 3600 sq ft of PROBLEMS! Since day one the plumbing has been problem #1! Multiple requests with NO RESULTS! The maintenance team is a joke! I ask to be called first because 1 time a maintenance man entered my home and I was asleep and another time I was in the shower! Despicable! Disrespectful! The latest fiasco- we requested a plumber AGAIN on 4/2/2021! I’ve left messages to have someone call because my family and I got covid and needed to cancel, the plumber showed up, but not alone WITH HIS WIFE AND SMALL CHILD! He did not come in my house but there’s an invoice on my account that he found tampons and wipes in the pipes?! He brought his son the last time he was here and this child was running wild through my home and around my dogs! I paid a $4300 deposit! And for what?! I’m contacting an attorney as soon as I’m able to leave my home.

name: Lilly Hobbs
text: DO. NOT. UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES. USE THIS COMPANY. I have been renting properties for 10+ years and never had such a terrible experience. I viewed a property I thought I wanted to rent and spoke to a leasing agent about some maintenance issues I was concerned with due to being handicap. I was assured the issues would be fixed prior to moving in  (2+ weeks lead time - and yes its written in the work order to be completed prior to move in) and I trusted their word and went through with the approval process/lease signing. THIS WAS MY FIRST MISTAKE. After signing the lease I went to the property to retrieve the key. Upon arrival I noticed the repairs were not done and there was now more damage to the property. I took pictures, sent them to the leasing agent, called the offices, and never got responses from anyone. I then waited 4 more days over a holiday weekend and started calling first thing the following Monday to try and speak to someone. After several attempts of communication I received NO RESPONSE. I still have not moved in any of my belongings and am in limbo. Finally when someone came out to "fix the issues", only one issue was fixed which was a lock on the garage door BUT NO KEY WAS LEFT FOR ENTRY nor was a knob even placed on the door, just a dead bolt? This is when I finally got a text saying the work order had been completed. I still to this day have not been given a key to access the garage. I then finally received a call Monday night at 5PM from someone who I had never spoken to before. I discussed with her the many issues I had and asked if we could terminate this agreement all together. At this point I had paid $2400 for a deposit and first months rent and felt this company had done nothing that was agreed upon. I did not even move one belonging to the property!  This company had created a very uneasy feeling with me and I realized I had made a big mistake by putting my name on a lease with them. The house was not even cleaned prior to my "move in" date even with the covid pandemic!  The woman assured me someone would call be back the following day with an answer to my concerns. I just received the call from someone who did not identify herself. She told me the company was not responsible for providing locks or a knob on the garage door but they did so any way and that the other repairs would be completed today. (oh gee, thanks.. still can't get in there without the key...) and that they were in no way willing to work with me on terminating this lease.  I asked for the contact info for an attorney to contact them and she told me she would email me and quickly ended the phone conversation. Its been over an hour and no email or further contact from the company. PLEASE STAY AWAY!!!! After much research on the company I have now found out that one of the only good reviews on here is a review from AN EMPLOYEE. This company is misleading and dishonest. STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS. I will update this post with pictures soon. SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM.

text: Jeff Thompson ARP 2 came to do maintenance on my house today he did a wonderful job. He was very professional and respectful also helpful. Did an excellent job

name: Tangela Newell
text:
Rick and Elton the maintenance guys were very professional.  They checked out every area of concern and fixed the problem!  I would recommend them for any service call!

Tangela Newell

name: Amanda Johnson
text: We had a few problems at our rental and Jeff was sent out and did an awesome job! We had a leaking washer hook up when we moved in. While he was here for that problem, we mentioned about a 2 inch gap between the door and the floor in the back door. There was no threshold. He fixed the leak and said he would make sure to put in another work order for the door and would be back. A few days later, he was back to fix that as well. He also noticed we needed weather stripping on the front door as there was a gap there as well and fixed that. Amazing service! We are very pleased!

name: Stacey Burt
text: Rick came out with great customer service and was very professional. Thank you

name: malandria pryor
text:
When I first decided to rent I was approved for a house drove a hr away to pay the deposit just for them to
Call me the next day and say that somebody moved in the house but when I dropped off the deposit the lady didn’t say anything even after she confirmed the address with me . So I decided to go with another property just moved in a month ago but I’m having multiple issues like there’s no knob in my garage door so it’s just open , my ac is leaking ,my floors are caving in from the constant water from the ac and I’ve reported all issue. I received a call from a “maintenance man” saying he was coming to replace the door and look at the ac/ floors but that was over 3 weeks ago and he never came. They NEVER answer the phone it’s always goes to voicemail & when you do leave a voicemail they never return your call . I signed a two year lease and now I’m stuck .

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!! Also for giving us the opportunity to recognize a job well done from Elton and Jason!!!

name: stephanie scott
text: I have been a tenant for about 5 months and they have still not fixed issues in my home.. My heat has went out Several times and now I am going 3 days with no heat.. The hotline is very professional, however the office staff is terrible.. The person over the payments I believe her name is Shaquita is very rude and unprofessional.. if u can help it please choose another company to rent from!!I have spoken with so call supervisors who promised they would get it resolved and it’s still not.. it’s not fair to pay this much rent and not live comfortable.

name: Arial Fox
text: DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT RENT FROM THIS COMPANY!!! I HAVE BEEN RENTING FROM THIS COMPANY SINCE 2017. THEY GET YOU BECAUSE THEIR REQUIREMENTS TO RENT FROM THEM ARE EASIER THAN MOST COMPANIES. HOWEVER THE HOMES ARE NOT WORTH WHAT YOU PAY IN RENT. THE HOME THAT I HAVE BEEN RENTING I HAVE BEEN FIGHTING WITH THEM ABOUT THE SAME ISSUE SINCE 2017! WHEN IT RAINS MY DOWNSTAIRS LIVING AREA FLOODS AND I CANNOT USE THE DOWNSTAIRS UNTIL IT STOPS RAINING! THIS IS NOT MY BASEMENT BUT MY ACTUALLY LIVING AREA. I HAVE FOUGHT TO GET THIS ISSUE RESOLVED WHILE STILL PAYING 1100.00 IN RENT EVERY MONTH NOT MISSING OR BEING LATE BECAUSE THEY TOLD ME IF I DID NOT PAY I WOULD BE CHARGED A LATE FEE . THEY HAVE SENT PEOPLE TO MY HOUSE WHO HAVE ONLY PATCHED UP THE ISSUE AND NOT FIX IT. THEY CONTINUE TO TELL ME THEY WILL FIX IT BUT GIVE ME THE RUN AROUND .THEY SEND PEOPLE WHO CAN NOT FIX THE ISSUE EACH TIME AND THE WORKERS EVEN SAY THIS RENTAL COMPANY IS WRONG!!. I PAID TO HAVE A LICENSE CONTRACTOR COME OUT TO LOOK AT ISSUE. I TOLD THE COMPANY WHAT THE ISSUE WAS AND THEY STILL WOULD NOT LISTEN.  I HAVE EVEN HAD UNLICENSED CONTRACTORS IN MY HOME THAT THE RENTAL COMPANY SENT AND THE CITY CAME AND SHUT THEM DOWN LEAVING MY HOME EXPOSED TO OUTDOORS FOR WEEKS!!! I EVEN HAD WORKERS IN MY HOME THAT ASKED IF I KNEW WHERE THEY COULD GET SOME WEED!THESE ARE THE TYPE OF PEOPLE THEY SEND OUT TO YOUR HOME!! IF  YOU WANT TO RENT FROM A COMPANY THAT WONT DO THIS TO YOU THEN DO NOT RENT FROM ALABAMA RENTAL PROPERTY!!

name: tsmkenken 1

name: Nina's Blues
text: Let me just say, I do not like this company and the ONLY good thing about them is Rick Richardson. He put me at ease for the multiple issues I had with the company and maintenance. I’m thankful for him.

text: Terrible. Its been 3 weeks since I reported a roof leak. If only I knew a lawyer that was affordable.

name: Amy Clayton
text: My daughter's have been in their house for a week with the toilet not flushing, sink drain leaking, outlets not working, and feces backing up into the shower with no plan for these people to come fix these problems!!!  Terrible!!! They can't use the shower or toilet STILL A WEEK AFTER MOVING IN!! TERRIBLE COMPANY!!

name: Chased Media
text: DO NOT RENT FROM THIS COMPANY! Been renting here a year of the 2 year lease. Very unprofessional business and a very bad company to rent from. They do not care about your living conditions as long as they get their money. The popcorn ceiling is falling and has been since we moved in. The main air duct to the house is completely separated and we’ve tried to get it fixed on several occasions and the maintenance guys put a brick under the vent to level it out instead of actually fixing the problem and leaving it separated. Causing our power bill to be roughly $300 a month for the whole year of living here. The vent has also caused a ridiculous amount of roaches, ants, and we even had a 4 ft snake in the house last month that came in through the air duct in the floor. All simply because they won’t come fix anything. Keep in mind I have a 1 year old that crawls around the house. When we first came to look at the house they had us get a list together of things for them to fix before we moved in. A week later on move in day not a single thing was repaired. If I could give this a -1 star I would. Absolutely the worst company I’ve ever dealt with and I don’t want anyone to go through what we have because no one should have to. It’s currently 82 degrees in this house as I type this. None of these problems are due to us. Please if you can help it do not give them business because they simply do not deserve it.

name: Tracy Hanns
text: Be careful when renting from these people.  They want to collect your rent, which I pay on time EVERY month, but does not want to do anything to the property once you move in.  I have a dead tree that has been in my driveway for months. I have four raccoons on the property that they consider "pest" so they will not have them removed.  I do not even contact maintenance anymore with any real expectations.  I usually just contact them now to show I have a record.  I worked to hard to try to up my living standards only to move into a cosmetically pretty home that has slumlords as its owner.  The sad part is the home and property could really be beautiful if they would do something besides collect my 1,360.00 per month.  I cannot wait until my lease is over.  I would not recommend them to my dog or worse enemy.  I truly wish I could give them a lower rating; my rating would easily be a negative 4 star rating.

resp.text: Hi Ms Hanns, I am so sorry you feel this way.  Per the Lease Agreement, we do not furnish any sort of animal or pest control.  These animals are also naturally occurring in the wild so even if the raccoons that were getting into your trash were removed, there would most likely be more.  As for the tree blocking your driveway, that is something that should be taken care of.  However, I do not see a work order in the system for this.  Please re-enter it, and I will go ahead and send it out for approval.  We appreciate you!

name: Mary Jones
text: Uses contractors who never totally fix problems

text: I played 23.00 for a application fee and its been like 2 weeks and I have told them a few times that I have never gotten a answer to the application im still hanging in the air so yea they just taking peoples money and don't care that you are looking for shelter.

name: Jeremy Ricker
text: The house I'm renting is decent enough. The issue I have is with maintenance and extra charges. Dealing Birmingham water works is a choir in itself, but when I can't put said utility in my name it's discouraging. I've been in the home for 2-3 months and the bill was over due from FEB 2020 so I'm a little irritated. Bill's 600+ and for myself to get it in my name it has to be paid in full. Plus I've put in 3 or 4 maintenance orders no with people showing up when I'm not home. Then something fantastic happened. I got a call by the plumber that was going to do the job and I told him when I was going to be home and we were on the same page....then it got cancelled by ARP. I really want to like this company. I'd lie to you if I told you they were great. Getting setup here was nice and I thougoughly enjoy the neighbors and the space out here. I just don't want to be screwed as far as money and communication.

I’ve been renting from the company for over three years and have never experienced this. It’s unacceptable.

The worse part about the situation is they put the house back on the market a few days after informing them I moved out! ( Via voicemail) because I still never got a response or call back. I lived in the home since 2018 and the last year has been terrible! I would not want another family putting themselves at risk because I’m sure they just painted over it and kept it moving.

name: Lavette Parker
text: Rick was excellent and arrived early in the morning to fix our problem. I hope he is the only guy they send from now on if we have any more problems.

name: Nicholas Keith
text:
I have been living at this house for nearly a month, and I have already put in several work orders without anything being done. I'm going to list all the issues I have reported and all the ones solved.
1.) Black mold in the bathroom
2.) Several of my windows are Plexi glass
3.) Walls are leaking
4.) Water leak under the house
5.) Mirror shattered in the middle of the night

The one and only issue fixed was the water leaking under the house. But hey you can't call to get the status of repairs, you can't email anyone more than once because they just stop responding. Don't worry though they are incredibly responsive before you sign that lease, but once they have you you're on your own.

name: Zack Patterson
text: The property that I rented from them was in terrible condition, with poor craftsmanship in multiple aspects and everything was just touched up or cleaned to look as if it had been maintained. Additionally, contacting their office personnel has been one of the most frustrating experiences I have had with any organization. Phone calls and emails consistently go unanswered/returned (I have literally never had anyone actually answer the phone when I call). The is literally NO chance that I will do business with this company again once this lease is up.

resp.text: Hey Zack! I'm sorry you have had a frustrating experience.  I just checked your account and it does seem that our team has been communicating with you via your online portal and has gone above and beyond to accommodate your payment extension requests and financial situations rather than send your account to eviction.  From our perspective this review is very unfair since we have been both communicating and accommodating you beyond normal process. - ARP

Good Afternoon,
We apologize if you have experienced a difficult time reaching someone on the phone. Please feel free to message us on your tenant portal or by emailing mlewis@spartaninvest.com. After receiving your message we will respond at our earliest convenience. Have a great day!

name: Nate Mccrary
text: Worst company ever.  I'll issue a work order and they just close it without fixing anything. A tree fell on the house 2 months ago and they still haven't done anything about that. There is 1 window in the house that will open (which is a safety hazard) and  I've had to put a window unit in that one window since they won't fix the a/c service request that has been in for 3 months. All this company wants is you to pay,  they won't fix a thing, go without paying rent and theyll show up and tape an eviction notice on your door. Please don't give this TERRIBLE SHADY company any of your money.

name: The Galaxy
text: Well I know and believe in my soul that they only want to place Hispanics and Caucasians  into their properties instead of POC. Why you ask do I say this well just know I know of multiple  families that have tried them and the properties are open now for rent but they OVERLOOKED them and have them waiting for months at a time,how darn professional  is that.

name: James Baker
text: Takes forever to get stuff fixed. If anything breaks down . Don't  Rent from them ever . Stuck in a 2 year lease

name: Mya Walker
text: They told me I was approved for a home and to pay my deposit! Paid it the next business day. The doors are locked so you have to use drop box! The next day they tell me someone paid their deposit for the same house they approved me for. They said first come first served. Took 23 days to get my refund and they kept telling me it was in the mail. I finally get my refund because I went down there and demanded it! Check never arrived in the mail so they lied! I'm so glad I didnt sign the 2 yr lease with them! This is how they treat Veterans!

resp.text: Hello Ms Walker, thanks for sharing your experience with us. We are so sorry to hear yours  did not meet expectations. You are correct in quoting that all of our properties are first come, first serve. We have many that get leased within the first day. It is not ever standard practice however, to hold a deposit for any length of time in this particular circumstance. After speaking with the team we do recognize there was a clerical error in returning your deposit, we can say confidently that it was in no way intentional. Our office has been on restricted hours due to COVID and recent events in the downtown area. This is no excuse but we have been doing everything we possibly can to avoid disruptions in service for our prospects and tenants but mistakes do happen and for this we want to sincerely apologize. Hope that you are well and that you and your family are safe and healthy throughout these difficult times. - Alabama Rental Property

name: Paula Roth
text:
Once you sign that two year lease you are screwed !!! Maintenance doesn't get done in a timely fashion or at all...and no one cares !! No one calls you back. Had to do without a stove and fridge for months ! Now a plumber released a rat infestation that had been trapped in the walls.....I had no idea !!! Horrible
Eight months and only a couple of issues solved.....most of those weren't even my original issues....think twice and inspect everything because they won't fix it later as promised !!

name: Heather Melson
text: I cannot say enough good things about Alabama Rental Property.  They make the process completely smooth and handle all of the details for your rental properties. text: The maintenance is very responsive and kind. Elton made sure he took his time and made sure the repairs were done currently .

Very thankful and a very happy client for many more years to come!!

Most maintenance requests are simply closed without ever being resolved, and when they are resolved it takes ages for them to actually come out and take care of the problems even though they state 24-48 hours for emergencies and up to 7 days for non-emergencies. I would make this a 4 star review if not for this. Very annoying and un-professional to say the least.

text: This Company Is Money Hungry They Fix Things Before Rent Is Due Over Charge For Simple Repairs "When They Finally Get To Them" Houses To Expensive And Not Even Worth It I DO NOT RECOMMEND AT ALL Simply Because The Tenants Are Not Cared For Like They Should Be

text: If I could rate this company any lower, then they would be in the negatives. My friends have been requesting maintenance repairs for even serious issues, I.e. black mold, for almost six months and get little to no response at all from the property managers. If incompetence could be personified, it would be this company and EVERYONE who works in it. No excuse.

name: Kishor Rao
text: Been working with Spartan for 6 months on my first property.  I'm a newbie but they've been great with me.  Anyone I've worked with at Spartan has been great!  I look forward to many more years working with them.

name: Denise Miller
text: I love these guys! They put up with my crazy anxiety when I first moved in and help me thru it all! I love the house I’m renting and love them for giving me the opportunity to rent with them. I recommend that any and everybody give these guys a try if you’re looking for a great new home and a rental company that’s always gonna be there if you need them! Thanks Alabama Rental Property!!

name: Alicia Laird
text: This is the worst place ive ever rented from they never return my calls and weve called about a tree that almost fell on our house for them to come get and they never did and we had to have them come fix the plumbing in the kitchen twice, the whole house is uneven, and we cant even have the microwave and the bathroom heater on at the same time or the power will cut off im so ready to move out and they wont even answer my emails about not renewing our lease and let us move out early!!!!

name: Mara Houghton
text: I moved into one of their rentals in January and  they went out of their way to work with me during the problems I faced during COVID-19. I have had a few maintenance issues with it being an older house, but August made sure they were taken care of!

resp.text: Thank you so much Mara for giving us the opportunity to recognize August's hard work!!!

name: Shannon Bibb
text: I haven’t had any problems with maintenance. When I call, they come. The longest I’ve had to wait maybe 2 days

name: Vonzell Williams
text: I have been living in the home for a little over a year now and I was very happy until about month 7 when I needed a maintenance request. When renting older homes to tenants maintenance just some with the business. I feel that this company did not consider that because I have been dealing with issues for the past 7 months that are getting resolved very late (sometimes over a month). Some of the issues I have had have gotten closed out although no work was done and I have had to put in multiple request to get the work complete. I am not really a review person. I am a veteran so there is a ton that can bother me. Until this. The lease agreement clearly states that an emergency is considered when the temperature in the house goes below 55 degrees and goes above 85 degrees. My central AC has gone out in the middle of the summer while temperatures reach over 90 degrees and I have still not gotten anyone to tend to the home in almost a week. Due to poor insulation in the house without the AC whatever the temperature is outside is the same temperature inside. I have been so disappointed that I have sent in my intent to vacate 10 months early. I now see why they are dead set on people signing 2 year lease. If it was only one no one would renew.

name: jamie twitty
text: Great company! The young lady I spoke with had a wonderful attitude and answered all my questions! Would recommend to anyone 💚

name: Jessie King
text: ARP helped me find a great home for my family. The process went so smooth and my leasing agent was very knowledgeable about the area we wanted. The maintenance team is quick to respond and resolve everything. I highly recommend them because they are so personable and great to work with!

name: arsenio mccants
text: Jason did an excellent job fixing the problem that was occurring in our bathroom. He went over and beyond to get the job done.

name: Danielle Charlnoes
text: I would highly recommend Alabama Rental Property to anyone looking to rent!  They're reliable and extremely helpful. Overall great customer service and experience.

name: Justin Beck Holmes
text:

name: Katlin Moore
text: If I could give lower than 1 star I would. In August of 2018 I toured a few homes and the  lady that did the tour was extremely nice. But I was told the application fee was cheaper than what was listed on the actual application. I paid the fee and asked for a refund, they sent me a check (but it was a bad check and it bounced) I had already bought things with my bank account prior to it bouncing so when it bounced I was also charged overdraft fees. I called multiple times (one with the lady who I toured the property with and she said she would check into it but never returned my calls) and then the actual office (no one ever called me back) I've never been able to get my money back towards this matter and whats so upsetting is the fact that I had tons of overdraft fees over their bad $35 dollar check.  Please never do business with them! I make it a point to tell everyone I know about this experience so they don't lose money with this company

name: Beverly Brown
text:
Tiffany went above and beyond to help me get into an affordable rental quickly!
5 STAR SERVICE

name: LaTonja Stevenson
text: Elton and Rick was very professional.

name: Allison Hunter
text:
We signed a lease with ARP on April 8th, and we have not had the best experience. The house itself looks great. However, it was impossible to get in direct contact with our leasing agent just to sign our lease in the first place. And I don't mean it was 'difficult' to get ahold of her, I literally could not get ahold of her after the initial application process. I ended up contacting another employee to just get our lease signed. I understand that the office team is all currently working from home (I presume, because the office is closed), however, the lack of communication is very frustrating. The tenant relations manager helped us get through the lease signing process and was very helpful with my questions. We were told that the day we signed our lease we had appliances ordered; they were scheduled to be delivered on the 21st and the movers would call us to set up a time. The appliances have not been delivered, nor has anyone contacted us for an update on our appliances. I have reached out to both ARP staff that I've been in contact with, and neither have responded. I ended up contacting another leasing agent by mistake (a post was made on their FB page with a different number for my leasing agent than the phone number I already had, but turns out it's a mis-type and the number is actually for a different agent), and this agent has been very swift and courteous with responding to me.

On top of that (lack of communication and no appliances), this past weekend, while attempting to install our internet service, we discovered that our home is not equipped with a coax cable outlet. The outlet is needed to hook-up the modem for our internet service. I placed a maintenance request to have some one come install the outlet (surely previous tenants have had internet), and I was just notified that my service request was denied. So we have no fridge, no stove, and no internet. Not the best way to start out our lease with Alabama Rental Property.

name: Courtland Davis
text: Alabama Rental Properties is the best without question. They were incredibly helpful and went above and beyond to make sure we found the perfect home. They were quick to return my phone calls and we’re good about calling to check on us to make sure everything was smooth sailing and in working order. I can’t imagine anyone giving ARP a bad review. I’m glad I chose them to rent from and couldn’t imagine going through anyone else. I’ll also say they have the patience of a saint. I know I must have looked at 15 houses and went back and forth before making a decision. They were knowledgeable and kind throughout the whole process. Not one bad bone in the whole company.

name: Quiyana Burt
text: I was hesitant on moving in due to the reviews, but I loved the house. I can’t lie, the initial move in process was pretty strenuous. It took forever to get approved, then the house wasn’t ready and the water was off. I can’t remember the significance with why I couldn’t get it turned on before. I want to say they told me I was not allowed to put anything in my name until i signed the lease. That left the water company with 3 days to come cut it back on. The grass wasn’t cut and there were dead bugs everywhere. It had major plumbing issues. Not to mention, I had to get my own fridge and stove. I think that’s standard but to have all of those problems and then turn around and get my own appliances was a turn off. HOWEVER, when I complained, the office credited me for my troubles. Not to mention, I lost my job the following week. I went in to the office and spoke with i believe her name was Miranda. She was very sympathetic and offered me a great deal to move without penalty and just pay (the agreed balance to move) what I could afford until I reached my balance. I did not leave right away. I was confident that I would find another job and my severance handled rent for 5 months. I did find a job. However, it was out of town. Miranda has been so helpful through this entire tough battle. I truly appreciate it. My sister went through something similar and her apartment complex was not nearly as accommodating as ARP. I gave it 3 stars because the move in was stressful. Lol. But I could not give it a 1 because I could be homeless today had it not been for their understanding and cooperation. I move tomorrow. I will miss my house but I appreciate my time there.

name: Roshan TJ
text: I started renting with ARP last year and so far they have been very good in collecting rent on time and quickly leasing the property. The staff is great and communication is smooth, I really like working with them and highly recommend. I hope they will continue this going forward, keep it going ARP!

name: Tangela Newell
text: I would recommend Spartan because they are great to work with.  Miranda is very welcoming and helpful!!

name: Mat Cox
text: I highly recommend Alabama Rental Property. I've had the pleasure to work closely with the ARP team for the last year and I've seen, first hand, how hard this company works to provide an excellent product and service for their customers.

name: chris Romine
text: Find another company or rent from an individual. They will be beyond helpful until the lease is signed and then quit responding. My family and I pulled up with a moving truck and were locked out of our home for an entire weekend after paying nearly $2k to get access to the home. Things that were supposed to be fixed before move-in still aren’t fixed and they do not seem to have any interest in getting to it. After moving in I have found so many issues it makes me sick. I wish I had listened to the people leaving similar reviews before I signed. THIS HAS BEEN A NIGHTMARE.

name: Adriana Hinojos
text: Amanda Johnston has a excellent consumer service she takes her time to Find your needs I highly recommended...

name: LaDarrius Jackson
text:
This company had great service and outstanding communication skills.
They will help you in anyway possible.

name: S. L.
text: Your company makes it so difficult to see the homes that are available and your agents are so judgmental, especially Simone.  Simone looks down on people who are on Section 8 and she seems to think that people who are on Section 8 shouldn't have any expectations or standards.  Simone's demeanor is very aggressive.  Simone cuts you off while you're speaking, she doesn't even allow you to finish your sentence.  Simone doesn't return calls in a timely manor, bottom line Simone doesn't have good Customer Service skills. Your list of available homes isn't up to date.  I've been told numerous times that certain properties are available and once I apply, then I'm told the home is no longer available.  I feel it would be better for business to update your list of available properties right away, once you receive a deposit for the home, that way it's very clear to the customer what's available and what's not.  The whole process of having to upload your picture ID would be fine if your system worked every time but I feel like when the system doesn't work there should be a second option available to access the homes, like texting a link to the potential renter so once they arrive at the home they can give the lockbox code and be able to access the home. It's very stressful looking for a decent place for your family to live and you would think your agents would be more compassionate.  Also, majority of your homes have bad landscaping, it's like you all don't think it's important for the yards to look presentable.   I hope someone will read this and address these issues. I'm pretty sure I'm not the only customer that feels this way.

name: Alonda Pouncey
text: We are present tenants  with ARP.  Our lease will expire the end of this month.  About 3 weeks ago I came in contact with Simone Harris who works with the company and I promise, she has been so helpful with our transitioning from where we live now to another one of ARP houses.  She took us step by step.  We understand that, we are not the only clients however, our needs have been met.  Thank you ARP, keep up the good work!

name: Mya Shavon
text: Our heat doesn’t work after two week and there is fecal matter coming from our toliet to the tub. Do not rent from here PLEASE I AM BEGGING YOU!!! Run far far away.

name: Grayson Dansby
text: Y’all I just have to say this. Makayla Dansby is hands down the most polite and patient person I have ever come in contact with. Her service was great and really made me feel like family. Also she goes above and beyond to ensure costumer satisfaction 😏😏, no matter the cost.... Makayla if you see this give me a call sometime I would love to catch up.

text: I've have had a wonderful experience with Alabama Rental Properties and the team at ARP. I would highly recommend you check with them if you are looking for a rental home. name: Desmond Dontrell
text: I applied for a home, I payed the $30.00 for each resident over 18 in my household. I then recieved an email, that was the rental report. I waited the two days, as instructed to do so, and that was February 2, 2020 and it is February 21, 2020, and I have yet to hear back. I have contacted them several times for them to tell me that they would put it in the system for the property manager to contact me. Mind you that my credit score is a 670,and the other resisdents is a 620. We have no debut, and all bills are paid on time. No evictions, and our income is 6 times over the amount asked for each month. I want to know why I have not recieved a yes or no. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS COMPANY TO ANYONE AT ALL.

text: They maintenance is garbage! Please don’t waste your time or money!!!! I can’t wait until my lease is up!!! text: I’ve been getting the run around  about a property that is missing a window I paid $930 I’ve been sitting in front of their office for two hours with my children waiting to get my deposit back that they had  for a month nobody won’t  answer the phone for me nobody won’t  answer email do not rent for them these are terrible terrible people!! name: Brittany Burney
text:
Run! Run in the other direction quickly! They take forever to get any maintenance orders filled (if they even fill them at all) they try to put everything on the tenant. Every time I need to get a maintenance request done I have to call and talk to the manager because the “service team” will refuse the order. I’ve lived here for not even two months and I have had soooo many issues. They also lease their properties as-is so make sure that before you sign a lease you check everything out thoroughly! My windows are painted shut and they refuse to do anything about it! The glass in my window fell out and they refuse to do anything about it!
So don’t just walk, but run in the other direction!!!

name: Heidi Duncan
text: Hands down the Best Rental Company around! You won’t be disappointed!!

name: Ben Davis
text: I've had a great experience with Alabama Rental Properties.  They really care for their tenants and it shows in the way they operate. I would highly recommend them if you are looking for a house.

name: Prycelis Ashton Moore
text: Miranda Maxam is a wonderful person to work with. Very helpful

name: Amanda Cheese
text: We love the staff! They are professional, friendly and very helpful.

name: Cooking With A Girl That Can't
text: I had an appt to look at a house today, I booked it two weeks ago. When I went to print the I found off this morning about the property, I couldn't find it anywhere. I contacted the company who then told me that the property was taken off the market about a week ago. I asked why nobody contacted me to let me know, and the rep, Lauren, did not have anything to say about it. Nevermind the fact that they blew my phone up for over a week wanting me to apply ahead of the showing. Apply for a property that was no longer available so they could get my information and do God-knows-what with it. This was my second interaction with this company and there will not be a third.

name: miranda corey
text: We love the staff! They are professional, friendly and very helpful.

name: Corey Kincaid
text: Be sure to THOROUGHLY inspect the house before you sign anything.  The simple walk-through during the viewing won't be enough.

name: Bounce Gaming
text: I’ve been a tenant for almost 3 yrs here and my experience has been quite pleasant for the most part. There’s been many changes since I first started out with ARP, mostly conveniences that streamlined a lot of things I didn’t like in the beginning such as the web portal for payments and maintenance. That’s a game changer for me because I’d rather not be in traffic downtown where there’s tons of construction happening. Miranda Maxam, is one of the agents I worked with on many different occasions. She’s reliable, friendly, and always do her due diligence to solve an issue very quickly. There’s been a few times where I even needed a payment extension and she’s been relatable and helpful, even offering to waive a late fee. The properties themselves are really good quality, and they’re maintained in excellent conditions, at really competitive rental prices with the freedom to adjust my home to my lifestyle without penalty or restrictions. They’re knowledgeable about the areas and even go the extra mile of revealing everything about the property and area whether it’s positive or negative. I definitely lucked up finding ARP because I had a hard time establishing my credit but they understood that and worked with me without up charging me based of my credit. The staff is great my only complaint is some of the contractors do bad jobs on maintenance. It only happened to me once but when I told ARP they sent a different company out that corrected the issue right away no hassle. Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for good quality homes at competitive rates, good or poor credit.

name: Dana Fuhrmann
text: Great team! Great service! Thanks for taking care of us.

name: Amy Dowdey
text: Everyone on their team is extremely pleasant to work with, professional and helpful.

name: Laporsha Foy
text: My first experience renting a home and this company makes me want to go back to the horrible apartments thats i came from. I would give them 0 stars if i could. After my two years is up I will not be renewing my lease. From the first couple of days I’ve been moved in I’ve have maintenance issues I’ve reported them and all they do is close them without notice. They also will only try to reach out to you one time. To set up and appointment to come out to the property. Keep in mind I work to pay my bills I cant answer the phone often. My hot water heater isnt working and I have a son how do I bathe my kid in cold water... I guess none of them have kids. My dryer outlet isnt working. How do i wash my clothes in my own home. I dont have to spend extra money going to a laundromat. DO NOT RENT FROM THEM. ONCE THEY GET YOUR MONEY THEY DO NOT CARE AND YOU ARE STUCK IN A 2 YEAR LEASE.

name: Latisha Capel
text: Sadly won’t answer the phone charges on account but won’t explain what the charges are for won’t come out and fix repairs and won’t even call back to be professional to Show that they care.

resp.text: Hey Latisha! Sorry to hear that you were having some issues! From our records, I am showing that the repairs have been made since. We do want our tenants to be happy and know we care.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do.  - ARP

name: Ellie Banks
text:
THE WORST RENTAL MANAGEMENT COMPANY I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED! I REPEAT, DO NOT RENT FROM THIS COMPANY NO MATTER WHAT THEY TELL YOU! I have been renting for almost a year now. You CANNOT get in touch with them, they DO NOT return phone calls. I don’t think there is a maintenance staff because they never respond to any maintenance requests thru the online portal. Once you sign that 2 year lease they don’t care about you and will do everything possible to avoid you and take your money.

EDIT: I am updating my review to once again say that this company has the worst maintenance I have experienced. The maintenance request phone number goes to a third party call center agent who can do nothing except create a work order for you (which is exactly what you can do yourself through your tenant portal). You can’t get in contact with anyone from the rental office, and if you call the leasing office they won’t help you and give you the same call center number. Our house looked nice upon viewing, but after moving in we realized how poorly the house was ‘redone’. There was a leak in my roommate’s ceiling that has grown mold for the last 6 months. She has called and put in multiple work orders. It has taken months to finally get someone to come look at it... someone finally came out to take measurements. The man had no mask or any kind of protective gear upon entering. However, I didn’t want to turn him away because it has been such a huge process getting them out here. They are finally going to fix this issue next week. They will respond in the maintenance portal asking if our issues have been resolved when no one has contacted us or followed up. In February we had a pipe bust and were without water for 2 days with no response from anyone about scheduling an appointment. I went to the office and waited until I could speak with someone in person. They finally sent someone out that afternoon. The man told me he was going to come back whenever the pipe was finished drying and check to make sure everything was working properly. He never came back. I highly suggest you do not rent from these people unless you just enjoy your house falling apart.

EDIT AGAIN: I can only leave one review so I’m just going to have to continue on this excessive list, but I am horrified at the thought of anyone renting from these people and going thru what I have gone thru. After 6 months of a ceiling mold issue being reported they finally sent a contractor on July 23 to ‘fix’ it. Whoever they sent literally hacked into and destroyed a huge chunk of my roommate’s bedroom wall. He ripped apart the ceiling and the drywall and discovered that the mold was worse than expected and there was fire damage all over the inside of the wall (from a previous house fire). He couldn’t determine where all of the mold was due to the fire damage. After an entire day of ripping the wall apart and spraying toxic fumes around, he told us that he wasn’t able to finish because the landlord didn’t accept his bid (??). Whatever that means, we were left with the wall/ceiling open to the attic and mold exposed. After leaving voicemails and calling excessively, they sent a different contractor to come fix it. My roommate moved back to Huntsville to her parents house because it wasn’t livable... I had to find places to stay and for our pets to go for a week while this guy came out everyday to ‘work’. That Friday he said that he would be back on Monday because it wasn’t an emergency! It took another week to complete the job. Every day that he came to the house he would leave for hours at a time saying he needed to get things from Home Depot. I came home one day from work (he had been working at the house with no one there), my front door was wide open and he wasn’t here. He had left to go get things..was gone for who knows how long and didn’t lock or shut the front door. He said ‘sorry can’t believe I did that!’. These people DO NOT CARE AT ALL. About anything. RUN. Run as far as you can away from this company. I cannot wait to get out of this nightmare.

name: Jimmy Snider
text: They wont fix issue.  They only want your rent. They DOnt care about there tenants.

name: Ashley Bradford
text: Well this company is very fraudulent. My friend rented a property at 5411 shepherd drive in Adamsville and two months into his lease he started feeling sick and fatigue. So he contacted the property manager Amanda and asked to have the house inspected for mold, that took almost three weeks to get someone sent out. When they were sent out they discovered that there was indeed mold in the basement and garage. They cleaned it up and stated that they couldn’t find the source so it would eventually come back. My friend found more mold in the basement a week after they can out and cleaned it. So they sent them back out to clean it and this time they found black mold in the Sheetrock. Still, they were unable to find the source of this black mold and said that it would continue to come back. When my friend brought this matter to the property manager (Amanda’s) attention she was very rude and dismissive about the entire situation. My friend then asked Amanda if there was a way that they could switch him to a different property or let him out of the lease and she was completely against this idea and refused to offer any kind of help or understanding of the situation. So then my friend threatened to get a lawyer and that’s when Amanda said that he couldn’t prove that there was ever any black mold in the home and that she was never told about the findings. Which was completely false because she was fully aware of all mold found. My friend took pictures of the black mold and sent them to her along with a recording of the inspector claiming that it was black mold, that it would eventually return, and that they couldn’t find the source. Amanda then claimed that my friend couldn’t prove that the recording was of the inspector and his conversation and that the pictures didn’t prove it was black mold, even though you could clearly see that it was. She then proceeded to tell my friend that she could start the eviction process for him if he would like. Now guys this entire time that he is living in this house with black mold he also had his newborn daughter and two other young daughters living in the house with him and they were aware of this, as well. Not to mention, the hot water wouldn’t work in one of the bathrooms, the basement flooded every time it rained, the floors were uneven, warped, and soft in places, the main breaker box would start  surging and sparking, and flip for no reason, the dryer plug didn’t work when he moved in so he had to replace it, most of the windows in the home would not raise properly, the toilets would become backed up very easily, neither of the tubs would want to drain at times, and they would send people out when the request was put in but they would quickly and cheaply fix the problems so the issues would happen again and frequently. It’s bad when you are asked to pay 1075$ a month and can’t even be comfortable in your home. Two months was all he was there for and he had issue after issue after issue until the day he was evicted.

name: Serra Craig
text:
The leasing agent we worked with was amazing, which led us to believe the experience once we actually signed the lease and became tenets would be great. That’s not the case. We’ve been in this home for two months and have had the following issues:
1. The access code we were given to get the key was incorrect. We waited 4 plus hours on maintenance to come and they didn’t show up. We were able to get the key because the leasing agent provided us with a code.
2. About a week after moving in & getting keys made, maintenance changed the locks and didn’t notify us. I sat outside for an hour, thinking my key somehow was damaged and no longer working. I finally decided to try the key safe and there were new keys.
3. We did not have hot water because there was something wrong with the hot water heater. It took them days to come out. I had to call Amanda, Rebekah, and some other lady who was supposed to be Amanda’s superior SEVERAL times and email them as well. They NEVER called back. It took probably 5 emails and a dozen calls before Amanda finally responded to the emails.
4. Right now, he electrical outlets do not work in the kitchen, bathroom, and part of the living room. We put in the service request 10 days ago and no one has even acknowledged it. We’ve been running an extension cord so we can atleast keep our fridge on. There is no sense of urgency and they could use a tenant liaison. For all we know there could be some serious electrical issues.

Avoid Alabama Rental Property at all costs. The leasing agents are pleasant, but that’s their job— to show you homes and get you to sign a lease. After you sign, the ball gets dropped. They don’t answer the phone or return phone calls. There is no one to complain to when you receive poor customer service.

It’s awful and I truly regret that we are bound to them for two years.

text: Horrible experience. I went to view a property yesterday and it was so suspicious. Lights were on outside and inside the property. Mailbox was overflowed. Then when they left I had no idea how to get in the lock box the "agent" on the phone was useless and instructed me to watch a youtube video on how to get into the property. Then I get into the property terrified because I'm thinking someone is inside I ask him to stay on the phone with me while I go inside because it seemed like nobody had been there in ages, spiders and webs as soon as I open the front door and *click. He hangs up in my face. I walk into a bedroom through the kitchen and my foot literally went through the floor. Twisted my ankle and I called them immediately AND took photos and STILL have not heard from management that they claim would contact me immediately. This is a whole new day. Ankle still hurt . Still havent been contacted. NEVER AGAIN!! There was a bees nest attached to the front door AND the back door I could tell nobody had been there in forever.

name: Megan Rogers
text: If I could give them zero stars, I would. We bought a house in Camden Lake last year. First time being under an HOA. I’m still trying to figure out what I pay over $300 a year for? There’s no playground, no “hangout” area, half of the street lights don’t even work, and the “lake” doesn’t have a sidewalk to go around it for safely walking. They are definitely pocketing money from everyone. They have all kinds of rules that you must follow but yet offer nothing enticing to even care to follow the rules. The board members, what a joke! Plenty of people are moving out and we are one of them! No surprise their ratings are awful! Good riddance!

resp.text: We are sorry you do not like the benefits of living in a covenant protected community. The covenants were written when the neighborhood was developed, and are now a requirement by most municipalities before they will allow a new development. We did not write them, but they do create a fiduciary responsibility for the Board to make sure they are enforced, which is one of the tasks that we are hired to do.  It is the Buyers responsibility to obtain a copy of the covenants for a neighborhood and to understand them before purchasing.  The Realtor typically provides these to the Buyer.  Once we are made aware of the purchase and the new owners contact information, we send a welcome packet in the mail that includes the covenants.  We also provide an Owner Portal that has all of the Association documents for owner to access.  Spaces is not "pocketing money from everyone".  Spaces is paid a set Management Fee by the Association to handle all of the management and administrative tasks for the Association to operate.  This includes paying all Association bills, working with and overseeing vendors, answering Owner, Realtor, lender, and closing attorney questions, creating financials statements, reconciling the bank accounts, administering quarterly and annual meetings, etc.  The annual budget is set by the Board of Directors and is then presented to all Owners to vote to ratify at the Annual Members Meeting.  Spaces then operates the Association within that budget for the year.  Spaces provides regular financial statements to the Board, and approved financial statements are available to all Owners.  We understand that some people do not value the benefits of having restrictive covenants and a managed community, but most people do. For those who do not want restrictive covenants where they live, we recommend looking for homes located in the county or finding a neighborhood that does not have restrictive covenants.

name: Clay Williams
text: Seems as if the turnover is too high here within the management staff. I was talking with Heather about purchasing a place a few weeks ago, only to find out she wasn't there anymore when I called today with my final decision. She was very knowledgeable about everything with the process and had me at ease with my decision to buy. I'll keep looking, thanks for letting the bright spot in the office get away.

resp.text: We have a great team of managers at our corporate office and on-site at our communities that have been team members for many years and provide excellent service.  The goal of everyone at Spaces is to provide a great customer experience, and beautiful communities for all of our residents to enjoy.  We constantly work to improve and have the right people in the right positions to deliver on this goal.

name: LaMesha Hale
text: If I can give a negative star I would. This is the absolute worst HOA in the world!!! If you purchase a home & Spaces are over the HOA, RUN THE OTHER WAY!!! We have been here about 10 years & after they took over it has been HORRIBLE!! We cannot wait to sale our home to get away. The neighborhood is Maxwell Manor.

resp.text: We are sorry you do not like the benefits of living in a covenant protected community.  The covenants were written when the neighborhood was developed, and are now a requirement by most municipalities before they will allow a new development.  We did not write them, but they do create a fiduciary responsibility for the Board to make sure they are enforced, which is what we are hired to do.  We cannot speak to how the Association was operated previously, but a primary reason we are hired is to provide covenant enforcement for Associations.  If someone is considering purchasing a home in an Association we manage, they can expect an Association that operates within the budget set by the Board of Directors and ratified by the Members.  They can also expect the restrictive covenants to be enforced in a fair and compassionate way.  We always send a friendly letter for each first time violation to make the owner aware of the covenant violation and provide a timeframe to correct the violation.  This friendly letter results in 95 percent of the violations being corrected.  In the cases where the violation is not corrected, we do have a set policy that is equally enforced to bring the property into compliance.  The majority of violation letters we send are a result of a neighbor reporting the violation to us for enforcement.  By having a set system, it allows neighbors to be neighbors without having to get into demanding compliance with restrictive covenants.  We facilitate that process for the Board and neighbors.  We understand that some people do not value the benefits of having restrictive covenants, but most people do.  For those who do not want restrictive covenants where they live, we recommend looking for homes located in the county or finding a neighborhood that does not have restrictive covenants.

resp.text: Thank you Cathrine!

resp.text: We are thrilled that you had a great experience!  Thanks for the great review!

resp.text: Matt, We have very recently been hired by the HOA Board to assist in managing the needs of the homeowners in the neighborhood but there has not been a meeting nor a vote by the membership for anything related to HOA business so I am unsure how you can adequately review our services at this time.  We look forward to meeting you at the upcoming neighborhood meeting where we are sure we can answer any questions related to the homeowners association.  If you have an immediate need please feel free to call us.

resp.text: Ms. Bryant, As a new homeowner, I encourage you to attend neighborhood meetings as soon as we are able to have them again, due to COVID, to meet your Board members and discuss any concerns with them.  As we discussed previously, this item needs further review from the Board.  If you were not given a budget for the HOA, I will be glad to send you one that shows where the funds are spent- which includes mowing the lawn and insurance on the buildings.   We provided the budget as well as the covenants and restrictions to the closing attorney to include in your closing packet.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you have had a less than 5 star experience with Spaces managing your HOA.  We assist the Board with all the issues possible with the HOA.  I'm not sure what you are referring to, but there are some outside the HOA jurisdiction, such as parking and road maintenance, that are ongoing problems.  Please reach out to us or a board member directly with your particular issue and see if it has been addressed.
