resp.text: Eman, there are several different issues that should be addressed separately in this review.  We are not affiliated with the Builder, however we have always found this company to go above and beyond in the neighborhoods they develop and homes that they build.  I cannot find a homeowner in our system by your name so I am unable to determine what neighborhood you live in to further address your issues.  If you would contact me personally at reception@spacesmanagement.com I will be glad to discuss them with you further.  If you do not have a copy of the HOA budget I will be glad to provide you one as well.

name: Michella Carter
text: I have never written a bad complaint about anyone in my life.But this was a lesson.Please be aware that these condos are individually owned by different people and managed by spaces management.If something goes wrong ,you report to a third party that has to get in touch with the owner before the issue is handled.Which determines how fast your situation is handled and the proper up keep of the apartment determines your owner financial stability.They will do everything in their power to not give you your deposit back.I have never in life had a deposit deferred for any reason.Its not enough money to sue but it’s my hard working money.Just be careful.

resp.text: Hi Michella, Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback. Spaces Management is a third party manager for the individually owned units at Midtown. Our goal is to provide the upmost customer service and respond in a timely manner to all requests. All units are inspected and photographed prior to move in to document the condition of the unit before occupancy. A second inspection is conducted during the residents tenancy to document the condition of the unit in preparation for the upcoming move out. The final and third inspection/walk through takes place to document the condition of the unit once the resident has vacated the unit. The security deposit is refunded less any damages, financial or physical property damages, to the forwarding address on file within 60-days of the lease end date. If you would like to speak about this further, please feel free to contact me at 205-342-3220. Best, Midtown Village Condominium Manager

name: Krystina Adams
text: If I could give them a 0 I would. They manage our neighborhood HOA and we literally pay almost $200 A YEAR for nothing. We FINALLY get a playground and it is a joke. No benches to sit on no trees around it. No pool. The front entrance road has been crappy and half finished for at least a year now probably longer. All they do is ride around and nit pick to fine you  then send you pictures of the minute things they consider not attractive. Hello... the unfinished road is unattractive. I cannot wait to move out of this neighborhood and get away from these”Nazi’s”.

resp.text: Krystina, Thank you for taking the time to voice your concerns.  The Board is diligent in keeping dues as low as possible while maintaining the common areas and adding improvements to the neighborhood as funds allow. Most recently the improvements included additional lighting and security cameras. The Board has also addressed the condition of the roads with the City and they have promised they will be repaired very soon.  This has been an ongoing issue with the original developer and the City of Northport and the Board has been communicating with them continuously regarding the conditions.    Spaces works with the Board to make sure that the neighborhood is the best that it can be.  Should you ever receive communication from us that you are unsure about, please do not hesitate to reach out to us so that we can help address the situation.

name: Melissa Spencer
text: Unethical company. We lived at Traditions Condominiums from February 2016 to February 2017. We were told in December 2016 that we have to sign a lease for fall 2017-2018. If we did not sign it by the end of December, they would start showing the apartment in January. Not sure what we wanted to do, we signed the lease. The apartment was small, no light, smelled horrible from old carpet as well as being a family with 2 teenagers, we were cramped and decided to look for a house to rent until we were ready to build. We found someone to take over the current lease as well as the next years lease. They were not subleasing, rather they were signing a new lease. Spaces Management charged us a fee for breaking the lease as well as a fee for each month. We tried finding this in the contract that we signed and did not find anything. When we called them about it, they told us that we had to submit it all in writing in email format. Even though we had an attorney, they threatened us to pay the fees or they would reassign the tenants that we found to a different apartment and not rent our apartment out. We would be financially responsible each month until our contract ended on their term. Just be careful who you rent with.

name: Arrow Xia
text:
One star for the never answered phone call and email. Whenever I was in town or moved out and tried to call them, they never pick up the phone!!! I moved out of town in July then received a bill in September, with a service that I never used. I tried to call several times, never get answered. I also emailed, no answer as well. They are doing a fair job at maintenance.
Another thing that happened when I moved out was all the UHauls were gone during that week, so I asked the main office if I could have a grace period for one day. The premise for me to ask this was my roommate is still leasing the apartment, and she has not found the new roommate yet. I assumed, if she agrees, then I should be good. I went to talk to the main office, the front desk told me to talk to the office at the Midtown apartment. I went there, the lady rejected my proposal and said they will have vendors checking my room right on the day I moved out and through my stuff out even if I have my roommate's permission to place them in the living room. So, I ran crazy for that week looking for moving trucks and finally moved out on time (actually two days in advance). I returned the keys and everything to the main office and told my story. Another lady, seems like the manager or some management-level person told me a totally different answer. She said if my roommate is keeping renting the apartment and agree to let me put my stuff in there, I could have the grace period!!! This is nuts! I was so upset for that day but decided to not give a bad review on Google review. This time, I really cannot. It is not about money, it is their attitude.

Updated

Around an hour than I left the one star review, they responded and someone finally answered the call. The answer I got for the charge is because of the wreath we had on the door🙄️so I told them that is not trash, that is what we used to place outside as decoration. Since my roommate is still living in there, it should not count as something I left not as trash. The new manager of the office said she had no other answer for my question other than I have to pay the “reasonable” charge. Oh, the most incredible thing for this management company is they will change the detail of the lease without notifying. Since I am moving out of the town and my roommate will stay, she renewed the lease. When we started to lease the apartment, we get told that we are only leasing our own room (we were paired up by the management company), which means we do not have to lease the whole apartment if we cannot find a roommate. After two years of leasing, our contract have never changed. However, they changed it this year without any notification, and my roommate did not look through carefully so she rent the whole apartment. This is the reason why I thought I should be ok to leave my stuff in the apartment with my roommate’s permission. Based on my roommate’s feedback, their maintainance worked as well as the office does. It took them over a month to get the sink fixed.

resp.text: We are sorry that you did not have a good move-out experience.  You can call our office at 205-750-2260 and we will be glad to assist you with any questions you have in regard to your security deposit statement.  The answer you received to move out by the end of your lease term was correct.  The unit has to be inspected and room made ready for the next resident.  It is not up to your past roommate to allow you to store your items in the common area that the new resident will also be using.  We understand that the move-out time is very hectic as a large number of residents move out at the same time each year.  We cannot allow residents to keep their items in a unit past the term of their lease as we have to have it ready for the new resident.

name: Scout Gage
text: Super helpful! The guy that help me put up my tv was super nice and extremely helpful! And he actually saved me over $100 by recommending something other than what I already had in terms of how to put up my tv. His suggestion worked even better than my original plan and saved me a lot of money. Highly recommend! Great service, super helpful, very nice.

name: Wayne Parker
text: Great management company. Everyone was very helpful and always professional. I was helped at every step of the process. I highly recommend.

name: Malaysia Ford
text: I am a future resident of The Nine at Tuscaloosa owned by Spaces Management. Spaces has done a great job with the leasing staff at this property, they are super friendly and extrememly professional/knowledgeable. I am so excited to be apart of this community.

name: Brenan Hester
text: Have been in a Neighborhood since 2014 and done everything according to the original HOA. Spaces takes over it in 2019 and now I have violations that have never been before! Also there are different HOA for different sections of this 1 neighborhood! Absolutely a joke as my 2 violations are a new , Christmas gift, Basketball goal and my garbage can beside my garage!! Seriously nearly every home in America has this and they are saying it’s devaluing a neighborhood! Would give them a 0 if possible and just to note their not BB accredited!

resp.text: Mr. Hester, As we have discussed, Spaces does not make the rules or create the covenants, we are hired to assist the Board or Developer in managing the neighborhood which includes collecting the dues, paying the bills and enforcing the covenants as they are recorded in the Probate office.    Although we are not BBB accredited we do have an A+ rating.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.

name: Danielle Festino
text: Day 2 of no air conditioning. Put in a maintenance order yesterday. Then called 3 times today. Tomorrow will be day 3 of no sleep because of 80+ degree apartment.

resp.text: We are very sorry for We are checking into this with our vendor.  It was assigned to them shortly after you made the request.  A lot of vendors are backed up because of all of the apartment turns throughout town.  We are following up with the vendor this morning.  Again we apologize for the delay.

name: R Entsmingr
text:
Andy and Spaces Management take no responsibility for Two Maids and NOT the highest rated and reviewed Trainwreck.  The maids are awful and Andy's latest errand girl does nothing to help resolve my complaint.

Don't go near this company.  They falsely advertise and send you lazy maids that smoke more then clean. Andy Turner and Spaces Management, I'm calling you out.

If anybody has had a bad experience with two sad maids like I have post your complaints on spaces management.  Also call spaces management and don't hang up until you get hold of Andy.  ;)

resp.text: We apologize if you did not have a positive experience with Two Maids and a Mop, but it is a separate company from Spaces Management.  Spaces Management strives to provide excellent customer service.  We reached out to the Manager of Two Maids and a Mop, and they do not have a record of R Entsmingr as a customer.  The manager reinforced that they have a "pay for performance plan" and if a customer is not satisfied, they return to address any areas that are unsatisfactory to the customer at no additional charge.  After looking into this issue further, both Spaces and Two Maids are working with Google to address what appears to be fake accounts created under the names of R Entsminger and Laura Smith as neither person has ever been customers of Spaces or Two Maids.  If either R or Laura would like to meet with the owner of Spaces to discuss their issue, he is glad to meet with them.  To schedule a meeting simply email reception@spacesmanagement.com with a few dates and times and a meeting will be set to resolve any issues.

name: Nicholas Ellis
text: The properties are nice and well maintained, but management is rude and mostly unresponsive. The company uses predatory business practices to relentlessly gouge university students. These practices are unethical, and I cannot recommend anyone to do business here. Another thing to note: as I have scrolled through the reviews for Spaces Management here, I have noticed a few 5 star reviews from people that I know to be Spaces employees. So, they are artificially inflating their rating.

name: Get Hauled
text: The best property management company in the business. Highly recommended. A+

name: Carolyn Roberson
text:
I can't rate a zero but I would if I could. River point apartments are horrible. Bugs are everywhere and I don't mean a few, it is CRAWLING. We've begged for pest control to no avail.

When my son first moved in a downstairs unit the bathroom had worms coming up from the shower drain. And he went ALL winter with NO heat. They kept saying the heater was fine. So he moved upstairs and the new tenant downstairs left because of that every reason.

Upstairs the AC never worked. It was always hot and water leaked continually out of that unit. He kept a gallon pickle jar under it to catch the water and emptied it daily. Maintenance "fixed it" (haha) but it never worked.

The bathroom sink NEVER drained correctly and even backed up with fecal material. He constantly poured drain cleaner down it. And management NEVER did anything about it.

Roaches were crawling everywhere, in the fridge, from the ceiling where some wall was tearing away. Gnawing through food wrappers. It was disgusting. Colonies were behind the fire extinguisher. He left a month early because he was staying sick.

The owner showed the unit to a potential buyer and my son told him about the bugs and it embarrassed him in front of the potential buyer.

Now they are billing him for a BRAND NEW AC and NEW BATHROOM SINK. and want him to pay for the damage maintenance did changing out a ceiling fan.  $3000.00!!!!

Stay VERY FAR AWAY from Spaces Management and River Point Apts!!!

name: Meredith Simmons
text: Spaces management is great to work with! They care about each individual tenant, and want you to have the best experience while living in their properties!

name: Kristen Osborne
text: The people are fantastic and will go above and beyond to help you any way they can!

name: Eric Levitt
text: Let me tell you about my experience with these guys. My daughter is renting and overpaying for her unit at the UofA off campus. Her AC has had problems before but none like this. Keep in mind this is a brand new renovated apartment that we rented. When the AC unit again had a problem we were told, sorry it cant be fixed as the unit is out of warranty and we need Matt to okay the repair. Well at 830 at night there is nobody to sign off on the service with the temperature in the apt now at 82 boiling degrees. We had to move her and her dog into a hotel to beat the heat while nobody answers the after hours phone.

name: Carlie Chapman
text: Great company to work with! They made the transition to my new apartment so easy!

name: The RC1
text: I currently live at river pointe apartments, one of the properties spaces management manages. Let me tell you about my experience.  There was a leak in the wall of my bathroom last year right after i moved in.  I was displaced from my apartment for a little over a week while they completely ripped apart my entire bathroom to fix the leak and redo the bathroom.  I let them get started right away and found myself somewhere else to stay.  Well after they finished fixing the leak and redoing the bathroom they just left without cleaning up my apartment.  There was dust EVERYWHERE covering everything in my apartment with a layer of it.  I cleaned all of the furniture myself but the dust was embedded in the carpet and it took almost 2 MONTHS of me calling to finally get them to send carpet cleaners out to clean the carpets.  I'm a little concerned about the health effects of breathing that in for so long.  But the whole ordeal was awful and the worst part is they didn't even offer to take anything off of my rent for me being displaced for over a week and having to live in that dust for 2 months.  I would caution anyone moving into these apartments or any apartments that spaces management manages.

name: Land For Sale
text: Tried to buy a condo that was being managed by Spaces. We offered to let the tenants out of the lease as part of the sale but Spaces refused to terminate the contract. They keep 10% of the monthly rental fee which I offered to give them and they refused. They are pain in the butt just out of spite.

name: Jameson Hughston
text: Excellent company.  The staff is very professional, easy to work with, helpful, and accommodating.

name: Morris SMITH
text: They are all about the money! I receive fines every month without warning. Oh and don't have a Tenant in your home, you will be targeted.

resp.text: Mr. Smith, thank you for leaving a review for Spaces.  Unfortunately, tenants can be difficult to get to follow the rules.  We will continue to work with you to make ensure that they properly keep up your property and protect your investment.

name: Kelly South
text: Great management company!  I highly recommend.

name: David Kimani
text: Management is EXTREMELY rude. They will tell you something over the phone and once you bring it up at a later date, they act as if nothing was said. The management will also hang up in your face. Very unprofessional.

resp.text: We want all of our customers to have a great experience, and we tried to assist you with options to resolve your problem of moving out in accordance with the lease agreement at the end of your lease term.  In this case, our team advised that all items in the unit had to be removed at the end of the lease term.  We offered to have the items removed and stored, but you refused. You stated you would have someone remove the items.  We began the clean up of the unit after your lease expired, and the items that remained in the unit were considered abandoned.  No one hung up on you, but rather it was you who hung up when this was being discussed.

name: Jasmine Hughes
text: The Association Management is racist, trash, and discriminates. They also are uneducated with basic property laws. Avoid anything dealing with them.

resp.text: This review has been reported to Google as inappropriate.

name: Heather Mitchell
text: Helpful staff!  A great company to work with!

name: Jason Gray
text: Great management company with some great properties to lease.

name: Brian Randolph
text: Beware this management company. My son signed a lease only to find a week later he had lost his scholarship and would not be returning. We continued to pay the rent thinking they were trying to help sublease only to find they were turning people away. When confronted, they agreed to sublease to someone WE FOUND. Now to avoid returning our security deposit they have created damage that did not exist when we left but they are trying to get us to pay additional money. The initial conditions were terrible to start with. Think twice before renting any apartment they manage.

name: Spencer Wise
text: Great management and people.  Above and beyond service

name: Akia Austin
text: This whole company is awful. Lived in Capstone Quarters for 3 years and it gets worse every year. The management is unprofessional and the maintenance is unreliable.

name: Garret Leopard
text: Very Helpful staff, and beautiful and well kept properties!

name: Sven S
text: Not providing any service to the neighborhood. Instead they’re making up new rules just so and then have their agents solicit for any possibility to charge the residents!

resp.text: Thank you for leaving a rating for Spaces.   I understand that your landlord has provided you with a copy of the covenants that are recorded in the Tuscaloosa Probate office.  Spaces does not create these, they are developed at the time the neighborhood is planned.   If at any time, you feel that you are receiving a notice for something that is not set out in the covenants, please contact us so that we can discuss it further.  Our goal is to have zero violations noted for our neighborhoods.  We understand that there are always extenuating circumstances and will be glad to help resolve those if we are aware.

name: TJ Ward
text: They hardly ever answer the phones, and they never call you back when you leave a message. This place has some shady business practices. Avoid this entire company while looking for a place to live in Tuscaloosa. They charged me $895 when I moved out for having a pet, but I never had a pet when I lived in Tuscaloosa. After confronting them about it, they changed it to a charge for not moving out in time. They were unable to tell me what day they had me moving out in their records. Their Facebook reviews show other people having the same issues as me. Please save yourself some trouble by not renting from them.

name: Christopher Long
text: Extremely unprofessional and dishonest. Do not rent from this company.

name: Katlyn Caldwell
text: Great company!

name: Grayson Garrett
text: Fabulous

name: Madame Angel
text: My house is amazing. I love it. My landlord is awesome an very understanding. I love my house period

name: Madame Angel
text: very understanding amazing people.. when something is wrong it gets fixed no problems. I love my house and they even let me paint. these people are amazing

name: Alicean Crawford
text: Sarah was an absolute delight as a realtor. I was a first time home buyer and she made it so easy. She was available to answer my questions anytime I had one. Sarah is a very relatable person and just made this process so easy. I recommend her 100%.

name: Macio Malone
text: An all around great person, realtor, and resource! Shes upfront, honest and goes above and beyond for you and makes sure your home buying experience is one to remember! Im a first time home buyer and i have to say Sarah Little is the number choice for anyone wanting to buy a home! She is a wonderful teacher and very informative about the home buying experience! She will not stop until she gets you into the home of your dreams! And shes such a sweet and down to earth person! A real sweetheart! Shes great!

resp.text: Awwww well thank you. Much appreciated!

name: Chris Daniel
text: I relocated to the Prattville area for work in late 2019 and contacted Sarah with questions about the area.  She was very cordial and responsive, talking with me for months as I prepared for the home buying process. She and her team always had timely answers and resources whenever needed including highly qualified lenders, home inspectors, and other service providers. Sarah made time for me whenever a property became available often on short notice. The home I bought in July 2020, we visited the day it was listed and we submitted an offer late that evening to ensure the best chance of success.  I highly recommend Sarah Little and her team if you are hoping to buy a home. Her knowledge of the housing market and the process of buying a home is incredible and you can be confident you are getting the very best representation.

name: Alexis Vroom
text: Sarah was really great! She was the property manager of the place I was renting from and help me find a perfect home for me! Was there every step of the way explaining everything.

resp.text: Thanks and congrats to you owning your first home! I'm here for years to come when you need anything from recommendations to advice!

name: Melodee Fox
text: She goes above and beyond  you help. I would recommend  her to sell or find me a house. She is amazing.

name: gumpguy334
text: Being a first time home buyer I had no clue what i was doing as far as buying a home, after a meeting she told me about the different types of loans out there, provided me with lenders to contact who were great to work with as well and got things done in a timely manner. Its been a long 2 year process from the start of the meeting til closing and she never skipped a beat on checking up on me, showing a number of homes around my crazy work schedule, and answering any question I had! It was a great pleasure working with it and made everything as painless as possible getting me into my home and definitely would recommend her to others as well on the future if i ever plan on moving!

resp.text: It was my pleasure and I couldn't be happier for you and your daughter to have your own home to make memories in!

name: Matt Dermody
text: Sarah was great helping me find the right house and helped out a lot afterwards! Definitely a recommend here!

name: Tabreena Eubanks
text: Sarah has been working with us not only did she help us find a home and help us purchase our very first house but when it came time for us to sell she was there to help us and has been amazing every step of the way  she has gone over and Beyond what anybody could have expected from a realtor and I would completely and utterly recommend her to anyone looking to buy a home or to sell their home

name: Robert Struble
text:
(Translated by Google) infirmative

(Original)
Infirmative

name: Jalen Brown
text: So, my boyfriend and I started this whole apartment search a long time ago, but with the pandemic and certain financial issues that came with that we put it on hold. Finally we decided to start looking again in June. We looked everywhere but nothing felt right. A coworker of mine, stays in an H2 property and really talked them up. I'd heard of them, and have friends who work for the company. So, we started looking at some of their properties online and they seemed promising. We then got in contact with our leasing agent,  Baylee Law, who sent us a list of available properties almost immediately. We set up a day to go view and she probably showed us 6 or 7 that day. She was awesome to work with, really personable, and extremely professional. Never pushy, but always gave us a good bit of info on each property. We finally found Linwood Park (which we love) and from Application to signing the lease it was super fast and easy. A very smooth process. So, thank you H2 and Baylee for helping us find our new home. If I could give you 10 stars, I would!!

name: A'aleah Taylor
text: JESSICA IS AMAZING. so friendly and down to Earth. She got me the cutest welcome gift ever, it was so unexpected! She made sure I knew all of the resources available for any problems I might have. I know I’m going to love it in my new apartment! It’s all thanks to Jessica!!

name: Jason Torrey
text: Jessica was the absolute BEST agent to work with! Not only is she a great agent, she's a great person who genuinely cares about the well-being of each of her clients. I would recommend working with her to anyone looking for an apartment in Birmingham!

name: Courtney Banks
text:
H2 review

Apartment hunting is not the easiest thing in the world. Though we were recommended to look into the H2 properties by a close friend of ours and from that point on, we didn’t look at any other real estate, we knew we would be in good hands with H2.

Because of the time frame in which we were looking it was becoming a very stressful situation. International students and students are beginning to return to town to begin preparations for school to start in a few weeks.. we thought we were never going to find a place. Sandra stepped up to the place and sent us a spot she thought we would love. We took it in a heart beat.

Sandra has been nothing but amazing with us. Working with us every step of the way. Ensuring if we have questions that they are answered in a timely matter. She is very positive and really helped us to stay positive in this stressful looking phase. We are now happy to have signed our lease and found a place to call home.

Thank you to the crew at H2 for all of your hard work and to Sandra who made sure we got a place to stay! We are very grateful!

name: lindley lawrence
text: I've lived in one of H2's buildings for over a year now and was pretty hesitant to lease with them again, but Jessica and Austin are absolutely wonderful and helped me find a beautiful new apartment. The previous apartment was a very old building that had very little care before H2 took over and they have been very understanding of the situation and even helped me move to my new place early! They have done an amazing job of working on new buildings to the company without disturbing current residents as well.

name: Will Wallace
text: Jon listened to our wants and price ranges and showed us the perfect apartment we were looking for. Great communication and overall extremely helpful. H2 itself is fantastic as well—easy to navigate resident portals and convenient methods of authorization while still feeling safe and secure. Highly recommend especially for noob apartment hunters like me!!

name: Margaret Lloyd
text: H2 gives you a personalized experience which is exactly what we needed when looking for an apartment close to campus. Jon got to know my roommate and I, so he could recommend the best locations catered toward our interests. The entire team worked together, and it shows because we could not be happier with our new place! Thank you, Jon, Autumn, and the entire H2 crew for all your hard work.

name: Marielle Menke
text: I worked with Jessica to find an apartment in the city and it couldn’t have gone more smoothly. Jessica was very flexible and accommodating being that I was moving from out of state. She was able to answer all my questions and concerns and follow up in a timely manner. Thanks Jessica!

name: Amelia Steele
text: Jessica is great! She showed me multiple apartments within my budget in a timely manner. She gave me insight that helped me to make a good choice on my apartment. H2 has made the entire process seamless. Would recommend!

name: Nicole Stratton
text: We loved living at Terrace View for the past 3 years. We had little to no issues with our apartment and any maintenance was quickly resolved within 24 hours. Autumn was a fantastic property manager!

name: macey glassco
text: Wonderful service!! Jessica gave us a tour of Rhodes Villa today and she is one of the most informative and helpful leasing agents i’ve spoke with! She was able to give us a lot of information about the unit and amenities and answer every question we had. She is even a tenant of an H2 property and gave us a view of how living there is.

name: Patrick Koontz
text: Jessica was my leasing agent and she was fantastic, she worked with my situation and was able to get me into a new apartment in less than a week. The whole h2 team was great, Jessica, Austin, and Parker all went above and beyond for me. I can’t recommend them enough.

name: Brenda Luu
text: I had the greatest pleasure touring with Jessica yesterday! She was very thorough with the application process and was very helpful in introducing me to the area. She is also super friendly and I really appreciate her honesty. If I could, I would tour every apartment with Jessica.

name: Claire Baker
text: The apartment renting and move in experience with H2 was fantastic and much easier than other places that I have lived! Using their website to find an apartment was very easy. They had accurate prices and floor plans listed for almost every property. Then, once I sent them my phone number via their website, I was immediately contacted by a leasing agent, Sandra, who offered me a tour of the property I was interested in. She was incredibly helpful through every step of the leasing process. Once the time came to sign a lease, it was emailed to me online along with a list of steps to complete that would make moving in even easier.

name: Shirley Kelley
text: Jessica was wonderful! She was available when I needed her and she answered all of my many questions in a prompt and courteous manner. I brought my elderly mother with me to look at the apartment and, believe me, she is very picky about where I live! Jessica won her over right away with her calm, patient, and friendly personality. In fact, I looked at several other properties that day with a different agent. All of the apartments were comparable in price, location, and features. We chose the apartment Jessica showed us because of the terrific service she provided.  I highly recommend Jessica for all of your real estate needs!

name: Lucas Nunn
text: Jon was very nice and showed me exactly what I was looking for.  10/10 experience with H2

name: Alexis K (1ChocolatePearl)
text:
From start to finish I have had nothing but a great experience with Jessica Barnes (H2 agent). She was very accommodating with my work schedule when it came to viewing properties..so much so that I had two specific properties that I wanted to view after work- she made me a viewing appointment that same day for those properties. After being undecided she showed me 3 additional properties that same day in which the 3rd property ended up being my favorite and the one I chose.

She listened to what I wanted when it came to space, style, location, and price. Only having a three week time frame from my current lease ending to finding a new place, she has made this process very easy and she’s been quick returning emails, calls, and answering all of my questions. I’ll be picking up my keys this week. I will be recommending her to everyone  looking to lease. I have nothing but positive things to say about Jessica and my experience.

name: Jon Jacobson
text:
Jessica made the whole experience so easy to manage. This is my first time living in an apartment in Birmingham and I couldn’t be happier with what she found. I will recommend her and H2 to anyone and everyone that is looking for a place in Birmingham.
Thank you!!!!!!

name: Ryan Hanks
text: I recently chose H2 again to help me find a new place.  And like before, they did not disappoint. Autumn and Jon were both very informative, helpful and did a wonderful job.  They both went above and beyond assisting me.  I definitely recommend H2 if you are looking for a place to lease!!!

name: Seth Maynor
text: Just moved in a month ago, but it has been a pretty good experience! Jon was a fantastic agent, had a great personality, and was very informative. There has been a few maintenance issues but they get resolved within that day, so their speed is appreciated. Greatly recommend leasing through H2.

name: Maddy McGee
text: I had a great experience with H2. Everyone involved with my renting process was helpful and informative.

name: Tanner Syx
text: Previously had used another company available near the area Southside properties or something like that. They were the absolute worst company I’ve ever had Ana partner through. H2 Real Estate is hands down the most comfortable and communicative and active staff (shout out to Autumn our manager and Kurt who found us our nice place) they have taken care of us from day one and are continuing to do as much as they can for us whenever we need them. Highly reliable! 10/5 stars.

name: Amber Taylor
text: Jessica Barnes is astounding. Beyond astounding honesty! Heaven sent really. She was so helpful and patient! I bombarded her with questions and she made sure every single one was answered. I’ve dealt with so many issues when leasing, but she really turned the whole experience around for me! I am so grateful for your time and efforts!

name: Braedon Miller
text: I was looking for a place on a three days notice that I could move into. I reached out to H2 Real estate and with my situation and the next day was reached out to by Baylee who was extremely helpful being able to show me multiple properties the next day and have me fully signed and ready to move in in just two days. They do a great job at renovating their properties and I’m very satisfied with their service and my place.

name: Brian Rose
text: Great experience! Fast and easy. I had no problems or delays during the application process. Jessica Barnes was very professional!!! I will definitely recommend to others!

name: Gracie Morrison
text: Jessica is THE BEST!!! She was so helpful every step of the way and answered every one of my questions. As soon as I met her and learned about the H2 properties I knew I had found where I wanted to be!

name: Michaela Brooke
text: I was connected with Jessica and she worked so hard to get me into the apartment of my dreams! She also worked with my hectic schedule and got me moved in FAST.

name: Joe McElderry
text: Jessica was super helpful! Found a great place!

name: Jonecia Spencer
text: The rental process was such a breeze. Bailee was a great and capable real estate agent. I was able to view the property and get approved very quickly! I enjoyed the entire process!

name: Trevor McMullen
text: Sherwin Marashinia was friendly and efficient at helping me find an apartment!

name: EB Kuhn
text: Jessica Barnes the leasing agent did a very nice job and made the process very easy. The apartment listing was a little misleading - it said wifi access was provided but that wasn’t really true. Had to submit 4 work orders immediately upon moving in.

name: Tira Crenshaw-McCaa
text: I just wanted to say that it is so refreshing to have a property manager like Austin Thigpen that cares and actually responds back in a timely manner to tenants. I can’t speak for anyone else but I am soooo appreciative of him as I had so many issues when I moved in last November. Thank you so much for everything that you do for us!

name: ACESKDT
text: Working with Jessica from H2 was so easy! She was super helpful with the move in progress. We are so happy to be H2 residents now.

name: Candice Baker
text:
I’ve been renting from H2 for several years and am in the process of renewing my lease at the Lennox in Glen Iris (love this property!).

Autumn Brown is always quick to respond to emails and provides great customer service.

Steve Drake in maintenance is also just wonderful! He is a pleasure to be around, very kind and funny, and fixes any issue I’ve ever had within 24 hours of putting in a maintenance request (which has gladly been infrequent due to the great renovations done on the property).

I’ve rented from several property managers in Birmingham, and my experience with H2 has been the best. Their current staff just goes above and beyond for tenants.

name: Grace Soldesi
text: Jon was amazing! Very thorough, kind & was always available to help me with any questions I had throughout the moving process

name: Shemiah Greene
text: My leasing agent Jessica has been nothing but a godsend! Not only did she show me an additional unit that was more in my budget, but also she was essential in me getting approved for the unit. She was a great leasing agent and she helped me throughout the process!

name: Air Adventure
text: I recently leased a unit from H2. My leasing agent was Jessica Barnes and she was excellent. I could not have asked for better. The first unit I saw was not appropriate but she suggested another one based on my needs. She made the whole process quick and painless by answering all my questions and responding in a timely manner. I was able to get through the process and into my new place quickly and efficiently thanks to her. I highly recommend Jessica Barnes and H2.

name: Will Duncan
text: I’m in my 3rd apartment with H2 in ~6 years and I’ve had a great experience with them. The maintenance staff is prompt and efficient and the office staff is very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend!

name: Amanda Knebl
text: Service has been wonderful and speedy. Sandra is my leasing agent and she has been so very helpful. I am very grateful for her and this company. I am very excited to move in to my apartment!

name: Chloe Jarvis
text: I’ve had a great experience with H2. After touring several apartments with 2 different leasing agents, I found the perfect one thanks to Jon! They listened to everything I wanted in an apartment and led me to the perfect place. He’s been great communicating with me about everything and has been so helpful with all my questions.

name: Alex Yates
text: Never live here! They seem so caring at first but it’s all about getting you to sign the lease and then they own you. They stop caring if the apartment is nice and working. I viewed my apartment with my roommate in May and pointed out the rotting back door, completed cracked and broken tub, and leaky faucet. None of which were fixed by the time we moved in over a month later. As I write this, I have lived in the apartment for a week and I still can’t shower or clean my clothes since we’re paying for an in unit washer/dryer that ALSO STILL ISNT INSTALLED. name: Carley McWilliams
text:
This is for the Manor Village location near Five Points South/The Vulcan.

I've lived here for roughly 9 months now. Overall, it is a good price for the area it is in. The apartments are also reasonably spacious for the price point.

The good: The management team and the maintenance team are always responsive and quick! I have had work orders fulfilled the same day that I put them in more than once. They are also good about getting back to you if you have any questions.

The not so good: Parking can be a bit tricky here! Management does what they can with the space they have but there is a chance you will need to street park. There has also been a washer out of order since before I moved in - leaving just one for everyone to share! During your tour, they will probably tell you it is getting replaced soon (or that's what they told me anyway). Don't count on it and just plan to go to University Laundromat. It is fairly close and a great value if you can't catch the one here available.

It has been a much better experience than most I have had with prior apartments. The location is great and the charm of the older buildings is hard to beat!

name: Rachel Powell
text: This company allows a company that works for them to pull guns on you and also hit you with their trucks if they feel. They will tell you it’s your fault if you complain. If you do rent from here please beware, their is a driver that will watch your house to see if and when you are home to tow away your car if you do not have a decal

name: Ellen Whelan
text:
Autumn Brown is my property manager at H2, and has given me more aid as a resident than I have witnessed by many property managers. Whether it's confusion within the lease, payment, or life just complicates things; she is always cheerful and ready to help. Even if mistakes or complications are on my end there is a sense of understanding that is very calming - especially now. Thanks again, Autumn!

EDIT: I am finally leaving the Irish, but only to move cities. I can't believe I'm leaving this complex and the porch view, but it must happen. Again, Autumn Brown has offered to write a referral and is as helpful as ever. Although there are issues within the communication of departments at H2 at times, all I ever needed was to communicate clearly to the staff and things have been done within reasonable time frames with pleasantness. Five years in this apartment have been full of memories and a feeling of "home". I am very sad to be leaving this complex and my neighbors, but am very thankful for the opportunities living here have given me. I'm really going to miss having my morning coffee on this porch.

Step 1. buy very old buildings where the average rent is somewhere between $575 to $775

Step 2. renovate every apartment the same at all the different complexes, which includes paint and fake wood flooring

Step 3. now upcharge to $1200 to $1500 a month

Step 4. try to get rid of old tenants so you can renovate their apartments and upcharge as well, while never doing anything to the outer exterior of the super old buildings

this my friends, is the H2 way...noticed they don't have reviews turned on, on Facebook, that's because of all the service industry people they evicted during covid, funny how the past few weeks they're getting tons of good reviews all of a sudden on Google, that's called an incentive program for people that leave a good review because they have a lot of damage control to do for the past several years of horrible management, ripping people off with hidden fee's, and the barrage of lies they tell people......

name: alain melendez
text:
Beware of the bait & switch scam.   I would put Zero stars if it would let me...These people post a price and "Forget to disclaim additional fees" not mentioned until they get your deposit ... Make sure you ask about all details before you let them take your application or deposit money...The manger D Bussey very elegantly will refuse to take responsibility for their mistake or the sharing of false information from their marketing or showing agent...   be careful so they don't scam you out of your application or deposit money...
In most serious businesses if some one quotes you a price,  they  honor it.  The agent, Parker Crane, admitted not disclaiming the fee and called a simple mistake that I will just have to pay???????
$5.00 extra per month is NOT a big deal to me but DISHONEST PEOPLE are.
What makes it even better, when I requested for my refund they told me that the $100.00 application fee will not be refunded regardless if they gave us the right information or not....

These guys have a ton of units in downtown Birmingham and the way they behave I am pretty sure this is a normal behavior for them... no telling how many students get scammed by these fellow... BE AWARE!

name: Laura Legg
text: I moved into Linridge which is managed by H2 two years ago. The day I moved in I had a leak in the ceiling, I was told it was fixed and moved on. The people seemed nice and I loved the apartment. Fast forward a couple of months, I had another leak in the same spot. This time it damage the drywall. I was told there was no danger of mold, etc and that it had been fixed and cleaned. I took pictures this time. Fast forward another few months, another leak, this time bigger- all of these were from my upstairs neighbors air conditioning unit and/or water heater. Still did nothing  to fix the drywall and there have been water stains and cracks on my ceiling for months. Then last night the water heater broke again and it flooded my upstairs neighbors apartment as well as mine. There was at least a half inch to an inch of water in my bedroom, closet, and living room. It came from the ceiling, it poured from the fan, it came from the vents...it took maintenance 40 minutes to get there and then he walked in, shook his head and walked out. Keep in mind this was 900 at night and I had just worked and extremely long shift and had to work again in the morning. My bed was ruined, my mattress was ruined, my rugs are ruined, my Martin guitar could be ruined. I have renters insurance, and I have been a good tenant. I pay rent on time. I report issues so they can be fixed- but they were never fixed. I was trying to get in touch with Wescott, the property manager, all night. She never answered. She still hasn’t  answered. I will say that TJ and Pam helped me the most, and TJ did try and find me a place to stay last night but I was able to sleep on my couch and opted to stay at home to keep an eye on things. Good thing I did because My apartment is still leaking and it’s 900 AM. For all I know there could be mold in the area where it leaked before that they said they fixed. I know there probably will be now. I don’t feel like this is a safe environment, and the fact that I cannot reach anyone who will help me when needed today is extremely frustrating. I don’t like complaining, but I am beyond frustrated now.  I would absolutely NOT recommend H2 to anyone.

name: Grant M.
text:
This is my review of H2 Real Estate and more specifically their property called Manor Village on Richard Arrington Jr. BLVD. I lived there for a year, and these are all the good and bad about renting from this company.

The good: All of the staff I dealt with there nice and professional, and were responsive anytime I had to talk to them. They also compensated me for the problems I incurred when I moved out, so that bumps them up from a 1 star to 2 stars. The property was in a pretty cool location with a nice view of the BHAM skyline. Aside from that, there's not much more to add.

The bad: Now the buildings in this complex are at least 80 years old and in rough shape. The specific unit I was in was a "renovated" unit that had a new kitchen, bathroom, and updated fixtures.

Before I signed the lease, I asked if the unit had new insulation and was assured that it did as well as a new HVAC system (Ill get to this later). There was also various places where water was leaking by a window, a couple places on the ceiling, and the back door. I marked this on my paperwork and was assured that it would be fixed ASAP. A crew came out and "fixed" (Their version of fixing water leaks is to spread some mud on the wet spot and paint it. Quality fix) two of the three spots, and left the large one by the back door where water was running down the wall. Due to their "fix" the water leaks inevitably came back next time a heavy rain came through. Sent in another work order and they threw some more mud on it, still ignoring the largest leak. At this point, I decided to drop the issue and ignore it since they obviously didn't think it was a large problem and ignored it too. A couple months later, the ceiling fell since the sheetrock had sagged so much, exposing the rotting and moldy wood holding the building together and allowing ants, centipedes, and other pests into the unit. Once this happened, they actually decided to fix it after I sent a firm email to the property manager about it.

The other large problem I had with the unit is the insane power bills I would get in the winter months. When they updated the unit, they didn't replace any windows or install any insulation (Like I was told when I moved in). This made the unit extremely cold in the winter, and dreadful to live in. I would set my heat to 65 degrees and my heat would run every 20 mins trying to increase the temperature. The heater would pop the breaker frequently because it was drawing so much power. This leads me to believe that the new HVAC unit they installed was wired incorrectly. After multiple techs come out to evaluate the problem, supposedly including an electrician and someone from Alabama Power, the problem was still there. My electricity bill would be between $250-$350 during winter months on a 1 bed apartment. They eventually started sending me credits for the power bills after I complained enough about it not being fixed which as a nice gesture. Fixing the problem properly the first time would have been nicer.

Some other issues I encountered:
- A colony of fleas moved in on the sidewalk next to my building, and eventually made their way into my unit. After contacting H2, the receptionist told me to call the extermination company myself. I don't have pets, and this was on the outside, common area part of the building. It's not my responsibility to maintain common areas of the complex, this was H2's problem. So instead of fighting this, I bought 4 cans of Raid and did the job myself.
- My dishwasher was not connected to power when I moved in.
- I had multiple issues with the faucets, door handles, and other finishings in the unit since H2 cheaped out on literally every finishing in the unit.

I do not recommend H2 to anyone. The lack of care when it comes to maintaining their properties and their "we will do that later" attitude is extremely frustrating.

text: Refused to let me out of my lease despite the fact that I needed to move out of state, and literally served me an eviction notice once because I was 4 days late on rent. They could definitely do a better job treating their tenants like people. With that being said, maintenance issues were always solved quickly and there were no major problems with the apartment.

name: Keisha Barnes
text: I am a new resident of the H2 community and so far, I really love my unit! I want to give kudos to Baylee, my leasing agent.  Baylee is phenomenal.  She helped me to find a perfect home, and was extremely supportive when it counted.  She made my concerns, her concerns, which made me feel very comforted.  She is very solution-oriented and personable; I would recommend her 100x.

name: Claire Milburn
text: I've had a positive experience with H2! My apartment at Melrose Place is fantastic. The remodel job is quality work, and maintenance is extremely responsive. I would give five stars if not for our parking lot, and a slightly stressful start to my lease. Our parking lot is really tightly laid out and full of pot holes, so I've gotten quite a few dings and scrapes from other residents. Also, my move in process was a bit hectic because I was moving from several states away. I ran into a scheduling issue with my walkthrough and key pick up. This got worked out, but I'd say H2 is used to just dealing with local clients.

name: S W
text: Emily is amazing. She worked with me every step of the way! Highly recommend!

name: Reagan Wells
text: I've really enjoyed my experience with H2 so far. My agent was quick to address any concerned and was very knowledgeable about the area and the conditions of the unit. My apartment was newly renovated as well.

name: John Ahn
text: Truly enjoyed my experience with H2 Real Estate. The staff is friendly, attentive, and willing to help in any way they can. Robin went above and beyond to find multiple options that were in my price range and even did FaceTime tours of the apartments I was interested in since I was unable to be present in Birmingham for them. She's very passionate about her job and really cares for her clients.

name: Damian Kuna
text:
First of all, I need to stress that I had a great experience when it comes to communication with my property manager, Daniel Bussey. He was always replying me quickly and addressing my concerns well. I wish he was everybody's property manager! There was no such thing as impossible and we could always work something out.
My complex (Foxhall) was quite ok, but because of thin walls I could hear noisy neighbors that were enjoying quarantine parties every night. Fortunately, Daniel was able to handle their behavior. Anyway, the neighborhood there is safe and close to the campus what makes it a perfect place to live at.

Secondly, H2 staff keeps the property nice and clean and there is a laundry room on site. I think they are now renovating and equipping every unit with a washing machine and dryer which is very convenient.

Thirdly, there is a pretty big (compared to other properties around) parking lot, so you don't have to leave your vehicle on the street what might expose it for potential breaking-in.
Overall, I do recommend living at Foxhall and cooperation with H2.

name: taylor blanchard
text: We absolutely loved working with Robin while looking for our current place! She set up an entire list of apartments for us to view in literally two days, and was so sweet and insightful about each of them! She was so easy to contact and ask questions and I would definitely recommend using her when looking for a place with H2!

text: We had an amazing experience with H2. We needed an affordable place and quickly and our leasing agent Robin McDermond found us exactly what we needed. She was quick to respond and went above and beyond to make sure everything was right for us

name: Shelby Benson
text: I was evicted from my apartment today. My rent was paid, but H2 decided that I hadn’t paid for 3 months. This is a lie and I have documentation, but they threatened legal action if I didn’t comply. I have been wrongfully forced from my home by warthog faced crooks. Whatever you do, avoid this company like the plague. I do not want anyone to suffer as I have. Not to mention there has been flooding in the apartment complex that was left to sit all weekend while the tenants had nowhere to go. Don’t let this happen to you.

name: Ronin
text: I thought I'd take the time to write a review about the gutter I currently live in.  As I type this, there is a constant dripping of water coming from my ceiling into a bucket that I have to empty pretty soon.  I think it's reasonable that this group should be called H2O Real Estate because I've had nothing but leaks from the ceiling and walls.  First off, when we saw the unit, there were no signs of leaking or roaches because I believe the unit had to have been cleaned up and painted before we saw it.  The day we moved in we didn't get the correct keys for our front door or mailbox.  Upon entry, guess what? Roaches (and then we noticed leaks soon after too).  Upon closer inspection of the unit, there were gaps and holes everywhere in our unit allowing bugs to come and go.  Whenever it rained, there would be a waterfall in front of our front door because there was no awning.  Upon an even closer inspection of the building and our power bill, the public laundry in the basement was (and still is) wired to our power meter.  After talking with the property manager, we were able to reach an agreement and agreed to pay a reasonable amount for the power after the issue was discovered.  It still baffles me that no one knew or told us.  Shady imho.  Maintenance people responded fast to our requests.  The plumbers involved in the renovations throughout the building began cutting open pipes in my room without telling me they were.  Also, one of the leaks in my bedroom has persisted for over 4 months and still hasn't been fixed but I'm reassured that it has been fixed each time.  I'm convinced the walls of this place are filled with mold.   I'd recommend finding somewhere else to live as other people detailed similar experiences at other H2O units.    I've attached some photos of a few of the leaks in my current living situation below.

name: Autumn Demonbreun
text: So far I have had a great experience with H2. I’ve only lived here for two weeks but apartments are very updated, haven’t seen any pest, very close to work (rented one of the five points locations), and the leasing agent Robin was very helpful in getting me into a new apartment quickly and even was available to show me an apartment on short notice on a Sunday.

text: I lived here for a year. Maintenance was great, no issues with the front office. I would recommend renting from H2.

text: Robin of H2 Real Estate did a perfect job of communicating consistently and going above and beyond to help me find the perfect apartment!! H2 was great to work with as well and provided me with all the info I needed to have a smooth move in.

During a very stressful time in my life, everyone at H2 Realty made moving a breeze. Baylee has been non-stop in answering all my texts, regardless of how simple the question. Courtney has made all paperwork and contracts easy to understand and execute. Autumn has been amazing in gaining approval and sending reminders of things I had forgotten about moving.
I highly recommend this office to anyone looking to move.

text: Friendly. Responsive. Good property. Could improve parking lot entrance for Carol Court

name: Forrest Richardson
text:
I’ve lived with H2 for 3.5 of the last 5 years.

It is unreasonable to expect everything to run 100% according to plan; things break and mistakes are made. However, H2 was successful and timely in responding to irregularities.

I have always been able to get in contact with H2 when necessary, and the maintenance team was fast and efficient. The maintenance crew also did (in my opinion) more than required to keep my apartment’s appliances up to standard; they were proactive in identifying future problems and resolving them.

I also need to mention the attention to quality of life improvements. In the last year our parking lot has been repaved and trees and bushes were planted where just concrete was previously.

I have no complaints with H2 and would recommend them as responsible landlords.

name: Kate Jones
text: I’m in my second apartment with H2 and both times have been helped by Baylee she is amazing!! I got exactly why I wanted!

name: Olivéa Rae
text: Sooo many bad reviews. Are these problems being solved?? Looks like I need to be very cautious. Everything will be hand written and not through a portal.

name: Jarrod Brown
text: Erin was incredibly helpful throughout my process of trying to find the right apartment for me. She did a wonderful job!

name: Michael Lindley
text: This is a review from when I first moved into an H2 property on 08/28/19 for a terrible experience. The problems never got better and Emily the property manager at Redmont Square really was no help whatsoever. Since moving in there had been one problem after another. Let me preface this with, we did a walk through the Thursday before and pointed out these issues. First, on the day of move in, upon arrival it was clear that the apartment was not ready to be moved into, yet you set a move in date that in involved us paying a proration(something I’m fine with paying if the apartment is ready). Lights weren't installed. Light fixtures were full of dust and debris. My first problem I see is that the weather strip is missing to the front door allowing easy access for bugs into this apartment along with releasing air conditioning. Second I notice none of the electricity in the kitchen works and that the refrigerator is not even plugged in and the new appliance plastic hasn’t been removed from any part of it. I was able to receive no help from any of the maintenance on this issue until Tuesday. Luckily my leasing agent Robin was able to contact someone higher up that was able to give us ideas that I would have to try to make them work(ideas involving me having to flip all the breakers) and one of the ideas did work. This should not have been my job to do this or have to set up the refrigerator. Next, I noticed that in the bathroom the paint was still missing on some of the drawers from where it had pulled off from opening. Under the sink in the bathroom. There was still exposed insulation and direct access into the wall along with missing paint on the inside of the underpart of the sink. One day, we started noticing the toilet not flushing properly(just filling up with water). Tried plunging that didn’t work. Called emergency maintenance and had to insist they come that day. Where this gets worse is I try taking a shower and realize the water is starting to pool up so I turn it off and when I do. I notice something starts coming out of the drain and realize it is actual human fece and not tiny specs of it, little chunks. I called emergency maintenance again to demand they come out immediately. Let me remind I just moved in officially on Sunday before that happened. Maintenance did eventually come but was unable to remedy the situation. So plumbers had to be called and they finally remedied the situation. This total ordeal lasted from 12-8 on a Tuesday. I was told by a worker that this has happened at a few other apartments at this building and also told by one of the neighbors that this place is falling apart and that there is always an issue. This has been true so far. This problem continued to happen throughout the entire time I lived at the property. The dishwasher didn't work well(main attraction to this apartment before realizing that) and wasn't even hooked up when I moved in. The reason I’m writing this review today is because after moving out I am leaving unhappy and believing this to be a pretty amateur company.. Seems a lot like the nightmarish stories I heard about Southside Apt Company. I find this to be unacceptable with all the problems and don’t understand why we were allowed to move in before it was ready. I wouldn't recommend this company to anyone and if you are considering it, be ready to have issues.

name: Chad Martin
text: Great work, they always find a way to develop cool projects that are a great fit for the city

name: Abbi Pearman
text: Very helpful!

name: Julia Bullock
text: H2 is an incredible company to work with! Our agent, Robin, was extremely knowledgable and helpful throughout the entire process, from finding the perfect place to moving in and getting settled.

name: Hunter Harper (RedMeatWhiskeyNeat)
text: Jessica is the knees bees

name: Lexie Alexander
text: If I could give no stars, I would. When we first met with H2 about getting a place, they told us that we could see the apartment before signing the lease, that never happened. We get the keys, come to look at the apartment, and it is a mess! Everything is dirty, there was dirt in the bath tub, sinks, nothing looked clean. We had to clean everything. Then, our first weekend here (office isn’t open on weekends), our water heater went out and we had to take cold showers all weekend. Our oven was broken for about 5 months before someone came to fix it. No one seems to care about the bug problem I’ve been emailing about for MONTHS now!!! They will not get pest control to come spray everyone’s apartment on a month to month basis. We had to deal with a mouse problem on our own as well because no one seemed to care about that either. I constantly have to deal with my neighbors having people over at all hours of the night and they are so loud it’s ridiculous. I wake up to screaming and fighting in the middle of the night sometimes. I could go on and on and on about how awful it is to rent from these people. They seem nice through emails and phone conversations, but they never follow through with anything. Do yourself a favor, do not rent from H2.

text: My favorite place to eat downtown. Great vegan options

name: Becca Beitel
text: I unfortunately live in the Stratford building on 18th St. I was told before moving in (along with others in the building) that water was included and that we could park in the church parking lot. Both were false, and when questioned they responded with mocking "we already told you we can't help with this, I dont understand why you keep asking". I understand there's limited parking in the city, but I received a ticket parking where I was told to by H2 employee Robin. When I told H2, they recommended "I reach out to let her know that's not true" instead of doing it themselves? Although my water is orange, there is nothing they can do. Apparently a historical building means no improvements, ever. The floor panels on both stairwells have become a tripping hazard since they keep falling off but clearly there's no maintenance in the building who care about upkeep. Impatiently waiting for the day I can finally move out.

name: Ben German
text: Daniel was so helpful showing me around the highland park area! Keep that guy around!

name: Sarah Hall
text:
I’ve been with H2 real estate for almost a year now and I can’t say enough good things.

Maintenance requests are always taken care of promptly and the H2 team is very responsive in general. Thank you for everything!!

name: Tori
text: If I could give a 0 out of 5 I would. Within my 2 years of staying with H2 I paid every month on time. I was compliant with all the rules and reported when I needed maintenance. The Lennox apartment complex has bed bug and I was warned by another tenant a few months after I moved in. For 4 months I suffered with bed bugs biting and attacking me. I told the company as soon as I noticed them. After that I had to wash my entire wardrobe. The first time they bombed the apartment It didn’t work so I had to go through the whole process twice. They took their sweet time to fix It. The second time around my washer broke. It took 2 months for them to fix my washer. They ordered the wrong part the first time.  they did compensate money but I was still suffering by getting bit. Then they made it seem like It was my fault the washer broke but they wanted me to wash all fabrics and put them in garbage bags even though the bed bugs were in the apartments. After moving out they picked out minuscule things in the apartment to charge me for. WHEN YOU MOVE IN: MAKE SURE YOU WRITE DOWN WHAT IS WRONG WITH THE APARTMENT AND THEN NOTE TO H2 THE THINGS THEY NEED TO CLEAN OR MESSED UP IN THE APARTMENT. If you don’t they will come after you in the end. My toilet was dirty with calcium build up and was a very old toilet along with the seat and they knocked me for that when I moved out. I cleaned that whole apartment top to bottom. This company is nothing but money hungry. I would never recommend them to anyone. They only refund half of your deposit fee and then nip pick money away from It as well. Good luck to anyone who rents from them. I am not happy with their company or services

name: Molly Easter
text: I would give them zero stars if I could. They haven't fixed a leak in my bathroom for almost a month now and when I moved in my apartment I had roaches. They seem attentive but they do not follow through.

text:
Our first time staying at the Palms and we could not have selected a better condo.  The owners were super nice and one call away if we needed anything. I left behind a really special item and contacted the owners who contacted the cleaning service and got the item back in the mail in a few days.
Great indoor and outdoor pool too and just steps from the beach.

name: Aika Myrzagaliyeva
text: Its ok condo. But view is amazing, it's right on a beach with great patio where u can have parties or breakfast:) make sure you get higher floor. For better views

name: Ebtesam Almohaisen
text: Clean rooms, easy and fast check in, amazing view, many nearby amenities

name: clara smith
text: Worst experience I've ever had.  The room wasn't clean and their were bugs.

name: Rhonda Oliver
text: Nice place... will stay again

name: Phillip Garrard
text: Service is amazing! All the amenities are excellent.

name: Dave Trindel
text: Stayed on the 10th floor. The view was great. The building and grounds were clean. Enjoyed myself.

name: Kendall Holland
text:
Bed bug infestation!!!!!!

My husband I am both got over 300 bites after being in bed for only 2 hours. We both have had multiple doctors visits to handle our reactions.

They did not offer to move us or a full refund. They sent an exterminator who did not adequately get rid of them and didn’t even remove pillows and other linens that were infested.

DO NOT STAY here!!

Another exterminator was visiting another unit the very next day.

name: Crusader Lite
text: Ok, we had a nice beach vacation and the room we rented was on ghe cheap side, but id did not feel like it, it was a very nice room with a small house feeling, everything looked amazing, the only thing i did not like was the beds, the first night was when i realized what made the place so cheap, the beds were hard and almost impossible to get good sleep on, but mist others probably wont think so, my friend loved the bed, and overall, the room was great, although im gonna take a long nap when i get home

text: The condo is nice and big with three rooms and a seating area for those morning breakfast/coffee starts.

name: brenda carrol
text: Absolutely divine

name: Tom Williams
text: For two days they’ve had remodeling going on beside us and on top of us. Sounds like a jack hammer! People can’t put the little one down for a nap or for that matter themselves! It’s LOUD!!! Sucks. I’m in room 211

name: J P T
text: Be visited during December, Christmas week, so it was a little chilly but beautiful! We had an amazing condo, not very many people there but everyone we encountered was super nice. The Establishment is very clean and could not have had a better location

name: Paige
text: Also ànother gorgeous place. Quiet and exactly the type of R n R I was looking for. Will be back

name: Tony Fuentes
text: Great location right on the beach. The door to our room had a keypad so we didn't have to worry about losing the keys which was nice. The condo was spacious but hardly any of the door locks worked. Wifi is fast. Parking as a little tough on Memorial Day weekend. The security lady was super helpful and nice.

name: Tammy Feist
text: This is a wonderful place to stay. Easy access to the beach. Closest places to eat. Kaiser by Wyndham vacations keeps the public areas very clean.

name: TREALTY, LLC
text: Condo 611, beyond outdated 🙅🏾‍♀️🤦🏽‍♀️ BUT has an amazing view and easy access to the beach.

name: Kasey
text:
Active BED BUGS!  We had a horrible experience.
Kaiser Realty handles this property. We expected ALOT more from Management. One of our guest was bitten just while sitting on the sleeper sofa. We were very disappointed and spent another day trying to get it corrected.  This took away from our vacation and we didn’t ever really get over the bed bugs and felt they were everywhere at that point.

name: BenjiDa Ninji
text: Management was informed prior to us checking in that the washing machine was broken. We called 4 times to have it fixed & got the run around. They did not offer us a refund or anything after we had to take 5 peoples dirty clothes to the nearest laundromat & it cost $7.00 a load to wash them. We stayed 5 nights & 6 days so it was very inconvenient toting dirty clothes back & forth when we paid for a condo with a washing machine. We will not stay here again!

name: Ms bombshell
text: I'm not of fan of their racist security guard. As soon as we arrived, me and my family was interrogated by their little security guard. There were two families waiting for the elevator, a white family and a black family (my family). The white family gets on the elevator with no problem. She did not question them or anything. She was REALLY rude about what room we were in. How many cars we had etc. as if she was trying to find some reason for us not to be here. AND on top of that she damn near  knocked me over with no excuse me or sorry. But we had all of our ducks in a row of course and she made herself look stupid (I love when that happens). However I will not be returning here because of this.

name: Uriah Rogers
text: No complaints here. Just didn't get to stay long enough. All could ask for. Great rooms. Full kitchen. Nice TV. Fast wifi.

name: Frank D.
text:
Big condo, 3 BR, 2 ba, rm 802.
2 parking passes, needed 1 more.
Interior Clean but dated ...... late 90,s.
Patio floor dirty with rusty beach chairs on one side.  New patio furniture other side.
Indoor pool and out door pool.
Good condo, Recommend but will also shop around, depending on prices

The responce to use simply walking into the info desk room :WHAT YOU NEED WHATS YOUR PROBLEM really that was the welcome. So besides that traveling my dad a heart attack survivor and my mom and aunt on the 7th floor and the elevator was broken REALLY! I will mark this place off my stay at palms ...ever list.....
My daughter: I did not enjoy staying at the Palms. Like my mom said, the employees were rude. I had to sleep on a very uncomfortable sofa bed. There were small holes in the walls and celing. I did not like the water pressure because it was too violent. The decor was not very pretty. I was very angry when the elevator broke because we had to walk up and down seven flights of stairs. I do not recommend staying at the Palms.

text: Company asks for money for an application before they’ll agree to show their property. I was super stoked to rent from them and move to Guntersville but I’m not going to waste my time if I can’t even see the house I’m wasting $40 to apply for. If I’m denied I can’t even get my money back! Great business practices ! I’m already going to have to drive 45 mins to see the house from Huntsville. I wanted their house and would do anything to get it but I’m good now.

name: Prim Sheek
text: I have been renting a property through Cummings Real Estate for only a month now and thus far I am extremely disappointed in the lack of professionalism and communication. I was told that after I turned in my inspection check list that maintenance would be out to address my concerns...three weeks later no one has came out. I then called and was told that maintenance has been backed up, that’s a pretty excessive amount of time to be backed up. Trusting a real estate company to fulfill obligations as a landlord is a very difficult thing to do. The lack of urgency and slow response time is alarming after committing to a 12 month lease. Hopefully there are some improvements and changes made very soon. As of now, if I could rent from another agency I would.

She want her money just like any other business and thats more than fair there is nothing free anywhere u go....if there is something broken she makes it her business to get it fixed i really appreciate michelle so much...

resp.text: We really love Ms. Daymon.  She has been a fabulous long-term tenant.  She has even relocated some of her family members from FL to be near her.  She has a real heart for her family and others.  She is a joy to have as a tenant.

name: Kathy Tisdale
text: I live at Cummings property now I don't have any issues at all they helped me wen no one else would I been here almost 8 months she and her office staff are friendly people trying to help people wen times are down I will continue to live here but if I move I want it to be another property thanks for the help and believing in me

resp.text: Kathy, thanks for your review. We are glad to have you as a tenant.  We hope we can continue our landlord/tenant relationship into the future.

name: Ms.Yetta Brooks
text: Infested with roache&bedbugs,an then the owner Michelle Cummings talk to you like a child like if you don't know the law she didn't give me my security deposit back saying I broke my lease but gave me verbal agreement that I could move out long as i didn't want my security deposit back but let the girl stay an charged her another security deposit an said she a give me a good reference an didn't an then said I owe her 340$ for June rent saying she could of put me in collections just like she said she could take me to court for breaking my lease but let my roommate sign a new lease moral of the story Michelle Cummings is money hungry an full of the stuff that come out her butt I wouldn't recommend anyone to live here not a good place but if u like roaches,bedbugs,an a person talking to u like your less than what u are then move there!!!!!!!I could go on an on but y'all get the picture.....I don't see how they even been in business for nearly 10 years description on website is all lies I tell you.....

resp.text: Ms. Brooks, I am sorry that you got into the situation you did when you left.  I know you must have been under great stress.  I know that you are angry and don't mean most of what is written.  Your friend that moved in behind you is still living in the apartment to this day.  We would be glad to talk with you and see how we could make you feel better about the situation.

name: Vickie Love
text: My  landlord is  SLUMLORD

text: Great place to live
