name: Hanna Sanchez Smith
text: The folks at Shamrock are fantastic - super responsive and very knowledgeable of the local market. We worked with David to purchase our home two years ago when we first moved to the area. If we ever move back, we'll definitely contact Shamrock again for our next home. Many thanks to the entire team for all your help!

name: Ulrich Braun
text:
A friend of mine mentioned Shamrock Properties as the #1 go-to property management company in this area. So I contacted David and worked with him to find an investment property. I got a fantastic deal on a new construction thanks to David. Now Shamrock Properties will be managing the house for us.
It's really a pleasure to work with David and his team. I highly recommend Shamrock Properties to anyone who looks for a house to own, to rent or to manage.

resp.text: Thanks man!  Building wealth takes a little time, seed money and patience and a Knowledgeable Advisor.  Our goal is to make lifetime clients not just one time buyers.   Happy to be there to help in the process and thanks for your trust.

name: Brandy Stephens
text: Shamrock manages my rental property and they are fantastic. I never have to worry about anything because they take care of it. They also vet tenants so I never have problem renters.

name: Vaughn Curtis
text: When we needed peace of mind Shamrock was there. When we needed shelter Shamrock was there to help. Moving from another state Shamrock helped us smooth with a smooth transition, it was special to us really life changing. Thank you for all you've done. Many blessings to you and your family team. Vaughn Curtis family.

name: G Lee Locklear
text: David has assisted me with the purchase of four properties and the sale if one so far. Any agent can draft an offer but finding one that is knowledgeable and works tirelessly in the interest if his or her clients is rare. Empasis on knowledgeable! I have found my realtor for life, and I recommend you give him the opportunity to work for you as hard as he has worked for me.

resp.text: Lee you summed up my belief on what Real Estate representation should be.  I've truly enjoyed helping you with your homes, land and your commercial needs and I'm here for the long haul with you.  Let's keep crushing it.

name: Nikki Miracle
text: We used Shamrock Properties for both property management and later for the sale of our home. Both teams were exceptional from start to finish. When we used them to manage our home they  provided wonderful communication and provided financial documents well ahead of time. They anticipated all of our needs and had the home rented out in hours each time. When we switched to sales, our experience was just as great. Everything was professional, polished, and stress free. We had a full price offer within two days, and all the advice we were given by the team proved worthwhile. This was the most stress free real estate experience we’ve ever had! We would choose Shamrock again if we had to.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review. We’re here when you get ready to buy that beach house!

name: Jeremy Bass
text: The team at Shamrock Real Estate Group is fantastic. They know what they are doing, they know the market and have great relationships with all the key players to help you find a house, be first in line when there are multiple offers, and get your contract to closing in record time. If your deal needs additional negotiation, they get it done quickly while keeping all parties satisfied.

resp.text: Thank you for the generous review, Jeremy! Glad to have clients like you!

name: Ryan King
text: 5 stars when we worked with Shamrock almost 3 years ago purchasing our Daphne house - and fast forward to 2020, 5 stars working with them again to sell our Daphne house! David and team are top notch when it comes to real estate - everyone worked super hard to help us get our house sold at the right price, and within a compressed time frame! Best real estate company on the Gulf Coast! They are practically family to us now! Thanks David and Team!

resp.text: It was a pleasure working with you, Ryan!

name: Nicole Langi
text:
We rented from Shamrock properties for almost three years and had a wonderful experience. Shamrock was easy to work with and all of the staff were friendly and helpful. All maintenance and plumbing issues with our home were quickly resolved.

When we decided to buy a home we went with their real estate services and David Kahalley was an excellent realtor. He is very knowledgeable and very patient and sincerely helpful. He helped us find the perfect home for our family. We highly recommend Shamrock Properties.

resp.text: Thank you, Nicole! So happy we were able to help you with renting & buying!

name: John Classic
text: I have used Shamrock Properties to rent out my house on and off for over 8 years and they have done a fanatic job every time. Whenever maintenance issues come up, they take care of it promptly. The entire team is wonderful and I will use them as long as I need a property management company!

resp.text: Thanks for the review!  It's been our distinct pleasure to help you with your property management.

name: kelly luquette
text: David and Avieen are phenomenal at what they do. Shamrock executed an all around seamless team effort with my property in both rental and home sell. Avieen manged the rental side and David the sell of the home when the transition time came. Outstanding, professional, timely, and honest communication from start to finish. resp.text: Thank you, Kelly! It was a pleasure working with you!! Thank you for trusting us with your real estate needs!

name: Danny Kahalley
text: As a Texas resident, Shamrock does an outstanding job managing my property in Gulf Shores, AL.  This company seamlessly blends professional service with personal attention.  You get access to knowledgeable and experienced real estate professionals, while also getting honest feedback and helpful consultation throughout the process.  You will feel like a valued collaborator working with Shamrock, which can be difficult dynamic to find in other property management services.  DISCLOSURE: While I'm related to the owner, I do believe their real estate services are the best in the Mobile/Eastern Shore area; I wouldn't post this review if I felt differently.

resp.text: Thanks for the excellent review Danny.  I'll make sure and get you something nice for Christmas.

text: Don’t waste your time or money with this “management” company I rented a house in loxley and from the beginning had problems had to clean up the previous tenants mess and even home owners stuff that was left along with a rat infestation, yard full of nails and trash, electrical panel outside throwing sparks, tv’s burning up due to power surges, constant plumbing problems etc. Stay away from 15830 County Road 54 loxley al 36551

They experts at what they do.  Shamrock is an appropriate name, because you'd be lucky to work with one of them.

name: Ashley Moon

text:

text: The New Stone staff is very knowledgeable of the Tallassee and surrounding areas.  They are always very helpful and quick to respond.  I would highly recommend them if you are looking for a home, selling your home or need assistance with property management.

name: Constance Ruff
text: They are all really friendly. They have always sent someone out to do repairs in a timely manner. I would definitely recommend them as far as renting from them. The only negative thing I really have to say is that THEY ARE RARELY AT THE PLACE. I prefer to pay my monthly rent in person instead of dropping it off in the door. But it is hard to catch them there.

resp.text: Hi Constance,  thanks for your review. We are sorry that you didnt feel you could give us a 5 star review. We strive to be at the office each day, but both office staff members are active real estate agents so there may be times when we are out of office showing property,  performing inspections, and meeting clients at property. We do have a dropbox to drop rent and correspondence for that reason. We also usually forward the office phones to an agent if we are gone during business hours. Feel free to call us at 334 283 2900 with any questions.  Thanks, Kami

name: Shona Griffith
text: I can not express how much I love New Stone Realty. Very professional and such lovely people to work with. Thank you New Stone. My fav. 🙌

resp.text: We have enjoyed working with you. Thank you!

text: I was looking for a house. They are all very friendly and the applications are very easy to fill out. They also refund application fee if your not approved. Great realty company, I would recommend them to you.

They lie about the rent..bunch of hidden fees, the have constant break ins into cars and do nothing about it, they dont clean apartments thoroughly before move in. text: Apartments are very cheap, bug infested, they have a bad habbit of doing last minute repairs to the complex like paving the whole thing and let everyone know the day before. name: Brandon Patton
text: I had a great experience living at Ridge Crossings. I would still be living at this property if I did not move out of state. resp.text:
Brandon, YOU ARE SO MISSED.  I hope everything is going well with you and your new HOME.  You know we will always have a place for you when and if you come back this way.
Thank you so much for the 5 STAR Review...stay safe and healthy!

name: Kelli Bimbo
text: I really have enjoyed my stay at Ridge Crossings. Thanks to the lovely staff that Ridge Crossings has. My favorite person there would be Angela’. From the moment I met her she’ very welcoming informative and helpful. She actually helped me get my first apartment. I love so much. I specially wanted no carpet in my apartment in the living area and kitchen and she went above and beyond finding me the exact unit I wanted. Anytime I need help or more knowledge on something I know that Angela will gladly help me. She’s so sweet and even though I’ll be leaving to relocate I want Angela to know she’s the very very best and had it not been for her I wouldn’t have enjoyed ridge crossings as much. So happy for my stay here !! And even more thankful for Angela! Vote Angela for president !!!!!

name: John McNaughton
text: My experience has been very good moving into and living at Ridge Crossings. Sadena was so easy to work with. I've run into her at the mailboxes and it felt like running into a friend. I've only had one experience with maintenance (an upgrade I requested) but it was a seamless experience. I've been enjoying my unit and it is starting to feel very much like home.

resp.text: John,  Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a 5-Star Review.  Sadena and our TEAM always want you to feel as though you are HOME and among friends.  Keep those compliments coming...you made our week!

name: Kiara Smith
text: Living at Ridge crossings has been pretty great so far. Working with Sadena Rice, the leasing agent, has probably been the best part. Sadena is still helpful and accommodating even 7 months post move in. The Maintenance guys are pretty quick to fix issues also.

resp.text: Kiara, thank you so much for your review and your kind referral of Sadena and our maintenance department.  It is our job to provide you with a great living experience and it seems we are off to a great start.  We are so glad you make Ridge Crossings HOME!!

name: Wynell Gilbert
text: Sadena Rice has been absolutely amazing and has made our stay here great.  She checks in from time to time and most importantly she is consistent with what she does.

resp.text: Wynell, Thank you so much for taking the time to give Sadena and the Ridge Crossings Team a 5-Star Review.  We agree that Sadena is very good at her job and that is to make sure you have the best living experience.  We are thrilled you call Ridge Crossings HOME!

name: Kate Wheeler
text: I can't say anything bad about my experience! When I moved in they addressed a couple of minor things that could be fixed within 24 hours. They reserved me a parking spot to make my move in easier. The leasing agents were incredibly helpful and made the signing process run smoothly which was important to me considering I was moving from another state. Every staff member I've been in contact with (including the maintenance staff) have been so kind and welcoming! It really makes me feel like this is a home and not just another apartment to rent. The staff really seems to care about me as a resident which makes leasing from them so worth it. I would highly recommend living here!

resp.text: Kate, thank you so much for the 5-star review! Welcome HOME!   We are thankful for our residents and we love that you shared your experience with everyone so they too can find their HOME with us at Ridge Crossings!

name: ARealYouByAry
text: I would like to personally leave a review on one of the office staff, Sadena Rice. She has always been very nice and friendly from the time that I moved into my apartment. Any issues that I have had she was sure to help me with in a timely manner. Sometimes it can be a hassle getting things corrected from a leasing office But with her I have never had that issue. I love her bright welcoming attitude and her promptness when it comes to handling things. She is literally awesome. Please ask for her if you are ever interested in moving onto the property.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your positive review and your review of Sadena.  We LOVE our team, our beautiful 76 acres, and our residents.  We are FAMILY!

name: Appachu Palecanda
text: Moved in here about 2 months ago. Have Had a pleasant experience so far and Sadena at the leasing office was wonderful to work with. Nice complex and really good location. Responsive Maintenance and the complex is well taken care off.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review Ridge Crossings. We think Sadena is wonderful also. We appreciate you choosing Ridge as your home. Please let us know if we can assist with anything in the future.

name: Stefan Carter
text: Great facilities and floorplans with extremely helpful and accommodating staff.

resp.text: Stefan,  Thank you so much for giving my team the opportunity to correct a situation and turn this experience into a positive one.  I am grateful that you cared enough to share.

name: B Richardson
text: My car, along with SEVERAL others, were broken into last night. I’ve lived here for over 4 years & this complex has gone down hill TREMENDOUSLY, the caliber of residents that’s  moving in is quite alarming. This isn’t the first time this has happened in this complex & as a single female I can say I no longer feel safe here. What exactly are the owners doing to combat this frequent issue?!! The only cameras on the entire property are at the entrance/exit & only captures the tag number. The rent/fees are way too high to not feel safe in your own home. I WOULD NOT recommend living here!

resp.text: Ms. Richardson, I am sorry your guest was a victim of a crime on the property.  As you know, we are cooperating with Hoover Police.  It has been the residents and your neighbors  that have provided the most assistance in this investigation and that would not agree with your account of the caliber of residents.  I hope you will continue to work with our office regarding your concerns.

name: Ashley McCord
text: Sedena Rice is my contact at Ridge Crossings and she is the most helpful person! She is kind, prompt, solution focused, and helps with anything I need. She gets 5 gold stars! My experience as a resident of Ridge Crossings has been great!

resp.text: Thank you giving Ridge and Sadena a five star review. Our residents are so important to us. If we can help you in the future please let us know.

name: Elicia Gilyard
text: Sadena Rice was such a pleasure with helping me move back to Birmingham. In the middle of Covid she made sure my move was seamless even coming in on her day off to make sure everything was ready for me! Even picking a great unit for me that wasn’t on the list yet! I love how speed anything I need is handled!

resp.text: Elicia, thank you so much for your Five Star review of Sadena and Ridge Crossings.  We are so glad you have made your HOME here.  It is our goal to continue to offer you an incredible living experience.

name: Lexis Hadley
text: Great Apartments. My husband & I have been here since last year & already in our 2nd apartment. We love it here, nice and quiet. If you decide to move ask for Sadena Rice. She helped us so much! Love her customer service !!

resp.text: Thank you to the Hadley's for taking the time to give Ridge Crossings and Sadena a 5 Star Rating.  Residents like you make our daily work worthwhile...we are here to make your living experience a great one!

name: Sheridan Sharp
text:
When I first moved in to Ridge Crossings it was great. No issues or problems at all. I’ll start with saying Sadena Rice helped us get mine and my significant others first apartment and she was very honest, helpful and a great woman in general. She has always been patient, kind and honest whenever talking to her and has an amazing personality during the entire process. If I could request anyone it would be her.
I am moving out in 2 days of this apartment and I couldn’t happier. First off, the mold is bad here. There was mold in every single vent in my apartment and I’m highly allergic ... I was sick for a while thinking I had covid, finally going to the doctor and it wasn’t covid it was mold after doing my search and knowing I’m highly allergic. I called for 4 days straight about the mold, and finally maintenance showed up the 4th day. All he did was scrap some mold and rust off, spray paint over it and give me new air vents. Mold also is all around the bathtubs, I noticed it when I moved in but it’s just has got worse, no matter how much scrubbing I do, nothing helps. The gas water tank has horrible issues, firstly gas leaked out of my tank and my dog had to go to the emergency vet... and had spots on her lungs from breathing it in for so long and thank god my boyfriend got there in time because I was at work and he took her to the vet. They replaced it and it goes out all the time and we have cold water for days until my boyfriend can finally get the pilot light to stay lit long enough. There is bugs in my apartment ... i keep my apartment immaculate and still bugs so their pest control is a joke. There was dog poop in several washing machines stuck and it smelt horrible... (I lived in a one bedroom and didn’t have a washer and dryer connection). My car was broken into as well as so many others months ago, nothing was done about it. There’s only one camera and it’s going in and out of the complex. My apartment smelt like Marijuana for months straight and I can promise you I don’t smoke that... there is so many people who SPEED through this complex and have their music BLARING at all hours of the night. Also, my neighbors fought for hours and hours atleast twice a week... it’s just very noisy.
the pool and the gym are very nice, the staff I think really does try to help, maintenance I think is busy a lot because there is several things that many people have wrong and i am not sure who’s fault it is for all of the craziness but this is not to bash the place because I loved it when I moved in here and it was great.
it’s just gone down hill since I moved in year ago.

resp.text: Sheridan,  Thank you for sharing your experience.  I am sorry we started out so strong and ended up letting you down.  I know we did not have the same findings as you stated above, but I hope you found your perfect place and all is well with you and your dog.

name: Hudson Jetton
text: All leasing agents are very knowledge, informative, and helpful. Both mangers, Lynn Mauldin and Marsha Robinson, are extremely dedicated in helping make the residence feel at home during there stay at Ridge Crossings. Management does a wonderful job in making sure the community is quiet and safe for its residents. Highly recommended that you check out this apartment complex. Visit Ridge Crossings and see for yourself. It's a wonderful place to live in the city of Hoover.

resp.text: Hudson, thank you so much for your 5-Star Review.  We love that you could live anywhere in Hoover and you chose Ridge Crossings.  We will work hard everyday to make sure you know we appreciate your choice.

name: Chari Dickson
text: Ridge Crossings Apartments is a very lovely place to live. Sadena Rice was my leasing agent and she was very professional, courteous, and thorough throughout the process. I have a beautiful and spacious townhome to call home.

resp.text: We really appreciate your positive review. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. Please reach out if we can be of assistance.

name: Chad Robertson
text: Thanks Danielle for helping my family find the perfect apartment!

resp.text: Thank you Chad for you 5 STAR review of Ridge Crossings and Danielle.  We are so glad you have found your HOME and the perfect team to assist you when needed.

name: Izz Noland
text:
I have lived at Ridge Crossings for just over 5 years. This place is home to me. I'll be moving soon, I'm getting married! The staff are amazing! The office staff, maintenance, everyone is so kind and caring. I feel like they've made my stay here to be a home, not just another apartment complex.
I've really never had an issues. Any maintenance requests are taken care of within 2 days max, the pools and grounds are kept nice, and although I've never seen patrol, I do know of a few Hoover police officers that live here. I've not once had an issue with theft or damage. If you're looking for somewhere to call home, call Ridge Crossings. It's a great location in Hoover to get just about anywhere in Birmingham. I'll miss this place, and I'll miss the comfort the staff goes out of their way to provide!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to review Ridge Crossings. We are so grateful that you chose to make Ridge your home over the past 5 years. Congratulations on your marriage! Please let us know if we can ever be of assistance in the future.

name: Ashley Clark
text: 💜💜💜I love my place! Just the right size, location and layout! I LOVE my breezy cool and quiet spot. I love how diverse & super friendly my neighbors are, and how we all look out for one another. I am an outdoors person and never get tired of the lush green foliage and landscaping, as well as our walking trail (especially in the spring with all of the beautiful flowers, streams & nature). Plenty of cool spots to tie a hammock and lounge or roll out a blanket and relax!!!!  In late summer hummingbirds are prevalent in the neighborhood and I've enjoyed watching and feeding them (they are pretty comfortable with people and pets!). The staff at Ridge Crossings is always available to help and readily resolve any requests I've ever submitted. Never an issue finding a parking space & any unauthorized vehicles, and/or activities are promptly handled. Convenient to major highways 459, 65, 31, 150. There is a UAB satellite location and other 5 star health and wellness facilities right in the neighborhood; all of my favorite shopping (Marshall's, Target, Ross, TJ Maxx, World Market, Home Depot, Hobby Lobby, Galleria etc.) Grocers (ALDI, Walmart, Sprouts, Farmers Markets, Publix) & eateries (Chick-fil-a, Freddie's, Chipotle, Starbucks, Melt, Edgar's, Big Whiskey....too may more to name) are just a ride  down the hill or walking distance, and they're just getting started with building all kinds of cool new hotspots to try! Seriously, whats not to love????? ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

resp.text: Ashley, you painted a pictures for All.  I will never be able to THANK YOU enough.  We are very fortunate to have all you mentioned and residents that value it as much as we do.  If you are not in marketing...YOU SHOULD BE!

name: Tommy Watkins
text:
My family and I have been living in this community for nearly 3 years.  It began as a quiet community with speedy maintenance and great customer service from management.  However, lately we are very disappointed with the experience that we have here at Ridge Crossings.  Roaches, Roaches.... have been a problem from day one.  We have called for pest control on numerous occasions and one guy said that apartment needs bombing due to infestation and after that his company never showed back up.  It is a year later and still the same issues.  Last week , Knox Pest came out and sprayed and set down traps and I see more roaches than ever.  They are not even going anywhere near the trap.  Can the roaches pay their portion of the RENT Please!.

Warning:  Monitor your account ledger quarterly.   We received a late notice and this sparked us to pull our ledger because we always pay them on time.  We have had a credit balance since we moved in year one.  However, they never apply your credit to your account automatically.  Upon a certified mailing request to them, I requested an account ledger reflecting a credit balance.  After pulling my account ledger, I notice that they post payments late to our account with a late fee; then a couple of days later, they credit the late fee.  Accounting System is a mess!.  Rent is due on 1st and I pay on the last day of the month each month.   Watch your money and when you ask questions, they can't explain them; they need to get back to you within a couple of days.

The service and the outdated apartments are not worth the money!  Stay Tuned!!! 6/26/2020 Please, Please bypass 2300 Building this will leave you scratching your heads. My lease is near expiration and I can't be any happier. Please take this warning!!!

resp.text:
Mr. Watkins, I am sorry to know we have let you down. You and your wife have always been a pleasure. I agree that sometimes late fees bill up, but they are always credited with a notation, "not late". I know you and family pay early and have never been late and your ledger does back that up. As far as the bugs and any other maintenance issues, I believe we have addressed them all, but I would love to meet with you both and make sure we are back on track in your eyes. Please reach out to me at your convenience so I may work with you both to make your Ridge Crossings experience a positive one again.
Happy New Year, Marsha-Community Manager

name: Bryce Besherse
text: BEWARE, AVOID THIS PLACE!!! My partner and I just escaped this place after a long and terrible year living here. Unfortunately moving here from another state we quickly signed a lease here without much consideration and it is the WORST place either of us have ever lived. The $800 rent comes about to nearly $1200 once all of the monthly fees are added on, most of the charges you pay for you dont use and you can't opt out of. We constantly encountered cockroaches, spiders, ants and even SCORPIONS inside of our apartment!! They do no pest control unless it's by request and then they charge you directly every time they come out. The apartment was not move in ready when we got there causing maintenance to be in our apartment weeks after moving in. There was black mold in the trim of the bathtub which was recaulked over, constant water heater problems, all water usage is split by the entire building so minimalists like us constantly overplayed for what we weren't using, there was a massive gap in the weather stripping under the front door; one maintenance broke a marble stone statue I had just recieved as a birthday gift by knocking it off the counter and then took beer out of our refrigerator on the way out. We constantly smelled tobacco and smoke in and around our building and management accused us directly of smoking cannabis on multiple occasions solely because we moved from a cannabis legal state, though it seems we were the only ones in the building not smoking. Our upstairs neighbors dog bothered us for months during which we complained countless times as we could hear it all day and night through the paper thin floor (walls are paper thin too). After months we find out our neighbors aren't supposed to have the dog and are finally removed after we had lost our peace of mind. They shamefully still charged us for a FULL YEAR worth of amenities including pool, rec room, etc. for which they only had open for 4 months that we lived here! I understand covid regulations but we paid for everything and were not reimbursed for any of it! Our license plate was stolen off of our vehicle in the middle of night while parked in the complex in our designated spot, police later called us and stated it was used on a different vehicle in a crime. Managment was extremely rude (especially Angela) and terrible with customer service; it was an awful experience to have wasted a year of my life here. These people are con artists and they are drastically overcharging for incomplete, dirty, bug infested apartments with a high crime rate, incompetent management and no sense of peace or security. The most horrendous living experience of our lives hands down. Believe every bad thing you read and hear about this place it has bad reviews for a reason!

resp.text: Bryce, I cannot apologize enough.  I am sorry I let you and your partner down.  It is the goal of our company and team to offer you a great living experience.  I am sorry and I hope you have found your perfect HOME and are happy.  Thank you for caring enough to share so we can improve going forward.

name: Candy Guimont-Martin
text: My son's new apartment; it was NOT like the model home they showed us... it was VERY dated and we had to get pest professional on our own, carpet was still wet we guess from cleaning it, but it smelled like wet carpet awful... the breezeways are dirty and trash in halls... cost definitely does NOT match the apartment

resp.text:
Ms. Leontine,
Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about these issues. We are so sorry that we have not put our best foot forward and want to do all we can to improve his experience. I would love to speak to your son directly regarding his concerns. Please have him reach out to me at marsha.robinson@steadfastliving.com.

Thank you,

Marsha Robinson
Community Manager

name: King Charles Boyd
text: Ridge Crossing is the best place to  live in Hoover if you're looking for an apartment. Staff is always helpful. Ask for Lynn and she will make you feel like you're already home.

resp.text: Mr. Boyd, Thank you so much for your five-star review of our property and our team member Lynn.  Please reach out to Lynn or any member of our team if you need anything.  Thank you again for making Ridge Crossings your HOME!

name: Simone
text: Nice apartment but I’ve only been here 3 months & have had to call maintenance too many times about the same thing. Every time I call the office no one answers which is stressful, especially when they aren’t open by the time you get off work. One of the staff members working in the office was very rude and it definitely wasn’t appreciated nor required.

resp.text:
Simone,  I am sorry to hear you are having the same maintenance issues and that your encounter with someone on my team was rude. I would love to discuss this further with you so I can get this turned around sooner than later. Please reach out to me at Marsha,Robinson@steadfastliving.com so we can set a time to talk. Again, thank you for your feedback and I look forward to speaking with you soon.
-Marsha, Community Manager

name: Dakota S
text: The leasing agent I met was professional and informative. No complaints there. I was disappointed with the company itself as the prices negotiated with the agent did not match those listed online, by about $50-100, and the agent mentioned a large number of non-negotiable fees totaling $160, also not mentioned on the website. I find the lack of transparency unappealing, as it signals a lack of respect for prospective tenants that I am sure current tenants experience. it’s a shame because the apartments and community are attractive and in a fine location.

resp.text:
Dakota, I am thrilled with your feedback on our agent and our attractive property and location.  I am very sorry to hear you feel as though we were not transparent in our rental amounts and fees.  I have reviewed your information including your "welcome letter" that verified everything except your utility bill.  I am happy to meet with you further to go over your concerns.
-Marsha, Community Manager

name: presley willoughby
text:
Move here if you want to pay a billion dollars in fees and bills!!!
I read the bad reviews of this place and thought id just look at it anyways. They show you a beautiful apartment and have a gorgeous pool and fitness area. but what you don't see, is the apartment you're going to rent. First off: they moved us into a DIFFERENT apartment than we signed a lease for. on a Sunday. with no one there to fix it. so when I signed up for a beautiful sun room, I got this weird screened room on concrete with exterior siding on the walls. terrible, its never used.
Second: I asked if windows could be put in because were are college girls living here and it was unsafe living on the underground floor with out windows at ground level. I was told sure at my own expense and no remorse of the misplacement of my apartment. It wasn't until I contacted corporate that I got blinds placed for privacy and safety.
Third: I've been charged multiple times for random things that I've had to email and get fixed, they did fix these, but its sad I had to watch my bills like a hawk to not get charged.
Living in the terrace level we have TONS of bugs. I call pest control at least once a week for roaches, centipedes, and bugs I've never heard of. I come home to roaches that are dead in my floor daily. which is very embarrassing.
Lastly: I wasn't informed when we moved in that water is split between the entire apartment complex ?? I was told is was just like Tapestry ( their sister property I moved from) (highly recommend they actually know what they're doing there) But WRONG they split this and apparently its not just this apartment but the entire Birmingham City because my water bill for a 2 bedroom apartment that we're in maybe 3 nights a week max is $150+ as I've complained multiple times they just say "yeah Birmingham water works its bad you know" ???????? REALLY?? ive lived in Bham for 2+ years in a 3BR and my water bill never reached over $80 living there 5 nights a week.
I have been highly dissatisfied with living here.
However, the corporate lady was nice.

On the upside, the big pool is nice, but is closes at 8 so don't get too excited.

resp.text: Presley, I am so sorry to hear we did not turn things around. We want to ensure all of our residents are happy in their homes and we are sorry we have fallen short on this for you.  We would love the chance to speak with you directly in regard to your concerns, please contact us at 205.733.9711 or RidgeCrossings@SteadfastLiving.com so we may set a time to meet. Again, thank you for your feedback and we look forward to improving your experience.

name: B Ri
text: I use to love living here now I hate it. Their pest control is the biggest joke ever!!! I’ve been having a huge roach infestation for months it’s getting ridiculous. I can’t even sleep at night because I’m so stressed on trying to get rid of them. I’ve told them multiple times I’m having roach issues and they send a joke of a pest control who doesn’t do really anything.

resp.text: B, I am terribly sorry you continue to have a pest problem.  Please contact me today, so I may get us on the phone with the pest control manager. We have never had a pest problem we could not correct.  I hope to hear from you soon, Marsha.

name: Pradeep Kesapragada
text:
If someone asked me how would I rate this a month ago, I would have probably said 5-star. But I think I’ve soon realized that they don’t really care once you move-in. I would love to go into the specifics of my problem, but I don’t want to waste my time doing that.
A sincere suggestion to the Management - Value your existing residents and their problems as much as you would for somebody who is planning to move-in.

resp.text: Pradeep, Thank you for your feedback.  I am so sorry your experience has not been positive and I want to ensure this changes.  I understand you were working with some of my team members regarding some concerns with your apartment.  I am sorry these have not been resolved to your standard but we will work to get them resolved immediately.  I will also be calling you shortly to get some additional feedback from you so we can get things back on track. Again, thank you for your review and I will speak with you soon.  Thank you, Marsha Community Manager

name: Frederick DeLeon
text: My move in was rocky to say the least. The only thing that made me feel welcome and made me feel like I was moving into a family run home is this very nice gentleman named Douglas.  He is wonderful and various ways. He treated me like one of his own and he gets things done immediately. If you have any request they will be done within 48 hours no matter what. Thank you so much too ridge crossings of hoover and thank you so much to Douglas because you have made my stay a 100 times over!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to review Ridge Crossings. We are happy to hear Douglas provided excellent customer service. Please reach out to our office directly (205-733-9711) if you need anything at all. Again, thank you for the review and choosing Ridge Crossings for you new home.

name: Whitney Brooks
text: Sadena Rice was absolutely helpful during my search for an apartment. Relocating from Auburn to Birmingham wasn't the easiest but she made sure that the process was hassle free and not stressful at all. I recommend anyone looking for a place to live that's affordable, has a friendly staff, in a quiet environment and feels like home to contact Ridge Crossings and ask for Sadena! She won't let you down. The girl is AMAZING!

resp.text: Whitney YOU are AMAZING for taking time to remind us what an incredible lady we have on our team.  We value our residents and I am so glad it shows in Sadena.  I hope everyone looking for an apartment in the Hoover area will reach out to Sadena so she may make moving less stressful and hassle free!

name: Stephen Madrid
text: Best leasing experience I’ve ever had.  Made my moving process flow seamlessly. Great location, great amenities and great staff in the office.  Ask for Lynn Mauldin, she went above and beyond to get my family taken care of and settled into our new apartment!

resp.text: Stephen,  Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a 5-star review.  We agree with you, Lynn is an asset to our company and to our residents.  I am so glad you found your new home with Ridge Crossings!

name: Tracey Hollie
text: I love living at Ridge Crossing apartment homes. I have lived here for almost 6 years and can’t imagine living anywhere else. The staff is amazing! My maintenance request are fulfilled timely and the management team is always willing to help.

resp.text: Tracey, thank you so much for continuing to make Ridge Crossings your home.  We are honored to have you say such nice things and we will do our best to continue to make you proud!

name: Ashley L. Spinks
text: I visited Ridge Crossings on Saturday & met with Douglas. He was absolutely great to work with & very friendly. He portrayed great energy & willingness to assist in finding the perfect future home.  They were very busy & he still took his time to assist us with our questions & showed us the community.  The townhome is absolutely amazing & spacious.  I decided to stay where I am for financial reasons, but highly recommend this community. Kudos to the team & community! It’s very nice & the amenities are more than one could ask for! Thank you again for such great customer service!

resp.text: Ashley, we are thrilled that you came out to tour our community and took the time to review us.  Douglas has not even been with us a week and to hear you enjoyed his customer service and the tour of the community assures us we made a good hire.  We are sorry you won't be making Ridge Crossings your home for now, but maybe in the future.  Thank you again and best to you always!

name: MSS Tutor Admin and Resources
text: This apartment has been a horrible experience. If you want constant water breaks, maintenance problems that are never repaired, crazy neighbors, inattentive management,  and continuous bug problems, this is the place for you! They will also charge you for unnecessary things. The smell of smoke in all of the apartments is overwhelming, and you may or may not get the apartment you actually tour. Plus, most of the apartments look nothing like the "sample" apartment they advertise on their website, so just be aware of what you are getting into. It looks like a good buy initially...but trust me. You do not want this place. Pay a little bit more and live somewhere that you will not be miserable. Water bills are crazy high because of all of the water line breaks, so don't believe the price they tell you initially at move in. And because of the constant water line breaks...the water is never turned on. Management makes or breaks a complex, and with an older complex such as this, it is necessary to have attentive managers. That simply isn't the case with this complex. Don't let the good reviews fool you-you do not want to get yourself into this!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to review Ridge Crossings. We are sorry to hear about your issues. We are here to help and would love the opportunity to address these concerns. Please contact our office at your earliest convenience 205-733-9711. Again, thank you for your input as it helps us improve the experience of our residents.

name: Nelson Allen
text: Renting an apartment can be a real pain, but our leasing agent, Sadena Rice,  made it a breeze.  She had an answer for every question we asked!  She went above and beyond to help us out!  She always has a smile on her face, and a positive attitude!

resp.text: Nelson, we could not agree more...Sadena does take the headache out of moving and she always greets you with a SMILE!

name: Artist Noel
text: I  have been residing at this complex for the past two months and I love it. Ms. Sadena Rice was professional, engaging, and answered all questions that I asked. I will recommend this complex to my family or friends that are looking for affordable housing. Thank you Ms. Sadena!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience at Ridge Crossings!  We too share your appreciation for Sadena and know she will continue to make Ridge Crossing a great place to live. Thank you for referring your family and friends!

name: steve jones
text:
I have lived at Ridge Crossing for 6 years and my family and I cannot imagine living at another apartment home. It all begins with the Property Manager Marsha. Not only is she friendly and professional she has an award winning staff that is the same. The Assistant Manager Lynn and the office staff makes you feel like family every time you walk in the door. I must say as well, the Maintenance Team is spot on it with any problem that may arise and they too are friendly, courteous and professional.
My family and I are sooo proud to call Ridge Crossing our home!! With that being said, I just renewed our lease!!! 👍👍👍

resp.text: Steve, YOU MADE OUR DAY!  Our team is so thankful for your 5-star rating.  You and your family have always been a delight!  We love that you call Ridge Crossings your home and we take that very seriously.  Your home is personal and we like to make sure you are getting the personal touch.  Thank you for your continued loyalty to your Ridge Crossings Family!

name: Bryanbadcompany The King
text: Douglas and Blake were both awesome! Very helpful in getting me set up with my first apartment. Went on a tour with Douglas and he had me laughing the whole time. Looking forward to my stay here!

resp.text: Hello Bryan, Thank you for your feedback. Douglas and Blake are a great duo.  I am glad they were there for you and they will continue to be there for you.  Welcome to Ridge Crossings and please do not hesitate in letting us know if you need anything.

name: Kesha Carter
text: I have been waiting for my refund from the administration fee after being denied because apparently you can't be late on rent more than twice. We were late three times in a two year timeframe. Alicia Petties has stopped communicating with me regarding when my payment will be returned. I hope her boss sees this and returns my email request as well as phone calls.

resp.text:
Kesha, I am aware of this struggle and will call you today.  We are working very hard with accounting to get this out to you immediately.  Talk to you soon.
-Marsha, Community Manager

name: Kevin Clark
text: Lynn and Marsha were so helpful in my moving experience. All of my needs were met in a timely fashion.

resp.text: Kevin,  Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know that your moving experience was a 5-Star experience.  Welcome Back to The RC!

name: kyle brohl
text: I've lived at Ridge Crossings for the past 5 years. In those years they have updated my apartment and have always been awesome to me. The staff is great, specially Marsha (Manager). Anytime I have any problems, she is willing to take time out of her busy day to help me. I would recommend this apartment complex to anyone looking for a place in Hoover.

name: Haley Lee
text: I would rate 0 if there is option! DO NOT LIVE  HERE; After you move out they bill a huge number of money for nonsense; first they intentionally send you a paper says if you are planning to renew contact them; which means if not do not contact them; then before your due date they are like: you forgot to tell us you are moving out; so they charge you almost 3000$ for this; the worst thing is on the contract it says one months rent fee; So they just want to charge you any amount of money they want; Horrible!!!! I am a decent person and I can’t believe they try to blackmail on me, I paid everyone they billed while living there even a lot of the bill does not make sense!

resp.text:
Haley, I do not show you as a former resident.  Were you possibly here under a different name?  I want to review this further for you and with you to assist.  Please contact me at the office at 205.733.9711. Again, thank you for your feedback and I hope to improve your experience with our community.

Thank you,
Marsha
Community Manager

name: Wendy Rodgers
text: Close to work. Not a lot of noise. Valet trash pick up and compactor for trash. Anything that needs to be fixed is taken care of right away. Nice pools. Nice area to work out in. Like the walking area around the apartments. Outside area is clean and the lawn people do an excellent job on the lawn.

resp.text: Please forgive my tardiness in thanking you for your review.  We appreciate you and are so thrilled you have made Ridge Crossings your home!

name: Kiara Harris
text:
I have not had a bad experience with Ridge Crossings at all. I think it is important to mention there is over 700 apartment homes in this community. Which can cause the team to get a little behind at times. There might be of total of 6 people in the office (not including the maintenance staff). That's quite a few people to keep happy with such a small office staff.

It's also important to keep in mind that this is an APARTMENT complex. You will never be 100% happy with anything, not even your own home.

I love this community. We are surrounded by woods which can bring about animals and roaches sometimes. However, they provide us with excellent trash service to prevent some of these issues. I CALL for trash pick up and they come right to my door (AMAZING).

I also use their online services. This generally is a stress free way to get maintenance request done and pay bills online.

I love this community. I also have three relatives who occupy homes in this community.

name: Miranda King
text: Our family has been here several years and we love living here!

resp.text: Miranda, thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to let us know Ridge Crossings makes you feel at home!  That is our desire and we take pride in our work.  Thank you again!

name: Tangela Diming
text: Nice friendly quiet place to live. The community is family oriented they always keep you up to date on anything and everything taking place in the community.

resp.text: Tangela,  thank you so much for your five star review of Ridge Crossings.  We are thankful for our residents and want to always make your home at Ridge Crossings a positive experience. Please let us know if there is anything you need.

name: Ashley Doufexis
text: Nice area. Close to everything! Love that the pool, racquetball, laundry center and gym are all clean and have new equipment. It's everything we needed! The staff is very professional, courteous and always quick to help!

name: Sean Raj
text: We stayed at Ridge Crossings for a year. The apartment itself was great, amenities we're great. Price was a little too costly but that's to be expected with luxury apartments. Only thing that got to us was after we left we were sent letters that we had some payments that had not been paid(which we did). To make matters worse we have been contacting the management for two months regarding our security deposit worth 1280 that has still not been returned and they have been ignoring us ever since. That's theft ladies and gents plain and simple.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to provide us your feedback. We want to make sure you are happy and would love the chance to speak with you directly about your move out statement. Please contact us at 205.733.9711 or RidgeCrossings@SteadfastLiving.com so we may discuss your concerns. We did speak to one of your roommates and emailed him a copy of the move out statement. Again, thank you for your feedback and we look forward to improving your experience.

name: Magan Hall
text:
I have lived at Ridge Crossings for almost a year now and we have had exceptional service from the office staff and maintenance. Although we rarely have problems, when we do they are Johnny on the Spot about making the repairs. We have been so happy with our time here that my fiance and I have decided to renew our lease and stay a little while longer! The complex is complete with two pools, a new dog park (the we love!!), a car wash, a 24 hour gym, a racquetball room, move theater, on site laundry facility which I use weekly, a mile long paved nature trail and plenty of doggie waste stations for cleaning up after your pups! We also just recently got trash valet and that has proven to be VERY convenient. All we have to do is toss our trash in the provided can and they come by each night and pick it up!
Now, there have been a few instances when we have seen water bugs in the breeze ways, but never in our home. This is kind of to be expected, though, considering the wooded areas around the apartment buildings. I will say that the rent plus water is a little pricey, but when it comes to your home, you get what you pay for.
Also keep in mind when reading reviews that Ridge has recently been sold and taken under new management. So far things have been great if not better than before!
Five stars, Ridge!

name: Cheryl Adams
text: Very nice apartments. Very clean. Very nice

resp.text:
Thank you for your positive review. We are so grateful that you shared this. Please let us know if we can assist with anything going forward.

The Ridge Crossings Team

name: Nathan Liberto
text: If I could give this place a negative star I would. The staff is friendly but nothing is explained to you. You get billed for things that are not correct. Personally was over billed for something by $900. The first 6 months was fine but I am so glad I moved and do not live there anymore. Read the fine print and also be careful to not get over charged. Check your bill before paying. NOT conducive for roommates either. They do not accept more than 1 check and if you do an ACH they charge $2.00. TERRIBLE upper management

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to review Ridge Crossings Apartments.  We are sorry to hear your experience was not positive. We would appreciate the opportunity to discuss the issues mentioned in your review. Please reach out to our office at 205-733-9711. Again, thank you for your feedback and we wish you all the best in your new home.

name: Mary Norwood
text:
The complex is nice and the grounds are well maintained, but don't let that fool you. I have been lucky enough to not have too many issues within my apartment, but the few times I have it has been next to impossible to get maintenance out to fix them. Most recently, my heater was not working. It was I believe during the cold snap right before Thanksgiving. I went by the office to report that my heat was not working at all when the high was in the 50s and low was in the 30s. It was written down and I was told someone would handle it the following day (this was on a Wednesday). My apartment was 60 or below. No one came the following day, so the day after I called and left a voicemail. That Sunday I was planning to have a group of friends over, and the heat had still not been addressed on Saturday. I called multiple times on Saturday expressing my concern that this and 2 minor issues had not been addressed. My sister was at my apartment when maintenance came by and was told that they would only address the heat since it was a Saturday and the heat was the only thing considered an emergency.

The office is only open until 5:30 during the week, except for 1 day when it is open until 6. On more than 1 occasion, the office has closed early when I have tried to make it by on the only day they are suppose to be open late. I had to take leave from work to leave early enough to be able to pick up a package that I had been waiting on.

I am about to end my lease this week and currently I am waiting on a call back regarding what I owe for my final 6 days. I was told that it should have been in my information given to me when I put in my notice. I was never given information when I put in my notice. I am so glad to be leaving this place!

name: Nettie Downey
text: Sadena is the absolute best! Go see her for any of your residential needs!!!

resp.text: Nettie, thank you so much for taking the time to recommend Ridge Crossings and Sadena...we LOVE her too!

name: casey harrison
text: I lived here for almost a year now! I have never in my life had a conservice bill that is 600 something dollars!! If I were you and you are wanting to rent do not rent from here find something that has a flat rate for water and sewage. Also vacant gas fee what the hell we live in Alabama yes there are times where a cold spell comes through but we don't need heat all year around!! I am sickened by this apartment complex now. Had maintenance people come out to fix a/c still not working properly. Still 80 something degrees in the apartment.

resp.text:
Casey, We are so sorry for this less than an exceptional experience. Please stop by the office, I would love to review and assist you with your Conservice bill and a/c concerns.  I look forward to hearing from you or your roommate soon.
-Marsha, Community Manager

name: cassidy covington
text: The WORST place you could move to. Haven't been living there for months. Got my "name removed from the lease". And yet still get bills. Save your money and live somewhere else. Chase villas was way nicer but had a longer wait- well worth the wait. Move anywhere else but this sh*thole. The office answers when they feel like. They will lose paperwork. Save your money and live somewhere nicer. Seriously.

name: Kim Kittleman
text:
Customer service inconsistent at best. Maintanence service somewhat responsive. Plus side, square footage for the $ better than most in Hoover. I did lose some respect for the complex when they offered $ for tenants to rate the complex high online. That's a bit unethical.

Update: 5-10-13.We have lived in the apartment complex for about 3 years. Finally, we are attempting to move into a home. To do so, we need a rental verification, which only one person in the office can process. That staff member is on vacation therefore we must wait. Hoovers housing market is extremely competitive, this delay may cause us to lose the home. There is no other staff member crossed trained to cover verifications.  Although the staff is often polite, we have found the business operations to be substandard. I would not recommend living here.

name: mario reese
text: Terrible place to live!! Over six cars were broken into last night. Management hasn’t attempted to advise other residents about this. Please choose another place to live!!

resp.text: Mario, I am sorry you were a guest and a victim of an unlocked car.  We are cooperating with Hoover Police and assisting them in their investigation and are hopeful it will lead to an arrest.

name: Arneita Taylor
text: My AC was out 5 weeks ask for adjustments on rent couldn’t stay there. Management never return calls act as if they didn’t care 6 or 7 work order . There was know apologies just as you don’t existed Please don’t make the mistake I did to continue living in a place I had my apartment flooded three time and all they could say was call the insurance company I’m a older female also black my clothes ,shoes and everything was damaged but they clean the apartment across from my apartment and they were white .

resp.text: Ms. Taylor, I am sorry for the misunderstanding with your a/c.  I know management has since contacted you.  Please feel free to contact the manager if you need further assistance.  We are very thankful for you working with us.

name: Laura Herrington
text: We lived here for 6 months are are moving out this week.  It was fine up until it was time to move out. I will update with that information when it is settled.  I had previously posted a positive review, but I may need to modify it, so here is this disclaimer.. and a rating of okay for the time being.

name: Meg Gill
text: Living here was one of the worst mistakes me and my sister could have made. Combined we lived here for two years without any trouble. The issue was when we moved off the property. We put down almost $1200 for a security deposit that we were told we would receive about 4-6 weeks after my sister moved out. It had been about two months and she still had not receive the deposit, so i decided i would call and ask about it. When i originally called, Blake told me that there was no deposit on file (not true.) When i called back, Rebecca told me that we should have received all but $500 of said deposit within 4-6 weeks (not true.) When i called back again, Alecia told me that absolutely none of the deposit was left due to pet damages. Don't get me wrong, I fully understand that treatments may have been needed and there were small damages, but what i not understanding is why it was my responsibility to replace all carpet when the carpet most likely needed replacing before we moved in. Keep in mind we had a 12 pound cat, not an 80 pound lab. When i asked to be sent all the documentation to send to a lawyer she told me that Lynn would be sending it to me within 24 hours (NOT TRUE) It has been over a month now and i am just now being told i have to request all documentation in writing. I spoke to Lynn for the first time this morning just wanting an explanation because i had been told so many different things, she was very defensive from the start and very rudely HUNG UP ON ME. This place is so unprofessional and i honestly felt like i was dealing with children the entire time. I do not even care about the money anymore, i care that these people think they can take advantage of their renters and essentially steal from them. Stay far away from this place if you can.

resp.text: Megan, I am so sorry your experience has not been positive.  We enjoyed your time here and I am sorry to hear the finish was not as you expected.  This case does get a little confusing, in that you moved out in 2017 and are just now questioning your deposit.  I am happy to discuss with you further.  Please contact me at the office.  I look forward to reviewing with you.  Marsha.

name: Shelby Kennedy
text: So I’ve had problems with Ridge Crossings from the jump moving in here. I’ll start from the beginning of the issues with them. First of all, if you work from home it’s best not to move here, as they will tell you you are not allowed to work on a business computer from your apartment. Secondly (and I’ll just speak on my own experience here), we had my boyfriends brother over for the day and were cooking out by the pool. We began to walk out to put leftovers in our fridge real quick and one of the managers from the leasing office approached me and my boyfriend with a rude tone telling us that if we left the pool that his brother couldn’t stay there. We asked her if we could run up to our apartment real quick and that we were coming right back. She said yes that would be fine. As we were on our way back we ran into his brother who had been kicked out anyways and she had been rude with him. Because of this she has another manager tell us that he isn’t allowed back on the property. At least one day out of the month the water won’t work because of pipe issues. We had to freeze the first few weeks of winter because our heat wasn’t working. Then we get a leak in our ceiling over our DINING AREA where we host meals and another leak from our sun roof. They fixed the leak but left the wet ceiling to mold. BLACK MOLD has also accumulated on the master bathroom ventilation area. After all of these problems we’ve decided to leave. Our lease is up on January 14th. Now our last straw and the reason I’m posting this review? We get a call from them today with the lady being rude to my boyfriend as soon as she gets him on the phone. She tells him she hasn’t received 60 day notice of us leaving and he told her yes we will be moving. And she told us that they have to receive a 60 day notice from us (we are already at only a month left until lease is up), or that they will charge us two more months of rent. WE WERE NEVER INFORMED THAT WE NEEDED TO GIVE A NOTICE BEFORE LEAVING. My boyfriend asks her “so we aren’t aloud to leave? We signed a one year lease.” And she tells him “No you have to stay or you will pay fees and you will pay for two months of rent”. We need to expose places like this. They are NOT good people. They will try to make as much money as they can off of you even if it means being downright deceitful. We pay over 1200 a month to live here and we are not treated nor have we ever been treated like respected guests since we began staying here. I would not recommend moving here to my worst enemy. Nobody should feel like this at a place that’s supposed to be home. I wish there was a way to give less than one star.

name: keith davis
text: I moved here from Baltimore 2 years ago and I love every monument of it here every since. the staff here are very friendly as well professional and helpful .. the area very quite and safe there is plenty around the are to shop and as well things to do with the family . I would recommend this place to anyone .

name: Darryl Bone
text: Very nice location,  nice units.

resp.text:
Darryl,
Thank you so much for your 5-Star Review! We are happy you make Ridge Crossings your home. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to reach out!

name: Steven Beaubien (S_Beau)
text:
NEGATIVE 5 STARS

Worst place I have ever lived in my life.  Maintenance team is inferior, tried to have a toilet fixed three times, which they failed to fix.  Eventually I gave up on the toilet.  It took them two times to fix the water heater.  Furnace broke down too.  The complex is always breaking a water main thus leaving you/us without water for hours.  Don't expect to come home from work and take that nice relaxing shower, no no water main broke again.  Staff does NOT answer phones.  After two weeks of signing lease mold began to grow on the walls, wasn't from me because I didn't move in right away.  I found that someone left an odor eliminator in the main AC duct which became moldy and most likely cause the mold to spread.  Maintenance always leaves a light on after they have been in your apartment, which cost you money.  On site laundry mat requires a card not money to use machines and where do you add money to the card.  I'll tell you where you add money.  At the leasing office, which is closed if you work nights or 70+ hours a week, which means you can't add money because the leasing office is closed by time you get home from work.  The way my mind works is, if I need to add money to the "laundry" card to use the "laundry" machine shouldn't the machine to add money be in the "laundry" mat and not the leasing office.  Laundry machines are always breaking down too.

Just save yourself the trouble don't live here.  A friend of mine lived here too, let's just say he didn't renew his lease.  Also they must be getting desperate for new tenants because they approve anybody now.  So just think about that for a minute, the word anybody.  Last but not least I have received a letter three months later claiming that I owe $658.00 early termination fee.  Here comes the funny part, I paid the $658.00 early termination fee along with any other fees (that's how bad I wanted to get the hell out of there).  So now I have to get the lawyer involved.

LIKE I SAID, DON'T LIVE HERE.  DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT MOVING HERE.  UNLESS YOU LIKE HEADACHES THEN BY ALL MEANS MOVE INTO the Ridge Crossings Apartments located at Tree Crossings Parkway.

Now some might say this is slander but what is slander?  The action or crime of making a false spoken statement damaging to a person's reputation.  Everything I said is true so it's not slander.  Have yourself a nice day.  DON'T LIVE HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Chloe M. Gooden, M.A.
text:
*Updated from Previous Review*
(Experience So Far...)

Pros:
1. The Staff is SUPER nice! They really do show great customer service including the manager which is rare a lot of places.
2. How they handle maintenance issues - Quickly. Efficiently. They do handle emergency maintenance issues really fast as well. All of the maintenance men are really nice.
3. Apartment is Spacious, nice renovations. (You have 2 renovation styles to pick from. I like that a lot. You can somewhat pick based off of your style which is good. (if available)
4. Super convenient location. Right by highway, mall, ton of shopping places.
5. Of course, there were issues after move in, as ALL apartments have because hello it's apartments. They have handled most things very well.

Cons:
1. The pipes are somewhat old, so you here knocking in the home when running water in certain areas.
2. Haven't figured out the vent circulation yet, but if you have a neighbor with bad habits (air wise, smoking wise, etc) you will be affected.
3. Don't like how they do the water bill. It is split between all tenants in the building. Our water bill was higher than a water bill for a 3-5 bedroom house in hoover.
4. Maintenance issues that have to do with the age of the apartment don't seem to be able to be fixed but just have to deal.

All in All:
I’ve never experienced the type of customer service they give here. I am most impressed with that part. Please ensure to actually speak with residents in the community and not look at review comments only to make your decision. I did speak with a resident and they gave pretty positive and honest feedback about the place. May me best to do so that way you are aware of what you are okay with and not,etc. We love are apartment and plan on staying for a while. Also, it feels quite safe.

name: Steve P
text:
Virtually non-existent staff. Calling the office does nothing, as the staff won't answer. Your only options are to select from a menu where "leave a message for our office staff to return during normal business hours" (which I can assure you does not happen) and "hang up and dial 911" are two of the four options.

The gym is an absolute joke; kids climb all over the few working machines and the staff does nothing about it. On more than one occasion the only working treadmill was occupied by a child doing sideways bear-crawls.

Ridge Crossings has an absurd amount of those destructive plastic speed bumps, to the point it is a struggle just to drive in and out of the complex. I need a Dramamine just to get up my driveway.

After several people complained about neighbors smoking and talking loudly in the breezeway late into the night, the staff studied the likes of Churchill and Eisenhower for their leadership and conflict-resolution strategy in how to deal with intra-tenant disputes. Just kidding, they put a passive-aggressive letter on all the doors of my building, stating that if they caught us smoking in the breezeway we would be fined $50. The smoking and late-night noises continue.

In closing, the floor plans are nice, and it does have a pleasant jogging trail. The stoplight at the complex entrance is a plus.

PS, Joe's Apartment has nothing on this place...

name: Nick Din
text: I've been looking for apartments because im moving up from Florida. I spoke to Katie "the leasing manager", on a Friday, gave me a great deals on apartments and I loved the amenities and everything they had to offer, as soon as she sent me the info by email and promised me pictures of the apartment. I still had some questions about the application and finishing the leasing process. I replied back and I even called and left her voice messages. I never received any pictures or a reply through email nor a call. Came Monday I called and spoke to someone different and gave me the news that the apartment I was interested in was taken. Seems like there's no communication between office staff. Thanks for NOTHING. Completely disappointed.

name: Sarah Jackson
text: Love living at Ridge Crossing. The view from the top is gorgeous! Great amenities.

resp.text: We love having you here.  Thank you so much for the positive review!  We agree the view and the amenities are top notch!

name: Britt W
text: One of the worst places to live! Took them over 3 months to fix our a/c and let’s not forget in the middle of the hottest months. Ran my power bill high and was told they would do something for us because it took so long obviously they just know how to lie. Their pest control is a joke I’m constantly seeing spiders and roaches and other bugs that I have no idea what they are. So i will be calling the regional manger since the property manager can’t keep up with her properties and also lied I would highly recommend not living here.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to provide us your feedback. We want to make sure you are happy in your home and would love the chance to speak with you directly in regard to your concerns and power bill. Please contact us at 205.733.9711 or RidgeCrossings@SteadfastLiving.com so we may set a time to meet. Again, thank you for your feedback and we look forward to improving your experience.

name: Wes Schaeffer
text:
I do not recommend these apartments at all. Their staff is not available at necessary times and one of them gave me the wrong information that cost me over $1,700.
Do yourself a favor and drive down 150 a few more miles and rent at a nice place.

name: Jonathan McKinney
text: Just finished meeting with one of the nicest, friendliest managers of anywhere in have been. We had a few small issues that were resolved right away and I could not be happier with this place. Whether it is long term or short term you plan on living in an apartment you should look no further for the a great place to live especially for the price and location.

name: Tareka Cameron
text:
Fun and friendly environment. The staff there is great! I have live here for 6 months or so and I have never seen a roach in my apartment. We are surrounded by woods, so that could possibly cause bugs, but even on the nature walking trail, I have not seen any creepy crawlers.
The trash compactor was broken for a couple of days, but like anything else manmade they tend to break and require repairs.
Other than that, we enjoy living here and the leasing staff is pretty awesome.

name: Lori Moore
text:
Ridge Crossings in Hoover, AL is a TERRIBLE place and not worth the money.

I lived there for 3 years, which was 3 years too long. Roaches, Spiders, Centipedes, you name it. They claimed they sprayed, but they would only call the exterminator if you complained so it had to become a regular call to make.

They also never answer the phone or return your messages. If you have maintenance issue it takes forever or they just half-way fix or rig something up.

Also, instead of sending you a final bill for water and trash it automatically goes to collections you don't get any kind of notice even though I provided an email address and forwarding address.

My AC went out in July for 2 weeks and I had to call constantly in order to find out what was going on. They never cared about providing reimbursement, money off rent, or even just giving me a fan to use in that time.

The apt above mine leaked, and they never did anything to clean it up. I had to and I bet that same unit it filled with mold in the walls cause they never did anything about it.

My door also got kicked in and someone stole a bunch of stuff even though my apt was facing the office. The maintenance people took 2 days to fix the door so I had to sleep with a bunch or stuff up against the door cause it wouldn't close all the way.

name: Felicia Quattlebaum
text: Way over priced for fees.

resp.text:
Felicia,
Thank you for the feedback. We're truly sorry to hear of your negative experience. We want to make sure any concerns you have are addressed and would love the opportunity to speak with you directly regarding them.

Marsha

name: Hellen Johnson
text:
If you are going to rent here make sure you look at the EXACT floor plan that you want. I stress exact because there are several different ones. They will tell you they only have certain ones available or tell you that your price will go up if you don't go ahead and lock in a certain apartment. Do not be persuaded by these comments. THEY WILL NOT REFUND ANY OF YOUR MONEY once you have given it to them. We were showed the model but was given a different floor plan to rent. Once we complained about the size not meeting our expectations we were asked for more application fees to get into our desired apartment.
Honestly after looking at just about every property in Hoover these aren't really worth the money. The office staff was polite and the grounds looked okay but in the end they stiffed us....I could hear a lot of noise from the highway and heard of roof leaks when I visited.  I would not recommend Ridge Crossings just because I really think my experience speaks to the true character of the management staff at Ridge Crossings.

name: Wesley Boozer
text: First off, I want to start by saying....anyone with a negative review, is going to put it on blast online. Whereas positive remarks are usually never supplied. I have lived here a year and just renewed my lease. Yes, the office staff takes awhile to answer the phone, but you have to keep in mind there are over 700 apartments in this community. Yes, there are roaches....but they're trees all around (so of course there will be bugs) They do a great job of pest control, in my opinion. Also, the staff will send notices via email before they do anything, such as shutting off the water to fix a water leak. I have nothing but positive remarks about this community. What I did before moving here is drive into the community and ask people who were walking their dogs what they thought. Don't make an assumption of negative remarks on the internet. Come join our friendly community. (Plus they have 2 pools, gym and a Movie Theater!)

name: Kat C.
text: Don't waste your money. Nothing works right. Office acts like you don't exist. And maintenance can barely change a light bulb. Worst mistake I ever made.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are so sorry to hear your experience has been less than exceptional and want to ensure we do all we can to improve this and make sure your maintenance items are repaired. We would love the opportunity to speak with you regarding your concerns. Please contact us at 205.733.9711 or RidgeCrossings@SteadfastLiving.com  so we can set a time to meet with you. Again, thank you for your feedback and we hope to speak with you soon.

name: Latraunda Smith
text: I lived here for a year and loved my apartment, it was quiet and I felt safe, its kind of pricey but i felt I could manage.  I really would recommend!

name: Brenden Elkins
text: Ive lives there 2 seperate times for a combined total of 8 years. i think its a great apartment complex with good residents and a helpful staff. apartment quality is really good.

name: Mary
text: This is the third time they've cut the water off without any notice, which is extremely rude.  I understand if it's an emergency but they could at least send an email when they become aware of the situation instead of cutting it off and leaving everyone in the dark about when it may possibly be back on, since they have no problem emailing me all the time telling me to recommend them.  I also hate the "valet service"; it is not a service.  They used to just pick up the trash at a certain time if you put it outside at the time; now they want me to "sign up" for trash service using a Facebook or Google account (there's also an option where you can call in and sign up) and then each time you want it picked up you have to make an appointment and allow ten minutes before and after for them to pick it up, and then you have to hand it to the person.  I've never used it but I still have to pay for it, it's easier just to take it to the dumpster.  They sent us q&a sheet about it when it started, and one of the questions was, why can't i leave my trash outside the door?  The answer was because we'll fine you.  Last time my lease was up for renewal they sent me a letter saying rent was going to be a certain amount and when I went to sign the lease it was higher.  It was just a "mistake".  Everything else is ok but the water shut offs are a big enough deal for me to give it 1 star.

resp.text: We are so sorry.  Our first concern is that you are not getting our notifications.  We do send out notifications via email.  Would you mind stopping by the office or give us a call to check your email address and make sure we have that correctly entered into our system.  With 76 beautiful acres we do time from time experience a break that does require the water to be shut off to make the repair.  We try to email this out in advance and then make repairs, but when we have an unexpected break like we did this Saturday, we shut the water off and then notify everyone.  Again, I apologize for the inconvenience. I am happy to meet with you further to discuss your Butler Valet options.

name: Alyson
text: This place is ridiculous. Do yourself a favor and live somewhere else. I’m tempted to pay the extra fees to terminate the lease early so I can go ahead and leave. Learn from my mistake.

resp.text: Alex, I am so sorry your experience to this point has not been positive. Please come by and see me at the office,I would love the opportunity to know more and see if I can help.  Thank you Marsha, Community Manager.

name: Augusta Chambers
