text: Clean and quiet although it was up in the day during the week; however, the balconies have nice views of nature of which I like. This is the first real experience from a real visit, I was visiting a relative.

resp.text: Augusta, thank you so much for visiting our community and for the kind feedback.  If you are ever in need of a home we hope you will consider us. Please let us know if there is anything you need!

name: Chyna B.
text:
We moved in in May and yea... I would have reconsidered if I knew what I know now. Ive had to call pest control over 5x just to still be dealing with spiders , ants , beetles and roaches .

So initially I told Alicia , the landlord , of the issue and she said she would have them come 2x back to back and if its still an issue we would escalate to do something further.

Well now they’ve been here 5-6x or more and she hasn’t done anyThing.Mind you our apartment is always CLEAN! I’m OCD and have a support dog to help with the anxiety it brings.  I’ve even seen roaches outside. I wish I could upload pictures.

We pay$1000/mo for this 1BR. This isn’t my first time paying this amount for an apartment but I sure didn’t experience issues like this. We chose to rent to give more time to find our home instead of rushing but at this point i wish we would have just bought a home and called it a day.

Our apartment is “renovated” but really it’s just cabinets and mirrors painted over with brown paint , sloppily at that. The apartment has no Fans, our room doesn’t have lights besides in the closet . The living room doesn’t have lights either. But ironically our sun room has lights.

My garbage disposal went out today, no idea why , my outlets for plugs pick and choose when they want to work. For example I have an outlet next to nightstand w my phone charger and lamp plugged in. Well only the bottom works so I have to switch the charger and and lamp out. There’s days where our sink water doesn’t get past lukewarm warm so I have to put ice in my dogs bowl to cool the water.The landscaping coming in is beautiful but by the apartments it is mediocre  at best

Positives : The pool area is nice and the location is nice , being by the highway. The gym is nice also , to just kind of small. Our apartment is a nice size to be a 1 bR

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to review Ridge Crossings. We are so sorry your experience has not been a positive one. We are always looking for ways to improve and would love the opportunity to discuss your concerns. Please reach out to our office at 205-733-9711 so we may set a time to meet. Again, thank you for your review and we hope to improve your experience.

name: Alonda Ford
text: Thank you for always being kind and helpful to my family. Your staff is awesome!

name: PeppinoS555
text:
They charge $15 a month for "valet trash" service, which is mandatory. There are days when they skip a day to pick it up but they never "skip" to charge for it every month. The utility is VERY expensive here,  just sewer is around $60 a month plus water, gas, electricity, trash, VALET TRASH, "pest control- is also (NONEXISTENT) and a service fee....(2 trash bills, it is not a mistake ppl). So do not get fooled by the rent price only. They also raise the rent EVERY YEAR. Started out $735 in 2017 for the smallest 1 br unit, a year later with "early" bird renewel $835.... Looks like these people here don't want good, respectful, long lasting tenants at all. And when those move out, you can only imagine what's left. No wonder why you see moving"(out)"trucks here every weekend.
The management is slow, but mostly very incompetent. I went 4 times in the office to complain about the same thing!(barking dog issue). No results.
I mean I was at the point to contact the corporate office in Irvine,Ca(Steadfast). (Just in case if you need the info in the future)...and you will believe me. The staff is nice and helpful you can tell, but so much they can do when there is a lazy, incompetent management behind them! The office staff is getting commission after they sign up a new tenant, so they will seem super nice at the beginning, but once you signed the contract, you are doomed until you move out. Let's see how cool and funny Blake and Douglas (as i read it) will be when you face a REAL problem. Let me know.
And just like other people say, sometimes there is not enough water pressure so you can't take a hot shower and those email notifications just never arrive....but they should.
When my lease is over I am 👋. Do not get fooled by that few positive reviews, because that is all what Lyn the manager from the office is doing, since she could care less if there is a real problem what needs to be solved.  Just like other tenants were saying is that, they care more to sign new tenants up, but once you signed the contract ,they will turn their back on you completely. I am the real proof to that. When you move out expect to pay more than double what you would normally pay for rent and utility. Also, please since you are here, take the time to check out Steadfast Living(their corporate office) reviews(barely 2 stars). You were warned, i wish if someone would have done the same thing before i moved in here.
*UPDATE: It's all talk, no action in the end of the day. The issues still exist after countless visit to the office. So somebody is not doing something right here. Thank you for the good wishes and yes FINALLY I will have peace living there.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry your experience has been less than exceptional. We do care about all resident feedback and in fact, we survey residents after move in, work order completions, pre-renewal, and move out.  We want to learn from our mistakes and ensure all residents are happy in their homes.  We work hard to keep in communication with our residents and utilize email blasts to keep everyone informed.  We also go over our contracts with residents in detail and all the items you mentioned are covered during our tour and review of our contracts. Again, thank you for your feedback and we wish you all the best in your new home.

name: Melissa Crusoe
text: My favorite tech is Squeaky. He goes above and beyond to ensure that all maintenance issues are handled in a timely and efficient manner!

name: Ashleigh Tremble
text: Just got the place, and place the guy showed it had a patio the one I chose online said it would have hard wood floors and a patio and ceiling fans I don’t have either, it’s false advertising and no one tried to accommodate with me, I hate it

resp.text:
Hello Ashleigh, Thank you for your feedback. This is the first I am hearing about this and I am so sorry you have had a negative experience.  Please stop by and see the manager so I can see how I can further assist.  We do have over 11-floor plans that are varied with different features and we want to ensure you are happy in your home.
Thank you,
Marsha, Community Manager

name: Kendall Hill
text:
My husband & I lived here for over 2 years. The maintenance is decent, if you stay on top of it. We had a broken garbage disposal that backed up our sink--they were quick to check it out but forgot about the part they ordered to fix it & did not come back until we called multiple times to remind them it was still broken. We also had a tree that grew over our roof. It made horrible noises as the limbs scratched the windows. We requested SEVERAL times that they trim the limbs but they never did. Our apartment then became infested with ticks--we found 32 ticks in one week! We lived on the 2nd floor, no other neighbors had ticks, so it must have been the tree. We requested again that they trim the limbs. They said they would immediately, but still never did.
The final reason for the bad review was their "move-out" procedure. We handed in our written 60-day notice to vacate & requested to set up a move-out inspection with an agent. No one contacted us to do this. We called & stopped by the office several times requesting information about moving out & what we needed to do (all other apartments I have lived in gave a move-out check list). We were told by 3 different office workers that they were planning to remodel our apartment. We were told to clean the kitchen & bathroom, make sure the drip pans on the stove were clean, & just to vacuum the floors because they would be replaced. 3 DIFFERENT PEOPLE TOLD US THIS! A month & a half later we received a notice from Ridge Crossings giving us 2 weeks to pay $1400 to replace the floors or they would send us to collections. After talking with the manager, we got no where. Sorry Ridge, you are liars and we will not be setting up a payment plan with you.
The apartments are nice, rent is decent, but the employees are very unprofessional.

name: Jason G
text: The gym was nice for an apt gym, the walking trail is beautiful, and the people in the front office were very nice. The problem was that on multiple occasions, they would lose my money order that I paid rent with. Clearing it up caused much inconvenience.

name: B C
text: My move in day was pushed back several days so they could "install new carpet" which wasn't done (still smelled like smoke and had visible indentations in bedrooms from where night stands had been), there was a bag of trash on the floor by the fireplace, there are numerous holes in one wall from thumb tacks (previous tenant) that weren't fixed, huge runs in the paint in the master bedroom,  shelves falling off the walls in closets, missing outlet and light switch covers, electrical problems in both upstairs bathrooms, and too many other issues to list. Any time I call maintenance they take 2 days to come out and have not fixed a single problem on the first try. I had to diagnose an electrical problem in master bedroom/bathroom myself and tell them what parts to replace after the third time they came out and were unable to fix it. Trash service times change constantly. Water is shut off with little notice. Trash compactor was broken for 2 weeks and there was a giant pile of trash with flies buzzing around it sitting right by the entrance, nice to look at every time I left or entered the complex. The "car care center" is 2 hose hookups with drains in the ground. The sharp speed bumps are guaranteed to destroy any suspension, and if you have an expensive modified car like me you will never drive it due to the difficulty of just getting in and out of the complex. I pay almost $1500 a month for rent and this is what I get in return. If you can afford to live here, go somewhere else.

name: Jessie Tidwell
text: Katie worked with me from day 1. I communicated via email and phone for about a month while out of town on buisiness. She had everything ready for me to sign. Been here 2 years and had very few problems arise. Be sure and give a 60 day notice on the 60 day mark to avoid fines (its in your agreement). Anything we called to had to have fixed was done within a hour. If anything does happen the team will work with you, but remember this is a buisiness. I would recommend this complex to anyone.

name: Roy Kennedy
text: MOLD MOLD MOLD. had a leak on the roof, they patched it, but the mold is still there, they never bothered to do anything about it. Do not move here, overpriced. Nosey management, because I didnt give a 60 day notice on my lease for renewal which I was not notified of they are trying to charge me -2 months worth of rent on my final bill. My lease expires in mid jan. Cannot wait to get the hell out of here. Dont waste your time with this backwards overpriced place. Why cant establishments just practice good business?

name: Amparo G. Calmaestra
text: My favourite place to live un Hoover

resp.text: Thank you so much for this fine review! We are thrilled to see you love the community as much as we do. Please let us know if there is anything you need.

name: Bill Forziano
text: Lived here for 2 years and hated it. The area is very nice and quiet. The management and staff is the problem you can never get in touch with anyone for maintenance, and when you do it is like they don't even care. The management and leasing people are very rude to unless you are looking for a new home.

name: Hamilton Horne
text: This complex and the apartments are very nice, but I do not believe the staff is very helpful. I had a leak in my roof for six months and everytime it rained I would call and was told that a ticket was opened, but it was never fixed until I complained to the main office in California. I elected not to renew mylea s e because of this reason, and the fact I can get a place downtown for cheaper.

name: Krissy W.
text: Very nice wooden flooring

resp.text: Krissy, thank you for your feedback. We love our new flooring and we are so glad you do too! Please let us know if there is anything you need.

name: mlau
text: I have lived here for a few months now and I love it. The office staff have always been friendly and attentive whenever we have come up there, despite being very busy because this is a fairly large complex. They fixed our leaky fridge and sink within 24hrs of us reporting them. The price including utilities is great for the area,  and the apartments and grounds are clean and well-kept. The neighborhood is quiet and it's close to everything. This is sincerely the nicest place I have ever lived. I live in a 2-br/2-ba unrenovated apartment.

name: Darvell Magee
text:
My experience with Douglas started off a little rocky because they were going through renovations at the time but when it came to my move in day he and his team really came through for me and my family
Thanks for everything.

resp.text:
Darvell,

Thank you so much for your patience and trust...our renovations are worth the wait.  Please feel free to reach out to Douglas or any of our team should you have any concerns.

text: Hard to contact a while back when we first started looking, but the staff came through for us.  Moved in so far with no issues.

There is mold in every vent and my child got sick already from it. NO BODY SHOULD EVER LIVE HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Sir Consumer
text: Turn Key Realty will respond but with a cookie cutter automated reply. I left a detailed message when attempting to contact them via Facebook. The automated reply indicated my message was not read. Professionalism should always include compassion and consideration as a true liaison. As a retired law enforcement ranking officer. Turn Key charges $50 person adult background check. This is almost double the actual cost in Jefferson County. Turn Key requires renters to earn a salary triple of what the rent is. The requirements based on the automated reply, has me to believe I will loose money just applying if not selected. If references can be provided and downpayment provided, making people feel like pawns is sad. These comments will be combed over with a standard response.

name: Keidra Edwards
text: Unprofessional and possibly prejudice. I had to have them shred my application. I   don't have time to discuss details that first sentence says it all....You've been warned!!!

name: Chris Duncan
text: I have used Turnkey Realty for almost 11 years (since before it was Turnkey).  Jessica has done a fabulous job of handling multiple rental properties for me. She has saved me countless hours and money through her expertise. I have recommended her in the past and will continue to do so in the future!  If you are looking for someone to manage your properties for you, then look no further. Jessica is the best!

name: Christina Coleman
text: I work for a company who does service work for Turn-key. I can honestly say this is one of the best companies we have EVER worked with. Property rental companies are generally a nightmare to work with, but Turn-Key has been a breath of fresh air. Jessica is bright, professional, and customer oriented. We love working with her, and all of her employees. If you are looking for a rental property management company to work with I encourage you to give them a call.

resp.text: Thanks Christina.  We at Turn key are so blessed to have your Services as well!

We had a very unique situation and they made sure to help us every step of the way. Have dealt with other companies and the level of service you get here does not even compare. Will never use another rental company other than turnkey for myself or future clients! Thanks for a wonderful experience!

text: I have been a Realtor for over 13 years and used to manage a very large apartment community.  I can tell you that I thought it would be easy to manage my own rental properties... They have done a great job of finding wonderful tenants, my rent is direct deposited every month, and repairs are handled for a fair price and in a timely manner.  I can highly recommend Turn Key to professionally manage any rental properties that you own.

name: Landlord X
text:
I acquired my first investment property in 2013. I was extremely nervous about screening prospective tenants because I was unfamiliar with landlord tenant laws.  I called several local property management companies, but they did not have patience with me because I had a ton of questions.

Jessica from Turn Key Realty stood out for me from the beginning because she took the time to not only answer my questions over
the phone, but she invited me to her office to go into detail about the pros and cons of becoming a first time landlord.

The tenants that Turn Key placed in my property are still there and do not plan on going anywhere, therefore I appreciate the thorough background checks and tenant management that Jessica and her team does.

I would recommend Turn Key Realty to anyone looking for professional property management in the Birmingham area.

text: Turnkey was very helpful to me when I was needing a house. They went out of their way to help me. Very nice to talk to on the phone. Thank you.

name: Chris Laney
text:
Great property managers. TMI has managed 24 houses for me for 3+ years now. They keep me honest (i.e. make sure I hold up my end and care for my houses), and also screen and manage tenants well. This is the only company I've found in BHM that is not incented to just make money off landlords and tenants with maintenance fees and lazy management.
I can only assume the people complaining on here are tenants who hadn't paid rent, or perhaps staying in a unit with an owner who wouldn't pay for repairs. TMI doesn't do repairs in all cases - they coordinate them but the owner can choose whomever to do (or not do) the repairs. I do regret if these situations occurred. That said, it seems like 4-5 upset people out of hundreds or even thousands they've had.

name: KJ plays
text: Better not give them your Security Deposit if your are not sure you're going to get the house or apartment. I gave them my Security Deposit last week but didn't sign a lease or nothing and they said I couldn't get my deposit back. Now I have to go through Small Claims Court to sue and get it back. This is not a good place to rent or buy from been reading reviews and I see they tell all the people who had bad service with this real estate to call them and they will be happy to discuss any issues you have but your best bet is to don't go through this real estate or to take them to court if you have legal problems.

name: Brittney Ridley
text: Very unprofessional and discriminatory. Saw a home on the market back in March that I absolutely loved, tried to put an offer in and was told they weren't accepting back up offers because the home was under contract. Reached out to listing agent Kristi McGee multiple times during that contract time just to let her know I was still interested in the home if the contract fell through. I left a voicemail and sent her two texts-no response ever. Home ended up back on market and still never heard from her. My agent was finally able to help me submit an offer to them and after days of her stalling, she responds the seller accepted another offer from the multiple offers back in March (that I was never given the opportunity to do then) that is actually less than my offer. The only reason I was probably able to put in this offer is because I had to go around her. I thought it was the listing agent's job to get the owner/seller best deal... Would not recommend and NOTHING GOOD EVER COMES TO PEOPLE LIKE HER AND THIS COMPANY, EVER.

text: Saw a house we were interested in online, unfortunately there was a mix up and we weren't able to rent the home we wanted. Amy quickly resolved the issue and was just awesome about everything. Really appreciated her taking her time to assist us, she was a sweetheart.

We will be more than happy to refund your $60.  This was a complete and honest mistake.  My phone number is (205) 985-9158.  Please call me to let me know if you want me to mail your check or if you will be picking it up. Respectfully,  Amy

text: I've been waiting for about a month now to hear back from them about my deposit. I've called them multiple times and they refuse to call me back. I can never get anyone on the phone there, not to mention the entire time I rented the house, it was like pulling teeth to get them to come out for repairs. They forced me and my roommates to be without A.C. for 2 months. Update: still no call back from this Amy person. This company seems to be run by a bunch of people who don't care about their renters. Update, Amy finally called to tell me that I'm not getting a deposit back because of the already terrible paint job that was their before I moved it. Not to mention they charged me for an "unclean kitchen" when on they day of moving in the kitchen was covered RAT droppings. On top of that, our fridge goes out in the last month of living there and they never come and fix it!!!!! After cleaning it up and living there for as long as the lease made me, I cleaned the kitchen to beyond what it looked like on move in day and they STILL charged me for it. On top of all of this, Amy had the audacity to ask me to delete my review before telling me I wasn't getting my deposit back. This company doesn't care about you if you're just renting and in college, young people stay away.

It’s just not even worth the headache or bad mood they would put me in. It’s not a pleasant thing to talk to TMI. I rather deal with the issues with this apartment without dealing with TMI until my lease is up. text: Very positive experience with the staff at TMI, answered all my questions and were very helpful!

name: michael mcbryar
text:
WORST COMPANY EVER!!! I don't even know where to begin. We rented a house through them, and thy charged a ridicules amount for the deposit. When we moved in i noticed a lot of issues that needed to be fix in the house, so I put a work order in and 6 months later it finally got fixed or should i say patched. We asked the maintenance guy not so smoke in the house because we had a newborn, but, he did it any way. it also took him almost 3 weeks to replace a light fixture in the living room. I finally got fed up and called the owner of the house and he was way better to deal with thank TMI.

on another occasion rent was due on Good Friday, I went that day to pay rent but the office was closed. so, i was like, "OK i'll pay it on Monday since there's no drop box". I went first thing that Monday and they charged me $150 late fee because they were closed the day rent was due so it caused me to be late. when i tried to dispute it the literally called the police on me. needless to say I paid the $150 and  went on my way.

Now its August and our AC just went out and I put another work order in and called the office to tell them that we have no AC in the house. They didn't even seem to care. all they said was "our maintenance girl will have to look at the work order and well get to you when we can". IT'S ALMOST 100 DEGREES OUTSIDE and the windows in the house don't even open. I swear this is the worst company I have ever dealt with.

DO NOT GO WITH TMI FOR ANY THING NOT EVEN TO BUY A HOUSE YOU WILL GET SCREWED BIG TIME!!

text: My names Latasha Williams, TMI is awesome!!!! If you call them for a problem, they will get in touch with the house's owner to get you fast results..kudo's TMI Realty.

text: Worst company of all times! I live in Central Gardens Apartments and this company just recently took over the property.  The apartments already had problems but, since TMI came it has gotten worse.  No matter how much you clean roaches, water bugs, spiders, rats, and unknown are all over the place day and night. The company tried to make us pay water but, water is included in our rent.  Because of some type of water leak the company will turn off your water for hours randomly. This is also the second summer my husband and i went without air conditioner, central air is included in our rent. They came by one time in May and the air work for 2 hrs only, told them and they never came back saying they will let the maintenance guy know but, here it August summer almost over.

text: Been knowing Hobert for 10 plus years now. Has a lot of business experience and knowledge. He will go out of his way to help you in any way possible. Great family guy and will treat you just like family too. Let Hobert Pruitt sell you your dream home or property!

text: My wife and I met our friend Hobert about 2 years ago. He puts his all into each and every endeavor, whether it's teaching Sunday school or selling real estate. You can count on him to be honest and put "your" best interest first!

text: I have known Hobert for many years now and Have always found him to be a kind and considerate man. Having been around him for so long I have seen how he conduct business, also here kind, considerate and very knowledgeable about real estate, so for a 5star experience you need to call Hobert.

text: I have known Hobert for close to 40 years. He is a man of Integrity, who Honors God. He has a passion for helping people. He listen's to what his clients want in their new home and then he helps them find it.

text: I have known Hobert for over 10 years!  He sold our house quickly and with enthusiasm.  You can’t go wrong using  him as your realtor!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: D Albano
text:
I have known Hobert Pruitt for some time – I cannot recommend Hobert highly enough!
Hobert is highly knowledgeable in the North Alabama area.  He has lived here for many years and lived in Morgan County all his life.  He knows the ins-and-outs of buying and selling homes, and is incredibly flexible and accommodating in scheduling viewings.    He is very patient and generous in giving detailed feedback and notes in reading through HOAs (which he has great expertise in reviewing) and contracts, pointing me in a good direction with lenders, helping set realistic expectations throughout the process, and basically guided me through every step of the way.    He is very professional and responded quickly whether by email or text.  Also important to me was the fact that he put absolutely no pressure on me and provided information in an even-handed, non-judgmental, manner, and was unfazed by several course-changes in what I was looking for.  Bottom line – I can’t imagine having a more positive experience and recommend him without reservation to anyone looking to buy in this stressful market.  Thanks Hobert!

resp.text: I appreciate your kind words!

text: Stayed at this property for roughly 8months and enjoyed my time there. Haley, the property manager, is great to work with and very responsive. She truly went above and beyond  from move in to move out. The property is well kept and a quiet neighborhood.

resp.text: We will miss you Larry, good luck in Georgia. Please let us know if we can serve you in the future!

name: Alan Cook
text: My wife and I moved to Alabama just about three weeks ago into Palladian at Fairhope.  Our experience has been excellent.  The grounds and the buildings are attractive and well maintained.  The property manager, Haley, is very friendly and her door is always open to help any resident with any issue.  Eddie, the maintenance man, is respectful and willing to fix any thing that might come up that needs a looking at in your apartment.  Anyone looking for a quality apartment should look here!

resp.text: Thank you Alan and Patty for your review!  We are happy to have you here with us :)

name: Alison Parish
text: The Palladian was a great place to live while starting a new job in Daphne!  It was spacious, clean, with plenty of green space for my puppy!  I loved the tall ceilings and the little patio!  It was very private and I enjoyed my morning coffee outside many mornings! The neighbors were top notch...friendly, but never intrusive!   The management was extremely helpful and efficient! Following the hurricane in the fall of 2020,  management had “boots on the ground” knocking on every door checking on the residents!  It was a wonderful place to live!

resp.text: Alison, we will miss you so much.  You were such a joy to have here, good luck in Mobile!  Please let us know if we can help you in the future.

name: Soror Thalassa
text:
The Palladian at Fairhope is all you could want in an apartment. It is a little neighborhood that is pet friendly and family friendly. It is quiet here most of the time, and the grounds and greenery are well cared for.
The apartment I stayed in was roomy and had all modern amenities. Anytime I needed anything, Haley and Arthur took care of it promptly.
If you’re looking for a safe, clean space to stay a while in beautiful Fairhope, you just can’t do much better than the Palladian.

resp.text: Thank you so much for these kind words.  We will certainly miss you and Lucy! Good luck with your new home :)

name: Christine Bookin
text: My experience has been exceptional! My husband and I are relocating from South Carolina and Haley has been such a blessing. No matter how many times I called she was always helpful and patient, she is extremely organized, and most importantly she relieved the high amount of stress that comes naturally from moving! Could be happier! 5 Stars!!!

resp.text: Thanks Christine!  We are so happy to have you here with us :)

name: Grant Kessler
text:
Lived here short term while house hunting. They have short term leases and that’s hard to find here.

The manager Haley is truly amazing. We did have a couple of maintenance issues upon move-in and they were in transition between maintenance personnel. Haley stayed on it and the issues were resolved.

The property is well maintained and location is awesome.

We have met several people who have been here for years. They have 2 & 3 bedroom units and the 2 BR units have single car garages.

Comfortable, clean, quiet and convenient.

They are Covid conscious and the office is closed except for appointments but Haley is available by phone. There is a nice pool, workout room and grill available by booking a time through the properties app on your phone. So, those public areas are reserved and occupancy restricted.

resp.text: Thank you so much for this sparkling review!  We truly care about our residents and love that we could accommodate you until you find your forever home :)

name: Pete Scarbrough
text: Love living here. Management and staff are great.

resp.text: Thank you Pete and Becky!  We love having you here!

name: Natalie Engelman
text: We moved from Georgia and had a hard time finding a rental that fit our needs in the quick timeline we had. Haley worked so hard to make our move happen quickly and easily. It’s been a great community for our family and our kids have loved it here. Haley is very responsive and always addresses any issues promptly.

resp.text: Thank you Natalie for this sweet comment, we work hard to assist all of our residents and appreciate residents like you guys at The Palladian at Fairhope!

name: Frank Stewart
text: I chose the Palladian at Fairhope - from out of state - based upon two friends' high recommendations.  I, of course, spoke with Haley in the management office to initiate the rental.  She couldn't have been more helpful with advising and assisting with all setups; including utilities, insurance, etc.  I moved in only a few weeks ago and must say that the choice is better than I could have hoped.  So far, I have nothing but good things to say about the Palladian at Fairhope and their staff... and expect that to continue.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Frank, we are so excited to have you here with us!

name: Molly Mitchell
text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! This has been my home away from home while working, my oasis, the place where I felt like a queen in my beautiful, immaculate castle!!!!! Miss Haley has been the best, most super helpful in every way!!!! They have special events, trivia contests with prizes, a beautiful pool, fitness center, safe quiet community, and everyone is so super friendly!!!! Any little maintenance issue that needed to be fixed was super easy to put in a maintenance requests for and quickly fixed!!! I am going to miss this place and the people immensely when I go back home to North Alabama, but I am so thankful I had the opportunity to experience this beautiful apartment home in this wonderful city of Fairhope!!!!!❤

name: Brandon Allen
text: WARNING. This place is a trap. There is no way to leave without getting sued or placed into collections after you leave. Even if they are at fault. They have a professional legal team, that has invested interest in the place, to ensure you do not walk out without paying a ridiculous amount of money. They rented my family a unit that had know air conditioning issues, and when asked to fix it, repeatedly they did not. My home maininted a temperature over 82 degrees all summer before we had enough and left. The tenant who lived there before we did stop by one day to warn us in person, and to no avail she was absolutely correct. Hayley, the apartment representative on property will smile in your face, and screw you over at the same time. Profession thief. Renter beware.

resp.text: Brandon, I hate that you felt you had to make this post.  We always, always try to do everything possible within reason to help our residents.  Your situation was different than what you are exposing it here.  Our hands are tied professionally once we are pushed too far.

name: Stuart Griffiths
text: Beautiful patio homes in awesome area

name: Roy Kinney
text: The Palladian Patio Homes have the nicest rental properties of anywhere that I have ever lived. My family rented a two bed/two bath home with a garage. The rooms are quite large with a very large living dining kitchen area. Maintenance is performed continuously on the property to help maintain a very high standard. A gentleman by the name of Pete conscientiously keeps the swimming pool in top notch order for all who swim. You could not ask for a better maintenance man than Ed. After saying all of that, I want to say Hayley, the Manager, is the very best of the best. She listens, communicates, is very responsive and shows genuine concern for all who live at The Fairhope Palladian. If you are looking for a permanent or temporary residence, The Palladian at Fairhope is the place for you!

name: Robert Calhoun
text: I lived in downtown Auburn, renting from Badger Properties.  Without a doubt, it was one of the best rental companies that I have used in Auburn.  Apartment complex was very well maintained.  The atmosphere was quiet, perfect for a serious student.  Also, I loved how convenient it was to walk to central campus and downtown.  I recommend Badger Properties to anyone looking for housing in the Auburn area!!

name: J. Keith Maxwell
text: I stayed in Center Court this summer for a temporary situation. I had top notch service from Chris Kearns and Jason at Badger Properties. I would highly recommend Badger if you're looking for a quiet place to study or just to live. His rental policy is great for older students. Also, the customer service is superb.

name: Amanda Weaver-Laird
text:
My experience with Chris as a landlord and Badger Properties has been nothing short of an excellent experience. I moved to Auburn 2.5 years ago for my job in property management and have only lived on properties that I worked at. When I decided to move away from my student housing property I wanted to move somewhere that was close enough to campus that I could walk for game days, but that wasn't full of young students and this was the perfect place (Park Hill cottage). It was secluded and quiet, but just a walk away from downtown and all the fun that Auburn has to offer. The biggest downfall for this property was that there is no dishwasher (not a huge deal), no washer/dryer (but there is a laundry mat on site and down the street at Thatch Hut) and it has cinder block walls so it gets really cold in the winter.

I made the decision a few months ago to move to another newly renovated apartment that Chris also managed (Broadway Apartments) that were a few minutes farther down the road. I was so excited about the price and the location is still great, a littler farther from downtown but the apartment is so worth it! The renovations that Chris did are great, I love the flooring, paint colors, it had new carpeting and the room and closet sizes are great, it also comes with a (very small) dishwasher and a washer/dryer. The only issue that I have with this apartment is the amount of noise that I can hear from the people upstairs. Maybe keep the dogs on the 1st floor! ;-)

Chris has been a great landlord and I would absolutely recommend him to any serious students or young professionals looking to be in a great place in Auburn.

name: ASHLEY MURPHREE
text: Badger Properties is a diamond in the rough when it comes to realty companies in a college town. During my four years at Auburn, I used four different realtors. Badger Properties was by far the best! Chris, the owner, is a very kind and respectful business owner! He does not allow freshmen to lease at any of the properties, which is great for studying. I lived in the complex on W. Glenn, which was great because I was able to walk anywhere that I wanted to go (including class and the library)! You will not regret renting from Badger Properties!

name: Clay Grisetti
text:
If you need a place to stay in the Auburn area contact Badger Properties. Myself, the best man at my wedding, my sister, and many of my friends have been incredibly impressed with Chris Kearns and his locations.

Extremely fast repair or response time if you need anything. Friendly management that does a great job taking the worry out of renting.

If you enjoy Auburn life you can find Chris around campus, town, and even at Sporting Events across state lines.

My wife and our families have moved away from Auburn now but we have recommended Badger to many students and professionals and everyone has the same thoughts: if you need a place to stay, call Chris at Badger Properties.

name: Ashley L.
text: Probably one of the most humiliating rental experiences I've ever had as a renter. I went to Badger Properties because I read good reviews on Google and had heard generally good things from people. I went to the office in person and told Chris "the badger" my situation. I was just getting out of a 12 month rehab program, and had been working for a Christian Ministry and looking for an apartment in Auburn since I was a student at Auburn University at the time. I was very up front about my bad credit but was working 7 days a week and had many references etc to back up that I was honest and good for the rent every month. After seeing me alone in his office after hours, and asking me to come along (still alone) with him to see one of the properties (still after hours) I agreed because I was desperately in need of an apartment. He took me to an apartment to collect rent from a girl around my age, then he took me to another apartment where he basically showed me a place and then just sort of "visited" with some tenants. Every one seemed to like him, the apartments were pretty nice for how old they are, regardless, I was impressed at the time. We then went back to his office (once again, all happening after business hours) and he gave me an application, but before he did that he sat me down in the seating area of his office. We were completely alone and it was very dimly lit, and the front door was locked. He asked me extremely probing and personal questions about my past drug use. Mind you, I was sober for over a year at this point, active in church (still am) and admittedly hadn't even smoked a cigarette in over a year. He asked me questions like, "So what led you to do drugs?" "what kind of drugs have you tried?" "how did you do your drugs? did you shoot up? snort them?" He just kept asking SO many invasive and frankly, inappropriate questions; it was almost sadistic. I answered them as honestly as possible without divulging too much, because I really needed an apartment, I was impressed by the ones he had shown me and I thought that being as honest as I could would show him that I was a good tenant despite my bad credit, etc. After filling out an application and getting my credit checked through the program he said he uses to run credit (which gave a very vague summary of ones credit) I went back to his office once I had submitted my credit report and application. He said he didn't think he could rent to me because my credit report showed that I was $25k in debt; I explained that those were my student loans and that the program he uses wasn't showing exactly WHAT the debt was, just the amount. He said he couldn't rent to someone who was that far in debt. I explained that I am a student and that those are my student loans. I said, I would get a more in depth credit report and bring it to him. He gave me back my money order with the application fee on it and said to come back with a new credit report. My aunt is a real estate agent and she ran my credit for me, this time I had a complete credit report with every single student loan showing in detail, but because I had now ran my credit twice in one week, my already poor credit score was even lower. Despite that I went back to "the badger" and told him that the large amount of "debt" he saw was indeed my student loans, which were not even in collection because I was still attending Auburn at the time. He said then said he couldn't rent to someone with a credit score as low as mine and with a history like mine (due to my past drug use I had a criminal record. I have not had a single run in with the law in almost 4 years). So all in all, after wasting time, money, energy and being thoroughly humiliated, I would say that Badger Properties only serves those they deem worthy, and they don't believe in giving people second chances, only sadistically probing and dissecting the past of people who have made mistakes despite turning their lives around. A huge waste of time.

resp.text:
After 15 years of running Badger Homes and Badger Properties, I stand by my record of treating all applicants fairly in terms of their qualifications for an apartment.  They area 1) Credit score, from a tenant or direct relative, 2) Academic progress, and 3) good references from their previous landlord.  As stated above, our screening reports DO only show a credit score, they do not show a full report - meaning, we don't know the type of debt.  Our screening criteria is designed to approve or deny based on the SCORE, regardless of the type of debt.

If this dispute ever got serious, *I could produce a chain of emails which would explain and clearly show the reason for Denial*.  There was never any "trade" or "back door" approval process offered, and their never has been since I started the business.  We document every case of approval or denial, so we are ready to defend against accusations such as these.  That is not how we operate.  To have one negative review in 15 years should be evidence of how we do things.  Are we perfect?  No.  But we don't run the kind of business we are being accused of in the allegations above.

On the rehab comment: I can confidently say that we have rented to people coming from / still in rehab programs.  We have also rented to gay, straight, and many different religions and ethnic backgrounds, as well as singles, married couples, singles with kids, and families.  We have rented to people with low credit scores, also, but they must have a direct relative with a qualifying score be screened and sign as a Guarantor for their lease.  Our records are clear on that as well.  The "second score" that was brought to me to qualify was well below our minimum qualification.  We require a 650, the score presented was well below 600.

As stated above, there was not a qualifying score, and possibly not the required academic progress - but maybe
she met that qualification, I honestly do not recall.  We do not search any Applicant's criminal record, only our employees.

As stated above, I DID refund the Application Fee, and provide a true explanation of the reason for denial.  I do not remember asking questions about shooting or snorting drugs - I don't even know enough about drugs to know what that would mean anyway.  I have never even had a beer in my life, which everyone I've known for 41 years can verify.

After hours, most (not all) of the lights are off in our storefront office, and the door is usually locked, but it is a full glass storefront on a busy street full of shoppers - so hardly a threatening or scary place.  I admit I probably asked questions that I didn't officially need to ask, true.  I am sorry if doing so had a worse impact than I expected.

I do remember that the reviewer above and I did go to see an apartment and collect rent from a neighbor, but in most cases our rent is paid online, and has been for years.  I always thought that giving tours after hours and visiting with tenants after hours was a sign of good customer service, not something I would have to defend later.

If an independent auditor surveyed all of our current and previous tenants - male and female - over the last 15 years, they would come up with a conclusion that we are a little slow on maintenance, tough on noise, but that's about it.  If they surveyed everyone that has applied and that we have turned down over the last 15 years, they would find that there was a clear reason for each denial, and it was based on our written requirements of Credit Score, Academic Progress, and References.  That's it.  There is no evil, juicy story to report.

Ashley applied to rent from Badger in Sept 2014 for a Dec 14 opening..  I admit, I could have done better with the questions or the office lighting(?), but I have made no further attempt to contact her or to be in her life in any way beyond the Application period.  I am not sure why in April of 2016 she has decided to bring these accusations/allegations.

name: Jenneffer Fenyes
text: Very friendly and kind staff. Ginger is lovely and was a big help in putting in work orders for my unit, plus helping me to figure out how to change out my air filter.

name: Dave Hunter
text: I have had the pleasure of having this company manage my house for 10 years. They have done a fantastic job of protecting my house and keeping it in great shape. Any needed repairs were dealt with quickly and at a reasonable price.

resp.text: Thanks Dave, we will sure miss talking with you and Sue.

name: Matt Lowther
text: Ginger is AMAZING! I rented for 3 years and I did not regret one day. They were always fair, honest and easy to work with. I highly recommend this company. Thank you Alabama Coastal Rentals! I truly appreciate your service!

name: Dewayne Boatwright
text: Rented for over a year. Very responsive to the very few issues I encountered. Would rent again. Ginger, Melba, and Daniella were great!

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  We try to be as responsive as possible.

name: BRITTANY BIG FACE!!!!!!
text: She showed me three houses never got me in one got denied for every single one of them it's not willing to help find you a place to live just want to collect application fee to make money never go here

resp.text: I am so sorry you were not approved.  These properties are all individually owned and those owners have the final say in who they approve.  With such limited inventory, we are getting multiple applications on most homes.  The application fee covers the costs of credit report and processing of application to present to owner. I wish we had another property that was suitable for you.

name: Michael Myers
text: I have to say, for the 2 years I rented with Alabama Coastal Rentals, my experience couldn't have been better. The staff, especially Ginger & Jessica, always went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure I was satisfied with their service. They all have great personality,  great sense of humor, and genuinely care. 5 Stars from me!!!!

name: Lawrencia Ratcliff
text: Great customer service

name: SRB
text:
I would like to thank Ginger for all the hard work she did finding us a house in a HURRY!!
Definitely recommend this company!
Unlike the other rental companies in the area, they answer the phone when I call and they called us back when the were supposed to. She listened to what we wanted and found the perfect house for us to rent. We couldn’t have asked for a better representative. Great job and thank you so much.

name: Gina Bush
text: I have rented from Alabama Coastal Rentals for over 5 years and have had Awesome experience from them.  They helped find me a home that meets my families needs and if anything ever went wrong they immediately came out to get it fixed.  I know they can only do so much with having to get permission from owners before doing anything major, which is understandable.  I love this company and would highly recommend them to my friends or family. Ginger is AWESOME!!! If you need a place to rent or buy Alabama Coastal Rentals is the place to go first.

name: Yuki
text: We've rented from Ala coastal rentals for over 5 years. The staff is like family and always accommodating and friendly. Ginger and Andrea would always be there to assist us. The property was exactly what we needed and we were sad to leave due to relocation.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the nice words.  We hate you had to move.....

name: Elizabeth B.
text: From the time I called with interest in leasing a property from the time I moved out...5 stars all the way! ACR staff was so easy to work with, the owner of the property was very accommodating, simply a great experience! Highly recommend!

name: Roberts Dale
text: My name is Tracy Hidalgo and I have rented from Alabama Coastal Rentals for almost a year.  Unfortunately due to circumstances beyond my control, we are having to break our Lease 3 months early.  I have thoroughly enjoyed my stay and can honestly say that any issue I had was met with promptness and professionalism.  Ginger is awesome and so helpful, as is the entire staff.  They have been the best and I would highly recommend anyone looking to lease in Baldwin County to call Alabama Coastal Rentals.  If my circumstances happen to change, I will be calling them again!  Great homes, great service, and great people.  Two thumbs up!!

name: Lisa Mitchell
text: I personally rent from Alabama Coastal Rentals.  I can honestly say that I have NEVER experienced ANY issues such as the ones described.  I recently had a plumbing issue after hours.  I contacted the owner and within 10 minutes received a call from the plumber.  He (the plumber) was working another call at the time but would call once he was on his way.  My issue was resolved VERY professionally and VERY promptly within 1 1/2 hours.  I have lived in apartment complexes where they would not have handled this issue until the next day!  Our lease is up for renewal this next month.  We plan to renew our lease and continue our relationship with Alabama Coastal Rentals as we are VERY pleased with our experience. ------ A side note------ I have never been asked to pay with cash.  I pay my rent each month with a personal check.

name: Zac Smith
text: The staff at Alabama Coastal Rentals, are very helpful, knowledgeable, and personable. Its a small enough business that you are able to deal with the same people each visit, but also large enough to have a great selection of properties to choose from. Overall they are very helpful, quick, concise, and up front about everything. I will definitely use them again and would highly recommend them in the future.

name: Hannah Turner
text: I would highly recommend renting through Alabama Coastal Rentals! The ENTIRE staff was not only extremely polite they were also "for the people" so to say. They are not just looking to bring in people and their money, Alabama Coastal Rentals cares about you and your needs. The apartments I lived in were built long ago but you would not be able to tell do to great upkeep. I had no problems with broken appliances or any hidden errors you might find the longer you stay at a residence. When I did have a tiny shower leak they were incredibly helpful and not rude. I think sometimes you can go to a front desk/office and tell the workers your issues and they feel a bit attacked as if it is their fault and this causes them to have an attitude which in turn makes them not as dedicated to resolving your problems. This WAS NEVER the case with Alabama Coastal Rentals, they never took insult to any problems and truly were genuine with assisting you and giving the proper help you might have needed. I am unsure if they are a family run business but they most definitely care about you and your stay with them as your own kin would.

name: Gooseman Ducky
text:
Zac..... who are you kidding?? I would love to know WHO there is helpful and knows what they are doing??
There is no way you are talking about the same people. Just like all these other people who wrote there experiences...nothing has changed and nobody there cares about helping folks. I would not use them for anything. Makes you wonder why all the money they take up front has to be cash or money order??

name: Nikki Paxson
text: Rented from this company for a year. Extremely pleasant experience. Never had any issues and only moved because I needed a smaller/cheaper place. They are very easy to work with! Andrea and Ginger both are super sweet! I saw a lot of negative reviews once I moved in and thought "oh no what have I gotten myself into" but at the end of my lease I found if you pay your rent on time, follow rules, take care of the property, and do things the right way when you move out you will have no issues! Received my full deposit back with no trouble whatsoever! It was a pleasure working with y'all. Thank you!!

name: Tayler Johnson
text: If possible, please do not rent from this company. I rented from this company for two years. There were problems after problems. When I moved in, nothing was cleaned. The carpets were VERY disgustingly dirty. The walls had dirt ALL OVER THEM. The outlets were hanging out of the walls. The counter tops had burnt spots all over when we moved in. A couple of months before we moved out we had issues with termites. It took the company three weeks to get somebody out to take care of it. They were more worried about getting the cheapest price than about take care of the problem. The best advice that I can give you is that if you have to rent from this company, take as MANY pictures AS POSSIBLE of when you move in and when you move out. If not, they will find EVERY LITTLE thing wrong to keep your security deposit. Also when you move out, make sure to get Ginger and Clayton's approval of how the carpets look because if they do not approve of it and you spend the money on getting them cleaned, they will hire their own carpet company (family members) to come and reclean them and charge you out of your security deposit...

name: Jane Bruton
text: Very Good service from AL Coastal Rentals.  Ginger and Andrea are professional, knowledgeable and  courteous.  Overall great experience.  Would recommend.

name: amanda davison
text: Amazing Company. Ginger and staff are Phenomenal! I wish all rental companies were as professional and good as Alabama Coastal Rentals.

name: Richard Krebs
text: Rented a house in Summerdale from Alabama coastal rentals for over 4 years, if ever there was a problem in the house  it was handled usually the same day..everytime I called people were friendly and helpful . when I bought my own place and had to move,i want to  give a special shout out to Andrea and Ginger who helped me through all the loose ends of moving out and I can not thank them enough, they were great......you can not go wrong renting any place from Alabama Coastal Rentals  5 stars plus... A+A+A+A+A+

name: Ken Woolard
text: I rent a small apartment from these people in Stockton, AL. We have rented from them for 3 months and they have been very nice and understanding. Few that they are, when a problem has arisen, they were quick to send someone to fix it (even if that problem came up late in the day, it was fixed same day). I would recommend to anyone looking for a place to rent from these guys

name: CTaylor
text: I've rented a few properties from them over the past 10 years and have always received great customer service with any issues I had. Most recently came home on a Saturday night to a major plumbing issue that was fixed within 3 hours of me calling!!!👏👏😁😁

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words,

name: Dan
text: I have rented a home in Lake Forrest from this company for 8 months. The staff was incredibly helpful in helping me to locate a single family home for me and my 2 children and is always pleasant and timely with any issues or concerns that have come up. I couldn't have been more pleased.

name: Anne
text: I had a great experience with this company. They were very nice and understanding. Ms. Ginger is the greatest!

name: Miyuki F.
text: When we first moved to the area they helped us locate a great home in Fairhope! Anytime we needed any maintenance they were very quick to get it done. We appreciate the staff at alabama coastal rentals. Even when we moved out they truly had our backs.

name: Sarah Barrett
text: Great experience and friendly staff. No issues with rental throughout stay. Would use this rental company again.

name: sharon Skoglund
text: You people voting 5 stars that haven't ever trusted them with your money shouldn't be rating them! If you haven't signed or ended a lease with this company your giving opinions not facts about how they do business.

resp.text: I am not sure why you are posting this.  You damaged the house upon vacating.  You did not dispute the charges until the front door that you damaged was not replaced .  The owner compensated the new buyers for the damaged door in their purchase contract for them to take care of in the future. When you took the owners and us to court, the judge did not side with you.

name: Pamela Rawdon
text:
While utilizing the services of Alabama Coastal they spent MY  money to repair a major problem.  They never sent anyone to do the job correctly.  The ceilings were ruined downstairs due to a large leak.  The persons they placed in my property were calling me and screaming about the leak.  I tried to explain that this is the reason one hires a rental company.

Alabama Coastal's work is poor at best.  They also make you sign, as part of your contract. that if the property is sold they receive a real estate commission.  That is fine if you don't have another realtor you choose to use.

name: Megan Marley
text: Great company!  They have found great families to keep my house rented for the last 2 years.

resp.text: Thanks Megan!

name: Amy Hoyt
text: These people are a joke!! No one knows what in the hell is going on, they have a red neck woman that smells like train smoke, foul mouth, with a low cut shirt at the front desk , the agent  says she doesn't know the answer to any of our questions because she has only been there for a few months.... we go in and talk to the so call "Owner" of the company and he is a complete idiot , dresses like the maintenance man and wants to start talking football with us instead of the issues at hand! Would NOT Recommend this place!

name: Steven Wetzonis
text: Great people!  Everyone that I have encountered at alabama coastal rentals has been very friendly and straight forward.  They showed up on time for the showing of the unit and did so with very short notice.  Ginger has been great to work with and we look forward to seeing her everymonth.

name: Jennifer Boone
text: ACR Manages one of our properties for us. We have never had any issue with them. If there has been any issue, they have always called and got permission for repairs and have used owner funds very conservatively. We are happy with their service and the speed and at which they place qualified renters in our home.

name: Amanda Shaw
text: Lived in a unit owned by this company for over one year. The keys we were given did not access the front door. The problem was never fixed. Other problems we reported were addressed within a reasonable amount of time. They were fair with returning our security deposit after we moved out, though it took a very long time (more than two months after moving) to receive it, and several calls from my husband.

resp.text: Our records show that you lived in a property that we manage in Bay Minette. You were the first tenant we placed there and the Owner had not given us a key to the door you are describing - but you had a key to the door that was closest to parking.  We show that you paid full July rent.  We were not aware if you moved out prior to Aug 1.  We show that your deposit check was sent to you Sept 14th (45 days).  I am sorry that you were disappointed with your move-out. We wish you the best in your new home.

name: Billy Brown
text: Great staff I have known the owners for years and operate with honesty and integrity. Great inventory to choose from and great for new people on the area

name: Paul Turner
text:
I've leased property through these guys for about 3 years with zero issues.

Any time something fails and needs repair they send a service guy almost immediately. I appreciate they take issues so seriously and respond like they do...I give them a 10 out of 10.

name: cedric goines
text: Ginger has to be the hardest working person in Baldwin County! Whenever we had any issues, no matter what time of day, she was there to help. From what i hear, she does this for everyone. I rented from Alabama Coastal for two years and can honestly say that we didnt have any problems at all.

name: Hewitt Ballard
text: This is a great company. I have used them for 6 years.

name: Samantha Lynn
text: Awesome place to rent from

name: Jackson Hawley
text: We LOVED our time in this property (Sunrise Village unit 110) in Gulf Shores! Just literally steps away from the sand and toes in the water. Our unit was ready to check in before our arrival time! We will never stay anywhere else while in Gulf Shores.

name: Dusti Baldridge
text:
We have had one of the condos reserved for over a year it was recently bought by this company. We were told they would
Honor our reservation, when we called to Secure it we were then told it is now 3700 and not the price we paid over a year ago. They changed the amount of people allowed to stay which is less then what we have and the guy was very rude. Mind you this was done 25 days before we are to be leaving for vacation. There is nothing available now for anywhere close to what we paid and they had no try to help resolve except pay the price that is way more then what we had it booked and paid for it.This is horrible business to basically throw someone’s whole vacation out the window 25 days before they are to leave and not try to honor or work with the customer.

resp.text: Please disregard this review, as this is not a guest or a renter of ours.  We do not buy condos, nor do we own any unit referenced.  The condo was purchased by an individual and anyone can rent it. The buyer instructed us to rent it at market rates and not permit substantial overloading, which is their right and we cannot tell the owner what to do.  This person called and berated our employee who was following the new owner's instructions.

name: Kim Cole
text: My family and I stayed in Shoalwater 1106 in July 2020.  The check-in & out process was easy, and the staff was always friendly.  The condo was roomy and well stocked. We really enjoyed the 3 bathrooms and the roominess of the condo.  We are looking forward to staying there again this year!

name: Nikki Costelloe
text:
Great location. Balcony is over the Holiday Inn pool so there is noise from that. However, likely always over a pool when on the beach. The only difference with the Holiday Inn pool is they alway have water splaying into the pool so there is always a spray noise. This is very minor but could be an annoyance by some.
Very well stocked!! Always had the dish or utensil we needed. Beautiful view with the windows on both the back and side! Would stay here again.

name: Joe Doyle
text:
Broken washer, dirty water, cockroaches, and terrible customer service.

I'll start by saying Gulfsands Rentals offered to compensate me $30 for my trouble, but in my mind is totally unacceptable for the situation. I requested 1 night be reimbursed out of the 7 that we stayed - then after two more emails they never responded.  And apparently this is regarded as a threat by them.

We arrived and the first thing we noticed is the washer door is open and about 1 foot full of filthy dark brown water. We called and got somebody trying to fix it but was unsuccessful. Repair man was great but stated they have been unable to fix washer over past weeks. I left to go to the beach and let him do his work. After 2 days of not hearing anything back I had to call office and ask about what they were going to do about the water. Somebody came to drain it. After a couple more days of not hearing about repair status I asked and they said it's unfixable.

The troublesome part about the washer is they knew it was having issues for weeks and never notified us we would be unable to do laundry. A family of 4 on a beach vacation needs this. I would have found another option. The attitude was consistently like we were a burden and it's no big deal to not have a washer. I'm on vacation and last thing I want to do is spend hours at the laundromat - but apparently that's only worth $30 of trouble.

Additionally there was never anything in the ad about the washer being broken.  Only after my numerous complaints did Gulfsands update their descriptions to say washer did not work.  If you look at other reviews online apparently this has been an issue for months.

Also we found two huge dead cockroaches each about 2.5 inches long. I guess this was the result of the exterminators that arrived unannounced to apply poison in our condo. Between the washer and the exterminator we had 3 visits from maintenance personnel while we are trying to relax on vacation.

Also 2 of the 3 TVs were unable to connect to the Wi-Fi. Not a big deal on beach vacation but worth mentioning. Cable doesn't work in 1 bedroom too.

Also even though Covid restrictions are lifted, Gulfsands is still doing a "remote" check in that is cumbersome. It feels like they are using the situation as an excuse to not have to interact with people. The office you pick your keys up at resembles a maximum security prison with all the cameras and just seems over the top.

Positives were tons of hot water, good location across from Waves (groceries, beer, ice, fishing, etc), and normally an OK value if these problems would have been resolved. Condo is certainly dated.

Overall I can't recommend based on my experiences with how the company is managed and the troubles I described with the condo.

*Update*  I think all you need to do is read the response from the owner below to validate they are unreasonable and probably not worth your business :)

resp.text: Please disregard this review.  This was a guest who threatened us with reviews if we did not pay them a free night for their washer being out of service.  This is a $30 credit item, which is the highest to any guest, as most were $10.  This is for groups of 6.  The guest told staff to 'keep it', as we learned after departure that they wanted more than $200.  This is called post exit rental extortion and is common in the market, especially this year.  We did confirm with the guest that if we didn't pay that amount, he would go on web sites to write negative reviews?  As you can see, this is the result.  The other issues appeared only after the request for money, which is also how this game works.  We don't play, as most other agents have stopped as well.  BTW, a large bug as described is a palmetto bug, and it is not from the condo, as it simply walked in an open door to escape the heat.  That's where they come from, outside.  We wish the guest the best, and hope they enjoy our beaches another time.  The water in the washer was soapy, and emptied as soon as requested, as we had to purchase a pump.  We also treated unit with bleach so it smelled clean.  Pest control comes once every 90 days, and not to poison their condo, but to treat pests, as with every condo in the city.  The new washer was on order, and was noted as not functioning in the rental ad since March 2021.  A new timer was installed for the prior guest to gain some life from the unit, and the unit was working for them, then failed again, as we waited several weeks for the new washer to arrive, which it since has.  Stack units were in high demand due to damages from Hurricane Sally and new construction, so they were not available from any source.  We had to wait weeks for it, but compensated each guest fairly.  This is a review done to intentionally hurt us for non payment of an amount that was not going to happen.

name: Cindy Pinson
text: Stayed here for a week in August and it was fantastic. Place was clean, roomy and had all the comforts of home. More than enough cookware for any kind of cooking you want to do (even a big pot for making a seafood boil). Great beach access and a nice grill. Everything was as described and the books and puzzles were a really nice touch! Communication was perfect from start to finish. Will definitely stay here on any future trips to Gulf Shores. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

name: Emily White
text: We had a great stay!  Communication and booking with Gulfsands Rentals was super easy.  Emails detailed everything we need to know and bring with us.  Check in and out was easy and simple.  Unit 503 was very clean, had new and stylish furnishings, and was very spacious for our family.  Definitely recommend and will still again.

name: Cheri Rash
text: I made reservations for October 22-25, we got there and got our things unpacked. I received a phone call that my mother had passed away and I had to leave the same day. I asked about rescheduling and they will only reschedule for this year even though my work will not let me off during November and December as I work retail. Will not give a refund and I can’t let someone else go in my place. I would think under the circumstances they would work with me because I would love to go back. But definitely do not recommend this company with this kind of service.

name: Hollie Bright
text: We stayed at harbor house B17 everything was great! But the master king size bed needs a new mattress! There is a big dip in the bottom of it which doesn’t make for a good nights rest! Other than that we will definitely stay again!

name: Susan White
text: We stayed at the Blue Atlantis in Gulf Shores July 4-11.  This beach house was perfect for our family.  We loved the kitchen!  There was a problem with a sanitation concern, but it was taken care of a day later.  The beach was wonderful with just a few people from the row of homes...like having a private beach.   The upstairs media room was occupied every day.  If you have a large family of adults and children, you need to check out this home.

name: Michele Kuntz
text: We have used Gulf Sands for 5 years and we are getting ready to book our next vacation. They took care of us each time we had questions or concerns and went above and beyond. As long as well keep coming we will use them to book.

resp.text: Michele, thank you for your kind words and for your continued, repeat business.  -Gulfsands Rentals Team

name: Jeremy Chrastina
text: We have stayed at Southern Sands multiple times over the past few years.  We love the accessibility to everything and the smaller feel of the building.  Very easy in and out of the parking garage as well as the units.  Beachfront is a huge plus.  Walk right out into the beach.  Great views of the coast and sunsets. We tried out a different spot last year and the whole time we were all saying how we wished we had booked at Southern Sands.  We are heading back to Southern Sands this year for sure.

name: Michael Durio
text: We loved our stay for the Labor Day Holiday everything was just as they said it would be.  The condo was well stocked with the essentials, great location and the beach was not to crowded even though it was a holiday weekend.

name: Dianne Epperson
text: Castaways 9C was a good place to stay. Very clean.  Beds were very comfortable.  Only problem was the parking spaces were way to small.  Everything else was just fine.

name: Darci Reeves
text: Stayed at Sunrise Village RM 104 and it was comfortable.  Could use some updating on the mattress but besides that it was fine. 3rd time to stay at Sunrise Village and love the location! Will be back!

name: Kelly Bordelon
text: We stayed at Sunrise village 103 and we were very pleased with our stay. 3 adult and 3 children and it was the PERFECT location right on the beach. It was so convenient here for carrying things on the beach and as well as the store right across the street. The only thing to note would be the screen on the window in the bedroom by the kitchen was ripped off and in that same room there were clothes tags behind the nightstand and a hanger that i seen when inspecting the room (i once was a hotel manager with superb inspecting skills lol). Evidence of previous guest was a bummer but not a big issue since it was just clothes tags because everything else was clean and wonderful. I hope they continue to keep this property up it is way too convenient and we will be back!! The kids loved it here as well! Thanks for an amazing last minute stay!

name: David Mcelhaney
text: This was the perfect location for a family getaway.  The townhouse is directly on the beach which is nice considering it's surrounded by highrises.  Being on the beach allowed for us to come and go as we pleased without having the hassle of going up and down flights of stairs or elevators.  We had 8 in our party and we were all comfortable the entire time with plenty of room to spread out.  We have already recommended to other family and friends and will be back the next time we come to Gulf Shores.

name: Rebecca Payne Rodriguez
text: We stayed at Seaside 3104 and was very pleased. We have stayed at the same place for the last 10 years. Different condos within the same building. You just can’t beat the location. The  building has great parking, sometimes right up to your door. The condo is on the ground floor so no elevators to deal with. Pool is just a few feet away. The master mattress needs to be changed out as it lumpy and hard to sleep on. Floors could have been cleaner upon arrival and there was a dead cockroach on the kitchen floor upon arrival when it should have been just cleaned. Nothing to ruin or stay but those two things need to be addressed.

name: Jeffrey Geddes
text: Excellent service. Loved our stay in Gulf Shores. Very responsive and helpful office. Highly recommended! We love this location as it is more family friendly than other locations appear to be. Being right on the beach at Sunchase was incredible.

resp.text: Thanks so much and we look forward to your next trip!

name: sally randall
text: loved how responsive and helpful they were . Made us feel like they really wanted us to be happy . Nice to feel that way. Very personable and we were not expecting that - as busy as we know they were and are. Really nice people .

name: Cindy Green
text: Harbor House sits on the beach and was wonderful for our stay. The condo itself was a little small but we stayed on the beach all day. It was a wonderful get away!

name: Brandy warden
text: Stayed at the hangout B duplex! Awesome view easy access to the beach and walking distance to the hangout and several shopping places! Customer Service for GulfSand rentals was also excellent they answered all my questions and was very patient. I will be booking again with them when we go back to Gulf Shores.

name: Randi Cialdella
text: Great beach access!  Kitchen updates were beautiful!  Had a little bit of a bathroom issue, and maintenance was quick to respond.  We will be back!

name: Charlene Naramore
text: Absolutely loved everything about our stay.  Gulfsands Rental had contactless service which went perfect.  Our condo was so clean and we will be using Gulfsands again for our future stay!

name: Brooke Walkup
text: This rental company was very unresponsive to my needs. I did not receive  the codes I needed to get into the condo on time. The after hours gentleman on the phone was the only helpful person I ever spoke with. Then once we were finally in; the A/C unit was not working. We spent the first night with NO A/C.  We called for someone to come out that night, but no one ever showed up. I had to call again the next day, then they sent someone out to take care of the problem. I was never compensated or even given a phone call to make sure everything was ok. I even e-mailed them once we were home, they have not responded. Overall this company was very poor! If I owned a condo I would NOT use them as a rental company!

resp.text: Regrettably, we have no one with this name on file.  All check ins receive their box codes as soon as their unit is ready, via email, contactless check in with Covid mandates.  All guests receive detailed instructions the day prior to check in, so they are always on the lookout for the check in email.  We be sure to prepare all guests well in advance due to required state mandates currently in place.  We hope you visit our beaches again and wish you the best.

name: Ginny Duren
text: This was our 4th stay at Southern Sands 305 and it was great as always. Favorite thing about this condo is the balcony. It's huge! We love staying here!

name: Dianne Joy
text: The keyless entry! It’s a must!!! The last thing you want to have to carry with you to the beach is keys.... thank you for having a keyless entry!! The room was spacious and clean and the beds very comfortable! we had an issue with a toilet but we were taken care of immediately! Thank you!!

name: Kevin Green
text: We stayed at Royal Palms next to the state park. Customer service was great! Very prompt response and courteous on the phone. The day we arrived we did a walk through and noticed hair on the floor in the bathroom inside the master bedroom, and there was a strong odor of urine. After raising the toilet seat cover we noticed there was urine on the seat, the rim, and the back of the toilet. We went to the store and bought some cleaner to clean up the mess but could not get the urine smell to dissipate so we closed the door and only used the hall bathroom.
