It seemed the previous renters had left various children's toys and McDonalds cups in the condo as well. While this wasn't really an issue it made for a disorganized appearance. The A/C was cold, the water was hot, and the view was perfect. I believe your cleaning contractor leaves a lot to be desired and could do a much better job. Knowing that you have various people renting, as a condo owner I would suggest purchasing matching dinner and flatware as well as all cookware. While the appliances were all in working order the dishwasher and washer/dryer were very dated and the stove elements were crooked and awkward to cook on. We absolutely loved the leather/vinyl couch and strongly recommend getting away from fabric furniture unless it is professionally cleaned. I understand the costs of owning beachfront property to be quite expensive, but for the price it could use some updating. You could utilize the cleaning company to check inventory of everything on the day of checkout and charge the renter for anything missing or broken items. Also I strongly encourage you to purchase darkout curtains for the master bedroom as the outside lights and early sunrise made it very cumbersome to sleep. The only reason this got 4 stars was due to the nastiness of the room. We would definitely give this company and owner another chance in the future because we love Gulf Shores and it is our favorite vacation destination so we will be back.

name: Jennifer Boudreaux
text: Very nice place.. comfy beds and convenient location! We will be back. Great value for your money!

name: William Tashie
text: We just finished our 4th year renting at Ocean Reef thru Gulfsands. They always respond quickly and accommodated our request to clean our unti early as we have young kids that nap early in the afternoon. The recent updates to yhe until we're a nice surprise and the new deck was also very nice to have for.our small kids. We will be staying again and hopefully for many years to come. Thanks Gulfsands for accommodating our family!

name: Arnelis Pitre
text: Horrible and rude people to work with. They don't represent the southern hospitality. They don't had any courtesy or consideration to my family. They run their business horribly!! They have a horrible and unsafe "welcome package" set up in where other people can get access to your information. We felt treat by the staff of this place. The people who may recommend  may know them.

resp.text: We always deeply regret any review below 5 stars, and we wish this guest the best for their future.  With the pandemic, our lobby is closed, so we provide detailed check in instructions, and even a laminated sign concealing the check in boxes (so it must be reviewed) reminding guests to only take your package, as there is another one in the same box.  This guest unfortunately took their check in package, and another guest's check in package, so they had 2.  The guest called and told us they had another package, and we needed them to  return the package for the other guest.  This is when the guest became upset with us and did not wish to return it.  The guest did return the package later. The guest then called indicating they could not get into the condo, and became more upset.  The guests were at the wrong door (they were at the unit storage locker).  We got them to the right spot once we figured out where they were.  We do regret this, but during COVID-19, our lobby is not open, and we do all we can to show guests what to do, and we will walk you thru any issue with a call, which we did when we understood where they were.   We did nothing wrong except give a super deal on a last minute 2 night stay with 15% off on top, and an Early Check-In too!  We only wish the guest had taken only their package, as we know this is what created the tension.  Our check in process is very safe, as we've been using it for 25 years without issue.  No one has access to any info about another guest, except their name if they happen to take that guest's package, as the check in boxes are combination locked, and only the guest has the combination.  There is no personal info in any check in package, other than name.

name: Jason Busby
text: We stayed at  Harbor House B20 and could not have been more pleased. Location was great. The condo was very clean and up to date. You cannot beat the beach access, just a short walk across the parking lot. Parking was very convenient. There is a small store directly across the road from the condos. I highly suggest paying just a little more and go there instead of trying to fight the crowd at Walmart!! My family and I will definitely stay here again.

resp.text: Hi Jason, we are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay at Harbor House B20!  Thank you for your feedback.  We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

name: Chip Gebert
text: Great people to deal with! Stayed with them before and will stay with them in the future!

name: Dustin Davis
text: Stayed at Crystal Shores West 905. This agency made booking, paying, and checking in so easy and accommodating. Couldnt have worked out any better and been any easier. Thank you. Although we had to cut our trip a day short for family reasons, this particular condo and location were perfect for us. Zero complaints.

name: Carson Dabbs
text: We stayed at Gulfside Townhomes 13. The unit was great and we had no complaints at all. I would like to say thank you to the staff at Gulfsands for making our family vacation so great! The entire process was wonderful from booking to checkout. You won't go wrong if you plan your vacation through Gulfsands!

name: Rachael Myers
text: I am the Kennel Manager for the Baldwin County Humane Society(BARC) and Gulf Sands made a HUGE, very much appreciated donation today of many supplies we desperately needed. They are a wholesome, local company that has our utmost gratitude. Thank You Gulf Sands!

name: Dayvault Robert
text: Stayed at Sunrise Village unit 110. Carpet dirty, no ones vacuumed under beds or under furniture in who knows. Mold on shower curtain. No hangers for clothes. Huge gap under door lets in everything including the cockroaches we killed in the kitchen. Everything worked thank God. Cold A/C, hot water adequate. Lack of kitchen utensils was a challenge cooking. The major thing was I think I paid for a pool and I just couldn't find it anywhere? So it's buyer beware, location is the only thing that saves this place. Even that won't bring me back there other properties close by just as cheap and nicer, I looked.

resp.text: We always appreciate guests taking the time to write comments, but we'd ask readers to please discount this review.  This guest was occupying the unit (mid stay) when he posted this review and never contacted us about any issue.  We emailed, called, and left VM to instruct guest where the pool is located and help to improve his stay.  We dispatched maintenance to address any issues and to show the guest the pool location; however, he was told to leave..but we did provide more hangers to add to those already there.  We honestly don't know if he found the pool, but it's on the north side of the complex in the fenced pool area.  This unit is booked solid, with no open in-season dates due to extreme popularity, and great reviews for value and location.  We tried hard here to assist with any issue.  The bedrooms are very small in Sunrise, so a standard vacuum will not fit under beds there, just a broom, and if any items were missed from prior guest, we'd always address an issue immediately, but we called off the housekeeping crew after maintenance was shown the door.  After the guest departed, we reviewed for issues, found standard pots/pans for cooking, and did address a gap under the front door with a custom door sweep.

name: Ellie Kelsey
text: I have used gulfsands rentals for about 6 Years now and have absolutely loved our stays. We’ve stayed at a few. The staff is great and we look forward to every year... sincerely, the Kelsey’s

name: Drew Deshotels
text: Everything was great, we really enjoyed our visit and the staff at Gulf Sands we're very helpful and efficient. Checking in and out couldn't have been easier. Thanks for a wonderful visit, can't wait to come back!

name: Ronald Woods
text: Found a huge cockroach in the bathroom. I killed it and took a picture, called the office. (Unit- Ocean Reef 702) Explained that this was unacceptable and I would be leaving with my family because of this. Lady said it was “just a bug.” Refused to give any type of refund. This was day 1 of a 4 day stay. Also very musty in the unit, floors were super dirty. When I walked across with my bare feet they were super dirty from the buildup.

resp.text: Hi, we did investigate and noted to the guest we'd be back to them, but they filed this regardless, after noting they'd leave a terrible review if we did not give them money.  As expected, the critter was a palmetto bug, and it likely walked in from an open door, not an issue anyone could correct or anticipate.  It was in the front closet by the main door, and not the bathroom. This is common during our heat wave, as these are large bugs trying to get into the cool unit from an open door, as they hang out by the beach.  No issues of cleaning were mentioned. We will always address any issue for any guest at any time, but we weren't notified of anything until after the guest had left the following day.  No issues were found with the unit, and the palmetto was simply removed.  Renovated, popular, 5-star gulf front townhome.

name: Andrew More
text: I've worked with Gulfsands Rentals since May 2009 and I've been very pleased with the quality of service provided. They are a full-service rental company, trust worthy, and I highly recommend them. My experience was consistently strong rents year-over-year and good communication regarding maintenance items. Great team to work with.

name: rachel saunders
text: The room and accommodations were good for the price, but the cleanliness left something to be desired. The place hadn't been dusted in a long time, the walls had dirt and grime on them, the window glass was dirty, there were dirty dishes in the cupboard upon arrival. I would have loved it if It would have just been clean. I left information for the manager detailing these concerns when I turned my key in. As well priced and convenient as it was,I doubt we will return.

name: DeShunta Wright-Fields
text: My family and I visit Gulf Shores every six months because we love Gulf Shores so much and every visit we use Gulf Sands Rentals. In fact, my husband and I celebrate our wedding anniversary here every year. We have never had any problems with this company. In fact, we love them! We won't rent from any place else. Stephanie is always so accommodating. Her customer service skills are exemplary! We've stayed in a few of their units at Island Sunrise and we completely satisfied. I'm not sure where all the bad reviews are coming from but I can't agree with any of them. My husband and I are visiting Gulf Shores in two weeks for my husband's birthday and our 5th wedding anniversary, we hope this trip is as good as our previous trips! Thank Gulf Sands Rentals for always making our trips to Gulf Shores so relaxing and worry-free!

name: Kathryn Williams
text: What A Scam!! We traveled from the great Northwest to Gulf Shores for the first time. We booked a "condo" in February based on photos on the internet. We were not allowed to see the property until this despicable "businessman" had all our money which was a total of $920. The place was a complete dump! The railing was falling apart. The steps were very dangerous and there was trash around the property. The unit was old and rundown with old furniture and a strange smell. When we rejected the reservation we were told that we would not be getting a refund. What a scam! So, we spent $920 for nothing!! What a rotten way to run a business. I don't know how you sleep at night!  We moved on to a clean, well-kept hotel room right on the beach. You have ruined a beautiful place for us.  We will be telling everyone we know of our experience. "What goes around comes around". You will "get yours" one of these days. Scumbag!

resp.text: We have over 15,000 guests per year, and in business for 20 yrs.  We had seen any items on this page before, so working to reply.  These guests broke all policy, and apparently departed in the middle of the night, but never spoke to anyone.  They booked many months in advance, and saw this cute, economy property online, the actual unit, long before arrival.  Please note, that if this were true, their credit card company would have quickly refunded them, as we work closely to comply with all credit card policies.  Please see our website for accurate reviews, as we have been in business a very long time. 'A' rating on Better Business Bureau also.  Regrettably, we will work to resolve any issue with any guest.  We never spoke to these people, but they use the Internet in regrettably ways, which has become all to common today.  We wish them well regardless.

name: jason testa
text: Top Notch Service! Made the whole reservation a breeze. Very Pleased with our Selection. We stayed at their beach house "Toto" and I must say the view was absolutely stunning. Just A few steps from the back door and You are in the Sand! Could not be Happier. We will be back this summer! Thank you!

name: Krista Haugland
text: I have stayed at sunrise village 7-8 times over the past 8 years.  I love the location, the area is quite and the rooms are always clean. I feel safe at this location and the beach isn't overly full.

name: Kim Terry
text: The Condo is a little dated and worn but clean and close to the beach.

name: Chris
text: Hung up on me when I called in for the first time. Unbelievable

resp.text: Hi Chris, regrettably we did not hear anyone on the other end of the line.  We repeatedly noted ‘gulfsands’ but heard no reply. Likely a connection issue on your end or ours. Any issue was technical and nothing intentional. These things can happen, but never are we trying to disconnect. Hope to hear back in the future!

name: Rachel Frey
text: We love Sunrise Village! Perfect location right on the beach. We will continue to stay here year after year!

name: Tracey Tracey
text: Just getting back from a most wonderful vacation.  Thank you to Gulfsands Rentals for your beautiful accommodations - everything was perfect!!!  We are already planning our trip next year!

name: Sarah Chenault
text:
I rented from Gulfsands Rentals, condo Royal Palms 1202. Although the accommodations were sufficient, they were not as advertised. To begin, we were under the assumption, based on the listing descriptions, that our condo 1202 was penthouse level. Upon arrival we were the last floor before penthouse, but the view was amazing.

This condo is listed to sleep 6 people. The accommodations read king size bed, sofa sleeper and two bunk beds. Specifications should have said children size bunks. The fold out still had plastic on the mattress and sounded like sleeping in a bag of potato chips.  The couch was more comfortable to sleep on as a sofa.

The first two showers that were taken in the hall bathroom were ice cold, as turning the knob to H made the water remain cold leading us to believe the hot water heater was broken. Upon calling Gulfsands Rental, we were informed that the hot/cold was reversed, meaning H was cold and C was hot. The exact words of the agent were, "Oh, that is reversed, try keeping the knob on cold." There was nothing posted to this affect in the bathroom, even though this as a known issue by the rental company.

In the master bedroom, the ceiling fan was not working. When calling the rental company they stated it worked only with a remote of which there was not one. A maintenance request was put in. When the guy showed up to look at it he said the motor was blown and he would have to either order a new part or a new fan. It was not fixed during our 5 night stay. We called on day one about the fan.

Other minor issues were the floor was not clean when we arrived, the wifi connection was unreliable and when eating, the only place for multiple people to eat was on the balcony, 3 deep on the soft or perched on the most uncomfortable bar stools ever created.

To sum up the review, the rental company should have been more forthcoming about known issues prior to booking. We feel we did not get what we paid for. I

I tried to post this on their website, but all reviews are moderated by them so the likelihood of it being seen on their website is slim to none.

resp.text: We regret this review, as the guest was looking at unit 1306 initially, but that unit was not available...penthouse level 1306...and 1202 was and offered with a link to view this unit.  This unit is not, and has never been noted as penthouse level, this was a guest mistake.  Unit 1202 is one level below the penthouse level and 12th floor is no different otherwise.  Nothing special is available on the penthouse floor.  Bunks are photo'd online and ARE described for children.  Sounds like the stay was very good, but not indicated as such.  The shower is actually correct, but we have found the simplest way to note how it works to the guests that have issues is to say its reversed.  There is an arrow on the rounded side of shower arm pointing to the H and C, but most folks miss it, so they assume the arm is to point to H or C.  We regret the issue, but it's just how it was manufactured.  The stools are brand new and heavy duty.  Don't know what else we can say.  This is a wonderful, updated condo with a great view.  We did report the fan not working to the owner, and he is fedexing his replacement for arrival today, as they are special units.  Light worked, and the AC makes the unit very cold, but one fan did not turn during the stay, and we did everything we could to repair it.  We received a 2 star review.  We view this review as inappropriate, as we have great deals and this is a very nice condo.  We feel reviews like this have no place on the web, but they have become commonplace as people will go out of their way to damage a company's reputation with little issue, but the thousands of happy guest won't take the time to note the great time they had.  We have had 12,000 guests just this season....in 20 years we have 8 posts on google.  We always let the reader decide.

name: Patricia Mcwhorter
text: We have used Gulf Sands for years and have been thoroughly pleased with our experiences!  Great rentals at good prices, friendly/efficient staff, and gorgeous beaches - what more could you want?!?!

resp.text: Hey Patricia! Thank you so much for this amazing review! We appreciate your business and we are so happy to hear that you are enjoying your experiences with us! We look forward to host your next vacation rental! - Gulfsands Team

name: Jim Turner
text: Just left today...awesome weather, great spot.  Had one issue, but they sent someone out fast and all got fixed quick.  Thanks guys...back again next year!!

name: Stacey Morgan
text: The whole process with them was like pulling teeth. We are two families that have booked a vacation together the past 3 years. We have been able to list both families and each pay our own part separately with no issue except for here. They will only let 1 person be on the contract and that is the only person that can pick up the keys. It's really inconvenient and aggravating when we travel in separate vehicles and arrive at different times. I stated such to the guy in the office and his attitude was like those at the DMV "oh well, this is how it is,  you have no choice but to get over it". Again, as an owner of the condo, I would want a different company dealing with my renters.

resp.text: Hi Stacey, thanks for your note.  We regret that our credit card policy created your review, as we hope your vacation was enjoyable and you felt you got a good deal (we have the best agent pricing in that complex).  Our policy is provided up front in our rental agreement and also on our Policies page on our web site to keep folks informed.  Card policies in the accommodations industry continually change and have become quite strict.  We follow all Visa, MC, AMEX and Discover policies as they protect both you and the condo owner.  We did offer the option of sending checks from multiple parties, since we can only accept CC payment from the person signing the agreement, and you did send checks from 2 different parties for payment.  We hope that helped.  With check in, our policy is the same as a hotel, and only the person on the reservation can check in.  We can add an additional tenant prior to check in, but they need to sign an agreement and also have a card on file.  Please know that our goal is to make your stay enjoyable, but we do note our policies up front and have to abide by them.

name: Connie Moody
text: Great,family owned rental company! Best rates in Gulf Shores(compared several others)! Always enjoy our trips of many years,now!

name: Sharon Haugen
text: We have rented from them for 8 years you would think that means something but we were treated very bad this tshaugen@frontiernet.net we have got the problem fixed and we will be renting from them again this year.

resp.text: We regret this review from a customer, but this was simply the guest wishing us to provide free nights for extending their stay, and we offered a 50% off rate, which was super and the guests indicated they would call us back.  When they did, they noted how badly we treated them, did not take the big discount, and left on time.  We regret they didn't wish take the discount, but we did not deserve this review for offering a great deal.

name: Susan Frederick
text: Really pleased with our stay. Our condo was right on the beach, well equipped  and very clean. Helpful staff- seamless service

name: Ashley Marotta
text: Great experience with Gulfsand Rentals! Loved our stay here and the whole process was quick and easy, will totally be back!

name: Trese Mashburn
text:
Regatta 203C -
While we absolutely LOVE this property and this will be our 3rd year in a row to stay in this unit, the reservation process this time was beyond ridiculous. This new management company was difficult to reach, several calls were made to attempt to reserve the unit during "normal business hours", but was met with a message that the office was closed during said hours. We always make this trip with family friends and we split the cost and deposit. This management team made that process nearly impossible and the young lady that I dealt with was rude, kept repeating herself without making herself clear, AND talked over me constantly. The previous management company for this property was friendly, helpful and accomodating with the separate payments - unfortunately this management company was anything but. It should not be this difficult to give a business my money. Still looking forward to our stay however, and will continue to stay in this unit as long as it is available because we love the unit and it's location with proximity to everything.

name: Jim Thompson
text: Great company we've used for years.

name: Sarah Daigle
text: There was absolutely nothing to like about Island Sunrise #556 but the view! This had to be the most disgusting condo I have ever walked into. There were missing and burned out lights throughout the unit. The linens and towels were poorly laundered. Before we could ever eat, we had to wash all of the silverware and dishes. There was hair all over the floors and when we tried to use the vacuum in the unit, all it did was spray sand everywhere and smell like a wet dog. Even the cushions on the couch and chairs felt wet and smelled like mildew. I have spent MANY vacations along the Gulf Coast and this one was truly regrettable. We checked out 2 days early because of the filthy conditions in the condo!

name: perin elliott
text:
First of all, sent payment in the form of a cashier's check, and just because it wasn't a "postal money order" they wouldn't accept it, so I had to go back to my credit union, withdraw another $200 and take cash down there with us and get the cashier's check back from them.  Ridiculous.  Any cashier's check is as good as cash.

Secondly, got to the condo and it was nothing like the photos or as described.  They say in the literature they send you there are "beach balls, beach chairs and umbrella" at the condo.  No such thing.  And no information at the condo on where or how to rent any.  Condo was much smaller than described and much older.  Some of the steps leading up to the second floor were dangerously high and some of the floor on the balcony outside is wet and apparently about to cave in.

First night there my husband needed to work on some homework for school and the internet was down.  Had to wait until the next day, then had to drive to their office to get it fixed - this after several calls to customer support.

Remote to main t.v. is broken.  They have a bad ant problem in the kitchen.  They give you NO extra towels or garbage liners.

We were VERY disappointed in this place and will NOT be using them again.

resp.text: We regret our guest would post this review, as the information noted is simply not accurate, and the guest never complained about any issued presented, with the exception of an Internet log in issue, which we helped to resolve with the utility provider.  To note each: payment submitted was not a cashiers check, which we did our best to accurately note to the guest. All payment options are sent to guests at time of booking.  A bank check is not certified funds, as this was not a cashier's check.  Beach balls are not in any unit, and no such items are noted in any information we provide.  Beach chair/umbrella rental info is provided with check in docs, including cost, vendor name on the beach and phone number for contact/reserving. Photos are exactly unit 205 which was completely remodeled from scratch...100% new interior rebuilt in February 2015, including all cabinets, interior doors..everything in the unit, except the shower stall.   Remote works fine, and no issue reported.  We provide 6 towels and a washer/dryer.  Condo is advertised as 600 sq ft, and it is just that also. We provide every guest with 'Things to Remember to Bring' and tell them at the time of booking. No ants were reported and nothing was found.  Guest WALKED into our office, to report Internet issues, which is provided by a 3rd party utility, and we called for them and appear to have gotten login issue resolved.   None of the items above were reported at that time or at anytime until now. This review should not be posted, as this is an extremely popular condo, and the guest appears to be confusing someone else's ad or info with this unit.  We honestly don't know how to reply to this...as its simply wrong.  We believe this guest was venting at us since we did not accept their payment.  No other issues were noted at any time.  Stairs are common size, so not sure how to reply there, and no items at all are about to cave in, and the facility had just received brand new aluminum railings too.

name: Stan Smith
text: Rent a home that’s $1600 a month which is way too much money for what it is , landlord refuses to fix a $60 ice maker front and rear decks are rotting and wife has fell bc part of it broke she’s fell cracked 3 ribs and sprung hand , ceiling fans only work in one direction , back yard fence is rotten and boards falling off I’ve had to put screws in it that don’t hold due to rotting numerous water leaks on toilet that’s over flowed onto carpets more than one occasion and had to clean the carpets have two service dogs they threw a fit about them which I have a right under ADA rules I keep house clean and in better shape then when we moved in it , refrigerator had maggots in it when we moved in cabinets had old food in it pictures to prove it inspections we’ve had has never been an issue Always have been told by property management everything looks great no complaints ever In The year and half I’ve lived here called an attorney said I have grounds that the landlord has broken his own lease then They say I broke lease by having a small 7 lbs shitzu that’s never a problem I don’t recommend renting anything from this property management agent there better companies with better properties for less money renter beware DONT RENT ANYTHING FROM DOTHAN PROPERTY MANAGEMENT A JAMES BOWMAN COMPANY  RUDE PPL

resp.text: I am very saddened by this review because we both know that this is not an accurate depiction of what happened.

name: Shane Corbin
text: Great company that takes care of tenants and landlords. Highly recommenced

name: Johnathan Mitchell
text: My experience with Watts Realty was great up until it was time to move out. I was charged an absurd amount for not cleaning leaves off the back patio area, even though I called prior to moving out and asked if I needed to clean the area. Not to mention, the area was full of leaves and trash when I moved in. There needs to be better communication between the landlords, so this problem does not happen. I will say the representative I spoke with was always professional and pleasant. However, it is extremely frustrating to be charged for something you were explicitly told did not have to be cleaned.

name: Jeannie Evans
text:
Watts Realty has managed apartments
for my family for 3 generations. They have a highly qualified, professional staff who have always done an excellent job to enhance the value of our property and keep it fully occupied, while keeping the tenants happy. I would recommend them to anyone!
Jeannie Evans

resp.text: Thank you for very for your review! It has been our pleasure for our company to work with you and your family to protect, manage & grow your real property assets over the years.  We appreciate the opportunity to be of service for all of your real estate needs! Thank you for continuing to utilize Watts Realty!!

name: Willie Frazier
text: Brett and Cliff does quality work and very professional.  I sure appreciate them. They always do a good job.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind comments! We will let both of them know your appreciation!

name: Lyn Bloom
text: I reported that had an issue with my door today and they came to fix it the same day. The maintenance department here is very responsive. Brett and Cliff are professional and respectful and never leave a mess.

resp.text: We appreciate your kind words!

name: Tiffany Ellis
text: Me and my boyfriend are in the first week of renting here and found a few things we wanted checked on by maintenance. I made a request through the tenant portal on Sunday and today, Wednesday, maintenance came out to fix the issues. I would say three days is not a long wait time. He was very nice and listened to my requests and did everything he could to make sure it was all fixed. I’m very happy with how things are going so far into renting through Watts Realty.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Sheryll green
text: My Maintenence service request was taken care of within 24 hours by serviceman Brett, who was professional, nice, thoughtful and diligent in duties. Very kind and respectful. Did not create a mess and took care of each of my requests in a timely manner and was very neat and clean in performance.

resp.text: Thank you!!

name: Valencia Banks
text: Brett is great he's always professional and never leaves a mess when he comes...thx

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review.  We will be sure to let Brett know he's appreciated.

name: Omarace Radford (GHOSTT)
text: Brett is very Professional & very courteous!!! Always fixes my problems whenever I call the Realty office!!! Very appreciative of his work!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!

name: Stephen Copeland
text: Been with the company for almost twenty years, great management staff, very dependable, and fair with property management.  They will manage and make tenants accountable by law.

name: Jackie Williams
text: Liars*** rent to whom they choose never was my credit ran NEVER **

resp.text:
Ms. Williams.

Thank you for your review.  With your rental application you recently authorized Watts Realty to obtain an investigative consumer report from AppFolio, Inc., who provided us with the information regarding your credit history.  Because of privacy laws we cannot discuss in detail regarding your complaint in a public forum. However, you will be receiving a letter in the mail regarding this decision and contact information for the reporting agency.  You have the right to obtain a free copy of the report if you submit a written request to AppFolio, Inc. no later than 60 days after you receive the notice in the mail.  If you do not receive the letter providing you with the information indicated, please contact our office direct.

name: Tyiesha Jordan
text: Brett always helpful

resp.text: Thank you!!

name: Rosalind Lewis
text: The clerk's at the front desk are informative and when requesting a look at an apartment , searching for the address on buildings caused tremendous stress. Numbers were different than given.

name: raven Johnson
text: I will not recommend them to anyone they are not understanding and they do not answer maintenance requests, emails, voicemails

resp.text: Ms. Johnson, we apologize for any inconvenience you have experienced. As you are aware, we have modified your lease, at your request, multiple times and have attempted to address each request you have made. We have attempted to reach out to you via private communication regarding your last request; however, we have not received any further information or communication from you since October 20 other than this negative review.   Please contact our office to complete the final paperwork you requested.

name: Free Forme
text: Horrible company. Stephanie was really rude. She told me that (watts) didn't want people of color in their homes. She hung up in my face repeatedly. I continued to call back and never was able to speak with anyone. This is beyond disgrace. Take your money elsewhere.

resp.text: Free Forme, thank you for your comment. Our company takes allegations of this nature very seriously. We provide equal housing opportunities to all people, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, handicap, familial status, national origin, sexual orientation or gender identity. Our staff are trained to be responsive to our callers at all times. Very rarely, a caller becomes verbally abusive. If this happens, our staff are empowered to warn the caller about any abusive language used before disconnecting the call. Our president, Chip Watts, is available to discuss this or any other issues you or any other viewers of this review may have. His direct line is 205-703-4277.

name: Priscilla Speller
text: I do not recommend this place at all scam artist to the max I done contacted this office soo many times about so many issues done had they contractor come take pictures of mold in my house bees nests etc none has been done son got stung he’s highly allergic that’s when they finally came to do something I have this huge while in my ceiling from the rain owner is trying to swap the dates and lie about a bunch of stuff even though there been paper trails witnesses etc etc place is just something else so I’ve been paying rent for a place i can’t even stay at smh management should be ashamed of themselves

name: Hollie Deaver
text: I submitted an inquiry email last week for an online listing at 5:30am. I received a response from each of the employees I emailed. The first response at 8:34am, and the second response came before noon. The experience I've had is flawless. Kaitlin and Michael are both extremely professional, viewing the unit was completely hassle-free, and every step in the application process has been clear. I highly recommend Watts Realty to friends, family, coworkers, and the public.

name: Xuan Huang
text:
We highly recommend Watts Realty Company.

Mr David Watts was our agent when we started to search for commercial property in downtown Birmingham. We were extremely picky in what we want, and because this was our first real estate investment, we were extremely cautious - for every property that interested us, we made multiple visits. In other words, David was not having an easy job being our agent, however, he showed great patience and understanding toward us. As the first-timers, we had A LOT of questions about properties, inspections, regulations, property management, etc, and David Watts always gave us satisfactory answers or referred us to other professionals. He assisted us in every step and met with us as soon as we sent in requests. With David's help, we found and purchased a property we loved, and it may not have happened if we worked with someone else.

Last but least, we are thankful the the entire Watts company crew who helped us arrange the meetings, look up some paperwork, buy the insurance, etc. We highly recommend Watts company and we are thankful that David was our agent.

name: Teresa Hill Berry
text: Most of their Apartments I do like however I've only known them to offer gas I don't want gas a lot of people don't want gas along with that I think the apartments are overpriced. I think that they should at least online tell you how much square footage and show the floor plan of the apartments as well. Today is at 8 at this review I would like to share this I have no intention of paying gas light water and rent. If I rent from Watts Realty and adding additional bills that I have not had an approximately 20 years.

name: Martin Williams
text: Watts is outstanding to deal with... they answer all my questions and their staff if very nice.  I Highly recommend them to either tenants or property owners

resp.text: Martin, thank you for your review...we are happy to be of service for your real estate needs!

name: Vincent (Vince) Bolus
text: Even after dealing with predatory management in the Tuscaloosa student housing scene for the last few years, the people at Watts Realty somehow managed to be even ruder and disrespectful than I could have imagined. It was nearly impossible to get into contact with a property manager while wanting to view an apartment (I called at minimum of 10 times and was never able to get on the phone with her once). The receptionist(s) is rude as well and always tended to rush me off the phone. When I expressed interest in talking to a property manager to the receptionist, without fail, the excuse was either that the PM was either "not in yet" (at 11 A.M., sure), or "on the other line." I will never rent from these people. Check the other reviews if you want more horror stories.

name: Cynthia Wilson
text: I went down to the office at the end of March because the apartment i wanted was available April 1. I had already seen the apartments due to a recent tenant and I like what i seen so I  put in a application to the address 705 1st St. S  in titusville. I used my real name which is Cynthia Jenkins. The lady at the desk informed me that the apartment wasn't ready yet but I told her that was  aware and just putting in my application early so it could be processing because I had really needed the apartment. I put in my application that morning and around 3 the same day was denied the apartment by a lady in your office. She told me they would be sending me the papers why i was denied and never received them. Very poor customer service skills need a better staff I would recommend them to no one also was told to edit my review and did because apparently now i'm lieing on the company and don't know where i applied to. Just ridiculous

resp.text: Ms. Wilson (Jenkins), thank you for providing us with your "real name" so we can address this issue to you. Our application process usually takes approximately 48 hours to complete. As such, we do not deny applicants on the same day.  We mailed a formal letter to you via USPS that explains what information was used in regards to your application. That letter also provides contact information for the consumer-reporting agency that prepared your Investigative Consumer Report. You have a right to a free copy of the report and to dispute the completeness of accuracy of any information in the consumer report with the consumer-reporting agency.

name: Justin Forbes
text:
If negative 5 stars was an option, I would choose that. David Watts is a property manager there who blatantly violated my rights under the Alabama Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act as well as several articles of his own professional code of ethics as a Certified Property Manager. If you want to receive the respect you deserve as a tenant and have your rights upheld, do yourself a favor and never rent from this company.

Hi Michael,

It's nice to hear your rationalizations in defense of your younger brother's behavior, but I am more interested in the opinions of the Jefferson County Court of Law and the IREM ethics board.

resp.text: Mr. Forbes, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns and your lease, we have determined that there have been no violations of the Alabama URLTA or the professional Code of Ethics to which our company adheres. Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your wife (Ms. Galang) and our office, we attempted to schedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your wife would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by both parties (including third-party contractors unrelated to our company), this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission under the Alabama URLTA. Upon entering the premises, multiple other lease violations were then noted, including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your wife.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have rights under Alabama URLTA. After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage were enforced. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid further miscommunications.

name: Emile Hughes
text: Great people, committed to doing a good job

name: Dawg Fan
text: On behalf of Bailer & Brock Investments, I would highly recommend Watts Realty. We are small company with several rental properties to supplement our professional income. Watts offers responsive, thoughtful, personalized (even for smaller clients), and wise advise to help protect our substantial investment. From natural disasters, to terrible tenants, to market knowledge, for almost 10  years, Watts had us covered.

name: gcouogluhgit.Jasmine vWilliams
text: Very unprofessional! I started out renting a home from them then one day out the blue they sold the home.. Like are you serious I pretty sure selling wasn't last minute for them so why not let me know as well. Not only that the people they sold to tried to jack up my rent and never fixed anything!

resp.text:
Ms. Williams,

We appreciated you as a Tenant during your time with us.  However, we do not appreciate the 1 star and misplaced Google review.  Please recognize the following points.

1)	Watts Realty does not own property.  We manage for many different third parties.  Your lease document would have the name of the Landlord when it was under our management.
2)	Investment properties are sold in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot control our Clients’ decision to sell their own property(ies).   Sometimes Watts Realty isn’t involved with the sale transaction, only to receive notice the day of a sale.
3)	Investment sales fall through in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot notify Tenants of the numerous potential transactions, especially when many never coming to fruition.  Due diligence periods extend to the date of Closing in many, many cases.
4)	The property in which you reside was sold over 18 months ago in May of 2016.  We promptly notified you of the sale, and have not been associated with that property since May of 2016.
5)	Due to this Google review, we contacted your Landlord just to inquire about the situation. We have no involvement or contribution with your problems with your Landlord.  We do not manage the property, nor are they a Client of Watts Realty. Please do not misplace your frustration on us. You need to work with your Landlord to resolve those issues.

name: Amanda Johnson
text: Thought I found a great property but took forever to get stuff fixed and now that I have moved, they are siding with the landlord to try and get me to pay for stuff that I am not responsible for. Stuff that was not even in the lease. I figured keeping my deposit would be enough but no they want more money.

name: Cris Galang
text: DO NOT RENT HERE. THEIR LOW STAR RATING SAYS IT ALL. These are horrible people who treated me and my husband with such disrespect. It seems like they are nice to you if you let them manage your property but they treat renters differently. It took them 3 weeks to repair leak from upstairs shower (obviously not emergent to them, didnt even bother following up the first week if the plumber they hired came and did the job). Then persisted in entering our home without prior notice even when we explicitly didnt give them permission to do so, clearly a violation of our privacy.

resp.text: Ms. Galang, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns, we have determined that there have been no violations of your privacy outside of the lease terms you agreed to adhere by. After you reported the leak on Sunday, May 27, during the Memorial Day weekend, the leak was assigned to a third-party contractor for completion. Regrettably, the shower drain requires a special tool to repair and the contractor did not have such tool available at the time they were on the property on May 27 (the same day you reported the leak). Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your husband (Mr. Forbes) and our office, we attempted to reschedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your husband would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by the parties involved, this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission as per the terms of your lease. We entered your premises on June 8, less than two weeks after you reported the leak, to complete the repair by the contractor while being supervised by one of our employees. After we entered your premises, several lease violations were then noted - including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your husband.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have a responsibility and rights to protect their property (and your home). After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage from the leak were enforced - which triggered other property rights issues that we are attempting to work with you for you to bring into compliance with the terms of our lease. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid any further miscommunications or lease violations.

name: Amber Lese
text: Never recieved callback for property management. Gave info to two different receptionists, both said they'd call me back....Still waiting....

name: Bogart Daniel
text: Been renting from Watts since 2009. I appreciate the rapid response to necessary repairs.

name: Jean Hudson
text: Was VERY uncomfortable with the request for my credit card information to view property! All other realtors gave lockbox code or met us for showing. The property and neighborhood was mediocre at best. Scammers??

resp.text: We utilize an automated showing system called Rently for the convenience of prospective tenants on the go and don't have the time to schedule a walk through with our residential property manager.  The credit card information is for security purposes to verify your identity.  It is only a $0.99 charge that allows you access to up to 20 homes that utilize the Rently system or 30 days, whichever comes first.   If you do not feel comfortable using your credit card, please call us and let us know that is the case and we can provide you access by gathering additional identifying information from you.  If you want to walk through with an agent, please call us and schedule a time to do so.  I hope that clears up any confusion.

name: David Walsh
text: Very friendly staff. Answered all my questions and were extremely help. I didn't end up renting from them because they didn't have anything available in the area I was looking in. However next time I am looking for something, they will be the first company I call.

name: Tiffanyliiolhhhkn ijy Roberson
text: Please do not rent from these people. you will definitely regret it.

name: Brian Burke
text: i can't recommend my dog rent from these folks. not worth even calling them

name: Francine Jones
text: They have the best apartment to live in

resp.text: Thank you for your positive review - we hope you enjoy your time with us!

name: JJonathan Coen
text: Wouldn't recommend such unprofessional property managers. Couldn't even get a response to my emails.

name: zach garcias
text: Do not, I mean do not rent with Watts Realty. Don't even know why they still in business.

name: Tan Gamble
text: After viewing a property that they find renters for I applied. I received a phone call the next day saying that I was denied due to credit. So I called back and asked what the minimum credit score was and there is not one. So how can the a reason why I was denied?

resp.text: Ms Gamble, we have mailed a formal letter to you via USPS that explains what information was used in regards to your application.  That letter also provides contact information for the consumer-reporting agency that prepared your Investigative Consumer Report.  You have a right to a free copy of the report and to dispute the completeness of accuracy of any information in the consumer report with the consumer-reporting agency.

name: Susan Cotten
text: Called yesterday to ask about property management.  Talked to Raleigh Winstead who promised I'd receive an e-mail from him by 10 a.m. today.  It's 2:49 p.m. and no e-mail.  Hasn't returned call I made to him three hours ago.

name: William “Russ” Thompson
text: $100 application fee!!!

name: Exclusive Painting1
text: AAA

name: Lauren Wiechman
text:
JH Berry is the property manager for the condos in which I am an owner. April H. is our main contact and I have been appalled by her tone and lack of professionalism every time I and other residents have spoken with her. Over the phone she is aggressive, combative and completely disrespectful. I have spoken with many other residents who have received the same responses and negative attitude from her that I constantly have.

Today I was attempting to help a neighbor who is a renter (who doesn’t have all the contact information needed) and called April to discuss a work truck that was towed from our property around 3:30pm on a Friday. Instead of being understanding she practically yelled at me, spoke to me with such disdain for even calling her. (Let me just say that the towing is somewhat reasonable on nights and weekends but during the weekdays we have so many deliveries that have to be made through the back entrance... where there is AMPLE parking.) April rudely told me that if contractors or workers will be parking in that lot the owner is required to call her so she can alert the towing company.... as if this were common knowledge. She said this is in our contract, but the towing/parking stickers were only started within the last year and I have no mention of this rule in the contract I received. Also, I am curious to know if April and her colleagues/maintenance reported to the towing company to refrain from towing last week when they were visiting our property.

The towing is a separate issue. What I am writing about is how April doesn’t understand how to have a civil conversation and prefers to treat others seeking her professional help like they are petulant children. It’s not appreciated and will no longer be tolerated.

name: Rosalind Lewis
text: Clerk behind desk friendly and cooperative. More one bedrooms available for lease than additional bedrooms.

name: Joshua Boliek
text:
I'm the former owner of a unit in Founders Station that I just sold last week.

I got my final utility bill from ConService today and come to find out it has a 10 dollar 'move out fee' on it when I don't even live in the property as it was a rental unit I paid for.

JH Berry paid for this account final bill as per policy and now I'm having to deal with them over this extra BS 10 dollar charge that ConService imparted on me.

I can't negotiate the fee as now it's with JH Berry. Not only is this extortion this is completely bs because I know ConService isn't doing any work other than deleting my name off a ledger and stopping the mail to me.

I can't imagine how many people get screwed by BS fees from companies like this. Why aren't our politicians focusing on this type of Nickle and Diming of people?

name: Erin Anders
text: If you are thinking about living in an apartment complex in Birmingham managed by J.H. Berry, don't. Trying to get in touch with your property manager is such a hassle and going to take you about two weeks. After trying to get in touch with mine for a week and a half or so, she emailed me back telling me that she had seen all the times i called, to stop calling the office and don't email her again, that she will respond when she can. She then proceeded in a later email to tell me to stop worrying about something. Something that was very important. The staff that dealt with me was very rude and VERY slow. They also recently changed their pet policy to no "dangerous breeds." So you can have a Chihuahua that bites and barks at people but you can't have a sweet, behaving pit bull rescue, because that makes sense......Needles to say, I do not recommend this company AT ALL.

name: Ginny Blair
text: I wish I could give no stars! If you see a property owned or leased through this awful company, run!! They do nothing! And I OWN my condo and they are simply the condo association. And they’re still awful! They do NOTHING about real problems but are quick to stick notices on doors- and don’t try to call about it because they won’t answer. Do yourself a favor, and steer clear!!

name: Selina Tang
text: The worst apartment complex I have ever lived in. Leasing office never picks up any calls, unless you call 25 times or more. Maintenance doesn't take care of anything. They claim to be 24/7, but it usually takes them over a week to fix an issue because according to them, nothing is ever an "emergency situation", not even when water is constantly leaking. Whoever works to pick up phone calls are extremely rude and hang up before you finish talking. Don't ever live here unless this is the last place on earth. Would give them 0 stars if I could.

name: Julie Anderson
text: I've lived in a JH Berry property for about three years now. I have had 0 issues with them. Maintenance has always been been courteous and prompt. We have had our flooring replaced, our hot water heater replaced, and our dishwasher serviced. The maintenance crew is very personable and professional. The office staff is always nice and if you leave a message with the answering service, they are always quick to return your call. In the past few months, we lost track of time and were a day late paying rent (first time in over 2 years). They were understanding and checked our account and saw that this was a first time thing and waived the late fee. I don't know why they have such bad reviews, we've loved living in a JH Berry complex. Please don't let the other reviews deter you.

name: Greg Pennington
text: It's worth trying, I've not actually lived there but I've been by the place.

name: Tait Wayland
text: Seriously awful. They are their landlord's bulldogs, they do not serve the interest of tenants. They represent everything that is screwed up about tenancy in Birmingham. Its no coincidence that the most notorious slumlords of the city use JH Berry and Gilbert for property management. They have no online rental payment option. They neglect maintenance requests, or "lose" them. They do not negotiate with tenants. They did not even provide my landords phone number when I needed it. Further proving they serve them, not you. Literally only managed to get our maintenance requests filled after they were neglected for months and we were on the brink of filing a lawsuit.

name: Andrew Cartwright
text: I've lived in one of their properties in Five Points for almost a year now and am renewing my lease for at least one more. Only issue I've had was with the property here, and that was my dishwasher clogging and overflowing.  Maintenance was out first thing the next morning and fixed/replaced what was needed. Once the lease for next year is up, I may consider moving again, but will more than likely stick with a JH Berry property.

name: AJ Selvaggio
text:
It was not enough that we had constant maintenance issues throughout our hellish year at this place - toilet overflowing randomly, not stopping running, doors that wouldn't lock, doors that wouldn't close, cockroaches, leaky ceiling, dryer that wouldn't dry, electrical outlets that would stop working, the water being shut off and no one being told until I get a frantic call from my roommate, and the best one of being promised and signing papers that you'll be able to move into your apartment at an agreed upon date (1st of the month) but not being able to for another week and a half because of maintenance... this all pales in comparison to moving out 2 weeks before our rent agreement officially ended, returning our keys, giving a return address for our deposit, filing and filling out all the necessary paperwork only to have our rent taken out of our bank accounts the following month.

Seeing as me and my 2 roommates had just graduated college, $314 being taken out without notice is not a small mishap, nor a simple miscommunication... nothing is just a miscommunication with J.H. Berry, especially if you lack the ability to walk into their offices (for instance moving away after graduation) then they will never answer the phone nor return your call.

They said I needed to transfer to accounting department because she doesn’t know what to do about that. Then accounting department said it was our responsibility to contact them separately to cancel auto draft. I said "no, we signed the papers, we did not renew our rent, we moved out, we returned our keys, we did everything that was our responsibility weeks ago, why did you think it was ok to take our money still and not say anything until I called you?" (She said she caught it this morning…)
"She said it’s just like a normal bank auto pay you’d have to call the bank separately…"
"I said wrong again, I have cancelled auto pays before, I cancelled utilities around the same time I moved out, and you know what happened when I cancelled the service? They stopped taking money out of my account because I wasn’t using their services anymore, so again, why did you think it was ok to take money out of our accounts when we moved out, I don’t care whatever the paper said, we moved out, we were no longer living there, you put a vacant sign on our mailbox, why the was there absolutely no communication in the small office where no one answers a phone, to not take $300 dollars from 3 kids who just graduated college and moved out already?" (They seemed to not care that we signed a paper when to move into our apartment at first, why do they suddenly follow signed papers to the letter--when it benefits them financially)
"Well that is how it works sir, but would you like to come into the office or mail the checks?"
"WE MOVED OUT WEEKS AGO, I’m in DC my other 2 roommates are also out of town and we cannot go pick up a check because you took money out of our accounts, and we are also not going several days without $300 that you stole from us waiting for you to get your act together to mail us a check, put it back in our accounts today."
"Well I don’t know if we can do that, I’ll have to talk to the person who is in charge of that."
"First of all, it baffles me the way you all say the phrase “in charge of” because I have never gotten the feeling that anyone knows what the hell they are doing there, you took the money out, put it back in. If I don’t get a call back by noon today I’m calling my bank and disputing the charges and my roommates are as well."

I received a call back saying they were unable to reverse the transaction and that they would have to write us a check.

Still in the process of getting our money back...

name: Ronald Otis Lee
text: My name is Ronald Otis Lee and I was born with Cerebral Palsy (Power wheelchair bound). I live way out in Brookside, AL. where there's nothing for me. Me and my deaf and C. P. wife had no choice at the time back in Nov. 2014 to move way out here because we loved into an all black neighborhood downtown at Park Place right close to the Jefferson Co. Courthouse. We were told at Park Place at time of signing the lease that the 1 bedroom Apt. we were getting was "All ready to move into". The day we moved in we found out there were no heat or air. The whole unites had been removed to replace another unit and there was such a long list of things missing or broken. We had to complain over getting things fixed for 3 months and never got it all. Before moving there we lived on highway 280 south in Apartments that was costing us $920.00 rent plus renter's ins., light and water. At both places our Apt. and cars were broken into many times and Park Place told us they had 3 police cars driving through at all time. NOT TRUE! The 280 Apt. would never fix anything. We lived in HELL at both places. The lost of a $800.00 car radio was gone. Things in Apt. taken. We had to move from both places or loose our lives. But moving has caused us even more problems getting to our doctors and hospitals plus I have to have attendant care morning and night. It's hard to get a caregiver to drive out here. I applied with J. H. Berry for an Apt. on south side at Central Station Apartment but even though our credit is bad from moving out at those 2 other bad managements J. H. Berry even turned us down even with our lawyer Robert Norris offered to to co-sign and they refused him. Mr. Norris even offered to pay J. H. Berry 6 months rent in advance and they turned that much money in advance down. The truth was and is wasn't the credit of ours. The truth is they looked at me in a wheelchair and my wife's deafness and made up their mines they don't want disabled people in their Apt. There was 1 small step up to get into the front door and there was going to need a small ramp for my wheelchair in get just into the front door and nothing else had to be fixed for my wheelchair. They just meant no handicapped person was moving into their apartments. When 6 months rent is offered and co-signing by a big shot lawyer as Norris Injury Lawyers is turned down the question is "Why? There's no other answer but NO DISABLED PEOPLE IN OUR PLACES!

name: Molly McVay
text: Holly, who works in maintenance, has been nothing but helpful and supportive every time we have had any concerns. I would recommend them to anyone looking for an apartment on the Southside.

name: Corey Griffin
text: The most rude and difficult people to work with. Apartment had fleas when we moved in and after they resurfaced in the spring they charged us for a flea treatment that didn't happen and threatened eviction.

name: sarah roberts
text:
Black mold, the land lords are surprisingly difficult to contact when you have a problem and make you feel bad for requesting maintenance.
They do not take responsibility for their properties, this is a beautiful place that is rotting and molding. It’s July and the pool is still closed. Makes no sense.

name: Izzy L.
text: I’ve lived in a different apartment almost every year I’ve lived in Birmingham, it it wasn’t until living with Dwell that I found a management company that actually cares about tenants and property. Fast and responsive maintenance and management, friendly, and great affordable spaces to live in that are convenient to down town.

name: Faith higdon
text:
12/2020 update:  still love it here. Moved in 8/2020 and haven’t had a single problem besides tiny maintenance needs (expected with old buildings) and they are SO FAST to fix anything. Not sure I would rent from anyone else really. Rent from these people!!

8/2020 : This has been my first rental experience ever - and I’m SO happy we decided to go with Dwell. I have friends who use them as well and I have heard nothing but good news. Such a relief after touring multiple other properties in the area with no luck. They are super quick to try to resolve maintenance issues, they’ve even reached out to me to make sure things were resolved before I even had the chance to contact someone. We moved in 3 weeks ago and are so in love with the place. The entire process was pretty simple, our neighbors are great, the neighborhood is wonderful and really haven’t had any trouble with parking. And they’re pet friendly! I love coming home from work and seeing everyone’s cute puppies and cats lounging in the windows 🥰🥰

name: Chrissy Benney
text: We lived in Haven a little over 2 years; it was a great price and location. Joseph was extremely helpful, accommodating, and kind. Maintenance requests were always handled promptly and professionally. We enjoyed our time there and would recommend their apartments to anyone!

resp.text: Thank you so much Chrissy! We really enjoyed having you as part of our family of tenants. If you ever need anything, we're happy to help any way we can.

name: Rosalind Lewis
text: The 1st visit: vacancies posted inside windows - now each visit afterwards with no information. I wish I could get a 2br apartment to rent from one of their buildings.

resp.text: Thank you so much for visiting our properties. We only tried physical flyers for a bit, so we do appreciate your feedback. Anything else you may have thoughts of, please let us know. We always want to know how to improve.

name: Benjamin Kidd
text: Dwell Properties is a rare gem in apartment leasing. The staff are quick to respond. The property and amenities are top notch and affordable. A+

name: Brandon
text:
I've lived at one of their apartments for 2.5 years, Joseph is great and always super accomodative and understanding. He actively took steps to get out of a contract with a terrible ISP during the first year of my stay,  very open to you making your apartment your own with aesthetic changes, and he is always very easy to get in touch with.

The apartments are great. They are older so expect higher utility bills and some noise, but they are kept in good shape and I've never had any problems that weren't immediately addressed. In these 2.5 years, I've also seen the fewest pests/bugs inside than anywhere else I've ever lived.

name: Greg Smith
text: Have been renting for almost a year now. Joseph and all the staff have been great and easy to deal with. Quick to solve repair or maintenance issues. What more can you ask for.

name: Mike Burrow
text: Wonderful people to deal with.  They make you feel like family.

resp.text: I really appreciate that Mike! The feeling is certainly mutual!

name: Angie Taylor
text: Owners are very nice!

name: Matt Elmore
text: Best management company in town, hands down. Tim and his staff have been great to work with, and I would rent with them again in a heartbeat. Thank you!

name: Michelle Abel
text: Its hard to get someone out to fix a problem. I put in a request a week before christmas because our ceiling was collapsing. Didn't hear back, so I called only to be told itd be after Christmas before anyone came to check it out. Or it took 2 weeks for anyone to come out when our door fell off the hinges. Or they send someone out to "fix" the a/c, but has to come back because no cold air is coming out but then admits he actually broke it the first time. The property manager is very dismissive about these problems as well and repeatedly ignores emails and requests for assistance.

name: clancy donovan
text: My wife rented a place from them at The Mount. Took them 18 months to fix a leak and mold above her roommates bed. They came a few time to “fix” it, but never actually amounted to anything. I had to come and stand over their shoulder while they painted it with Killz, and trust they actually fixed the roof leak.  The representative said they were sorry and would give them a free month of rent.... which never happened.

name: Tiffany W

name: Boram Choi
text: Eddie found me the perfect first home to buy and made sure everything was going well throughout the whole home buying process, from inspections to appraisals and getting potential repairs on the house from the seller. I never thought buying a house was going to be as easy as it was! Very pleased with the service I got.

resp.text: Congratulations on purchasing your new home! We're so happy you're satisfied with your home buying experience. We'll let Eddie know he's doing a great job!

text: I currently rent one of the properties Revitalize manages. So far I have found pest such as roaches, lizards, and mice. Also I’m enduring winter without a heating system or a stove to try to make it through. The issue that makes the matter tough is the lack of air seals through out the home. I was moved in to the home with these condition. The answer and reaction has been consistent however, the receptionist isn’t as engaging or knowledgeable as you may hope. Each time I was told the person of interest was unavailable and won’t be available for some time. After that, the receptionist redirects my call to a voicemail system that currently hasn’t been returned.

text: The maintenance department is really good David and Ray did a really good job putting in my brand stove they were very professional and got it done in a timely manner!!!! Thank you guys so much ❤️❤️❤️❤️

resp.text: Thank you, Cytavia for your kind words. We'll let David and Ray know how thrilled you are!

text:

REVITALIZE REALTY SENT OIT NASTY LITTLE EVICTION NOTICES IF YOU WERE LATE. AND THREATS OF LAW SUITS.  YEAH IF YOURE LOOKING TO LEASE, AND SEE A SIGN THAT SAYS " REVITALIZE REALTY, ID SCRATCH THAT OFF YOUR LIST.

name: FPV FANATIC
text: Best place to buy/rent a house. They went above and beyond to help us.

name: Dr. Tameka Lee
text:
Crystal Tower 1409
We went to Gulf Shores for vacation.  It is the first time that I have ever arrived at a condo and it WAS NOT CLEAN!  I was told by Mr. Bender that no one would be coming that evening, so I was left to clean it to give my family a comfortable place to stay.  At further request, they did send maids to mop, leave facecloths, and clean the filthy oven. We were not reimbursed for these related fees....seeing I'm the one who tidied the place up (vacuming chips from under the table, picking up left over items of the previous guest, and wiping down surfaces).
To their credit, they did replace the hot water heater while we were there as it was leaking into the floor, and I explained that I wouldn't lift another finger.
The condo is not bad, corner unit/nice layout.  However, the primary bedroom mattress is not for those with a bad back; it is hard and not comfortable. But their biggest problem is their property management.
I would not rent from them again.

name: James Maulden
text: Nice condo, we had two minor maintenance issues that were taken care of as soon as we let them know. Would have been 5 stars but the cleaning was a little lax. We would definitely stay with them again.

name: Susan Gonzales
text: Awesome room.  Right on beach. 1402, beautiful,  very clean room and everything you need.  Jenny was great at Bender Reality. Beautiful sunrises and wonderful sunsets.

resp.text: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay!  Surf Side Shores 1402 is a terrific condo with wonderful views and so conveniently located to local restaurants and attractions!

name: Dona Freeman
text: Highly recommend Bender, we have used them numerous times and never been disappointed.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind remarks!  We're thankful for your repeat patronage and look forward to your next visit.

name: Jeannie Bowen
text: Cannot say enough about the staff who assisted us while in one of their condos while hurricane Sally was approaching.  They were very helpful and even contacted me multiple times after we left to make certain we had filed a travel insurance claim and that the claim had been processed to our satisfaction.  So very courteous, helpful and friendly.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind remarks!  We regret that the hurricane affected your stay, and we're so glad that you were refunded through travel insurance.  Please give Bender Realty a call when you are ready for your next Gulf Coast getaway!

name: Lindsay LaCue Abels
text: Bender realty is wonderful. My family and I had a trip planned well in advance however we declined the travel insurance. Hurricane Sally hit and we were contacted by Bender that our condo was damaged and unable to be rented. Bender was gracious to offer us our unit at a later date this season with 100% paid or 50% towards next years vacation. I have read many unfair reviews and that is simply not the case. It was poor decision making on the renters behalf not Bender. The rental policy was clear and non-refundable. Bender has gone above and beyond. We are praying and hoping for a quick recovery to Gulf Shores community and residents during this difficult time.

resp.text: Thank you for your very kind response.  Even with our policies as they are, we still want to help our guests as much as possible.  You are very important to us!

name: justin abels
text: Bender realty has been absolutely amazing. Our family has been using them for 6 years and we will always use this company. We have never had any complaints. The condos are always clean, comfortable, well maintained, and priced well. Thank you Bender!

resp.text: We truly appreciate your repeat patronage, and we look forward to 2021 for many reasons, but certainly one is to have you back in Gulf Shores at the Sandpiper!

name: Autumn Bond
text: They were amazing. The original reservation on booking.com said our condo would have enough beds to accommodate us on our girls long weekend and when I got there it didn't come close. The ladies at Bender not only got us a condo that had enough beds but it was a major upgrade from the place we were originally booked for. I went from being major disappointed with booking.com to i will forever be dealing with Bender vacation rentals directly in the future for all of our future family vacations which will be in a house from now on that is beachfront now that we know what to expect and how it is all laid out .  We will have our few days of girls only time and then let the boys come up and stay the rest of the week and wknd with us that way its all hands on deck w the youngest ones and we can fish at night.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!  This trip was very important to you for so many reasons, and we were thankful to be able to help you make it a memorable one.  We look forward to many future visits from you and your famil.

name: Steven Gimenez
text:
Can't say enough how outstanding this company has been to rent with and their willingness to look out for their patrons.

Sorry that we had to cancel this year, but we will be back as soon as we can!

Incredible customer service and professionalism!

Thank you and stay healthy!

resp.text: We truly appreciate your repeat patronage and could do no less during this very stressful time.  We look forward to seeing you next year!

text: We've been renting from Bender twice a year for the last 10 years. They are without a doubt the nicest people I have ever dealt with for vacation rentals. We had to change our reservation due to the virus shutdown and the took care of everything without any charges. I like them even more now.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words.  We appreciate all of our guests, and are gratified by your repeat patronage.

text: Because Bender Vacation Rentals stepped.up.and did refund my family i must ammend my review. Although we didn't stay at the property, due to hurricane, they responded to our plea for a refund with with a yes.

resp.text: Thank you for your amendment!  Bender Vacation Rentals always wants to do the right thing by our guests.

text: Very nice people. Rates were very reasonable. Condo was small but comfortable and we were only using it to sleep anyway. Only complaint about trip was that we ended up next to a weekend long bachelor party and got zero sleep the entire trip! Can't blame Bender though, they didn't operate the party condo.

name: MartyWheeler Burnett
text: Excellent, personal customer service. Our rental condo was exactly as pictured, clean, and comfortable. The kitchen was completely furnished with everything needed. Beachfront units have terrific views, and the beaches are clean and well maintained. The staff at Bender goes above and beyond to meet your needs, which is why I'm a return customer.
