Exelente servicio y buena atencion 👍👍

name: Kim Russell-Wright
text:
Betty and her team go above and beyond for the neighborhood’s they manage.  In my opinion, they are the best in the area to manage Community HOA’s.
Professional, courteous and incredibly knowledgeable!!
Jim and I are honored to know her!

name: Ramon Cummings
text: The staff was professional and was prompt to take care of my needs.

name: david Dykes
text: A great group of people that I have dealt with as a HOA member for 10+ years.

name: A H
text:
Our family has lived in a community managed by Hughes for 6 weeks.

Not impressed at all with how they manage our community. I believe they are targeting us, although I can't explain why, however after speaking to 6 other neighbors who violate the same issues and have not received any notifications, it's difficult to explain away the targeting.

When I spoke to a rep about us being targeted she claimed those other neighbors must not have been in violation on those specific touring days. One neighbor claimed she did they same things we did on a daily basis, so....

Pro: At least they are quick with architecture reviews.

name: Cory Weathers
text: No one responds to phone calls. If you're in they're good side, they will work with you. If you stand up to them and their harassing barrage of nasty grams, they couldn't care less about you. I HATE the fact that they are the property management company for The Reserve. I wish my HOA would find a different company.

name: Johnny Eley
text: Probably the worst property management EVER... No benefit to this community. they are closed on Friday's and open at 8:30.

name: Tez
text:
Approximately two weeks ago I called my HOA representative, Charlotte. I called several times during the day leaving a message with the front desk and on her voicemail. Charlotte returned my call that same day but a few hours later. I inquired about a pool install in my back yard. She answered my questions told me how to obtain the forms I needed. Today, 19 May 20, I received a very hostile call from her asking where was my paperwork and if I had started any kind of work yet. I told her I contacted the city and my potential contractor and decided to postpone the project for now because of the Covid 19 making the process a lot more cumbersome. First she kept asking for my email, then she said I don’t mail the paperwork I email it to you so I need your email. I told her she had given me all that information two weeks prior to be sent via email with my written request. No kinding this lady instantly started ranting like she was chastising her child....she told me not to call again like it’s an emergency and not following up. I said excuse me and she repeated the same thing. So I let this very unprofessional representative of Hughes property know that she was acting like the bully owner’s of STONERIDGE homes and that she was not speaking to a child. I respect everyone I come in contact with because I have respect for the human race. This lady has forgotten she is in customer service and needs to work on her people skills or retire!  Of course when confronted with her terrible behavior she did what bullies do and hung up the phone. I reached out to Betty to voice my displeasure with a representative of her company. I have not  heard back yet.

Follow up...No less than 15 minutes after leaving a message for Betty she called and was very apologetic and professional. I would definitely say this employees attitude does not represent Betty’s company or her business ethics. Very refreshing to get a call!

name: Rick Sanchez
text: I've had a couple of encounters with this office before and both times I've received better, faster service at the DMV. I sat and waited for over 20 minutes for a simple pool key and there was no other customers in the office. The second encounter, I sent a letter about excessive vehicles parking in the street and their response was, "I'm sorry, there is only so much we can do about that." Well what are you getting paid for? The receptionist acts like she works at a facility with a 100 offices and certainly has the snippy attitude to match. Poor service.

resp.text: I am sorry for the experience you encountered; however, we have researched our database and do not show you as a client.  Please provide us with the date of this incident along with the subdivision in which you reside as we take great pride in our customer service.

name: Jim Boyle
text:
The Hughes Property Team has been most helpful and responsive to our family during each of our interactions during the past six years.  This included issuance of keycards, passing of common area "issues"  needing Home Owner Association (HOA) Board actions, timely communications to & from the HOA Board, and the forms required by the HOA for approvals of installation of fence, changing of foundation plantings, and assistance in getting the right departments involved for street repair or fiber conduit installation damages.
The Hughes Property Team has responded to each communication  or request professionally and in a timely manner.  This has included three subdivisions and two Home Owner Associations.

name: Ed Collins
text:
Outstanding company! Ethics abound. As a Former HOA President and state director, there is no better management firm in my opinion. I have worked with them close to 15-years and found their owner and staff to be right on point with best management practices and legal requirements Most elected and appointed directors are untrained and do not realize that a management company works at the direction of the board, or the declarant in many instances.  They maintain a healthy balance and are always vigilant to represent the best interests of the board and owners. Incidentally, the staff is well trained and no more professional with whom to work. .

Ed Collins, Director, Alabama Concerned Homeowners Alliance.
.

name: Jim Johnson
text: What a fantastic group to represent our community. No issues what so ever!

name: Jaenelle G
text:
Update: After my initial post, we were given the option to meet with Mrs. Hughes. She thoroughly explained the HOA application process to us and was apologetic about the initial miscommunication. She even gave us her direct contact information. She explained that they normally allow walk-ins, but because she was away from the office there was no one available that day.

Previous post:
I am having to deal with Hughes Properties through our Home Owners Association (the Hamptons at Piney Creek). I have emailed (Charlotte) requests to have someone contact me and still can’t get a phone call (although she responds to my emails). Every time I call I get a voicemail. I even went to their physical location and was told one person was busy doing taxes and all the others were away.

resp.text:
Our office policy is that email is our exclusive method of communication for all HOA related matters.  This provides a paper trail which protects the owner of the property, the HOA, and Hughes Properties.  With that being said, as stated in your review above, we have responded to you via email.

As our job entails that we work both in and out of the office, it is always best to schedule a time to meet prior to dropping by our office.  Please schedule a time to meet with your HOA Administrator if you have any further questions or concerns.

name: Melissa Royster
text: Our family lives in the Ridge Subdivision in the Madison/Monrovia area- we have hosted 2 parties in the last month at our neighborhood clubhouse.  We had the privelage of working with Elisse when booking our reservations and had to speak with her multiple times on the phone- We just want to brag on her-her kindness and willigingness to go above and beyond with some chaotic situations that arose made a huge impression on us!  Her sweetness on the phone kept me ( the MOM) from losing it!  Thank you Elisse!!!!!

name: Paige Hargrove
text: Hughes Properties Inc is an outstanding company!

name: Recie Austin
text: I retract my review of this company to avoid negativity and give them a neutral star rating. Google feel free to remove this review. God bless.

resp.text: Recie: Thank you for being a contributing homeowner in the community. Please let us know if we can help in any way!

name: N Hig
text: I double paid and would like to get a refund. Nobody picks up and you have to leave a message. Nobody calls back.

resp.text:
Please let us know your full contact information by emailing: info@southernpmg.com
Also, if you leave a message, we will return your call.

name: Andrew Scarborough
text: As part of our HOA Board I experienced firsthand, this company’s consistently bad communication(not answering emails), inattentive management style, and disrespect from the owner of this company.  We often had to wonder who was managing who, because basic issues that should be easily addressed required repeated follow-up with you to make sure it got done.  For example, one of our condo owners had to actually drive to the post office to pick up their mail for close to two months because mail carriers would no longer deliver mail to a box that had no door and we couldn’t get this company to address getting the mailbox replaced in a timely manner.  The disrespect from this company’s owner came in the form of talking down to other board members and owners via email, hanging up on our board president during a phone call, and skipping a yearly board meeting to go to Tuscaloosa when he knew the main purpose of it was to get specific answers from him about the problems we were having as a property.  Fortunately, we’ve found another management company that doesn’t give us any of these problems and we are just beginning to recover financially.  I hope this review will help other people avoid the same problems and stress we had as property owners.

resp.text: Hello Andrew. Can you please give me some feedback on what caused the 1 star review?

name: Christopher Renda
text: Terrible Communication. It is physically impossible to get in touch with anyone. I honestly would like to find out how to get out of this Property Management Group without having to move from my home as we love it here. You will receive letters in the mail for changes to policy and/or violations and when you try to follow up you will receive no response. As a first time homeowner, this seems to be a very poorly managed HOA and I hope that all Home owners association groups do not operate in this way.

resp.text: Christopher: I apologize for the inconvenience you may have experienced. Please call the office and let me know how I can help personally.

name: John Higginbotham
text: First; I will update this review if it triggers a retaliatory response from this company. This company does not care about people. I say this from an experience I have had during this Covid-19 pandemic. After being laid off, this company refused to waive a late fee of $50.00 and an “admin” fee of $25.00 for its HOA fee assessment from not paying on time. Under normal circumstances, this would be expected, however, during a pandemic, you would think a company would be a little more understanding and naturally help those affected by this virus. This is why people dislike HOA companies. They seemed to be filled with hateful people that just want to make someone’s life hard because they are unhappy. Tread carefully when looking at properties run by Southern Property Management.

resp.text: Hey John. The manager was instructed, by your board of directors, not to waive the late fees. We ultimately take our directions from them in these cases, but we did ask on your behalf.

name: Jordan Johnson
text: Southern Property manages our condo association. I've owned several condos throughout my life and I've never experienced the kind of inept, rude interactions that I've had with SP and Kim. Especially considering what we pay, I wish we would switch to a different company.

resp.text: Jordan: You're not listed in any of our records as being a homeowner in any of our properties. Please call the office if you are truly an owner or tenant.

name: James Brandt
text: Our HOA has been a customer for over 3 years. They are quick, reliable and do an excellent job. We are very happy with our property manager. She replies almost instantly to any request and is proactive. Using them has been a big time saver and is money well spent. .

name: Melody Cook
text: Worst communication and management I’ve ever encountered for an HOA. I have emailed Danielle, and have literally left her 5 plus voicemails regarding installing our fence at our home. When they do answer the phone, it’s a gentleman that offers no answers but just connects me to Danielle’s supposed line, where I continue to fill up her voicemail box. I am not sure she even exists since I have heard nothing from her or the company.

resp.text:
Melody,

I apologize for the inconvenience this has caused but her actions aren’t typical for us, in fact, she no longer works with us.

Please contact me directly and I’ll help you.

Barrett

name: Jim Brandt
text: Our HOA has used this company for years. We have enjoyed our relationship with them. They are professional, responsive and proactive. They removed much of the day to day responsibility from the Board Of Directors. There research into selecting new vendors has been spot on. They oversee the collection of dues, maintain of finances and anything else the BOD requests. Using Southern Property Management Group is money well spent. I highly recommend them.

name: Ron Kilgo
text: Great communication!  They’re always helpful in returning documents and providing the information requested in a timely manner.  I would highly recommend Southern Property Management Group to any HOA property searching for an excellent management company.

name: Selenia Dunst
text: Probably the worst company I've ever dealt with. Paid 195$ a month for them to never answer the phone or return phone calls. I can think of literally one occasion out of the three years I've been here that they have returned a phone call. Forget about answering the phone. According to the bylaws this company was responsible for outside maintence to our condos and would only mow the grass when multiple people voiced complaints. Multiple times we've seen snakes laying around where our dogs and children play. They removed the only dumpster available to the community and then told us to stop dumping our trash there. According to the bylaws, this company was responsible for half the cost of window replacements. While our windows were long overdue we could never get a response back from them for the three years we've tried to get them to comply. Even so, the few windows on the street that were replaced were sub standard. I'm so happy that another company has taken over the management of these condos, hopefully things will change for the better.

name: Ginny Waller
text: OK on promises, but very poor on follow up. Currently 3 weeks late on providing a check for services. " we have had a change in our accounting department" four times but still no check. Suggest all avoid this firm.

name: Carol Duncan
text: Southern Property Management Group is the easiest management company I have ever dealt with.  The response time to a problem is always less than 24 hours.  Good Job Southern Property Management Group, keep up the good work!

name: Anastasia DeTambler
text: This company prices low, but has hidden fees in their contract. Beware!! They will bankrupt a small community. Read your contract carefully! Especially if your community has delinquent accounts.

name: Mark David Roberts
text: Our condo association's vote to hire SPMG has been the best thing we've ever agreed on as a community!  The common areas are clean and very well kept, and the association has never been in a better cash position, thanks to efficient management and thoughtful involvement on the part of Southern Property Management Group.

resp.text: We're pleased to be a part of your community, and thanks so much for your comments!

name: Dawn Leone-Parker
text:
I am the realtor selling a Stonehenge Drive property in Eden Villas.

My Seller has owned the property since last August, at which time Stonehenge Drive, the development's pool and tennis courts were in dire disrepair.

SPMG came on board as the new HOA property manager in January and have been trying very hard to work with Eden Villas’ HOA board to fix the mess they inherited.

They seem very sincere about making this development as beautiful as the day it was built.

resp.text: Thank you, Dawn. We appreciate working with professionals like you. Keep up the good work.

name: Billy Parvin
text: I saw these reviews and gasped in horror. This company did the exact same thing to our neighborhood HOA funds. They slid in hidden fees on our delinquent accounts and was charging the neighborhood a monthly  fee if we didn't get the money from them. It was all about the money for them, your money. Do not hire these people.

name: The Lioness Cas
text: Call back to homeowners would be nice 1 month ago

resp.text: Who did you call and ask for?  Did you leave a message?

name: Katie Robbins
text: Thank you SPMG for always going the extra mile. We appreciate you.

resp.text: We appreciate YOU.

name: Katharine McElroy
text: Professional, wonderful response time and countless on site visits. Could not be more appreciative for the work they do for our HOA!

name: Bob Ellard
text: Professional staff that works hard to take care of it's clients.  I would highly recommend them!

name: Ashley Russell
text: Unprofessional and rude. Do not expect them to return your call and make sure you keep up with what you have paid.

name: Matthew Sheldon
text:
I've worked with quite a few property managers over the years, and I have to say, I genuinely enjoy working with Southern Homes.

The staff and owner have been nothing but accommodating and thorough in taking care of my properties. They have risen to the challenges as they come up and have gone out of their way in accommodating my properties needs.

Highly recommend.

name: colleen merkins
text: Our house has been destroyed under the (mis)management of this company twice. 2018 we paid $35,000 to repair damages and now, in 2020, it will cost another $5,000-$6,000. This does not include the months of rent we are owed. The "manager" has never checked on the home nor have the attempted to collect past due rents. The house, which was 2 years old when we turned it over to them is now dilapidated and infested with mice and roaches. The head of the agency is shady and refuses to accept responsibility for his neglect as the person being paid to manage the property. The neighbor's dog could have done a better job of managing my house and I regret ever entrusting our home to this agency.

name: William Sanders
text: Would’ve gave him a 10 star review if possible I definitely recommend him for your tax needs

name: Katch Karessah
text: They get 5 stars because you can get your own spot at 19 years old.

name: Burnette Plumbing
text: I love the company .I wish they would subcontract me some jobs

name: G3rard Gaming
text: I definitely won't be telling anybody to rent from these people I told these people my situation and they told me that they were okay with it at the start of the pandemic my job let everybody go including me and I told them that we got a severance package from our job that's why I was able to pay my rent at the place I stayed currently but after a while of making sure at least my rent stayed paid from the severance package the money ran out so I got behind a couple of months because of the pandemic mind you again I told them about all of this and they said it was okay because I currently found a job that paid more than my last job to where I can afford the house I was trying to rent from this company and as a plus my mother decided to move in with me which she works and she gets paid well over when I get paid so both of our incomes definitely can pay for this house that I was trying to rent from them and like I said I explained everything to them but showing proof that I can afford this place and telling them that yes I had a little problem but it was because of the pandemic that we are all going through I thought they would show a little leeway and understand what I was going through but obviously not like again I will never tell anyone to rent from this company

name: Sarah Moore
text: I lived in one of their properties in north Alabama for 5 years. The landlord is a joke. Calling Hubbard Properties to make a complaint or bring an issue to their attention is also a joke. I was told to e-mail our "regional manager" Crystal, and did just that and she never e-mailed me back. Also, I have a friend that currently lives in the same complex, and she had to have one of her legs amputated in late August, and they have yet to put in a ramp where she can go to and from her apartment to the sidewalk. Unless her husband is home, she is stuck inside. After talking to the landlord multiple times and being given the runaround saying she had to call corporate (which I'm sure she never did). If I could give these people a rating of ZERO I would.

name: tony chaney
text: Called the after hours maintenance line today to complain about my AC not working. This has been an ongoing issue for 4 weeks. The woman who took the call had the audacity to suggest that my air conditioner was freezing over because of over use. She is clearly incompetent. The unit freezes over because the coolant runs out n the cold air freezes the coils. I didn't bother explaining this to her because clearly she has a low IQ & I didn't want to offend her already delicate nature. Next time before offering a lie as an excuse, consider your audience.

name: Hollar G
text: If I could give them zero stars I would. They are extremely rude made me miss multiple days of work stating that they were coming to fix my apartment I pretty much live in squalor. At this point I’m ready to call the city

name: Amy
text: The office staff to include of head office manager Ms Monica are the rudest and most unprofessional individuals I have ever come across. Speaking specifically of their properties in warrior Alabama, they are nothing more than brick slums. it's almost impossible to get the maintenance to complete a task, or even actually fix it to begin with. for what you will pay for a one bedroom, I would recommend going somewhere there isnt black mold and mildew growing behind every partially sheetrocked wall.

name: Monique Allen
text: I hardly ever leave reviews but I have to. THERE ARE SO MANY THINGS WRONG WITH THESE PEOPLE!! Ive been here going on my second year and for one its not even up to code we have exposed wires in our unit !! Secondly the staff is beyond rude!! We are in the middle of a pandemic and the audacity of you to leave a voicemail being so RUDE!! Malia i know iys your job to call and ask about rent money. Not to be rude!! I can go on abt these ppl but ive had enough!! DO NOT RENT FROM THIS PLACE!! Units are decent but i aint paying for DISRESPECT !!

name: Shannon Thomas
text: Horrible horrible

name: Michael Jensen
text: I have rented from Hubbard Properties for nearly ten years. I love the small neighborhood feel and the management is wonderful. Pam has overseen my area and is the sweetest landlord you could ever desire. If I have an issue that needs resolving she gets it taken care of immediately. Don't get me wrong, the apartments are not the Hilton by any means. They are built in the 40s and have some issues here and there, but nothing major. It is just quirks that are expected out of a small house. However, for under 450 a month I get a two bedroom apartment with hardwood floors, ceiling fans, lots of floor space, my own backyard, pest control, free water, and a maintenance man that lives minutes away. The same apartment would cost 1,300 a month in Birmingham. I have loved living here and could not be happier to say that!

name: Jennifer Rushton
text: I highly recommend Not to live in Millbrook Pointe. Management and regional manager are horrible. Crystal Ward the regional manager won’t return calls. They nic pick about everything. Assistant manager tried to trick me with a form. Can’t wait to move and get away from this scheming company.

name: redd bryant
text: I have rented from Hubbard Properties for the last two years. The neighborhood is small and quaint with a very safe feeling. The maintenance man Ronnie lives in the apartment complex and responds to any issues immediately with the utmost professional manner. The apartment manager Pam is very friendly and takes her job very seriously. She handles any issues with the neighborhood within a day of being notified if not sooner. When there were concerns about drug dealers in the government subdivision down the road she had the police sit nightly by our entrance to insure our safety. In the last year every apartment had a new metal roof installed and each apartment was insured for the client to insure our belongings are safe in case a storm hit the neighborhood again. The owner of the apartments even comes on site to visit and make sure everyone is happy and everything is kept up. Rent is only 340 a month and includes water, lawn care, garbage disposal, and pest control. The next closest apartment charges 450 a month for a one bedroom with no extra amenities. The amount of care that the Hubbard employees have for the clients is top notch and I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Rena Allen
text: I had mold all around my window and call them landlord and the maintenance guy can out to inspect and cleaned it with bleach and pretty much that’s it and I felt sick for a couple of months not knowing about the mold issue and I wasn’t comfortable how they handled it at all and wanted professionals to come out to make sure it was all gone and they refused. They want me to move out and that’s it. Horrible management and place. Horrible do not move here please and risk your health. Stay away from magnolia bay Apts in gulf shores.

name: Davion Farrington
text: Worst Company ever!!! Very disappointed in the way they handle their tenants, and the apartments. This was my first apartment and I was forced to move out due to the smell of a dust and mold covered hot water tank and air conditioning unit (have pics). Moved in to a broken fridge that also smelled no matter how much I cleaned it, they said they’ll replace but didn’t and after a couple of months of no maintenance service and ignored complaints, I decided to move. You have genuinely been warned!!

name: Blue HoneyBunz
text: Not a good company to rent from.  Staff's are rude. Maintenance has poor service.

name: Chris Taylor Sr.
text: Rude staff and workers.  Unsafe place

name: Marquetta Lucy
text: I dint try to hit this they get 0 i mean no star from me

name: Nemo Scott
text:
They a bunch of slumlords I wouldn't even recommend these ppl to nobody..
I had somebody break in my house and they didn't even want to come fix the door it took 3 hours before somebody came and then the air haven't been working since I moved in

name: Lauren Backer
text: The housecleaning crew arrived on time, which was impressive considering I'd only made the appointment the same morning. The cleaner in charge came in first while the other person  got their equipment out of the truck, and went over the paperwork with me. He took a look around, and presented an estimate that was a bit higher than I was expecting. I pointed out that the woman I spoke with ,told me that their services would be less than this, and showed him the email estimate I received. He  explained that His wife had calculated a rate based on a smaller house than mine, but said they could make it work with the lower price.He was very professional,and came highly recommend by a church member. Although I was skeptical about him being able to throughly clean my home ,he did an amazing job even clean the garage which I didn't include in the estimate. My five year old granddaughter laughed the entire time they were there ,I would highly recommend this company.

name: Gabbie Ash
text: I spoke with April Herrick who was so helpful with some account questions before transferring me to Kelly Grimes who helped me with my access devices. They both were so friendly and knowledgeable. Never felt rushed even though I know I took up a lot of their time!

resp.text: Hi Gabbie, thank you for your praise and kind comments about April and Kelly. We value your feedback and appreciate the opportunity to serve you and your community. We will share this feedback with them and our team.

name: Kenneth Blizzard
text:
Our neighborhood recently transitioned from another property management company to Associa. April Herrick has been instrumental
in making that transition as smooth as possible.  She contributes so much to the greater good of the neighborhood and always has our best interests in mind.  We truly appreciate all of her hard work and dedication to our residents and to helping our board on a daily basis.

resp.text: Hi Kenneth, thank you for taking the time to share your experience working with April. We value your feedback and appreciate the opportunity to serve you and your community. We will share this feedback with her and our team.

name: Jeremy Black
text: I want to truly express how grateful I am to have spoken with Kelly G. this afternoon. She was incredibly helpful and offered a phenomenal customer service experience. I truly appreciated her attention to detail and assistance with any questions I had!

resp.text: Hi Jeremy, we're happy to hear you had such a positive experience with our team!

name: Jada Sparks
text: Best customer service. I really appreciate all the efforts Kelly G provided. She was knowledgeable while solving my issue. I was pleasantly surprised. Great work!

resp.text: Hi Jada! We're so happy we were able to help you out!

name: Carl Chamblee
text: Today, I reached out to April Herrick to provide assistance with a billing issue.  She was so pleasant and knowledgeable and took great care of my concerns.  She is the epitome of what great customer service is.  It is amazing to find a pleasant voice in the world we live in today.  She took her time with me, we enjoyed humor, and I gained much knowledge from her assistance.    Hats off to you April.  Thanks.

name: Brett Koger
text:
I am very disappointed in this management company.  I have sent a request and asked several questions and I have not received an answer in over 3 weeks.  I don't know what to do to get my request fulfilled.

If it was once and only me it wouldn't be much of an issue but it is this way for most in our community.

Do better

resp.text: Brett, thanks for bringing this matter to our attention. Please email us directly at customerservice@associaonline.com so a member of our team can assist you. Thanks again for your review and we will do our best to resolve your issue.

name: Sherri Wilburn
text: I spoke with Kelly Grimes today about an upcoming rental of the clubhouse and as usual she was extremely helpful answering all my questions & making sure that everything is set up so that the reservation will occur without a glitch. I appreciate her pleasant attitude and patience in trying to make sure that things are taken care of properly.

resp.text: Hi Sherri, we are very happy to have provided you with such a positive experience!

name: Bob Heney
text: I would give them "0" stars if I could.  They are compensated with funds from homeowners (HOA) and do not see it necessary to respond to inquiries or issues.  Complete waste of time, and more importantly, our money.

resp.text: Bob, it is disappointing for us to hear that your experience was anything less than great. When you have an opportunity, please reach out to us at info@mckaymanagement.com so we can try to restore your confidence in our business. Thank you again for taking the time to reach out to us, and we hope to hear from you soon.

name: Troy Cinque
text:
Shannon and April were so friendly and resolved issue with professionalism and promptness.
Keep up the great work!!!

resp.text: Hi Troy, thank you for your praise and kind comments about our team!

name: Richie Bruce
text: I serve as president of my neighborhood’s home owners association.  In this volunteer role, I work regularly with April Herrick, Community Association Manager of Associa McKay Management.  April does a fantastic job of keeping the board of directors informed of financial information as well as any community issues that we need to address.  She is very professional, pays attention to detail, and is well organized.  Our experience with Associa McKay, specifically with April makes our volunteer service to the neighborhood much easier to manage.

resp.text: Hi Richie, thank you for your praise and kind comments about April. We value your feedback and appreciate the opportunity to serve you and your community. We will share this feedback with her and our team.

name: David Palmer
text: I am a vendor for Associa McKay and I’m glad to give them 5 stars for their great work.  I worked with Kathryn on a recent job and she was incredibly professional and responsive.

resp.text: Hi David, thank you for taking the time to share your experience working with Kathryn. We value your feedback and appreciate the opportunity to serve you and your community. We will share this feedback with her and our team.

name: Simeon Watson
text: I would like to thank Hope Mills the Community Manager at Associa McKay Management for he super quick response and attention to detail to my request.  I've requested a few things and before sundown I have received a resolution to my request with the desired outcome met.  Thank you Hope Mills.

name: Christy Warnick
text:
April Herrick has been really nice and helpful with getting our account setup with the association.  She's been available to answer questions and does so with kindness.  Also, John Duarte has been exceptionally great with any maintenance questions and very helpful with any and all issues.
Thank you!

name: Clarence Jones
text: I have been extremely frustrated trying to get my HOA issues resolved, and after working with Kelly here at the Hoover AL office I feel so much better. She was so kind to me and even continued to communicate and give me updates. I just can't thank her enough for her kindness and demeanor after dealing with me being so frustrated.

name: Bart Singleton
text: I had an excellent experience with Kelly Grimes at Associa McKay Management, which is the property management company for my condominium association.  Kelly Grimes was very pleasant, helpful, and responsive.  Kelly handled my request with a sense of urgency and then followed back up with me to ensure that I was satisfied with my rental of a guest suite.  Kelly Grimes is an great representative for McKay Management and she created an excellent customer experience for me.

name: Ean West
text: Have been in Patton creek condominiums for a short time and already came up on an issue, have spoken to April about this a couple of times. She is very professional and has done a great job to assure me on the process and working on  helping me get this resolved. So far very pleased with management and the property as a whole. Thank you April.

name: Andrew Duarte
text: Great group of people very responsible and quick to respone.

resp.text: Hi Andrew, your wonderful feedback and rating mean a lot to us.

name: Greg Williams
text:
I just want to take this opportunity to recognize outstanding service and effort by Kathryn Davenport and Kate Wiggins in setting up our annual HOA meeting. Kathryn and Kate furnished projection equipment, laptops, and PowerPoint expertise for our presentations. We are a gated community in the Trace Crossings development in Hoover, Alabama. We have 111 households. Kathryn has been our property manager for close to 10 years and has kept us on track by providing professional consulting and services. We really appreciate all of her work and the things she does for us. I would highly recommend Kathryn, Kate and Associa  McKay Management.
Best regards,
Greg Williams, President,
Chestnut Ridge Owners Association

name: Mary Meadows Livingston
text: I am on the board of my condo association. We made the move to Associa McKay from another management group a little over a year ago and there has been major positive difference. We finally feel like we are under good care and have someone looking out for our best interests. Additionally, our manager Pam Etheredge is incredibly responsive and professional.

name: lydia weber
text: I am a new owner here at Patton Chapel condos. I want to thank John for always Being there when I have had to call him. He is a really great Maintenance person here at Patton Chapel condos very pleased for always helping me out. I’m still dealing with the parking issue which I’m hoping soon will have it fixed. This is my second time not having a parking place to park. Being a new homeowner I’m hoping to have a spot for me to park at my unit. Thanks again John for helping out.

resp.text: Hi Lydia, thank you for taking the time to share your experience working with John. We value your feedback and appreciate the opportunity to serve you and your community. We will share this feedback with him and our team.

name: Pamela Juneaux
text: Love working with Josh!!! He comes to our property happy, he listens, pays attention is respectful, understanding and a hard worker.  He always makes sure to let me know exactly what’s going on. Can’t say enough about this young man.  One of the most pleasant people that I’ve had the pleasure to meet. He get things done for our community! The whole experience with McKay Associa has been awesome for Bay Village.

resp.text: Hi Pamela, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to Josh and the team here at McKay Management!

name: Ladd Davis
text: McKay Management was very responsive to a request for a sale/conveyance package.  Kathryn Davenport was very professional in all communications and assisted my firm in obtaining documents to accommodate a large commercial transaction.

resp.text: Hi Ladd! Thank you for your praise and kind comments about Kathryn and McKay Management. We value your feedback and appreciate the opportunity to serve you and your community. We will share this feedback with her and our team.

name: Abigail Miree
text: Worst management I have EVER experienced!!!! Awful

resp.text: Abigail, thank you for taking the time to rate us. If you are willing, contact us at customerservice@associaonline.com with your contact information and any additional details and a team member will reach out to you directly to help resolve your issue.

name: bob barker
text: Working through a problem has never been easier ... even when I'm the problem.  Ha!

resp.text: Hi Bob, we're happy you found our staff to be so supportive during your experience here at McKay Management.

name: Meri Hunter
text: I want to post a good word for Andy Healey. He has been the McKay rep for our community in Hoover, Alabama. Andy was quick to respond to my questions and requests. He attended a neighborhood meeting and was very helpful in answering our questions and guiding us in knowing how to work with our developer. Andy is good natured, positive and wants to be of assistance in this work.

name: Rick Ray
text: I am a new member of the board for my condominium complex. Andy Healy is our representative for McKay Management. His knowledge and expertise have been invaluable to the board. He is consistently punctual and dependable. His initiative is evident. Typically when we ask him for something he already has it available. I give him 4 stars only because “nobody’s” perfect,

resp.text: Hi Rick, thank you for taking the time to rate us! We value your business and appreciate the opportunity to serve you and your community. We will share this feedback with our team.

name: David Petitt
text: I started working for Associa McKay Management in February. name: Amy Farren
text:
I wish so desperately that I could give this company a zero-star review. BEWARE OF THIS COMPANY. My husband, our one-year-old son, and I have experienced horrible flooding in our unit three times in the past 6 months. The neighbors behind us have experienced this as well. The first time this occurred we had to stay with relatives while they replaced the insulation and drywall for most of the walls in the apartment, as the flood was ankle-deep in almost every room of the unit, but they refused to do anything about the reason for the flooding in the first place. Neighbors informed me that the tenants that were here before us dealt with the same issue. Their drain for groundwater to not get it in the apartment is literally a cubic foot and the whole entire area is mud with nothing to catch any water. The next time this happened they refused to pay for any more than 1 week hotel stay when we were informed that the dry out alone was going to take three days. At first they said that they were going to fix the drywall and the floors (which now have mold growing from the previous flood), but then changed their mind. They also sent an email stating that they were in no way responsible for any of this and that the week hotel stay that they were offering was a generous act they were providing. If anyone reading this review would like to see screenshots of that I will happily email them to you. Thankfully our landlord is not a greedy crook like McKay and is letting us out of the lease since McKay management refuses to work with her on any of these issues. We have been packing to move into our new house, and we woke up at 2 a.m. this morning, because our child was crying. When we got out of bed our feet immediately splashed into water. Once again the whole entire apartment is flooded. Thankfully since I knew it was going to storm we had most of our belongings stacked on our couch and countertops to hopefully not have any more of our things ruined. This company would rather people live in a molded apartment that floods all the time WHERE A TODDLER LIVES, than to shell out any money to fix an issue that is without a doubt their fault. So before you move into anywhere where it is overseen by McKay management think again, and be prepared that if any issues arise,0 they will not be taken care of properly, and you will probably have to spend a whole lot of money out of pocket to pay for things that they should be paying for. My sister has been a manager at numerous apartment complexes and it is standard for a hotel to be paid for if your unit is damaged due to something that is the management company's fault. So I'm taking this public and maybe it'll help the next poor soul that has to live here.

Renter of 2829 D at Colonial Park (you can see another review referencing this same building)

text: Working with McKay Management has been a positive experience thanks to Andy Healy. He is kind and eager to help in any situation that arises. He is a pleasure to work with and an asset to McKay Management!

name: Deb “Deb” cal
text:
Associa McKay is the management company for our condominium HOA. I've lived in several Condo's in my life and have never seen such a non-responsive company. We've been assigned 3 managers in the short time I've lived there and none of them seem to know what's going on at our community. Our Contractors are not paid on time and some are talking about putting mechanic leins on our property. Great, now we'll have to get an expensive attorney involved to get the leins off our titles when we try to sell.

If you have a choice, do not use this group. Go to their HQ page,  Associa McKay Management in TX and take a look at the massive amount of upper management they must pay, and then ask yourself if your HOA can afford to pay so many executives out of state, yet never pay your contractor's that are just trying to get by day to day in your home state.

name: Kris Kelley
text:
I am a home owner and former board member at Colonial Park condominiums in Hoover Alabama .
2829 unit number C Georgetown Dr., Hoover, AL 35216
Previously , I publicly called out, to the entire community , the outrageous conduct of McKay Management and the Board of Directors for allowing it.
I resigned from the board and put my unit up for sale!
I have sustained water damages five times since purchasing my unit in Dec 2015. Four of the five water leaks and damages were from the adjacent units. The last two from the unit directly above mine ( unit # G) which is an absentee owner (Joshua Johnson ) that rents out his unit. Mr Joshua Johnson consistently fails to maintain his property in a fashion that prevent property damages to other units. Units not properly maintained is a violation of the Colonial Park bylaws, documents, and condominium rules and regulations.
On December 13, 2018, I realized  there was water that had leaked into my units closet onto my wooden closet shelves. There are water stains on the closet ceiling and walls. I notified McKay Management and two of the board members on that date. I explained I was not certain where the water was coming from, but it appears to be directly under the unit above mines ,washing Machine. I have continued emailing and texting McKay Management and McKay maintenance supervisor , expecting appropriate action.
The water damage is now spreading to the ceiling of my bedroom. Damages caused from water leaks do not stop until issue it is rectified.
Why has  a plumber familiar with our buildings and utilized by McKay Management  not already been dispatched to access the issue and start repairs.
Basically the only thing I have  been told by McKay , several times, is , the owner of the unit directly above me “has been notified”!
So McKay management , 2 Board Member, 1  maintenance supervisor Trevor for McKay , and the owner of the unit above me, all now know that I am sustaining water damages!            Failing to take the appropriate action to resolve this water leak and water damage problem , is gross negligence and retaliatory conduct from McKay Management, which is exactly what I said about them previously,. Management and retaliation by “Mean Girls”.  Spear headed by Jada Hilyer and Angie Glass.
It has been 14 days worth of non sense emails and texts “ the unit owner has been notified “.
Do you think my realtor will sell my unit to a perspective buyer knowing that there is an unresolved water leak and water damages ?
Unfortunately ,this email access does not allow me to attach all my correspondence.
Once my unit is sold, I would like to personally hand delivery to the Executive Staff at the Home Office in Dallas Texas , all of my documentation from Hoover Alabama, Associa McKay Management and the Board of Directors from Colonial Park condominium association.

Kris Kelley
2829 Georgetown Dr. unit C Hoover Alabama

resp.text: Kris, Thank you for leaving us feedback and for bringing these issues to our attention. We have made an on site visit over the weekend and have been in touch with you and the homeowner above you regarding this issue. If there is anything else we can do, please let us know. Thank you!

name: richard simenc
text:
I don’t really know how to put this.. but here it is, my experience(s)with Mckay Management:
At my building there are two units that the owners/occupants have not paid their dues in years..they are behind multiple 1000’s of dollars.
1-The same units have unregistered vehicles and a moving truck that impedes our assigned parking as well as our visitors parking- both have  have been reported to Mckay management multiple times with no action by Mckay management.
Along with the same occupants , they fill our dumpsters with the junk that is left over from their moving jobs. This has also been brought to McKay’s attention , and again... nothing done!
These occupants run a make shift moving service and the moving truck is technically a commercial vehicle. When I brought this to the attention of Mckay management , I was told that the occupants would be notified to move the truck because it is not allowed to be parked on the property and it would be tagged and towed.. *BIG SURPISE that nothing was done by Mckay.

Mckay management collects money and does nothing for the owners who pay their dues on time. It seems Mckay gives leniency to the occupants who do nothing but make our community look as if it’s junk yard. It’s very frustrating that Mckay does nothing for the upstanding residents who take pride in what we/they have.

If I had more thumbs I would add them to my TWO BIG THUMBS DOWN TO MCKAY NON- Management

resp.text: Richard, we truly appreciate your feedback. We encourage you to email us at customerservice@associaonline.com. Thanks again for your review and we will do our best to resolve your issue.

name: Stewart Dean
text:
After speaking with the representative that commented on my review, I'm bumping them up a star. She reviewed my account and discovered that the account manager that was responsible for my neighborhood didn't follow company procedure and the person that responded to the e-mail I wrote last week failed to do their due diligence in researching my complaint. She apologized for the difficulty and corrected the fees that I owed and I was able to log in to my account and pay them without further incident.

It was clear from the conversation that they have been working on the internal issues, and if those issues continue to improve, I'll be back to amend my review again. I'm sorry that I had to post a negative review for my concerns to be taken seriously, but I was quite pleased at how quickly they were able to get things resolved! I'm cautiously optimistic about future dealings with McKay.

I’ve been dealing with power tools after midnight (I supplied our rep Angie Glass with a video to document noise), and up to 20 hours a day of noise on a regular basis. My family often has to stay elsewhere to have a chance at a night’s sleep. The resident also litters, and I have pictures. Angie Glass doesnt return my calls or emails, and she has done NOTHING about this issue. She often waits a month to return emails about this and unrelated issues. Other owners here have also experienced this. The local Associa McKay is just about worthless. They are unethical to take our dues and not even return a call about a water leak or a harrassment issue.

This is nothing more than a shake down on your way out.  This speaks to the character of these people.

text: Having just moved into a new home we needed a bit of help making sure our HOA fees got sent from our closing attorney to McKay Management. Morgan Place and Keshia Edwards were wonderful in making sure everything was taken care of. They were both very professional and easy to work with. 2 thumbs up!

resp.text: Alene, thank you for taking the time to rate us! We value your business and appreciate the opportunity to serve you and your community. We will share this feedback with our team.

name: Laurin Humphries
text: These people should just close down their business. They bothered with sending us a letter with a threatening fine about a "broken" lantern hanging from our front porch (aka the top latch had simply popped open), but they don't bother with any appropriate upkeep on our landscaping, exterior painting that's long overdue, paying our division's water bill (resulting in our neighborhood receiving a letter threatening to cut off our water supply, and are just all around terrible to have "managing" us in general. 4 THUMBS DOWN.

resp.text: Laurin, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We apologize that you are disappointed with the customer service and maintenance provided by your local office. If you are willing, contact us at customerservice@associaonline.com with your contact information and any additional details and a team member will reach out to you directly to help resolve your issue.

name: Kayla Hoover
text: We bought a condo a couple of months ago and I'm not exactly pleased with McKay. All the ladies at the office are very kind and friendly but the company does not really handle anything. I thought with HOA fees being $254 a month we could expect to see where our money was going but I don't. We have a pool that at one point was so covered in algee you could see foot prints if you stepped on the bottom and the water was super foggy. I have slipped and fell twice when it rains due to the missing grippers on the portch. The trash around the pool was not taken out from Sept 1 until the pool was shut down mid oct. I know this because the same plate was in the can the whole time. They gym is extremely basic. We spent $680 on having their maintenance men install new doors and they were done so horribly bugs were coming in around them. We had them come out to see what they thought should be done and the maintenance guy said they needed to be completely redone all over. When the workers came out the sanded a spot and threw some trim on it and called it a day. I have throw my body against the doors to lock them. They sent us a proposal for a new budget and it was substantially higher which means fees will go up to accommodate this issue. I could go on but I'm tired of typing and yes I've talked to Mckay about my issues before I made this review.

resp.text: Kayla, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We apologize for the inconveniences you have experienced. We understand that you have talked to our team about the issues you mentioned but if there is anything we can do please reach out to us at customerservice@associaonline.com  and a team member will reach out to you.

name: Sean Sullivan
text: can you believe that McKay charges $435. to send a letter to your closing attorney to confirm that you are up on your dues...

resp.text: Sean, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback.  We are sorry to hear that you are frustrated with the billing process we use for your particular association.  Each association’s billing and collection policy is based upon their individual governing documents and we use those policies to perform this service.   If you are willing, contact us at customerservice@associaonline.com with your contact information and any additional details and a team member will reach out to you.

name: Ben Lavender
text: Nice people but very ineffective. McKay should apologize for accepting money. Our neighborhood has trash cans in front yard (numerous houses), yards that HAVE NOT been cut 1 time this year and vehicles parked on sidewalks. We call, they're nice but nothing corrected, nothing resolved.

resp.text: Ben, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We apologize that you are disappointed with the service provided by your local office. If you are willing, contact us at customerservice@associaonline.com with your contact information and any additional details and a team member will reach out to you directly to help resolve your issue.

name: Todd Vinegar
text: I live in a neighborhood "taken over" by McKay Management.  They came in with no warning and started sending threatening letters out to homeowners about grass and parking.  Then, all of the sudden no more letters, but we are still expected to pay hundreds of dollars a year for them to cut the grass at one entry way that is the only "common area" we have.  Roads are awful and they do absolutely nothing else in the neighborhood!!  Not sure where all of our money goes???  In someone's pocket I'm sure.

resp.text: Todd, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We would like to look into this matter and ensure that this concern is addressed. In order to do so, we would like to ask for more details regarding your issue. You may send this to customerservice@associaonline.com and we will make sure to attend to it immediately. Thank you.

name: jameka malone
text: We pay $190 annually and  for what? I personally don’t see where the money is going. Our roads in the subdivision are in very poor condition. There are a ton of pot holes and holes in the roads. Also McKay charges unnecessary fees. We have decided at this point to consult with an attorney to weigh our options as far as the fees goes. Lastly, when you call and ask questions or express your concerns, they are always passing the buck!!

resp.text: Jameka, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback and for bringing these issues to our attention. We apologize for the inconveniences you have experienced thus far. We would like to reach out to you in order to fully understand the situation and help resolve the issue you mentioned as soon as possible. Please contact us at customerservice@associaonline.com with your contact information and any additional details and a team member will reach out to you.

name: Alexander Romei
text: Have zero accountability, mismanage funds, have let the landscaping go to hell, overcharge, and likely rob owners of there HOA dues. They remind me of the sheriff in Robin Hood.

resp.text: Hello Alexander, we truly appreciate your honest feedback.  Thanks for bringing this matter to our attention as a Customer Service Associate is currently working on your inquiry.  If you need further assistance, we encourage you to email us at [customerservice@associaonline.com]  , Thanks again for your review and we will do our best to resolve your issue.

name: jill pugh
text:
May 8th now... i have recieved a call about a week ago and gotten everything worked out... I will say this, it had to take a review such as this to get them to make something happen... They did apologize though... i don't how sincere she was but I accept it... bottom line I was wrongfully charged and they made it right... hooray for mckay!!!

Reveiw 1 of 2 April 3th 2018

April 17 2018 now!!!

I havent recieved a call yet in response to this review I placed 2 weeks ago...

I moved to  Park Trace in April 2016... I'm married with three children a dog and my mother lives with me...   We are black Americans and my wife and I , which are disabled veterans have proudly served in the United States Armed Forces ( Air Force and Army).

I'm not going to tell about every experience but will touch on the main ones because I may have to take Mckay to court before we sell our house because I'm sure I will have Lein on my property after this reveiw.

Just to put it out there, I have received a letter saying I have to pay over 1000 dollars in fines for a sidewalk I did not paint... The fine is supposed to accrue late fees and it has been a few months and I haven't recieved anything in regards to the fine accruing late fees...

Now, I would like to start by saying McKay never showed up to closing and we never recieved any correspondence covering the bylaws, rules or covenants... We recently learned that the swim and tennis club was separate from the actual hoa Mckay... so we had to pay two years of past dues... which is okay-but an inconvience. No one noticed that this was issue? I had to take two years for them to tell us this, wow!
Before we could get moved in good we recieved a letter stating that we need to move the trash from the street which was left by the previous owner and even though a bulk trash collector comes regularly to pick up this type of trash yet they still wanted us to have this removed and our name was also on the letter so it was not directed towards the previous owner... I did not think anything of it...

We recieved another letter stating we have to rid our yard of weeds and we did... but we received another and there was no weeds present... so I emailed them to come out and show us where the weeds were and we recieved no response to date...
I recieved another letter, among other that I did not mention, for over 1000 dollars for a sidewalk and stairs that were painted  before we acquired the property.
BTW I HAVE ALWAYS RECORD EVERY PHONE CALL EVEN BEFORE MOVING HERE TO PARK TRACE.

I have sent them proof that these things were painted before we moved in from Google earth... My neighbors also know this and will testify in court on our behalf...

This all started when our neighbors' dogs were let loose to deficate, urinate and run our company of friends off...
I tried to resolve this with our neighbors before call the Dog man... he has had this problem with them before...

I have talked to my mental health doctor and I still feel like I'm walking on eggshells around my very own home.

It should never be this hard to live in something you are paying for...

I told them I will not be paying this because it is false and instructed them to take me to court but they say they will not take us to court and that's probably because they can put a lien on your property for non patment.  And if you take them to court they will find a loop hole or some kind of wiggle room with the high profile lawyers they have in place... in the end you they will get your property because ymif you lose you will have to pay your lawyer and their lawyer fees which will be on the thousands and the end result? Well, you will lose your home...

I have sent in recording and they said I'm still go in to pay... I've called and talked to a lady, will not display her name here but she had hung up on me when I told her I will try something else... she hung unmistakably hard and it was loud and I have it recorded as well.

*****TO BE CONTINUED *****

resp.text: Hello Jill, we're very sorry to hear that you're disappointed with the service that you've received thus far from McKay Management. We apologize for any inconveniences you may have experienced. We take customer care very seriously and would like to discuss matters in greater detail to try to come to a resolution. Please email customerservice@associaonline.com with a number where you can best be reached, and we will ensure that someone contacts you soon. Thank you.

name: shannon Prado
text: This company will "rape" you with fees... I recently closed on my home in a neighborhood where Associa/McKay Mngmt "manage" the HOA. I had not only did I have to pay $200 on the annual dues, BUT they wanted another $250 to for an "Assessment" letter, another $15 "convenience" fee AND bc the attorneys sec. requested the letter a day before closing they wanted another $150 "expediting" fee. I'm sorry, but $615 for a couple of quickly typed docs is BULL! BBB which Associa  is a member of is my next stop...OH, and don't ask them what the charges are for. They will only give you generic terms. They can't justify charging this much money. Associa/McKay is a complete sham.

resp.text: Shannon, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback.  We are sorry to hear that you are frustrated with the billing process we use for your particular association.  The standard transfer closing package was provided to your closing attorney with the governing documents, and the expedited fee was a result of the rush placed on the order by the closing attorney.  If we can be of further assistance, please contact us atcustomerservice@associaonline.com with your contact information and any additional details and a team member will reach out to you directly to help resolve your issue.

name: Fannon Meador
text: You pay so much money for mortgage but you can't pay $12 for a pool pass for the neighborhood that you live in, unless you pay membership dues. The neighborhood doesn't even provide anything other than a pool. And if you call they will act like everything is fine then make you drive just to tell you you can't get one because of a balance on the account! These people are corrupt and stupid!

resp.text: Hi Fannon, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We apologize that you are disappointed with your interaction with your local office. If you are willing, contact us acustomerservice@associaonline.com with your contact information and any additional details and a team member will reach out to you directly to help resolve your issue.

name: amy nix
text:
I’m new to having an HOA. I’ve contacted McKay three times regarding an issue. One person asked me to send pictures of my issue with my unit area and I did. No response. When I went to my first HOA meeting that person was there. When I brought up my issue I realized the lady I had spoken too on the phone with was at the meeting. The blank and frozen posture she had when I said I haven’t heard back confirmed that she was the one I had spoken too. I’ve called and sent an email about another issue with no response. Reading all these reviews and seeing the blanket response continously given saying we are sorry you are disappointed or having difficulties etc. is laughable to me. If you really care you would return calls and emails and mainly do your job. I don’t expect every request I have to be fixed immediately but I do expect a response to my contacts. I worked retail for many years and have been taught to have excellent customer service. I expect this same service for businesses I deal with yet I rarely see it.

UPDATED REVIEW. I’m giving them two stars now because I finally received a response. The employees I’ve spoken with have always been nice but the lack of response and seeing results is my reason for low stars and negative review. One employee did get back with me regarding an issue quickly a few weeks ago. I of course do want things to be done if possible and if they are responsible to do it but a response is very important to me. Even if it they can’t or aren’t responsible for the issue.

resp.text: Amy, it is disappointing for us to hear that your experience was anything less than great. When you have an opportunity, please reach out to us at customerservice@associaonline.com so we can try to restore your confidence in our business. Thank you again for taking the time to reach out to us, and w  e hope to hear from you soon.

It took me over a month to get a response from anyone! And that is after I had tried to call multiple times and sent numerous emails. They are very hard to get in touch with, and I do not like that I have to pay them money each year, just to end up being basically ignored by them.

name: Carman Currenton
text: Horrible! I have called several times about neighbors parking on the sidewalk and moving my trash can on MY property so that they can park there. I was lied to about a notice being sent out. I have been double billed for dues and never receive a phone call back. This was the worst decision to have this sorry company take over. Still waiting on your call Angie!

resp.text: Carman, we truly appreciate your honest feedback and for bringing these issues to our attention.  We apologize for the inconveniences you have experienced. name: montana jackson
text:
I've lived in a neighborhood "managed" by Associa McKay Management since October 2015. My HOA dues are roughly $100/year. I paid my pro-rated dues for 2015 at closing and anticipated a bill for 2016 in the coming months. Well here we are...February 21, 2017, and I've received my first notice about any dues owed. Instead of a polite phone call, e-mail or notice OF ANY KIND letting me know I owe them money, I receive a threatening letter informing me that there has been a lien placed on my house because I owe them $628. Just do the math, y'all. 1+1=6? HA!

I should've taken it upon myself to reach out about any money owed but it has not even crossed my mind. Isn't this something you should receive a bill for? I receive a bill from everyone provider. My mind is blown.

I will be at their office at 8 AM in the morning with the roughly $200 I owe but I REFUSE to pay a dollar more. The sheer lack of communication from this so called "property management firm" is laughable.

I urge you to leave a review about this company if you've had an experience with them- good or bad! I'd love to know who has actually heard of or heard from Associa McKay Management.

I manage roughly 900 units in Birmingham and I couldn't imagine how my tenants would feel if I were to communicate with them like this...rather, not communicate with them. I'm absolutely DISGUSTED.

I hope that this review reaches the management teams supervisors, I really do. I'd love to hear from you! Hell, anyone at this point!

I'd also love a response back from the email and phone calls submitted back in 2016 regarding my lawn!

See ya in the AM, Associa McKay!

resp.text: Montana, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We apologize that you have had trouble reaching us to discuss billing and maintenance services. If you are willing, contact us at customerservice@associaonline.com with your contact information and any additional details and a team member will reach out to you directly to help resolve your issue.
