text: Work with Michelle Baker in Huntsville, she’s awesome. Super responsive, fast and handles everything you’d want a PM to take care of seamlessly. Could not be more pleased!

name: Jamaine Williams
text:
AHI properties has great service and responds very quickly. I would recommend this company to anyone looking for a property manager. Astria , Tim and Philip will go over and above the call of duty to assist you in any way.

JJ Williams

name: Lindy McCullers Carmichael
text: We lived in our rental for two years. We signed contracts to move in early November for a move in date of mid December. When we got our keys the house wasn’t cleaned, gross utensils, cups and dishes were still in the cabinets and dishwasher. The walls were disgusting and had stains all over them. We had to cancel our movers and push them a week, and extend our other rental a week longer to clean the house so it was move in ready. There were numerous issues with broken cabinets, doors not closing properly, door knobs being broken, basement flooding twice and all requests were ignored, or we had to submit multiple times these issues to get fixed before a response or it took weeks for someone to come out and just look at it (never actually fixing it). Fast forward 2 years to move out time and not getting our deposit back because they charged us to fix the things WE REQUESTED to be addressed. We also are being charged to repaint the whole house when it was never painted for us to move in and was disgusting already from previous tenant. Another ridiculous charge was for not pressure washing the front side walk. If we knew that needed to be done we would have done it but NONE of these things were in our contract. I’ve worked in customer service for more than 20 years, and I’ve never worked with a company / persons as awful as AHI Properties. Do not rent from them and as a previous homeowner of a rental DO NOT use them as your management company. They will treat good tenants horribly and screw the homeowner over because tenants don’t want to deal with their BS.

name: Michael Allen
text: I’ve been at this property for only 3 months and I’ve had a terrible experience the maintenance manager Phillip is lazy and rude and tries to find everything he can not to do his job. My gas wasn’t on when I moved in and didn’t get turned on til about a week later. I told them my complaints over the phone and the things that needed to be fix and now they deny me telling them that but remembers me saying something about the gas not being on and then when I asked for a supervisor to talk to he refused to give me a way to contact them not all the employees are bad and some tried to help but this is the worst experience I’ve ever had renting

name: Patrick Fisher
text:
Well I am not yet a tenant. But I will be once everything is finalized, I just want to say AHI Properties is a amazing and wonderful company there response to my application and getting my approval to move in is amazingly  very quick. They are so polite and professional  I really  would recommend they services
Weather you a tenant  or investor.  Shout out to  Cheyenne Camacho & Kenna Eason for there fine work and diligence in getting  me and my family  and approval  for there beautiful home. I look forward  to long term relationship I will  have  with AHI Properties. And the whole team.
Thank you,
Everyone

name: John McDonald
text:
Rented from this company for 2 1/2 years. They’re terrible. They once called to tell me that they were calling the police if I didn’t lower the volume from my party. This was 3pm on a Saturday, and it was my 13 year old daughters birthday. She had a classical quartet playing because she is blind and enjoys Bach.

Asked the neighbors which one of them complained about the noise, and it was the guy two doors down who claims his “Third Reich memorabilia is just heritage, not hate”. He also rents from them and has a lower price than me per month, even though his house is more updated and more square footage. Nice to see the company favors him.

name: Jonathan Cook
text: Even as an employee at AHI I am shocked everyday at how our team is not only the most professional PM's in Birmingham, but also a truly caring group of individuals I am happy to call my friends.

name: Matt Rhodes
text: Never dealt with a worse company.  Very unprofessional and chauvinistic.  If this is how people want to do business, by all means, give them your money.  I’d rather deal with some rat infested all bills paid motel than go through the ringer with these clowns again.

name: Shea Edwards
text: The management is terrible. The staff are even worse. 1 star for the worst work environment that I've ever experienced.

name: L C
text: Horrible management company. communication / response to work orders go ignored. When it comes to move out and getting deposit back, they lie about items so they don’t have to pay you back. Overall horrible experience and don’t know how they’re still in business. Do not do business with them!!

name: The Overstreet’s
text: We rented from this company for 2 in a half years. They wanted us to pay for brand new painting of the home after leaving. This was not in the lease agreement and we had proof of before and after pictures. They took our deposit for paint damage that they claimed we caused. I do not recommend anyone to rent from them! They never gave us a call back only emailed us after we’ve sent numerous of emails to them( very unprofessional). The men that are over the maintaining of the home always had an attitude when I informed them of things that were messed up in this home. I reported a tree that had fallen down in the back on the fence to protect their property to send someone to remove it and his attitude was very nasty!  When we first got approved for the home in Hoover, only one lady was friendly ( Ashley) the property manager was not friendly at all. We are military and have rented several properties and have never had any problems until this company! We also own a home and would never want to get over on them but again they asked us to pay for something we didn’t do!

resp.text:
We are so sorry you had negative experience. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Customer service is a top priority to us and we apologize for any inconvenience or misunderstanding. From what I understand our team presented your security deposit dispute to the homeowner. They have declined to modify the disposition. They did want to offer some clarification. The charge for the labor was our minimum labor charge and includes the time to go and purchase the materials needed. The costs charged for materials are the actual costs we incur. A copy of the receipt was attached in the e-mail for the drip pans showing the cost and a picture of the stove with no drip pans. The light bulbs that were out were in the master bathroom.

The ceiling that was painted was the ceiling in the middle bedroom. It had a number of scuffs on the ceiling as well as ribbons stuck to the ceiling. When those ribbons were removed, it took paint off the ceiling. I’ve attached a picture of that as well.

The charge for painting was a prorated charge. The chart we use from the International Association of Certified Home Inspectors gives interior paint a 10 year life span. The house was painted 6 years ago. That would mean the damage cost 4 years of life of the paint. The total cost of the paint was previously discussed with you. We only charged you for the one ceiling with ribbons on it.

There was no charge for any cleaning or replacement of carpet or other flooring.

If you would like to discuss the issue please feel free to call us at 205-682-9106 and we will  provide you more information.

name: jimmy Martin
text:
AHI is a true team of professionals. I have two investment properties managed by AHI and the support has been exceptional.

Honored customer,

J. Martin

name: Matt E
text: Ahi is a well structured and mature property management company.  They have been very responsive to all my request and the requests of my tenant.  I would put them at the top of your list if you are considering hiring a property manager for your property.

resp.text: Thank you so much Matt for the awesome review! We truly appreciate you.

name: A CV
text: Worst place ever! Do not rent from them. Do not let them manage your company. Horrible to work with!!

name: Charles Doublet
text:
We have been so happy since we switched to AHI Properties.

Their thoroughness, professionalism, and proactive care has given us peace of mind.

resp.text: Thank you so much Charles for the awesome review! We truly appreciate your business.

name: chris phillips
text: Philip Barnes is by far hands down the most vigilant and attentive property manager I have ever worked with.

name: Adam Aldrich
text: A company that has lost it's way. We used AHI for 4 years to manage our home and were very happy with them for most of that time. Unfortunately the last year things have changed with them. They are mismanaged and don't care about their customers anymore. They take weeks to respond, they won't admit fault when they make mistakes and just pass the blame. We even talked to the President and he just kept trying to pass the buck. In the end we had to take over our housing project repairs ourselves to get anything done. I will never use AHI again to manage my properties and you shouldn't either.

resp.text:
We are so sorry you had a negative experience. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Customer service is a top priority to us. As the President of the company, I spent 30 minutes on the phone with Mrs. Aldrich talking about her concerns. I acknowledged that we failed in communications with you that did not live up to our expectations and I apologized for that.  I also addressed her concerns that the scope of work was not completed.  We did notify you on two different occasions by email that the quote did not include replacing the carpet on the stairs. I again apologized that our communication may not have been as clear and concise as it needed to be.  I found no written communication that they requested that he carpet be added.
During the call, I took full responsibility for our shortcomings.  We might not always agree but we do care about our customer's concerns.

name: Don Brannon
text: I couldn't be more pleased with how you taking .Thank you for the great job.

name: Jimmy Russell
text: Run if you see this name on your lease.

name: Altaf Afroze
text: Overall, AHI Properties has a very good team of professionals serving the client needs.

resp.text: Thank you so much Altaf! We truly appreciate your business.

name: Adam Aldrich
text: I’ve been using AHI for several years and really enjoyed working with them. They have a great team that quickly finds qualified renters for us. They handle all the details and stress that comes with owning rental properties and allow us to focus on other things. If you are looking for a company that cares and has good people that know what they are doing, then I would recommend taking a look at AHI.

resp.text: Thanks, Adam! We appreciate your kind words and positive review. We're delighted to work with you as well!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive feedback! We truly appreciate your business.

name: Bob Pace
text: AHI held our security deposit for almost 60 days but finally sent it ....as per our lease we were required to have the town home and carpets cleaned  including treatment for fleas ( we had a pet). We used the vendors recommended by AHI , presented receipts to AHI as proof that this was completed, but they still shorted our deposit for not cleaning the carpet? Have made inquires to AHI regarding the funds owed, but cannot get any response.  Poor customer service !!!! Never again.........

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know. Alabama allows landlords to process security deposit dispositions within 60 days of the restoring of possession to the owner. In reviewing the deductions it appears that the only deduction was for a flea treatment and not the carpet cleaning. One of our staff members was covered with fleas upon entering the home. Please feel free to reach out to us with any additional questions.

name: melanie wlodyga
text: This is the best Home rental company locally! Everyone is very helpful especially Paige Sweeney!! She has been a pleasure to work with!!! Communication is great! Property is great! The payment portal is great! Nothing negative to say! I highly recommend this company!!

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Melanie!

name: Ruei-Jiun Hung
text: Good communication bridge between owners and renters

name: Tiffany Adams
text: AHI did a great job in securing a tenant that took care of my property. I love their screening process and procedures. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable . I was kept informed about everything concerning my property every step of the way! Thanks AHI for easing the stress and allowing me to have a great LL renting experience. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a company to manage their property. Thanks for your help!

name: Deidre Chaknis
text: My husband and I had a terrible experience with AHI and finally terminated our relationship with them. We rented our home in Birmingham after an out of state job transfer and hired AHI to manage the property. There was little to no communication about maintenance issues until the deposit of our rent would be short at the end of the month. Billing was done months later about repairs we weren't told about. I sent email after email to the maintenance team and wouldn't receive a response for months, if at all. We asked for the house to be inspected every six months - that didn't happen either. The one time it did (nine months after the initial request) we were told everything was fine in the house, specifically that the carpet and walls looked good. When our tenants vacated 60 days later, AHI came up with a laundry list of issues that needed to be addressed. When I asked why the discrepancy, we were told that some tenants try to hide damage during inspections. But the things AHI recommended addressing were the carpets and painting the walls in the entire house! How was that "hidden" during the inspection? This was the final straw and we terminated our relationship with AHI. Now that we're selling the house, we have to spend even more money to repair issues AHI never told us about. I don't trust the judgment of the maintenance team and would not recommend AHI to anyone.

name: Mr. Sanders
text: AHI can be a good company as I have a house under contract with them, but a common denominator is their lack of communication, very inconsistent, several phone calls and e-mails never answered or returned. I wonder if they are under staffed and can’t handle the load? I wanted them to manage a new property I just closed on in Alabama but they don’t answer, or send the documents to sign, it’s as if they don’t want the business or don’t care, causing me to look elsewhere for a PM. No company is perfect but come on, a quick response or phone call doesn’t take that much effort.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We're very sorry we did not meet your expectations and would love the opportunity to earn back your business. Please reach out to one of our managers directly at 205-267-1005. Thank you and we hope to be able to work with you again soon.

name: lawrence haas
text: AHI is the worst company I have ever done business with. They managed our house in Hoover, Alabama for 1.5 years, and they are very slow to move on repairs and to communicate with my husband and I. We had a sewer back-up in December/January that they didn't tell us about, then it happened again in March and it backed up into the hall and 2 bedrooms. The laminate floor in the hallway buckled and the carpet was nasty as a result of the back-up, so I told them that I wanted the plumbing and flooring issues fixed, and multiple emails later they stated the repairs would be done late May-early June, meanwhile the tenant found some law in Alabama that allowed them to move out if the house is "under construction". I called one day and the maintenance guy said the tenant had moved out, and I was like "what?!" Anyways, none of the managers would field my questions and only the administrative staff and maintenance workers would call me back, and I'm not a difficult person, the management here is just extremely poor. When they made the repairs and did the cleaning after the last tenant moved out, it was so bad I had to redo everything, and on top of everything I had the worst flea infestation of all time. Find another company if you are looking for someone to manage your property.

resp.text: We're very sorry that your experience with AHI was not a positive one. We understand the insurance company was also involved in this situation and would like the opportunity to make it right. Please call our corporate office and speak with the principal broker at 205-682-9106.

name: Nathan
text: Great company to work with!

resp.text: Thank you Nathan!

name: Chris Gerard
text: For several years, I have totally relied on AHI Properties to take care of my rental house in Mobile. I live in China and I am not easily reachable. AHI properties has pro-actively addressed issues with the tenants. Their response time is phenomenal. Not only are they courteous, but they are always cheerful and polite. Their thoroughness and dedication makes them an easy choice over the other companies. I highly recommend people to choose AHI Properties.

name: Maurice Smith
text: We want to thank all of you for your help in managing our home. In particular Phillip and Tim who have been of great help to us in keeping the house maintained.  As well as you (Joe), Mark, Julie, Christine, Priscilla and Brook in keeping us legal and paid. I will bet I left someone out that helped us over the past 4 years.

name: Tara Heis
text: The AHI staff made our rental experience a great one. They made sure the house was immaculately cleaned before we moved in, they quickly addressed any problems, and they were very helpful in the moving out process. There are no surprises with AHI, because they are professional, courteous and efficient.

name: Peter Foster
text: I feel very fortunate to have AHI Properties managing my rental property. I am confident that I chose the right management company as they have provided top professionalism and service. It's always good dealing with them and my tenants have good things to say too. I highly recommend them if you're looking to hire a good property management company.

name: Norman Alexander
text: AHI Properties has been excellent. We appreciated how quickly our house sold. Highly recommend to others.

resp.text: Thanks Norman!

name: Eric Aubd
text: The people at AHI Properties are responsive, professional, and very nice. They have been my property managers for a long time and they do a GREAT job. I have referred a friend of mine to AHI Properties, and he has been happy with the management as well. From finding great tenants, to keeping me informed of finances, they do it all.

name: Khadijah Kendricks
text: Very poor in communication and assistance. Called due to the online payment system but it continues to have an issue every month which I was told wouldn't be the case. Then called for a week straight to have their maintenance people come out and they STILL have not made it. I know it's up to the owner of the home to choose these companies but I've been here 4 years and if i have to deal with this headache every month, I would rather move.

resp.text: We value your feedback and apologize for any confusion during the changes and transition of management companies/new company ownership. We offer several options for payments and online payments. We will be happy to walk you through the steps of setting up an account. As we do with all of the properties we manage, maintenance requests are addressed in the order they are received. We do have procedures and policies in place for having maintenance requests approved and scheduled, however we work diligently to have them addressed promptly. Please call Paige Sweeney on Monday to discuss your account. We appreciate you as our resident!

name: A.D. C
text: THEY SUCK

name: Tammy Sanders
text: Paige and the rest of the team at AHI Properties have been great to work with. They have found excellent tenants, handled any minor issues so I have not had to be involved and communicate timely. This is the way rental property management should work, I do very little and receive a check each month.

name: Sonya Steckler
text: Excellent response to my request, and with follow through. Since I am an owner who lives out of town, I asked them to drive by my property and take pictures of the exterior and email them to me so that I can see for myself the current condition of my property. They did exactly as I asked, and said they will be happy to do it again.

name: Joshua Jones
text: Thank you so much for letting me a part of your life and this house has been amazing. I am going to miss the house and the neighborhood. Thank you!!

name: glenn bond
text: No show

name: Aaron Rhodon
text: My experience with AHI has been great!  Priscilla D, my property manager, is a valuable asset and she has always been on top of things and very helpful.  She is always the first one to notify me of any changes that are happening, and keeping me up to date.  Thank you!

name: Jennifer Robertson
text:
We needed a furnished apartment for one month while we wait for our house closing. Management company personnel has been wonderful and very helpful.

The apartment they put us in is beautiful, great location, wonderful amenities. The problem is the apartment is on the bottom level. We called and asked to be moved or a refund, nothing could be done. So, for two weeks we have heard nothing but stomp stomp stomp, toilet flush, cell phone calls, and vacuum every day!!  We're wearing air plugs day and night so we can hear ourselves think.

Recommend you see unit before you sign anything!

name: Valerie Williams
text: AHI yard sale today. I was there early when it started, but dissapointed only to hear they had a family and friends day yesterday.It was advertised for the public for Thurs and Friday but there wasnt really anything left.You can tell it was already gone even before it started.They use to have the best sales.We use to look forward to the sale every year and tell others we knew.Maybe next time.

resp.text:
Hi Valerie,
We apologize that you were disappointed with the yard sale this year. We offer our employees the opportunity to review the items prior to the sale as part of our appreciation for their assistance in the yard sale, however each yard sale changes with how many and what kind of items are available. Please follow our schedule on Facebook @AHIyardsale for any information on future yard sales.

name: Michael Titus
text:
I just wanted to take the time to thank AHI Properties for the stellar work that they have done on my behalf in the property management realm. This is my third property management company and I cannot begin to talk about the difference in the work that this company has done for me, compared to the other property management companies that I have used in months and years gone by.

First, I want to say thanks for having me at a near 100% occupancy rate and a mid 90% collection rate and for handling the tough calls on the nights and weekends that my previous companies either did not handle, did not handle well, or did not handle with the finesse required to keep my tenants happy. I have found the staff at AHI to be extraordinarily professional and willing to rent properties in neighborhoods that other companies have chosen to whine and complain about. Not only have they rented them, but they have collected the revenue that others said they could not collect.

Their software program has allowed us to see every transaction in a transparent way and to know where every dime of our rental proceeds is going, at the moment that it is going there. I think that this company will continue to grow and I am very fortunate to have found them.

I told them that if I could ever serve as a person to recommend this company, I want to be such a person. My kindest regards to everyone up the chain of command at AHI Properties.

text: Very Friendly staff Joe levino was very nice and attentive to our needs.

name: StrikerJ
text: Service was lackluster. Maintenance was a chore to actually get them to come out. They never fixed the initial problems on move-in with outlets/broken drawers in bathroom. Granted we didn't bug them about it but we shouldn't have to. When we signed the lease there were many things different in the contract than we were told when meeting with an AHI representative, like needing professional cleaners upon move-out. No big deal but it seems like a large entity like AHI could just bundle it in with their own contractors for a better total price, instead of leaving it up to the  tenants to find them. Instead AHI will charge the tenant double of what it would cost to do the same job, then add fees to take away from the deposit. Just seems like a sketchy deal, thankfully we avoided these fees at the warning of some friends who got out of the properties a little while before we did. We won't be using AHI again.

name: Scott Dobbs
text: Renting and leasing a home is easy. The HORRIBLE part is dealing with ANYTHING pertaining to maintenance. We've been waiting on our garbage disposal to be fixed and the person they hired has 1) Forgot what part he was supposed to order after two weeks 2) Rescheduled due to the part being late after 3 weeks. The people AHI uses for maintenance absolutely HATE returning voicemails and listening to phone calls apparently...

text: I have been renting from AHI for several years and always appreciate the help and kindness of their Office Manager.

text: The initial impression is OK but if maintenance is needed the support falls off.  Call backs are none existing. When the maintenance group finally calls back they are rude and condensing. There seems to be intent due to the manner in which they handle all maintenance issues. As a landlord the question of do they real have your best interest is very concerning. A landlord should be concern if there are maintenance issue which are not resolved. Small things turn into costly headaches. Beware is the message here. Most renters that call with issues are normally ones which have the home owners best interest those that do not call could be hiding issues.

Cindy took over from there as it was her house and she was super helpful and friendly!  I definitely recommend Renters Warehouse!

resp.text: Sarah, we are delighted to hear that Al and Cindy were able to help you find your new home. We love what we do, and getting word that we are exactly what you were looking for makes us beyond excited. Our goal is to have everyone experience the sense that we are part of their family. Thank you for taking time to share your opinion with others.

name: Jason Ryu
text:
Do not expect to get your security deposit back. RW does not protect tenant's security deposit.
They let my landlord withdraw my security deposit, without giving me any contact or information about deduction, even after, I contact them more than 15 times and it all happens after I go through moving out inspection and evict.
I requested refund or the evidence of maintenance which I'm obviously not responsible(Can't even tell it really happend), every single email or call I make them, gave me the same answer(check posted photo).
So basically, if you rent place through this company, land lord can make up some reasons after you evict, and before you receive your security deposit, they can simply withdraw it without your authorization, and just ghost you, wonderful experience!

resp.text: The property owner determines any and all charges that are assessed during the move out. Our disposition manager spoke with you after you had concerns with the charges that the property owner assessed. You provided our office your written dispute of the security deposit. The disposition manager was able to send your dispute to the homeowner for their determination. Upon review, the property owner feels the amounts withheld are justified and no adjustments will be made. This is the property owner’s final decision and, unfortunately, there is no further action that Renters Warehouse can take on your behalf in regards to this dispute.

name: Jay Baxter
text: Today I sat down in front of the TV to eat some breakfast... and that's when I discovered a tornado and dangerously strong winds had hit one of the places my family purchased rental properties.  We were in panic mode since we have wonderful tenants and nice properties there.  I called Maria Guevara at Renter's Warehouse... and, in less than 2 hours, she was able to help me confirm that all of my tenants in those 8 properties were okay.  Maria, thank you so much for removing my family's migraine and ulcer this morning, we sure do appreciate you and the rest of your team!  Please stay amazing.

resp.text: What a wonderful surprise! Your words of encouragement, Jay make us feel proud of what we do. Businesses are mainly about people connecting to people and knowing that our team is on the ball makes us proud. It is great to know that Maria was able to provide you with the highest levels of service and peace of mind.

It is customers like you taking the time to tell us what we are doing right, that we are able to constantly strive for excellence. We will be sure to give Melissa a pat on the back.

Lazy realtor, pictures of the house were of the house when it was brand new... Not the condition I received it in.  Covered in filth, 20 bags of garbage at the road side, MOLD all over in the house.  The best answer I got for resolution was, "you knew what you were getting when you moved in".
Be careful

resp.text: Hilary, our apologies for the delay in our response. Due to the COVID-19 situation, Google delayed publishing user reviews and are now gradually publishing these reviews, thank you for your patience. I am sorry to hear that you experienced these issues. Your lease began on April 1st. On April 6th you contacted us with complaints about the smell of mold and the condition of the water heater. We considered this to be an emergency case and immediately contacted the homeowner. A vendor was approved to visit the property. Upon inspection the tech found no odor that would be related to organic matter. The home was in need of a good cleaning but there were no visible signs of organic matter as well. The water heater was unable to be checked due to no power being on in the home, the tech did check for leaks and found none in its current state. Other issues throughout the home were noted and included in an estimate, the owner approved for all repairs to be made at your earliest convenience. You refused to schedule with the vendor and requested to terminate the lease. The owner approved your request on April 15th, we are currently in the process of closing your account. If you have any questions please contact our office at 844-793-4948, we will be happy to assist.

name: miles gamble
text: 1st account manager scammed my tenant out of a $950 deposit that should've gone to me. After firing him I was assured the money would be refunded after the eviction was completed. After months of following up I never received the deposit.

resp.text: Hello Miles, you had a tenant placed in the home on 2/8/2018 and they were evicted from the home on 10/4/2018. After they were required to vacate the premises the disposition was proceeded with. The charges assessed to the past tenant exceeded the security deposit funds. The security deposit totaling $950.00 was to be sent to you as the homeowner. However, this balance was applied towards the outstanding balances on your account. The following charges on your account were the following; $55.00 for an estimate fee, management fees from June - October, and a portion of your re-keying of the property. Please be advised, their is still a balance owed on your account for this re-key of the property. Please submit a payment for this outstanding balance on your account. If you have additional questions please contact our office at 844-793-4948 and we will be happy to assist you.

resp.text: Our apologies for the delay in our response. Due to the COVID-19 situation, Google delayed publishing user reviews and are now gradually publishing these reviews, thank you for your patience, Ashleigh. We are sorry to hear you were unsatisfied with your showing and application process. Our agents do have busy times and typically do not answer their phones while showing a property. They are good about returning calls when they are available. Scheduling a showing is also available through our website. Each rental property will continue to be shown and accept applications until an applicant has been approved and hold funds have been submitted. At that time, the home is no longer shown. Each individual homeowner determines whether or not to accept an applicant.

text: Turns out that RW will take a double deposit for a 3 year contract, then return NONE of it when the tenants walk out after a year. Home owners and investors beware; Renter's Warehouse is not on your side!

resp.text: Hello Daniel, the homeowner determines any and all charges that are assessed during the disposition. In the event that you have unpaid rent at the time of your move out, it will be deducted from your security deposit. All charges have been outlined within your formal disposition notice. If you disagree with the amount(s) charged, please submit your formal written dispute to our office. Once we receive a dispute, we will forward it to the homeowner for their determination. If you have any questions please contact our office at 844-793-4948 and we will be happy to help you.

name: Frank carruba
text: I bought my current house and sold the previous one using Eddy Harris at Expert Realty.  Very good, professional work by them.  On the sale they put up a sign showing my house was coming soon.  On the sale start date I had 2 full price offers. Eddy handled everything.  What an easy transaction for me.  On the repurchase, Eddy knew the area that I wanted to buy in.  He actually found me the perfect house that had not even posted a for sale sign yet.  The house was presented as a for sale by owner.  That didn't matter to Eddy.  He still arranged a showing and  prepared the offer contract for me and did all the things a listing agent would do associated with a buyer client.  In fact he even stayed on top of things with the seller to make sure things he was contractually obligated to do were handled properly.  Great job by Eddy and his staff at Expert Realty.

name: Alex Fowler
text: Do not trust this RE company. Eddy insisted on hiring his inspector (friend of his). Inspection didn't show major issues with the plumbing and electric. Eddy told us that the house is in a great conditions cause he knows the seller personally. He deceived us and his buddy provided us with the fraudulent inspection. Now we are having to fix several issues and spend lots of money. I don't recommend Expert Realty to anyone!

We would greatly appreciate the opportunity to help you wherever we can – if you have had a bad experience with our service, please contact us at ExpertRealtyBham@gmail.com

name: Robin Flowers
text:
Me and my other half put in applications and a $250 deposit. Unfortunately we were denied because of some stuff on our history, but we called in advance talked to them and they said that shouldn't be a problem considering none of them were felonies and over 7 years old. We ended up getting a denial email that says it will return our $250 within 60 days. Within the 60 days we were no longer going to be at that address so I called the office and ask them if they can cancel that check and have it sent to their office and will come pick it up and they said that was fine. We did end up getting the other check before we moved and I held on to it. They told me once to check gets to the office they will call and let us know that it's there. They did not void the check nor resend another one to the office you only have 60 days to get the check and cash it, if it falls within the 60 days you no longer get your $250 back. It would be two months in a week we went ahead and deposited the other check that we already have.

So just to let you know if you got a criminal background of any kind even if it was just being arrested don't waste your money they will keep the $50 application fee per person and it is non-refundable. As far as the $250 they don't give it to you as fast as you gave it to them.

Seems like the people in the office are really confused and don't know what's going on.

resp.text: Hi Robin, we regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at (334) 835-8275 to speak to our manager directly.

name: Marvelle Rhymes
text: I moved from Georgia to Fieldcrest Apartments in Dothan Alabama in May 2020 to current. The apartments are nice and very well kept. The lawn is always cut, and grounds are clean. Property manager Levi made my move in very easy and stress free, but the entire management team is very nice and handles any maintenance issues very quickly. I would recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a nice and safe environment.

resp.text: Hi Marvelle, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at Fieldcrest Apartments. Thanks again for the recommendation, and have an amazing day.

name: Tara Wooten
text: I was never late with my payment for rent. I made sure that I pay my rent on time because I don’t want to get thrown out if I don’t pay my rent. Yesterday 10-05-2020 is the due date of my rent and me being a single mom and full time job and having to deal with attorneys and school and car trouble and work and helping friends, I lost track of the days, I finally remember that I need to pay my rent at the last moment, although when I was trying to pay my rent last night $792.33  I was having trouble using my tyndall bank, then when I choose to pay $300 it went through! .  Anyways I lost track again, and start putting my kids ready for bed and all that for school the next day. This morning 10-06-2020 I remembered that I did not fully payed my rent! So I went online and I payed my rent using a different card for $792.33 and it worked! When I got out of my apartment door I saw a letter hanging on my door, and it terrified me of what the letter was saying that I need to quit and vacate my residence!!! I mean seriously? It wasn’t even a full 24 hours delayed and you want to  terminate my contract? I did not even received a warning? And it is written in there that due to my “delinquency” this is my first time to be delayed and it’s not even a full day! The letter was stamp by the property manager Haley waldman.  Seriously??? This is how you treat your customers? Very professional!!! I wish and hope that none of you will be in a troubled life the way I am going through, but I still try to rise up everyday for my kids. You need to have a little bit of heart and compassion to people. We are giving you business. Now it’s time for me to get my own house! It Gods Grace.

resp.text: Tara, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience with us. We'd like the opportunity to discuss this with you. Please reach out to us at (334) 319-8677 at your earliest convenience to discuss how we can turn your experience into a positive one.

name: Danielle Truesdell
text: Absolutely love living here! Cost is pretty awesome. Utilities run low. Quiet complex. Plenty of things to do when your bored(swimming, tennis, basketball, workout). The staff is beyond blessings. Hayley in the office is the sweetest! They do a really good job of trying to make sure you are 100% happy. I’ve had very few issues with maintenance. The parking isn’t slightly aggravating sometimes, but I mean, I’m still loving it here! I’ve lived here almost 3 years going 4. Definitely suggest it! ❤️

resp.text: Danielle Truesdell, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at Fieldcrest Apartments!

name: Jeri Webb
text: I application to rent an apartment there, but the manager neglected to tell me that you had to make three times what the rent was knowing that I did not make that kind of money I would not have made the deposit and so they held my deposit since the 16th of January and I still have not received it

resp.text: Dear Ms. Webb,We have had the opportunity to review your concerns.    When applying for an apartment at Fieldcrest, all applicants are required to review and sign the rental criteria.   In the rental criteria, it outlines the income, credit, and rental history requirements as well as required criminal background checks.  Our records show that you reviewed and signed this form on January 16, 2021.   Our records also indicate that your funds were returned as of January 22nd.    Should you have any other questions, please reach out to me directly at 334-792-9700.Sincerely,Hayley Community Manager

name: Nicco LoPorto
text: The cleaning lady and Head of maintenance were very helpful. They made sure I was able to tour the apartment. I love the renovations and the staff I was able to meet. Definitely one of the top 2 apartment complexes I’ve toured in the Dothan area.

name: Tonni Jones
text:
this place is horrible...
you pay a premium price for section 8 quality...
roaches everywhere and pest control does not control anything... i have to spray the apartment myself...
carpet was “clean” when i came in, then the apartment flooded and had 8 fans and an army of dehumidifiers running  all week long... the apartment has developed mold but the maintenance guy says is “good mold, not the black kind” what ever that means... mold is mold is mold is mold...
the air conditioning unit looks like it came with the mayflower, old, rusty does not cool well and it gets patched with tape... yep, reflective tape is the tool of choice here...
needless to say i have made claims at office but nothing ever gets fixed... we are still waiting for them to fix the walls from the “renovation”...
keep your money and do not fall into this money pit.

resp.text: Hi there, I would like to get some more details about your experience with us.  I do not show you as a current or past resident and would truly like to followup on this.  Please contact me at the office at your earliest convenience so that I can get this resolved as soon as possible.   April Watkins Community Manager 334-792-9700

name: Jeff Weaver
text: Extremely poor communications with when they turn off the water, when a lease is coming up, or much of anything. Lived there for three years, paid on time, paid the pet deposits, and still got charged for the carpet replacement they were going to replace anyway. That's 330 bucks. Good for value but professionalism is lacking in the communications area.

resp.text: Hi Jeff Weaver, we appreciate your honest review. We set a high standard for ourselves, so we are disappointed to hear that your experience with us was not a positive one.  We are currently working on a better was to mass communicate with our resident when there is an emergency that we need to make our residents aware of.   We would like the opportunity to address your concerns about the move out charges. Please reach out to us directly at (334) 319-8677 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Jordan Chavis Wells
text: I've put in this work order over 3 times since the flooding has happened in our apartment, due to the neighbor above us and her hot water heater, since November of 2018. I recently said something AGAIN and receive this survey asking "how well the job has been completed?" let me tell you it has not. Our ceilings still have water damage spots all over, the paint on most of the hallway and master bed room walls are not fixed and our hallway light has yet to be replaced.. I'm very disappointed in the work ethic and service of our simple request.

resp.text: Mr. Wells, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around.  Our team wants to  personally apologize that you did not receive the follow up that you deserve.  We are currently working on repairing all the issues in your home.  Falling short of meeting your expectations is not to the standards we strive to achieve, and we humbly ask for the opportunity to make this right. Thank you providing this information so we can improve upon our services.   Fieldcrest Apartments

name: nicholas travis
text: I have only lived in Fieldcrest apartments for 2 weeks. My time here has not been pleasant the least to say. I've had to go to the managers office on 4 separate occasions to tell them my issues. when i first moved in my apartment wasn't the greatest to look at, my carpet was dirty and there were dead roaches on the kitchen counter. I also had encounters with roaches throughout my apartment the entire time I lived here.  the paint is so cheap and you can smell whatever your neighbor is cooking through the vents. my guest toilet was not screwed in all the way and would run all day and night. my kitchen cabinet was missing a face cover. I emailed the front office to address my concerns and was told pest control would be out the following Friday (7 days). well that didn't happen, so on Saturday I went to the office to tell them pest control did not come, and I scheduled a meeting with the assistant manager. On the day of the meeting the manager advised,she would like to resolve these issues within the next day, she would have pest control come out and maintenance would resolve my issues. they did come out and only fixed the wall outlets that I said was a problem and pest control did a horrible job when spraying the roaches. the morning after everyone had come out, my toilet then had cracked and begin to flood my laundry area, and still had a small roach appear. I then went down to the front office again and advised them of my issues and finally they replaced the toilet. I am looking to move out of this apartment due to the roach infestation and other issues that are with this apartment community. they require you to pay a full months rent when putting a notice to vacate early. which isn't bad except you leaving due to them not providing acceptable living situations. do not waste your time at this property, they will overcharge you for an apartment that is not even renovated. DO NOT MOVE HERE !!!!!!!!

resp.text: Dear Mr. Travis, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you were not satisfied with your apartment.  I understand that you guys were coming from out of state and thought that our community was more modern or upgraded.  We do have renovated apartment homes and are working on more every week.  Unfortunately  when you applied online, you did not choose an upgraded apartment when you picked your home online.  We are truly sorry that we could not meet you exceptions.  Falling short of meeting your expectations is not to the standards we strive to achieve.  Thank you providing this information so we can improve upon our services.  Fieldcrest Apartments

name: Trent Bruce
text: When paying close to $1000 a month you would expect issues to be fixed correctly. Well if you have mold due to a leak above you it won’t be. We had, and still have a leak in our first bathroom. The piece of drywall that is there, that has been replaced before we got here was covered in black mold. Instead of replacing the piece of drywall, they just spray over it. And now the mold is coming back thru. They did the same to our master bath as well. We’re on our first and ONLY lease with this apartment complex. I would recommend a house before I did these apartments.

resp.text: Hello Trent, we work hard to address all resident concerns in a timely manner, so we're disappointed to hear about this situation. We would like to work towards a resolution, so if you are willing, please reach out to us at (334) 319-8677 to discuss this further. Thank you.

name: Bobby Kelley
text: When some one complains about your truck being loud but the Noise ordinance doesn’t take effect till 10pm at night if your working on a truck and you need to press the gas becarful to many eyes watching. Have ask many times for the loud noise and radios during the day and no one could do anything cause it had to be after 10pm. That’s all I need to say

resp.text: Hi Bobby, we appreciate your feedback. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns regarding the noise complaints. Please reach out to us directly at (334) 319-8677 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Mandi Kyser
text:
My husband and I lived in Fieldcrest back about 2 years ago. It was our first apartment after getting married. We fell in love with the area and absolutely loved having awesome neighbors and a safe neighborhood. Around the time that we moved out (April 2017), we had a bunch of problems towards the end. We had called up maintenance a lot regarding the flooring bubbling up due to the AC leaking. Also, there was a complete take over of guinea wasps. I had noticed some shavings on the floor towards the sliding glass door.  One weekend our family members came to visit. My aunt had to sleep in the livingroom. When she woke up, she had these AWFUL whelps on her chest and neck.  That's when we found multiple guinea wasps on the floor. Upon further review, we noticed that they were drilling into our ceiling. That's how they were getting into the apartment. Obviously while we were living there, they didn't really do much. One man came an sprayed and then another man came and caulked up the holes the wasps were drilling into the ceiling. We still had a wasp issue, so we continued to spray and caulk the holes ourselves.

I would like to give 4 stars, but the end before moving out was rough. Not only the wasps but our neighbors behind us often left their dogs tied outside on leashes. They were also not the nicest of pooches. They would run at us in the breeze way sometimes.

Living there drove us to purchasing a house. We are grateful to be our own property managers now. While our stay sucked towards the end, I don't haven't any complaints about the staff. Everyone was extremely sweet. The only issue was that none of our issues were really being handled.

resp.text: Hi Mandi Kyser, we appreciate your honest feedback, as we are always looking for ways to improve. Here at Fieldcrest Apartments, we strive for excellence, and are disappointed to hear that you received anything less. We really do hope that your Aunt recovered. Although it has been 2 years since this occurred we would like more details to take some future action steps. Falling short of meeting your expectations is not to the standards we strive to achieve, and we humbly ask for the opportunity to make this right. Any additional information you can provide will allow us to improve our services. We hope to hear from you soon and again thank you for your feedback. Fieldcrest Apartments

name: BarbieCleans
text: the manager that runs this place ( that also sub-leases her apartment by the way , which is theft -FYI) needs to quit her job . shady doesn't even begin to cover the things that go on at this place . they're super friendly in the beginning but trust me, they gossip behind all the tenants back and laugh about you . so keep that in mind , while they are constantly upping the rent every year, April is allowing someone else to live in her free apartment and is pocketing the money . they also break tons of privacy and nothing you tell them is confidential . they gave us a basically unlivable apartment in the beginning in which the floor had a hole in it , then told us " no one can live in that apartment " and moved people in and also pocket that money as well . the staff that work for them are really nice and sweet and great people who just happen to have to work for her .  it's just the manager and assistant manager who are running shady business . the apartments themselves are decent but not for the price . the dishwashers however are useless and they will not replace them , so don't even bother with asking . kitchens are super tiny, had constant mold in the bathroom that they blew off. doors on washer /dryer area constantly fell off . the only nice thing I can say is majority of the neighbors are very friendly and trustworthy . however , they have had some break ins .

name: Audra Weaver
text: When we moved in three years ago, customer service was great. However, there have been many changes, and courtesy and communication from the office staff to tenants is lacking severely.

resp.text: Hi Audra Weaver, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience.   We wish you the best of luck in your new home .

name: Richard Bullock
text: Update to recent negative Rent Gouging review :  Rent on new lease was adjusted to a very modest increase from old lease prior to the recent 3 month lease.  Thank You April and Haley. My recent review was a mistake and Fieldcrest is a good community to live in!

resp.text: Dear Richard, thank you for sharing your positive experience! We are always more than happy to assist you if anything else comes up. Take care!  Sincerely, April Community Manager

name: Eric Daniel
text: I would not recommend living here. I had to have a place on very short notice and this was the only place that had an apartment available. While the maintenance staff is top notch the office personal is lacking. Read the other reviews that have been posted and it will give you a good idea of what to expect out of the front office. It is quiet most of the time but lack of parking is a major issue. They are also remodeling the exterior of the buildings so that adds to the cluster of issues this apartment complex has going for it. Bottom line is keep looking for other options I know I'll be gone as soon as my lease is up.

name: Richard Carver
text: Was approved for apartment and put deposit down. The next day I found out by my job was moving me to Ga. I put a deposit down the day I was approved. So after we found out that next day I was getting transferred out the apartment complex kept my deposit which they only had for one day. This is absolutely theft at its best. I would not recommend this community just because of this incident. What else would they do.

name: Jennie Losee
text: Visited a friend living there. Nice complex and quiet. Kid friendly. And nice layout of apartment floorplan

name: InfamousStryfe Vlogs
text: Beware your neighbors are constantly watching you and ready to call the office about the smallest things. I work full time and attend school at nights but I was constantly receiving letters and the office personnel can be really difficult to deal with at times and they will have the maintenance crew watching you throughly. I wouldn’t recommend this place at all.

name: Juleena Joy
text: It was very nice and safe place to living with family. I am living in Fieldcrest apartments for last 5 years, and enjoy every services that's provided by managements to all communities.

name: Debbie Fitzgerald
text: Problem with air shutting down. Sounded like explosion and sides of unit outside blew off. Maintenance blamed on kids. Really ?! It was storming with tornado watch in area  in the middle of night. Air started working but another boom on Saturday with sides blown off both units for upstairs and downstairs apt. Wires showing so I took pictures this time . Air is working but appears to me pressure is building up and blowing sides off unit. It appears the boom is when they hit the building. Unit looks very old and rusted.

resp.text: Mrs. Fitzgerald, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and we regret to find out that this was not the case.  What you are explaining sounds kind of scary.  We would like to make sure this issue has been resolved.  Please reach out to us at your earliest convenience and we will do our for a resolution.

name: jacqueline floyd
text: Worst place ever to live. Nothing ever fixed, constantly smoking by employee then blame resident, always hanging out at family apartment instead of working. Never honest . Karma...

name: 林国龙
text: I lived in this apartment for more  than a year,When I live in.There are  a lot of animal hair and smell on the  carpet，We cleaned up for a long time  before cleaning up.I think they did  not clean up the carpet and carpet  odor control before we lived in.But  when we move away.They sent me a  bill.Carpet odor control bill 3 days  450 dollars.When we left.The carpet  is very clean.I do not know why our  carpet is very clean, you also want  us to out of 450 dollars carpet odor  control costs.My deposit is 250  dollars, when I left, they told me to  help me put the last month of the  water fee deducted from the deposit,  and then sent the rest to me. And did  not tell me that I need to pay the  other fees.replacement of 4 drip pans  20 dollars， reasonable .cleaning of  the apartment, reasonable. 125  dollars reasonable .prime and kiltz  of walls 40 dollars reasonable .carpet odor control 3day （150/day）450 dollrs, Very  unreasonable.So do not think that  your deposit can take back, they will  only let you pay some unreasonable  costs.The carpet is not damaged The  walls are not damaged just the smell  you let me pay $ 450. Do you feel  reasonable? If you want to renovate  the whole room, do I have to pay the  money.

name: Summer Knight
text: Lived at Field Crest Apts. The kitchen was small but everything was very clean. I had to walk a ways to my apartment from the parking but hey, I needed the exercise. I walk around Walmart many times so what is a little walk to my apt? It was quiet and I kept my sliding door curtains open overlooking the gardens and I sunbathed on the patio. A few older people lived by but never bothered me and I never had a problem with them. They have a lot of older tenants. I never had a problem with theft. They are strict and watch shady people with an eagle eye and get rid of them. I sun bathed at pool and had some of the best memories of Dothan. I heard everything going on and who was good neighbors and who were bad. It is in a great location on the south side although the north side is where I usually went out and shopped. But the other side of town is just a fifteen minute drive, so no big deal coming from a big city. I got married so I broke my lease. I didn't get my deposit back but I did clean up before I moved. As long as I paid my rent and followed the rules, I was fine.They do have rules. Don't move there and expect to take over the place and break the rules is what I''m getting out of all the negative comments but I'm just one person. All these comments may be one person too. lol

name: Jaron Anderson
text: Fieldcrest staff is very friendly and efficient. Maintenance requests are prompt. It very convenient and a very good value.

name: Tyler Rowe
text:
I lived here for two years. A lot of what I’ve read on the more recent reviews I find to be very relatable. I’m extremely dissatisfied with my time at Fieldcrest, and I strongly caution anyone else considering an extended stay at these apartments.

I, like most people, simply want to live my life in peace. That is hard at fieldcrest because they are monitoring you and your stuff at nearly all times. My first issue was with my dog. I took my dog out one afternoon and looked over at a congregation of maintenance guys. One of them pointed at me as he was talking to the others. I paid this rude gesture no mind and went on about my business. I got a call minutes later from the front office urging me to pick up my dog’s waste. I don’t remember not performing this duty, especially because I had to buy my own bags on Amazon because their dog waste stations are frequently empty. But it was nice to know I was being watched.

Another specific issue I had was with my car. I own two cars, one of which is an old project car I’ve had for many years. I don’t keep current tags on it, but I do drive it fairly often. They have a policy that requires all cars to be operational and have current registration. They threw the book at me after a year of already living there. I plead my case, and they showed some leniency. My company was considering me for a transfer out of state so registering my car made no sense. When they were bought out by another holding company, they became very aggressive again threatening to tow my car. I admitted defeat and prepped my car for storage. After telling them this, I received a note that on all caps read, “LAST CHANCE”. This event was very frustrating and made me ill toward them to say the least.

Finally, I was charged upon move out for replacing the carpets. Which is fair. My dog had, to a degree, damaged the carpets. Their policy for pursuing these charges are very aggressive and are for some reason “automatically turned over to collections” if not paid in 30 days. Sure, my fault, I’ll cover it. The frustrating part is that my pet deposit covered none of it. At another apartment I paid a non refundable pet deposit that covered regular carpet cleanings and replacement. Another apartment I’ve lived in had a refundable pet deposit that covered those things only if necessary. At fieldcrest, it is a pet fee. It covers nothing, and you are out anything extra.

Other experiences, including maintenance requests involved writing a note that says “deal with it,” are profoundly negative. I honestly cannot think of a single positive.

If you come into the area for work, and want some privacy on your off time, this is not the place for you.

name: Max Matrin
text: I also enjoy the fieldcrest services in last years with my family , they provides comfortable apartments for staying with the family with in very reasonable price. I also recommended to all my friends .

name: dan jenkins
text:
Do not move in there. You will be facing old worn out buildings and a very uncaring staff.
And when you move be prepared to face bills for every possible thing. Plan on the staff trying to soak you for every penny and then try to ruin your credit.

BEWARE!!!

name: Mike Wattson
text: I am shifting fieldcrest apartments in Dothan last year with my family,that's was amazing apartments will full fill your requirements including all amenities  with in reasonable price.Enjoy life with your family in fieldcrest apartments with full bloom .

name: wat up
text: Don't move here they just want mess up your credit .....and see how fast they can get your  security  deposit .... and comes with hidden fees after you do get approved wasn't here 30 days before I got a eviction notice 2weeks top and wasn't given the apt I wanted  just terrible

resp.text: We are disappointed to hear that you did not have a more positive experience with us at Fieldcrest Apartments. Please reach out to us at (334) 319-8677 when you can so we can address this situation directly. Thank you and have a great day.

name: Russ J229
text: Best maintenance crew in Dothan!

resp.text: Russ Jackson, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at Fieldcrest Apartments! Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you; we are more than happy to help!

name: Josh Fernquist
text:
My overall experience with them is best described as poor and unresponsive service. With the exception of maintenance, when I would contact the company, I was usually met with unprofessional customer service or simply did not receive responses. Even while I was giving my 30 day notice, it took me 4 attempts to contact them, twice via email and twice via phone, to receive any information or paperwork.

After a storm caused our oven to need to be replaced, it took the company 30 days to finally get us a new oven. I called appliance companies that confirmed they could have gotten us the oven in a third that time even with shipping. When I asked for a concession to compensate for this major inconvenience, I was told that as long as they showed they were making progress, they didn’t owe any concession.

When leaving the house, we were given a bill for our entire security deposit plus several hundred more dollars. This is especially frustrating considering that, with the exception of one portion of wall damage that can be fixed with half an hour of labor, all of the damage to the house was either prior damage (which they told me they had catalogued and which should have fixed in between tenants) or normal wear and tear. I never expected to get my whole deposit back, but considering the care and attention we gave to taking care of the house, I was incredibly disappointed.

In conclusion, if you would like to rent from Becky Hancock, I highly recommend you put aside money for a lawyer or a large payment at the end. But frankly, you’re better off never dealing with this company. Since I have moved, I have only had great experiences with my new property managers. Becky Hancock Realty is an outlier in poor performance.

name: Josh Thompson
text: Love the house that I am renting through Becky Hancock Reality. Feel like I am getting a great deal on price per square foot for the area. I have worked with multiple rental agencies in the past, and April and Belinda rest of the office were great and super easy to work with. They worked with me to ensure my ESA dog was welcome. The day I moved in the garage door opener was malfunctioning. I reported the malfunction at the end of the day and the first thing the next morning a repair crew was fixing the issue. Best turnaround time I have EVER experience in renting.

name: Dakota Millsap
text:
*If you are PCSing to Fort Rucker, DO NOT rent from Becky Hancock**

During close out, Becky attempted to charge us nearly $1000 for "wall damages" despite most claims being fraudulent and non-existent. The walls were never painted or repaired prior to us moving in, so we were hesitant to pay. We asked for clarification as the initial estimate was provided by a faulty company operating out of an apartment complex.

At that point, we had lost all trust in BHR. We asked that receipts be provided to prove that work was done on the property with the fees they quoted us and the property management team was rude, condescending and called my roommate "crazy" and told him to verify it himself.

As a now property owner myself I refuse to use BHR and have heard numerous horror stories of their horrendous customer service and money-first policy.

name: Jay Bachman
text: I just sold my house that I had been using as a rental for the last ten years.  The property manager Belinda is amazing for owners!  We move to BHR with her when she left another agency in town years ago.  I would totally recommend them to anyone looking to have a property manager.  They also set us up with Tonya Turk for selling our house.  Hands down the best real estate agent we have ever worked with.

name: Melissa Allen
text:
I have been both a renter and an owner. And actually an employee. I can honestly say I’ve seen all sides of the property management. You just won’t find a better company or people to work with.  Becky is extremely fair. You are in excellent hands here. I just finished a 13 year rental experience as an owner. My place was always rented, I received great advise on keeping it rented.  They addressed all my concerns right away. Fantastic people there. Kimberly Robbins, Belinda Somersall and Anessa Daye were excellent to work with.  Friendly, responsive and went way out of their way to take care of me. Whether you are an owner or looking for a rental, you just can’t get better.  I know I’m grateful!
Melissa Allen

name: Hunter Russo
text: My wife and I rented a house at Fort Rucker through Becky Hancock Realty while I was in Flight School and it was a great experience. They were super responsive and quick to fix any issues within the house. Unfortunately, we got caught by the military stop-movement and have gone back and forth on the date of which we can PCS. It seems like I have emailed them ten times with a change of date on when we will be moving out and I can only imagine how difficult it is for them trying to coordinate cleaners and what not. They have been so flexible ad helpful through this whole stop-movement and it has definitely eased the stress of the moving process.

name: Kyle Chaffin
text: Rented for over 2 years with them, was never late on a payment. Took them 6 months to hire someone to fix the backyard fence. They never had pest control come and spray even though it was "provided". They took our security deposit and overcharged us for damages. Do not rent from them, you will be throwing your money away.

name: Shane Smith
text: Becky along with Brooke were excellent in our home buying experience. We have purchased several homes in the past and Brooke is the first realtor that found a home for us, all other purchases came from our own efforts using websites with home listings. This is also significant because the house we made an offer on and ultimately purchased had a second off come in just a couple days after ours. The home  popped up on the market and because Brooke was actively looking for us we found this house that same day. Thank you Brooke and Becky for all your work and effort!

name: David R
text: STAY AWAY...rented from them for 2 years.  Upon move out was over charged for damages I did not cause.  I was charged for damage that was documented on my move in walkthrough.  I had photo evidence I didn't cause damage which was not honored.  After several back and forth emails they did not respond to anything. When we initially moved in the place was very dirty spent days cleaning. Unethical. avoid them.

name: Jonathan Graham
text: Long story short, we left the house in much better shape than when we originally rented it and they still took our whole deposit.  They charged us for random things that were hard to dispute because they didn’t give us their report till we had moved out of the state.  For example, the yard and bushes were severely overgrown when we moved in. We cleaned them up and maintained them very well for a year but still got charged $260 for lawn care when we moved out... We had mowed and cleaned up the week our lease ended, and the only explanation we got was that they had to mow it before the next people moved in. (It cost $30 to mow that size lawn not $260)... there were a couple employees  who were extremely rude and talked down to you, especially Belinda. DON’T RENT FROM THIS COMPANY they steal your money and have a 2.5 star for a reason!

name: Jenny Brown
text: I loved my rental experience with Becky Hancock Realty.  Everyone I encountered there was professional, courteous, and respectful.  My house was immaculate when I moved in, and any time a maintenance issue arose (which was rare), they were extremely quick to get it handled.  They never accused me of being the cause of the issue.  They just took care of it.  Sadly, my rental was sold in the middle of my lease, and the new owners also became the new rental company.  I did not have the same experience with them as I did with BHR.  At the end of my lease, I was very sad that BHR did not have another home I could rent from them at the time.  I ended up moving to a new house with a different local rental company, and they have not been as great as BHR.  If I get the chance again in the future, I will definitely rent from Becky Hancock Realty again!

name: Zachary Rice
text:
I have been a renter with Becky Hancock for over two years. We do everything we can to maintain the home as our own because we are homeowners ourselves. Our time with Becky Hancock has been more of a headache than anything else. Their staff seems like they have the potential to run the company efficiently but this company does not care about the renter, the homeowner or the home. We have various work orders for major things the homeowner probably doesn’t know about. The backlog of work orders is understandable, it’s the empty promises and lack of care that baffles us. If you are a homeowner or renter, I highly advise against using there services. Thank you and if someone at Becky Hancock is reading this please reply to my email and or call. Maybe we can resolve these issues and possibly help fix things so your company doesn’t fail. If you just listen to your customers and clients you may do better than 2.5 stars.

Our neighbor is a Becky Hancock renter as well and experienced 4 months of having a broken dish washer and a rent raise but the
homeowner never knew about either...

Ps. They do a great job of finding you a good home.
Cheers!

name: Brad Baxter
text: Hard to avoid doing business with them as they manage most of the rental properties in the area but if you can please avoid. They will make sure to take most of your Security deposit with extremely strict standards for leaving the house. Guaranteed at least $500 for cleaning crew, carpet cleaning, and bed bug inspection costs that you will have to spend for them to sign off on departing the rental.

name: Eduardo Feliciano
text: I highly recommend Becky Hancock ....an REMAX PREMIER i have the privilege to work with Tonya Turk there's no words in this 🌎 to describe her for me an the people that had the opportunity... the privilege...to work with this woman we can only say me my family an our kids have a safe future...I .really wish we had more people like yout thank you Tonya Turk for been such an amassing person...God bless u and every one around you....AMEN

name: Monica Pigg
text:
We came across Becky Hancock Realty when needing to find a place to rent quickly. We only had a week to find a home and get started moving.
Belinda the property manager was absolutely amazing and worked with us quickly to make this happen. She worked around me and my husbands schedule and she was extremely helpful and friendly.
Sabrina at the front desk was very friendly and also understood the urgency and helped us make this happen.
We are very satisfied. Thank you to everyone at the office, especially Belinda and Sabrina for taking good care of us.

name: Nicholas Call
text: I was in a jam finding housing for flight school, but the team here really stepped up to help me find a place to live. Thanks again to everyone there.

name: • Your • Local • Flower •
text: Kim and Belinda were great to work with. Contact Kim to buy your home and Belinda is the rental property manager. Both women are awesome at what they do.

name: Chris Chapman
text: Becky did a fantastic job helping us sell our house. We had moved out of town and the house was a rental. She handled everything directly with the tenant and completed the sale all without us ever needing to come back to Alabama. Strongly recommend. Thanks Becky!

name: Stephanie Turner
text: BHR has managed my property for over 6 years. I could not ask for better. As an owner, I respect their operating procedures from start to finish. I have never had any issues that were not addressed immediately and professionally. Thank you to all of the BHR Team..you are providing an amazing service!

name: Christina Seidel
text: Never ever go here.. Their rentals are usually $100's more than other real estate places in town.. Kimberly Hoobler should not be trusted.. She sent us link after link to make a deposit and we were not even approved yet.. What if we weren't our money would have been tied up for who knows how long..

name: John Hawron
text: This was the worst renting experience of my life hands down. The people who work here are rude and impatient and act like you are unreasonable if you can't get everything they want immediately. In stark contrast they take a long time if you need something. We waited for a month-and-a-half for a new microwave and two months for a new dryer. The people that they hire to do maintenance are complete con artists and will often use only electrical tape or duct tape to repair issues instead of doing it properly. Becky Hancock realty will do everything in their power to justify taking as much of your security deposit as possible. In my opinion the military should flag them and not allow them to rent to soldiers until they fix their policies and people. Absolutely horrible experience, do not rent from them!!! P.S. I had a great experience with TLS 👍

name: Danielle Thacker (Ray Dog)
text: Editing my review from move in. Upon move out, there was an issue with one of the checks sent out. Upon multiple times of trying to reach out in response to this check, Becky Hancock Realty failed to even acknowledge these responses. If you have any issues upon move out, don't expect them to get resolved. With three separate renters, one of the checks with the left over deposit from move out was not received by that renter. Despite us doing business with this realtor, they dropped us off their radar once their business was done with us.

name: ryan pantone
text: Terrible experience all together. The apartments front door and rear door or broken and easily broken into. Thats just the tip of the iceberg . Ive been robbed. Nothing has been done to fix the problems. Moved out because it was scary to sleep there.

name: Stephanie Thacker
text:
Becky Hancock Realty bent over backwards to make sure we had a home when we needed it. Even with a high volume of renters and limited options in the market, they had exactly what we needed. I highly recommend working with them. To add on to that, Belinda, the property manager came in on her own time to get our paperwork completed! She was wonderful!

Edit: Once you move out and pay your dues, they will not respond to you. I attempted to email and call BH multiple times about a deposit refund and they did not bother to respond. A check did not make it to one of us (3 lived at the home) so we never received that refund.

name: Haeun Kim
text: THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE IVE EVER EXPERIENCED IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. Front desk lady, heavy set with blonde hair was rude as can be!! I’ve never went out of my way to write bad reviews or even good reviews but this realty place had me and my husband extremely upset with their customer service that I had to take time out of my day to warn others before they waste their time at this place. I should’ve read more reviews before I went up there as bad as everyone makes it seem it’s very true and I am glad I avoided renting with them with all the complaints on this realty place. Absolutely garbage customer service! I hope google updates for zero stars on reviews because I would definitely give them one.

name: Kevin Haeb
text: Worst rental company I’ve ever experienced in 15 years of renting. There are much better companies to use in Enterprise. Service members stay away for your own good!

name: Sunshine Jackson
text: Easy navigation

name: dperales8
text: From move in to move out an excellent company to deal with. The best leasing office I’ve ever dealt with hands down. On the day I was to sign my lease, the house I initially wanted to rent was sold. The staff moved with haste to get my second choice prepped in cleaning and paperwork so I could still move in that day.
