Throughout my lease, they were prompt and communicative in all my work orders, from small (toilet/sink) to large (fence/garage door). They were polite in communication and alleviation of confusion. Prior to moveout I was told upfront what costs would be deducted from my security deposit for reasonable things. I elected the self-clean option of moveout and was inspected with reasonable expectations. I did have deficiencies and was able to remedy on the spot. When moving in/out can already be stressful enough, this team is one stressor you won’t have to worry about.

name: Erin X
text:
We rented a house from RBI Rentals, who was bought by Becky Hancock a few months after we moved in.  We worked with Belinda who was originally working for RBI and switched Becky Hancock.
We had a long list of problems with the house we were renting that were supposed to be fixed within a week of us moving in.  One problem was fixed the very same day - the rest were never fixed.  We called weekly to find the status of our repairs.  When we did reach someone, they would set a date for someone to come by.  When we left a message, we never heard back.
We lived in the house for over 2 years and only one problem was ever fixed.
After a year our air conditioner started leaking.  We had to call multiple times and set multiple appointments before someone was finally sent out.  We were told the air conditioner was dead and needed to be replaced, but the A/C Repairman did a quick fix so we would at least have some cool-air in the meantime.  Becky Hancock refused to replace the AC.
We finally moved out in November 2012.  We went on a walk-through with Judy who told us that there were some damages (which we agreed to) but that our security deposit should easily cover it.  We stupidly did not get a written agreement regarding the walk through.
A few weeks later we received a bill for over $500, on top of the $650 they already had from our security deposit.  We exchanged e-mails with Belinda and Judy and often would not receive a response for over a month.

We were changed 2 late fees - one which we had already paid, and one which should not have existed.  In one e-mail we cleared up this issue, but in a subsequent email they tacked the fees back on.
We're being charged again for blinds that we replaced on our own dime.

If you choose to rent with Becky Hancock I recommend taking pictures of everything before you move in and everything when you move out.  Otherwise they will try to swindle every dime they can.

name: Hannah Hannes
text: I am a military spouse and started looking for houses to rent when my husband came to Fort Rucker for training. From the very beginning Becky Hancock Realty has been very helpful. I drove all the way from Texas to look at one house and before I made my decision they had me look at 4 other houses in my price range that had what I was looking for in a house to make sure I got exactly what I wanted. Once I decided which house I loved, everything came so effortlessly. They even worked with me in that my husband couldn't sign the lease right away and allowed him to do it at a later date. Since the day I moved in Laurie Turner, Property Manager, has helped me with all of my needs. Any maintenance request I have taken to her, either by e-mail or just going into the office, has been taken care of within 24-48 hours. If I call on a Friday, by Monday morning it is fixed. She has been so wonderful to work with and has made this an easy living arrangement. I would recommend them to anyone new and looking for a house to rent or buy. They have been truly amazing. Thank you so much Becky Hancock Realty!

name: Susan and Win Anderson
text: Terrible company. Consistently rip soldiers and their families off. Do not use this company. Should be on the banned list.

name: Luis Moreira
text: Worst experience I've ever had with any realty company. I cannot emphasize this enough, FIND ANOTHER HOME. I could go on for days on how bad my experience was from day one but I rather not relive and write out pages worth of my frustration. FIND ANOTHER HOME. Especially flight students. They don't care about your situation and they'll increase your rent at the end of your lease because they know you dont have the time to move out and have no choice but to renew. Stay away

name: Sada J
text:
I'll never use Becky Hancock realty again. Worse customer service experience I've ever had with any company. They're crooked. I would not recommend them to anyone.

2.5 rating is your warning!! It should be less than that!!

I’m editing this because I didn’t include much information from my experience with them. The apartment I was renting through Becky Hancock wasn’t the best but it was what I could afford at that time. When I moved out they kept my security deposit and was told I still owed an additional $1,000 because of damage to the apartment. Wow! There was no damage to the apartment other than the damage that was already there upon move in. And definitely not $1000 worth of damage. Crooks!!! So I say that to warn others to please take photos of EVERYTHING before move in and take photos when you move out as well because if not you’ll be blamed for damages that you did not cause. I was accused of stealing a washer and dryer out the unit..... after proving to them there was no washer and dryer in the unit when I moved in and the washer and dryer I was using  during my 3 years of living there was my own that I purchased from Sears that I had receipts for! They were going to charge me for that if I didn’t have PROOF!!! They talked down to me like I was beneath them. Thank God I’m a homeowner now and won’t ever have to use them again. The 2.5 star rating is proof that you should avoid them if possible if not make sure you protect yourself and DOCUMENT EVERYTHING!!

name: sheena poole
text: This is my second time using this agency. Military friendly and the agents are flexible and always helpful. Thank you Mrs Belinda Somersall for all your help!

name: Randy Pryor
text: They stink. They will do all they can to keep your deposit after you move out. From Bed bug and flea inspections that are Never mentioned in your lease. They will not accept your cleaning service even though they say they will. They ask for things to be cleaned that were not clean when you moved in. We were in the home for 3 years and never put a nail in the wall and they came up with some fictious lie there was damage to wall on the small bedroom. I would not  lease or recommend their property management company to anyone unless you want to be screwed at the end of your lease on move out.

name: Ariel Mejias
text: My family and I moved into one of Becky Hancock properties in June 2017, in January 2018 we had a unfortunate event happen to the home- not to anyone's fault everything including the home was lost. Within a week the Realty team had us in a new place as well gathered donations to get us through that week until we got into our new home. We appreciate the work of our property manager Belinda and excited to continue to work with a familiar face in our new home as we make new memories!!

name: William Dirks
text: I never write reviews on any companies, but I have to in this case in hopes to save other people some headache. ABSOLUTELY avoid this company if you are military, or not for that matter. We had several times where we would call for maintenance and no one showed up. Then at the end of the process they took our deposit and charged us an additional $200 for random expenses. We took very good care of the house and did not have any pets. They advertise a quick checkout process that is totally a scam. Avoid this company like the plague.

name: Michael Lait
text: My wife and I just moved to Enterprise from Orlando, we could not believe the excellent care and wonderful service we received from Becky Hancock Realty. We were looking for a house we could call a home, our agent Kim took us to many different homes. She never quit looking and she found us the perfect home! We have been here six weeks now and we absolutely love our home. The rent is exactly what we planned to spend, however the amenities of the home is incredible. I want to personally thank Kim for all her hard work, her diligence paid off. I also want to thank Becky Hancock for pairing us with such a fantastic real estate professional!

name: Alan Crawford
text:
Terrible property management service. Integrity was an issue for us.

We used Becky Hancock Realty as our property manager for the letter part of 6 years. While we were away, the team kept our property rented for 90% of the time. This is the best thing about this company. Aside from that our, there are many other aspects to consider when selecting a company to oversee your investment when you are not able to do so your self.

I am very confident that the managers never once stepped foot in our property while there were tenants occupying the property. This was huge to us as we found many items that were damaged and not functioning after arriving back 6 years later.

The quality of cleaning and repairs when the turned the property back over to us was very bad. We had to completely re-clean the entire place. There were many items that required repair, to include the HVAC system and the sprinkler system.

Pros:
- 90% occupancy rate at or above market value.
- Never missed a payment.
- Online management software makes it easy to keep track of financial records

Cons:
- Did not uphold their end of the co tract with respect to quarterly visits to the property.
- Terrible job keeping up with the condition of the property an appliances. (Preventative maintenance)
- Very bad post rental cleaning standards. I am sure they require more from the tenants when they move out then they actually did for us. Black grout lines, carpet required replacing. Almost the entire place HAD to be repainted.
- When we confronted the managers about the status of several items of dismay, we were given a blanket answer of “Normal wear and tear”. Had the managers competed proper exit walkthroughs I am certain tenants would have been responsible for the majority of repairs and damages. Instead we were left with most of them.

Suggestion, use Becky Hancock if you are local and have the ability to conduct your own spot checks or enforce the terms of your agreement. If you are going to be out of state/country for an extended time, place your trust in another management firm.

name: Jeffrey Mouser
text: Becky Hancock is much more concerned with their owners than their renters. Definitely an owners come first organization .  All I wanted was a little fairness or at the very least for some one to listen to my side and make an informed decision. Instead all I got was, " well sir, it's in the lease".

name: Alisha Turner
text:
This move has been EXTREMELY stressful for my husband and I. From not knowing whether we were PCSing or not until 2 weeks prior, to PCSing from Fort Drum NY all the way here while 33 weeks pregnant, to arriving with only 10 days to find a place when one realty office had agreed to hold a home for us but then gave it to someone else, to EVERYWHERE being unavailable for another 30+ days, low-quality, over-expensive, or not accepting pets... It's been super hectic for us! THANKFULLY, we came across Becky Hancock Realty and their team helped us find exactly what we need, available now, and in great condition (they definitely take care of the properties to really provide safe and cozy housing)! ADDITIONALLY I'd like to applaud 3 lovely ladies on the Becky Hancock Realty team: Anessa, the Maintenance Coordinator, was so friendly we talked for a good fifteen minutes about family and kids, she gave us her name and number and let us know if we ever need anything she'll get right on it! Sabrina at the front desk was fabulous too and helped us get our paperwork together for the leasing appointment (we called in at least three times to talk to her and she was always friendly and helpful)! And Belinda whom we had our leasing appointment with, was extremely knowledgeable and super helpful! Overall, the team is professional, but even more importantly, the team is personable and that's what really made our experience!

-- Thank you so much, Becky Hancock Realty, from our little growing family to your wonderful team!

name: Zakina Henderson
text: My washer & dryer have been giving me nothing but problems since I've moved in here, I haven't even been here a year & have call about my washer 5 times, but every time I call they send 1 of their bootleg workers who will say that there is nothing wrong with the machines then I end up having to pay for having them to come out & not finding anything wrong. I just put 8 towels in the dryer for 70 minutes & guess what, they still aren't dry!!!! No need in calling them to fix it cuz they will swear nothing is wrong with it!!!! Now I see why my lightbill is sky high... new washer & dryer in here please.

name: Paulness
text: I would highly advise others to find a different agency to rent from.  The bottom line here:. All the rental agencies in Enterprise are terrible; they know their market and use it to prey upon service members.  My advice is this:. If you're going to rent in this town, make sure you take photographs of every wall, floor and ceiling.  Take videos of the appliances working.  And be very thorough when conducting and filling out your move-in section reports, document every knick, scratch, and imperfection, because when you move out, they will charge you for damages and keep your security deposit regardless of whether or not you caused them.  And they realize you've moved to a different state or country and are powerless to recoup it.  Now, dealing with this agency has been a headache.  I moved out, and was charged for damages that were documented when I moved in, and their justification does not coincide with the receipts from the repair companies.  They're a very unethical organization.  If I have to live there again, I would rather stay in a motor home than deal with these people again.

name: James Watson
text:
They lie during the checkout process. They offer what they call an easy checkout process, where a tenant can hire an approved cleaning company instead of cleaning the house themselves. The cost for the cleaning company ($300) comes out of the security deposit. Here's a quote from the check out form: "Simply hire one of our
recommended cleaning services and you are done, assuming there are no major damages to the property." I used this easy check out process, but when I finally got my deposit back from them (over a month after I checked out), they had taken out an additional $280 for additional cleaning services on top of the approved company I hired. They also took money out to pay for lawn care service, and paid for service from the same company that I had paid for every month for two years (including the month I checked out). The were no deductions for damages, so I don't understand why these additional cleaning fees were not part of the easy checkout program that was supposed to be all inclusive. Bottom line, they will take more money from you than they say they will, which makes them undeserving of their tenants' trust. They get away with it because the vast majority of their tenants are military, and when those tenants move it's often across the country or overseas and it's very difficult for the service members to negotiate with this company to get their money back from so far away. It also makes it easy for Becky Hancock employees to ignore those service members.

name: Krista Jost
text: I would give 0 stars if I could.. My husband and I have been tenants for all of 1.5 months and have had nothing but problems since. There were several issues with the house from the time we moved in and have yet to be fixed, we were told that “cosmetic” things such as light bulbs and closet doors WE have to fix ourselves, though we moved in with them being out/broken. Our master bathroom has been shut off and “out of order” since we moved in. We call them several times about it, half the time they are not in their office so we leave a voicemail and have NEVER gotten a call back. We constantly have to call and check up on them reguarding everything. They say they do not allow parking on the street but we continuously have a car from two doors down parked in front of our house, we call all the time about it and they do nothing. The trash people won’t take our trash because of this car and our yard is always mowed half a$$ because of it as well. And anytime we call the office, Allie is the one who answers most of the time and she is absolutely rude for no reason. I could go on for days and it’s sad beings the little bit of time we have been here. A big inconvenience for service members to have to deal with, we are currently working on the realty being blacklisted for service members. My advise; look for a different Realter.

name: Trusty Pepe
text: Tons of fake 5 star reviews.  Be wary.

name: Erika Long
text: We recently sold out house with BHR and they were great.  Before that they managed the property as a rental for 10 years and we couldn't have hoped for a better partner.  High recommend using them for either home buying/selling or property management.

name: Fearless Pepe
text: If you are MILITARY moving to Fort Rucker please read.  DO NOT use Becky Hancock, either find someone else or better...LIVE ON POST.  Pictures online looked beautiful, in reality the house had been vacant for months and looks nothing like the pictures.  We PCS'd down here and had no where else to stay so we took it.  To keep it short our property manager is straight up incompetent.  Initially when we showed up...they tried to get us to sign the lease WITHOUT SEEING THE HOUSE.  How terrible is that...trying to get a potential tenant to sign a legal document without even seeing where they would live in person.   STAY AWAY MILITARY LEARN FROM OUR EXPERIENCE.

name: Kayla Smith
text: After being hung out to dry last minute by century 21 (apparently they do not have any 2 bedroom 2 bathroom residents in all of enterprise) the entire staff at Becky Hancock Reality jumped through hoops to get me into a home in a VERY timely manner and got me exactly what I wanted. They were rock stars and I will be going to them for my realty needs in the future.

name: Josh Miller
text: Would give 0 stars if I could. Do not rent from them. They will take your entire security deposit and then some for very minor repairs.

name: Tessa Hartmann
text:
I absolutely despised dealing with these people. They were terrible about calling you back, even if you left them a message. When we moved into the property, there was an issue with the back door locking. A strong wind could blow it open, literally. When we moved in, the carpet by the back door was soaking wet and moldy, because the door had blown open in a storm and the carpet was never cleaned. They said that the door would be replaced and the carpet cleaned and bleached within the week, it was a Tuesday. By the following Monday, they had done nothing about it and when I called them they basically just said they were working on it. I understand that sometimes things take a while to organize logistically, but at least call the tenant and let them know what is going on with the maintenance. Especially when they have mold growing in their carpet. We lived in the property for one year and the manager was changed twice, without us ever being notified. We had some issues with the siding in December and called them about it. We never heard back about what they were doing to fix it so we called back in around February. The former manager had left the company and never passed the information along to the new manager. The new manager said they would get it done right away, and fix the microwave that had just gone out. The microwave was fixed within a few days, but they never did anything about the siding other than come and get an estimate. We called back around a month later and they said that the job had been closed, even though nobody had fixed a thing. After multiple calls and switching to yet another property manager, the siding was replaced about three weeks before we moved out in August. The worst part about the whole thing was that they took advantage of us upon moving out. When we moved in there were some patches in the wall where the paint didn't match. I understand that it was my wife and I's fault that we didn't write all of the individual discrepancies down or take a picture, but when we moved out, they charged us to repaint two rooms, the hallway, and the entire inside of the garage. Not only did they give us a house with some damages, they then charged us to fix it. We are newly married and were first time renters and I think they realized that they could take us for a ride and there wouldn't be a whole lot we could do about it, because we didn't do anything to protect ourselves.

Bottom line, do not rent from these people. They are a horrible company who I am glad I don't have to deal with anymore.

name: Steven Duke
text: Great people. We have been a vendor for years and they are awesome to work with.

name: Brandy J
text: This was our first realty company we dealt with for our move.  Move in was without any issues.  The home was maintained and the services received from the property manager were good.  Belinda was a huge help with any issues that did come up and really helped us feel comfortable.  I did not give five stars because service was not friendly when we initially went in to apply and we were subject to be recorded as if we weren't trustworthy and repeatedly told we were being recorded during our leasing process. I think that's a bit much but they've done well by us so far.  However I will update this review within a year.

name: Kathryn Southard
text: Becky Hancock Realty was a wonderful introduction to the Fort Rucker area, for us.  Sheree was the agent that worked with us, and she was so patient and accommodating as we searched for the right home for our family.  We couldn't have asked for better customer service!

name: MrPuertorico114
text:
MILITARY BEWARE. If they see you in uniform the first thing they ask is for orders so they can see how much you make to jack up the prices on rent. All my non military neighbors paid at least $200 less then i did for exactly the same townhouse.

Out of $750 dollar deposit i got back $61 because they decided to hire multiple cleaning companies for some mysterious reason and decided to repaint and upgrade the house with my money. Please stear clear of these thiefs.

name: Shawn Jones
text: Belinda (Senior Property Manager) and her team were very helpful on getting my house rented.

name: Jason Walthall
text: As a home owner, I am very dissatisfied with them as property management.  They are slow to inform me of tenant issues and pay top dollar for maintenance services....which in turn needs increases the rental amount to the tenants.  I plan on dropping them as soon as I can legally exit the contract. Take it from an owner....BECKY HANCOCK does not provide good service to tenant or owner.

name: JC416
text:
My husband and I had the worst rental experience ever with this company. We wanted to tour two homes and met up with Kevena at the office to do so. Our first impression of her was that she didn’t care about us or her job. She barely introduced herself and didn’t make eye contact with either of us. She had us follow her in our car from the office to the homes. We had already driven by the homes the day before, so we knew pretty much where we were. She led us about ten minutes in the wrong direction, and we followed because we thought maybe she was just taking us there by the back roads. Then we backtracked the whole way back to the houses, and I had to speed to keep up with her.

When we got to the houses, we asked her questions about each one and every time, we got the same “uh I don’t know, never seen this house before” type of response. She didn’t even try to fake it.

After viewing both homes and being thoroughly unimpressed, we asked her if there were any other homes in the area that were similar and available. Once again, she unapologetically told us she had no idea and didn’t even offer to look into it for us.

I have no idea how this lady even has a job if this is the way she treats her clients. At no point did she act interested in what was going on, and she certainly didn’t know anything about what she was doing. Overall, the whole experience seemed incredibly unprofessional and unplanned. I would not recommend this company to anyone.

name: MrPuertorico114
text:
MILITARY BEWARE. If they see you in uniform the first thing they ask is for orders so they can see how much you make to jack up the prices on rent. All my non military neighbors paid at least $200 less then i did for exactly the same townhouse.

Out of $750 dollar deposit i got back $61 because they decided to hire multiple cleaning companies for some mysterious reason and decided to repaint and upgrade the house with my money. Please stear clear of these thiefs.

name: Wes Boldizsar
text: If I was able to give them no stars I wouldn’t we did what was asked of us but there were things that was reported to them and never resolved,would not rent from them again

name: Nicole Brooks
text:
I would recommend this agency to NO ONE!!! Terrible office organization, front office is very unorganized, staff seems less than qualified, and their answers to questions are impossible to understand. This agency is not willing to work with anyone given ANY less than perfect circumstances! My husband I have less than perfect credit but not horrid. We were told thats not the only thing they filter on. They also look at past rental aggrements & rental refernces. Well we have never had to rent before. We own both of our homes and when the person giving us our application  was made aware of this, she just looked at us like we spoke alien!? And they denied our application as soon as they knew that! Even though we had a LIST of personal and professional references, our deposit & first months rent in hand ready to go and our monthly bring home was over  $5200.00!!! Obviously enough to pay rent!
TERRIBLE BUSINESS MANAGEMENT!!!!!

name: JC416
text:
My husband and I had the worst rental experience ever with this company. We wanted to tour two homes and met up with Kevena at the office to do so. Our first impression of her was that she didn’t care about us or her job. She barely introduced herself and didn’t make eye contact with either of us. She had us follow her in our car from the office to the homes. We had already driven by the homes the day before, so we knew pretty much where we were. She led us about ten minutes in the wrong direction, and we followed because we thought maybe she was just taking us there by the back roads. Then we backtracked the whole way back to the houses, and I had to speed to keep up with her.

When we got to the houses, we asked her questions about each one and every time, we got the same “uh I don’t know, never seen this house before” type of response. She didn’t even try to fake it.

After viewing both homes and being thoroughly unimpressed, we asked her if there were any other homes in the area that were similar and available. Once again, she unapologetically told us she had no idea and didn’t even offer to look into it for us.

I have no idea how this lady even has a job if this is the way she treats her clients. At no point did she act interested in what was going on, and she certainly didn’t know anything about what she was doing. Overall, the whole experience seemed incredibly unprofessional and unplanned. I would not recommend this company to anyone.

name: Shawn5cents
text: This place will rip you off and take all of your security deposit no matter what. Do not rent from them. Do your self a favor and find another company. You have been warned.

name: Shawn Jones
text: Belinda (Senior Property Manager) and her team were very helpful on getting my house rented.

name: Randy Pryor
text: Good people. Great property manager. Highly recommend them

name: Nick Beauchamp
text: One of the worst businesses In The Fort Rucker area. Becky Hancock is a crook.

name: Pete Lakoff
text: They have mastered the art of scamming military members.  Absolutely horrendous overall experience.  DO NOT RENT WITH BECKY HANCOCK

name: S. Kianka
text:
They really don't seem too concerned with handling issues concerning their rental properties. So far things are simply ignored 9 out of ten times I report them. Apparently they only care when something is about to explode.

*My house flooded. A pipe burst in my neighbors place and flooded us both. I called for emergency help, and no one bothered to show until an hour later. Luckily I managed to turn the water off for both houses myself, or it would have been a total loss. Now I've been trying for weeks to attempt to get them to refund part of my rent payment for time lost and an exorbitant electric bill due to all the stuff that had to be hooked up for a week to dry the place out.

* These people are thieves, pure and simple. I moved out (after my place flooded due to their negligent maintenance, after my living room ceiling was left lumpy and sagging due to water damage from another issue after the flooding, and after their "repairmen" came by to fix the outside (which had no damage and needed no work) and broke my personal property with their ridiculous hammering and banging around), and am now greeted with an itemized bill that leaves me owing 420 dollars for "wall repairs" which were not even needed. They charged 625 DOLLARS FOR UNNECESSARY "REPAIRS", using up my security deposit and costing me extra. The place had carpet with holes when I moved in (in some places it never even reached the walls), nails in the wall, holes (which, in a lot of cases, I filled in myself), caulk missing in some areas that let insects in, giant holes around pipes, fresh paint that was not applied properly and bubbled up and peeled off (in other areas the color was mismatched and streaky, and it was cheap and came off the wall when you tried to clean it), and was overall just a mess. Do not rent from these people. They do not take proper care of things, they tell you they're going to "inspect" and never show up, take forever to get a single, simple thing fixed, and then extort you when you try to move out. I wish I'd never had anything to do with them.

name: Brooke Thorpe
text: Love everything about them!

name: Randy Pryor
text: Good people. Great property manager. Highly recommend them

name: Calub Hopkins
text: The front desk lady Sabrina helped me and my wife get our first rental house pushed and helped us get approved worked with me every step of the was we are great full for all there help!!

name: Pissed Off
text: I’ve never posted before, but I thought it was necessary to prevent future potential renters from getting ripped off (and renting) by this rental company. They know the constant flow of soldiers coming into Ft. Rucker need places to stay, and unfortunately if you want to live off post, odds are you have to go through them, or thr other equally corrupt rental companies in the area. First off, your security deposit, sign that away and don’t expect it back. Between the cleaning fees (will force you to go to a local company), wall damage (normal wear and tear), carpets (separate from cleaning fee), that security deposit will be sadly depleted! The places they rent to you, often look look worn down, but yet they expect it to be returned as if it was brand new. So, if you are a clean individual who returns your place in the same or better condition, you are looking at a minimum of $300 in cleaning fees, $200 carpet cleaning fees, and $50 for pest control. You will be charged that regardless of what you do. Then expect wall damage to be $200+ for normal wear or tear, and higher for anything more. In closing, go through a private renter, or stay on Ft. Rucker. Avoid tbrowing away your money to these scam artists!

name: Gibson Bradley
text:
My family is an old one in Enterprise. My two grandfathers were the first two presidents of the Enterprise Chamber of Commerce. My name is Lee Yarbrough Gibson Bradley.  I am named after Edward Lee Gibson and Joseph Calvin Yarbrough. The idea of Enterprise and its growth was the vision of my grandfathers and their absolute belief in the future of this area. They invested their hearts and souls in bringing Fort Rucker and industry to this area. I taught school in Enterprise for twenty five years. I loved every year in service to the children of Enterprise and to the community to which they belonged.

Over the years, my family and I have moved from neighborhood to neighborhood.  Sometimes it was happy and sometimes not so much.   The one thing I could always count on to make any move, buy, or sale easier, less complicated, and efficient was Becky Hancock.  While Becky is not native born, she is a native.  Becky has consistently emotionally invested in this community and financially invested the business life of this community.  I cannot truly convey how valuable her advice and counsel have been.

If there is one thing I can tell you about the real estate market in Enterprise, it is to call Becky Hancock. She will serve your interests and do everything in her power to make your dreams come true.

name: Kelsie Mercado
text: Don't really care for their customers and they will find anyway to get money out of you. Worst company ever. And I'm not one to judge harshly but these people only care about one thing and that's bleeding you dry of your money. Rented my property from them but it had some damage. When I listed it 3-4 days later so they could fix it, they said it was too late and that I would have to fix it myself. They honestly don't care about you.

name: Bryce's Mommy
text: Military families please DO NOT rent from this place!!! I wish we had read the reviews before renting with Becky Hancock Realty. They will do whatever to keep your deposit. We opted to clean ourselves when moving out, which the house was not dirty at all and they said we didn't pass clean out inspection. They charge us for previous owner's damages. If you have to rent from this place I suggest taking pictures of everything and every room of the place, even of the roof, and if there is a dish satellite that was previously there (They will charge you a fee for having it put in and not being taken down) Don't make the same mistake we did! They love taking advantage of military families because they know once we pcs we can't come back to look at the damages they "accuse" us of leaving behind at the property.

name: Tamara “tam” Unkel
text: I went there twice and had to fill out the visitors card both times only to pretty much be told they couldn't help me. I assume bc I have a pet. The second lady didn't even say hello to me and was super rude. She read out my income to other people around. And when she sat down for showing me unwillingly which houses they had available - she left me and my sister standing without offering us seats during the whole time of our visit. Very rude and not helpful at all. If you're not military - just spare yourself the hassle. And if you are military - you can do better!

name: Neisha Veal
text: Will not rent from Becky Hancock again. There were things wrong with the property when we moved in. We pointed out several of these things during the walk through. Not only did these things not get fixed, but we got charged for them when we moved out. For some reason JLS felt the need to patch and paint every damn thing. We have such a bad taste in our mouth about this company. If you choose to rent from Becky, PROCEED WITH CAUTION!!!!!

name: Logan
text: Bad customer service. I’d bring lawyer into the security deposit refund process. Soldiers consult the local real estate office or other options. Do not rent from them.

name: F m
text: Useless individuals. My wife and i are independent artists who moved back to the Wiregrass after 4 years in Chicago. We wanted to pay everything up front meaning no need for monthly payments, and they wouldn't even talk to us. Literally showed us the door and said they would shred our information. Any realty company that can't understand 1 in the hand is worth 2 in the bush is too business stupid to do business with. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

name: Tj Johannes
text: Had been renting with them for about two years, never again. They refused to fix anything with the house, they made up rules on the fly (tried to tell me I couldn't have a window unit because it violates the homeowner's covenant. I'm not a homeowner; should have had it in your renter's agreement.) Despite using one of THEIR authorized cleaners, they charged us almost four hundred dollars to clean an already clean house. They said it would take ten days to return our deposit, try more than a month. Then they try to charge me for leaving a satellite dish that has been there since before I moved in. Never renting here again.

name: Jacqueline Hubbard
text: Well, I feel as if I wasted $30 bucks for an application fee. I wish I had seen all these negative reviews before I decided to try and rent from them. I went in paid my fee and was told 24 to 48 hours I would hear from them. That was a Monday. Thursday came and no call. So I called them. They didn't even process my application. I was told it would be done that day and Id get a call before they closed...guess what..no call. So I call on Friday and they couldn't find my application. I was told once again they would process it and call me back.... today is Thursday, a whole week and 3 days later..nothing. I have rented from Prestige, who had me done in 1 day. Becky Hancock Realty, you guys really need to up your game. I don't see how you get customers the way you run your business.

name: Ben Stocker
text: Don’t expect good service or your deposit back at the end of your lease.  Worst agency to rent through around Ft. Rucker. I too would give 0 stars if I could. Do not rent with Becky Handcock.

name: Evan Niles
text: Awful Awful Awful.... 1 star cause I can’t put negativie.  I unfortunately had to rent 2 twice with them. Just warning everyone that when u put a deposit down with them don’t expect to get it back. Actually except to owe them more money. They are the worst company to work with. When moving out they give you a list of cleaners to use that will charge u outrageous prices. For a full clean. But here is the kicker. Even tho they are doing a “full clean”. Becky Hancock will still use ur deposit to pay other cleaners to come in later. We moved out of our last place a month ago. Only lived there 5 MONTHS..  and kept it nice with no damages. And when they did the final inspection they told us that the house was good and we should get back most of the deposit. Nopeeeee. We just received notice from them that we owe the $400 on top of them taking our deposit for “damages”. Lol. Even tho the pictures we took with them show no damage. This is the worst company I’ve ever dealt with and I pray you read these comments before dealing with them. Because unfortunately we saw the reviews too late. Please beware.

name: mikster pmaster
text: Trashed my rental townhouse. There was a squatter living there and they didn’t even know.

name: Constance Oates
text:
I would like to thank the staff at Becky Hancock!!! Wonderful curitous staff... A special thank you and great big hug to Mrs. Tonya Turk! I just purchased my first home she went above and beyond to help me. I have a child with Autism, she came numerous times to reshow our house for him because the change was so much for him and he needed to see it over and over to remain calm. That is only a small example of the kindness she showed me and my boys. I am enternally greatful to her!!! She answered every single question no matter how mundane it may have seemed with professional, direct, and honest answers. THANK YOU MRS. TONYA TURK...For everyone I meet that is looking for a home to buy or rent will be sent straight to BECKY HANCOCK AND THE MOST AMAZING AND OUTSTANDING MRS. TONYA TURK!!!!

LOVE YOU ALL AND THANK YOU SO SO MUCH. My boys and I are home and happy :)

Mrs. Tonya I am crying again (happy tears)!!!

name: Keith Kraker
text: While stationed at Fort Rucker I rented from Realty Executives and Becky Hancock realty. The difference between the two was night and day. At Becky Hancock I felt like I was a valued customer. From the day that that I first walked in with my wife to look at houses through our year as a tenant we were always given great service. The apartment we rented turned out to have significant problems, however, that was compensated for by the prompt and friendly customer service we always received when we called Becky Hancock to get things repaired. When we moved on to our next duty station, the apartment cleaning options with Becky Hancock were much more tenant friendly than they had been with Realty Executives and we were only charged for what were truly damages. Our experience with Becky Hancock wasn't 100%, however, it was light years ahead of our experiences with Realty Executives. When the Army moves us back to Rucker we will be renting from Becky Hancock again.

name: Delaney Mulcahy
text: Probably the worst rental company in the area. They take full advantage of military members and their families. Used the $750 security deposit to bring in several different companies to basically remodel the whole place. You will regret using Becky Hancock reality.

name: jason sierakowski
text:
The best way to describe Becky Hancock's business from a renters point of view is that her upper management staff has no idea how to run the organization. It's kinda like describing shaddy things they do, but you can't catch them in the act of doing something illegal. We toured houses that weren't ready for show, and we're available for over 90 days. Fort Rucker housing office has had many complaints on this. So, what do they do with the security deposits? Who knows. For home owners with Hancock, I would be cautious is they actually try and aggressively rent

Every single time I went to the realty office, I left more disgruntled then before. When it came time for my family to check out, I explained my neighbor has a carpet cleaning service, which is certified,ect. There staff looked at me like I was a stupid idiot, handed me a "Becky Hancock vendor approval" to have them fill out and ME to bring back.

I understand this is a small community and many people coming and leaving the area needing homes to rent, but SHE needs to be more involved, not sit back and collect your 8-10% on renting a home, identify the company's issues and fix them. Look in the mirror and ask, "what am I doing to assist service members getting rental homes, or helping rent there home, with a customer first approach?". I wish TLS or Gwen Gilley would step there game up to take over.

name: Peter L
text: NOT MILITARY FRIENDLY. Becky Hancock is the Comcast of realtors.

name: C G
text: I'm glad I found out early the type of people working at this office, I would never want to do business with dishonest, crooked individuals like Kevena and Belinda. I spoke with Kevena twice trying to get more information on a rental property. She scoffed at my 3 questions and condescendingly spoke to me without answering them. Eventually she transferred me to Belinda who would be the property manager for the rental. Belinda said the owner of the property would have to be contacted to approve my pet and that she was going to transfer me back to Kevena to answer my questions. I kindly asked if there was anyway I could work with someone else as Kevena had not been very helpful (I didn't mention how unkind Kevena had been). She put me on hold for about 10 seconds then picked up and said my pet was not approved. There was no way she called the owner in that time, she lied. I hold honesty and work ethic as two of my top virtues. These two women have proven they have none.

text:

name: Dennis Collins
text: Terry general manager  she is a good Christian to work with

name: G Man
text: Ok I'm giving them two stars because one is just too mean, but they deserve a 1 star because overall customer service is aweful! 1st I want to say I only have experience with their rental and home owner side of the house. I'm military and I bought a house from Butch Wright from Re/Max when I PCS'd he I elected for his company to be my property. Everything was great until he retires and Becky Hancock realty bought him out. That is when everything went down hill. 1st off their ability to call you back is non-existant, Belinda is the absolute worst property manager maybe on Earth. She doesn't know how to speak intelligently on the status of your property. She also is terrible at doing move out inspections. Here is why. I had multiple tenants while under Belinda's keen eye. After I closed out my account the fridge was missing trim, my lawn mower was gone and some how she doesn't have any record of it. There were holes in the walls that cost way more then $150 to fix but only charged the tenants $150. Someone had a cat and when I walked in it smelled aweful. Carpet I never was reimbursed for mismatched and appeared to be pieces together. Like a tenant stained or ripped it and put a patch bandaid on it. They lost the two garage door openers that I had with the house. They gave me to two in return but neither of them work. They didn't checked the backyard at all. There are places along the fence where dogs dug and tenets filled it in with random metal pieces and rocks.  Those are just problems with Belinda. Now for the actual company. Their bookkeeping is horrible. And the owner statements I receive do not match or add up to the completely different system the book keeper uses. I found this it at move out when somehow a vacant house used $700 in four months paying only water and electric bills. I strongly suggest never ever working with this company. Lastly managers are non existent I asked to speak with a manager every time Belinda did not call me back. Yet I spoke to them 1 time in multiple years. And I heard they are bad at selling houses as well.

name: Robert Bercume
text: I do not recommend Becky Hancock reality we sent a list of rentals my wife and I wanted to see but the agent didn’t get keys from other realtors to view them so we got stuck looking at just their rentals. The house we rented at 114.5 Magnolia Circle had issues that we were told would be fixed but took many calls to finally get a working microwave and new backdoor locks. Within 1 month of renting the house wells Fargo sent a gentleman to the house to inform the home owner that he was behind with the payments; I took the paperwork to the property manager at Becky Hancock reality and explained my concerns.  I was told by the property manager that problem was cleared up and everything was good but next month same guy drops off paperwork again concerning the mortgage. I again told the property manager and got the same answer everything was good according to the owner; but again the same guy came by with paperwork concerning the mortgage this time I had to demand the reality company verify the owner was paying for the house and finally the owner paid and provided the proof.   I guess they don’t require proof that the mortgage is up to date before listing properties as it was clearly behind before my family moved in!  If you do rent from BHR document everything wrong with the house in detail and take pictures during your walk through as they will charge you for everything they can to keep your deposit. There was no option for no stars so I had to select the one star!!!

name: shuriken “SHURIKEN4100” LM
text: Well as others I had a terrible experience with this company, I had a home at 236 Rolling Pines Drive, Enterprise, AL 36330 that I was rented from their inventory that was flooded, they never disclosure, and flooded again I had to call neighbors to help me to get out of that property. The funny stuff was that they tried to sell me that property.. It even had a leak on the roof and the windows were falling apart.. I couldn't trust them, who wants to sell a property like that?  Don't Expect your security Deposit, PLEASE BE AWARE THAT EVERY COMPLAINT IS THE SAME, WISH THEY DIDN'T DO THAT TO VETS OR SOLDIERS AT Ft Rucker ....

name: john doe
text: We always expect realty companies to keep every cent of the security deposit, especially in areas such as military establishments, and universities. But when they want more... its just absurd. This company has a sub standard level of customer service, from the moment I moved in, to the moment i moved out. I'm a single man, so i wasnt knocking down walls or tearing things up. They never fixed anything when i moved in, no matter how many times i called. They lied about water damage on a ceiling calling it a burnt spot from the lights... comical. There was a prevalent cat smell and a cat door, but there had never been pets in the establishment according to the realtor. Most people dont read reviews, and i wish i had, but when youre young and dumb, who cares? Until you're living in a house where you fix everything, and then get ripped off on the way out.

name: Shane Densmore
text:
We are in the military and we had the absolute WORST experience ever with this company. From the get go, the staff was unfriendly and just wanted us to sign the rental lease. We should've known from that point to walk away.

There were numerous times we put in work orders (no hot water, paint issues, etc) and were either ignored all together, or took over a week to respond and get anyone out to help.

When it came time to move out the lady was very high-maintainance and wouldn't even shut the manual garage door by herself (I guess she didn't want to break a nail). We asked important questions about how much was going to be taken out of our deposit for mandatory carpet cleaning etc., and every time she just replied with "I have no idea"....thanks for being knowledgable about your job......

P.S. if you have pets, DO NOT RENT from these people. There is an outrageous pet "fee" that is non-refundable and they don't use ANY of that for repairs or "mandatory" pest control after you leave.

In conclusion  DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY. YOU WON'T GET YOUR DEPOSIT BACK AND THEY ARE TERRIBLE TO WORK WITH.

name: Aaron Arguello
text:
I am a retired Army Warrant Officer and I have a rental home managed by Becky Hancock Realty.  I can honestly tell you Becky and her crew have been abosultely outstanding in managing my rental home!  Even through the down lows of the rental market my property manager never gave up and with diligence always found tenants for my home.  Becky and her staff are the best in the Fort Rucker, Alabama area that I have dealt with.  I sincerely recommend them to anyone looking to buy or rent!

Sincerely,
A.A. Arguello
Lorton, VA

name: Stephanie C
text: loved the experience. It was raining a little but they didn't mind still showing a few places.

name: Trent M
text: Terrible customer service. They do not return repeated phone calls. The most attention I have received from them is when they wanted payment. The lease signing was an extremely condescending process, and they blamed me for paperwork they did not send.  If you have a choice find someone else.

name: Tim Powell
text: Expect to have most of your "security deposit" turned into a forced donation to the homeowner's remodel fund. Microwave was broken for a month, once they found out I was moving, they blew me off when I asked them to fix it. Rent from another company.

name: tim jeter
text: Good listings

name: Body alignment class
text: Can you turn off lights after visiting your sites for rent?! In the townhouse on Woodfield Place lights are always left on! The light outside is quite irritating at night!

name: skyler henke
text: Service members avoid at all cost. Will take as much of your deposit as they can.

name: Sean Meisner
text: Worst renting experience I've had.

name: Cliff Crofford
text: Very bad customer service and horrible staff. do not bother with this Company.

name: Deaunqua Bryant
text: Great realtor

name: sherry brewer
text: Honest

name: Brian Scott
text: Communication is next to none.  We get random emails in the  owner portal for charges that we are not expecting constantly.  I cant wait to get out of contract with this company.

name: Ogando Juan
text:
(Translated by Google) Very good service

(Original)
Muy buen servicio

name: Ashley Wilson
text: My fiancé and I rented a house from this company for around 2 years and while most of it was fine, there were a few things that made me very unhappy. For starters, the owner would randomly show up on our property without any notice. The lease clearly stated that the owner was to give us at least 3 days notice before coming onto the property, but she never did. There was another instance where she had some random guy come to work on our fence at 7am, no notice at all. We woke up immediately panicked by a stranger on the property. He didn’t knock, and didn’t tell us why he was there until my fiancé went out to ask him. Even the exterminator guy was like, “oh she didn’t tell y’all I was coming? Ha she’s funny like that.” I have severe ptsd and didn’t find it as funny to have strangers show up to my house with no warning. Lastly, we moved out on March 26th, when both the owner and the lessor told us we did a fantastic job caring for and cleaning up the house. They said that we would get back our security deposit by mail. I just received our deposit back and it is $170 less than it should be, along with a fat cleaning invoice. I’ve cleaned houses on the market for a living before, and I spent DAYS detailing every inch of that house for our deposit. After paying rent consistently throughout the pandemic, while both of our jobs were shut down, I did everything I possibly could to get our deposit back. That house was spotless. Whatever dirt y’all track in after we leave is your fault. It took them almost 2 months to mail us our deposit, only after we called them multiple times about it. During one call I heard her say, “oh sorry! We have the check it’s just been sitting on our boss’s desk.” After paying consistent rent on time throughout the pandemic, even when the law protected us from not doing so, then being shorted like this, we are so disappointed and will not be recommending this company to anyone anymore.

name: Joshua Jones
text: Food is always delicious and great customer service!

name: William Brothers
text: All the People that work there are helpful. Blake, the boss, knows what he is doing and if doesn't, he'll find out. Great place to rent a house.

name: amanda hall
text: I’ve rented from this company for over two years. The owners of this company are amazing! Will get your issues handled in a timely manner, always responds quickly, friendly and professional.

name: Denice Blake
text: We've been renting a house in Hartselle, AL, from Southern Oak Properties for over 4 years.  They are very professional and kind. They always handle any complaints, repairs or problems very promptly.

name: Forrest Haynes
text:
This will be an honest review of this company from a former tenant. No malice intended.

I rented a property from this company from 9/15 to 2/18. I met the owner of Southern Oak, Blake, at the property two weeks prior to move in. There were several small maintenance issues he assured me would be fixed before I moved in:

- No exterior lights working (bulbs)
- Carpet had very noticeable stains and cigarette burns in multiple places.
- Carpet had ripples in multiple rooms, needed to be stretched.
- 6"x12" hole in master bedroom closet drywall where they had repaired a damaged water spigot but did not repair the drywall
- Return air grill was damaged and would not latch.
- Refrigerator door shelves were broken and taped together.

They replaced the return air grill, and stretched the carpet, that was it. The guys that stretched the STAINED/BURNED carpet did not even vaccuum afterwards, carpet fibers everywhere. I needed to move in ASAP so I overlooked being too lazy to replace a few light bulbs, repair a drywall hole, and covered the cigarette burns in the carpet with furniture.

From this point on this company was reasonable. My problem with them was at move out. There was no move in/move out documentation done. The move out inspection consisted of meeting Blake at the property where he walked around for 5 minutes. It took weeks to get my deposit back. When I finally did get a check back for my deposit it was $170 short. No letter explaining why, no phone call explaining why, nothing. After multiple phone calls to their office looking for an explanation they told me the carpet was not "professionally cleaned". That's right, the same STAINED/BURNED carpet that should have been replaced before I moved in was not clean enough for them. They had no clue what the move in condition was because they did not document it.

While I lived at this property I repaired several small maintenance problems and did not request to be compensated:

- Rebuilt two toilets
- Replaced two sets of bi Fold closet doors
- replaced two shower heads
- installed two shower curtain rods
- changed the ballast in the kitchen fluorescent light and replaced both bulbs with LEDS
- Removed an entertainment center that was left in the attic from the prior tenant because I knew if I didn't they'd charge me for it!
- Installed a coupling at the dryer vent because at move in it was 3" PVC!

Even with doing all this, and having the house much cleaner at move out than move in, they still withheld $170 from my deposit, and for that reason, I would not recommend them to anyone. They earned their 1 star review.

***If you rent from this company, heavily document the move in condition of the property, or you'll be paying for it later.

name: Justin Nix
text: Staff is very responsive to tenant issues. Kim rocks!

name: Jimmy Ray Smith (JRay)
text: Great to work with our renter's!

name: L Stein
text:
I needed to retire and move very quickly last fall from Indiana to Madison to help care for my grandchildren during this crazy pandemic.
Taylor Drake became my contact in finding an apartment quickly and efficiently at Madison Park apartments. She has been an absolute blessing walking me through all of the processes. Anytime I've had ANY questions throughout this past year, she has answered them courteously and  promptly. I know I can count on her for any help I may need. She is a fantastic model of what customer service is all about; she's a gem--don't lose her!! The apartment is wonderful! I love the layout of the space, the landscaping is just beautiful, the grounds are immaculate, and the pool is crystal clear... always! I've lived in many apartments across the U.S. and this has been the best!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind comments about Taylor, she is truly amazing and a key part of our Madison Park team! If there is anything we can help you with, please don't hesitate to reach out!

name: Ramsay Newman
text: Madison Park apartments makes everything easy. I love it here. been here for two years and did not have one issue. Taylor Drake in the front office is quick to respond and is very helpful.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words and continued residency here at Madison Park Ramsay! We will make sure Taylor hears your compliments.

name: Madhuri Pasupuleti
text:
I have been a resident @Madison Park Apartments since 2018. Great apartment, great maintenance, great ambiance, and most importantly, friendly staff ( Taylor and Kristen). They always greet me with a smile and are the best at what they do. The maintenance staff, Bill, is very helpful and fixes any maintenance issues like a pro.

Love my stay here. I would highly recommend this apartment.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Madhuri, we appreciate your continuing to chose Madison Park as your home after all these years! We are extremely lucky to have Taylor, Kristen and Bill on our team and will definitely pass your compliments on.

name: Ashley Archey
text: I moved here from California and Taylor Drake has been wonderful! Any question I have she promptly answers without hesitation. The complex is kept up and looking beautiful. The apartments themselves are spacious. I had one with a sunroom made the apartment feel much bigger. I was nervous about bring my dog but he was welcomed with open arms which I appreciated! Thank you Taylor for all the awesome work you do!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Ashley! We are glad that Atlas loves his new home. Taylor is great and we are very lucky to have her as part of our Madison Park team. If there is anything else we can do for you, please don't hesitate to reach out.

name: Conner Tyson
text: We have greatly enjoyed our time at Madison Park! The leasing process was great. Taylor went above and beyond when communicating with us about different lease options and pricing. I had LOTS of questions and she took the time to answer them all. The entire office staff is so pleasant and we are so glad we chose to live here!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing Madison Park as your home Conner! We look forward to the wonderful time you'll have as one of our residents here. We are so lucky to have Taylor at Madison Park.

name: Amber Winkles
text: This is an excellent community to live in. I couldnt say enough good things about Madison Park. I am new to this complex, but I have had noting but positive experiences here. The application process was easy and quick and I was called right away. Taylor and Kristen are WONDERFUL people and are so sweet. They are quick to help you and find a solution that works for you. The maintenance team is on point! The apartments are beautiful and clean. The community is peaceful and quiet. I love that there is a dog park for my baby boy to run and play. The grounds are beautifully maintained. There is ample parking and even a spot where you can wash and vacuum your car. The pool is beautiful and always clean. The list goes on and on. They really think about the residents and make sure we have plenty of what we need and are happy with our homes. If you are looking for an affordable apartment in Madison, this is the place to be! They are like family here and I love my new home. 💕

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Amber! We are so glad you're enjoying your new home. We will pass your compliments to both our onsite and maintenance teams, if there is anything we can assist you with, please don't hesitate to reach out to our onsite manager.

name: Victoria Hawkins
text: I have loved my experience at Madison Park Apartments! There is an abundance of amenities, the apartments are spacious, and the staff is great! Especially Taylor Drake! Taylor has been so kind and is always so quick to respond and assist with all my questions! I am very happy that this is the place I landed when moving across country.

resp.text: We thank you for choosing to live at Madison Park Victoria! Your kind words are appreciated and we will pass the compliments along to Taylor. If there is anything we can do to continue to make your cross country move as smooth as possible, please don't hesitate to reach out!

name: Jessica O'Connor
text: I moved to Madison Park in 2019 and Taylor Drake at the leasing office was very accommodating and answered all of my questions. Since then I have not been disappointed with the service I have received from her or any of the other staff in the leasing office or maintenance. Also, the apartment itself is great and feels like home. I would recommend that anyone looking for an apartment in the area to at least check Madison Park out.

name: Rachel Sims
text:
Madison Park has been a great place to live temporary while we wait on our home to get finished! The amenities offered are very nice and the apartments are so spacious.
Everyone has been so friendly and the office staff and maintenance have been very helpful during our time.

resp.text: That's great to hear Rachel! Congratulations on the new home and please let us know if there is anything we can do to help.

name: T Parker
text: This is where I call home. Living here, I don't think ever want to buy a house. I love it here. It is so nice and quiet. The staff are amazing. Taylor and Kristen are so wonderful and so sweet. They are always willing to help in anyway. I love them. The maintenance guys, Bill N. and Michael K. are awesome. When I put a maintenance request in, it is completed within 24 hours. Even with Covid-19 happening, they get the job done with mask and gloves on. My air conditioner went out in my apartment, they replaced it with a new one. They also put a portable air conditioner in my apartment overnight until the parts came in the next day. These apartments are amazing. The neighbors are friendly, not mention it is gated. Home Sweet Home!

resp.text: That is so wonderful to hear Ms Parker. Having amazing residents like you is what makes our community so great. I will pass on your kind words to the team. And please continue letting us know if there is anything we can help you with!

name: B G
text: Madison Park has been my home for some time now and it is truly a wonderful place to live. The community is quiet and peaceful, community events are creative and fun, and the amenities offered . But what I truly appreciate about Madison Park is the incredible staff, particularly Kristen and Taylor! They have always been able to resolve any issues I may have had. They go above and beyond to enhance my living experience and have made it all the more enjoyable. If you're in need of a place to stay, Madison Park is the place to be!

name: Debbie Rogers
text: I LOVE these apartments esp how quickly Bill in maintenance responds to work orders.  I place a work order and  usually within half hour to hour (and most times quicker )  Bill has item repaired.  Thank you Bill. AWESOME job

resp.text: Wow, that is so great to hear Ms Rogers :) We appreciate you being part of the Madison Park community and will pass on the kind words!

name: Megan Marks
text: We have lived here for two years and had nothing but great experiences! The pricing is good, especially for the area. Taylor Drake, the assistant manager in the office, is awesome! She has always been such a big help and always has a smile on her face when I see her. She even helped me load a heavy package from the office into my car once! The office staff as a whole has always been friendly and welcoming, but Taylor goes above and beyond for the residents at Madison Park Apartments.

resp.text: Hi Megan, thank you for your residency with us! We love Taylor and will be sure to pass on your compliments :)

name: Angela G
text: People are fine but they post false pricing... It was posted an hour ago that they were 1260... They were 1410. When asked was told well nothing I can do about it... That is by definition false advertising.

resp.text:
Hi Angela,
We have investigated your concerns and do show our website correct and up to date. We apologize for your confusion. Our pricing does change daily depending on many factors. We wish you the best in your home search. Kind regards.

name: Di Schlabach
text: Super friendly Office!

name: Alecia Flint
text: I lived at Madison Park for 5 years and only moved due to relocation. The property is beautiful and well kept. Everyone I dealt with in the front office was always nice and helpful. Maintenance was quick and friendly also. I had a great experience. As someone who reads reviews in making my decisions I wanted to leave this one to help anyone looking to potentially move here. Do it, you won't regret it!

name: Alison Ditmars
text: I loved my experience getting our apartment here Kristen is awesome !!! And she had a smile and was so nice the whole time she was showing me the unit we move in September 14th and because of my experience with her I am so excited for this new adventure with my husband!!! Thank you Kristen for being so nice and taking the time to show me around

resp.text: Hi Alison, that is so wonderful to hear and thank you for the kind words. It is wonderful to have you join our community and please let us know if there is anything our team can do to help you move in to your new home.

name: Katisha Matthews
text: They never answer the phone at all just care about your money that’s it we had a snake In front of our door they told us it’s not a Emergency I can’t wait till my lease up

resp.text: Hi Katisha, we apologize for not getting the phone last week. We were experience phone outages for about 24 hours, but everything is working correctly now. Please don't hesitate to reach out if we may assist you.

name: Deborah Hopkins
text: Overall I liked this place. Kristen was an absolute doll! Only complaint it our apartment had a tremendous amount of mold growth and I dont feel that it was properly treated at all!

name: Billie Hunter
text: Very nice complex.

name: Teresa Rivera
text: e. Place amazing staff.

name: Tyler Smoker
text:
I have lived here for a little more than 2 years.  The apartments are very nice and the management staff has always been nice. However, over the past couple months, it seems the residents that they are moving in are subpar.  Excessive noise at all hours of the day and night. Including people racing through the parking lot, people blasting their bass/music in their car to the point where I could hear lyrics inside my house with my doors and windows closed in my apartment, and inconsiderate, rude neighbors that when asking them politely to be a little more considerate, they shrug you off and go on about their rude and hateful ways.  I can not wait to move in 2 years when I get new orders to go somewhere else. Never living in an apartment again.

Edit: I've lived here for 2 years and a few months. I'd imagine someone could query on the last name to find what unit I live in.

resp.text: Hi Tyler, we would like to reach out to you to see if we can assist with issues you are having. However, we don't see you as a resident at Madison Park. Did you leave this review for the correct property?

name: JJ Jinright
text:
Amenities are nice,  but get ready for apathy from management on any issues and surprise fees. They got bought out in the last year and stopped caring. Fees that cant be rationally explained and the renters will always be at fault.

Edit: Previous tenants have fed local wildlife causing issues, with requests into management and no actions taken. Currently, I am learning that several residents have been affected by fees that were not communicated and the "fault" was pushed to residents. I did reach out to voice my concern, the response was A. We can ask corporate, but that's about it. B. Paraphrased: 'We can't keep up with when all of our residences information can expire resulting in a fee.' That's literally the job.

resp.text: It is great to hear you are enjoying the community amenities. We care very much and appreciate any feedback. We ensure all residents are treated fairly, with a priority of maintaining a clean and safe community. Current community fees are standard and transparent. Is there a specific fee you are confused about? Please don't hesitate to reach out if we can assist.

name: J C (WhatCanISay?!)
text: Great apartments

name: Michelle Norwood
text: Very clean complex

name: Joslyn Abrams
text: HONEST REVIEW: As a Tuscaloosa native I’d heard about Woodlawn Manor and the reputation proceeded it. But when I came to view the unit I was pleasantly surprised and could not beat the price point. It is central to everything in Tuscaloosa. I moved into a one bed one bath with my dog the first of February and it has been fantastic. Being a single woman I was nervous about living alone out here but  The leasing office and agents are AMAZING and my neighbors are so friendly and welcoming! It’s ideal for college students or elderly who don’t want the responsibility of a home right now.  This was a gamble that paid off. Great price, great location and under Druid City Properties it’s really turning around. Don’t miss out on Tuscaloosa’s Hidden Gem!

name: Jeanetta Nixon
text: I love staying here. It's nice and quiet

name: Amanda Harper
text: I can not wait until my lease is up!!!! I've never lived anywhere like this before. The maintenance requests go unnoticed, I live downstairs and my upstairs neighbors obviously does not have a job. They fight, blast music and stomp all day/night. I've called several times and reported them, NOTHING has happened. I would sleep in my car at the park before moving here. Let's not talk about the bug problem. They do not care about their tenants but expect the rent each month. I have a toodler whos never even been outside over here because of the fast driving and gun shots. DO NOT MOVE HERE.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback.  As of June 1st, 2019 Woodlawn Manor is under new management.  Druid City Properties is now over this complex.  We are committed to improving Woodlawn Manor and making it a quieter, nicer, and safer place to live.  We hope the upgrades over the next few months will help improve your opinion of this property.  Please contact us with any and all additional feedback so that we can continue to improve.

name: Shakila Rashaad
text: I give this place 3 stars because of my upstairs neighbor and these ghetto ass rats around me! She let's them run wild they bust my car window I got so sick of her ass I had to talk to her to many times so when my window got cracked I went to the manager she sent her a notice & it has got 10times better I rarely hear anything & I never see those kids anymore 😁😁 as for the apartment it's great really nice I have no bugs & whenever I had an issue maintenance was quick and resolved every issue but I rarely had problems with the apartment. I would recommend a upstairs unit for anyone wanting to move here though because most of these people are welfare rats with lots of bad ass kids!
