name: Lisa Imwalle
text: This management association is amazing!  They are extremely passionate about their job to protect, preserve and serve our neighbors.  I recently had a dispute with a neighbor and they compassionately helped us come to an agreement.  They genuinely cared about both parties involved and handled an emotional situation with professionalism and excellent communication skills!  I am so thankful I can sleep better knowing the dispute is resolved!

resp.text: Hi Lisa, thank you for this review! It is our honor and pleasure to serve you and your community! We're so happy this has been evident in our interactions. We're pleased to hear a dispute was able to be mitigated by our staff with professionalism and compassion. Glad to hear you can sleep better now! Rest easy!

name: William Grant
text: Having served on our community board for over a decade and as current president for nearly five years, I can state unequivocally that Neighborhood Management is by far the best property management company that we have ever worked with. Amanda Carr (Vice President of Association Management) and Nicole Predhomme (Association Manager) have gone above and beyond to not only make a seamless transition from our previous property management company, but also exponentially improve upon the management duties in every possible way. Nicole P. has done a tremendous job as our manager as she is extremely responsive and detail-oriented. Our accounting and finances have never been in better shape and I feel confident in the future with Neighborhood by our side. It is a great feeling to be able to have confidence and trust in your property management company. Best decision that we ever made!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, William! We are so grateful to hear of your positive experience across accounting, management, and the whole Neighborhood Management team. We love exceeding expectations for the residents we have the privilege of serving! We will certainly pass this feedback along to Amanda, Nicole, and the entire team. Thank you for making the switch to Neighborhood Management and giving us the opportunity to work with you!

name: Georgeana Wilkerson
text: 1st time and it was Very pleasant and professional experience!  I was emailed the forms to complete and submitted the required documents to the HOA board for their approval to paint the exterior of the home. Betsy Davenport was very kind and responsive to forward the request to the board members immediately. I received an approval quickly and we are proceeding with a fresh update on the house. They did not make it complicated nor was it frustrating to deal with anyone. Working together was very good!

resp.text: Hi Georgeana! Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We're so glad to hear your ARC submission and approval process was smooth and easy. Enjoy your fresh new paint job! It's our pleasure to serve your community!!

name: VALORIE CREASY
text: I can not speak enough positive words about Betsy at Neighborhood Management. She was very attentive to my needs and was able to help from the previous manager of our property. Thank you Betsy for EVERYTHING you did to help make our account correct! I appreciate it BEYOND words!!!

resp.text: Hi Valorie! Thank you for your review. We're pleased to hear that Betsy was attentive and took care of your needs. We can feel the large amount of gratitude in your last sentence, and it makes us so grateful to have a team that serves you well! It is our honor and privilege to serve you and your community!

name: Rose Schoener
text: They have a new community manager. I sent an email regarding something that was suppose to be taken care of by the previous one and the response was almost immediate.  I am, so far, happy with the way she handled my issue.

resp.text: Hi Rose! Thank you for your review. We're very glad to hear you're pleased with how the issue was handled by your new property manager. We're excited to have some great new hires on our team. It's our honor to serve you and your community, and we certainly want that to come through in everything we do!

name: JF Warren
text: Until a few days ago, I would have given less than one star because I have had absolutely nothing positive to say about this organization....Communication has been one-sided when assistance, advice,  or even a return phone call was needed or asked for from them...After 17 years this seemed to have become the norm instead of the exception......Fast forward to the arrival of a new manager who introduced herself last week (Betsy).....She has been successful in getting an old, simple, possibly trivial (albeit years long) problem solved for me after many requests to others whom I contacted over the years....I hope the next time I am asked to submit a review by the organization that I can give five stars for what it is worth...I will gladly do it.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We do hate to hear that your past experience was not up to our standards of what our company strives for, and we apologize for that drop in communication that we were unaware of at the time. We are, however, very glad to hear your current experience with your new property manager has been pleasant and satisfactory. We're very excited to have Betsy on our team. She's been a great addition and delivers on our core values which is just what we look for! We really appreciate your business and the opportunity to serve you and your community.

name: Cheryl Oatts
text: It is a pleasure to work with Nicole Predhomme at Neighborhood Management, LLC.  She is only a phone call away.  She takes the time to thoroughly answer any questions I have.  She follows through with prompt service.

resp.text: Hi Cheryl! Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear of your pleasant experience with our team! We'll certainly pass this along to Nicole! We appreciate the opportunity to serve you and your community!

name: Simple As A to B
text: Betsy has been a breath of fresh air.  Appreciate her willingness to listen and and our interactions have been straight forward and fair.

resp.text: Hi, thank you for your review! We're grateful that you feel heard by our staff and have enjoyed working with our team! This review will be passed along to Betsy. We appreciate the opportunity to work with you!

name: Joy Smith
text: Nicole P went above and beyond to help me.  Very professional and willing to take ownership of unforeseen issues and to see my needs were taken care of quickly.

resp.text: We appreciate your review, Joy! We are so glad to hear Nicole was able to go above and beyond your expectations as well as be able to take care of your needs quickly. These are some of our core values, and we love seeing them in action! We have let Nicole know of your kind words. Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you and your community!

name: Anthony Howard
text: NHMLLC and its employees are wonderful business partners. As a vendor for their company, they are always professional, courteous, organized and understanding with us. Amanda and the Birmingham team, always ensure their properties are managed efficiently and effectively. We love working with NHMLLC!!!

resp.text: Hi Anthony! Thank you so much for your review. It's great to hear from a vendor's perspective that the excellence we strive for as a team comes through in all aspects and relationships. We appreciate your partnership with our company!!

name: Dennis Lovin
text:
Serving a homeowners association is not a simple business.   In our case, we have over 170 households to help live in a covenant community.   The truth is, some people buy in a neighborhood with a homeowners association, but actually wish no one to hold them accountable for the mutual standards.  It is living with covenants that make a well-managed community a priority.

Try keeping this many folks in harmony without a superb homeowners management team, and you'll quickly discover, as we did years ago, that it is an impossibility.   Too soon confusion and chaos begin to drag both the enjoyment of life and the value of the properties down.

Neighborhood Management does an exception job with an exceptional and skilled staff.   They do the hard work of dealing with difficult people and situations directly, relying on the Board of Directors for guidance and instruction.  You could not pay me enough to do for us what they do---and this statement comes after years of professional experience dealing with people.

resp.text: Dennis, thank you for your kind words and support! We are very pleased to hear of your positive experience with our team. What we do at Neighborhood Management is indeed hard work, but it is rewarding work! For us, it is a privilege to serve you and your community. Thank you for allowing us that opportunity!

name: Winston Smith
text: Neighborhood Management, LLC, is NOT you typical HOA which clearly starts at the top. The folks I have dealt with are easy to work with and "get stuff done". Total professionals who want to help. Speaking of whom, Jenny Templin embodies being a professional. She clearly knows her craft and is well versed in all aspects of it. She works tirelessly to ensure homeowner issues are addressed and taken care of. She is the best!

resp.text: Hi Winston! Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear of your positive experience with Neighborhood Management and also specifically Jenny. We will certainly share this positive review with her and the whole team. We believe hard work pays off, and we're thankful to see the hard work our team has put in has benefited you and your community. We love having the opportunity to serve your community!

name: Susan Hacker
text: After a horrible experience with another mgt co about 4 years ago, our HOA contracted with Neighborhood Mgt. First property manager seemed okay, but over time felt she was not giving our HOA an appropriate level of service. She left and we were assigned a new property manager who again seemed okay at first, but...At this point I was totally disappointed with Neighborhood Mgt. and complained to Amanda Carr. Ms. Carr took action, and shortly after, our HOA was assigned a new property  manager, Nicole P., and we couldn't be happier so far.  Nicole is detail oriented, organized, prompt in handling of our business matters, firm when needed, courteous and professional, always available and attentive to our calls - a welcome change. I was in the habit of checking up to make sure things were being done, most times finding they had not or getting no answer at all.  With Nicole, things are totally opposite.  Everything is handled promptly with answers to questions usually the same day or by the next day - no excuses, just action. Before I had to keep a tickler list because we had too many things fall through the cracks.  After working with Nicole for about four months now, I feel more assured and comfortable that things are being done without my follow up. It is so much easier for a Board to work through a management company for compliance issues, etc. than to have to handle them directly with your neighbors.  But for Nicole, this would be a 2 star review because of past experiences.

resp.text: Hi Susan! Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us this feedback. We're grateful your community gave us the opportunity to manage your HOA as it is our honor to serve your community! We are glad you took your concerns to our VP of Association Management, Amanda, and the issues were handled appropriately. Nicole certainly does an excellent job. It's wonderful to hear she's providing the level of service we strive for! We'll be sure to pass your words along to her. We genuinely appreciate being able to serve you and your neighbors!

name: Frank Tucci
text: I would just like to take this opportunity to thank Amanda and the association for the wonderful job they did to organize and communicate the Christmas food and gift drive.  Based on the results I saw, it was a fabulous success.  Thank you for setting it up and coordinating everything!  We all live in a fabulous and giving community and I am proud to be a part of it!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review, Frank! You are certainly right – our Annual Food & Toy Drive was such a success this year!! We couldn't have done it without all of the wonderful, generous communities we serve! Huge thank you to all that participated!!

name: Robbe Gay
text: I work with many Property Management companies and Neighborhood Mgmt is one of the best!! It is not always easy to work with some HOA's and mgmt companies, but these ladies are the best!!!

resp.text: Hi Robbe, thank you for your review! We love our team and are so glad to hear you've had the opportunity to work with many of them and have experienced the same pleasant experience across the board. We appreciate the opportunity to work with you!!

text: Neighborhood management has been managing  our association for several months now. I work closely with Amanda as well as other members of the company. resp.text: Thank you for you review, Tammy! We are so glad to hear that you are pleased with our performance and communication. We do want what's best for the communities that we have the honor of serving, so we're grateful to you for recognizing that and taking the time to express it!

text: I live in a NHM community and have always been impressed with the positive, professional image they present. name: Robert Barnes
text: A few neighbors and I had a problem with a street light that was overly bright and shone through our windows and lit up our yards at night like it was 2:00 pm on a sunny afternoon. Thanks to coordinating efforts on the part of NHMLLC the issue is no more.

resp.text: Hi Robert. Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear that our team was able to coordinate with Alabama Power to see to it that this issue was resolved for you. This is the standard we aim for. We hope you guys can now have more relaxing evenings and restful nights!

name: Brooke Hundley
text: This HOA is the worst!!!!!!!!!!  Would have given ZERO stars if google would allow!  I think they spend all their time looking for weeds and sending out violation notices!

resp.text: Hi Brooke, thank you for your review! We are sorry to hear you haven't enjoyed your experience with us and appreciate your feedback. Although we have been hired by your board to specifically look for those types of things and to send out violation notices to keep your community looking as beautiful as it currently does, we'd like to highlight some additional things we've done just recently with our time to benefit your community: worked with the board to open the pool early due to nice weather (typically it doesn't open until Memorial Day), installed a security light fixture at the pool, took care of brush clean up in several areas, and made several repairs to the entrance, accent, and up lighting. We're also very eager about a recent new hire on our team that is a 10+ year veteran in association management that is now the property manager for your community.  We hope this can provide a bit of insight into some ways we've being working hand-in-hand with your board to provide the best service possible to your community, and we apologize if that hasn't been made clear in the past. We truly appreciate the opportunity we have to serve your community!

name: Robert Cleckler
text: Reached out to Amanda Carr today about some things and she was very responsive and was able to get things resolved quickly and to my satisfaction. I have always found her easy to work with and she is always very helpful. Great job!

resp.text: Hi Robert! We're happy to hear your situations were approached head on and handled immediately to your satisfaction! Thank you for your review!

name: Paige Ellison
text:
I appreciate the role of HOAs in protecting homeowner property values and in supporting neighborhoods' quality of life. I try to always pay my dues, assessments, and any increases in dues on time and without complaint.

However, this HOA management company leaves much to be desired. The management company's point of contact for my neighborhood could not be reached by phone. Eventually after numerous phone calls, her assistant answered and did not want to transfer me to the point of contact.

I have two properties in this neighborhood and I could not determine which property email correspondence was referencing due to the lack of clarity of neither address being mentioned in the message. I was told I had no email address on file, yet I had email traffic. I was charged $500 to "set up a new account" when I purchased a second property in the neighborhood although it was apparent that both properties were under one account when the HOA worker offered to balance the credit and deficit between the two properties.

Amounts could not be explained including what was owed to the company and credits showing on the statements to me.

The HOA management amount provided for a home closing statement could not be explained and was blamed on the closing attorney. However, the sellers were required to pay the HOA management company for determining this number. It was explained to me that this is handled by an entirely different branch within the company and could not be addressed by the HOA Management representative assigned to my neighborhood.

This inefficient and ineffective management of my neighborhood dues and the convoluted manner to determine the status of a homeowner's present financial standing with the HOA, along with the collection of fees from closing agents/attorneys to ascertain the status of a property owner's HOA account, and coupled with the collection of a $500 account set up fee each time the same person buys another property in neighborhood,  leaves me with a bad taste regarding where the genuine interest of this particular neighborhood management company lies. I have become convinced that the quality of my neighborhood is not the really important part. Rather it is the profit margin for this management company.

I would greatly discourage utilizing this management company until their priority of your neighborhood's quality of life is clearly of greater prioritization than nickel and dime-ing homebuyers, closing agents/attorneys, and homeowners, without even the courtesy of simple explanations regarding their bookkeeping.

resp.text: Hi Paige. First, we’d like to say thank you for your review. Your satisfaction is very important to us, and we hate to hear that you’ve been dissatisfied. We have investigated each individual issue you have presented here in an effort to clear things up and see where there may be opportunity for growth within our company. We do apologize for any lack of communication or miscommunication. In our examination of your account and community, we’d like to offer some clarification. The $500 fee you speak of is an initiation fee specific to your community billed by the developer to fund association operations. This is not a fee from Neighborhood Management in your community nor any other communities that we manage, in fact we actually do not get a single dollar of that fee. We simply collect it on the developer’s behalf. As you mentioned, you have two properties in this community. The email confusion was due to the brand new account being made. We had your email on the older account but not the new one. That has since been updated. In an effort to make this a smoother process for you, we offered to merge ledgers which would in turn merge your accounts; however, you stated you were not interested in doing that. We can still merge them if you’ve changed your mind, just let us know and we’ll get right on it! Lastly, there are some additional details pertaining to your account that our VP of Association Management will be reaching out to you with in an effort to not reveal any personal information of yours here. Our hope is that this provides the clarification you’re looking for but please know you can reach out to us with any additional questions you may have.

name: Lance Powell
text: As board president, I have the pleasure to work along side with Neighborhood Management (Eva Wilson) on a frequent basis. I'm very pleased to have her represent our community as our property manager as she does with our best interest in mind. Requests are always handled in a timely manner.  She has helped the board make an impact on the community with numerous upgrades. I look forward to  continue having Neighborhood Management and Eva Wilson represent our community.

name: Peggy Peck
text: I have been on the HOA Board since the builder turned over the community to our homeowners, and it has been a pleasure to work with Amanda and now Jenny.  Both women are pleasures and professionals.  When I send a message to one of these ladies, I can feel assured that one of them will be in touch with me usually within the hour.  They work hard for us, and they volunteer to go above and beyond my expectations with every encounter.  I highly recommend Neighborhood Management to any community looking for a management company.  I give them 5 stars.

name: Corey white
text: I can see other people have had the same issues with this company. VERY Unresponsive. If you are in the market in buying a house and this is your home owners association i would strongly consider not purchasing that house. You will end up with extra fees all because you never received a call back, and they are bot gonna help with those fees if its their fault in the first place. This is in regards to the Cottages at Fieldstown. But this company is everywhere so be careful.

name: John Barnes
text: NHM is one of the best property management companies in Alabama.  Time and again they have exuded excellent problem-solving skills in an industry that produces new issues every day. Their responsiveness and professionalism is top-notch.  They truly care about their associations and members. Great company from top to bottom.  Highly recommend!

name: Courtney T. Noble
text: Neighborhood Management decided it was a good idea to place liens on 20+ people’s homes in the middle of a pandemic without one single piece of communication to let people know. The only reason I knew was because I searched the probate website. They also tripled, almost quadrupled, the annual HOA fees due by sending us to a collections attorney (Alford & Barnes). They did this instead of simply communicating with residents who had inquired about who they were. This is a neighborhood that they have never serviced and has yet to have an HOA meeting in the 7 years I’ve been a resident. Therefore, we were simply doing our due diligence. The “neighborhood manager” who was assigned to us failed to communicate and is no longer with the company. Coincidentally, she is the one who processed all of the paperwork for the liens. Just because you can “legally” do something doesn’t make it morally or ethically right. Thanks for adding a deeper financial burden to some that are already having a hard time. If I could give them zero stars, I would.

name: Teresa McCrillis
text: Neighborhood Management (Amanda Carr) was an outstanding management company for our property.   Help was always courteous and timely.   As a board member, I worked directly with Amanda on a variety of issues, and always found her to be willing to understand our issues and work for a resolution.  She took a personal interest in our community and helped us improve.  We will miss Neighborhood Management.

name: Portia Jennings
text: They never answer residents phone calls; they do not do anything positive for the neighborhood and literally impossible to work with. Angie was nice and responsive at first but now she just dodged calls and doesn’t return them or emails. I do not recommend.

name: Raima Reese
text: It is a pleasure to work  closely with Neighborhood Management,  . As Board President I have worked directly with Amanda Carr and Jenny Templin.  Both are excellent property managers and I cannot say enough good things about them. Amanda and Jenny  put the customer first and  always  display,   professionalism and courtesy.  Recently  Jenny has solved many community problems very quickly and efficiently. It means so much to my Board  members and myself to know whatever problem or situation our community is facing we know that neighborhood management will handle it.  Both Amanda and Jenny  have gone above and beyond continue to make my community the best to live in.

name: Debby Rosser
text: Jenny Templin has been very helpful to me with my many, many Treasurer questions over the past few months.   It is important to me that she responds to my calls promptly, and follows through with her promises.  She has helped me make my Treasurer of our board job so much easier.   I recommend Neighborhood Management.

name: Brandon Roberts
text: Jenny and Amanda have done an excellent job taking care of our community. They work with our HOA Board to help our apartment owners keep a high standard. They are quick to respond and are very professional. The financial reports they provide are easy to understand and their attendance at our meetings have been very helpful for problems that arise.

name: Karim Giraud
text: Neighborhood Management LLC (Amanda Carr and team) has doing an outstanding job. I have been dealing with them since 2012 as a resident and and as the HOA President since 2016. They have been helpful and available whenever I needed them. There were some issues early on, but they have worked hard to rectify them and make resident experience with them better.

name: Leila Parish
text: Love the team at Neighborhood Management, LLC!  Amanda and the entire property management team go above and beyond for all of their clients.

resp.text: Hi Leila! We're so glad you feel this way! We certainly try to exceed our customers' expectations, so this compliment means a lot to us!

name: Kathleen Millen
text: Neighborhood Management does an amazingly effective job of making all the folks in our community feel as special as they know they are. That's a really hard job and Cat Booth is particularly good at.it. Good communication and consistent treatment for every homeowner are her hallmarks.

name: Whitney Mork
text: Excellent customer service and client care! Catherine Booth is always extremely responsive with any questions we may have and she has been a pleasure to work with. I’m very pleased.

name: Alexander Romei
text: This is company that works hard for their communities. I've had the pleasure of working with them professionally and having them oversee the HOA in my neighborhood. In both instances they have made my life easier and maintained a level of professionalism thats hard to come by. Jenny, Amanda, and Angie are saints. Anyone would be lucky to have them manage their neighborhood.

name: Gwen King
text:
I have tried repeatedly to contact Amanda Carr on behalf of my mother in an attempt to reconcile the HOA bill.  Three messages that have not been returned.

I have also dealt with her regarding the visibility of the trash cans.  There's no where to put then except the back yard.  We agreed to a four month window to possibly add something on the side of the house to block them.  Two weeks later, we got another letter say legal action would be taken . . . over trash cans!  My call to Amanda on that issue also resulted in the need to leave a message that has also gone unanswered.

Poor customer service is one thing, but, when it continues to cause my mother stress over trash cans and late fees because of possible erroneous HOA carry over charges, that's hard to accept.

resp.text: Hi Gwen! We’re sorry to hear you’ve had a negative experience with our company. Since your mom is the homeowner, please have her reach out to Amanda to discuss these matters. We want to work with your mom to help get these issues resolved for her any way we can. We appreciate your feedback.

name: Nicole Williams
text: Thank you for supporting the Community Food Bank of Central Alabama through a food drive!

resp.text: It is truly our pleasure to partner with the Community Food Bank of Central Alabama!!

name: Jason Whitehurst
text: Neighborhood Management has managed our community for many years. Amanda and now Carolann have been dedicated to our neighborhood. They are friendly and helpful; always quick to respond. We can count on great feedback and suggestions for improving our neighborhood. I know they care about our overall community and each neighbor.

name: Karl Granholm
text: As former Vice President of my association, I have had the pleasure of working with two representatives at Neighborhood Management.  Both have addressed every question I have presented with either a full answer or a fast follow up.  In a day where service is the deciding factor, Neighborhood Management's representatives have been top notch.

name: Steven Cottrell
text:
I can't say enough great things about Neighborhood Management. Their  responsiveness is next to none. Especially Catherine Booth, she cares for her properties as if they were her own. Always providing excellent solutions in a timely matter. It has been very refreshing to work with people that know what they're doing and care for their communities.

Steve Cottrell

name: Nichole Cochran
text: Very friendly and professional. When I have reached out to Angie Glass with a question, she had been extremely quick to respond and very helpful. She is very detailed and makes sure to answer all my questions and help out when needed.

name: Tim Suggs
text: A super friendly community where neighbors help, AND, watch out for other neighbors. Beautifully maintained lawns and detailed common areas make it a pleasure to live here. And everyone is just so nice and helpful too!

name: Jerry Howard
text: As a Development Manager I have worked with Neighborhood Management for 12+ years.  They have been extremely responsive and professional in the day to day management of the homeowners needs and contractors servicing the common property.  Additinally, they are wonderful with leading the annual meetings where budgets are adjusted and reviewed with the homeowners.

name: William Norton
text: Neighborhood Management has been employed by our Property Owners Association for nine years.  During this time I have been on the neighborhood Board of Directors for six years, meaning I had direct and frequent contact with Neighborhood Management.  We depend on Neighborhood Management to handle our finances, send out compliance letters, to assist with collections, organize neighborhood meetings, and other ad hoc tasks.  I've found them to be responsive, thorough, and totally trustworthy. Neighborhood Management frequently goes beyond what we expect or what is required.  It is particularly important that we have competent, detail-oriented assistance with our bank accounts, CDs, and financial reports and their service in this area is excellent.  I would highly recommend Neighborhood Management to any homeowners' association.

name: Danny Bostany
text:
Courteous, Professional and Efficient. This management group has been handling our HOA for a number of years and we have always had a great working relationship. As a board member I cannot remember a time when things were not handled promptly, professionally and efficiently.
I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Jeff B
text: WONDERFUL PEOPLE to work with, very responsive to emails when I've needed something.  I would recommend them highly!

resp.text: Hi Jeff! Thank you so much for your positive feedback and recommendation! We're so glad to hear you've had such a great experience with our team!!

name: Chanel Mason
text:
If I could give 0 star I would...Angie Glass, Amanda Carr, CarolAnn Holbrook (who no longer works there) and John Barnes are all some f’n crooks! In the midst of a global pandemic they illegally placed liens on several properties within my subdivision (including mine) without notifying any of us! Alabama law states HOA companies must give property owners written notice of the assessment and lien by personal delivery OR 1st class mail and they DID NOT! The law also states within 12 months from the date the assessment becomes due, the HOA has to record a statement of lien in the office of the judge of probate. At least 30 days before recording the statement of lien, the HOA has to give the owner a written notice by certified mail and they DID NOT send me a written notice by certified mail!
They sent several accounts to “collections” which was John Barnes with Alford and Barnes law firm. He in turn offered settlements to residents and not all! Per CarolAnn, Neighbor Management took over our subdivision in the summer of 2019. We were never formally notified. We’ve never had a single meeting. No board members elected, no bylaws sent to residents etc. We never knew who our neighbor manager/contact for the subdivision was until Feb of THIS year, yet they expect people to pay $200 HOA dues?! The only thing I’ve noticed is the grass being cut. Nothing more! They are a f’n JOKE!

The fact that I see other reviews that state similar actions further lets me know this is how they handle the their African American communities! The white communities have no issues because I see a lot of @$$ kissing reviews!!!

The whole process and how they handled it is bullsh!t and legal action will be taken against them!

They have crossed the WRONG one! MFers!!!

name: Lewis Sanders
text: Neighborhood  management has managed our community for the last 8 years. They have been a lifesaver and has always looked out for communities best interest.  Amanda Carr is easy to work with and her knowledge is incredible.

name: Drew Perkins
text: Such a great team to work with.  Amanda and the entire property management team have always been amazing.

name: Corey Stephens
text: I was very impressed with the timely manner in which Catherine Booth responded back to me, and handled my issue. This is a great company with great people!! Thanks again Catherine.

name: Cara Brewer
text: Neighborhood Management is the best!  I have only had good experiences dealing with Catherine.  She is always so professional and friendly.  Strongly recommend!

name: Connie Pende
text: This management property keeps the complex in excellent condition and all residents in compliance with rules. Glad we downsized and moved to this community.  Carolann is a joy to deal with, much better than the last one.

name: Mary Roensch
text: I have dealt with many HOA managers during my lifetime and Neighborhood Management is by far the best  Managing homeowners is a very difficult job but necessary job to protect neighborhoods and property values.  Homeowner's also get upset when they do not get their way even though they are probably in violation of covenants.  Amanda Carr is an outstanding example of an excellent manager.

name: amy baird
text: My neighborhood has had a phenomenal record with Neighborhood Management, NM, for over a decade! From bookkeeping, keeping us on track with covenant guidelines, managing annual HOA meetings and food drives to individual concerns, NM has always given us high quality service and care. Best decision and investment we could have made and continue to do. To all the staff at Neighborhood Mgnt., THANK YOU!

name: Vinnie Alonzo
text: When I think about Highland Lakes and Neighborhood Management LLC I think about Catherine Booth.  I've lived here for over 14 years and over that time I've gotten to know and work with Catherine on various projects...She's the best and definitely my go to person to handle any questions I might have about our community... she's always there to help.

name: Sue & Glen Turton
text: Carolann is quick to respond to issues we’ve brought to her attention  The multi-neighborhood toy drive at Christmas was a good example of how much she cares about people and the neighborhoods she represents.

name: Julia Tupper
text: Very unprofessional. Called several times to speak to Amanda Carr and could not reach her. Finally got an email from Amanda and she was unnecessarily rude. We called back and asked the girl that answers the phone for Amanda’s boss phone number or email. She responded with I can’t provide his number/email because I don’t  want to lose my job. Amanda then continued to email us and tell us we were responsible for fees due to not getting in touch with them. After we tried several times to contact them by phone. We were told we were being charged because we did not leave a voicemail. All we ask for is good customer service and someone that can help us get this handled. We vote they get a customer survey.

name: Kyle Lubsen
text: We use Neighborhood Management to manage our HOA at Holland Lakes and, as President of the HOA, I work closely with them. They are very responsive to our needs and easy to work with. They are reasonably priced and a good value for what we receive. We are very glad that switched to Neighborhood Management.

name: Jamie Baker
text: Amanda Carr with Neighborhood Management is an excellent manager. She responds to my emails in a timely manner and relays the information to whomever needs to know.

name: Brian Freeman
text: Scott and Eva professionalism and knowledge of HOA management is invaluable to the success of our community. The software has greatly increased our ability to manage our community.

name: Scott Smith
text: As a member of the HOA board at Chace Lake, I have enjoyed working with Jenny Templin at Neighborhood Management. She is accessible,  professional and works with a high level of integrity and honesty. I feel comfortable recommending them to manage any community.

name: Mike Harris
text: As the President of our HOA, it has been a pleasure working with Amanda and her team st NHM. I've found the entire group to be very responsive and concerned about meeting the needs of our residents. They've given insight into programs that have worked well for neighborhoods such as ours as well as programs that have not. Their experience and management expertise have proven to be a valuable asset to all of us. I would highly recommend them  as an efficient, professional leadership source for HOA management.

name: Dave Quinn
text: Amanda and her team are so polite, professional, gracious, and a true joy to work with.  Please extend our thanks for just how you all are just plain AWESOME!.

name: Christy Garrett
text: Could not be more thrilled with Amanda Carr and her team. Having endured a prior HOA company mismanaging the subdivision, Neighborhood Mgmt is a dream. They have always been prompt in their replies and requests. I just sold/bought in another community managed by them and not only did she take care of the requirements for sale, but knowing they were the management company made the decision to buy all the more easy.

name: andrew perreault
text: I have been working with them for a good while now, and they do a very good job with a job that cannot be easy to do.  I recommend Neighborhood Management.

name: John Gospodareck
text: Carolann is great to deal with and good to respond in a timely matter. No problems with this company.

name: Freddie Mathis
text: Thank you for the update

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Freddie!

name: Ann Whitaker
text: Professional services for neighborhoods, NHM assist communities in keeping up the values and beauty of their properties.

name: Jaquice Boyd
text: This is a great neighborhood management company! If you have a HOA I would highly recommend them!

name: Jan Hirsch
text:
The Cotswolds have used Neighborhood Management since our developers built our neighborhood (403 homes) many years ago.  Amanda Carr has been our Manager for the entire time, so she knows our community quite well.  There's no doubt that managing our neighborhood, plus another 25+ similar communities, must be one of the toughest jobs out there, which is what Amanda does!

I've seen some other reviews about this company, and can identify with some of your comments.  There have certainly been times that Amanda didn't get back with me as quickly as I would have liked, and other times that she wasn't quite as pleasant as I would have preferred, which is why I've only given a 4-star rating.  But...she and her company have played a huge role in keeping our neighborhood beautiful and well-managed.  They have worked hand-in-hand with our HOA Board to insure that our homeowners are taking care of their properties to conform to our HOA standards which help keep our home values high.  I appreciate her/their efforts and expertise, and hope they continue to do an excellent job for The Cotswolds for the long haul!

name: elisebeth bashinsky
text:
i lived at club village condos in bham, al. we sought out neighborhood mgt
when having some communication issues with another company. i emailed
amanda carr one evening.....it was like throwing seeds into the wind and not knowing how they would land.......no later than 8am the next morning, she had contacted me......the rest is history, and a good one at that.

this company is very clear on their services. they respond promptly.
they are resourceful. they are what i deem, 'small'. i like small.
my take was that each group they service is treated and managed as unique in itself. not one fit for all, so to speak.

i highly recommend that if you are seeking a service such as this, you call them, email them, talk with them and above all, meet with them in their office!

thank you for letting me share.

stormy

name: Al Rhoney
text:
Neighborhood Managment was referred to us by residents of another subdivison that they manage.

I have worked with Amanda Carr and Carolann Holbrook and have met with Scott Smallwood several times as well. My partners and I are very pleased with their professionalism and attention to detail. Their financial reports are clear and complete and their attendance at our annual meetings have been very helpful for our residents. I have also found them very responsive to my email communications, which is very refreshing!

Unfortunately, their work also involves dealing with residents who haven't paiid their HOA dues, or are out-of-compliance with the covenants and restrictions. Without Neighborhood  Management, that small percentage of residents could hurt the overall image of the neighborhood for current residents as well as visitors who may be thinking of purchasing a house there.

Most people choose to live in an HOA controlled community because they agree that having Covenants and Restrictions assures them that their property will maintain its value and even appreciate over time.

The majority of residents who do pay their dues on time and who do comply with the Covenants and Restrictions are pleased that we spend the money to hire Neighborhood Management to assure that those few who don't comply won't spoil the neighborhood for the rest.

name: Robert Beckham
text: They do a great job. High expectations, Dependable.

name: Bryan Allen
text: Every bad review on here is 100% accurate.  Amanda harasses me...a black homeowner with regards to a dead tree, but wont do anything about dead trees in white homeowners yard.  These jokers are not fair or consistent.  I would love it if this company was dismantled piece by piece.

name: sarah dean
text: We just moved to Pell City.  Last week I mailed a check for a pool key to Fox Hollow neighborhood in Pell City.  It was the end of the week so I wasn't expecting anything until mid week this week.  Since my son had been checking the mail a minimum of 4 times a day since I mailed the check, I decided to call today to make sure they received it.  The lady on the phone said they had recieved it and would make sure the key went in the mail today.  This afternoon I notice someone pull up in our driveway.  I went out and it was an employee from Neighborhood Management dropping off our pool key.  I didn't get her name but she sure did make 3 kids day today!  Thanks so much for going above and beyond!

name: Mindy Torres
text: I reached out to Neighborhood Management in order to add fencing to my yard - Angie responded almost immediately and within a couple of hours we had approval from the architect!!!!

name: Curt Sunderland
text: Monica Eubanks and Amanda Carr have relentlessly harassed me about supposed violations of our covenants such as garbage cans being exposed from the street and my bushes supposedly needing trimming, de-weeding, and mulch. I store my trash cans inside of my garage and have stored them there for the past two years. I have trimmed, de-weeded, and put down mulch at the end of November and several other times prior to that since we moved in 2016. This is just plain harassment and I am first sending them a cease and desist letter along with an invoice for wasting my time.  They seem to be harassing me and my wife because we are older adults. I keep my house and yard well maintained and have not violated any of the covenants that we accepted when we built and purchased our home. If this differential treatment continues I will be forced to file a lawsuit naming Monica Eubanks personally and Neighborhood Management separately for detrimental effects to my health due to the stress caused by the constant threats from letters of violations and fines. I know there are other home owners in the neighborhood that would like to end the contract with Neighborhood Management. I will be pushing for this in the next meeting coming up this month. Bye Bye Neighborhood Management. You will be gone from Chelsea Station soon!!!

name: Jennifer Smith
text: Incompetent company

resp.text: Hi Jennifer. Thank you for your feedback. While we hate to hear that's how you feel, we'd love to have a call with you to better understand the issues and provide potential solutions. Please feel free to give us a call at your convenience.

name: Torrey Jimerson
text: Terrible company.  Unprofessional.  Will not acknowledge they made a mistake.

name: Michael Pierce
text: Their service is below horrible. We can never get answers to problems we have. We only get the run around.

name: Janara Grayson
text: Just didn't get a good vibe from them at all no customer service

name: Me
text: They have barged in on our neighborhood. They just tell us how much we owe, we haven't seen any paperwork.    They say that they don't know where the paperwork is or they don't have the paperwork etc. I think maybe my next step is to call an attorney. It's a shame that people can't be honest.

name: sues cents
text: The people I deal with like to overpay for services, and they never respond in getting services performed at my property.

name: Christina Jenkins
text: Waited over a week for an answer on an application that could have been answered in one day with a simple math equation. Not cool, never even pulled my credit. Self employed people can’t bring in bank statement. To show income. That’s how I do my taxes. Wouldn’t let me use quarterly tax info from H&R Block. ? Not self employed friendly.

name: Jack Sweeney
text: Bowen Realty has been tremendously helpful to me when I moved to Mobile. They helped me find a place, answered all of my questions, and were incredibly friendly. The whole rental experience has been great -- quick to schedule needed repairs, understanding about my situation, etc. I cannot recommend them enough!

name: Melissa Myers
text: Completely recommend! I’ve rented from other places before, and no one even answers the phone. Bowen actually answers, cares, and follows through!

name: Majora Mask
text: The company and people are very nice and have really good deals there, also are very understanding and a place I recommend!!

name: A C
text: Great company. The employees are typically quick to respond to any issues and send out their handy men promptly if you have a problem.

name: Mellissa Coty
text: Very very very rude staff. Hard to Communicate with them and they are trying to charge me outrageous amounts for damage that I didn't do. I would consider another realty before contacting this one

name: Chris Ellsworth
text: Since a great man who owned and operated this business has passed  it has diminished tremendously the simple way of seeing it is its about the money not the consumer or its contractors its receiving all the money they can get and paying the least money out it's a business not what it was before and not what I'd ever refer anyone to but that's my opinion

name: Pam Ward
text: Pleas take my advice and DO NOT RENT FROM THESE PEOPLE. THEY ARE KEITH REALTY COUSIN!!They employ criminals and they don't CARE if you are in danger or not!! It took 8 months,to get windows,fixed...they installed a new ceiling fan and the screws flew out a few days later. This,realty company seriously only cares about money. They will not fix anything unless you crawl up their arses. The owner of the home,I rented, constantly stalked the house and this experience has been awful. They won't cut your grass or overgrowth . DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND DO NOT DEAL WITH THESE SLUM LORDS!!! They will over charge you while being rude as hell.  Erin Bowen especially and her rude mother will show you NO respect and they will harass you for anything. You will not get your security deposit back and you will be miserable. They should be sued.

name: Jill Revette
text: Bowen is simple. They were VERY helpful when I started looking for a new place to live. The staff is very nice especially if you are nice to them.

name: Kristine Bristow-Curtin
text: Do Not expect them to fix anything!! They just want their money and thats it. Staff does not help when you call to have a problem resolved. Please take your money else where!!

name: Gabby
text: My experience wasn't the worst though I didn't have high expectations. I have heard some terrible stories though, including a racist one. And like all shady landlords, they will find a way to keep your security deposit, aka lying. I would avoid them at all costs.

name: Keith McCall
text: The housing they have is much better than the busted housing Keith reality has.

name: Casey Welborn
text: Stay away as others stated! My apartment was never cleaned before I moved in, never had proper working air, and didn't care when the owner of the property let his crack head break into my apartment and had the nerve to try to turn me over to collections because I moved out. Do not do business with these people! The front office is super rude, and they just don't want to be bothered with you!

name: Meagan Thomas
text:
I turned in a work order yesterday afternoon to Nicole @ the office on Dauphin.
My list was @least 5 items long, & I honestly didn't expect everything to get done this week.

But this morning, Jay from maintenance came in & fixed everything in two hours (including the time it took him to pick up faucet replacement supplies @ Home Depot).

And I love my MC apartment. It's a bit older (which I really like); it's a lot of space for an affordable price. It has hardwood floors, & my neighbors are pretty friendly.

(Some of my friends @ other apartment complexes w/other property management have given up working with their main offices. They have to keep calling to get anything done, & it just sounds like a hassle.)

Overall, I've had a pleasant experience working w/Nicole, Colleen, Mark, & Jay. So, I would recommend working w/them (& considering the MC apartments).

name: Bikal Parajuli
text: close before its closing time. Apartment are fairly nice. The people at the office suck, they are rude to you they don't talk to you nicely.

name: Lauren Schengber
text: i highly recommend you do not rent with this realty company. i lived at one of their rental properties, directly next door to the office. upon moving out, erin bowen the owner attempted to withhold over half of my security deposit even after showing her pictures of the original state of the apartment in 2015 when i moved in. she tried to keep $100 from my deposit telling me i took the blinds from the kitchen and the bedroom when there were no blinds in the kitchen or the bedroom when i moved in. i showed her pictures from when i moved in with the time stamp. she tried to charge me $50 for outlet covers, which like the blinds, were missing when i moved in, with pictures to prove. earlier in my lease, i had a leak under my sink which created a soft spot in the floor at the foot of the sink. after calling about it 4 separate times, maintence came out and replaced the knobs on the sink handles with nice shiney new plastic ones. the sink continued to leak. later on in November 2016, a friend of mine tripped on the porch and went to catch herself on the railing and went over with the railing itself. it was a solid 4-5ft drop on top of the broken banister. very lucky she wasn't hurt. bowen realty put up caution tape and signs that say "watch your step" -  fast forward to current january 2018 and there is STILL caution tape up and the bannister is not fixed. remember how i said i lived next door to the office? which means for the last year and half erin bowen has pulled up to her office and seen the obvious caution tape and unfinished repairs. over a year and a half. erin bowen called my mother and told her that maintenance had seen boys and alcohol in my apartment. my mother said my daughter is 25 and that's none of your business. to get my deposit back, she made me come in to her office so she could preach to me for over an hour about responsibility and how to treat my future landlords. when i would walk next door and leave messages with her front desk ladies, she never received the messages and told me it was my fault for not talking to the right person. why do you have receptionists if they don't take your messages? for the first year i lived there so many people said to me you rent from bowen! they're terrible! and i always said nice things about them. oooohhh how i could kick myself!!! if you value your sanity and not having a constant headache, DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH ERIN BOWEN.

name: ChillinWithTheCooley’s
text: Rude. Very slow on repairs, most time they won't repair. I was wrongfully evicted because they refused to get the raccoons out of the attic and between the walls. I had fleas in my home but no pets. All of my neighbors wrote complaint letters. PROBLEM NEVER RESOLVED. BAD BUSINESS

name: Adel Awaji
text: Maintenance is good. I called Monday morning complaining about the A/C and they respond very fast and solve my A/C problem within 2 hours.

name: Karderrius Phelion
text: It’s a family owned business that lack customer service and customer interaction. Purchase properties in low income area to primarily take advantage of minorities. Disgusting, unprofessional and racist.

name: Jonathan Jacobs
text: This company seems that they want to shoot themselves when having to deal with the potential tenants.  I wanted a house and they drug their feet and then rented it out from under me . I dont recommend this company at all and I am a real person, not a foreign person hired to post a positive review.  STAY AWAY FROM BOWEN REALTY.

name: Brat
text: Too much to type about my experience with these people, BUT STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE! Rude & Unprofessional is an understatement! I just wish someone would have warned me. I Will Never In My Life Deal With These People Again!! If I could rate them as an -0 star I would.

name: Jay Money
text: Maintenance is slow to respond. Be prepared to live without A/C for a few days if you rent from this company.

name: KP Tate
text:
AVOID!!! Awful, awful service.
Wouldn't refer this company to a dead person, not even the homeless. They prey and feed on low income areas. White supremacy is real.

name: Katie Bumpers
text: Good places.

name: Michael M
text: Really rude and unprofessional staff.

name: Reagan Oswald
text: Completely wasted my time & money, took an apartment right out from under me when I had everything ready to pay and move

resp.text: Everything ready to pay and move? Please contact us directly at 251-604-81zero6 to discuss further.

name: Jeremy Kervin
text: Samantha was delightful and helpful

name: Jessica Muse
text:
Horrible company. DO NOT MOVE IN UNDER THIS COMPANY.
Maintenance is horrible. The apartments are trash. This is the second week me and my 3year old daughter is having to go without heat. This is a horrible company who cares nothing but about themselves. Too damn shallow to replace the heating unit. I will not continue my business here.

name: Griffin Hardy
text: Very poor management.  They do not return phone calls...period.  Was not given my deposit back with zero explanation.  Had a very bad roach problem in my apartment (Town View) for MONTHS and they didn't come by ONCE to spray for it.  Would not recommend anyone live in any apartments they manage.

name: D Leto
text: Some of the people that are employed here are great. Whoever, maintenance takes a very long time to get a request filled and they are currently having a unit renovation on the weekend which is EXTREMELY unprofessional to do when you have a fully occupied complex.

name: Nat B
text: I have lived in The Windsor for almost a year and have enjoyed my little studio apartment in Forest Park. Christina and Baylie have been super helpful and are a pleasure. Maintenance has been quick with any concern. I highly suggest checking them out.

name: Shelley Stewart-Stevens
text: My husband has a DUI felony on his record, although it is over 20 years old, it flagged him. We are in our 60's, he is in poor health. He has not been in trouble since.  It does tell you on the application about the criminal check, but who would think it being that old it would show up?  BEWARE, once a felony is on your record no matter how new or old, this company will not rent to you. A form of discrimination? Perhaps. I gave one star because you have to make a rating.

name: Cynthia Sloss
text: I contacted Maintenance fri Morning Because of bathroom Plumbing issue in my 3bdr 1bth apartment was told someone will be here asap.....its Sunday 6/14/2020........NO ONE HAS CAME!!! THIS IS THE ISSUE OF OF INJUSTICE TODAY!!

name: Michael Freeman
text: We noted necessary repairs that needed to be made in our apartment while moving in as standard. Evan, our property manager assured us these repairs would be made in a timely fashion. This was in March. Now, it's October. We have repeatedly called Arbour Valley and put in work orders online through Rentcafe. No one gets back to us or the maintenance worker comes and takes a look and ends up saying she needs to order parts. This is insulting. Renter beware. This leasing company puts property owner profits before tenant expectations. Don't expect any communication from management or speedy repair work.

name: makayla phillips
text: My experience with Arbour Valley has been exceptional. The properties are well maintained and clean. I called for maintenance to be done a couple days ago and they were out to my apartment within 1-3 days. As far as pricing goes, you really can't beat the price you pay for what you get. Great accommodations.

name: Felicia Ridgeway
text: I live in Mobile Al where I have a apartment with Tyler Ridge.  This is a  Arbour Valley's property ...The property manager is terrible at handling our location. Her assistant Stacy is the best person in that office at least  she is honest. Nothing we pay for, we have. Gates are broken and have been for YEARS. The most important of the missing things is a Drop Box to place rent or payments in. I don't understand why we as the renter's are held responsible for late fees when we cant even it it to them. This is a great place to live just the people who run it are awful except for Stacy and no she is not my friend or relative.

name: Navaneeth Nagendra
text: Writing this review a little late I had the Worst experience. I initially had enquired about a property that previously belonged to some other property management and was lately bought by arbor valley. So when I went to their office to enquire about it, they were very irresponsible. Did not give answers. Made me wait soo long. I had to go there 3-4times and no one received the calls either. There is a guy Evan who’s is very rude. It became such a pain to keep visiting every now and then since I am working. Finally decided to take a different property.

name: Rachel Walsh
text: Management is unresponsive to emails and phone calls. Maintenance is slow and inconsistent. Silver Oaks Apartments is roach infested. Many maintenance concerns we're not taken care of for months and months on end including leaks and mold. Office staff is condescending and rude. When you call in a maintenance request repeatedly office management will tell you that that request has been resolved when it hasn't. Do not rent from this company; they do not care about their residents. They only care about the money.

name: Tinka Mckinley
text: I swear I wish I would have seen these reviews before I rented from this HELL HOLE!!! maintenance never repairs anything. I've had water sitting in my dishwasher now for 3 weeks. It's filthy outside and at the garbage sites because people empty whatever is in their car on the ground! I just moved in here on July 21 and this is already happening.... DO NOT RENT FROM PEBBLE CREEK APARTMENTS AT ALL. IT'S FALSE ADVERTISEMENTS ON TOP OF SOMEONE WENT IN MY CAR AND STOLE MY FIANCE LUGGAGE!! I'M BREAKING THIS LEASE!!!!!!

name: Janet Maddox
text: Worst renting experience of my life!!  Beware of this reality group.  I know most people only leave reviews when they've had an extremely bad experience and sometimes a great ones.  If you find an apartment managed by Arbour Valley I would highly recommend looking high and low for anything else.  It's impossible to get in touch with anyone from the company should you have a maintenance emergency, and even then they will do NOTHING.  Basically, you're on your own.   Renters beware: you do NOT want to rent from this reality group.

name: Donna Collins
text: They have taken over Arboretum Apts. and living here is worse than the ghetto. Air conditioner doesn't cool they won't fix it. 300-400 monthly  bill the whole summer. Nasty water backed up in dishwasher , they won't fix it..Roaches,and waterbugs have taken over my apt. They won't spray haven't one time since I have lived here.Huge tree is growing right out my patio door, the roots have buckled up my patio concrete. The edges are sharp and jagged. Sinks stay stopped up. Boards holding up vanity in bathroom and refrigerator...so tacky. Also board holding up sink from vanity.. Still waiting on screens from February. Screen door was put in wrong still waiting for it to be fixed. Coat closet  door put in up side down...still not fixed. No water pressure downstairs or upstairs.  Kathy is a joke said we could transfer to an apt or break lease..now she won't answer any of our phone calls, she must be screening her calls. Getting lawyer I have 2 many pictures and a notebook of every call to repair or walk in to office and tell them to repair. Diane is a joke too.

name: Nunya Business
text: This is the worst leasing company ever. I have had my dishwasher broken, a leak in the ceiling, and my dryer not working properly for 3 months now and they still have no fixed it. Took 3-4 months for them to fix another leak I had, to fix my closet light, and to supply me with a remote to the light in the bedroom. They never call you back, never fix anything, basically they do not care. Also, they're extremely rude when you do confront them in person. DO NOT RENT FROM THESE PEOPLE. THEY ARE AWFUL AND DO NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS.

name: Sam Wilkinsn
text:
Obviously a front for crack or heroin dealers. Rent checks go missing, they move offices about every two months, non-responsive to inquiries.

Totally bizarre. I don't know if I'd believe all the freaky stuff that goes on here if it hadn't happened to me! Stay away!

Update 2/2017: got a notice to vacate today. They did not even give 30 days. This is a front for money laundering or drugs. STAY AWAY!

name: Felicia Randall
text: I have lived in Nob Hill Apartments since December of last year renting a 2br 2ba paying extra for a renovated apartment that was never renovated and it has been horrible... before I moved in I asked about 4 things, Maintenance (a joke), crime in the area (not bad), pest control (nonexistent), and did my fireplace work since I was paying extra for a unit with a fireplace when I first moved in there was a leak over the toilet in the master bath, my first night in the apartment the second toilet flooded with no response from maintenance til the next day... the next day maintenance said he would turn the valve to work the hot water and the heat on but that didn't happen until Tuesday so 3 days with no hot water and heat in the teens in December... then as I tried to take a cold shower I notice the master bath isn't draining... this issue and the leak over the toilet took nearly 3 months to correct not to mention the outlets didn't work in the living room (and all the outlets through out the apartments are put in backwards,) the apartment wasn't cable ready although they said it was and gave me the company to go through and I was charged extra when it took the cable man longer to install because of it, almost all the doors in the apartment don't close properly because they are not the correct doors for the frame according to maintenance when they finally came to look at it a few months ago... I could go on and on with the issues that have not been repaired but would rather spend my time find a legal recourse for these slumlords. If any of the other renters complaining would like to contact me to attempt to find some legal recourse to stop these people please contact me through facebook.

name: Desiree McCarty
text: Horrible property management. You can never get a hold of anyone. Maintenance is never done. They let water sit in our apartment for days and shrugged their shoulders when i would call and complain. Property owners beware they will let your rental properties run to the ground and then smile and tell you nothing is wrong.

name: Ryan Morton
text: Not only do they not fix anything, they don't even bother to respond to a voicemail or phone call. We have had our stove broken, pipes leaking, and AIR CONDITIONING broken in July...and nothing. Would never rent again.

name: Baily Austin
text: Josh was the best real estate agent we could ask for! He was attentive to our needs, thoughtful and willing to help in any way possible.  He and the staff at Bradford were great to work with and we look forward to working with them again in the near future!

name: Michael Ledbetter
text: If I could leave a more negative rating I would. I rented from this company and they attempted to take advantage of me by using MY utilities to renovate their other apartments in the building i was renting in  (apache flats) Josh Smitherman is a low down landlord. I confronted him about this and he was a complete jacka** about it. Needless to say I ended my lease with them immediately. Dont make the same mistake I did and rent with bradford. There are better/cleaner/cheaper apartments owned by other companys to rent from in montevallo. What a joke Bradford realestate is.

name: Tracee Miller
text: Rented from Bradford for 2 years while at UM.  Really enjoyed my time in Montevallo and my time renting a house from them.  Their office is conveniently located in downtown Montevallo close to UMOM- so it was easy to pop in and pay rent.  Super nice people, always made me feel right at home, willing to go the extra mile.

name: Anthony and Heather Bryson
text: During the moratorium set forth by president Biden, this company has decided to through a family out on the street even though they have followed the guidelines set forth by the president and cdc and was promised to pay in full once they got the money at the end of the month. Do not recommend this unprofessional, LAW BREAKING company to anyone.

name: Perish Underwood
text:
Great, down home, friendly real estate agency.

Listed my house and sold it in a day- couldn't ask for better service or nicer people!

name: charleta king
text: I placed a rental application with this company. I never received a  follow up call regarding their properties available or status of my application. I called a number of times and either they were not available or I was told they would return my call (which did not occur).  I follow up today only to be advised that my application was not approved. I would not recommend.

name: Nope Nope
text: It seems kind of crook like to make people pay to apply for properties they may not even be able to accept because they have pets.  Please consider getting that information available to prospective tenants prior to the application process so you're not taking people's hard earned money and making them gamble.  They have beautiful properties, but I will use a different service and recommend other pet owners use a different service due to this.  $30/application with the risk of not knowing whether or not the property takes our family members?  No thank you.

name: UM LOVE
text: Welcoming environment.  Great rental company to deal with.  They made my transition to my first apartment as easy on me as possible.  They were there to answer questions and offer help as needed.  They even came and hung my curtain rod because I didn't have the equipment.  Total 5 star company!

name: Tabbitha Conner
text: Awesome company! Just rented my first apartment from them.  They made the process easy for me and made me feel right at home in Montevallo.  They were also helpful in helping me get my power and water set up as well as directing me to cool local things to do! Thanks Bradford Real Estate! My roommate and I would highly recommend.

name: Debbie Jo Killingsworth
text: Great

name: Wayne B Colburn
text: Josh & the crew at Bradford are awesome.  they helped me find a place to live when I was down and out and took care of me the entire time I lived there.  they go above and beyond for anyone who walks through their front door.  they're also very supportive in the community and I like to support those who give back.  thumbs up for Bradford realty.

name: Sasha Jiminez
text: rented from this co for 6 years while I lived in Montevallo.  great to work with.  never had any major maintenance problems that they didn't take care of right away.  always kind and friendly and glad to help in whatever way possible.  lots of my friends rented from them as well.  would highly recommend.

name: Bowbee Outdoors
text: Josh is disrespectful to customers. Maitnance is nonexistent. If ac goes out expect 3 days minimum before anyone even looks. Flood in your ground level apt? Not there problem for at least a week. Plenty of other options. I rather blowtorch my nipples off than deal with this company again.

name: Bethany Aucoin
text: I have been renting an apartment from Bradford for almost a year now and I have absolutely no complaints. I have noticed other people complaining about their discrimination or problems, but as a lesbian couple in the south, we have had nothing but pleasant conversations with the employees and they have always been happy to help us with whatever we may need. Our house could have been in better shape when we moved in, but the few issues that we have had have been taken care of by the employees promptly. They are all very nice people and I always have the best conversations with the lady at the front desk.

name: Sal Vagal
text: FANTASTIC Rental agency! I wish I could pick them up and take them with me.  They've been nothing but an absolute pleasure to work with.  I've read negative reviews but completely believe what you put in is what you get out.  I never had an issue that wasn't promptly corrected, never called and had anyone be rude to me.  They were always a pleasure.  I feel like in this world people think they can be rude and ugly to people in the service industry and expect them not to be rude back.....

name: Larry David
text: These folks were a pleasure to work with. I’d recommend them highly. Great to work with. Always going above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of and happy

name: Brooke Morgan
text: Do not trust this company. The house we rented from them was destroyed when we moved in—so my parents and I had to fix it up all on our own: repairs in the walls, the floors, the fixtures. It’s ridiculous. Not to mention, many people at Bradford are extremely rude and make my roommates and I feel inferior for even asking a question. Do NOT come to Bradford Real Estate. Find someone else who is worth your time, money, and cares about you genuinely as customers.

name: Penelope Wallace
text: I'd give them 10 Stars! They're all amazing to work with, Jeannie is super friend and Josh has always been on point.  They've been nothing but helpful and accommodating in everyway.  I wish all rental managers were this awesome! Thanks for making Montevallo an awesome place!

name: Tonya Young
text: Awesome folks! I don't know why anyone would ever complain about them!  They're timely and courteous and are always awesome to work with.

name: Apricot Pearson
text: Great folks- would highly recommend working with them.  They represent lots of good properties.

name: Jackson Pearson
text: I could not possibly agree more with the negative comments that I've read on here. I've lived in three of Bradford's properties over the last 10 years and have only positive things to say about them.  They're open Monday-Friday 9-5, just like their website says they are.  I will say that I've called within those hours and had to leave a message before but they've always called me back.  They have an email address for emergency maintenance which they've always been responsive to as far as I am concerned at least.  The people who work there are always polite and helpful.  I've had issues with bugs in the past as well but they sent an exterminator over for an extra spray a couple of times between the regular monthly spray and the issue was taken care of.  The guys who do their maintenance seem very nice.  They've surely never been rude or disrespectful.  I've had a couple of situations where they came to fix something and didn't have all of the parts the needed, so they had to leave and come back- once even hey had to order a part and it didn't come until the next day, but they seem to be qualified and have always made repairs that meet my standards.   I've surely never been made to feel as if they don't care about me or my issues.  I see them at least once per month to pay rents. I always have a delightful conversation with Jenny who works the front desk.  She is always kind to ask about my family and my life.  This business is very community oriented and involved in most every event that goes on in Montevallo.  I always see that they've sponsored little league and parades and festival and food drives.  I just can't imagine anything than that the people who have left negative comments created negative situations for themselves.  I'd even go so far as to say that this company goes above and beyond for their tenants.  Josh even came by to check on my heater one year on thanksgiving night because it had been giving me some issues that week.  anyone that is going to come out after hours and on a holiday just to make sure my family and I aren't cold is ok by me.  I'd give these people 10 stars if it was an option.

name: Christie Albergine
text: I️ had a great e patience with these people. I️ have to imagine for those that didn’t that it was their own fault.

name: Reckless Love
text: Applied for a rental house with a co-signer that was within my price range, paid the application fee, only for them to waste 3 day of my time after being told my the agent that there should be no problem getting approved. I constantly felt an air of discrimination from the front desk secretary. multiple times I was refused to speak with my agent. I was quoted a timeframe of 12 hours, it has been 3 days and they refuse to work with me. This company has lied to me, wasted my time, and now put me at a severe disadvantage with less than 24 hours to find a place to go. Gina is overall unpleasant to work with and Josh refuses to speak with clients. The power of approval is in a single mans hands (josh). there is no regulated system, but seemingly approving or denying basred of opinions of the person. the entire time I felt I was being pushed away and like they were trying to keep me out. UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD YOU GIVE THIS COMPANY YOUR BUSINESS.

name: Ouida Brackett
text: I called to deal with an issue of the company putting a check through on my account that was post dated. When I initially asked the front desk clerk if it would be okay to pay my 1st months rent,  and since I was there, give her a check for the upcoming months rent. I don't live in Montevallo and the property I was renting was in Alabaster. So since you can't pay rent online, I gave the post dated check so that I wouldn't have to drive back to Montevallo. I was assured TWICE by the clerk that this was okay. Fast forward after I paid my initial deposit as well as first month's rent. They decided to also deposit my post dated check for the upcoming month. Leaving me with an NSF due to the fact that the postdated amount wasn't accounted for in my monthly budget. ESPECIALLY after you already received $2,000 from me within a weeks time. I called and spoke with JOSH who verbally assaulted me and basically called me a criminal for writing bad checks. After he informed me that it's not their policy to take a post dated check and he doesn't know where I got that info from. I LITERALLY GOT IT FROM THE FRONT DESK  CLERK!!!! HE took no ownership, did not apologize, complained about a $50 fee he would have to pay b/c of my returned check and then hung up in my face. The crazy thing about this whole situation is that the check cleared on my end. My bank LITERALLY cleared the check and just charged me an NSF fee. All I wanted was my $30 back. He didn't even have the human decency to listen to what I was telling him before becoming beligerent!! This company is the absolute worst that I have ever dealt with in my life. And my husband is military so we have moved and dealt with numerous companies. RUN...DON'T WALK AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!

name: Jansen Arceneaux
text: If you enjoy rental companies without an after hours line, customer service agents that will lie to you about appointments and then call you the liar when confronted than this is the place for you! Worst rental experience I've had in a long time. This is a small town, small family, small minded company. They truely don't care about you. From a customer service standpoint I was so dissapointed. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. Also they do not do electronic payments!!! This is the 21st century Bradford!! Try and keep up 😉

name: Jennifer Patterson
text: great company.  I'd do business with them again.

name: Thadia Newton
text: If i could give them zero stars i would. They do not maintain their properties and take advantage of college students. Whenever I would send a maintenance request they would not come and even told me they had no record of me calling. This is a terribly run agency. DO NOT RENT FROM THEM.

text: They could care less about their tenants. When maintenance issues occur, they ignore you! They have no sense of urgency in resolving emergency maintenance issues! Do not use this company!!!
