name: rd G
text: I don't know what's going on with treehaven gleen it's turned into a trashcan people throw trash in the parking lot and it's turned into a parking lot for broken-down cars one person on the backside set up a tent and in the grass and park cars in it treehaven is turning into a eyesore and darin needs to do something about it

name: Justin Kirk
text:
I’m not sure what you’re referring to that says in any way that we indicated the property wasn’t nasty from the start. The checklist we completed upon move in said the kitchen was filthy and hadn’t been cleaned, the walls needed paint, noted the broken electrical outlets and the nails/holes left from the previous tenant. We had to SCRUB this place. Not to mention all the spiders we dealt with for a month because you hadn’t been taking care of pest control. We would have noted the uncontrollable bamboo, but it was February and it wasn’t growing in the cold months. How can you even begin to think we caused a bamboo problem? The owner himself said he had tried to get rid of it “for years”. Exact words. Once again he himself saw the yard mowed before we moved out. When I went to check the yard on 5/13, it had not been TOUCHED since we left. All you do is blame your negligence on other people. From the yard to the unmanaged interior.

The water infiltration issue in the BEDROOM FLOOR was not due to “massive flooding”. EVERY TIME IT RAINED, water came through the flooring. And EVERY TIME it happened, you were notified and offered zero assistance in fixing the issue. This is not something that happened just once. I will be sure to find the business card from the man who came out from community development and assured me that if I called him the next time there was visible water coming through that he could see with his own eyes that they would condemn the house until the issue was fixed. I also have two other witnesses who were at the house for that conversation. We told them not to worry about it because we were getting out of the house to which he said “I don’t blame you, I’d hire an attorney”. He also said that a mold expert would need to come out to test the MOLD AND MUSHROOMS. Even your maintenance man left the house to get himself a mask so that he wouldn’t be breathing in the mold when you sent him to the house after LYING saying that YOU would send a mold expert out. This is all documented. Every single bit of it. You “allowed” us to move out because you knew you were caught. Anyone with common sense will be able to see that. You said yourself “the mold will dry out. It’s about to be warm outside”.

You can try to justify it all you want, but mushrooms growing in a bedroom is not normal. I was sick for a solid week after stirring it up while moving.

Not fixing a water infiltration issue that you’ve known about for who knows how long? Negligent, irresponsible.

Bottom line- I’m not here to argue with you as it clearly gets us nowhere. That’s what attorneys are for. I can back up everything I’ve stated, unlike you. I’m here to warn other people of the sorry excuse of a landlord you are.

Again people, trust the negative reviews. I have no doubt in my mind that every single one directed toward Darin Bashaw is true. I’m willing to bet all my stolen money on it.

resp.text:
Mr Kirk once  again I am sorry that you were unhappy with home. We repaired the few minor items called out by the city in a few hours. This home has been under our management for years with no one else having the same issues you reported. You threatened legal action and we advised you of our attorney’s information. I truly wish you and your family all the best of luck.
Sharon

name: Briana Wilson
text: this business is a joke. I think its funny how all the reviews are the same with even more added nasty. lol its always the tenants. these units are trash the company is trash and so are the people. save your best of luck speech or whatever it is that's copied and pasted as a response. <3

name: William L.
text: I'd looked at a property, got approved for the rental then right out of nowhere as I was going to pay the deposit the agent Darin rented it to someone else. I got no explanation of any type to why I was ultimately screwed over. DO NOT use this unprofessional company

resp.text: It wasn't really out of nowhere. We require a hold fee paid within 24 hours to secure the property. In this case the hold fee wasn't attempted for over 3 days. Until the hold fee is paid, a home is still very active and very available to anyone who can get the hold fee in first. It's not fair to other people for us to have to guess that someone is still interested when other customers are willing to place the hold fee.

name: Rejeana Morgan
text: Lived in a rental house for 4 years. Paint was rubbing/ peeling off a bedroom wall. We finally moved! After we moved they rented the property in SE Huntsville with in less than a month and our old neighbors has informed us that Huntsville property management never bothered to repaint the interior of house before moving others into property during Covid! Nasty management company.

resp.text:
As the property manager we make sure every unit we manage is fully cleaned and disinfected after tenant change, per COVID guidelines.
Just as an FYI since you may not have talked to the new tenants; they needed to move into the unit immediately and agreed to take it without getting fixed up or painted.

name: Brittni McFarland
text:
HPM and Darin have labelled the safety issues in our home we discovered upon moving in as "cosmetic". The hanging exposed wires and other safety issues we clearly documented upon move in proves otherwise.

ETA 2/24/21: I have seen the reply that was made by the business. This home has been in possession by HPM for some time now. Darrin said to us that it was a "funky old house" and then when we told him the safety concerns he told us that he has successfully rented the property out for almost a decade and that my husband and I were "too picky."

resp.text: Thank you for the information. The response was incorrectly posted. We are checking on this now.

name: krr gee calypso
text: These new people that took over treehaven gleen is bogus thay won't allow people to come and visit not to mention thay won't fix anything there's alot of other people out here that have more than two people in their apartment instead of worrying about how many people are in your apartment thay need to make treehaven gleen a secure place to live and fix things so don't rent from these people because you will regret it's not a safe place to live anymore

resp.text: We took over managing this property shortly before this review was posted. and have been working through the pre-existing issues at the property. Our management team hasn't addressed with anyone about number of people in their apartment.

name: Larisha
text: Very professional Company. Communicate promptly when you reach out to them; with experiences I've had with most rental agencies that's definitely a good sign.  Thanks Darin for your consideration.

resp.text: Hi Larisha, appreciate your kind words. Hope we can find you a nice house. Look forward to having  a great relationship. Darin

name: Nina Maria
text: I’m currently renting a house from this so called business, they barely call you back, it’s been two months in I have a room in the house that stay at 86 degrees. This house is infested with water bugs I don’t sleep knowing I have to watch over my children I need to find a way out of this lease. I’ll never rent from them again. Not to mention I went two weeks without a refrigerator before they got me a new one smfh. Really can somebody point me in the direction to just legally break my lease.

resp.text: I am sorry you are having issues. I looked through our records and we don't have a Nina Maria leasing with us so it is difficult to address your concerns with no address or name in our system. I am also not familiar with "water bugs". We have a full time receptionist at our front desk. We also have an on line system to log work orders. If I had more accurate information I could structure a more helpful response. Best of luck to you.

name: Carla Davis
text: Professional company with a nice staff. Just began renting a house and so far I am impressed. I will update as we go along. Looking forward to doing business with these great people. Very pretty rental home with all the amenities we were in search of!

resp.text: Thank you Ms. Davis, we appreciate your kind words!

name: Trudy Harris
text: I have rented from this company in the past, I received the best customer service from the staff in the office as well as the maintenance crew, they have always came out in a timely manner to repair any issues. The Property Manager was always available to speak with me or get back with me at his earliest convenience. If I did not have to move out of town, I will still be there. You Guys Rock!!

name: Thomas Geeslin
text: Had a issue with my house when we first moved in and they addressed it immediately and when we had another problem it took over a week and several calls and a email. They called me back, the property manager was personable and seemed very willing to take care of the problem. I haven’t had a chance to recheck the problem yet but was told that they would handle the problem we are having as soon as possible.

resp.text:
Mr. Geeslin, I am at a loss as to where this bad impression is coming from. You only a few weeks ago moved into one of our beautiful Madison rentals. There has been only one service request in the tenant portal for no heat, which was addressed promptly and had to do with the gas being still shut off at meter. No other complaints or maintenance issues were submitted that I am aware of. I did get the message from the office late on Monday and called the very next day to find out about your needing a working key for one of the 6 locks. It was a normal, pleasant conversation. So, I don't know why you are left thinking I am anything other than a normal and pleasant person . Sorry for the bad impression and that it took me a couple of days to get back to you over that weekend, but I rarely work in the office and provide my cell phone number to all owners and tenants, so I can be reached in urgent situations. I explained that we have keys, I personally tried the keys and they worked in all the locks. But, copies were made of our masters and maybe one was cut wrong? No big deal, just text me the lock that you don't have a working key for as I requested and I will get you new copies. I have yet to receive this text, so can only assume the keys worked after all. HPM and myself strive to always provide the best and promptest service.
-Darin

name: Lawaina Simpson
text: Moved here from Florida to a great apartment. Have been in my apartment now for 3 years and I love it. The staff are all very nice and my apartment is beautiful!

resp.text: Thanks Ms. Simpson, we appreciate your honest review!

name: Allison Hubbard
text:
Its hard to post a negative review without sounding like a disgruntled tenant; however, I just don't think this company know how to manage properties effectively. I had several maintenance issues that were extremely difficult to get repaired simply based on communication failures from Huntsville Property Managers. The worst of these issues was probably the 11 degree weather with no hot water and no one to contact about it. I called and left several messages and we went without hot water for about 3 days.
I work in property management and I would never recommend this company to anyone. Thankfully the owners of our rental property switched management companies.

resp.text: Ms Hubbard, First of all thank you for letting us know about your concerns. Please know that we take the care of our tenants and the property we manage very seriously. You are correct. We were dealing with major burst pipes all over Huntsville during this time. We called several outside plumbers who were also slammed with frozen pipes. We got out there as soon as possible. We prioritized families with children and the elderly. After that we took care of service calls on a first come basis. One item in your complaint is inaccurate. We were let go due to the excessive amount spent (in the opinion of the owner) making repairs to your home.  I wish you all the best in your new home.

name: Ke Ke
text: I enjoyed my stay with this company. No major issues. I always paid my rent on time. I was never late paying my rent and i expected for them to never be late on providing maintenance service. I put in a request to have a continously stopped up sink and running toilet fixed. Months went by and no one ever came to fix it. When i put in my notice to vacate, then they finally came out to fix it when i was loading my things into a truck. I would definitely rent from them again...

resp.text: Thanks for the review. Unfortunately, we cannot find this name in our tenant rosters, so are unable to specifically address the issues you are reporting. I do not know how you submitted service requests or if the request made it to the proper people,. But, if the requests are made through appropriate channels, we are generally able to get clogged pipes cleared and running toilets rebuilt within a day or two.

name: John Rowe
text: I used these people to manage by  property, never received any of the rent money and they 1099 for the rent money  they kept for themselves. Also the Tenant that occupied the house never paid any of the electric bill which was left in my name. I believe they did this because I'm from the north. A word of warning to all people from the northern states if you own property in Alabama

resp.text:
Mr. Rowe,
None of this is true. This house is in Albertville, an hour and a half away from our office, way too far to be a desirable listing. You begged us to manage this house with your tenants already installed, because you felt all the local people were criminal and corrupt. Against our better judgement we decided to help you out. You didn't want us to send you any rent money while tenant was there, hoping they would buy house and use those funds to help with their closing costs. Your tenants were dead beats, stopped paying rent and were promptly removed. They left the house in terrible shape, with rotting food in fridge, human waste in toilet, old rusting and broken down appliances, a severe cockroach infestation and a property resembling a land-fill with all the construction debris and trash strewn about evenly over an acre of land. The utility bill was attached to their final account with the back rent and other expenses. Their account was referred to collections when they refused to pay what was owed. When they were gone, you wanted us to list this property for sale. We reluctantly agreed to help you here as well. With your permission, we used the meager available funds as best we could to clean property and house for selling. This involved 2 guys over 3 days and 8 round trips with a 30 foot trailer filled with garbage hauled from the property. The house had to be seriously detrashed, scrubbed down and treated for cockroaches. We did the absolute best we would with what funds were available, spending more in fact than what was available in order to clean up completely. But, we were still about $10,000 short of what was needed to get the home ready for habitability, much less marketability and you refused to spend anything more. We 1099 for all the income received and also sent an end of the year statement which itemized all the expenses, leaving you with net income of $0 for tax purposes.

name: Alyssa Feldhaus
text: The worst service. Did not notify me of a $600 water leak in our home. Has made more than one major accounting error. Takes FOREVER to get a response. If I could give 0 stars I would. Sharon butler is only interested in serving those who have expensive homes. We own 3 properties and used this company for one of them simply because I don't have the time to deal with section 8 renting... she apparently doesn't have the time either. Go to management apex instead.

resp.text: I am very sorry you feel this way. The leak you are referring to was a frozen pipe within a wall which could have done major damage. I felt it was an emergency and as such took immediate action to mitigate damage. We actually manage several lower income properties. We absolutely value all our homes and clients no matter the price point. We wish Ms Feldhaus all the best of luck.

name: Emily Cathcart
text: Huntsville Property Mangers is great. My Grandparents have a few properties that HPM manages for them. They are wonderful with my grandparents they explain everything to them that’s happing with there properties and handles everything.

resp.text: Emily thank you for your kind words. We love being a trusted manager for their portfolio

name: Tynika Dent
text: I think the staff is wonderful. Rented from them then the property was sold. The new management was and is horrible. I am looking to rent from these wonderful again...asap. The new management forced me out in the middle of my lease and said nasty things about Huntsville property managers which I totally disagree with. Rock on guys. My name is Tynika btw

resp.text: Tynika, thanks so very much for the kind review. Please reach out to us when you are in need of a new place to live.

name: Duane Harris
text: Highly recommend this company, I’ve had nothing but positive experiences starting from the day I moved in.

resp.text: Thanks Mr. Harris, we appreciate your support.

name: Charlsie Kirk
text:
RENTER BEWARE - 14020 SANDHURST DR SW
Today I received an email that the property I recently moved out of is back up for rent and $225 more per month than what I was paying. I’m here for this review to warn the next renter of the nightmare that is Darin Bashaw, and how poorly this property has been maintained. First and foremost, false advertisement. This is not a 3 bedroom home. It’s a 2 bedroom (one of which is COVERED in mold) and has a sunroom that directs you to the back yard (that is an uncontrollable BAMBOO FOREST). It is NOT a clean home, but rather the complete opposite. This house is NASTY. When we moved out after only 2.5 months, there were MUSHROOMS growing in the bedroom and bathroom. Absolutely NOTHING was done about a water infiltration issue that we reported to Darin 3 weeks after move-in, which resulted in us having to send an official letter to move out without penalty. As if that weren’t enough, we weren’t informed of the uncontrollable bamboo growing in the yard. When we moved out, the yard was mowed, yet Darin stole $120 of my deposit that he was supposed to return “due to neglect of the yard” THAT HE HADNT EVEN MOWED WHEN HE STOLE MY MONEY. He let that yard grow for TWO SOLID WEEKS after we moved out. The OWNER OF THE HOUSE saw it mowed with his own eyes when he came to check on his house after the CITY came and wrote them up for all kinds of things that needed to be fixed but weren’t. This includes electrical outlets, DRY ROTTED WOOD, poorly sealed doors, the shed out back, and who knows what else. They have not had time to tackle the mold issue since we moved out. I know this because I was there last week 5/13 to get my mail and check out the yard. They hadn’t even cleaned. I know this because the overflowed trash was still sitting in the carport and hadn’t even been taken to the road for pick up. This was such a terrible experience that we now have a lawyer so that we no longer have to deal with this man. I have pictures and videos of this entire experience, which include Darin cussing my husband and being completely irate when we returned the keys. All I can say is TRUST THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS. This man ROBBED me of my deposit and three months worth of rent and let my family move into a MOLD INFESTED HOME. He is a crook and a PITIFUL excuse for a professional. I’m embarrassed for the company he works for. What a terrible representation of a business.

resp.text:
Ms Kirk, I am sorry you were not happy with your home.
You were allowed out of your lease early. The "mold" was categorized by Community Development, who came out as your request, as mildew. Additionally, this was after the massive flooding experienced by all of Huntsville. The list from the city was minimal and so unimportant that they gave us until the end of summer to make repairs. The bamboo was in existence for years and controlled via mowing. You were responsible for the yard. Because you didn't maintain the bamboo is now out of control.  We have rerented the home and have now needed to deal with the bamboo.
Your move in report rated most of the house as acceptable upon move in. Again I am sorry for your experience and wish you all the best.

name: Bob Armstrong
text: They have managed my building for 3 years now and I have 4 words to describe them, responsive, trustworthy, professional and dependable

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Armstrong, we value your business and look forward to many more years together!

name: Eli Allen
text: Huntsville Property Managers helped me rent my house a few years ago when it wouldn't sale. They just arranged for the tenant to purchase, though their Intero affiliate. Couldn't be happier about the 'full service' and great attitude.

resp.text: Thanks Mr. Allen, it was a pleasure doing business with you!

name: Kelly F
text:
Don't waste your time or money.  We're now stuck in a lease and haven't even moved in yet.  Went to view the house on Monday, Dec 3.  On Dec 4 I emailed that we were prepared to pay the deposit for the house and was told "I can probably get it finished up for you to sign the lease on Friday."  Come Friday we heard nothing about whether the house was ready so text the property manager for an update who replies "The lease was ready in the office today. You weren't able to make it?"  Well, no, no one said it was ready.  We meet at their office Saturday to sign the lease, get keys, and of course hand over money...then we go to the house.  Not cleaned.  Text the mgr to let him know it's not clean and he replies "The carpet and linoleum are brand new, so you should be able to move your furniture into the house. I will see if I can get someone back, though it has been cleaned and may not get any cleaner looking."  No, this isn't cosmetic, this is filthy and lazy. That evening I email several pics of the house and receive no reply.  Three days later still no reply so I call him.  I say hello and who I am, to which he replies "yeah?".  I say I'm calling for an update on the house being cleaned.  He says it is clean, just not to MY standards.  He says the carpet and linoleum are new, to which I reply that doesn't mean the house is clean.  I asked him about the pic I sent of the AC return vent.  His reply was that there's a filter.  Oh, so the filth caked up on the outside is ok because there's a filter.  I ask about the storm shelter.  He says they cleared it out.  Well, my pics show otherwise.  I ask about the closet with trash on the shelf and animal hair all over the floor, how a broom has never touched the floors and that I don't want to put my groceries on the filthy pantry shelves.  He replies that he has been doing this a long time, that any other person would've moved in already, how much they have already spent getting the property ready, and that I obviously require extra care so he'll send someone back out tomorrow.  After being insulted I suggested that maybe this isn't the right thing for us and what can we do.  He said we've already signed the lease so nothing.  I asked if this is what we should expect over the course of our lease and he replied that it's up to us, not him, said have a nice day and hung up on me.

**And in response to the records indicating the move in is next weekend and you "agreed" to early move in...that is simply incorrect.  Your records may show that as an estimated date but then why would I be told on Dec 4 that the house could probably be finished up by Friday (Dec 7)?  Doesn't make sense. If the house simply wasn't going to be ready then I would've preferred that answer over being stressed that it really wasn't yet.  But I am very appreciative of the effort to have someone out so quickly to clean.  Hopefully the relationship improves moving forward.

resp.text:
Kelly I am sorry you are unhappy. Our records show you were due to move in next weekend. You asked for a weeks early move in middle of the week. The home was not ready, but we agreed to your early move in. The cleaning person is over there as we speak re cleaning. This was the first opening she had.
The home has new carpet and linoleum.  The storm shelter is an exterior structure. We do not clean those. I am confident you will be comfortable in your new home.

name: Decaurrey Clark
text: Horrible company. Takes weeks to get maintenance requests filled. They half step on everything..

resp.text: This tenant issues are exaggerated and/or not true. She moved into an apartment we had been managing for exactly one day. The first time I looked at unit was when I showed to her, it wasn't ready by our standards to move into, but she had a moving truck full and wanted it immediately. We honored her request and conducted the screening and had new lease prepared the same day, letting her move in to the apartment in existing condition. She complained immediately about a leaking sink drain in kitchen. The property manager himself fixed that sink within an hour. She had a couple of other minor complaints and was instructed to properly submit service requests through the tenant portal, so maintenance can can get on them most efficiently. To date, she has never submitted a service request appropriately. She was quiet until July 18, when she just came back from a trip and said the fridge went out and all her food was spoiled. I was going to send someone to take a look, but she also said it was working again. Next, she started texting the property manager after hours on Friday July 20th, and then angry texting on Saturday the 21st at around bedtime. She was informed that nothing can be done over the weekend and maintenance would check first thing on Monday. Maintenance did go out on Monday and determined the fridge needed to be replace, she also mentioned the water heater didn't work. Water heater was discovered to have a leak at electrical control panel, causing it to short which is something we considered an emergency, and water heater was replaced the same day that Monday. We have contractual obligation to address any non-emergency issues over $300 with owner prior to spending their money. Sometimes it may take a few days to get in touch with the owner for directions, which will delay our repair response time. This owner approved for a new fridge on Tuesday and one was ordered immediately. We also have a fiduciary responsibility to  owners and have found the most expedient and affordable way to get new appliances is to order online, where we can shop the best deals and take advantage of free delivery and hauling of old appliances. When we do order, we always order something in stock for next or 2 day delivery. In this case, for whatever reason, Lowe's needed a couple of extra days but still, a new refrigerator was delivered by the end of the week. We also have a legal responsibility to tenants to address any health and safety issues within a 2 week time frame. Even if we cannot get in touch with owners or get adequate instructions, we will go out of our way to meet our legal obligations, while also meeting our fiduciary obligations. We strongly recommend our tenants carry renters insurance so they can file a claim for any damages or spoiled food.

name: Fred Quiroz
text: Love this company!!!

resp.text: Ms Hale, I am sorry you are unhappy. Your review, however, gives me no information to go on. I looked through our work orders and didn't see any outstanding. Please let me know what needs are and I will attempt to resolve. Our tenants satisfaction is of course important. Please give me more information. Our office is open and you are welcome to call in and talk with our receptionist.

name: stalexis glenn
text: I moved in Friday 8/9/19. Upon moving in my air wasn’t working, called and they said they would send some one out. 2 maintenance men came out but my air wasn’t fixed. When i called back they said they would not come out unless it was 85 degrees or more. They did not fix my air until 8/10/19 after i called that morning and told them i was hot and someone needed to fix my air that day. Second problem on my move in day, my tub was clogged. I put a work request in on 8/9/19 no one has yet to come out. I called 8/10/19 they said they will mark it urgent & someone would be out that day. 8/10/19 i took a shower & the water did not run out i had to scoop dirty water out & flush down the toilet. I called 8/11/19 & 8/12/19 about the tub being clogged and they said someone would fix it that day. I come home from work 8/12/19 and it is still a tub full of dirty water. I call the maintenance line and he said he would mark my request urgent and send the on call maintenance man to my apartment ASAP. As the air conditioning man was fixing the air in another apartment he knocks mine out somehow i called about that also. So the on call maintenance man calls me and says that he tried to come out but didn’t have a key to my apartment so i asked him what i was suppose to do about a shower and he said “the best i can do is be there in the morning”. AFTER i was told it would be fixed today. Cable line are ran from the upstairs apartments to the bottom. I asked if he fixed my cable he said the line was cut and spectrum was coming out tomorrow. I called spectrum and they had no record of this. Then he said the air conditioning man would be out & i am STILL without air. Moral of the story they will tell you anything to TRY to keep you happy. It has been problem after problem after problem and i have not been here a WEEK YET. My air is still out, my tub is still clogged, i still do not have my cable & WiFi hooked up. I WOULDN’T RECOMMEND TO MY WORST ENEMY!!!!

name: Stacy George
text: Great business to rent with.

resp.text: Thank you Stacy.  We really appreciate the positive comments.

name: Leandria Goodson
text: They are probably by far the worst people to rent from. Been a tenant with them for many years and it did not start off this way. What I love best about them is the maintenance department who first of all doesn't "fix" anything..they will "patch" things up and give you a bogus maintenance charge when you report the issue to them again. Oh and not to mention the person who handles the maintenance requests is a real joy to deal with over the phone, as this person is rude and very unprofessional.  Something else that I truly love about them is how they will send you bogus late fees  if you don't keep up with when you paid them and how much. My advice to any new tenant is to keep copies of your rent payments and if you pay online take screenshot of the paymment confirmation.

name: Only Truth
text: I rented 1836 Glendmere Dr Vestavia, AL. This house is a disaster to live in, especially when the property manager (Don) doesn't repair anything. The house basement floods when it rains, there was mold in ceilings, and the plumbing has issues. Do not rent from this company they only want your money and will not assist with their property.

name: Sarah B
text: This company IS BY FAR the BEST rental company I have rented from. From day ONE...Victoria, Amy, and Sarah have been EXCEPTIONAL. These ladies work hard and help in any way they can and we appreciate their constant support!! Our apartment had an issue with mixup in the beginning but these women worked expeditiously to resolve the issue!! My family and I will be here for the long haul because it's hard to come by a company that stands by their customers and their well-being!!! We love this place!!

name: Jackie Brown
text: This one of the worst property management companies in Birmingham. If you have no other choice, Red Rock Realty is just for you! They do not follow tenant leasing laws. They don’t do anything to solve problems, if anything they create more. You’ll make a complaint they will listen to you and sympathize but they will not be proactive in solving any situation dealing with disturbances of a neighbor. They also tried to say I didn’t pay my rent which was not true my bank statements said other wise. Instead of trying to help they will manipulate a situation trying to force you out from where you can afford to live. If you have 15 people that need a place to stay in a one bedroom rent from Red Rock Realty, they have no capacity limitations. You’ll have a Red Rock time. Remember Red Rock is just a stone covered in blood.

name: Alicia Sherman
text:
Brad Clay stated they do not accept out of state guarantors, even if they provide a year's rent upfront.  I am unsure how this is at all beneficial to them unless they are attempting to keep a certain kind of tenant from renting their properties.

Food for thought.

Edit to respond to owner's comment:

Thank you for your quick response!  If only your responses were this timely when reporting a problem in one of your units!  Let's be clear that I did not accuse you of anything, merely stated that this was the only logical reason I could conclude for not accepting a year's rent upfront.  While there are other issues I could address, I think your yelp and google reviews speak for themselves.

resp.text:
Ms. Sherman,
We have been advised by our attorney not to accept out-of-state guarantors because of the cost associated with holding those guarantors accountable.  We do allow tenants to pay rent in advance but this does not circumvent our standards to confirm a resident’s ability to provide income showing they have the ability to pay rent.  To make accusations online that we are discriminating is wrong and unfair.  We are an equal-housing opportunity provider and work with every applicant equally on qualifications.

Thank you,

name: Love Knox
text: I've been in one of the properties for a while now I have to say that it has been a fair stay as long as you don't need them for anything.. What I don't like is that you can never get anyone on the phone, maintenance takes their time to fix things and let not mention you can never get the person over the phone to return phone calls. The washers in the washroom work sometimes.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  We honestly do our best to answer all calls and greet each person, however if you ever have an issue please feel free to email us at: Leasing@redrockrg.com or info@redrockrg.com.  You can also contact us through the Online Portal.  If you don't have access to it or have misplaced it, email us and we can send you a link to reset.  Thank you!

name: Judy Burgess
text: greatplacetolive........wonderfulpropertymanager!

resp.text: Thank you Judy.  We appreciate it.

name: Tammie Cooper
text: As a potential tenant, I would just like to extend my appreciation to Ms. Jamie Kunta for her help and patience. She was very professional,  I really enjoyed our conversation as she was walking me through my application process. Thank-You!

name: Crystal Alexander
text: I just moved in my Apartment in Hueytown!!! Ms. Sarah Hutto is the Manager and she is Awesome!!!! My apartment is beautiful and affordable!!! The neighborhood is great everything is in walking distance!!! The neighbors are awesome they welcomed me with food!!! So glad I chose Red Rocky Reality in Hueytown!!!!❤️❤️❤️❤️

name: John Doe
text: Just dont

name: Emerick Pressley
text: Jamie Kuntz and Mrs.Snow are the best !!! They were very patient and respectful with my moving process. I will recommend Red Rock Realty Group to anyone of all ages and all circumstances. Love love love this place !!

name: janice Williams
text: Red rock reality bought the apartments I live in on August 2019. I have never been late on rent but the manager doesn't post rental payments until the 8th to the 12th of the month and then post a late fee! Doesn't answer the phone either. I would love a call back. UPDATE: After this post I received a call back from corporate and everything was resolved in a very professional manner. Thank you so much for taking care of this problem!

name: Chris Burgett
text: I want to first say that I love how quiet our apartment is and the location. I enjoy that it is one level and no one is above or below us. The one thing, and it's a HUGE PROBLEM, something that I told them about right after moving into said apartment about is the carpet. I mentioned that it was filthy and the owner of Red Rock persisted to state that it had been professionally clean. And after talking to our neighbor I believe this to be true. But the previous owners were disgusting and I don't know what they did to it but even after us buying a high dollar, well made carpet cleaner ourselves and cleaning it TWICE we still cannot walk across the carpet without our feet being sticky and them nor or socks being BLACK. This makes me sick to my stomach. We should be able to walk on our carpet without this being an issue. We have a three year old and I feel disgusted knowing it will never been clean. We only moved in the last week of October and I hate knowing we have to deal with this problem indefinitely. It has torn places and places where it is coming apart in two areas in a line that will only get worse. You guys KNEW the last tenant was fifthly and knowing that should have just replaced the carpet so no one else had to deal with it. I believe it needs to be pulled up and something else put down ASAP. I know that if it is not that we will be moving out, instead of staying put (as we had hoped to do) as soon as our year is up. That is a shame because otherwise we love it.

name: Julie Wilson
text: My air conditioner went out last night (10/4). We have placed several calls through the maintenance line with promises of someone getting in touch with us ASAP. We haven’t heard a single thing. This is Alabama in the middle of summer. It’s HOT. I would never recommend these people to anyone.

name: Laura Puckett
text:
I applied for an apartment about three months ago. I paid the application fee ($90)  and waited for their call. When I finally received the call (after more than a week, rather than the 3-4 day waiting period they promised), I was told someone had applied before me, so they received the apartment. Things happen, and I was okay with this news. The woman I spoke to on the phone said they would have another apartment available at the same location in two weeks time. That's great! She said they would call me as soon as it was available, and I would be the first person on the waiting list.
Three weeks go by. I call to check on it after hearing nothing. This time I'm told they don't know what date the apartment will be available---not even a time estimate.
Fast forward three months. No updates. At first I called once a week, and they typically answered the phone, though they were NEVER able to offer a time estimate on the apartment. For the past month, I'm lucky to ever get a person on the phone--instead I have to leave voicemails that have only been answered once.
And now the voicemail box is full. They never answer. I was patient to begin with, but I specifically halted apartment hunting for the apartment they originally said would be ready two weeks after I applied.
I'm so disappointed with this experience. If you are in a time crunch and must have an apartment quickly, please don't use this company.
I am lucky to have found a much nicer place to live, with much more helpful staff. I'm leaving this review in the hopes that someone will completely avoid this realty company, rather than wasting three months on them with no results and down $90, like I did.

resp.text:
Dear Mrs. Puckett,
We are very sorry to hear of your negative experience with our team at Red Rock and apologize.  Please know that we have two new great leasing staff members that have just joined our team this last week and we would love to have the opportunity to try regain your business.  We can assure you that you will have a completely different experience.  Again, we sincerely apologize for not assisting as we should have.

Sincerely,
Brad Cleage
Red Rock Realty Group

name: CEO Scroggins
text: Jamie Kuntz is so awesome. She did whatever should could to get me approved. Also very courtius thank her so much. Amy also was great, very patient

name: Prasanna Kumar
text: Great Hospitality & good response time for maintenance issues. Have been living in Red Rock property for over an year and never had to call more than once for any maintenance issue.

name: Nathan Joly
text:
Worst realty company I have ever had to deal with. Was treated horribly because of my skin color. My girlfriend put in her application for an apartment which basically got approved but her boss wouldn't verify employment over the phone (that's okay and a safe thing to do). Instead of letting her know of the problem, she received no notification. She called to find out days later about the status of her application because she heard nothing from them at all and was told of the problem. For a company needing to fill spots, since empty spots cost money instead of make money, this is a very horrible way for employees to be. When she put in her deposit and we asked about a receipt, we were told the receipt from the money order was enough (the tear off tab). I guess receivership of money doesn't require a receipt for this company or Brittany doesn't understand how a receipt actually works. Every other company we've rented from gives a receipt as proof of receiving a deposit (Arizona, California, Florida, Virginia). Very sketchy. Not a company we want to deal with.
Update (20181106): The response to my review was horrible. Your core values don't mean a thing if there is no true follow-up to a problem so it can be corrected. I am in the U.S. Air Force and one of our core values are Integrity First. This company posted a advertisement as a 5 star review. There is no integrity there as they stated in their core values.

resp.text: We are very sorry you feel this way, however we take pride in serving our clients and customers with the highest degree of professionalism. Our Company Values are Accountability, Customer First, Enjoyment of Work, Family, Financial Responsibility, Integrity, and Teamwork. We try and live by these in everything we do.

name: David Hester
text: Highly recommend Red Rock Realty for residential property rentals.  Excellent service by caring professionals.  Especially the front office staff and property manager.  I would definitely rent again with this company if the need arises.

resp.text:
David,
Thank you for the awesome review. We strive to provide excellent costumer service!

name: Venkatadri Raparla
text: Nice realty group to lease for residence near UAB. Hospitable and helpful staff, maintenance is reasonably good. They try to resolve issues instead of staying idle for complaints such as parking issues, pest control etc. But one of the things they need to concentrate more is on maintaining cleanliness around apartment complex

name: Miesha B
text: Red Rock realty was very accommodating when it came to issues I was having in my apartment, due to the previous tenant. The office went above & beyond to fix these issues. Even to the point of replacing my dryer with a new one (even though my particular complex no longer offered washers/dryers).

resp.text:
Miesha,
Thank you for the Google review. We strive to provide excellent costumer service always!

name: Tiara King
text:
If I could give this 0 starts I would. The atmospheres is very tensed & uninviting. The front desk/customer service reps that works in the Residential Department are very unprofessional & confrontational. The older Caucasian (heavy set) female doesn't acknowledge customers &  the younger Caucasian lady (slender with slight overbite) likes to raise her voice & talk to adults  as if they'er ignorant children. I always request receipts before submitting my payments in the drop & they always act as if it's a problem. No other customers are present & you're not doing anything but on your personal phone/social media.

If you activate the audio on your cameras you can clearly hear that words were exchanged between your cs rep and myself. Of course you can see a confrontation you can only hear it. Now you all are fake. Who ever I talked with when I filed my complaint stated that she shouldn’t have given me a hard time regarding a receipt request and now you want to call me a liar for the world to see. That’s slandering my character.

resp.text:
Ms. King,
After you spoke with one of our principals on the phone to file your complaint on 2/4/19, they reviewed the video of your visit to Red Rock on that day.  The account of your visit given to our principal and the one that you give in your review is not accurate.  We saw no confrontation between you and our leasing agent and our other agent was on the phone assisting a customer during your visit.  We welcome reviews of Red Rock, both positive and negative, as they help us grow as a company.  However, we do not appreciate when needless comments are directly personally towards our staff.  It is our goal to provide the best customer service possible, but sometimes we may fall short of some visitor’s expectations.  We apologize that your visit was not inviting and we do hope that it will be on your next visit.   After your visit and review, we have discussed with our leasing staff the importance of maintaining a welcoming and inviting environment for all who visit Red Rock.

name: Cindy Bentley
text: Red Rock Realty Group is a full service commercial Real Estate Company. Managing over 2,200 apartment homes and single family homes. Red Rock is led by senior management with 84 years experience. If your looking for a professional full service real estate company to manage your multifamily asset, commercial, single family home. Call Red Rock today. Our team is invested in your success.  Cindy

name: Snoe Fargeaux
text: Very prompt! You can’t beat being smack dab in the middle of the city in a reasonably priced complex and you get a overlook of the city. My complex doesn’t allow animals and I loovvveeee that! Police precinct right around the corner.

name: Kay W
text: AVOID AT ALL COST!!!! They rent out to literally anyone including scum drug dealers. They don’t even check on their properties. When calling the police on neighbors we were retaliated against. Red rock doesn’t properly address anything. They are extremely incompetent in the office. Luckily, the altercation gave me an opportunity to move. The only reason I moved in was because of the movein special but they could give our properties for free and I still wouldn’t rent with them. Continue to have your tenants have dice games in your parking lot. They are rude as well. I can go on and on about the company in general but all these bad reviews speak for themselves.

resp.text:
Kay W,
We are sorry you feel this way. We looked back in our records and we do not have any written complaints that have been submitted to our office regarding any of these issues from a Kay W (in your lease you will read we require all complaints be hand written and submitted into our office). You are more than welcome to email info@redrockrg.com with your name, old address, and phone number and someone from our office will reach out to you.

Thank you

name: john sisson
text: In my business dealings with Red Rock real estate I have found them to be very professional. In working with them year after year I have nothing but compliments for the level of customer service they provided me. Red Rock is a company continually pursuing excellence. They are problem solvers always pursuing a solution to problems instead of ignoring them. In the future I would be willing to work with him again without question.

text: The Lady at the front desk is incredibly rude.  Her excuse for not having the paperwork ready when I got here was his she is the only one here.  Exceptionally poor customer service.

text:
The experiences I have had with the front desk have been an exceptional! They are always a pleasure to work with; their attention to detail far exceeds any expectations. If my dealings with these ladies was my only experience, it would have been 5 stars!
However, my experience with the maintenance requests has left something to be desired.  From the first interaction, it seems every request has required multiple follow up calls, and even unecessary attitude and push back.

name: Shannon W.
text: Red Rock Realty has a great group of owners.  I have worked closely with them for over 10 years and enjoy the professional relationship.  They treat the people they do business with professionally and their employees are treated fairly.  Red Rock is a great place to do business with.

text: Cindy is wonderful,  she was very helpful on our leasing process. She made herself available,  she was very kind, and has great interpersonal communication skills. She's really Great!  I give Cindy 5 stars...we'll see how it goes from here.

name: Chris Harris
text: I have always had excellent service with purchasing property and having Red Rock manage them. I never knew I could buy apartments and never worry about them. Red Rock handles renting them, collecting rent, and keeping up with maintenance. #1 company.

name: Larry Deavers
text: Parking spaces are somewhat difficult to find

name: Laura Turner
text: I have had nothing but trouble with this company.  I own a home and moved out of state and needed to rent it.  At first, they found great tenants and I really had no trouble.  Unfortunately, those tenants moved out and everything slid downhill. The next tenant skipped out on the last 3 months of rent (which I have still not received from 9 months ago).  He also trashed the house.  Obviously, Red Rock did not do their due diligence when finding a tenant.  I had them try to find a new tenant.  3 months went by with little to no communication.  When I complained to the property manager, I was told that I could take my business elsewhere. It keeps getting worse from there.  I have lost the energy to continue.

name: S. Kel
text: Vengeance belongs to the LORD! May the Only True Living God judge your company for the evil you did towards me in Jesus' name Amen I am a child of GOD and you had no right nor authority. He said 4 you to over rule evil with GOOD. He said to bless and not curse. He said OWE no name nothing BUT love! Will u all continue to trample the Spirit of Grace...IDK but that's between U n the OMEGA!

name: Ashley Vrocher
text: I had an amazing experience purchasing my home from Red Rock Realty Group.  My agent, Adrianne Curran, made the experience seamless and I would highly recommend her to anyone.  In addition, the follow-up from the executive team with a personal note was greatly appreciated.

name: Patrick Bryant
text:
The worst customer service I've experienced. Our air conditioner broke and they passed our maintenance request to a "third party," who did absolutely nothing. They refused to give us any updates or help, blaming their "third party," while our apartment temperature climbed into the 80s. After a week we hired another maintenance company who showed up within hours.

Also, I spoke with three different customer service reps about this issue. The problem is not with any particular employee, it's with the company itself.

name: Warner McGowin
text: The people at Red Rock are top-notch, and I've had nothing but positive experiences with them. They're very honest and straightforward, and they know the Birmingham market well. Great company.

resp.text: Thanks for your review Warner! We really appreciate it!

name: Timothy Astor
text:
Please do yourself a favor and rent with another company in Birmingham. This is one of the most disorganized and frustrating realty companies I have ever had the displeasure of having to work with. The shame is that the apartment itself is quite nice, even if it wasn't cleaned before I moved in.

Initially, after Red Rock tried to overcharge me, I was charged twice for my security deposit. Then, when moving in, I was told that the only way to pay my first month's rent was through security deposit and that I had to drop it off in person at their office. What a thoroughly archaic way to collect rent! On top of the fact that their office hours prevent you from actually getting to their office if you have a full time job. Regarding their hours, even if you call while they are supposedly open, never once have they actually answered the phone. And good luck receiving a timely callback if you leave a message, as it takes at least a week for them to respond.

Fast forward two months, and I receive a notice of 2 months back rent due plus a late fee and my security deposit. Not only have they lost the record of my security deposit, they failed to note that they already charged me TWICE for it. After spending 2 days on the phone and numerous assurances from multiple employees there that everything is settled, I hope it doesn't happen again. Next month comes along, and I am told I am being threatened with eviction due to $1300+ back rent missing from their records. I am still awaiting a call back regarding this new report of incompetence.

This company is absolutely horrible when it comes to organization. The only person who has been helpful at their office, Jordan, appears to be the only competent one there, but the issues still keep piling on. If looking to rent in Birmingham, DO NOT look here.

name: Monika Jackson
text:
Never had an issue with bed bugs until I moved into one of their units. It has been a total nightmare!! I’ve had to throw out most of my things and it seems they don’t even care. I’ve contacted maintenance TWICE with this very serious issue and still no response. My next step is calling the health department. BEWARE!!
Update: I still have bedbugs and I am still being bitten 3 weeks later. They have “treated” my unit twice & its not helped at all. Plus I found out the lady next door had bedbugs in November & the man above me has had them too but they claim he doesn’t have them anymore. I moved in towards the end of Feb & the bites popped up towards the end of March which means these bugs were still here well before I moved in & they didn’t treat it properly. I’ve decided to just move and they refuse to give my security deposit back but I don’t even care. I’ll rather live in a clean, safe environment. The name of these apartments are KINGS DREAM.

name: Tamara Lawrence
text: HORRIBLE! HORRIBLE! HORRIBLE! I WISH I KNEW THEN WHAT I KNOW NOW. THEY DONT CARE ABOUT THEIR TENANTS AT ALL. YOUR BASICALLY ON YOUR OWN. I MOVED IN AND TWO DAYS LATER MY A/C WENT COMPLETELY OUT. THEY SENT A TECH OUT TO REPAIR IT AND THE NEXT DAY IT WAS OUT AGAIN. I THEN STARTED HAVING PROBLEMS WITH ROACHES AND SPIDERS NOTHING WORKED. I WALKED INTO SPIDER WEBS ALL THE TIME. I HAVE A 10 MONTH OLD I CANT EVEN PUT ON THE FLOOR TO CRAWL AROUND. I THEN STARTED HAVING PROBLEMS WITH MICE. I ASKED IF I COULD MOVE TO ANOTHER COMPLEX AND I WAS DENIED. THEY CAME OUT TO MY HOME TWICE TO SPRAY AND I HAD TO CALL THEM TO DO THAT. PLEASE TAKE YOUR MONEY SOMEWHERE ELSE THIS COMPANY IS HORRIBLE!

resp.text:
Ms. Lawrence,
Our records indicate that prompt service was provided to correct you’re A/C issues and we have no other records over the past three months showing that any other issues have occurred.  In regard to pest control services, the lessor has a monthly contract to spray the property and each unit.  We have no other reports from tenants of any pest issues, but have reported your issues to the vendor.  Please remember that you should contact our 24/7 maintenance hotline to report any maintenance problems.  We are sorry that you have had these issues and always want to take care of problems promptly.

name: Jonathan Hogan

resp.text: Thanks for your positive feedback Jonathan!

name: Kailee Nelson

name: Bama Thomas
text:
Red Rock Realty Group out of Birmingham, Alabama has been a great experience for me. They have a caring and empathetic staff!!
Red Rock wants to fulfill the needs of their residents in a timely manner and are very courteous at doing so. I would recommend them as an employment opportunity and as a landlorld.

resp.text: Thanks for your review Bama!

I suggest do no business with them!

He would appreciate hearing about your experience so that we can improve.

Sincerely,
Red Rock Realty Group

text: Horrible company, the worst I've ever seen and that's no exaggeration! They work against you not with you, very dishonest and unprofessional. Seems they try to put you out more than keep your service, keep in mind i have lived in my apartment for over 10 yrs and have never received a "termination" notice until this company took over. They disregard the lease signed and come up with these lies and made up figures and blame the previous company for it the first time. They don't want to fix anything but quick to put a termination notice on your door if rent is late. I don't know where these 5 star reviews come from, me and 2 other neighbors are planning to move out. They never answer or return your call.

name: JayMoney
text: I'm so relieved to have moved from under this company their sooo unprofessional and the leasing agents are rather lazy and very rude.. Ive had many issues car broken into, rigged up apts to not really see damages that were there. I advise nobody to rent to them I hate they bought J.H BERRY OUT

resp.text:
Jaii Dee,
I am sorry to hear that your experience with Red Rock management has been negative.  We strive to manage our properties well.  We hired several team members from J.H. Berry Multi-family during the transition.  As for your car break-in, crime can happen anywhere and we do not provide security for vehicles parked at the apartment building.  Please report vehicle break-ins to the Birmingham police department so they can investigate the matter.  If we can help with anything else, please do not hesitate to reach out directly to us.

Sincerely,
Red Rock Realty Group

name: Patrick Anthony
text: Great experience with the lady’s at the front desk. Always great you with a smile and will do anything they can to help you out 👍

name: Malisa Daniels
text: This is the Most unprofessional company I've ever dealt with. The receptionists Brittney and LaQuita are so rude. I had to keep calling the office about my application it took over 2 weeks to get any answers. I had to visit the office multiple times and deal with the rudeness to get answers. I was so tired of having to deal with them, that I ended up bringing my boyfriend to the office to talk for me, because I just had enough. Brittney wouldn't even acknowledge him. I should have known that not only is this company unprofessional but they are racist. My boyfriend is white. When I first walked into this office, their was another white male man upset and complaining to them how he felt discriminated against. I should've taken that as a warning sign. I highly warn anyone not to rent from this company. I took my deposit back and walked away. 0 stars

resp.text: We are very sorry you feel this way, however we take pride in serving our clients and customers with the highest degree of professionalism.  Our Company Values are Accountability, Customer First, Enjoyment of Work, Family, Financial Responsibility, Integrity, and Teamwork.  We try and live by these in everything we do.

name: super tails 55
text: I came in to Red Rock Realty Group to inquire about a property for rent in the Southside area of Birmingham and was greeted by the two ladies(LaQuita and Brittany) at the front desk. They were extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the area that I am considering moving to from Atlanta.

name: Beth Overstreet
text: I have left two voice mails over the past 2 weeks ( 2 diff people), asking someone to call me back about renting two apartments (for 2 UAB students) and haven't heard back.  It's a shame because we knew which apartment we wanted and which dates, etc.  Makes me wonder what the service/response time would be if we rented one of the apartments and had any issues/repairs that needed done.  Guess we'll look elsewhere.

resp.text:
Beth,
We are sorry you have had a hard time reaching someone here in our office. You are welcome to email info@redrockrg.com with you name, number, and experience you are having and our VP of Property Management will contact you.

Thank you,

name: Justin Wiley
text:
This was one of the worse places that I could have wasted my time trying to seek housing. Not only are they unprofessional, but they have high staff turnovers, so I found myself repeating the same thing. I work with an agency that assist the elderly in looking for affordable homes, and I have never experienced such a lack of professionalism in all my life. I would not rent from them nor recommend them to anyone!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I only gave the one star because I had to in order to submit this review!

resp.text:
Justin,

We're sorry to hear you've had a bad experience with us. We have recently added a new member to our leasing team. We strive to give the best service,  be professional and uphold the laws of Fair Housing. Every person who applies is required to meet certain qualifications listed on the application. If you feel as though that is not the case, please contact our Vice President of Property Management, Tommy Joyce.

Sincerely,
Red Rock Realty Group

name: Megan Walton
text: I have been a resident at the signal hill apartments for almost two years now and if I could give them a no star rating I would. I have been a great tenant, paying rent on time or early, no issues with other neighbors. The maintenance team seems to like to neglect their tenants. I have had water issues personally with water coming up thru my carpet to the vent in the bathroom leaking. To hearing about water it self leaking thru the walls in other apartments. To an upstairs neighbor being out of town with a leaking toilet that then started leaking in another apartment below them and maintenance taking days to show up and fix their issue. March of 2017 I called about water coming up thru my carpet and took me calling multiple times to “fix” said issue. In the past year I have had multiple sinus infection I now feel I can tie the missing link to mold that was never properly taken care of. Now I have tested positive for mold in both my living room and bedroom. I did an air test kit myself, so I now know and have proof of it. (Can’t see it but can smell it)  I assume they’re having issues believing me because I’m unable to see it. I have tried breaking my lease this past Friday on 25 May 2018 and asked them to honor my 30 day notice instead of a 60 day notice due to mold and it seems they have issues honoring that and want me to stay the full 60 days. I came in today may 29 with my mold test kits and am still waiting to hear back from the owner. I am not trying to cause issues, I just want to be able to leave and move on with my life to better my health. I am aware there are no laws in the state of Alabama that cover mold but the fact that they are so money hungry that they are willing to put their tenants health at risk for their rent money. I am very displeased with this company. I will never go thru them again.

name: Elizabeth Boyd
text: Terrible leasing company. We have put in numerous work orders that don't get answered. The health department had to be called to get trash picked up. No one returns phone calls.

name: Kevin Kevin
text: terrible service, will never rent from again.   charged me $50 to go the .25 miles from their office to my apt door to unlock it.. treat people like a number and not a valued customer.

name: Stefanie Frazer
text: I moved in 3 months ago at Gardendale terrace. I didn’t get a mailbox key when I moved in it is now September put in TWO requests and still have NOT received my mailbox key!!! I feel like they don’t care about their tenants at all!!!! Horrible experience!!!

name: Stephanie Bennett
text: "Superior service thats rock solid" is the slogan for this company and yet the maintence service is awful. I have been given the run around for 4 hours for someone to come out and fix my air unit. My apartment has flooded on several occasions and I know there is mold in the base boards.

resp.text:
We are very sorry you had a negative experience with our company.  Customer service is part of our core values but it sounds like we fell short this time.  We would like the opportunity to improve on your experience with us.  You can reach out to our Senior Vice President, Brad Cleage at bcleage@redrockrg.com.  He would appreciate hearing about your experience so that we can improve.

Sincerely,
Red Rock Realty Group

name: Teresa Hill Berry
text: Red Rock Rock managed Sherman Oaks in Eastlake for a private individual his name is Mark. Read the reviews online. I moved into an apt and 3 days later the worst odor I ever smelt in my life and I had to suffer it for 3 1/2 months before the owner would come out and he was so low down he came out when I wasn't there and removed a dead animal from a crawl space. I saw a dead possum at the end of my building. I made numerous calls & Mark the owner  never  do you need anything  for over 3 months He didn't care. the landlord reduced me to being crazy after the Health Inspector had been to my house twice and sent two letters. The owner said that the letter from the health inspector was not true. I spend a lot of money on Lysol and other products to camouflage the odor and kill the bacteria. the owner to this day still thinks that I don't deserve a dime. and he thinks that he should further punish me by holding my security deposit 5 wks. I have now learned that constructive eviction is not for the tenant it is it is a legal loophole for the landlord to screw you out of your money. Unless you dead or half dead at least in Birmingham Alabama. I finally got the owner to release me from my lease to God be the glory. online reviews or  less than 2.9 now I know why. there was a strong musty odor in the apartment as well.My my eyes would burn a lot I felt my eyeballs were melting . I had headaches & I felt something or someone was dead in the walls to this day I regret not having call the police. Oh I forgot to mention about the so-called preacher Ernest Smith resident manager. Earnest a want to be preacher told as many lies as Mark and red rock. This was the most traumatizing and horrific  ordeal  I do not wish this on anyone. After removing the dead possum from the crawl space I finally got my letter from Mark to release me out of my lease. I moved out the end of June a new tenant moved in the beginning of September. I was told by one of the neighbors a Mexican family moved in at least they had at least two months to clear the air in that particular apartment. Lets name this story the hidden secret why because the apartment was newly renovated. Grandma always said looks are deceiving . I was about a1yr  cancer survivor  and  suffer with COPD with other disabilities. The federal government declared me 100% disabled in the year 2000. Mark the owner apparently thought I was just another hood rat. I lived at 7723 Apartment B 3rd Avenue South. They waited 2 months after I left then moved in a Mexican family. I almost died in there with a stinking possum. I wasn't compensated in anyway. Constructive eviction means nothing in Alabama. Unless you lost a limb or life or a have a class action lawsuit apparently. You call a lawyer and they tell you you should and when you move they tell you to file bankruptcy that's what Jonathan at Legal Aid Society call me with. All the wild suggested that there was no way that legal aid services could assist me. Every 3 months when he's got nothing else better to do he called me stalling till statue has run out. you move they tell you they are glad that you got out of that situation but they can't help you. Calling legal aid is a waste of your doggone time. Constructive eviction as far as I can see is a legal loophole for the landlord to screw you anyway they want to. When you complain they do nothing can't wait till you move don't care about the money you lost. It cost me $1,500 to move in there and $1700 for me to find another place to live. I moved twice in the same year. Everytime Jonathan at Legal Services have nothing else better to do he gives me another call with another bright idea. Is Young still trying to learn his role but I do not appreciate him calling him wasting my time acquiring the same info he got the first time stalling. Whenever you get time Google constructive eviction. Hope you have better luck than I did.

resp.text:
We are very sorry you had a negative experience with our company.  Customer service is part of our core values but it sounds like we fell short this time. I open my refrigerator and there is Lil baby roaches And now they are all over my house. I called and ask for a new one and the lady told me well the old didn’t work and this one does and they won’t replace It.  I countinue to called 2more time to get it replaced and no call back. Now they are so bad I’ve seen them in my bed and I have a lil baby so I will be breaking my lease bc that’s just nasty.

name: Billy Sprague
text: This is a SCAM. I applied for an apartment for 575 a month and make almost 100k a year with good rental history. They still denied me to make the money off the application fee. They do not even return phone calls or answer the phone. I am not sure they are even a real company. I suggest if you find a place that they manage if they are real you run as they can collect more off a few application fees per day then any apartment would be worth. Very Poor business ethics.

resp.text:
Billy,

We appreciate you taking the time to write a review. We do not make money off of application fees, the fee goes to cover the background check, rental history check, credit check and the time it takes to process all of these things. We have a process to review applications and mail a letter to all of our applicants letting them know if they were approved or denied. If denied the reason will be stated in the letter. It is the law that we cannot tell you over the phone why you were accepted or denied.

Our policy is to return calls and emails with in 24 hours, but with the holidays (and recent ice/snow storm) this has been off a little. For that we apoligize. If you believe there was any confusion or fault on your application please feel free to call us at 205-324-3383, email us leasing@redrockrg.com, or come by 1425 Richard Arrington Jr. Blvd South Birmingham, AL 35205.

Thank you,
Team Red Rock

name: TennTom
text: I had a business appointment scheduled with the property manager (JA) to discuss  being added as a vendor for their company. Upon arriving 10 minutes early, the receptionist for RRRG said that he was not there and that his personal assistant did not know of a meeting being scheduled, that's because I had scheduled the meeting with him directly over the phone. The receptionist called him to let him know that I was there and he said he was on his way back to the office. 15 minutes later she tells me that she saw him pulling into the parking lot that he will be in in a moment. 10 minutes later she said that he is standing in the parking lot and is on his cell phone. Waited 15 more minutes before I finally got up and walked out of their office and left. Upon returning to my office I emailed him (trying to be courteous) to let him know that I understand that he may have been busy but I would like to reschedule our meeting. He never did try to contact me back after all the wasted time that I spent setting a confirmed appointment with him, driving to his office, and sitting in the lobby for over a half hour for our scheduled meeting. After that encounter with RRRG I am glad that he stood me up, it shows what type of people work there and I would not offer my services to that company if they begged me! I feel sorry for anyone they represent.

This company is lazy treats customers like crap. I have video footage of this company dumping raw sewage on to the driveway on several different occasions. They do not fix anything. name: Shelby Stackhouse
text: **Other than timely move in date. Just because they said they will do something before move in day, DOES NOT mean that they will. While staying no problems on move out they ask for fees that were not included in contract or any paperwork i signed off on. If you move in make sure whatever paperwork you fill out ESPECIALLY MOVE IN CHECK LIST, make sure you turn in the same day of move in as well get it notarized. They are all about money. I was warned beforehand with other ppl who were military personnel that moved in previously. They will more than likely take the majority of your security deposit/ deposit for damages or things that were there before move in or just so they can get the property ready for ANOTHER client when they were no damage to property. Just keep up with paperwork take pictures videos, etc move in day as well of anything you get done new to the property.
