text:
Had the absolute displeasure of talking to their property manager Tracy, who absolutely turned me off from wanting to do business with the entire company. As back story; I made it clear I was a first time renter and was already uncomfortable with the process, in response to which I was just pressured further to place a non-refundable security deposit on a place sight unseen (in person). - While all the pictures on their website are awful.

Shout to Daliyah, who on the other hand seems to be an excellent rep. and a delight to communicate with, since she actually tried to help me out.

name: Gabe Belford
text: We were very pleased with our recent experience.  Tracey is awesome!! She has been responsive, professional, and helpful throughout the process. I would immediately refer anyone to Prestige Homes. She's help my mom in these stressful times.  Some of my other family's planning on moving to the wonderful Enterprise area and will all be using Prestige for their rental needs.

name: Danielle Wright
text: Tracey was amazing! She went out of her way to go do video walk thru so I could see property.  Above all they were quick and responsive to any questions. She made the process easy. Definitely helped to relieve 1 worry for relocation

name: Arline Valdez
text:
Lexi and Karen (agent) helped us navigate through finding a home in the timeframe we need, answered all of our questions quickly and honestly, and even shared in the excitement of our upcoming move to a new state/rental home.
Lexi is an absolute joy to work with! Karen (agent) was able to show us the home at our convenience—even in this strange time of social distancing, and her professionalism shined as she advised us on the best course of action in securing a home. Tracey was speedy in responding to our questions, and processed our applications in a very timely manner.
Thank you all!

name: Kaitlin Sims
text: One of the worst property management companies out there. They promised me the house would be cleaned, power washed, and carpets cleaned when we moved in. After several requests and claims they would send someone they never did. And none of that was done. After moving out they took half of our deposit (I have never had any rental company take anything from my deposit before) and we left it cleaner then when we got it. The only redeeming factor with this company is the front desk people are nice.

name: Michelle Thompson
text: Horrible property management company. Our HOA is now on our third property manager from this company and once again failed to communicate anything to the homeowners. Their number one issue is lack of communication. Time and time again I have emailed and called to be treated as a nuisance rather than a concerned homeowner who is informing them of an issue. They come up with more excuses as to why they can not resolve issue than how they can be of service. Do not due business with this property management group.

name: mrs. C
text:
Overall, we had a better experience than other people in these reviews. We received our full deposit back plus a return of overpayment on the last month of rent. We were not charged or blamed for any damage caused by previous tenants, and there was a good bit.

In my opinion, a lot of the housing in
Enterprise is getting older and more run down. That's just the type of housing you are likely to find around here. At one point, someone came over to our home and asked what we paid a month. He was shocked because of the state of the house and said we were overpaying for its condition. We did have issues at the home a few times, but all work orders were addressed quickly, and the companies sent  out were kind, professional, and efficient.

As far as the staff at Prestige, some were great and some were meh. The longer we worked with them, the more friendly the office seemed overall. I do not know why.

Ultimately, what led us to move was 1) We had a nicer home lined up, for cheaper, elsewhere. 2) We wanted to be closer to work 3) When we were initially looking to move we called the office to inquire about a listing. The woman who answered the phone was very snappy and grumpily said "No", to sum it up. It made we wonder if she had known we were currently tenants, would she have been that rude? Did they not care if they thought we wouldn't/couldn't be a paying tenant?

Overall, no. I would not recommend this company or be likely to work with them again. That is based off my experience renting elsewhere in the past and knowing there are better companies.

I would also like to make a note that when moving out you have the option to let Prestige set up the move out clean themselves and oversee the quality of the cleaning. I feel doing this is better than putting in the work yourself only to be told to hire someone afterwards, etc. If you have them hire the cleaners and there is an issue with the cleanliness, the cleaners are responsible for fixing it at no cost to yourself. The cleaners on their list are aware of these rules, etc, to my knowledge. The total cleaning cost was $460 for us, which included the home and carpet. If you can afford that, I highly recommend it.

name: Renata Zappia
text:
We recently rented a house with Prestige Homes and so far, they have been very efficient.
The girls at the reception are very friendly and helpful, as well as the person responsible for the rent, Ms. Tracey, who is providing us a very good service.
Upon entering the property, we identified some improvements to be made and reported the problems to Ms. Tracey, which promptly sent the service companies to take care of the issues that were approved for repair by the landlord.
There are still cosmetics issues throughout the property, but besides that, so far, we have no complaints about Prestige Homes.

name: Victoria Garcia
text:
My family has been without a washer for four days. My wife is in the military and has her uniforms locked in there and there response is it’s not a priority!
We are on different orders than civilians! We are NOT allowed to go to a laundry mat!
They have literally left us here to fend for ourselves.
And BOTH women were EXTREMELY RUDE over the phone!
ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS

name: Ashley Summerlin
text: They love to rip off soldiers after they move out. They’ll charge you to repaint $1200 the whole inside of the townhome even if you leave it spotless. When you have photo evidence that you left it spotless and they have no proof otherwise. If you refuse to pay, they will be petty enough to contact your chain of command and send it to collections even after you move away from Fort Rucker. Absolutely unprofessional. Rent literally anywhere else. They prey on the military. You have been warned.

name: Lexi Danielson
text: Prestige Homes has been fantastic to me. They have a knowledgeable group of property managers who do not use real estate jargon to confuse their tenants and are always willing to take the time to respond to any emails regarding any concerns that you may have. Work orders are handled in a timely manner and it is done with ease through the tenant portal or by calling into the office.

name: Nat Hyde
text: Very professional organization that makes it easy to do business with them. Great option for those new to the area.

name: Debbie Johnson
text:
We were treated very unfairly.  Did not get any credit on our deposit and was charged over $500.00 to paint the inside because we tried to touch up where paint peeled from adhesive picture holders.  There were paint there we thought was used on the walls and it was a slight difference in the color.then they charged us for rent after we moved out. They wouldn't work at all with us. Gwen Gilley would not return my calls either
Very unprofessional !!!!
Think twice before you rent,/lease from them.

name: Tammi Wesley
text: Great ,Amber was so helpful.  I will be back .

name: Chantae McMillan
text: Not helpful in correcting payment issues that come out of another system that they make us set up for automatic HOA fees.

name: cassie martinez
text: This is all based off of my opinion: For new soldiers in the army and seasoned soldiers PCSing to the area. Please be careful with this company! They truly pray on the vulnerability of soldiers not knowing much information when it comes to renting. Read your lease! Do not just sign it, speak to military housing assistance in building 5700 on base before you sign your lease if you decide to go with this property management company. Take pictures and notate EVERYTHING wrong with the property even if it’s very minor if you decide to rent a house through them they will nickel and dime the hell out of your security deposit. When it’s time for you to PCS to your next duty station Do not I repeat DO NOT have them do a final walk through without you! If you have a work order to put in make sure you document it every-time you do. Be careful renting in courtyard place as well. Do not deal with Wendy or Irene from this company either, they are never reachable and they truly do not care about taking your money to fix repairs on the landlords house that the landlord is responsible for. Again this is all in my opinion!

name: Michael Rant
text: DO NOT rent from these crooks. They thrive off of charging exorbitant fees to military members who are there for the 12-18 months of flight school. Very poorly managed and generally rude when it comes to working with members of the military. They will rip you off be warned.

name: Taylor Windham
text:
Horrible service I would highly recommend choosing a different property management. You’re never going to see your $1500 security deposit again. No matter how good you leave your house even if you mark things that are wrong. We moved into a dirty house with nails and screws still in the walls from
the last renters I’m positive they were charged for it and it wasn’t even fixed for us when we moved in. They got their money and didn’t use it to better the home. Their business is a total scam.

name: tori burk
text: WORSE RENTAL EXPERIENCE EVER! You will never see your deposit even if it’s absolutely clean!

name: Jennifer Castillo
text: If i could give more stars i would. I absolutely love this group of people here and i highly recommend them.

name: Jessica W
text:
This company preys on the military population. If you're going to rent from them, DO NOT sign anything until you walk through the property IN PERSON with them. They tried to put us in a house that was filthy, had chipped lead paint, and a broken window. Prestige staff claimed to have done a walkthrough that morning, but didn't see the trash on the porch, broken window, broken window frames, peeling flooring in the bathroom, and chipped paint on all the doorframes? We did a home lead test and discovered the lead paint ourselves. We were allowed to then break the lease, at which time we required them to do a walkthrough with us. After acting horrified at what they saw, we saw the house listed for rent again the next day.

This is our second time in enterprise and I had not previously heard anything bad about this company. Apparently, quite a bit has changed in the 3 years we were gone. Look for a different company. This one will steal your money and not think twice about that.

name: Isaiah Carlton
text: Absolutely terrible. After reading through Alabama Tenant Law, I'm ending up having to take them to small claims court for their poor business practices. Despite the documentation and pictures that I have noting the condition of the townhouse when I moved in, they still want to charge me for "damages" without even providing any evidence that I caused any damages, which I did not. They pretty much are trying to charge me for a house renovation at my expense when the owner is legally in responsible for that sorts.  Unfortunately, they serve military members predominantly. So, they know how to nickel and dime service-members and take advantage of their expeditiousness when moving out. THEY WILL TAKE YOUR WHOLE DEPOSIT AND THEM SOME!

name: Angela Tucker
text: Great service Mary Tracy and Amber have been amazing!   We move into our new rental next week!!

name: Robert Gross
text:
I absolutely recommend Prestige for your property management solution. Due to PCS I recently needed a property management company. I was hesitant about Prestige from some of the reviews, but honestly the other companies didn't have any better reviews so I took chance.

I worked with Melody Mason to establish management of my townhouse. The staff was very friendly and she made the process as painless as possible. I also recently had trouble with a landlord unrelated to Prestige. I called Melody for her expert opinion. She not only gave advice, but agreed to meet me at the property for a consultation. She did not have to go out of her way, but did and helped out tremendously. What more could you ask for in taking care of customers.

From what i can tell the major complaints against Prestige property management were prior to Melody taking over as Senior Property Manager. I can't speak for the other companies in Enterprise, but I can absolutely endorse Prestige. This is not a plant review. If you're a Soldier looking for a property manager and want more details on my experience I'm on outlook global, feel free to contact me anytime.

R,
Robert Gross

name: William Fugok
text:
We recently rented a property through this agency and I can’t say enough positive things about the experience we had. The approval process was quick and painless, and their property selection was top-notch.

All that being said, their customer service was really what set Prestige above their competitors. Prestige was the last agency we visited and right off the bat, I knew we would be giving them our business. Where other agencies treated us as if it was a burden to assist us (or just looked at us like we were from another planet), Prestige immediately made themselves available in every way to help.

I don’t remember all the names of the agents who came to our assistance (it really was a group effort), the entire staff made it a pleasure to work with them. Bottom line this is the only property management company I would recommend. Period. Thanks Prestige.

name: Paul Nielsen
text: I have multiple issues with the property I rent from them which has taken over 8 months to have repaired and still no word. I ask EVERY MONTH if I can get them fixed and what I need to do to facilitate the repairs. Also, my lease ran out a month ago and my property manager Wendy is completely unreachable. I have left countless emails and called more times than I count and she is never available. I don’t know why it is so difficult for them to renew a lease. I’m literally trying to give them money and they CANNOT figure it out. These people are incompetent and if you ever give any info to the people at the front desk, don’t count on it going anywhere. Even the property manager says that the info up there gets lost in the abyss of garbage that these people tell their tenants. Wouldn’t recommend this group to anybody.

name: Cliff Crofford
text: We chose this agency over the horrible business that is Becky Hancock. Finding a house was a much better experience as they helped us find a place that matches our budget and needs. While we lived there, they were slow to process any house issues (we had  torn carpet our entire stay) even though we were assured it would be done shortly after move in. Move was simple as we chose to contract an approved company to clean the house and do the rugs. When we got the final adjustment, we got everything back except the agreed upon price for cleaning. I didn't rent from Becky, but I understand they love to keep the deposit. Do not bother with them, go with Prestige.

name: Yian Saephanh
text: Terrible company! The worst experience in all my years as a renter. Just like many people who has used this company, you’ll move into a dirty home with damages to the property. Even with days spent cleaning when you move out they will still find a reason to keep your deposit. Unless you use one of their cleaning company which cost up to $400-500. They will charge previous tenants for damages but do not use it for repairs, instead they will charge the next tenants for the damages. I unfortunately have to  deal with them twice due to my husbands PCS’s and deployment. Even with order documents and over 30 days vacating notice I provided, they still emailed me a bill for early lease termination plus rent for the next month 4 months later. It is disheartening and disgusting that this company can take advantage of people especially military families that’s given them most of their business in a small town like this.

name: Kelly Turman
text: Even after cleaning to military standards, paying for carpet shampooing and white glove tested.... they still deducted a cleaning fee. The apartment was dirty when I moved in... it was prestine when I turned in the keys. They never respond to emails or voicemails.  I even purchased my home from Coldwell banker/prestige and they wouldn't let me out of my lease 22 days early. Horrible company... stay away.

name: Pate Butler
text: Great company to rent from. They fixed every issue we had and never gave us the impression of being an inconvenience. Vicki was always accessible. They fixed our air conditioner immediately during the hot summer on the same day. Great experience from leasing to move out!

name: Scott Beaman
text: I am a property owner who has had my home listed with Prestige for a few weeks now.  I have had nothing but a pleasant experience with this company.  After a horrible experience with my previous property manager, Prestige has renewed my faith in property management companies! My property manager, Teresa, has done a fantastic job!  My home was only listed for a  little over a week before she had it rented.  It was listed/advertised within a day of contacting her and all necessary maintenance was promptly completed in order to lease the home.  I am most impressed by the personal attention Teresa has provided.  She always promptly returns phone calls and emails in response to any questions I may have.  Teresa is phenomenal to work with and I highly recommend listing your home with her if you are a property owner!

name: Justin Stewart
text: I have had 4 units in management with Prestige for about 5 years now. The current senior property manager (Vicki) is on point. She is a consummate professional and a hard worker. If she does not know the answer to something, she will find out and get back to me with the information.

name: Candace Carter
text: When we first looked at the house during a tour we noticed the fence in the back yard had been ran through by a vehicle. The Property management had no idea the fence was in such condition. Later we had learned from several different neighbors, the fence had been broken for about three months. The realtor assured us that someone who be out to fix the fence as soon as possible if we wanted the house. We decided we wanted the house and after moving in on Friday, by Monday we noticed other things wrong with the house. Monday we sent an email reminding them to fix the fence and notifying them of the other issues, which were how disgusting the tile floors were and how the house was infested with spiders. They had someone come out within a week to spray for the spiders which was supposed to be a quarterly service but that was the only time they ever came out. The other issue was the floors. They were covered in a greasy film that you didn’t notice until you walked on them barefooted or knelt down on your knees. As soon as you stood back up your knee would be black or as soon as you walked two steps on the floor the bottom of your feet would be black and sticky. In the response to the email I sent regarding the fence, spiders, and floor; I was told the floors were clean apon her very own inspection and they would not have anyone come clean the floors. So I had to clean the floors myself. We had only spent two days in the house prior to me sending the email. During our time with this property management we had other issues they never addressed and three different people in charge of that property in a six month period.  No one ever came to fix the fence the entire time we lived there. We told them well before 30 days we were moving. They gave me a list of everything they required to be clean before we moved. I was in contact with them about once a week in our last 30 days there, just to make sure we were doing everything right. I kept asking for someone to come out to inspect the property they kept telling me they were too busy and then it was time for us to go and no one was able to meet with us on our last day. It’s been 30 days since we’ve moved and we have been trying to reach them still about our deposit and every time we call the person in charge of that property is not in the office we always leave a message with our name and number and never receive a call back.

name: Elizabeth Marceaux
text: Teresa Lee and Gwen Gilley have both been great helping us manage our property from long distance. Teresa is punctual with phone calls, emails, and follow ups, and always puts the client first. Any time our property needs attention, Teresa has been very trustworthy. Teresa is also very attention-to-detail oriented. We trust her with our home!

name: Amber Markwell
text: This company goes above and beyond for their tenants. The Property Management Team is super nice and easy to work with.

name: Candace Carter
text: When we first looked at the house during a tour we noticed the fence in the back yard had been ran through by a vehicle. The Property management had no idea the fence was in such condition. Later we had learned from several different neighbors, the fence had been broken for about three months. The realtor assured us that someone who be out to fix the fence as soon as possible if we wanted the house. We decided we wanted the house and after moving in on Friday, by Monday we noticed other things wrong with the house. Monday we sent an email reminding them to fix the fence and notifying them of the other issues, which were how disgusting the tile floors were and how the house was infested with spiders. They had someone come out within a week to spray for the spiders which was supposed to be a quarterly service but that was the only time they ever came out. The other issue was the floors. They were covered in a greasy film that you didn’t notice until you walked on them barefooted or knelt down on your knees. As soon as you stood back up your knee would be black or as soon as you walked two steps on the floor the bottom of your feet would be black and sticky. In the response to the email I sent regarding the fence, spiders, and floor; I was told the floors were clean apon her very own inspection and they would not have anyone come clean the floors. So I had to clean the floors myself. We had only spent two days in the house prior to me sending the email. During our time with this property management we had other issues they never addressed and three different people in charge of that property in a six month period.  No one ever came to fix the fence the entire time we lived there. We told them well before 30 days we were moving. They gave me a list of everything they required to be clean before we moved. I was in contact with them about once a week in our last 30 days there, just to make sure we were doing everything right. I kept asking for someone to come out to inspect the property they kept telling me they were too busy and then it was time for us to go and no one was able to meet with us on our last day. It’s been 30 days since we’ve moved and we have been trying to reach them still about our deposit and every time we call the person in charge of that property is not in the office we always leave a message with our name and number and never receive a call back.

name: Catherine Doyle
text: I was a tenant with Prestige Property Management and we had a good experience renting from them. They were quick to respond to maintenance requests. They stay very busy so sometimes you have to be patient, but overall they were wonderful to work with.

name: Alexa Finley
text:
We rented through this agency, Theresa being our property manager and she was absolutely awful. She didn't come out and show us the property upon our arrival, we had to get the keys from her office and then drive to the property ourselves. It was not cleaned, painted, or repaired. I notated all of that in our move-in paperwork, and my husband requested someone come fix our washing machine and it never happened so he had to fix it himself. During our 2 years there, Theresa never checked on us, which we thought was very odd and worrisome for ANYONE that would choose to have Prestige manage their property. I emailed Theresa at one point about a rotting tree in the back yard and if we could remove it, she said she would email the owner, but then never got back to me and during the next storm this 15 ft tree fell over in the back yard. We had to spend the next weekend digging the roots out, hand sawing it to pieces and replanting grass. We also had an issue with our air conditioner not working, the company came to repair it but didn't properly fix it and Prestige tried to charge us for it, and two months later our unit flooded. Upon move out, Theresa had VERY poor communication, what took my other property managers a day to sign and handle, took her weeks if not longer. We were in another country and it was over a month later before she gave us back our security deposit. Not professional, not timely. Upon speaking with other people in the area that have rented through Prestige, having issues is a common thread. I was told by workers that came to fix our air conditioner that Prestige homes requested them to not speak about any issues with the unit with the tenants, which I thought was odd because if it was something we did, I'd like to know so it doesn't happen again. He said it was their way of controlling the tenants disputing costs. Then the move out cleaner informed me that she hasn't been getting paid by Prestige homes and they were weeks behind.
They aren't being recommended by the military community.

Edit: While we were in the process of moving out, Theresa  already had potential tenants checking out the apartment by themselves - prior to her viewing the condition of the property herself.

name: Ryan n
text: Any prospective owners or renters, move on and find any other organization to manage/rent a property. If I could give 0 stars I would. Stay away from this organization. My property was left unlocked with the door wide open to allow the numerous feral cats in the neighborhood a place to urinate. Constant turnover of property managers leaves an unattentive, slacking, and unprofessional staff. Don't anticipate getting your security deposit back either, regardless of the initial walkthrough. Instead expect extra charges to fix other's mistakes.

name: Justin Ewert
text:
We rented a house through Prestige for about 2 years in Enterprise, and were very happy with them! Any house is going to have its problems pop up, but prestige was always quick to get help out to fix the problem, and always followed up to make sure it was fixed. We had an air conditioner break, pool pump leaking, hot tub stop working, minor roof damage and some bedroom flooding due to a foundation crack. They got all the problems resolved quickly!

Very Friendly customer service,  and have even been helpful working out some issues post-move out (packages mailed to old addresses :/)

name: Zack
text: Worst property manager to rent from if military. Will lie about charges to security deposit as well as have maintenance workers lie so that charges are not covered. The inspections and move out process is not transparent and they take advantage of Soldiers having to PCS. Absolute scammers.

name: Jeffrey Braunhausen
text: Teresa Lee is the best property manager I've ever dealt with. She's expediant, professional, and on top of her game. If your looking for a home to rent, or you have a home you want to put on the rental market, use this gal. She has open lines of communication and has the renters and owners interests at hand. Everybody wins with her at the helm. I would also like to recommend "Rags to Riches" cleaning service when you vacate your property. No hidden fees and worry free.

name: Fernanda Gomez
text:
Military Families: My husband and I just got stationed in Fort Rucker for the first time and we got recommended Vicky Halt through another military family who used her. She was amazing and extremely helpful and always available. She worked with us for two days (my husband and I are very picky lol) and in the end we found the perfect home for us. Although we didn’t use Prestige because they just didn’t have anything available in the time frame we needed, she was able to show us properties from other companies. She would be a great resource for anyone trying to find a home! Highly recommended prestige mostly because of Vicky Halt.

Blessings and Good luck!

name: Fernanda Gomez
text:
Military Families: My husband and I just got stationed in Fort Rucker for the first time and we got recommended Vicky Halt through another military family who used her. She was amazing and extremely helpful and always available. She worked with us for two days (my husband and I are very picky lol) and in the end we found the perfect home for us. Although we didn’t use Prestige because they just didn’t have anything available in the time frame we needed, she was able to show us properties from other companies. She would be a great resource for anyone trying to find a home! Highly recommended prestige mostly because of Vicky Halt.

Blessings and Good luck!

name: Jim 2000
text:
This company manages a property for us while out of state.  So far they've changed their emails twice and changed who manages the property three times all without telling us.  We had to find out after no one would respond to our emails.  Our tenants have been on a month to month payment plan instead of resigning a lease.  They've also been a month behind on their rent for the last 5 plus months.  I found this out after my mortgage came out of my savings because I hadn't received payment.

The bottom line is you have to drag information out of these people.  They seem courteous on the phone until you have a problem.  Then you are an inconvenience.  For instance I was told I owed $500 after my tenant moved out.  I looked at the statement and could not possibly see this.  I called for an explanation and no one was there to assist me .  I was told someone would call me on Monday.  I expressed that they are leaving a heavy burden on my shoulders to think about about and the woman on the phone became very indifferent and hung up!

Back to the tenants.

Our tenants paid their rent and attempted to get caught up on their late rent.  Their check bounced so no money was deposited however this company collected a late fee anyway.  Guess who paid the late fee?  That's right I did.  After explaining to them over the phone and showing them that although their check bounced, the late fee was still charged to us along with the monthly fee we pay anyway.  It is simple math really lol.  It was only about $15, but still it's my $15.

Here I am attempting to reach them and yep, their email address has changed again.  I prefer to email as our conversations are essentially recorded.  Here's to another try.  Honestly not worth the 14% we pay.  Recommend you find a better realtor and management company who actually wants your business.

name: Justin Ewert
text:
We rented a house through Prestige for about 2 years in Enterprise, and were very happy with them! Any house is going to have its problems pop up, but prestige was always quick to get help out to fix the problem, and always followed up to make sure it was fixed. We had an air conditioner break, pool pump leaking, hot tub stop working, minor roof damage and some bedroom flooding due to a foundation crack. They got all the problems resolved quickly!

Very Friendly customer service,  and have even been helpful working out some issues post-move out (packages mailed to old addresses :/)

name: Timothy Locklear
text: Beware: worst property management company I have ever used! I do not even know where to begin to describe how horrible there service was. Everytime i called i was directed to a new person and told my last management associate no longer worked there. They were constantly late on paying me the rental dues. They will never reply to calls or emails, pretty sure they just delete them and say F*** them I'm not returning their call. I don't even know what they do because my property was in very rough condition when it was returned to me. This is my warning proceed at your own risk.

name: Jeffrey Braunhausen
text: Teresa Lee is the best property manager I've ever dealt with. She's expediant, professional, and on top of her game. If your looking for a home to rent, or you have a home you want to put on the rental market, use this gal. She has open lines of communication and has the renters and owners interests at hand. Everybody wins with her at the helm. I would also like to recommend "Rags to Riches" cleaning service when you vacate your property. No hidden fees and worry free.

name: peter andrews
text: I have been with Prestige since 2012.  They have managed my home well, and I have had several occasions where the had to deal with complications on my behalf.  The exercise good, expedient judgment, and deal with situations accordingly.  I have had my roof replaced from hail damage, floors replaced twice from water damage, illegitimate lawsuits from renters, and several other normal maintenance actions managed by Prestige flawlessly.  I recommend them for anyone who is looking and unsure or in doubt of their current property managers.

name: Nicole Jeffcoat
text:
Hands down the best of the best. Most perfessional, helpful and honest my husband and I have had the pleasure to deal with. Will always recommend them anytime!

Nicole Beck

name: Celeste Forslund
text: Would never recommend this company. Our entire deposit went towards a house that was already very run down, the carpet was extremely run down, I left the walls cleaner than when we arrived... And they charged us for the carpet, and walls for some reason. There is no way cleaning was almost $200 after the work my husband and I put into the place. My husband fixed SO MANY issues with the house! Never thought we would leave so empty handed. Have rented from SO many places before as we are military, and have NEVER had this happen.

name: Kim Satterfield
text: Prestige Properties manages my townhouse in Enterprise, AL, and I strongly recommend their services.  As a team, they are highly professional, energetic, and extremely competent.  Teresa Lee, with whom I have worked the most closely, is also incredibly dedicated, very hard working, and quite efficient.  She is a pleasure to work with.

name: Gerald Ganous
text: I would like to start off by saying PHPM staff members Victoria Halt and Wendy Healsip went beyond my expectations to help me in a situation that was out of their control. On several occasions I was contacted after business hours and on the weekends in regards to helping me relocate. My hats off to these two ladies and I look forward to doing business in the future with them. If you're looking to relocate and don't wanna be pressured in your decision let these ladies assist you. FIVE STARS to Vicki and Wendy!!

name: Tracy Robbins
text: We rented a townhome for just over 1 month.  There were a few things that went wrong with the property while we were there and they responded well.  Make sure you take pictures of EVERYTHING as soon as you move in (any small stains in the fridge or oven, even if they seem like normal acceptable signs of wear) and make sure they correct ANY cleaning defects that you find (take a look beneath the sofa cushions, on top of fans if you dare) and be aware if you clean yourself out (even to a higher standard than when you moved in) they will charge you a cleaning fee.  The move out cleaning fee from their approved cleaners was $275.  Also, be aware, we kept our thermostat at 78 degrees in September and were very conservative with our energy usage but we still had an overage on utilities of more than $50.  As long as you are prepared for the extra expenses and protect yourself by taking adequate pictures of the defects and document everything as soon as you get there, it was an acceptable experience.

name: Courtney Westrick
text: Karren Lewis is an amazing realtor. Incredibly helpful and insightful. We couldn't be happier with our new home. Highly recommend!

name: Ashley Mittelbach
text: If we could give zero stars we would. Never got responses on repairs except for a couple times. We had to break our lease and bought a home as we were being ripped off on the rent and the inability to get our power bill below 390 dollars after we had to add a window unit. We paid for cleaning services out of pocket and they forfeited the lease trying to blame us for the damage done from a storm! They are AWFUL

name: kelly carson
text: Will definitely rent from this company again if stationed here!!!  They were so helpful and professional.  the few misc. things that were wrong at the property during my stay, they immediately took care of.  When I left, they had my deposit back to me within two weeks.  Awesome crew!!

name: Erick's Son
text: Don't rent with these people, plain and simple.  They don't upkeep their housing very well at all.  You're better off looking elsewhere

name: Sarah Schwanke
text: If I could give 0 stars I would. GARBAGE company. Like others have said, they do NOT do any repairs. We have been dealing with MOLD in the house since we moved in and we have a child. Its NONSTOP with this company. Do yourself a favor and stay away from them.

name: Mike Akins
text:
Was told confidentiality by an employee that this company makes a practice of ignoring maintenance requests from tenants that they consider annoying.

Absolutely awful property management company.

They routinely blow off maintenance requests resulting in unnecessary expense to homeowners and risk to residents.

Have called 6 times now to have repairs done at our house and found out that Wendy (one of the property managers) has been deleting our work orders.

Highly recommend you find a different company to manage your property and/or rent from.

name: Jana Rose
text:
While I cannot speak for the rest of the realtors, our experience with Wendy could not have been worse.  We were stationed at fort Rucker last minute and needed a place to stay.  We paid the deposit and we were assured that the townhome we wanted was move in ready.  Upon arrival, we saw that the walls were filthy, the carpets were stained with animal urine and feces, and there was mildew on the toilets.  We immediately contacted fort Rucker’s housing department.  Once they contacted Wendy, we received one last phone call from her berating us for calling the housing department, and then we were transferred to another agent.  After a walk through, our new agent and an employee from the housing department agreed that the townhome was not fit for tenants and we were refunded our deposit and released from our contract.  Thankfully, Jackson Crossing had units available, and we were able to find suitable housing through them.

If you do decide to contract through this entity, please do a thorough walk through before signing anything.  It was readily apparent that Wendy had little interest in addressing our complaints, and it was clear that she failed to do her due diligence in ensuring that the properties under her management were kept up to livable standards.

name: Jasmine Roberts
text: I would not recommend renting from Prestige. When we moved in the rental property the home was not clean at all. We had to do our own cleaning and then they charged us 300 for a cleaning fee after we moved out.( We cleaned the house thoroughly) They have bad customer service all the way up to the owner. They do everything in their power to keep your full deposit. There is no need to try to call and complain because all they do is defend each others actions even when their staff is unprofessional. They are rude and money hungry. They also overcharge for the simplest things. DO NOT RENT FROM PRESTIGE! Melanie Mason was my property manager and i was more than displeased with her performance. Repeated calls and voicemails unanswered.

name: Body alignment class
text:
From positive moments: the place was ideally clean, maintenance is quick and good.
From negative: they charged us around $80 for loose toilet seats at the end! When cheap toilet seats are used for 2.5 years they get loose! I disagree that we have to pay for that.
It also looked like we were more concerned about renewing our expiring rent contract than our manager. We had to call her again and again to ask about it.
In addition to that, it seems like if you clean yourself or hire someone not from they list, they will charge you for cleaning anyways.

name: Jessica Batson
text: They managed some commercial properties and storage units for my grandfather for years.  When he stopped checking on it and I took over to help him the accounts were a mess.  They were collecting management money each month but not checking on properties after people moved out and did not know who was renting which units.  There paperwork showed someone owed 2 years of rent but he had actually left the unit 2 years ago and they just left it on the books.   I spent weeks with phone calls and emails and every question I asked seemed to stump them, “did he get a deposit back” , “did someone check the property for clean up and damage”  , “why are we paying a power bill to a building with no power?”   I have never worked with such incompetence.  They did end up refunding 4 months of management fees because I started questioning what we were paying them for.

name: S Miller
text: We had a great experience with Prestige while stationed at Ft Rucker. Work orders were addressed quickly, staff was helpful when we called, and home was great.

name: James Watkins
text: As a multiple property holder with Prestige Homes Management for many years I am so Happy with the service Teresa and the team maintain  on a consistent basis! Property Management Rocks!

name: Hector
text:
Let me begin saying this, Do not rent from this company due to  extreme Poor customer service. When I came to Enterprise and saw the house it needed basic things before moving in. Things like cleabing of the whole house, the carpet was nasty, the backyard was full of dead leafs, a huge whole by the main door of the house big enough for a cat, etc. We talked about those things that needed fixing and when I moved in late December of 2017 everything was the same. Nothing changed, I had to stay in a hotel for 2 days while they “clean” the house and make it somewhat “moveable”.

We spoke to some supervisor and she said the house was not “prestine” and how it was someone else’s fault within the company that the house was like that.  I told her that that’s not my problem, I’m not asking for favors. I paid my money and that they were quick to get it. After 3-4 months things were getting fixed little by little and my wife and I have been cleaning the house little by little as well.

If you want extreme poor customer service, rude attitude from the employees then conduct business with this company. I’d suggest to continue looking for other companies.

name: Justus Breeden
text: We moved into our home in Aug. It was so filthy that our 5 person family all got sick with bacterial infections. We were told it had been cleaned prior to move in. After 2 phone calls, several e-mails and my husband finally having to go to the office and provide pictures of the black grout, food still stuck in the microwave and on the ceiling, filthy tubs, toilets and walls, burnt out lightbulbs, broken sinks and windows so filthy you could write a name in the coating of grease and dirt. These things are just a few of the issues. They sent a cleaning lady who told us with annoyance  "The windows are not my responsibility, the food caked on the ceiling isn't what we do." There was dried milk on the wood area of the bar and we were told "thats not milk and will never come off." I used to own a cleaning business and I knew better. of course, it wiped off with a wet paper towel.They stayed on the phone for 20 minutes, while taking breaks to tell me what great friends she is with Wendy.  This was an attempt to shut me up. She poured large amounts of water and solution onto the floor and smeared it around. I had to clean it myself to avoid damage. The microwave, refrigerator, and one bathroom REMAIN broken, a panel from the fence is still missing, the painting the handyman did prior to our moving in is still not fixed. Our AC unit has been dumping gallons of water every few minutes. I have called 4 times for the AC unit only to be ignored. We have provided pictures of everything in our home that was broken and been ignored. We've spoken to the highest person we can find at Prestige Homes and still everything remains broken and now our AC unit threatens to ruin the natural hardwood floors and we've been blown off 4 times. To the point that a work order was issued last week for the AC upon my first call only to be told this morning that our work order had been deleted. Maybe the staff has a personal vendetta because we, as tenants, have tried to force them to do their jobs. Unfortunately, they remain negligent. We own rental properties ourselves and I can say that after years of experience this is not how a property management company operates. If you are looking at a house offered by this company please turn and run as fast as you can. They are negligent to the point of being almost unlawful. They are dishonest and will lie right to your face. We were told "6 of the walls have fresh paint" only to be given the run around about that blatant lie upon moving in. 5 bedroom homes aren't easy to find here. We wanted a nice home in a safe neighborhood for our family so that we could begin to build a life here in this town that we love. We pay our rent on time and take care of our home, even months after moving in I am still scrubbing the filth from the previous tenants that they told us they took care of. Nothing you can do as a tenant will get through to these people. They make a living by collecting their proceeds from the rent and then turning their back on their responsibilities as a property management company. If you're a tenant with the same problems we've experienced then I urge you to tell others about this lying, manipulative company. Wendy was our agent and the one who told all the lies, however the office manager has also lied to our faces and failed to make sure her maintenance staff takes care of broken appliances, AC Units, and broken fences that pose a safety risk for my young child. I urge you to contact the homeowner of your property, email and phone numbers are a matter of public record and are easily accessible. Please tell your homeowner about this awful company. I know my homeowners believe that they are getting what they pay for, but in reality Prestige Homes is committing theft and fraud by taking the homeowners money and not holding up to their end of the contract agreed upon by the homeowner and the management company. I urge you to tell everyone you see looking at homes offered by this awful fraudulent company to run the other way. Go to Remax or anyone else who has some morals and AVOID WENDY!!!

name: Brendan McGuinn
text:
Had a great experience with PHPM. Work orders were always done in a timely fashion. Rent was a fair price for the property we were at. We received our deposit back in a timely fashion. Our landlord Melody Mason was always courteous and professional. Would definitely rent from PHPM again or recommend to friends.

With this said you need to keep in mind that you are renting someone else's property. We treated the property like it was our own place and made sure to give it the highest level of care possible. Do your part and don't be bad renters. Do this and you won't have any problems.

name: Dan Knight
text: MILITARY BEWARE!! I was at Ft. Rucker for Flight School and this company did everything they could to prevent me from breaking the lease early upon graduation.  It has been 7 months and they still will not return my calls regarding getting my deposit back.  They lied to me countless times, with no apology when caught up.  Lorie tried to force me to continue paying rent even after my PCS orders moved me across the country until I had to explain the Soldier and Sailor Relief act and continually made comments negatively toward the military in Enterprise.  All Military avoid this company as much as you can!  They have screwed over your fellow military members, don't be another!

name: Jennifer Goza
text:
I am currently renting from this management company and if I could give them lower than a one star I would. The property that I rent has recently been put on the market to sell. As any "human" would do, I decided to be nosy and see what the house was listed for. As I was on the MLS site I decided to "glance" at the pictures! I was absolutely amazed at what I saw! The property was once a very vibrant and beautiful home.

After much thought I decided that I needed to call the listing agent to invite her over to my home to look at it and see it and retake pictures of what it actually looks like! (Being a rental property for so long it has had "the hell" beat out of it). She was SUPER sweet and advised me to contact Vickie...the "Property Management Manager" and let her know everything that we discussed and that she needed to be the one to stop by and look at the home BECAUSE after all, the owner, who is in the military overseas, trusts them with HIS HOME. She also told me that she was actually aware of the condition of the property prior to me moving into it.

Vickie was not in the office, so I decided to email her. I explained everything and was super nice about it all. I also told her that my relationship with her company from the beginning started off as a war but had gotten better and as of lately all the maintenance requests that I had submitted had been handled in a very timely manner!

I was absolutely APPALLED at the response from her. She refused to come by and basically ATTACKED ME saying that any cosmetic damage to the home is clearly at the owners decision to fix. Which is totally understandable, however I think the OWNER needs to know what it looks like. Once he actually knows then he can decide from there what to do...I mean things like the ceilings falling off..light fixtures falling out of the ceiling..you know "COSMETIC" things.

I moved into this home in April because it had a pool..the pool was in terrible condition when we moved in and did not get fixed for three months..

I had actually begun looking for a new home to move to (because I felt like if there was a "contract to sell" the property...it was the best thing I could do at the end of my lease)...BUT I had looked at several properties to view that Prestige Homes had listed and I will never rent from them again.

Please please...if you are serving in our US military..DO NOT EVER rent or buy from these people "sight unseen". I realize that in many cases that is considered normal but the lack of care and concern is very sad and I would hate to know that anyone would ever have to deal with what I have had to deal with!

name: Lara Leigh
text: I’ve had mixed experiences with rental companies in the past, but my experience with Prestige was a positive one. If you have any problems, ask to speak to Vicki Halt. She is excellent and will do everything she can to help you out

name: Rick Astley
text: they took my security deposit. it was cleaner than the inside of a lysol can. robbery if you ask me.

name: Ashley Frizzell
text: This has to be the WORST COMPANY in Enterprise,AL today. Almost 3 months ago my husband and I filled out an application they took our money and I never heard back from them. I continue to call to get something from them and still nothing at this point I want my money back for my credit check that they never ran. If I could give them a minus star I totally would. Worst place EVER!!!

name: Megan Gatzke
text: I wrote about my bad experience on here. THEN I got a phone call from the manager -harassing, arguing, and not apologizing for my bad experience. She didn't even try to make it right.  RUN.FOR.THE.HILLS. I better not get a call again for this.....

name: Ray Ross
text: GWEN, is great, the rest is bad know before you move in, white glove clean, and still was charged

name: Ian Amsler
text: As a property owner it was impossible to get a call back from the property manager. Told I'd get a call back Monday. No call. Call them and leave a message. No returned call.

name: Dennis Shoener
text: Avoid if you can

name: Rayshawn Currie
text: WORST PROPERTY MANAGEMENT IN ENTERPRISE ALABAMA!

name: Walter Exantus
text: Don't expect a call back but they nice

name: DD
text: Helpful and friendly

name: connie moya
text: This is the company helping people who were affected by the tornado in Fultondale. Not just any company would do this free of charge. If you have excavation needs, consider this company. They have a good heart ❤️

name: Anthony Meeks
text: Nice people. A little slow to respond to questions. Had to call them three times to get an answer.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention we’re sorry to hear that your experience was not up to standards. Would you mind calling our office to discuss more about your experience? Thank you.

name: Jamie Mathewson
text: Bre and Ronette were amazing!! took 3 weeks to approve the fence but the responses on emails were friendly and very professional

name: renee Kelly
text: Ms. Ronette was very professional, courteous and prompt.  She ensured my ARC request was staffed and walked me through the portal with ease.  She's the best and very user friendly.

resp.text: Renee, what a kind thing to say! Ronette really is a rock star! We are glad you were well taken care of.

name: ASHLEE ADKINS
text:
For the first time since moving into our new home in March of 2018, we received a violation notice. Oops! So, I made a call to find out more details on what was wrong with said violation. My call was answered on our first try.

After explaining what was in the picture, I’m happy to say Ronette was very quick (in less than 48 hours) in helping get us “legal” again.

Thanks again for all the help!!

resp.text: Ashlee, we are so glad to hear that we were able to assist and help you get back in compliance quickly and easily. Thank you for the great review!

name: Billy Brizendine`
text: Ms Ronette was very responsive, quick, and friendly! She helped me through the entire process and answered all my questions with ease. Thanks!

resp.text: Billy, we appreciate your feedback! We will pass along the praise to Ronette!

name: Rachael Glass
text: As an experienced retired property manager and having served on HOA boards I give Elite A lot of credit for what they do in my community I now live in.  Management is a juggling act because you have so many things to try and satisfy.   They are pleasant to talk to and are always open to resolving things when it is brought to their attention.

resp.text: Rachael, we so appreciate your kind remarks! You are right in that this industry can be very difficult, but we love what we do and the wonderful people we get to work for/with so it makes it all worth while!

name: Lara Gilbert
text: Ronette Harwell was amazing to work with! She was extremely helpful in guiding us through the ARC application process. She was quick to respond and had such a sweet demeanor. She truly made it easy to ask questions.

resp.text: Lara, thank you for letting us know of the great job Ronette is doing! We will pass on the praise!

name: Howard Fry
text: I had to obtain approval from my HOA to have work done on the exterior of my home.  Elite is our HOA property manager.  I was able to download the appropriate pdf from Elite's website and enter the data directly on the form.  I appreciate being able to enter the data directly.  I had to submit other files regarding the dimensions and colors.  Elite received my application and files then forwarded them to our HOA ARC that performs the review.  The ARC reviews the plans then sends their recommendation to the HOA Board who then notifies Elite.  That requires emails, downloads, review, communications, and postings.  I submitted my request on August 28 and was approved on September 3 and that is less than one week.  That turnaround time is what I call responsive.  The instructions were clear and the forms user friendly; that is a relecton of their professionalism.

resp.text: Howard, we greatly appreciate your feedback! You are so right, this IS a very involved process and we are happy to hear that you had a great experience!

name: melanie aldridge
text: Great to work with...issues are addressed quickly and professionally.  Communications are always pleasant.

resp.text: Melanie, Thank you for your 5 Star Review! Happy New Year to you and yours.

name: Mark Hopper
text: My subdivision is managed by Elite Housing Management. We have had a shuffle of management companies over the last 8 years. It was not until ELITE came aboard 2 years ago, that the property began to take a positive turn. The grounds improved. The amenities- pool, lakes, grounds, all improved.  ELITE  HOUSING'S visibility inside the subdivision improved,too. ELITE initiated an overnight patrol to assist in community presence proving to be a deterrent to vehicle break ins. My wife and I have been pleased with the service of ELITE HOUSING MANAGEMENT!

resp.text: We are incredibly grateful that you took the time out to leave us this note. Our company values put customer satisfaction as top priority and we are committed to our customers. Its customers like you that make our job wonderful. We look forward to serving you again.

name: Tina Littleson
text:
Ronette was Wonderful!
Very responsive and informative.
Great personality and fun to work with.

Thank you Ronette!

resp.text: Tina, your review is so appreciated! We will pass along the praise to Ronette!

name: Katy
text: These are some of the nicest and most patient people I have ever had the pleasure of interacting with. No matter how many questions you have you can rely on them to answer you or send you in the right direction. Michelle, Linsey, and Rhonette (I'm so sorry for the spelling as we've only talked on the phone) thank you so much for being there and doing such great jobs.

resp.text: Katy, wow! Thank you very much for your kind words. We have a wonderful team here and are so glad to hear that they are taking care of our homeowners! We will pass along the praise.

name: dylan dwyer
text: We are moving into our home and needed to get a fence installed. We had to get approval through our HOA first. Ronette helped me through the whole process. She was lightning fast in her responses and was very helpful! Thankful for making this an easy process!

resp.text: Dylan, we are so pleased to hear that Ronette was able to assist you with getting your fence installed easily and quickly! Welcome to your new neighborhood!

name: Sruthi Krishnan
text: Ally, at the Elite Housing Management was Awesome!!! :) She was helpful and very quick in providing answers to my questions.

resp.text: Sruthi, thank you for letting us know of the great work Ally is doing! Don't hesitate to contact us for any questions you have in the future.

name: Emmett Moore
text: The staff is very pleasant, friendly and professional.  Almost all of them are very organized, responsive and take care of issues expediently.

resp.text: Emmett, thank you for the kind review. We love working with you and your community and will continue to serve at the best of our ability!

name: War Eagle20
text:
Think twice before allowing this company to manage your HOA property.
They have illegally OVER STEPPED THEIR BOUNDARIES countless times in my neighborhood with threats of inflicting unwarranted fines and even threats of coming to your property IN WHICH YOU OWN and dismantling or tearing down things such as flags, political banners, etc that DO NOT GO AGAINST OUR HOA COVENANT or BYLAWS.
This company is a walking lawsuit waiting to happen!
I didn’t want to give this company even one star. Unfortunately, I had to in order to post my review.

resp.text: Hello War Eagle20. Please understand that we were hired by the Board of Directors of your HOA to uphold the covenant and bylaws of your HOA. We have not overstepped these boundaries within your community. We would never threaten anyone in the communities we manage. Our job is to ensure that the HOA covenant and bylaws are being upheld by members of the community and to provide a variety of services to maintain your and your neighbors’ property value and safety. Hopefully you will come to see this after you review your HOA’s covenant and bylaws again. If you would like us to review these with you or show you the portion that refers to political signs and displays in your yard we would be happy to assist.

name: Undrea Randolph II
text: I don't typically leave reviews for anything but Ally was AMAZING. First time homeowner and very new to HOA stuff and she was able to not only answer all my questions but follow up where needed. Greatly appreciated and an excelled asset. Glad to know she will be there when i call!

resp.text: Undrea, thank you for sharing about your great experience with Ally! We will pass along the praise!

name: Allison Hunt
text: The Staff truly cares about the homeowners, and making the community and the value of your home grow! It is a company that cares, and they show that through their hard-work. It is a small company that manages a rather large number of communities in the up and coming Huntsville/Madison area. AWESOME COMPANY!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us such a nice review!

name: Willie Brazile
text: I think this company has been basically useless in my community.  We have yet to meet anyone associated with this company nor have seen any proof our dues are going towards anything substantial in our neighborhood.  We don't have any speed bumps to detract speeding, the community spaces outside our lots are not cut frequently, and we do not even have a clubhouse.  With well over 100 homes in the community, there should be funds available to have a nice area for the community.  Also on multiple occasions,  there has been no public declaration on dogs policy.  There are people who willingly have their dogs with no leash in the street and other yards and the HOA has done nothing about it.

resp.text: Willie, we understand your concerns however it is important to note that Elite Housing Management is not the HOA for your community: we are the management agency your HOA has elected to handle the day to day tasks necessary to keep your community in proper running order. The ultimate decisions on what can/will be done with your community rests with your Declarant/Board of Directors.

name: Kim
text: Thanks Tami w/ Elite Housing for trusting our company Stephens Electric co.,Inc to do work  on your properties it is such a joy to work with Tami and Elite Housing on many project she is very professional and always on top of the work they are needing done Wonderful company !!!

resp.text: Kim, we really appreciate your kind words! Tami is wonderful and we will pass along the praise! Thank you for your hard work!

name: Donna Saunders
text: Elite Housing Management replaced a previous company and walked into a difficult situation.  Our fountain barely worked, the pool construction had been delayed several times and a host of other neighborhood complaints.  Elite stepped up to the plate.  The fountain has been running.  The pool had a "Grand Opening" with food trucks.  The food trucks were invited into the neighborhood especially when we under severe lockdown from the pandemic.  I have to give a special shout out to Ronette Harwell for being patient with us and our Architectural Applications.  Her response to our questions was immediate and she asked the right questions to get our applications approved quickly.  Elite Team keep up the good work especially as the neighborhood continues to grow and change.

resp.text: Donna, thank you so much for the rave review! We love working with your community. We will share your praises to Ronette!

name: Battlefield Alpacas
text: I’m not sure they have even read our new community’s covenants.   We pay $75 a month, zero amenities.   Every other home has a violation.

resp.text: We would like to learn more about the issues you are experiencing within your community, and see how we can be of assistance. Please give us a call at 256-808-8719 to discuss your concerns with a valued member of our staff.

name: Greg Hurley
text: Ronette Harwell was a joy to talk to. She's super responsive and always willing to help. I think she deserves a raise.

resp.text: Greg, we appreciate you taking the time to go out of your way to let us know about the great job Ronette is doing! We will all give her a pat on the back!

name: Buzz Killington
text: We will always get letters to pay your dues but when we call about any issues it's a pain to get through. When we finally get through to complain about a dog that is always off it's leash, the said call animal control.  We don't have speed bumps or a rec center. What am i paying for?

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, as it helps us get better. As an HOA Management firm, our responsibility is to help keep your community safe and to optimize and maintain the value of your property. Unfortunately, there are some things that are out of our hands and best left up to the professionals who deal with specialized things, such as a loose dog.

name: Don Shield
text: Management is very responsive and their professionalism is outstanding. Elite’s system tool is easy to navigate and track the total life cycle of our HOA.

resp.text: Don, thank you so much for the compliment! We love working with your community!

name: Annette Akers
text: My recent experience with Elite Housing Management was with Ronette Harwell in particular. I submitted an application to build a fence. As I'm not an experienced homeowner, I was unsure of how to layout the fence on my plot plan. Ronette was wonderful and explained how to read a plot plan very patiently and helped me understand. She responded to any question almost instantly and I had my approval within a day. Wonderful experience! Thank you.

resp.text: Annette, we're glad to be of assistance! We will absolutely pass along the praise to Ronette!

name: Will Mahle
text:
They seem to take credit for good reviews here, then when there is a bad review, they blame the HOA Board of Directors.
They fined me daily for a moving pod that was in my driveway even after I explained to them that I had lost the contractor working on the house I had purchased due to Covid.
It is all about the Benjamins with Elite Housing.

resp.text: Will, as an HOA management agency working on behalf of the HOA, we do as the board of each community directs us to do. We are hired to enforce the covenants and rules of the community, while remaining strictly objective. Please give us a call so we can discuss this issue and work towards reaching a resolution.

name: Donna Boyett
text: I had an issue that they addressed very quickly and efficiently. They were very professional. Much appreciated.

resp.text: Donna, thank you for your feedback! We are here to help!

name: jamie prince
text: Elite has made an incredible difference in our community and I could not be happier. I was skeptical when they first came in to the community due to some of the reviews I saw but in less than a years time they have taken all of that skepticism and worry away. The Elite staff lives up to their name with their swift responses and resolutions to any and all issues we have had!

resp.text: Jamie, thank you for your review! We are glad to know that we have gained your trust and that you are happy with our company!

name: Lizabeth Payer
text: I would give Elite 10 stars if I could. They literally saved our Association from a previous crooked and corrupt property management company. Thank God for Chad, Crystal, Tammy and Ally - the office staff I have the most interaction with. Especially Chad and Crystal - our Hero's for sure. Always there to help, quick to respond, and they calmed all of our fears regarding maintenance issues, property struggles, and getting things back on track which was not easy. I don't know what the other haters are talking about - without a doubt they are the best in their field. Our Association is very grateful to Elite - a huge thank you for all your hard work.

resp.text: Lizabeth, thank you so much for your raving review and for trusting Elite Housing Management to care for your Association! We love working with your community!

name: Josh Cook
text: Elite is a Joke!!!! seriously the worst excuse for a HOA myself and a lot of others have ever seen before in our neighborhood. They literally take all of this money from the neighborhood to cut a little patch of grass. I could understand if we had a playground or pool in the neighborhood but we don't. We just got our yearly budget report which just shows they don't do anything. If you are looking to buy a house DO NOT buy a house that has Elite Housing Management for the HOA they are complete Trash.

resp.text: Josh, we hate to hear that you are displeased with how Elite is caring for your community. However, we feel it is important to note that Elite is not your HOA... we are the management agency appointed by your Home Owners Association Board of Directors for your community. We do not make the calls for what happens in your community.

name: Aline Kuntze
text: I had a great experience with the agent which helped me in my neighborhood, Ronette Harwell. She was pretty considerate and quick to help!

resp.text: Aline, thank you for sharing your great experience with Ronette and Elite Housing Management!

name: Robert Lamb
text: Horrible staff. "Elite" is nothing but a scam. They take tens of thousands of dollars from each community every year with nothing in return. The grass around the lake in our neighborhood stays overgrown. People constantly park on the street while also having cars parked in yards and on the side walk. No playground for the kids to stay off the street. They never run a street sweeper to clean up all of the trash that people create in the neighborhood. We have only had ONE meeting in the four years we have lived in Bermuda Lakes.  I can't believe this company is allowed to steal peoples money the way they do!

name: Ana McCormick
text: Every time I call, Ally is always there to help with my day to day questions. Ronette has been phenonmenal! We have only had to make request twice now but both times, she has always responded quickly if I needed to add or make changes to our forms. (even my cartoon drawling lol).  I have been pleasantly surprised and happy with this HOA management company!

resp.text: Ana, thank you so much for your review! We love patting our teammates on the back for a job well done!

name: Joanne Hunt
text: Not impressed at all!!!!  This company sent me a warning letter based on a drive by weeks prior...my trust level in this company is extremely low at this point.  The employee I spoke with did not seem confident in her responses...she was making it up as she was going along.  When I responded logically, she seemed intimidated.  I am seriously considering selling my house to rid my self of Elite Housing!!!  By the way, I rate Elite Housing 0 stars!!!

resp.text: Joanne, we hate to hear that you are not happy with our company. We do our best to help the communities we represent by enforcing the covenants that each HOA has set in place. Our management team would like to speak with you to discuss your grievances; please give us a call at your earliest convince. Thank you.

name: Trey Dyer
text:
The Bridges on The River HOA

I feel it necessary to share my very positive thoughts and interactions with Elite Housing Management Company, and most importantly the Staff!  Amazing folks at EHM, from Chad, Tami, Crystal, Ronette, Ally and anybody else that works at EHM that I haven’t had the pleasure to meet.

After reading most all of the reviews, believe me as a current HOA board member, this company is top notch!  Many of the negative reviews have nothing really to do with EHM.  They only enforce the covenants that we as a community have in place.  As another HOA board member noted, the board members and homeowners are the responsible party’s.  Our last Management company was impossible to reach by phone!  Absolutely not the case with Elite, as I have yet to receive a voicemail box during work hours.

There app is very helpful.  I have not encountered another company using one.  I am sure some do but I am just saying it is a plus.  Email responses are super fast.

For the reviewer that complained of Elite not keeping streets cleaned/street swept!!!  Really??  Just Really??  Address that with your HOA board members and have them allocate funds to have it done.  Elite will then ensure it is handled, I can assure you of the latter.  I can’t speak for your board members however.  End rant.

Keep up the GREAT work EHM!!!!

resp.text: Trey, thank you so much for the raving review! We really appreciate you taking the time to share what you love about our company and to address our wonderful staff. We love working with your community and look forward to the future!

name: David Hood
text:
Cost: 4/5
Effectiveness: 1/5
Communication: 2/5

To preface this review, I live in the Burwell Gardens subdivision.

Our covenant very specifically states (Section 4, Page 9) you may not park your cars on the street regularly. It is immediately evident that this is not adhered to. Pick any time of the day to drive down the neighborhood street, and you are forced to zig-zag through a labyrinth of cars.

The HOA did send out a notation about 6 months ago advising the neighborhood there would be fines for cars regularly parking on the street. Traffic cleared up for ~1 week, then promptly resumed with the parking habits. It is clear that the fines are either not happening, or are being ignored completely without any consequence.

I'm not sure why this HOA is permitted to continue doing business in our neighborhood.

Pictures can be made available upon request... but as you cannot swing a dead cat without hitting someone's car on the street in our neighborhood, this is unnecessary.

name: Victoria Lowes
text:
BEWARE. As other reviewers have mentioned, these are lovely properties managed by a very problematic owner. When my husband and I moved out we cleaned and mopped every inch, left no damages whatsoever, then asked the landlord (Ms. Nikki Evans) about scheduling a walkthrough so we could get our deposit back and identify any concerns on her end that we might have missed. She texted us back saying that there was no need for a walkthrough because she’d been to the unit since we’d left, that “we left it very clean,” and that returning the deposit wouldn’t be an issue. Great, we thought.

Fast forward two months later and still no deposit (to be fair she was still within the 60-day window noted in the lease) – and only after repeated calls and texts did we get her to respond (a regular problem noted by other online reviews). She finally sent back the deposit weeks after she said she would, and it was two-hundred dollars short. We were shocked. When we asked for an explanation, Ms. Evans said the place was “filthy” and that she had to add a cleaning charge. Since we had screenshots of her texts (which I’d post here if it wasn’t prohibited) extolling how clean the place was, and of us asking for a walkthrough to avoid this very situation, we thought she must have been confusing us for some other tenants. When we brought this up she just stonewalled, then talked about how busy she is running the business all by herself, then plain started insulting us. That’s when we started feeling like we’d been swindled.

We feel like fools. We literally have photographic evidence of Nikki Evans telling us how clean we left the place and insisting there was no need for a walkthrough, then two months after the fact she skims two-hundred dollars from our deposit and when confronted stonewalls and insults us. I realize it was completely our fault for not demanding a walkthrough and recording every minute of it. Long story short – if you’re a current tenant, definitely insist on a recorded walkthrough or you will have no leverage if/when she pulls the same move. And if thinking about renting here, I urge you to take similar precautions when you move in and out. In our experience, when confronted with the truth she was quick to attack and seemed incapable of holding herself accountable for anything.

Tuscaloosa/Northport are small towns (thankfully) and my husband and I both feel pretty low after the whole experience. I’ve tried to make this review as balanced as possible. I understand this is someone’s business/livelihood and wouldn’t post it lightly.

resp.text: Victoria, were you informed that the stove and baseboards were dirty? If so, did you go back and clean them?

text: We stayed at the Beachview 200 with Lucky Bird Vacations and it was nothing like we expected or even like the pictures. We were very disappointed when walking into our condo.
