resp.text:
Hi Ashley

We hate to hear your experience staying at Beachview 200 was not what was expected.  If we would have been contacted upon arrival, we would have been happy to contact the outsourced cleaning company to come back and correct any issues upon arrival. Also, we were not aware the broom and mop were missing. We appreciate the heads up and will be sure to have replaced promptly. Again, we apologize for any issues you had during your stay. We would have loved the opportunity to correct all issues while you were here to ensure your vacation was a success.

name: Charles Beale
text: Beach view is a great location everything is all around you here within walking distance of condos beach is right across the road

name: Kimberly Alsbrooks
text:
We stayed at the East Point Cottages, Fantasea cottage.
The wifi did not work.  We called the management,  and were told it was an HOA issue. Communication with the management- Betsy or Allie- was largely ignored.
The cottage was nice.  The kitchen chairs are odd, small and uncomfortable.   There is a small loveseat for 6+ people to share.  The kitchen barely has the necessities for cooking.  The ice maker does not work.  Buy ice!  Bring your own plates, cups, utensils, laundry soap, dishwasher soap, paper towels, cleaning products- including toilet paper.
There should be an outside shower somewhere,  but there is not.  There is an outside spigot for you to wash your feet.  There needs to be some outside hooks for hanging towels, etc.
Let's talk about location.  The cottages are all in a row from the main street.  If you book, ask exactly how far the cottage is from the main road.  You have to walk across a very busy road to get to the beach.  The walk is fairly short, but would be a challenge for little ones.  Not sure where the pic of the road in the ad came from, but it is misleading.
Don't bring a toddler here.  There are stairs EVERYWHERE.  If you have limited mobility folks in your group, book elsewhere.
The swimming pool is tiny and there is not a shower to wash the sand off before you get in.  Yuck.
Overall, we have a fantastic time.

resp.text:
Hi Kimberly, in regards to communication, I have responded to each email sent over the weekend and called the internet company to see if it could be fixed remotely. Unfortunately, they could not so the next slot available was the next business day. The other homes internet should be in range to use as well. If ever an issue, we can usually pick up from one next door or straight across.  I doubled checked our email system report status of each emails sent out to see if reported sent/viewed. All were sent out but not viewed,  so that may be to why you didn't see the information provided about the internet issue.  Also, we keep a FAQ sheet in our homes with contact number for internet on the weekends for after hour issues.  Both Ally and I were at the cottages several times over the weekend, either of us would have been more than happy to bring ice for you or ran to grab some, had we known it was an issue when dropping off other items requested. The after hour number is the best source to text or call, which is our main number. The number is also provided via emails, website, or in house information sheets for any emergency issues such as water leaks, a/c issues, electrical, or plumbing.  We will be sure to have our maintenance take a look since we are now aware its not working properly. We send out check-in instructions with list of all items to expect upon arrival, which is one set up of household items. This list can also be viewed in the rental agreement, FAQ sheet and terms and conditions as well. I will look into other ways to push the information out in the future to help clarify.  We appreciate the suggestions for the outdoor items and will relay to the owners as possible items to add over the next year.
Lastly, we have several photos, videos, and detailed descriptions of our properties in order to ensure every guest is aware of locations and layout of the cottages. Our photos show different angles from different homes interior and exterior.  Video wise we have several tours of the homes and walks to the beach. The walk from the back entrance less than 2 minutes and from the front entrance 1 minute and 30 seconds. Upon arrival at the red light to cross over, the city installed a cross walk, revamped the side walk area which is over 6ft wide, and dropped the speed limit to 25 mph to ensure safety for all crossing to beach areas. Again we do our best to portray our properties as is and to provide more than adequate information readily available on several platforms for viewing.  We are always happy to answer any questions if any still are left unanswered.

text: Very unsatisfied. You have to wash your own towels, tidy up and bring cleaning supplies, and the rooms are small. They say it's a one bedroom when it was just a studio. You have to pay a cleaning deposit for the maid to clean up after you, but she never comes in. So Do NOT stay here.

text:

It’s an efficacy apartment (smaller than out room at Drury Inn in MS) with poor quality wiring. My father has been in construction his whole life and taught me a great deal. There were SO many concerns with the  room we stayed in. When we called a nice maintenance man to come figure out why our lamp wouldn’t turn on we found out the wires were loose. I mentioned it being a fire hazard and nothing was done.

**HOWEVER**

It was in the middle of everything, had a well lit parking area and an elevator. Our kitchen was cute and the beds were decent.

name: Melissa Burkett
text: If I could give them a negative 5 stars I would! Don't rent from these people!!! Liars don't even begin to cover it

name: Samantha Montane
text:
I am dissatisfied with Dothan Real Estate Services (DRES) as a homeowner. I put my trust into this company to insure my rental property would be properly managed, besides rent being collected every month. Per the signed agreement, the tenant was responsible for caring for the rental property, such as changing the air filter every 30 days, replacing light bulbs, cleaning the home thoroughly and trash removal upon departure, and notifying (within 7 days) the property management of any damages and/or problems to anything inside or outside of the home. None of these actions were completed by the tenant upon DRES releasing the security deposit.
I gave the tenant a 30-day notice, August 10-September 10, to vacate the property (also stated in the agreement that there is a 30 day notice unless stated otherwise). I planned for my family and I to move into my home September 11, but they failed to inform me the tenant was not able to relocate until September 13. I had to write to them days before my family and I were going to move in to find out this information.
I trusted in Dothan Real Estate Services to properly inspect my home after the tenant’s departure. This was not done properly, and the security deposit was released within one week of the tenant’s departure, before I could make an itemized inspection of my own (which is written in the signed agreement). Per the Alabama Code Title 35. Property § 35-9A-201 “Upon termination of the tenancy, money held by the landlord as security may be applied to the payment of accrued rent and the amount of damages that the landlord has suffered by reason of the tenant's noncompliance with Section 35-9A-301 all as itemized by the landlord in a written notice delivered to the tenant together with the amount due 60 days after termination of the tenancy and delivery of possession.”
Once I moved back into my home (5 days after the tenant) there were numerous things that were wrong. The things that were missed by the inspections were: the microwave no longer works, light bulbs in both bathrooms were blown, the sink in the half bath is leaking, air filter was never changed (or at least not for months) which caused my HVAC system to freeze,  the home was very dirty with dust and debris everywhere, garbage and furniture left out by the street, and there was an unauthorized pet that left urine and feces (which I have pictures) in the hall closet. I immediately notified DRES, looking for a solution, and to my surprise they were not willing to help. They even agreed to the wrongful actions, but still would not offer a solution.   I must replace these things and pull up my floors in the hall closet due to the damage of the pet. I only asked for help with the $200 deposit for the unauthorized pet, but they were not willing to help. They violated their own rental agreement by falsifying all the things this company was willing to do.
They still have yet to give me a copy of what they did take out of the security deposit and how much the tenant received. I will no longer consider Dothan Real Estate Services for future rentals nor will I give any recommendations to anyone. As an owner, my first home/rental experience was terrible due to the lack of ethics from this business.

text:
This company doesn't deserve one star for the unprofessional treatment we received as dependable tenants. Just know that once you sign the lease, what you see with the house is what you get. The upstairs hvac breaks down every couple of months, only patch work. The roof leaked at one point and there is water stains on the wall in the master bathroom and ceiling upstairs; they refused to paint over the stains. When we moved in there was a table and chair left in the garage, mop and bucket; along with other items at the house. The toilet stools, refrigerator, stove was filthy, and dead bugs throughout the house. My husband and I cleaned the house thoroughly and changed over 10 light bulbs out to make the house halfway comfortable to live in. Forget about the dishwasher making your dishes clean, and don't worry no one is going to replace or repair the dishwasher. Oh, forget about the office manager, Vickie being of any help, great disappointment.
We were NEVER  late on our rent and ALWAYS  kept the grass neatly manicured and even pressure washed the driveway. It makes me wonder if people are just evil and/or  don't know any better.
To add insult to injury,  when we  moved out and  were CHARGED $125  because we left a roll of tissue, the same mop and bucket that was there when we moved IN, and one light bulb was out and a mark on the wall that didn't match the wall color on the picture that the office manager sent. Oh, and  she also said we left cans in the refrigerator that we weren't aware of. I recorded the entire house before leaving and double checked behind ourselves, NONE OF THIS WARRANTS A FEE OF $125, my  husband even cut the grass and cleared the garage of things that had nothing to do with us.
I understand the type world we live in is full of evildoers, liars, cheaters, thefts, and nothing good will come to those. If we would've known the company was doing so poorly  and needed to lie to take working individuals money, we would've never rented from such company.
RENT AT YOUR OWN RISK 129 Princeton Dr.

name: Tyler Anderson
text:
Excellent staff made applying for our new apartment an easy and very straightforward experience. Unfortunately that was the last thing that was easy or straightforward in regards to dealing with this company.

The first night in our new place revealed that the kitchen had a major issue with a German cockroach infestation. After playing phone tag for a week, we were able to get someone to come bug bomb our place while we were out of town. Not only was this completely ineffective, they had used a total of two plastic tarps to cover furniture (actually covering an unopened pack of spare plastic tarps) . This left many of our things  to be covered in poison. And as I mentioned, it was completely ineffective. Finally we were able to get the fridge replaced, which got rid of the roaches (at least in our unit).

The window AC units in the apartment were covered in a black mold. This took over a month to be addressed. When we were able to get some type of maintenance person out, we were given less than an hours notice for something that took over 4 hours to complete.

Our bathroom sink has a leak that has been addressed by the same plumber multiple times without being resolved.

I guess the one other positive I can give them besides how I said in the beginning that they facilitated receiving our security deposit and first month's rent, is that I've heard that many landlords typically don't respond to maintenance requests at all. This seems to be something relegated to Mobile, AL. So I guess good for them for raising themselves slightly above the mantle of "Mobile Alabama Slumlord". We try to take care of our place so it can't be called a "slum" but I can't speak for the rest of their properties they lord over.

On that last note about the rest of their properties, this is completely hearsay, but the person who removed the roach infested fridge also wondered out loud "why they want to move it to another unit if it has roaches in it." So maybe I should wish you good luck renting the property that doesn't have the roach fridge.

name: Andrea Stone
text: Pretty good place to rent from. We contacted them while looking for a place from out of state. We drove out, visited, looked at a place we liked, then we were able to do the entire application process via email. This is the only rental company I have had that has an actual, functioning website to pay your rent. I get to pay my rent every month without having to go to the bank or get a money order. The owner of our home is also a very nice man, makes sure everything is repaired in a timely manner should we need it.  Very professional as well. Most rental companies I dealt with in the past always had a few wicked, evil people on their staff. Not The Rent Experts. They are good, honest folks.

name: Ashton Pennington
text: I have so many good things to say about this company. I'll try my best to keep it short. I'm sure as many of us have experienced, good landlords/management are hard to come by. Well your struggles will be non existent at Rent Experts. It starts with the exceptional customer service. Alexia Pettway will be the voice behind the phone 9/10 when you call. She has a bubbly personality and will handle all of your needs with getting your rental application started. I mean she has the answers to all questions. It then moves to Office Manager Alice Byers. Whatever you need handled at your current rental property she will take care of and I mean QUICKLY at that. I am currently renting a historic house with the company and as you can expect with older houses problems will occur. Alice has assured every maintenance issue was handled either SAME DAY or within a few. If I were to call my old management company at my past apartment complex you would expect to be without air conditioner or hot water for MONTHS. Not here. My hot water heater went out and was replaced SAME DAY. I could go on and on with great things to say. If you are looking for a rental property PLEASE skip the money hungry apartments and go through the Rent Experts. I promise you will not regret it.

B. Wendell

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. We want to make things as easy as possible for our customers. Previously we were only open Mon-Fri. text: We are so grateful to Alice and The Rent Experts. We moved from CA to Mobile. name: Andrew Dean
text:
They are really great at helping you get settled into a rental property when you become a tenant of theirs. However, all things change and so did their staff.

We are trying to get our deposit back of one month's rent and they want to charge us $550 for cleaning and who knows what else.

Beware - make sure you get a copy of everything they write down and put on the rental contract or any pictures they take with you during your initial walk  through.

The owner of the property we rented out lives next door. They had left items in the garage as storage and Rent Experts (Tracy Hidalgo) made it very clear to not touch any of their items and to leave it. She took pictures and made note of it in our contract review.

Guess what? Now, we have moved out and the Rent Experts team wants to charge us for items that don't belong to us that we were told should remain.

Here's the kicker.... they charged us $350 for a "full Cleaning" of our house after we moved out. Granted, we weren't a maid service but it was just as good as we moved into it. When we moved in - german cockroach infestation that took forever for them to fix; mold on ceiling of bathroom that they just had some idiot paint over; Nerf guns from owner and jackets from owner that we were told to just LEAVE; dusty fans that we cleaned off; and faulty instructions on the air unit which needed to have bleached poured down its piping to relieve clogs and drainage (which we had to pay to get worked on).

But I called Rent Experts and spoke with Christian and he said that $350 was a standard, full clean by the company they had go in there and clean. I called up to Rent Experts, due to curiosity, and asked what company charges $350 for a few dusty fans and items that needed to be carried to the curb (that weren't ours). I was told that Rent Experts does the cleaning themselves.

So, basically, they paid themselves $350 to go in there and "clean."

STAY ON TOP OF THEM and DO NOT TAKE ANY NON-SENSE OFF OF THEM.

text: They just suck,plain and simple.

text:
I left feeling restored from the mandates of life and like I gained a friend in Taylor and in Bella Beach Properties.

The space was fun and functional (working remote, cooking a meal, ordering in, watching a movie)! The view from the patio of the 15th floor was even better in person!

Taylor and the team were amazing!  From answering general questions to responding to a maintenance request, I felt well taken care of.  I even forgot some items in the medicine cabinet on day of check out and Taylor called immediately to inform me and connected with his staff so I could quickly arrange for pick up.

My only regret is that I didn’t make it to Floribama! (Guess there’s always next time)!!

Bobbi

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words. We loved having you. I must share a quick story. The day before Bobbie departed, our cleaner arrived to a condo that was left in such a complete disaster that it brought her to tears.  The next day, she went to clean the condo where Bobbi had stayed. Our cleaner said “if every guest was like this person I would be in heaven”. Bobbi left a nice note for the cleaner and left the condo spotless. It made her day. Thank you for being so awesome! We looking forward to your return visit and yes, we too feel we have a new great friend.

Good thing I rented through Airbnb and they were able to find me another rental. I would not recommend Bella to anyone. They were not professional and the property was not as advertised.

text: Easy booking, prompt responses, clean and comfortable rental.

name: Donna Nunnelley
text: Bella Beach Properties is the best property management on the Beach. Call Mary Cain Fowler. You will be pleased that you did.

name: Andrew Voelter
text: Do not book through them!!  The condo we rented was filthy. Over all, completely neglected. Master bed sheets had to be 5 years old, hair and stains on them when we arrived. Real nice to find at 10 pm after a long trip. Leaking toilet, non draining tub, highly stained outdoor couch, broken patio lounge chair on the balcony, missing outlet cover, missing closet door, washing machine noise that sounded like it was going to explode at any minute, highly stained carpet. I could go on. Worst of all...we emailed them with concerns (photos attached to help them, we thought) and not even a response!!!!! Nothing!!!! Even after my wife spoke to them...Nothing!!! They obviously do not care about their renters. Stay away!!

name: Samantha Frasier
text: There were 7 of us that took a girls trip and stayed at the palms unit 304...we all had a great time and really enjoyed this condo. I will definitely use Bella beach properties again!!

name: Mary Edwards
text: Love Bella Beach Properties! Taylor and Cady are so hospitable and knowledgeable! Highly recommend!

name: Dave Lyon
text: Beautiful people helping you vacation.  The staff is awesome.

name: CJ
text:
Mary Cain Fowler is the best. Have used Bella Beach Properties numerous times in Orange Beach and would recommend them to all.
The company is run with the highest standards and I can not Thank Mary and Tyler enough for all that they do for all of their clients. Not so much as clients, but all are treated as family.

name: C W
text: I have written many time asking for details and have only heard. Ack once in the past 6 months and was told they would write me back. I have stayed here many times but as of now will not book anymore with them.

name: Paula Granberry
text: Taylor and Mary were very helpful in finding the perfect condo for our family vacation.  We chose The Tidewater condominiums for its ideal beach location convenient to restaurants and activities for the family.  I would highly recommend the personalized service at Bella Beach.

name: Randy Curry
text: We stayed at the trade winds condos. The property is nice. But the customer service from Bella was awful. We never received an email or any information on how to check In. Only a automatic reservation confirmation payment confirmation. Called several times, left messages, emailed and never got a response or a call back. Finally someone texts from someone on how to get in. They really should provide more information to those who rent a condo.

name: Tonya W (the Sassy Puffin)
text: I had the best getaway to Orange Beach last week! I stayed at The Palms on Perdido Beach Blvd., a spacious 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom condo overlooking the gulf. Nice location. Would definitely go back.

name: Justice Wally
text: Excellent Realtor and very knowledgeable of the Orange Beach and Gulf Shores area.  My wife and I recently purchased a home in Orange Beach and Taylor Means was very helpful and patient in our home search.

name: Denny Harms
text: Bella Beach Properties is amazing. 3rd year in a row booking our Spring family Vacation with these guys and they will be our choice for years to come!!!

name: Amy Barclay
text:
Stayed with Bella Beach.. it was the nasty place I have ever stayed!  We had to go
buy sheets to put over the furniture because they was so dirty and smelled so bad.

name: Jonathan Cannon
text: Our family stays with Bella Beach Properties every time we visit Orange Beach or Gulf Shores, Alabama. Bella Beach Properties always delivers a great condo for our vacation!

name: Taylor Means
text: Bella Beach Properties offers beautiful, clean gulf front condos with excellent customer service!

name: Zac C
text: Very polite, very professional, and the condos are great.

name: Ryan Miller
text: Beyond rude and it was dirty so many difficulties even getting into the right condo. They just kept messing up our reservations then turned into a screaming match and told we were lying and that we are all fine and should just enjoy the beach even the patio doors to the balcony locked us out. I understand the property has wonderful views. However, this is not how you treat the guests. Even if the property owner was at fault, you decided to manage the property, you are responsible for taking care of the guests. Due to the horrible experience we left and stayed somewhere else the second night. Even a simple apology and explanation would’ve helped. Instead we just get called liars and to get deal with it. Should I also mention that there are 3 small kids here and the fridge was full of beer when we arrived? And the balcony door automatically locked if you went outside? How is this a way to manage?? All I wanted was help and what I received, was exactly the opposite.

name: Paige Finson
text: It was a nightmare trip to say the very least. The management has no customer service skills at all and screams and argues with guest. Taylor was the worst never stay with them !! The place was dirty and they couldn’t even get the condo number right. We tried talking about our complaints then told we are wrong and was yelled at and wasn’t allowed to talk. Don’t waste your money for the good views stay else where !

name: Mark Carter
text: Had an awesome time at the beach this week. The condo was great and Taylor was wonderful to work with. We were a little high maintenance but he took great care of us. The last place we stayed in with another company was a disaster. We were so happy we decided to use Bella Beach this time. Would highly recommend. 🏖

name: Mark Emanuelsen
text: Great rental experience and the staff were very responsive on questions we had. Will definitely be rented from them again!

name: Gary Tilkin
text: This is the second time I have used Maestro Maintenance Management.  My daughters kitchen sink was clogged.  A plumber for one of those home warranty companies came could not fix it.  The Plumber from Maestro fixed it in two and one half hours.  He cleaned after himself.  Tested everything and once again it was perfect.  Let me add, this plumber came on Saturday.  Ask me if I am happy.  Thank you gentlemen.

resp.text: Thank you, Gary! That's our aim! To be your go-to source for every single home maintenance or repair need you have!

name: Sarah Catt
text: I’m so glad I found Maestro Maintenance! As a homeowner, I never know who to call if I need work done around my house. Now, I call Maestro and I know it will be someone who is trustworthy and dependable. The communication has been great. I have my 27-point inspection this week and can’t wait. What a great company!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Sarah! That's the goal! We want to be your go-to for all things home maintenance and repair related. Give us a call so you can get on with your day!

name: Andrea Collins
text:
Single mom who lives in an apartment on a budget. Needed a section of fence put up.  My first thought was it might not be a big enough project for this company to be interested in.  I was very wrong and very happy I didn’t let that stop me from contacting them. I sent a text that took me to a link with drop down questions about what I needed done.  Next I got a phone call invite to discuss details.  And budget.  Within 3 days I had a quote in my budget! Several days later the work was completed and better than I could have hoped.
Communication was seamless. The process was so easy. Workmanship was excellent. I will definitely be a repeat customer.  More than likely will be subscribing to their monthly subscription service.  Check this team out! I give them 5 stars 🌟

resp.text: This project was an absolute joy! Thank you for this incredible review. We look forward to supporting you again!

name: Lacy Beasley
text: Steve at Maestro Maintenance is the best!  He's quick, a good communicator and easy to work with.  I highly recommend their services.

resp.text: Lacy, you are too kind! You are so great to work with and we're grateful for your business!

name: Anne McIntyre
text: We have loved our experiences with Maestro. It has been so helpful to not have to deal with meeting with contractors to find the right quote or the right person for the job. And..any random handy work needed around the house or yard has been handled quickly for such a reasonable price. Highly recommend!!

resp.text: Thank you, thank you, thank you! This review is music to our hears. Please sing out if you need any additional support!

name: Catherine Singletary
text: Maestro did a great job! From the great quoting process, to the great work they did in my home, I cannot say enough good things. Highly recommend

resp.text: Things are tough enough on working moms like yourself! We are so happy to help and hopefully bring a little harmony to your home in the process!

name: Daniel Walters
text: Jason and the Maestro team where prompt and quick! Something that had taken me MONTHS to try to get an electrician out to do was done within 48 hours of contacting Maestro. Couldn’t be happier!!!

resp.text: This makes our hearts sing, Daniel! Thank you!

name: William Timmons
text: Jason and everyone at Maestro were so very helpful! From the initial call, all the way to updates during the process, and completion. They did a great job with helping us get Christmas lights put up. From holiday needs all the way down to everyday household repairs I definitely recommend them! We will use them again for sure! Thanks Maestro!

resp.text: You guys were a pleasure to work with and we appreciate your business so much! Thank you!

name: Samantha Dubrinsky
text: Maestro Maintenance has been an extremely valuable resource for our organization. I cannot tell you how generous the staff is with their time. They came out to our organization multiple times to consult with us and walk us through some items that were way above our heads. They were patient, understanding, compassionate and very helpful. We continue to use Maestro and are grateful for the quality of work they provide us!

resp.text: Thank you, Samantha! We pride ourselves on our customer service, and reviews like these bring us great joy! We look forward to working with you again soon.

name: Laurel Webb
text: Maestro was awesome helping us quickly take care of our carpet and upholstery cleaning needs. Great pricing, communication and service. We will definitely be contacting them again in the future.

resp.text: So happy to help!

name: Whitney Renfroe
text: Maestro has been a game changer! They are so professional, trustworthy, and thorough. I love not having to deal with scheduling, meeting, or monitoring contractors anymore. They take the pain out of maintenance. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you, Whitney! We are happy to allow businesses like yours to keep focuses on your talents. Let us know if there are any other maintenance needs you have for us in the future!

name: Christy Montagano
text: I cannot praise the Maestro enough! Everyone is so kind, professional, reliable, and offers outstanding customer service. I would highly recommend Maestro!

resp.text: Thank you, Christy! We enjoy having you as a customer :)

name: Heninger Garrison Davis, LLC
text: Maestro is a wonderful partner to us and we love having them as our property manager because they are a pleasure to work with and they do great work! They are able to manage all of our maintenance and repair projects and needs so we can focus on running our business!

resp.text: We enjoy working with you and it is our pleasure to handle all your maintenance needs. Thank you for choosing Maestro!

name: Howard McKay
text: Maestro has been a tremendous relief for me in how they have managed multiple jobs. They have helped with plumbing jobs, access control issues, appliance repair, roofing jobs, landscaping jobs and any problem I can throw at them. Their communication sets them apart.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review, Howard. We hope to complete another job for you soon!

name: N K (BherGrylls)
text:
It was an absolute nightmare for me and my wife to rent from them. In my opinion, it was unprofessional and some of the most defensive land management service ever.

I am never going to do business with this place again.

name: Karrie Crews
text: Never had an issue with anything. Rented from Robert for 3 years. If I ever called with an issue someone was out that day. Ashley or Robert always wrote me asap if I had any questions. Went above and beyond all the time. Would suggest. This company.

name: Lauren Harris
text:
Completely and utterly unprofessional! Before renting through independence ask yourself “do I really want to rent from a company who would evict a 5 month pregnant women with asthma during the middle of a pandemic in which a no eviction bill was just passed?” Got a letter at the end of February in the mail stating we were behind on rent (Clearly we were, they had locked us out of the online payment portal), wouldn’t return any phone calls, hung up on my boyfriend the one time Ashley actually picked up the phone, and set the office to appointment only so you couldn’t just walk in to handle matters. That was the only communication we had with them. Fast forward to March 18th when three Madison county sheriff deputies showed up with some crackhead with an attitude and three guys to set my stuff out. I never received an eviction notice and nothing was ever posted on our door. We had the money but were just unable to make the payment due to the poor professionalism exhibited by Robert and Ashley in returning communications. I have been told by many parties to seek legal help and that is exactly what I plan on doing. I was at work and my boyfriend was home when the sherif showed up. In the time it took him to pick me up from
Work to rent a uhaul they already had most of my stuff in the yard, and my belongings had already been picked through by the people sent to move the stuff out. Included in the missing items were my gun safe, two lock boxes holding personal information like my sons birth certificate etc, and a box that contained my coach and Louie bags as well as a bridesmaid dress. All valued well over $2000 for the one box alone. It is worth mentioning after such horrendous treatment considering my condition and willingness to pay that Ashley clardy is the wife of billy clardy the officer who recently lost his life on the job. While she is accepting handouts left and right and having her house paid off what she has failed to mention to the community is that she was cheating on her husband with Chris from her plumbing contractor sludgebusters. Before you scream slander it does not apply to factual statements that can proven in a court of law or with the use of lie detector tests. My boyfriend worked directly along side with Chris at sludgebusters and that’s how we got the apt in the first place plus the first hand knowledge of her trashy misdoings. If you absolutely are homeless and desperately need a place to stay I would say try public housing before ever considering renting from independence realty. I am contacting legal guidance regarding the no notice posted, no eviction ban during a national emergency for a high risk mother to be, and for the goods stolen from my property. In 18 years of renting I have NEVER rented from such a poorly run company. I will never recommend this company and if I could give them less than 1 Star I would. The pictures listed on the website NEVER depict the actual conditions of the properties so I strongly urge you do a walkthrough and check all plumbing and electrical before signing a lease.

name: Jasmine Marie
text: Have been renting there for 3 years now never had a problem until now. They are claiming I owe the $25 from 2 and a half years ago. Then another $50 from 1 years and a half ago. I can't even pull bank records from that far back. They are claiming they got audited and rent was debited out late??? It didn't make any sense, and why is it my fault you guys made an error somewhere 2 almost 3 years ago and I am just now being billed for it????

name: Tenika Mapp
text: I really love Robert and Ashley!! They are an awesome pair to work with. The choices in housing  Independence Reality has are great!  I've been with them for years and have never been disappointed. I move to what I feel is best for me and my situation. Robert is the sweetest!!! Love him to pieces!

name: Paula Suveges
text: These guys are great. They've been managing our place for years and doing well for us.

name: Kim O
text: They put a notice to evict on our door for "failure to pay rent". We're not late or behind on rent. They're fraudulently charging us for plumbing issues from another property and tried to pass it off as our home. They know 100% that the charges they are attempting to collect are not from this property but are retaliating because they were proved wrong. They are filthy crooks, please do not trust these people, Robert and Ashley.

name: M.T. White
text: I was very satisfied with this company. I highly recommend this company. Robert Taylor is great and does the best job. I rented one of his rental properties and I had no complaints at all.  He makes sure the property is well taken care of and kept his promise on giving me a great, affordable, safe place to reside. I appreciated that not only is he a great Realtor but it is always wonderful to do business with someone that is kind and compassionate with a welcoming warm smile.

name: Diqueta McCoy
text: Our company is pleased with the services we are receiving with Independence Realty.  Any questions we have had have been answered in a prompt manner.  We are looking forward to continuing the business relationship.

name: Marie Dorothy Anne Liamzon-Tepman
text: I have nothing but nice things to say about Independence Realty. They really understand the needs of owners and tenants and they are clearly very knowledgeable in the Huntsville property management market. Definitely a good company!

name: Kim McKinney
text: My husband and I moved from Alabama in 2010 and we hired Independence Realty to be our property management company. In the beginning, things were a little bit rough, we were working with a lady by the name of Constance. She was a hot mess! Robert Taylor phoned me one evening and notified me that he had taken over all of her properties and she was no longer with the company (shew, thank goodness)!! Once Robert took over, we haven't had any issues that wasn't fixed immediately. For instance, one of his assistance sent us a rent check for a different property. He paid almost $30 of his money to send us an over night check to Alaska. Back in June, our tenants lease was up and he wanted to move but Robert sealed the deal and we arranged different lease agreement to fit the tenants budget. I couldn't be happier with Robert and Independence Realty. I would not want any other company to handle my property because they couldn't compare to Robert. I really appreciate everything he has done for us!! Out of the three years we have used Independence Realty, we have had to pay to fix a fence and the walls needed painting but other than that...When people have moved, we have had people in the home within a couple of months. I've heard horror stories of property management companies nickel and diming their clients but never have had that experience with Mr. Taylor. EVER!!! :)  I would HIGHLY recommend Independence Realty. You won't find a better property management company. :) We have been with Independence Realty for three years and will continue.

name: Michele Kinsella
text:
Poor manangement
A friend who rents from Independent had her sewer system back up through the toilet, the tub and washing machine. This is not the first time. A plumber was sent out but no work has been started. The resident is living in a home with molded carpets and other dammage and is fearful to wash, bathe or even use the commode for fear that it will happen again.
The manangeme t company has never made contact with the Tennant nor sent anyone to assess the dammage in the home...pull up carpets etc.

This is unacceptable. I wonder if the family that owns the home is even aware. This is an older lady. Not once even when the floors were bringing with water this they offer to put her up in a hotelu til repairs or at a mini clean up be done.

I would never rent or purchase a home through a company .... Independence realty who clearly have no manangement skills.

name: Mitchell Maloney
text:
Robert and staff at Independence Realty are the absolutely the best at what they do.  I thank God every day for them.

All the best,
Mitch Maloney
West Bend, WI

name: Steve Duerre
text: Robert took great care in managing our units.  Thanks for a great decade of service.

name: Bart Caswell
text: We were stationed overseas and they rented out our property.  They let the tenants put a crack in our kitchen sink, a hole in the ceiling, scratches all over our hardwood floor, break our brick ditch guard and take both our garage door remotes without charging them.  They didn't clean the house because there was tape all over the refrigerator, microwave, and kitchen cabinets.  The house was filthy too.  When I asked Robert about it, he said he paid our $700 fence repair bill for us.  I thought ok, at least he is helping out some so we cleaned the house up.  A month later, he charges me for the fence bill.  He cares about nothing but getting his money.

name: ladyrob4110
text: I've rented two beautiful homes from them. Robert is great guy!

name: t White
text: I rented an apartment by Independence Realty and paid on time every month and as a matter of fact I paid early every month and I left the apartment in perfect condition and Mr. Robert Taylor refused to return my security deposit.  The first time I called a month later he claimed to have not inspected the apartment yet which was a lie due to neighbors witnessing not only the staff entering the apartment days after I moved but him showing it to a potential renter.  The second time I called weeks later he claimed the apartment was a mess and he will be keeping the apartment which is a lie also.  If you decide to rent from this company make sure you have good documentation and cover yourself and pay close attention, but on the other hand why would anyone want to do business with someone that is that crocked and unprofessional. I have definitely learned my lesson.  I had no ideal renters would stoop so low to avoid paying back a security deposit.

name: Roger Hornbrook
text: Still waiting for some stuff to be done other than that no problem

name: Kaysey Shelton
text: TERRIBLE!!! I put in a maintenance request for a significant leak in my ceiling.December 2015.. by March 2016 nothing had been said or done about the leak. I have 2 small children, the ceiling was molding and falling apart and the carpet was mildewing and smelled terrible. I moved out in a hurry and turned in my keys. I brought in my documentation of having sent 3 request AND CALLING. I was assured I would get my deposit back for the inconvenience and even had something signed. Robert sends me a $45.00 check 3 months later AND A BILL where he deducted $250.00 from my deposit and first month rent for CEILING repairs. He does not care about his tenants or his properties for that matter. BEWARE!

name: Gina Slay
text: Worst leasing company ever! Don’t recommend and who ever gets the old apt I had good luck(wynterhallc) - your utility bills will be over 300-400$ in the summer. They tried to fix the AC not twice but 3 times still broken-still sucked they never fixed and was in the apartment 2 HoT summers!! Almost caught my apartment on fire when they had to come fix the heater- the coils Burnt so bad turning it on sparks and ashes came through all the vents- burning stuff that never got replaced! You can clean your apartment when you leave/ don’t bother they won’t give you back a dime of your money for deposit. There were several time I called for maintenance for sinks, toilets, holes and leaks in ceiling.never fixed!!  They’re scared to talk to you on the phone. Will text you instead- not professional at all!  They don’t care about any resident.. they are slum lords andike the post above- all the care about is that fat guy(Roberts) money..

name: Lucas Johnson
text: Ashley and Rob are great people and very helpful.

name: J Boogie
text: I wish i could give 0 STARS... I'VE BEEN Renting HERE FOR ALMOST 10 YEARS.. and now they ARE TRYING TO RIP ME OFF WITH SOME KINDA $30 CHARGE TODAY SEPTEMBER 28...2018... THIS CHARGE WAS SUPPOSEDLY MISSED FROM 2014...

name: Jami Burns Richards
text: Prepare for a LONG review. This company took over management of the house I live in back in January 2015. They assured they were taking over to make sure things were kept up better on the house- LIE. My very first maintenance request with them was immediately a bad experience. They CHARGED me for the plumbing maintenance, in which this house has had many plumbing issues for YEARS and needed a new toilet- per the plumber. After MONTHS of going back and forth and refusing to pay this charge I had to send a VIDEO to the manager/owner, Robert Taylor, of how there was no pressure in the flush of the toilet. It was replaced. There has been NO up keep of the property other than what I have done myself (carpet cleaning, yard work, pest control, etc). There is a LARGE FALLING tree in the back yard that with time has started to lean more and more. Even my neighbor has called the company concerned about it. After over 9 months of discussing this tree I was promised it would be removed in December 2015... Well, here we are in June 2016 and it is still there. Limbs (8" round) are constantly falling, ruining any back yard furniture I have. Has even damaged my brand new grill. The carpet and walls have mildew from MULTIPLE leaks coming under the walls and into the hallways. All of which I called SEVERAL times about. This last time it took over a week to get anyone out for the carpet, in which I had to demand several times. The carpet people sucked and didn't want to pull the carpet up to dry it underneath (the leak was coming from under the wall so underneath the carpet and padding), then when they did, the didn't tack the carpet back down properly and now there is a huge gap between the carpet in the hallway.Every since then the house has a really old, dirty, mildew smell to it. This carpet is over 10+ years old and is rental grade carpet. It is literally falling apart from NORMAL wear and tear, I have told them several times that it is in awful condition. I have had several random "late" charges added to my account multiple times, in which I have to question and raise hell to have removed... rent paid on time. I am FINALLY moving. I turned in a 30 day notice a couple of weeks ago stating I would move at the end of June. Today, June 3rd, I receive a text about turning in my keys. I call them and am told that the owners (whom I've never met in my life) were under the impression I was moving May 30th... WRONG. The move out date is in writing, and recorded in email. How does an error like this happen? Either they make a TON of errors, or they are highly unprofessional. Not my cup of tea. They have been in breach of contract multiple times, and damn near refuse to take care of their properties. I almost don't expect my deposit back because this company is just that untrustworthy in the past year and half that I have had to deal with them.

name: Tyrone Mitchell
text: Independence Realty has great service.

name: Feborah Dixon
text: Thank you for taking care of my request!  Courtney Owens was friendly, personable and thorough.  He quickly completed my request and went on to make an overall assessment of the issue and promised to note suggested follow-ups.  I appreciated the extra diligence to prevent damage to the house in the long run.  Job well done!!

resp.text: Hi Feborah,Thank you so much for taking the time and leave us your feedback.We are more than glad to see that your experience with Courtney was amazing. Thank you, Saúl - Resident Experience Specialist.

name: LaToya Walker
text: Our maintenance specialist Courtney (Birmingham) is THE ABSOLUTE BEST! Anytime there is a need he is ALWAYS on time and also VERY productive! We appreciate you so much Courtney! Thank you!

resp.text: Hello LaToya,  We appreciate you leaving us a review of your experience with Courtney.  We are glad to hear that they could resolve your concerns!  In case you need further assistance, please let us know!  Thank you, Mauricio - Resident Experience Specialist

name: m black
text: Courtney Owens is very professional. He takes his time to explain a situation and presents all options. name: Annie Jordan
text: I was pleased to work with Helena.  She was very professional and quick to respond to handle my situation. I was very upset because I had been given the run around with a company about a hot water heater. I found her number and she jumped right on it to make sure that I would get help to resolve the problem. It was like a breathe of fresh air to speak with her.  She told me she would call me back and she did just that. I appreciate good customer service and that is what Helena has.  Thank Helena again for me!

We're lucky to have her on our team. Please let us know if you run into any other questions. We are here to help!Thanks, Will - Resident Experience Specialist

name: Tee Price
text: Each time I have had to call customer service has been an absolute pleasure!! They have alway been nice and knowledgeable about any questions I had (and I had a lot lol) and no long call waiting time either time. I'm so excited to move in and get settled tomorrow!

resp.text: Hello Tee, Thank you for leaving us an excellent five-star review! We love seeing when our residents have enjoyed their experience with us. As always, please let our Resident Care Team know if you have any questions! Thank you, Mauricio - Resident Experience Specialist

name: Danielle Steele
text: My first experience with Courtney was great! He’s very professional, kept me informed, and made sure he addressed all of our concerns.

resp.text: Hello Danielle,  Thank you for this amazing review!  It is good to know that you enjoy our services and value the great work of Courtney!  Thank you, Mauricio - Resident Experience Specialist

name: Tina Jean
text: I have never had a worse experience just trying to renew a lease. You call the 844 number and your on hold for ever once you get ahold of someone still nothing gets done. I have communicated via email and you may get a response days later if you even get a response. I've been trying to renew my lease for a month now. Still can't get anything done. Worse communication I have ever had from a company.

resp.text: Hello Tina,   Thank you for the feedback; we work so hard to solve all our customer needs; please reach us at wecare@msrenewal.com to help you out. Thank you, Mauricio - Resident Experience Specialist

name: Christina Miller
text: This company is not responsive at all. They asked for extra proof of income, which I submitted same day. Leasing agent said that she would call me back same day. It’s been two weeks, I’ve called and emailed and can’t get a response from anyone. The house I originally applied for is now rented, I’m interested In another house and still can’t get a call back. Worst rental company.

resp.text: Hello Christina, I want to apologize for the duration it's taken to receive word back regarding your application. Feel free to email us at wecare@msrenewal.com with the address of the home you applied for so that we can look into the status of your application.  Thank you, Mauricio - Resident Experience Specialist

name: Amanda Carr
text: Our company manages homeowners associations in which Main Street Renewal manages many homes, so we work very closely to ensure the the homes are in compliance with the community covenants.  Main Street goes above and beyond to make sure their renters understand the rules of the neighborhood and helps them to comply with any requests that may come up.  They are always responsive, helpful, professional, and honest which is a breath of fresh air to work with in what can sometimes be a difficult industry!

resp.text: Hi Amanda,Thank you for taking the time to leave us a great review! We appreciate all your help to ensure that our homes are in compliance with local HOA rules. Without your hard work, we wouldn't be able to provide such great experiences for our residents. Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

name: Fletcher Hare
text: I would be giving Main Street a negative amount of stars if it weren’t for Courtney Owens. He is the man. Quick, efficient, and professional. The epitome of customer service.

name: David Morrison
text:
I work as a General Contractor remodeling homes in the Birmingham, AL area.  We became part of the Main Street Renewal team over a year ago.  The partnership couldn’t be better.  In the last year and half we have remodeled close to 100 homes with close to 20 of which were Main Street Renewal properties.  Let me tell anyone looking for a rental property in the Birmingham area to make Main Street Renewal your first/last call.

I can say with first hand knowledge that the quality of the homes in Main Street’s portfolio is second to none.  The majority of property management companies seem to be more worried about profits rather than having the best homes in the city.  In fact, when my lease runs out at my current home I will be moving into a Main Street property myself.

Finally, let me say to any other contractor’s looking for steady work.... get yourself setup as an approved vendor with Main Street.   You won’t find a better construction team to work with.  My primary point of contact is Superintendent Chris Harris.  Chris is great partner that has years of experience.  He will do anything in his power to help you succeed.  Eric Grill is the Construction Manager for Birmingham.  He too has been great to work with.

resp.text: Hi David, thank you for the wonderful review of your work with our homes! Main Street Renewal provides exceptional homes for our residents with a strong attention to craftsmanship. We are working hard, along with vendors like yourself, creating the best possible experience for current and future residents. I'm pleased to hear that Chris and Eric have been such great partners for you. Our team is fortunate to have them. We look forward to continuing to work with you in the future! Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

name: Jeff Brittain
text: We rented from them for 2 years, maintenance requests were slow to be fixed and most times we repaired things ourselves. We moved in May because they wanted almost $100 more bucks a month for the same place we had lived for 2 years. We cleaned and repaired that place from top to bottom, got a satisfactory on everything on the checkout list, except for some touch up paint needed on the backdoor that was actually there when we moved in. Out of a $1495 deposit, they returned $497, stating it had to be repainted, dog odor (which was supposed to be covered with the non-refundable pet deposit we paid), and various other ridiculous claims. They were supposed to have called us back last week, and we have yet to hear from them. They stated they had over 60 other claims filed, so that tells me they're nothing but crooks! DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS COMPANY!!!

resp.text: Hi Jeff,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. I want to apologize that your experience with our Maintenance and Move-Out Teams did not meet your expectations. I'm happy to follow up with you regarding the return of your security deposit. Please feel free to contact us at wecare@msrenewal.com so that we can gather some additonal information. While we understand that your time with us has ended, we wish you the best with your future home search.  Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

name: Kenzie Underly
text:
Update 2 weeks after last update: RUN! Don't rent from this agency. They have sent out 4 of their mainstreet techs to look at the dryer outlet, every single one says we need an electrician. They say they'll put an order in for one to come out and they never do. I call again and it's been the same process EVERYTIME. I even contacted the email below and he said he would put an order in after the last guy did the same thing. Yet again they scheduled it to the same tech that was here last time.

Deck finally got fixed after multiple calls and emails. They didn't even use the weather treated wood, good luck to the next few renters who will go through the same thing in the next 5 years.

IF YOU WANT TO KEEP YOUR SANITY PLEASE GO ELSEWHERE. I've called their service center at least 30 times over a 4 to 5 month span, all regarding maintenance. Most of their call center people are clueless.

Update: It's been 4 months, deck still isn't replaced. I had nothing but issues regarding people coming out to the house to fix varies things. Some of the vendors are great, other barely ever will call you back. Our outlet for our dryer has been shorting out for 3 months now and nothing has been done about. I often have to call at least 3 times before anyone will come out to the house. I emailed the email provided below, about 2 weeks ago, haven't heard anything back. The mountain of issues with this house keeps growing and I honestly regret going with this company. I counted the other day and I've called their maintenance center over 25 times in 4 months!

I love the neighborhood and size of our new place, except our moving in experience has been unpleasant. My partner and haven't been in our place for a month and it's been problem after problem.

The place was suppose to be inspected before we moved in and considering the plumbing inspector arrived a couple days after we moved, it's apparent this didn't happen. He said there was work that needed to be done. Never heard anything after that, until I reported a leaking pipe a couple days ago (the inspector came out almost 2 weeks ago). The downstairs reeks of mildew and the garage also has a leak ( the ceiling tiles in the garage around the leak have mold so it's easy to see there's a leak).

The lawn hadn't been mowed in 3 months according to the neighbors and it appears to be true.

The deck is completely rotted and my fiance already fell through once. This problem has been addressed and can't completely blame them for it going unnoticed since it on the side of the house and not directly connected to the back door.

Then today tops it all, the gutters haven't been cleaned in forever so now the backdoor is flooding the back room because the gutter is emptying right in front of the door.

The application process and our agent that we dealt with was great, but it's obvious there was a lot left undone before we moved in.

resp.text: Hi Kenzie,Thank you for taking the time to update your review. I understand that you've been experiencing a number of maintenance concerns since entering your home. I just noticed the email that you had sent over, and I will continue to follow up with you there as I receive any new information. We appreciate your patience as we work towards a resolution.Thanks, Will - Resident Experience Specialist

text: I have thoroughly enjoyed being a resident with this company. If I did not have to move due to personal circumstances, I would have happily resigned another lease. The home that I leased was in great condition and maintenance was the best. I did not ever need to call the office, except for if I elected to. Ms. Daniels in Residential care is the best. She was very helpful during the move out process and continues to be of assistance to me, even now that I have moved out. I appreciate this company and would definitely consider them if I return to Birmingham.

resp.text:
Hello Santrecheel,
Thank you for taking the time to submit this feedback, we greatly appreciate it. We are happy that your time with us went smoothly and are thrilled to hear that you were taken care. It’s bittersweet to see you go, but we understand how life works sometimes! We hope you have a great rest of the week and thanks again for the review!
Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Amber Tucker
text: I am extremely upset!!! Nancy Jordan is the rudest person I've ever had contact with in my life. My initial contact with her began and ended with her speaking over me in a manner like I'm a child. She is supposedly handling my application but when I asked about a refund on my application fee(because they are taking too long to process my application) and to speak with her supervisor she hung up on me. I've explained that my current unit was disqualified and I need to move expeditiously. I'm withdrawing my application and refuse to rent from somebody who treats potential clients in this manner. Like do you not realize Ms. Nancy that tenants are the reason you get a paycheck. I'm so disappointed because Msrenewal does have nice properties but I'll take my $1200 somewhere else.

resp.text: Hi Amber, thank you for leaving us feedback. I want to follow up on this concern and gather some more information regarding this experience. Please contact me at wecare@msrenewal.com so that we can further discuss this matter. Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

name: Liz Carr
text: Courtney came out to my home today on a maintenance call- he was extremely courteous, professional and helpful! The best experience I’ve had with Main Street to date. Thanks again, Courtney!

resp.text: Hi Liz, we appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review! Main Street Renewal is so lucky to have someone like Courtney on our team. He is always willing to go above and beyond to help our residents. We will be sure to pass along your kind regards. If you run into any more concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at residentcareteam@msrenewal.com. Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

name: Walter Powell
text: The tech that came out was professional and most of all fixed what was needed.

Please let us know if there is anything that we can do to improve your experience with us further.Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

name: Shannon Bibbs- Napier
text:
I initially saw a house in Midfield I was possibly interested in and set up an appointment to go and view it . I even took off half a day so that I can make this appointment as if you're late to the appointment you would be charged a late fee . I went to check out the home and waited almost 15 minutes for the lady to come . We viewed the home but she kept trying to tell me about another property , etc etc. Before we left she asked if I could follow her to another house that I may like better which was about 10min away. I didn't like the home at all but I remember the agent telling me that they had more homes in the Hueytown area . The agent quickly text me an application but I continued to look . After finding a house in Midfield on there website that wasn't ready for viewing yet my brother and I applied for the home bc it was nice from the photos and I had stopped by to check it out myself . Paid the $80 sent in all my information and was  contacted my Robert Bickerton who told me and my brother how he needed to fill in his portion of the application and uplod his documents. Well the  link he sent wasn't working and I tried to explain that to him and all he emailed me back "please see the email I sent earlier" I then had to call in and speak with someone else and explain and they reset the link for me .  I saw where my credit had been checked and I said ok maybe they are moving along with the application process . I get a email the next day stating that we had been denied but he couldn't give me a specific reason but did say" it 's probably your rental history and  Rentgrow will be in contact with you on a couple of days to tell you why you were denied  " I contacted my landlord whom I have been renting from for 10 years and asked her had they called bc she is expecting them to reach and she said no one ever called her for my rental history . I even emailed ROBERT back to ask him  what he meant about rental history so I can tell him no one ever checked mine in the first place. He never responded back nor said anything else that may help is else  to get  into that home or another home .

Long story short  I didn't appreciate the way that things were handled and I felt as though I paid $80 for them to run one thing and that was it .

I'm so glad that we found another home with another rental company and had proof that they did employment verification as well as rental history verification . We will be moving into that home at the end of the month .
So it you're on the search please consider other companies before giving them your money .

resp.text: Hi Shannon,  I appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review. Our applications are processed by a third-party service called RentGrow, and they fully check rental history and employment verification. I want to apologize that your experience did not go as planned. We wish you all the best in your new home,  and please feel free to contact us if you have any additonal questions or concerns.    Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

name: Que Smith
text: The staff here is very helpful and always answers when I need them. The resident team Jackie and Latoya made moving a breeze. Thanks ladies.

resp.text: Hi Que,  Thank you for the excellent five-star review of your experience with us! We are so pleased to see that you had such a great experience with Jackie and Latoya. Please let us know if you have any questions along the way. Our Resident Care Team is here to help!  Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

Having rented with several companies in the area, Main Street surpasses all of them.

name: Lukesha Nick-Goon
text:
I've recently signed a lease with this company.  The day of move in, I do my walk through that I was told to do prior to moving in any of my belongings, only to find that as I walked down the stairs into the basement, that the stairway was blocked by the airducks connected to the AC unit. Mind you it's a Saturday that I move in. Contacted the company on that following Tuesday, AC repairs are still not done as of today. I've put in numerous work orders for the same repair. A representative contacts me after each work order and assures me that once the bid is in someone will be out to repair.

It's mid April in Alabama, thermostat stat has read a temp of 76 or more. It's hot AF. I can't rest and I am feed up. Let me not pay rent and pay for repairs.. My belongings, will be put out on the streets.

After reading these reviews, I wish I had read them prior to going through this company. All I want is a working AC unit. May is a few weeks away. I have 11 more months to be here..😣

resp.text: Hello Lukesha, We understanding moving is already stressful and having additional issues is not the experience we want to provide and we apologize for that. We are working to escalate your concerns within our Resident Resolutions department to ensure you are taken care of moving forward with these repairs. Our agents are working to gather an update on your repairs and will be contacting your directly to provide the next steps. Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

name: Sabrea Baylor
text: This company here my friend, does not deserve a good review .Nevertheless,  They have beautiful properties. I live in Birmingham, Al and there was a property I viewed through Rently ,  when I viewed the property, it was still open and had not been applied for . This past Sunday on 2/2/2020 I decided to apply for the property and pay my application fee. After Applying, I wake up Monday morning to call and check on the property I was told by the Homewood Al office I would receive a call back in 20 minutes, never heard anything back. I get up Tuesday morning 2/3/2019 to go and visit Msrenewal, and check on it one of the property managers introduced himself, got my info and told me that he would check on my application, he later returned 5 minutes later stating that I had needed a guarantee for the house( A Bs excuse) . I’ve been renting since I was 19 years old and I am now 25, never had a broken lease and I’ve also never had an eviction nor late payment, furthermore I’ve never had a problem getting approved for anything, especially when you make the income .This would be my second house. However, I got in my vehicle and decided to check their website and the home was no longer available. I am not a genius but it doesn’t take a rocket science to see that someone was able to apply and secure the home before me, that isn’t the problem. The problem is the excuse I was given and the fact that they left the house available for people to still apply for knowing that they already had potential candidates ready to secure the home , and also the fact that they basically took my hard earned money when simply they could have reached out to me, and explained the situation, and offered for me to apply for another property with the app fee money ! I know that I am not the only person who has dealt with this situation but I did want to post a review and give a heads up to others that are interested in this company . I will be reporting them to bbb & reporting further more on the issue.

resp.text: Hey Sabrea, thank you for leaving us feedback. I apologize for the inconvenience that this caused. We do allow multiple applicants to apply for a home, and we are working to provide applicants with insight as to how many people have applied for the same home. As you stated, you can transfer your application to any one of our properties within 30 days of applying. If you would like to discuss your application or the process as a whole further, please reach out to us at wecare@msrenewal.com. Thanks, Will - Brand Reputation Specialist

name: G G
text: Great experience. Always, try to take care of concerns and or reply in a timely manner. I recommend!!

resp.text: Genoa,  Your recommendation means so much to us and we're so happy to have earned it. Thank you again for taking the time to let the world know about your positive experience. Have a great day!  Thanks, Robyn - Brand Reputation Coordinator Thanks, Robyn - Brand Reputation Coordinator

text: They are so confused we get a letter from them saying we were conditionally approved but have to meet financial requirements so I’ve been trying to call to see if we needed to pay extra and guess what they have no idea what’s going on they barely answer the phone anyways idek why i bothered honestly we’ve already wasted ton of money applying for houses that’s gone the next day

name: Britney Rice J
text: Currently a tenant with mainstreet as well and every experience has been a pain. Currently it is 91 degrees in my home and I have two small children and myself am an asthmatic. I have put in many work orders for someone to come out and work on the AC unit explaining that there is something wrong with it (this year and last year) each time they say it’s just old or it’s just really hot. Well this time there is NO cold air blowing whatsoever and my family and I are suffering. I’m sure that we will be told the same thing again and it will take many days for someone to get out. I won’t be able to take another day in this heat. Thank God my children are school age and they can get relief. I’m not sure why it’s like pulling teeth to get issues resolved with this company.

resp.text: Hi Britney, I would like to look into this for you. Can you please email wecare@msrenewal.com with your Main Street Renewal address and best number to contact you? Thanks, Adam - Manager, Brand Reputation

name: G. Jean
text: I had the pleasure of speaking with Rebecca and was very pleased with our conversation.  Her helpful suggestions and kind words really lifted my spirit and although I was a stranger to her, she spoke with me as a friend.  Main Street Renewal has some of the most lovely rentals I have seen and if I ever decide to rent again I will definitely use these guys.

resp.text: Hello, Here at Main Street we are family and want our teams to extend that out to all of our residents. We are thrilled that Rebecca was able to assist you to the best of her abilities and beyond. Thank you so much for the review and we hope you have a wonderful rest of the week! Regards, Whitney – Resident Resolutions Specialist

text: Ben has a strong personality that means  Business and is all about getting the job done and done correctly . He is always on the go doing what ever he can to keep the job or task at hand moving forward . He is great guy and will do whatever he can to help you.
