name: Stephanie Adams
text: We had a terrible experience with this company! We rented a home with them and moved in in December of 2014. We moved in on a Saturday with our six month old baby. We went to take showers after a long day of moving, only to find there was no hot water. We left several messages to get this fixed and finally received a call late the following day and the woman said (verbatim), “We advise you to boil water.” Are you serious?! You tell that to someone who JUST moved in, better yet a family with an infant?! We inadvertently ended up speaking to the owner of the home later on and needless to say, he was NOT pleased with how we were treated either. The staff here is rude and extremely inconsiderate. Terrible experience.

resp.text: We are truly sorry for your negative experience with us! We thank you for your feedback and comments and will keep them in mind as we continue to better our services for our clients and tenants in the future.

name: Nick Moore
text: Susie was great! The entire rental process was simple and fast.

resp.text: Thank you Nick.

name: Anketa Kelley
text: Blake was awesome with getting me into my rental.. Thanks ARM for allowing Blake to be apart of your team!

resp.text: Thank you for your review Anketa!

name: Lindsey Setser
text: I am currently leasing a home through Alabama Rental Managers- ARM. All of the staff I have worked with- Harper, Kristen, and Blake- have been so professional and prompt in assisting me. If you are looking to lease a property, I highly recommend you check out ARM and all of their amazing homes they have to offer!

name: Jessica Noe
text: Blake was very helpful and made the whole process of renting a home run smoothly! Overall was a great experience.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Jessica!

name: Jennifer Lewis
text:
I never leave reviews but after my horrible encounter with this rental company, I had to inform the public. This rental company and the employees I dealt with are pathetic. This is the most unprofessional disorganized company. I found a rental I liked but when I went out to look at the property alone to make sure it looked good it was nothing like what they had pictured on their site. So I decided to call and discuss this issue. Well, when I called I spoke to a Kristy or Krista something like that who is absolutely worthless. I assume she's new bc she couldn't answer simple questions and got extremely rude and aggressive when I called her out on it. I will be calling the owner of this company and informing then how I was treated when I called to inquire about rental properties. The girl lacks class and needs a serious course in customer service. Who runs this circus??? What a joke. Now as I read threw the reviews I see exactly what kind of people run this company. Whoever replies to the reviews needs to be fired immediately. What kind of business owner/employees tries so hard to make the reviewer look bad and claim they are innocent. I wouldn't rent from this company after everything I've seen, heard and  read. It's obvious the problem is with the company not the renters. I hope they realize how bad they make themselves look by the responses they give. They respond like immature kids who have gotten their feelings hurt. Someone needs to come in and train these people. I've owned a business for 30 years and if I had employees like the one that answered the phone she would be fired immediately as well as whoever replies to the reviews. They are the reason this company is getting such a bad name. There is a certain way you deal with people when you work at a business like this and the way they handle things is pathetic. This company obviously cares nothing about it's reputation. If they did the would've gotten rid of the ones that most of the reviews are about. I see a increase in good reviews which it's obvious to anyone what's going on there. Its almost laughable how awful this company handles business. I've read thru the reviews and some of these people should've sued this company. I will personally be reporting this company. This is no way to do business. They lie about the condition of their properties. They obviously don't hold up their end of the lease agreement either. To the girl who had the neighbor who kept threatening them. Take the police reports to an attorney along with picture's, you have a viable lawsuit. Wow.....

Update: I asked around about the best rental companies in the area and almost ever person I spoke to told me not to deal with Alabama Rental Managers. They have a worse reputation then I first imagined. The employees are spoken about in a terrible way.

name: Hak Je Kim
text:
Our family moved out at the end of October. I knew we were getting back the security deposit after 60 days. I called them in February since we STILL haven't received it. They said they sent it on December 30/31 to the old address because they didn't have our new forwarding address. Being so exhausted with moving, I faintly remember writing down the new address on a sticky note when I returned the keys and garage remotes back in October. HERE'S WHERE I HAVE A PROBLEM. They said that I didn't put down the new address. Okay, so it was my bad that I didn't 100% MAKE SURE I put it inside the envelope.
1) WHY would you send it to the old address when you CLEARLY knew we moved out of there TWO months ago?!?! YOU HAVE MY EMAIL AND PHONE NUMBERS ON FILE.
So you saw there was no forwarding address on file.. is it really that hard to reach out to me and ask for our new address??? You simply just had to call or shoot me an email before mailing out the check.
2) I got in contact with the owner of the old address; he never received the security deposit check from ARM. Called them back and they said the check still has not been cleared so they are reissuing another one.. BECKY from accounting asked for the forwarding address last week on Feb 21st, and I quickly replied to her email 34 minutes later. Never heard back from her so I called yesterday to touch base. RUDELY says I didn't give her the information. uh, you had the info you needed like 7 days ago? NO NEED TO BE SHORT AND SNAPPY with me when you're the one who didn't check your email.
It's March now and I'm picking up the check this Friday so I'll find out what the other deductions are then.
[I get that I must have "failed to give a forwarding address" but we were with you guys for almost three years.. Yes, I should've called and tripled checked to make sure you had it during Nov-Dec. BUT if you saw something on your side of the end that wasn't right, couldn't you have at least communicated with us first?]
-personally would not reccomend || too much hassle-

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback.  We apologize your experience was not a positive one.  We are required to mail the final account statement to the last known address if no forwarding address was provided.  We are glad you were able to get the issue resolved and pick up your check.  We wish you the best of luck with your new home!

name: Penny Pointer
text: Worst excuse of a rental agency, they do not tell you that if anything breaks in the rental you are required to fix and repair yourself. And the hidden fees are amazing. Do yourself a favor and stay away.....

name: Chemese Leverette
text:
Blake McCranie was very helpful during the process. Thank you!
Chemese Lynch

resp.text: Thank you Chemese!  Welcome Home!!!

name: Nakita
text: I just want to say this company is exceptional. When I first reached out to them about renting a home, I was nervous b/c of my credit, and coming from a divorce that was hard on me financially I just knew my family would not get approved. I showed my kids the home before I even got approved (I was just so excited about it) and they were as well. I prayed to God, and after talking to the mgr of the company they walked out on faith with my family and gave us a chance. When I tell you I LOVE this home, and so does my 3yr old daughter. She has over came so much with her health etc.. And every time I pick her up from daycare she says "Mom are we going to the new house?"  and she just smiles. Just to have a backyard for your child to play in may be small thing, but just to see her smile brings me joy in every way.  Thank you Blake, Kristen and the  A.R.M family...

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Nakita!  We are so happy for you and your family.  Please call us if we can assist you with anything!

name: Gilad Gilad
text:
Hi All,
The ARM gave me a good service for my rentals. I had a problem with my tenant that didn't pay and the management company solve it on good manner. He was late but still I got the money.
Specially I want to say BIG thanks to Paige Sweeney from ARM that was very professional and kind and gave me all the details and updates on that scenario.
Thanks you Paige :)
Gilad

resp.text: Thank you so much Gilad!  Your business is important to us!

name: Stuart Raburn
text: Alabama Rental Managers managed a rental house for us for 4 years and did a wonderful job.  We just took if off the rental plan to sell but would highly recommend them and will look forward to working with them again.

resp.text: Thank you Stuart!  We appreciate you as our client and look forward to hopefully working with you in the future.

name: Antionette Render
text: Rick

name: Kyle Heston
text:
I wish I could give 0 stars, and oh where to begin.  In the beginning everything was great and seemed promising.  However, once me moved in the previous tenant had left multitudes of belongings they did not wish to keep.  Not to mention they did no sort of cleaning upon their departure.  When this was brought to the attention of the rental companies staff we were informed they were sorry for the inconvenience, but there was nothing they could do (keep in mind it took nearly 3 months to get a response).

I would NEVER in my wildest dreams rent from this company again!!!  If this review stops anyone from renting from this company it might take away a minuscule amount of the pain we went through in dealing with them.

name: Joseph Greer
text: I rented 840 Kent drive odenville Al, 35120 from them my hot water heater went out and I called them over and over I finally gave them a 30 day notice and they said I had to give them a 60 day notice and right before I left they came to fix the water heater and that was a year ago, now just going to have to go after the owner of the house

name: Jake Ryan
text: I would like to express my sincere pleasure with Alabama Rental Managers, specifically Blake McCrane.  He was very knowledgable, courteous and patient in showing several properties to my wife and I over the course of a week.  We never felt rushed and were always pleased with Blake's knowledge of the properties and its amenities.  While we did not lease a property yet, we will definitely use Blake McCrane and Alabama Rental Managers to find our dream rental.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your kind feedback.  Blake is a great asset to our team and we will definitely pass this along to him.  Please call us if we can ever assist you.

name: Mayra Juarez
text: Real estate agent Kristen Lankford is very rude and has absolutely no understanding what customer service is. I left her numerous messages about rental inquires I had, she didn't even show me a smidgen of common courtesy by calling me back. Not only that, when you are able to  get a  hold  of  them, they act like  they are doing you a favor by renting you their overpriced garbage of rental properties. Please avoid these morons!!!

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback.  We are addressing your concern.  Please feel free to call me directly if I can be of assistance with your home search.

Jenny Moore

name: Ron Beasley
text: ive been renting with them going on 2 years. EVERY time ive needed maintenance to do something it takes forever to get a call back and several trips of having someone come out before it is fixed. They refuse to communicate with the property owners on what is going on. Will never recommend this company and will not renew my contract because of their poor service.

name: Cody Bruner
text: Blake did a great job. Very pleased.

resp.text: Thank you Cody!  Blake is a great asset to our team.  Please call us if we can assist you with anything while living in the home.

name: Tosha Rainey
text: This company is horrible to rent from!!!!!!!!!  I told the owner of the property I am renting if he did not change property managers I would be moving.  You can never get anyone on the phone.  I have had several maintenance issues while renting from them and I have had to spend more time getting things fixed than I should have.  The owner uses a home warranty company that requires a $75.00 fee every time they come out that I have had to pay every time.  They are suppose to call the company and give them their credit card # before they even come to my house.  They have reimbursed me each time but, the renter should NOT have to pay this.  They don't know if I have the $75.00 to pay or not and you can't get anyone on the phone to talk to the maintenance company either.  I went 2 1/2 months without a working shower and TUB.  Our family had to go and take a shower at my parents for a couple of weeks because the one working shower  broke also.  There is no follow-up from the office after having maintenance issues.  The office staff is rude and won't return phone calls or e-mails.  I went to the office and demanded to speak to someone and was told the VP "Jenni" was on the phone and wouldn't be able to speak with me.  She sent out a QA person who has nothing to do with maintenance issues or even staff issues to talk to me .  I am not sure what the property owner pays them for because they do not  do ANYTHING to help the renters.  I am not a property owner I am a renter so I should not be dealing with issues the property mangers should be handling.

resp.text:
Tosha,

Thank you for letting me know that your HVAC was fixed yesterday.  As I mentioned in my emails to you yesterday, please call or email me directly in the future if you have any issues that are not being addressed immediately!  Unfortunately, sometimes it does take a little longer for maintenance items to be corrected when dealing with the Owner's Home Warranty Company.

As we also discussed, please do not ever pay out of your pocket for these service fees.  Someone is available in our office to pay these fees, even after office hours.  The vendors that are called out to the home through a Home Warranty call are not Alabama Rental Managers' vendors.  In the future, please just simply ask them to contact our office and we will take it from there!

As it pertains to not ever getting anyone on the phone, we have someone answering our calls from 8:30 am-5:00 pm Monday through Friday here in our office and an after hours service that answers all calls outside of business hours.  There should never be a time that you are not able to speak to someone when calling our office.  As you and I discussed, the day you came by our office, I had received your voicemail aprox. 45 minutes prior to your arrival and was on the phone with the Home Warranty Company for your rental home when you arrived.  One of my team members even met you at the front desk at my request to let you know I would be up to talk with you as soon as I was off the phone.  Unfortunately, you left the office prior to us being able to speak.

Again, please call or email me directly if I can ever be of assistance.  We truly value you as our resident and we want your experience to be a positive one.

Best Regards,
Jenny Moore
Vice President of Operations

name: Sam Sowia
text: I recently moved to the Birmingham area for work and I wanted to rent simply because I'm not 100% sure how long I will be here. I contacted Alabama Rental Managers. Now if I had taken the time to check Google reviews and the Yelp reviews I wouldn't have even contacted them. As a business man myself I can tell you that just from reading some reviews and reading the way a employee responded to them that this is not a top notch, classy rental company. If I owned this business I would immediately fire whomever has responded to these reviews. Very unprofessional. Its obvious the person responding needs a course in Business 101. You don't respond to a  review by turning it around on the reviewer. You don't reveal things about their business dealings with your company. I would immediately fire the person responding or insist on them taking online classes in how to be a professional. From my first phone call to this buiness I saw red flags. The phone was answered by a female who was laughing as she answered the phone. I asked simple questions about several properties that she should've known the answers to. After the third Ummm......I'm not sure, I asked her to transfer me to someone who would know and she got very defensive and very rude saying to me, "Sir, if you would just be patient and nice I would be able to find out answers to your questions but If your rude again, I will just hang up on you." I asked her why she didn't know the answers and her response was,"Its not my job to know answers to those kind of questions." All I could say was, "Wow." Honestly it was amusing. From the person responding to the reviews to the women who answers the phone this is one classless, trashy  business and so are those two employees. I finally asked her to please have an agent or someone with any knowledge about the business and properties to call me. I waited two days and no one ever called me. I can almost guarantee Miss Classless didn't even give anyone a message that a potiential renter wanted to speak to an agent  about a property. Probably because she knew I would inform them about the way she spoke to me. I wouldn't rent with this company now even if the house was perfect for my needs, nor will I reccomend this company to anyone. In fact I will strongly discourage it. I didn't make it past the front desk and I'm so glad I found out how unprofessional, disorganized and completely classless before I gave them my business. Some advice to the person responding to these reviews. Instead of sitting around reading and responding to reviews all day why don't you learn how to be a professional and an asset to this company because right now from what I can tell your far from an asset or a help to this company. Quite frankly your most likely causing more problems because you handle the disgruntled tenants and potential tenants the way you do. This company needs to get someone to come in and help this business and it's employees learn good customer service and how to act like professionals instead of acting like low class trash. Whoever responds to the reviews and answers your phone's cost you a renter and more potential renters by the way they act. Its a huge turn off and it's most likely costing you business, I know it did mine. Big mistake Alabama Rental Manager's, I could've sent you so much business. I'm a relocation specialist for a very large well known company. I help employees find rental homes to live in while they are working in this area. After my experience with this company, I will strongly discourage anyone using this rental company.

resp.text: We are truly sorry for your negative experience with us! We thank you for your feedback and comments and will keep them in mind as we continue to better our services for our clients and tenants in the future.

name: Nelly
text: Blake was very knowledgeable and great with my move in process.

resp.text: Thank you for your review!

name: Key Whi
text:
I am a owner of a property they manage. The first year my house was rented they did ok; just ok. Now things have took a turn for the worse. Its like they get new employees every other month. The tenant gets to pay the rent whenever they feel like it and late fees aren't collected. I'm owed 3 months worth of late fees and I keep getting told, "We sent a notice, and I will stay on top of it".
Maintenance concerns are always sent to me late. Recently repairs were made without authorization and I was told the money would be taken out of my rental income, I wasn't asked. They let some company charge $425 to fix a toilet leak and i'm expected to pay for it. I'm not sure how much they charge per hour or if they used gold plated parts but looking up the parts they including in the sentence they typed for an invoice (not itemized) all parts would be less than $100. The bad thing is I was notified 5 days AFTER the repairs were completed and was told then that repairs needed to be done.
They are like "mom and pop" rental managers. You will get promised the same product as a big name company but it will actually be extremely sub par......... as far as letting them manage your property YOU MIGHT WANT TO RECONSIDER!!!

resp.text: We are truly sorry for your negative experience with us! We thank you for your feedback and comments and will keep them in mind as we continue to better our services for our clients and tenants in the future.

name: Jeff Acker
text: ARM has been very helpful with Maintenance requests.  Jennifer has been professional and courteous, and has handled every situation that I've had.

resp.text: We appreciate it Jeff!

name: Byron Hicks
text: Very informative and thorough, we received interest right away!

resp.text: Thank you Byron!

name: Brooke Meers
text:
RENTERS BEWARE!!! RENT FROM SOMEONE ELSE!!! We are so glad to be out of the house we were renting with Alabama Rental Managers. We were without heat for an entire year, heat was still broken on the day we moved out. They can try to deny it all they want, but I have documentation of every single freezing cold day we spent in that house! We have a young child and a dog, let alone the fact that heat is the ONE thing they legally have to provide. These people are A holes!!! Jenny Moore (or Jennifer Rudeness, as we all like to call her) is an absolute horrible person, she is extremely rude and it's abundantly clear that she has no respect at all for due process. She needs to buy herself some training in customer service and train the rest of her staff as well, considering they probably developed their piss poor attitudes by watching her actions, or shall I say, "lack thereof"! I will even donate my entire deposit ONLY if they use it to train themselves in proper customer care, which I personally have been specializing in since I was 18. Otherwise, I fully expect an entire refund of my deposit as that house is now CLEANER than it was when we moved in. The grout was brown, now it's white thanks to me! If I could, I would give zero stars! We are a military family and we don't always get to choose where we move to, unfortunately we got very bad luck with this location and this horribly outrageous "Management" company. HOMEOWNERS BE WARE! THEY DO NOT DO QUARTERLY WALK THROUGHS AS THE CONTRACT YOU SIGN WITH THEM STATES! We lived there for over two years and they did ONE walk through 3 months before we moved out. They are liars on multiple levels. My family has been in real estate my entire life, I wouldn't trust these people with my clothes, let alone my house and if I was running that place, EVERYONE would be fired. They are breaking laws left and right and they only care about getting paid from both parties, renters as well as homeowners. This company will be extremely lucky if I decide to not waste my time reporting them to the BBB! I suggest you change your illegal ways, Alabama Rental Managers!

In response to your reply,

NO! I will not waste my time calling you ever again. I will not waste my valuable time dealing with you ever again, no matter what. The only thing I might be doing is reporting you to the BBB as mentioned. You have SO many negative reviews dating back months and you still feel your customer service is at an acceptable level. You are blind! I feel it is a mistake to keep your customer service training in house, as I would currently give you a 2% rating out of 100% which clearly means your training techniques are NOT working. You choose to respond to reviews in a way that makes you look good. I have news for you, you are not good at your job whatsoever! And yes, we have been in your office multiple times, And dealt with people in person. AND FOR THE RECORD!!!! We only stopped reporting the heat issue because you REFUSED to handle it properly and I was about to rip my F-ing hair out. I have documented photos and videos of every single cold day we spent in that house. The fact that you chose to show publicly how many times we complained, actually helps my case 100% so thank you for that. I suggest you take my advice and hire someone for proper customer service and house management. It's simple, DO YOUR JOB OR QUIT, JENNIFER PS: if you would like to continue this "debate" about the grout, I will gladly show you the differenc in pictures! You did not report the grout being brown because it was so dirty that you thought brown was it's natural color. I repeat, NOT GODD AT YOUR JOB! Gross.

resp.text:
Brooke,
I apologize that you feel this way.  I do not recall us ever having the opportunity to meet and only recall speaking to you once regarding your notice to move out.  If you felt like I was rude I do apologize as this was not my intent whatsoever.

I do see from your work order history that there were 2 heat calls in 2015, 1 in 2016 and 2 in 2017 all of which were addressed and repaired.  The home you rented was an older home therefore having maintenance issues is not unheard of.  I pulled your move in inspection report and there is no notation of the grout being brown.  We appreciate you leaving the home in good move out condition.

While we certainly appreciate your offer to donate your deposit to training, we are handling our training internally with 100% focus on customer satisfaction.

Please call me at your convenience so we can discuss your concerns that you feel are illegal practices so I can address these issues immediately.  I look forward to hearing from you.

Jenny Moore
Vice President of Operations

name: Annette W
text: If you any other option please go with it. They are rude and grossly dishonest with tenants. Out of $1095 deposit only received $180 back with a very  vague explanation and no proof. Jenny Moore is very unprofessional was hung up over 5 time after asking for proof. Would not contact me after asking to be present for walk through, Never return calls or emails until it benefits them or too late for the Tenant.

resp.text:
Annette,
We are very sorry that you feel this way.  Our conversation Friday was discontinued promptly due to the language you were using.  I followed up with you immediately after the call via email by sending you and your husband a copy of the statement showing the move out charges that you requested.  On 7/19/17 you had asked what the charges would be and I replied to you letting you know you would receive this statement in the mail 45-60 days from move out.  I have since forwarded you pictures of all the cleaning items and repairs that were needed to get the home ready for the next resident.  I am unable to post them here.  If you still have further questions or concerns, please feel free to call our office and we will get this taken care of for you.

Jenny Moore
Vice President of Operations

name: Cole Sharp
text:
I have been renting a home from this company for almost 2 years now and will definitely not be renewing my lease. Throughout the entire lease I have had small issues that are slowly addressed by their maintenance company and poorly fixed. Recently we have been having major electrical issues that pose a serious problems. This issue has been recurring for over a month now and still not fixed. Every time you try and contact the company they transfer you to some "maintenance program" in another state. The "electrician" they sent over has been guessing in the dark for simple fixes and not made any effort to correctly resolve the issue. The company told me after about the third time this issue happened that he was more of a handy man they send out for all issues than an actual electrician.

If you rent from this company, do not expect them to work with you at all!!! Very poor service and extremely disappointed.

name: Joe Green
text: I have been very pleased my relationship with ARM. They have taken away a lot of the aches and pains of being an out of town landlord. The staff is very professional and gets back to you quickly, which I really appreciate.

name: Troy Shoemaker
text:
My fiancé and I have rented from AL Rental Managers and we have several problems occurring within our home. First of all, we have tried filing several maintenance requests which are pretty serious problems that could ruin the property. We have even traveled out to the main office to try and get the maintenance looked at before the worst happens and of course we still haven't heard anything back even after they said they would call us that day.
Also a lot of normal expenses aren't mentioned or really included in the lease, things like trash and normal pest control (This was a biggie because when we moved in, we felt like we were on that show Invaded because we had to fight skorpions, spiders, beetles, roaches, and other bugs for months before we could get a good night’s sleep since AL Rental obviously didn't think spraying between tenant was a good idea).
Renting from them has definitely taught me which questions to ask when renting from anyone ever again. I will never use this company or recommend to anyone.

name: Amanda Smith
text: Blake was a great help and perfect during the rental process!

resp.text: Thank you Amanda!  This is great to hear.  Please let us know if we can assist you further.

name: Lizzy Lee
text: I have been a resident at ARM for 7 year's now Terry Nova and her company has been very amazing to me and my family the beautiful homes that I lived in was absolutely gorgeous guiet and safe neighborhood i never had any bad vibes from ARM they treated us like we were family and now my lease will be up at the end of march so now I'm moving but guess what I looked on ARM website and found another beautiful gorgeous home in Mccalla that I'm moving to bc there's no other place I rather rent I'm about to sign my lease next week and Terry Nova and Blake and Kristen and there company has been very understanding,caring and amazing there's no other place I wld go to or absolutely rent from Alabama Rental Managers is one of the greatest companies to rent from and I give them all 5 stars so anybody out there that's looking for a good and beautiful place to rent go to arm website and check it out I guarantee u will absolutely luv this company and u will be very happy with your stay because I absolutely am very happy with my stay at arm so once I sign my lease I will be with this company another 2 years and longer so guys please check it out I promise u want b disappointed!!!! Thanks you Terry Nova and ur company for everything luv u guys 😘

resp.text: Thank you Liz.  We will pass your kind words on to Terri.  We look forward to having you as our valued customer for the next 2 years!  Please call us if we can ever assist you with anything.

name: Amber Rodriguez
text: Worst decision of my life!! Lies, deceit, They dont inspect their properties prior to renting.  Money..48 hour deposit scam.  They run you around until time is up. They are devils

name: Tiffany Mclaughlin
text: There is so much to say..I will start with the leasing administrator Kristen who is extremely incompetent, unknowledgeable about the rentals, you have to call her a million times to find out anything because she doesn't return phone calls and she's VERY rude. If you don't like dealing with the public then find a new job instead of being so rude and making us feel like we are beneath you. What's really sad is her having to resort to asking FRIENDS to write a good review about her after a bad one. Very obvious too. The REAL tenants that have dealt with her horrible attitude write REAL reviews. If she treated people better then she wouldn't have SO many people mention her in their bad reviews about ARM. I also found out that Kristen lied to me about a rental being taken. I found out she lied because a friend of hers wanted it. I got my information from someone in the company and they were more then forth coming about this and about the "friend reviews".Maryann who answers the phone for maintenance, is rude too and acts like your bothering her when u call to report something she must be miserable on the inside to act so hateful when you call. What is up with this staff?? Most of them not all but most act like they hate there job and that they are better then the renters. Why I dont understand because I've seen this group. They have no reason to be cocky. If I owned this company I wouldn't dare continue to employe and pay people who are so rude. The president of this company needs to read these reviews as well as the ones on Yelp and other sites. This should tell you something, the neighborhood we lived in has 5 rental homes. Everyone moved out after one lease except for one family. One of the homeowners in that neighborhood is selling bc of the rentals. The price they charged us for rent you would think the house would've been built well and have nice floors and appliances instead of the cheapest linoleum, cheapest horrible carpet, cheapest appliances and crappy construction. If we hadn't needing something ASAP we would've continued to look. These homes are in Odenville off Kelly Creek and were built in 2015. One of the homes foundation was cracking and the roof was warped looking. When you move out, they make you do everything so they dont have to lift a finger. They even make you hire a professional carpet cleaner. Along with a check list of what your required to clean and the price if you don't. There is a picture of the list on Yelp. One little thing not done and they deduct it from your deposit and they will be extremely picky I assure you. They want to charge 75 dollars if the yard isn't cut but when you move in the yard looks like a jungle. Just read the reviews folks. When there are WAY more bad reviews then good, on numerous sites, then you know it's the truth. All of the bad reviews state almost the exact same issues. Almost all of the good reviews are from people who are just starting to rent with this company and the other good ones seem coheraced, almost like they asked these people to write a good review to off set the bad ones. Go read the Yelp reviews and the Gripeo review. ARM was great to us when we were moving in but just give it time and their true colors come thru. It doesn't take long AT ALL. This company has the worst reviews of any other company in the area and what I find funny is they comment back on  the bad reviews trying to discredit the person and argue the review. Extremely unprofessional. Its obvious they are saying anything in hopes of convincing the reader its not as bad as it truly is. I'm sure they will comment back on this review pointing the finger at me however my former neighbors know the truth about this company and so does alot of others. I'm sure there are some bad tenants but nowhere near as many as the bad reviews. The problem IS NOT the tenants, the problem is this company and the people who work for it. Save yourself money and distress. Rent with a company that cares about it's tenants and the quality of their rental homes. Read the Yelp reviews and the Gripeo review.

name: Troy Shoemaker
text:
My fiancé and I have rented from AL Rental Managers and we have several problems occurring within our home. First of all, we have tried filing several maintenance requests which are pretty serious problems that could ruin the property. We have even traveled out to the main office to try and get the maintenance looked at before the worst happens and of course we still haven't heard anything back even after they said they would call us that day.
Also a lot of normal expenses aren't mentioned or really included in the lease, things like trash and normal pest control (This was a biggie because when we moved in, we felt like we were on that show Invaded because we had to fight skorpions, spiders, beetles, roaches, and other bugs for months before we could get a good night’s sleep since AL Rental obviously didn't think spraying between tenant was a good idea).
Renting from them has definitely taught me which questions to ask when renting from anyone ever again. I will never use this company or recommend to anyone.

name: W Price
text:
This company placed a tenant in my townhouse that virtually destroyed the inside of it.  They stated they would do quarterly walk-throughs, to look for damage/misuse/etc., but obviously never did.
When I first handed my property over to them for rental, they never placed a sign in the yard or on the nearest major road for passerbys.  It was only until I complained that they did so.
I'm not really sure what they were paid to do, since they didn't protect my property from damage or supply maintenance (you pay for your own repairs).  You have to put 1 month's rent down and they get a 10% cut every month.
I was stuck with around $2K worth of damages and 2 months of back payment on my mortgage.
I almost lost my townhouse through foreclosure and part of that falls on AL Rental Managers.
I would not recommend this company to anybody for rental management.

resp.text:
I recently joined Alabama Rental Managers as the Vice President of Operations.  Our company's number one priority is to provide excellent customer service.  I apologize your experience was not a positive one.

We have taken great measures to add qualified team members and new procedures to better assist our home owners and our residents.  We have implemented new processes as it pertains to new inventory which includes the placement of a sign, photographs and a virtual tour within 48 hours of the agreement being signed by the home owner.

Inspections are done by home owner request and we are in the process of rolling out pre-move out inspections and random inspections which will be done twice per year.

Thank you again for your feedback, your feedback is important to us.

name: Ingrid Schnader
text:
I'm in a 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment at Vestavia Place. There are many reasons why I love staying in my apartment!
1. My apartment faces pretty much a forest, so if I'm out on my balcony, I have an awesome view and a lot of privacy. I love even sitting on my couch with the blinds open and looking out of the window and hearing the birds chirping.
2. These apartments are spacious. Kitchen is narrow, but there is lots of countertop space and cabinet storage space. I also have a coat closet, a pantry (probably supposed to be linen closet, but I put my food there), a walk-in laundry room and two huge bedroom closets. My bedroom is big enough for a king bed. The dining area is big enough for my parent's hand-me-down kitchen table and china cabinet.
3. For the space you get, the price is right. They're always doing rent specials too, so be sure to ask management what the current special is. When I signed up, I got $300 off my first 3 months of rent, and I really needed that.
4. Dog park! This complex is so dog-friendly, and my poodle loves the dog park. All of my friends want to meet me at my complex with their dogs so we can have puppy play dates.
5. Pool and gym... they've been under construction, but they look awesome, and I can't wait to try them out.
6. Community-wide wifi. It's fast and reliable, and because it's community-wide, it's way cheaper than if you set up wifi yourself.
7. You can save up for apartment upgrades through their "Dasmen points" system. You get points for paying rent on time, referring a friend to move in, etc. Points can be redeemed for new shower head, new smart thermostat, or even a stainless steel appliance package for your kitchen.
8. Super safe. I have walked laps around the community at 9-10 p.m. with no issues or fears.
9. SUPER FRIENDLY staff! They all seem to know me and my dog by name. They always smile and wave when they see you. Very responsive via email.
10. Very quiet.  The way the apartments are set up, my living room doesn't share a wall with any neighbors. So you're never kept up at night from a loud TV or music.

My only complaints...
1. I'm not a fan of my carpet. My friend lives in a first floor unit — these have a beautiful vinyl plank flooring in the living room. But I was told that 2nd and 3rd floor units have carpet (for the sound barrier). I'm saving up for a nice rug to put in my living room.
2. They have stands for doggy bags around the complex, but they're always empty. So not every resident cleans up after their pets.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review our community. We are very pleased to hear that you have had a great experience here, and we appreciate you as a resident! Let us know if you need anything.

name: amber l
text: Terrible maintenance team. The office never follows up on any calls or requests. My AC is leaking all over the place and the plumbing is backed up.

name: Paige Dixon
text: Do not rent from Vestavia Place unless you want the next few years of your life to be consumed by a nightmare of maintenance issues, incorrect charges, and incompetent staff. I moved out over a year ago and they are still giving me problems. I lived in a one bedroom for a year and a half and a three bedroom for a year. The maintenance issues I experienced were almost unbelievable, from my hot water being out for two full weeks to kids stealing a pipe off the exterior wall and flooding my laundry room. Most issues were blamed on me as a tenant even though the problems were structural or with VSP equipment. Trying to get them fixed was a huge mess of red tape and constant reminders. Most amenities for which tenants are charged (pool, gym, etc) were not in working order most of the time (pre-COVID). I have never experienced a company with incompetence on such a broad scale, ranging from office staff to corporate. I regret ever living here in the first place and I can’t seem to escape even now.

resp.text: We are sorry you did not have a better experience here at Vestavia Place. We pride ourselves in professional management services. If you feel you are not getting the service you deserve, please e-mail management@dasmenresidential.com so we may address accordingly.

We recently implemented a new program at DASMEN to automatically notify past residents with a balance allowing them to easily pay online & setup payment plans! We apologize that we haven’t reached out to you sooner, if you have any questions about your balance feel free to email collections@dasmenresidential.com for assistance.

text: I recently moved in November and have had problems since I got here. Now I’m dealing with plumbing issues... water coming from every which way. We’ve called Saturday Dec. 28th and told them and they sent the maintenance man out. Well the problem was not resolved. Water has still been coming out everywhere, we’ve called and was told every time a plumber is coming out. No plumber has come out yet and it is now Jan. 1st!! Tissue with feces is coming up out of the toilet, it’s coming up in the tub and sink! This is ridiculous. Do not come stay here if you can help it! I normally do not leave reviews but I am fed up! My child can’t even walk around with just socks on. Why does he have to walk around his home with shoes on!?

resp.text: Hello Brittany, we have reviewed your comments about our community and are sorry to hear they are not more positive. We take issues like yours very seriously and have contacted the Property Manager Kim. She will be reaching out to provide some assistance. Thank you!

name: Rebecca Fox
text:
I have been living at Vestavia Place apartments since the middle of October. I could not say more positive things about this apartment. The management staff is very friendly and truly make you feel like you are at home. There are community events all the time for residents and the management staff know me by name each time I come in or reach out. The maintenance staff is very courteous and quick to resolve any issues (all of mine have been incredibly minor). I live in a one bedroom apartment and I always get compliments on how spacious it is - the space is very smartly laid out. I can fit a full queen bedroom suite in my bedroom which was difficult to find with one bedroom apartments. It is also the only apartment that I have found that actually had a dedicated laundry room rather than a washer and dryer unit being in the kitchen or bathroom. The only negative I would say on that is that technically it could fit a full sized washer and dryer but I went for a stackable unit so I wouldn't loose accessibility to the extra shelving in the laundry room. Closet space in this apartment is PERFECT and I actually have enough storage space (there is extra storage in the laundry room and two large closets in the bedroom). The community is very quiet and all of my neighbors are very friendly. As a single woman, safety is important to me, and I feel very safe in this community and have no reservations about taking my dog out at night.

The community is kind of tucked away but it is also very close to a neighborhood Wal Mart and gas stations as well as downtown Birmingham so you don't feel like you are too far away from anything.

I would recommend this apartment to anyone.

resp.text: Hi Rebecca, thanks for the positive review! We are very happy to have you as a Vestavia Place resident and are looking forward to many more years together. Have a very wonderful week!

name: Sheila Wiggins
text: Update the reason why I rated this apartment complex a 1 is because since the new property manager took over things has gotten out of hand, the staff is very unprofessional, they do not have a good form of communication, I've given a 30 day notice 6/7/19  because they increased the rent on my 2 bedroom apartment after a yr of staying, I wrote a review previously and was asked to take it down which i did and made a mutual agreement to vacay the property on 7/7/2019, I was called about a week later and was told that my 30 day notice was cancelled, I told the young lady i did not cancel my 30 day notice and that i would be leaving the property on 7/7/19 Im not comfortable paying what they are asking for a 2 bedroom, not to mention my lease is up and i will not be renewing it, I spoke with someone today to get my renters insurance info and was told that i still have to pay July's full rent even if Im moving on the 7th, because my notice was updated to a 60 day notice,I explained that I talked to the leasing manger and that's not the agreement that we made the young lady began to get flustered and started to be very rude and agitated(over talking me), so i asked her to have her manager contact me I'm just not comfortable at this point I have been a great tenant since I've moved in this complex, things just are not the same since Lynn and Sabrina are no longer over this property Kim tries her best to be civil when speaking with me but she just has IDC (i dont care) attitude. I feel like they are trying to force me to stay against my will. I could understand if i was charged for 1-7 but not for the whole month and how can you force someone to stay somewhere they just don't want to not because of the property but because of management and the office staff.,CONTINUED on 7/17 So i got a 7 day notice and finally got a returned call back, I believe her name is Shannon, this was the same lady that I spoke with when i gave my 30 day notice the same lady that asked me to remove my last review, she really just tried to handle me!!!  she said they are starting the eviction process LADY I wanted to move 7/7/19 you kept me here (against my will just didn't want a negative mark on my credit so i complied) and said i would pay this month rent when I turn in my key because of lies and miscommunication she told me before I just cant trust anything she says at this point, so I agreed that I would pay July's rent in full when I'm moving out you know make one payment and be done, she told me "that would not acceptable very RUDELY and because they are filing for an eviction I would have to pay the legal fees!!!! I'm sorry but if my memory serves me correctly I didn't want to stay here either!!! I've already paid my 1st month and security at my new house because I thought I would be out of this apartment on 7/7,  however that was not the case, I have no problem with paying my rent, again I've never had a late fee, never had a 7 day notice good tenant no complaints no nothing!!!I just do not trust the office staff so i would pay everything when i turned in the key I have the money to pay i just dont want them to say i owe anything else, Ive asked on several occasion to speak with someone higher then Shannon she says they are going to tell you the same thing, at this point I wouldn't personally  recommend this place to a fleas on a dogs balls, the apartments needs updates and lets not talk about how high your power bill is going to be because the heating and air conditions are older the Christ him self. BEWARE of this rental company im over it and almost out this place.Actually thinking about calling FOX 6 news on them for this harassment

name: AM MR
text:
UPDATE NOVEMBER 3.  THEY HAVE COME ABOUT MY THERMOSTAT SOOOOOOOO MANY TIMES AND TODAY IT IS BLOWING.  FAN WILL NOT STOP BLOWING.  IT'S BEEN IN OFF POSITION FOR HOURS.  THEY HAVE COME FIVE TIMES TO FIX IT.

UPDATED NOV 1, 2018 The leak is back.  I have had a few weeks of dry floors.  I wake up to moisture and rot again.  Do not move here.  I lived in Unit 2735 A, a 3 bedroom, for one year.  The master bedroom was the worst bathroom with water periodically oozing out of floor coming from the pipes in the wall behind the toilet and sometimes from the toilet tank (which joins the kitchen on the other side, where the washing machine has to be located.  Black mold or rot of moulding  behind the wall where the water is.  NEVER FIXED.  THEY COME.  THEY DISTURB.  THEY MOP UP WATER.  THEY SAY FIXED.  IT'S NOT FIXED.  THEY CAME FIVE TIMES BEFORE IT STOPPED.  I DO BELIEVE THAT THE MAINTENANCE INCOMPETENT OR INTENTIONALLY PROVOKING EARLY RENT PAYING TENANTS BY NOT FIXING ISSUES.  THE THERMOSTAT FAN RUNS AND WILL NOT TURN OFF.  FOR THIS ISSUE I HAVE CALLED THREE TIMES.  BARRY HAS COME OUT THREE TIMES.  FINALLY, IT STILL BLOWS AND I HAVE TURNED OFF THE CIRCUIT BREAKER TO TURN FAN OFF.  THERE IS NO POOL.  BASICALLY, IF YOU MUST LIVE IN A 3 BEDROOM, YOU WILL BE MOVING TO THE GHETTO AND PAYING 1049 FOR RENT, 80 FOR TRASH AND SEWER AND 30 FOR WATER.  I HAVE NEVER SEEN A MORE INCOMPETENT MANAGEMENT TEAM.  I'M SORRY TO HAVE TO SAY THAT IF YOU CAN DO BETTER, YOU SHOULD.  UNFORTUNATELY, THESE APARTMENTS KNOW THAT TO ATTEND THE SCHOOLS IN VESTAVIA,  A LOT OF US MUST LIVE IN THESE APARTMENTS.  IT IS DISPICABLE!!!!  WATER EVEN COMES INTO ONE OF THE BEDROOMS FROM OUTSIDE AND WETS THE CARPET ALONG THE MOULDING IN DAUGHTER'S ROOM.  THEY COME.  THEY LOOK.  THEY DO NOTHING.  WHY?  BECAUSE WITHOUT A FULL RENOVATION, SOME OF THESE THINGS AREN'T A CHEAP FIX. I TRIED TO UPLOAD VIDEO OF THE ROTTING MOULDING EVERYWHERE BUT FOR SOME INTERESTING REASON, I CANNOT GET THE VIDEO LOADED.  I WILL UPLOAD PHOTOS SOON!  BY THE WAY, THEY CAME BY TODAY AND I STILL SEE FRESH WATER BEHIND THE TOILET!!!!! IT IS NEVER FIXED, YET YOU GET TO TAKE TIME OUT OF YOUR PRECIOUS TIME TO TALK ABOUT MAINTENANCE DAY AFTER DAY AFTER DAY AFTER DAY, YET THEY COME OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER.  IT SEEMS LIKE A COURT OF LAW WOULD MAKE THEM ACTUALLY FIX THE PROBLEM AS OPPOSED TO COMING TO ADD GLUE TO A PIPE.  THEY ARE LAUGHABLE.  YET I PAY 1049 PLUS 100 IN CORRUPT WATER AND SEWER CHARGES.

name: Celeste Rodgers
text: I have had nothing but headaches since moving into this apartment complex a little over a year ago. On the outside the apartments look nice and are in a good location (hence the two stars), but on the inside they are a complete disaster. To begin with, when I first moved in all the stainless steel appliances they boasted about were not yet fully assembled. When I first opened up the oven and dishwasher I was shocked to find pvc pipes, tubes, and screws just sitting inside them. Also half the light fixtures were without bulbs. I thought maybe they didn’t have the place fully set up yet and called and they fixed it after a few days. Without a working oven at first and having just moved to a new town, I went out and got some microwave dinners... that’s when I found shock number two. If the TV and living room lights are on and you use the microwave for longer than 60 seconds the power shorts out. They had an electrician come look at it and he told me the wiring was all done wrong and there was nothing he could do. Still to this day I only microwave in thirty second increments to avoid having to use the flashlight on my phone to find the breaker box and reset the power. The next issue I found was that the apartment is on a slant and the floors are uneven. So I had to completely rearrange the furniture in my room to keep the drawers in my chest from sliding out or my TV from being dangerously close to tipping over. The next issue was the plumbing... still to this day from time to time after having had it “fixed” three times all the sinks and tub in my apartment will randomly start filling from the bottom up with dirty water. My neighbor tells me it’s done the same for him too. It’s disgusting and I refuse to take baths and only shower because of it. Also when the Neighboor uses his food disposal the gunk starts pouring in from the bottom up on my side... a nasty surprise to have when cooking diner in the kitchen. And another major issue I had was there was no functioning cable connection when I arrived. The cable wire had been cut out of the wall by the construction crew. Charter made me get written permission from the complex to instal a new one, which took ages to get. My installation fee and labor fee came to  $83, and the complex refused to pay more than $30 because that was their “policy”, despite having promised functioning cable connections in the rent agreement. I could go on about issues in my apartment forever, but I’ll stick to those main issues. The next problem I want to warn any future residents about is that the complex is misleading when saying they have a gym and self laundry service. The laundry room is under construction and has been since summer so is completely closed, and the gym was turned into a storage room “temporarily” for several months now as well so is closed too. The pool didn’t open until mid summer and would only be open a few hours on certain days, which apparently the office didn’t know because several times I called to see if it was open before going only to pack everything and get down there to find it chained up with a big closed sign on it. Also the trash valet service is a mandatory $15/month fee, and they only pick up your trash after it’s been sitting out for days. Oh and  the “cafe” is a kerig set up in the main office lol. Which gets me to the main office... good luck dealing with them. Management has turned over hands three times in the year I have lived here. Nobody ever knows what is going on and you get different answers from different people. Not to mention their hours are constantly changing, they will take one and two hour lunch breaks, and they close frequently for the most random of holidays I’ve ever heard of. So good luck if you work a full time job trying to find a time when you are off and they are open to pick your packages up. I would not recommend this apartment complex.

name: Nina Mayberry Ali
text:
I moved here from up North and before my family relocated we did lots of different reviews being Birmingham was such a bad reputation, Vestaiva Hills was the second best City area outside of Mountain brook, The first Apts which we moved to directly across the street from Vesta, Place was nasty infested with water bugs ad the Town- homes were infested with large Rats, so we gave notice, and they allowed us to break our lease. We then moved to Vestavia Place, The water bugs was awful the grounds was not kept and I had to make a police report agent the downstairs neighbor for Threatened me and my grandchildren several times, Although I was not afraid I decided to let the Law handle it, and she was evicted.

The  staff including the management team as changed more then five times in 15 months there is always new staff. The pool and workout room and Laundry room was closed all summer, and never once have they offered the residence any kind of prorated rent for our inconvenience, Our Apartment has several  internal and external problems  . When it rain it rains inside our kitchen and Mater Bathroom we have to put buckets in both rooms to catch the rain I have videos of the rain coming in. All the floors are cracked underneath the carpet , they have sent several floor guys in and each of them stated the floors need to be redone throughout the entire Property being they are over fifty years old, so when walking through the Apartment I can feel and hear the cracked floor. The leaves are never removed they just blow them onto the grass so we never have beautiful green grass its leaves and dirt everywhere, I had to request for them to repair the Hallway Bathroom the flooring was lifting up molding around the tub was coming off all the vents throughout the unit was full of dust it was nasty my husband and I had to do most of the deep cleaning to even move in, They had promised new appliances at move in instead they had old discoloring Mitch matched stove and refrigerator there, after a couple of weeks they finally replaced them.

When we moved in we had ATT after the second week they told us we couldn't use ATT every resident must have Spectrum, so we were penalized  for breaking our ATT contract. Spectrum service are so awful everyday between 6pm and 9pm the internet works like a dial up service because so many people are logged on at once in this area. Just when we thought it couldn't get any worse  Vestaia Place/ Mountain Lodge Apt had Spectrum come in and rewire every united, Throughout December their has been strange men six or more walking through my home. Once I woke up to them in my Living room saying they was Spectrum yes the Apartment Manager had gave out everybody Apartment keys for these strangers to enter each united. On Wednesday Dec 19th they returned several of them they were in the attic which is connected to the bathroom in my bedroom. I asked them were was the Maintenance or Management because  I was uncomfortable leaving them in my home with my key. Spectrum employee re-insured me they would not be in the Apart alone he lied! When I returned I noticed things out of place  my husband sliver chain that was on the sink was gone, so I started to check around and notice my 35mm cameras was gone and two  Zizio remotes to both our band new Tvs. I had just deep cleaned my home and laid two remotes under ever Tv I know they were there. The chain I had just cleaned and my camera was on the table next to my bed because I sell online I was just using it the night before.
They didn't re hook the cable I had to move everything back and re hook all the cable cords a neighbor said the office never came spectrum locked the door with my key. I am headed today December 21st to make a Police report because the  Property Manager refuse to handle the problem or give my husband the Corporate office number. Before Spectrum she sent five Spanish guys in my Apartment saying they were the floor guys they to had my Apartment key, now uniform business cards nothing yet once again Vestavia Place gave Strangers my Apartment Key.

name: Markedia Stafford
text:
There must be some incentive for leaving 5 star reviews... Because I have not been so fortunate to experience any of the great things they are referencing.

I'm sure Josh is a kind and hard worker (never met him), but that does not make actually living in this apartment complex a pleasant experience.

I have lived here for just over a year and this has by far been my worst residential experience.

The rennovations within these units were very poorly done. I look around in my apartment and feel as though this place could fall apart at any moment.

The plumbing within these units is also terrible. I have completed countless maintenance requests for no resolve. I have also been asked to no longer use the shower in my bedroom, because it causes a leak in the apartment below me.

Maintenance has even come to cut a portion of a wall out to resolve plumbing issues. I never got a completion notice and the wall was never repaired.

You should also be prepared for the water within the complex to be turned off without notice, for repairs that could take hours.

The HVAC System also works poorly and the age of this unit causes it to be quite drafty so expect high utilities expense.

The keys to my apartment somehow were "misplaced" by the leasing office. I was not informed by the leasing office, but by maintenance men when they came and knocked on my door asking for a copy of my key.
It was very difficult to take this up with anyone in the leasing office, because the turn over here is crazy. Very rare that I've walked into this office and seen the same face twice. (HUGE RED FLAG IN TERMS OF SAFETY FOR RESIDENTS)

The walls are very thin... You'll hear EVERYTHING your neighbors are doing and the outdoors areas are not kept clean.

Please also be prepared for whatever goes down your neighbors kitchen sink/garbage disposal because it will come up through yours and the smell is deathly.

And the list goes on and on...

My suggestion: Before you stop into the leasing office, I suggest you drive through this complex and take a good hard look before they glaze you over with things that sound awesome and show you model apartments that would not actually stand up to everyday living.

Also, read EVERY review!

resp.text:
Hi Juanita,

Thank you for your review.  I'm sorry that you're having a hard time getting along with your neighbors.  If there are any outstanding items in your apartment, please let us know.  I checked our system and do not see any recently opened work orders.  We are here, please give us a call.

name: Adam Pope
text:
Good neighbors, horrible service. Lived here for two years. Had A/C and heat go out at least 6 or 7 times. A/C is VERY OLD with no replacement in sight. A/C has leaked in washroom multiple times.

Dishwasher and garbage disposal issues leave deathly smell in apartment.

If you live on the first floor, beware of water leaking through bathroom vents at any given time.

Walls and ceiling are VERY thin. You can hear everything. EVERYTHING.

Ownership has changed 3 or 4 times in the two years I lived here (2015-17).

Do not expect emergency service after hours because company hasn't even bothered to update their old voicemail to reflect ownership change.

Go live in Woodmere Creek Apartments. Just a few minutes away. Maybe a little more money, but less hassle and fewer problems.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  I’m sorry to hear that you have had anything less than a 5-star experience.  Please call us at your earliest convenience so we may learn more about what happened, in effort to reach an amicable resolution.  Thank you!

name: Qui Haygood
text:
Apartments change owership as they sometimes due, but I would have to say that I have been here since August of 2016 and we have experienced at least, three or four.

The blessing in all of that mess was that once it was officially changed over to Vestavia Place, the last two managers including Ms. Chistie and, now, Ms. Sabrina have made this place a joy to call home. We have maintence staff who are friendly and professional while in your home. Issues are usually handled in a reasonable time with some exceptions.

The seclusion and peace that my little peace of heaven offers is worth giving this place a look if you are in the market for a good stepping stone. I would not suggest this place for long-term living. The high turn over of office staff will make your head spin and there are more than a few foundational issues in the buildings themselves. There was a remodeling project started last summer that has yet to be completed.

I do feel the pool is safe enough during the summer to allow my little ones to splash around and have been graced with a few great neighbors in my particular building. I don't really venture out beyond that. I also appreciate that this is a dog friendly complex. The complex is kind of cut out of and into a wooded area so the dogs get the run of the few grass areas available, but are kept completely clear ofhe toddler-friendly play area. t

The gym is figureprint monitored which makes me feel safe when I'm in there early mornings or late nights alone. I never feel afraid to walk the complex at night because of the on-site officer and the pleasant people your run in to sometimes.

This place does certainly have its pros and cons. And there have been some extremely horrible office staff and management. Also, beware of the water bill. That is the only utility issue that has yet to be addressed since I moved in (2016- present) and the bill climbs higher every two months with no explaination.

I've been able to raise a family here and I don't regret my choice, but I would not suggest spending more than 3 years here AS-IS.

name: FLhogs n dogs
text:
False advertising on listings.  Unethical.  Posting houses active that are under contract, etc.  Entire matter filed with Alabama Association of Realtors.

Standard of Practice 12-8
The obligation to present a true picture in representations to the public includes information presented, provided, or displayed on REALTORS®’ websites. REALTORS® shall use reasonable efforts to ensure that information on their websites is current. When it becomes apparent that information on a REALTOR®’s website is no longer current or accurate, REALTORS® shall promptly take corrective action. (Adopted 1/07)

resp.text: ValleyMLS, of which this company is a member, requires that all listings that go under contact reflect that status change within 24 hours of ratification of such contract. This company adheres to the policy of the ValleyMLS.

text: I did not choose to work with anyone from this inconsistent office but had no choice after one of their realtors bought the property I live in from rocket city property management. If you owe a business, arent they supposed to send you a letter or written notice? They are so unprofessional because not only did I get ZERO letters, in the lease it stated I was to pay 45$ for late fee not 50$ so someone is not able to ensure things are consistent in this office anymore. I would not recommend dealing with this office whatsoever. They raised my rent and took three weeks to stop a huge rain water leak I had coming through my ceiling, and let me go without a working fridge for nearly a week while leaving two fridges in the tiny apartment for two weeks for storage not able to use either one. It has just been a ridiculous experience I am hoping there is a still a decent place to rent from in this area but so far this place has done me wrong totally I got two babies under 2.  Can’t afford unnecessary extra charges, rent going up, and not having a fridge. Just ridiculous and sad. I cannot wait to move.

text: If I could give ZERO stars I would! I helped my mother rent a home that Management Apex managed. Upon move in, it was filthy and things were broken and in disrepair. I have many photos and videos. These items were all eventually repaired or we were reimbursed because we had to pay for them ourselves but it took months to actually resolve. The WORST is my mother is a military widow on a fixed income and does have some health issues. The A/C unit went out in her rental home and she has been without A/C for 16 days thus far while temperatures are in the high 80s-90s. Management Apex solution? Send a small portable unit that is only meant to cool a 12X12 space and consistently tell us that, "our hands are tied" or "we must use the owner's warranty company". SO, in the meantime, my mom is just supposed to endure 80-90 degree heat in her home that she PAID for. Take our advice DO NOT do business with this company. Hire an attorney, report to the Alabama General Attorney's Office, report to the Better Business Bureau and the local news stations. Treating people like this will put you out of business.

We could not ask for a better property management team that worked with us, giving 5 star professional service, from moving in to renewing another year lease through them. Laura Clemons & Shawn Kent have been spectacular to work with. Laura is exemplary in her email response. They are a small office and you always know they are working hard for their owners and tenants. Shawn did our move in inspection and later met with us to make sure things were going fine at our rental property a few months after moving in. As a homeowner of a house out of state, we wish Management Apex was our Property Management company! Homeowners have peace of mind that they are protecting their financial investment but also making sure the tenants are taken care of and ensuring the entire process meets all needs.  So whether you are looking to rent your home or need a place to rent, you can have complete confidence in Management Apex, their services, and especially their outstanding team of professionals! They have helped secure companies to cut our grass, weed & pest control, and pointing us in the right direction with any questions- being new to the area-that has made our experience second to none! Welcome home to Management Apex!

Many Thanks,
Chris & Amanda Cureton

name: Tyler Nau
text:
This has been the worst HOA company in Alabama. Avoid doing any business with them. This company was a huge waste of our time and money. Please do your research before using them.

There are so many other successful competitors in this market. Why waste your time an money here? Pay that little bit extra, for a professional company with proven results. It’s going to take several days before they even return your call. They are best known for adding unnecessary fees etc. to your bill. I should have charged them a “$100” fee each time they wasted my valuable time. Instead they will create ways to overcharge you with fines and fees.

The current field inspector Sam Benefield, is a total joke. Hopefully this company has set up some additional training programs for him to be successful in the future. He has a long way to go, to be considered a seasoned field inspector. However, Jesse is a good guy. Jesse is just trying to keep this failing company afloat. I will try to attach/share some photos and emails of our conversations in the comments below. This should help you make a smart informed decision, before getting into a contract with this failed part-time business. Please feel free to reach out to me for any additional personal feedback.

name: HJ Sullivan
text: I have not rented from them, but my experience was NOT good with this company. I scheduled an appointment to view the property and the person responsible for showing me the property did not show. The worst of it was that I traveled from Birmingham, AL and my time was wasted. I will definitely NOT be a customer nor a tenant of this company.

name: Katie Milliken
text: If I could give them 0 stars I would. I've owned a home for a little over a year now, and they never sent me information in the first place on where to pay my HOA fees. Then I got a message from my real estate agent that they were sending my fees to collections. If I had the information on where to pay or who the company was, I would have gladly done it. Instead I had to hunt them down myself. Come to find out, you can never get a hold of anyone in the office anyway. I left several messages and never gotten a call back,  Thankfully, my subdivision was recently taken over by a new management company, and I have had ZERO problems from them.

name: Barry Bryan
text: The company has assisted me in the purchase and sale of two single family properties and AJ went above and beyond on the last purchase due to delays from HomeTelos. She is current on market rents and knowledgeable of the sub markets. I intend to use her services for many more purchases, sales and rental of properties. Extremely pleased with the service.

name: Andrea Crowder
text:
Interestingly, you will find almost all the top reviews are written by people who don't actually work with Management Apex - just hang out with them and "watch" from the sidelines.

We rented through Management Apex for two years. They were AWFUL! We had much better management through other companies - who would send someone to fix problems when there were issues. For the last couple months of our time there, the hot water heater was broken. It was leaking out horrible, nasty water (I'd be glad to share a picture here if there is any question on that). I was in touch with them and eventually heard back from an email that the owner didn't seem to want to fix it, so we're left with that. My whole family was sick during this time.

We were amazing renters. During our two years there we replaced all three toilets (that were stained beyond repair and had flushing issues) with high end TOTO toilets, replaced the dishwasher (that was spitting out black stuff and hair into our dishes and then into empty loads right after we got there), replaced a bench out front (that was broken wood with exposed, rusted screws), put protective doorstops behind each door (where they had gone through the walls behind them before we moved in), and repaired a rotting fence on multiple occasions. Once, and entire chunk of the fence fell down exposing the back yard to a busy road. We repaired that too.

At the end of our lease they did not return any money, or contact us, within the 60 day timeline. Because nobody would answer our calls or emails, we ended up going into the office after that time. We were first told that they weren't in the office (after the receptionist went down the hall to talk to them) and then she ended up finding someone for us - who told us that he hadn't gotten around to it. We waited. Eventually he came out with a partial check. Apparently after we moved out the owner had the rotten fence ripped down and a new fence installed - and they decided to charge us money for new gates (new double gate is what was circled on the invoice). We never had a double gate while living there. It would have been nice because we would have then been able to take our riding lawnmower into both yards rather than have a separate mower for each yard.

And while we have never met the owner - I am inclined to believe that they have just as crappy of service on that side as well. Hence the reason he pulled his properties from them and had them listed with a new company the day after we were gone. Even though our checks were always in before the first of the month, if they had to wait for a check from them like we did, I don't blame him one bit!

If you want a decent company, whether as owner or tenant, I suggest you look elsewhere. One star is 20%. Management Apex does not deserve 20%.

Any questions? I'd be glad to share more.

name: Brittany Watkins
text: Here is a tip for you...  Have all the homeowners, who use you as a rental property management company, write down in the paperwork they give to you ALL of the appliances they include in their rental property along with make and model.  I say this because NO TENANT should have to take off work to get this information for you or the repairmen.  It would be already done it would reduce the time GREATLY. I understand you want to save money and so does the homeowner, but it is unacceptable and poor service to have the TENANT do this for you.  TENANTS should not have to take off work because of your poor management skills. A LACK OF PLANNING ON YOUR PART DOESN’T CONSTITUTE AN EMERGENCY ON MINE

name: Brittne Parsons
text: One of the main issues I have is the pool. We were promised a pass code to open the gate, but instead were told to just reach around and turn the nob. I know people use our pool who do not live in our neighborhood. Also, the bathrooms are dirty and is usually out of toilet paper.  I really do not feel like I get what I pay for.

resp.text: Your concerns are important to us, and we will be addressing them immediately.

given them a consequence for violations.

We are expecting to have a great experience at the Villas at Jones Valley and expect our retirement years not to be disrupted with the normal hassles of homeownership.
