text: I have called several times and had to leave a message because no one ever answers the phone. I  call them about an issue, the same issue everytime, and not once has anyone called me back.  They haven't taken care of the problem because of course I had to call and leave a message again this morning,  so they haven't taken care of it.  It is very frustrating to me to pay them their fee every year and get nothing in return. I'm sure they would call non stop if I  didn't pay them.  Yet they get paid and can't answer the phone or deal with problems that we have. Very disappointed!

resp.text:
The team member who fields HOA calls is typically out of the office between 10:00 - 3:00 each day performing community tours and home inspections. Calls are returned either when they return to the office in the afternoon, or the following morning.

Specifically related to this Resident, our Team member has spoken with them on the phone. Additionally, our Team member has shared this Resident's concern with the Board for their community. The challenge at hand has been approached from a few angles, including notification letters and calls to the police.

Please understand that the issue we are dealing with here is a difficult one, and we have made numerous attempts to resolve. The violation we are dealing with goes beyond the authority of an HOA manager, and should be reported by this Resident and other Resident's of this community to the local authorities.

name: Valerie Johnson
text: Management Apex is a reliable property management company with great people to work with!

name: margaret lessa
text: Terrible company, You can never get a hold of a live person on the phone ever. Tried to rent several properties and tried to contact someone for over a week, couldn't even get back to me at all.

name: Bubba Stallings
text:
Terrible service for HOA.  Never answer the phone, never respond to emails, never actually provide any type of tangible service.

They are contracted by builders to run an HOA and never give homeowners the opportunity to actually have a voice on the HOA board.

We have had them as our HOA manager and have wanted to discontinue service the entire time, but the builder in our community has constantly renewed their contract.  The builder is another story but I won't include the discrepancies of Hunter/American Homes on this page.

For some reason, they can't even get their act together to even receive payment for services, then they charge you a late fee because they don't put enough effort into their payment process.

They say that they have yearly HOA meetings - I have only been to one that was actually told to the community.  There were nothing but complaints in the meeting from the entire group, and nothing was resolved.

I would not be surprised if other communities are not having the same problem.  I would be really surprised in no legal actions have been taken against this company.

resp.text: We surely don't like hearing of dis-satisfied residents, and are willing to listen to your concerns. Please feel free to contact us at 256-704-2112 so we can address any specific concerns within our contractual obligations. Respectfully.

name: Kathleen Dunseith
text:
I have been dealing with Amanda Howard Reality/Management Apex for over a year. When I purchased my home I was not notified there was an HOA and remained unaware for 4 YEARS. I was notified there was an HOA and tried to find a way to be exempt (considering that I would not have bought the home had I known) to no avail. I called multiple times with no returned calls. The only way I ever spoke with someone was by showing up at the office. I kept getting the run around and "I will have to get back to you on that" - which they never did. Last year I spoke with someone and thought we had settled it that I would pay the dues owed since finding out we had an HOA (starting in 2014) and I have done this. This year, I get a notification that they are still trying to collect on the previous years and when I brought up the arrangement I was told "Sorry for the miscommunication."
They are trying to charge me HOA dues for the 4 years I owned my home but did not know there was an HOA. They didn't even manage the HOA at that time.
I would not use this company or Amanda Howard's if they were the last ones on Earth.

resp.text: Disclosing that a buyer is purchasing a home in a covenant restricted community is not the responsibility of a HOA management company. A HOA manager does not even have the buyer's information until this information is sent by the closing attorney. A HOA manager is however responsible for collecting annual dues. A HOA manager also does not have the authority to waive charges, this can only be approved by the Association's Board. In this particular matter, our company was provided with financial records from the previous HOA manager. These records indicated that this Resident had an outstanding balance. We are attempting to collect on delinquent accounts to better the financial situation for the association. In an effort to avoid the lien process, we have offered installment plans to assist Residents in bringing their accounts current.

name: Nikki Truong
text: Stay away from renting any property managed by this company. They will find any reason to keep your security deposit and hold you responsible for problems that are structural and had nothing to do with anything you did to the property.

resp.text: We are always disappointed to hear that someone was not happy with services rendered with us.  We try to learn from instances where a party didn't leave happy.  I am not sure how we could have avoided keeping your security deposit with all the water damage caused by your negligence.  Your security deposit didn't even cover the full amount you owe (please remit payment as soon as possible for your balance).  Also please know that if the owner hadn't decided to submit an insurance claim you would have been responsible for a lot more than the deductible.

name: Chloe S
text: We have been in our rental only six months and have dealt with multiple bug infestations, squirrels in the attic, mold in the showers, and now a part of the ceiling is caving in and when it rains, it literally pours inside our bedroom!! My husband has called every time, they’ve sent someone out three times to deal with the bugs and squirrels- we still got them! He recently called about the new problem of the caving in ceiling and to tell them we want out of this lease because this house is UNSANITARY and UNLIVABLE! He was told someone would call back, guess what, absolutely NO ONE HAS CALLED BACK! He has called multiple times since yesterday and has left voicemail after voicemail! We are now arranging an appointment with an attorney. Absolutely do NOT RENT from these people. They do NOT CHECK the homes before renting them out to people!

resp.text: We do apologize for the issues you are having with the house.  I did go back through the work orders and we have addressed each issue that has been brought to our attention. Plumbing issues (we had to send Mr. Rooter twice) in January, Pest control in January (which had follow up visits included, totally the 3 visits you mentioned).  We can assure you we have seen the house before y'all went in, we have a detailed inspection done between the last tenant and yourself, we had to schedule repairs and cleaning between the last tenants and yourself.  We do admit that COVID-19 has slowed our response time down some on phone calls because we are working from home mostly, but we are still able to respond to all voicemails with in a business day to the best of my knowledge. If there were ever a time we weren't you always have the emergency line to call if something needs to be addressed immediately.  Since we were unable to finish the conversation today on the phone due to your husband using profanity, we will be happy to continue a conversation in writing via email or the portal, no profanity please.

name: yogurllvivi .w
text:
I have been a rental tenet with Astro Property Management for 6 years. This has ben by far the most professional rental company that i have rented from.
Every time i called, e-mailed, or texted a maintenance order someone from the office would respond letting me know who would be contacting me in order to come out to fix the problem. After maintenance left i would receive a follow up call to make sure that the job was completed, i was satisfied, and most important that i was comfortable with the person who was sent to do the job.
( i always have been )
One of the many things that i truly appreciate is that they take the time to answer every question that i have ( i asked a 1000 at least )
It saddens me that i will be leaving them. I am in the process of buying a house. When i told them, they were so incurring and positive.
I highly recommend this company word's alone cannot explain how much i am going to miss them.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!  It is always good to hear that we have made renting from us a good experience!  Good luck with the purchase of your new home!

name: Rachel Jethroe
text: Love this place
